description:
Dare to Lead™ | Wellington | 22-24 September 2025, The ultimate starting point for brave leaders, courageous cultures and organisational change.

"Highly recommend."
"Inspiring."
"An amazing experience."
"One 'aha moment' after the other."

Founded on the research of Dr. Brené Brown, Dare to Lead™ is an empirically based courage-building programme, delivered by Boma New Zealand CEO and Certified Dare to Lead™ Facilitator Kaila Colbin.
Brené has spent two decades studying shame and more than seven years specifically looking at leadership. During her research, she interviewed leaders from all over the world — from Fortune 100 companies, non-profits, public sector entities, and more — and asked one question: what is the future of leadership?
Remarkably, their answers pointed to one thing: we need braver leaders.

We need more courage.

The most significant finding from Brené’s latest research, and the foundation of Dare to Lead™, is that courage is a collection of four skill sets that are teachable, measurable, and observable.

After completing the three-day Dare to Lead™ programme you'll understand how to:
Effectively navigate vulnerability and unlock change
Turn values from fluffy language into tangible, practical behaviours
Build a common culture of trust in your team
Cultivate the skills to rise from setbacks and be more resilient

This curriculum is essential for teams who want to:
Be better equipped to deal with difficult conversations
Reduce unhealthy and unproductive behaviour
Be more creative and innovative
Build resilience and improve alignment
Foster a culture of accountability and trust

This experience is for you if:
You're in a position of leadership within your organisation
You see the potential in people and processes, and are willing to take responsibility for achieving that potential
You’re passionate about accelerating performance in yourself and others
You have to navigate organisational change as part of your role

Need help with the cost?
If you are an Educator or at a Not-for-Profit, you can automatically access a special price of $1,995 + GST when you register.
We also have partial scholarships available to attend the programme. Apply here and we’ll be in touch.
Boma is a Regional Business Network Provider. Your organisation may be eligible for funding support to attend this programme. Find out more at regionalbusinesspartners.co.nz

Our Health and Safety Plan
Boma is committed to delivering safe events. We follow best practices suggested by the New Zealand health authorities and work closely with our suppliers to prioritise health and wellbeing.
Our comprehensive health and safety plans ensure you can book with certainty and attend with confidence.

Our refund policy
For details on event refunds and transfers, please see our refund policy.

Contact us
Please email hello@boma.global with any questions.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Marlin’s Dreaming - Wellington, A year and some change since touring HIRL, Marlin’s Dreaming will again bless Aotearoa’s main city centres for a short summer stint this January 2026.
Marlin’s Dreaming has long been associated with New Zealand’s balmier months, but this marks the band’s first summer tour since 2020, and a chance to play through the back catalogue of hits. 
Drawing songs from 2024’s sweet, nostalgia inflected album HIRL, the starry debut Lizard Tears, and the scores of sublime tracks between, it’s a chance for fans to get the complete Marlin’s Dreaming summer experience.
Renowned for their tightly choreographed live shows, the summer tour will add the talents of Tiare Kelly (Benee) on the keys & vocals.  
“We’re joining to play a couple of great festivals in Slackbarn and Festival of Lights so wanted to take a moment to get out to Christchurch, Auckland, and Wellington. As well as playing through our back catalogue, we also have new music to tease, that I’m really excited to try out live,” said Semisi Ma’ia’i frontman of Marlin’s Dreaming.
“It wasn’t until after booking these shows that I realised we hadn’t played a summer tour since 2020, which history has shown was one of the most significant things to happen that year.”
As well as its headline shows, Marlin’s Dreaming performs in the Hawke’s Bay at Slackbarn on January 10, and Festival of Lights in New Plymouth on January 11.



San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.
label: Music & Concerts

Be more creative and innovative
Build resilience and improve alignment
Foster a culture of accountability and trust

This experience is for you if:
You're in a position of leadership within your organisation
You see the potential in people and processes, and are willing to take responsibility for achieving that potential
You’re passionate about accelerating performance in yourself and others
You have to navigate organisational change as part of your role

Boma is committed to delivering safe events. We follow best practices suggested by the New Zealand health authorities and work closely with our suppliers to prioritise health and wellbeing.
Our comprehensive health and safety plans ensure you can book with certainty and attend with confidence.

Our refund policy
For details on event refunds and transfers, please see our refund policy.

About this event:

This highly interactive session will have engaging discussions that will uncover practical insights into creating user – focused, unified digital services that genuinely enhance customer experiences. We will discuss the complexities of web design and development, exploring them from a project delivery perspective, with a focus on building effective and impactful digital solutions.
About the Presenter:
About the Presenters:
 Pikselin: Pikselin is a New Zealand based consultancy and solution provider in the digital engagement and application development space. As a digital agency, they create user-focused digital experiences that are both functional and visually engaging. Pikselin delivers responsive websites, intuitive interfaces, and inclusive digital services for clients across government and private sector. Their expertise lies in simplifying complex information through thoughtful, user – centred design. As an approved supplier on New Zealand’s Government Marketplace, they have led key projects for a range of clients across the public and enterprise sectors. Pikselin is known for its collaborative approach and commitment to elevating digital experiences that truly serve New Zealanders. 

Steve Barnard Managing Director Steve leads client and partner collaborations at Pikselin, overseeing projects from marketing to post-development support with over 30 years of experience in New Zealand's IT industry.

James Guthrie Tech Lead James transforms complex design requirements into maintainable accessible code specializing in real-time data visualization interactive mapping, and fully accessible cross device websites.

Brian Smith Design Director Brian leads Pikselin's creative vision collaborating with clients and the creative team to deliver exceptional products and services.

description:
Electra Business After Five - MONDAY 22 September 2025, September Electra BA5 Showcase 
Woodhaven Gardens 
Join us for an exclusive behind-the-scenes experience at Woodhaven Gardens, one of Horowhenua’s largest and most community-minded businesses.

Join us for a rare behind-the-scenes look at Woodhaven Gardens, one of Horowhenua’s largest and most innovative businesses.
Founded in 1978, Woodhaven now spans 1,800+ hectares, grows over 20 vegetable varieties, and employs 250+ staff. 
Discover how they combine tech innovation, sustainability, and community investment to contribute $30–35M annually to Horowhenua’s GDP.

Speakers:
Emma Clarke – Woodhaven Gardens: Innovation, sustainability, and community impact.
Deborah Manning ONZM – Founder of KiwiHarvest & NZ Food Network: Transforming NZ’s food rescue and sustainability landscape.
You are invited to view Woodhaven's operations from 5.30-6 pm before the speakers begin. 
Deborah Manning ONZM, Lawyer turned social entrepreneur who is a trailblazer in sustainability and food security, transforming New Zealand’s food rescue landscape through her venture KiwiHarvest, and the New Zealand Food Network. In 2025, Deborah was awarded the New Zealand Sustainability Leader of the Year Award at the Kiwibank New Zealander of the Year Awards.
Horowhenua Mana Kai Network, born from a January 2025 hui on rising food insecurity, the Mana Kai Network connects local kai initiatives to create long-term change. Hear how this community-led, Council-supported collaboration is improving food access and equity across Horowhenua.
WOODHAVEN GARDENS
44 Joblins Road, Levin
Monday 22nd September 2025
5.30-7 pm  

This event is in partnership with Woodhaven Gardens, Horowhenua District Council, Mana Kai and Muaūpoko Tribal Authority.

Tickets $10pp
(No door sales. High-vis vests provided – no high heels please.)

description:
Employment Law Session - Casual Employment & Trial Periods | Marlborough, Following on from our Disciplinary Process Workshop in 2024, we are pleased to bring you another practical and informative session designed to support employers in navigating the complexities of employment law. Join us for Employment Law 101, where we’ll cover the essential elements of starting the employment relationship on the right foot. 
This workshop will provide clarity around: 
When and how to use trial periods lawfully 
What defines casual employment and how to manage it correctly 
Best practice for offering employment and ensuring your documentation is spot-on 
Common pitfalls employers face in the hiring process and how to avoid them 
This session is ideal for business owners, managers, and anyone involved in hiring or managing staff. Whether you're new to employing or just need a refresher, you’ll walk away with greater confidence and a clearer understanding of your obligations.
The workshop will be delivered by Tim Blake, General Counsel for Hospitality New Zealand, and includes time for questions and discussion.
Don’t miss this opportunity to strengthen your employment practices and stay on the right side of the law.

description:
Export Ready: Strategies and Lessons for International Growth, Whether you're exploring new markets, refining your export strategy, or preparing to scale globally, this practical workshop will equip you with the tools, insights, and confidence to take your business international
What’s in store
Join export expert Pete Torrington for an interactive, 2.5-hour workshop designed specifically for local producers and manufacturers. Drawing on over 30 years of global experience, Pete will guide you through the essential steps to becoming export ready.
You’ll learn how to:
Assess your export potential and avoid common pitfalls
Choose the right international markets for your product
Build effective distribution and retail strategies
Navigate food safety, packaging, and compliance requirements
Price and promote your product for global shelves
Whether you're just starting your export journey or want to sharpen your approach, this workshop offers real-world advice and actionable strategies to help you succeed.
Who should attend
Food and beverage producers
Consumer goods manufacturers
Agribusinesses and primary sector entrepreneurs
Anyone considering export as a growth strategy
About the Facilitator
Pete Torrington is the founder of Ask Pete Advisory and brings over 30 years of international commercial experience in food and consumer goods, including senior roles at Colgate-Palmolive across Europe, Asia, and Australasia. He now works with New Zealand manufacturers and producers to help them grow in overseas markets.
More information: www.askpete.co.nz

description:
Draw It Out - Teens block course, A fun and deep way for teens (11-17 year olds) to learn to process their feelings.
Theme: Listening to your inner voice
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
Teenage years can often be filled with external influences, making it hard to listen to our own inner voice for guidance. This 4-session block course teaches teens how to use drawing to process hard feelings and access their own inner resources, which can be used at home as visual journaling.
Dates
This block course consists of 4 workshops:
4.15pm-5.30pm
Tuesday 19th August - Metaphors for feelings
Tuesday 26th August - Uncovering needs
Tuesday 2nd September - Unlocking self-compassion
Monday 8th September - Curiosity in direction
Cost
$184 total ($46 per session)
Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Seedlings – Opening, Seedlings brings together eighteen artists who have each contributed to the ongoing journey of Twentysix Gallery. Taking its title from the season of spring, this group show reflects the quiet energy of growth — each artist sharing a single work that speaks to where they are now and the evolving life of the gallery community.
The show spans painting, photography, textiles, ceramics and sculpture, reflecting the range of practices nurtured here over the years. What unites these works is not a shared theme but a shared spirit of generosity, friendship, and dialogue. Together they speak to the quiet ways ideas take root, shift, and flourish — nurtured by artists who have been with us since the gallery’s beginnings as well as those newly joining the fold.
Featuring Aida Smith, Chloe Mason, Chora Carleton, David Brown, Emma Hercus, Gina Kiel, Jess Swney, Lewis Cosgrave, Lindsey Horne, Nan Mulder, Pam Brabants, Petra Scheuber, Russell Kleyn, Simon Mark, Suzanne Lustig, Thomas Strawbridge, Will Bennett, Yoan Jolly.
We’re celebrating the opening on Friday, 24th October at 6pm with a community BBQ and live music from the Rongotai College Big Band. BYO drinks and something to throw on the grill. Kindly sponsored by Culley’s and Behemoth Brewing.
The exhibition runs from 25 October – 15 November 2025 at Twentysix Gallery.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Impactful Leadership, Impactful Leadership:
What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.
Welcome to the final conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
What good leadership looks like has changed, but many of the methods we rely on to deliver it haven’t. This conversation will showcase what horses can teach us about impactful leadership in modern workplaces, and how anyone can turn those lessons into action that delivers.
Why be part of this conversation?
In this thought-provoking session, BBC journalist-turned-leadership coach Janine Sudbury will share how she discovered what really works in leadership development, and why traditional approaches often fall short.
You’ll take away insights including:
The three secrets of the horse whisperer that unlock authentic, presence-based leadership
How to overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing to lead with clarity and confidence
Why horses give the most honest feedback—and how that feedback creates lasting breakthroughs
Who’s the speaker?
Janine Sudbury is the founder of Impact Leadership and the creator of a truly unique experiential leadership programme that swaps the boardroom for the paddock. specialises in helping women overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing Syndrome to lead with more confidence, clarity, and authenticity.
With powerful insights and unforgettable stories, including her work with former All Blacks coach Steve Hansen, Janine invites you to lead with more purpose, presence, and impact.
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Janine Sudbury speaks
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
Business card prize draw:
Attend the event and go in the draw to win a “New BMW for a Weekend” and a “New MINI for a Weekend” from Continental Cars BMW and Wellington MINI Garage.
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
7 August: Strengths & Superpowers - Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest
20 August: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live! - Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Funkin’ Donuts Vinyl Session at Parrotdog Bar, FLEX WEBSTER + DJ AUDIT [AK]
7" 45 SESSION
ALL STYLES, ALL SMILES
SAT 27 SEPT 2-10PM
FUNKIN’ DONUTS is a celebration of all things funky on the 7” 45 vinyl format.
The brand’s name comes from the records themselves - small, round, and with a large hole in the middle, they’ve long been nicknamed “donuts.”
Founded by Flex Webster in 2022, FUNKIN’ DONUTS began as a jam session with fellow 45 heads before evolving into a platform for original edits and future vinyl releases. With an ultimate vision of putting out 7” records, Flex has already released six albums of party edits under the brand, with plans for the first physical release coming soon.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Pastor From Gaza, St John’s is collaborating with Central Baptist to host this Pastor from Gaza, as he shares about being the Church amidst conflict.
Born and raised in Gaza, he now ministers across the Gaza and Middle East, providing pastoral support and practical aid to persecuted Christians, refugees, orphans, and widows.
This tour is not political—it is about the Body of Christ. The Pastor will share his own testimony, speak to the ongoing challenges faced by Christians in Gaza, and highlight his wider ministry in the Middle East. It is a message of hope, forgiveness, and perseverance—one that will challenge the Church in Aotearoa.
This event is to raise awareness of the spiritual and practical needs of believers in Gaza and the Middle East, as well as invite us to give in support of his ministry, with funds going directly to help persecuted Christians with food, shelter, and outreach.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
AWDT Alumni PD day 2025, AWDT Alumni PD day 2025
Join us for a day of professional development and networking with AWDT alumni in 2025!

About this Event

AWDT Alumni PD day 2025
Description: Join us for a fun and informative day at the AWDT Alumni PD day 2025! Catch up with old friends, network with industry professionals, and learn from engaging speakers. This in-person event will be held at MPI pastoral house - 25 The Terrace, providing a great atmosphere for reconnecting and expanding your knowledge.
Theme: Future of the Food and Fibre Sector.
9:00–9:30: Coffee
9:30–12:00: Sally Duxfield – keynote/workshop.
12:00–12:45: Lunch
12:45–1:45: Helen Moore & Kate Gwilliam (Halter) – agri-tech/startup perspectives.
1:45–3:15: Jenny Cameron – genetics, future outlook, and China relations.
Don't miss this opportunity to grow both personally and professionally. Register now and secure your spot at AWDT Alumni PD day 2025!

description:
Monthly Jazz Night: Les Tripes- Parisian Swing Trio, Get ready for a night of irresistible rhythm and sizzling jazz!

Swing clarinetist Oscar Lavën, guitarist Adrian Jensen, and double-bass raconteur Robert Henderson are "Les Tripes" (french for "The Guts") ; a hard-working interpretation of the irresistibly heart-pumping film-noir sound of Django Reinhardt's Quintette du Hot Club de France. Lavën, Jensen and Henderson are professional musicians based in Wellington, and have honed their project through years of performance in venues large and small.

Les Tripes will have you tapping your feet and swinging along as they infuse each performance with passion, precision, and a touch of French flair.

Don’t miss the chance to experience a night of pure, swinging magic!

Book now to join us for a French inspired Set Menu from 5.30pm (served in one of our dining rooms) before moving out to the show.
2 courses $55.
BOOKINGS ESSENTIAL.
Email reservations@thistleinn.co.nz to book.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Leadership And Management Part 1, Learn how to make the transition from buddy to the boss and lead a successful team. Managing staff can be a very rewarding, interesting and fun role, it can also be a tough and demanding job. Between managing your own time and projects, helping your team members solve problems and complete tasks, and helping other managers, your day can fill up before you know it.

This workshop aims to maximise your leadership and management potential and help you become a more confident, effective and efficient leader and manager with information on understanding personality types, effective communication, setting expectations and goals, assigning work, effective delegation, motivating staff, leadership styles, giving feedback and having courageous conversations, understanding what is required to be a good leader and manager and encouraging teamwork.
 
The workshop is designed for those who have been promoted recently into a supervisory management role or for those who have been there for some time but need to improve their leadership and management skills. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Leadership Play Day - Wellington, Leadership Play Day: Wellington 17th October 2025
Friday 17th October 2025 | 8:30am–5:00pm
Location: Nairn Street Cottage, 68 Nairn Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6011

What this day is all about
Leadership Play Day is a full-day, game-based learning experience that takes leadership development out of the boardroom and into play. Instead of being talked at with boring slides, you’ll step into three carefully designed games that let you actually practice leadership.
You’ll be experimenting, problem-solving, laughing (a lot), and walking away with insights that stick because you’ve lived them, not just heard them.
This isn’t theory. It’s leadership in action.
Learn more at our website.
How it works
The day is made up of three 2-hour games. You can book individual sessions ($99 each), or join us for the full day ($297) to play all three and unlock The Leadership Playbook - a bonus 60-minute facilitated debrief where we connect the dots and help you take away a clear set of personal leadership shifts.
Here’s what’s on in Wellington:
The Moonlit Market (8:30–10:30am)
Pitch, trade, and negotiate under pressure. Build agility, creativity, and bold decision-making in a playful, high-energy marketplace.
The Broken Bridge (11:00am–1:00pm)
A fantasy quest to practice difficult conversations. Explore courage, clarity, and how you show up when the stakes feel high.
The Inner Tides (1:45–3:45pm)
Use the Emotional Culture Deck in a role-playing game to strengthen emotional awareness, resilience, and confidence in leading with empathy.
The Leadership Playbook (4:00–5:00pm)
Available only with a full-day pass. A guided reflection session to connect your learning, extract insights, and leave with a practical playbook you can use back at work.
Why you should join
Practical skills, not theory - you’ll walk away with tools and insights you can use immediately.
Safe practice, real challenges - rehearse tough moments without real-world consequences.
Energy + engagement - no sitting back, you’ll be on your feet, in the mix, learning by doing.
Unique approach - game-based leadership development you won’t find anywhere else in NZ.
Whether you’re a leader, facilitator, HR/People professional, or just someone curious about growing your leadership edge - this day is designed for you.
Tickets
Individual game session: $99
Full day pass (all 3 games + Leadership Playbook debrief): $297
👉 Ready to roll the dice on your leadership?

Spots are limited - grab your ticket today.

description:
Mamas Running Business: Where Motherhood and Business Connect, Kia ora Wellington mamas!

Join us for our third Mamas Running Business—a space for mamas who are running (or dreaming of starting) their own business. Let’s connect, share, support, and grow together!

We’re Anna (communication skills trainer, parent coach, and researcher) and Dani (photographer, Postpartum Circles facilitator, and online business owner).

We created this group to explore the beautiful, messy, and inspiring intersection of business and motherhood—to foster opportunities, share tools, and build a community where we can connect honestly and grow alongside one another.

Come just as you are—kids, questions, dreams, and all. We can’t wait to meet you and start this together.

Tickets include a hot drink of your choice and some light snacks.

*registration required (limited spots)*

Register here: https://www.annabanas.co.nz/event-details-registration/mamas-running-business-where-motherhood-and-business-connect-2

Anna Banas
Daniela Fuenzalida
label: Business & Networking

description:
Sonic Delusion Smoooth Single Release Tour Greytown, To mark the release of his brand-new single “Smoooth”, Sonic Delusion is hitting the road for a special six-date release tour. Known for his infectious grooves, playful looping, and feel-good folk-pop energy, Sonic Delusion brings audiences a mix of fresh tunes and crowd favourites — all wrapped in the joy and honesty that make his shows so irresistible.
Audiences can join the celebration at:
Saturday 15 November – Lakeside Playhouse, Opunake
Sunday 16 November – Wood St, Kakaramea
Thursday 4 December – Globe Theatre, Palmerston North
Friday 5 December – Firebird Cafe, Levin
Saturday 6 December – Hilltop House Concerts, Wellington
Sunday 7 December – Janette House Gig, Studio 73, Greytown
From Taranaki to the lower North Island, each stop promises to be a night of rhythm, laughter, and community. With “Smoooth” as the soundtrack, Sonic Delusion invites audiences to protest the madness of the world in the best way possible — by coming together, dancing, and choosing to live smoooth.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Market Partner Academy LIVE - Wellington, Get ready, Wellington—Market Partner Academy LIVE is coming your way!
Join us on Wednesday 1st October 2025. 1:15 p.m. – 6 p.m. NZST at Whisky & Wood – 60 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro for an unforgettable afternoon packed with learning, connection, and MONAT magic.
This training event is a registered Market Partner only event open to all career ranks from MP – SED. Whether this is day 1 or 100 of your business this event has been designed to help you learn from the best and help you grow your businesses with all of the post MONATions excitement.
This event brings the energy of MONATions right to your city—featuring:
Hands-on sales training
Exciting product launch updates
VIP Program insights
Inspiration from our incredible local leaders
Practical business-building tools you can put into action immediately
You’ll leave with fresh ideas, new connections, and a renewed vision for your MONAT journey—all while having FUN! Expect good vibes, insight, learning, and plenty of laughter along the way.
Come along, invest in yourself and your business, and take this opportunity to grow alongside fellow Market Partners and our corporate team.
Tickets include a sweet treat.
We can’t wait to see you there!
This is a registered MP only event - no prospectives
About this venue
Whisky & Wood offers a modern, stylish event space in the heart of Wellington, perfect for a high-energy, collaborative afternoon
MONAT Gratitude
$3 from every ticket sold will be donated to MONAT Gratitude and go towards our Gratitude efforts in Australia. MONAT Gratitude is a very special piece of the MONAT culture where we seek to instil the values of giving back not only in our corporate offices, but also in our Market Partners all over the world. Our mission is to motivate and inspire our greater community to take action and generate positive change by partnering with visionary organisations in the areas of education, children, and families that are improving the world.
Follow @MONATGratitudeOfficial
MONAT Gratitude, Inc. (hereinafter, “MONAT Gratitude” or “Gratitude Team”), is a Florida registered non-profit organisation, exempt from taxation, pursuant to the provisions under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, with its primary and principal place of business as 10000 NW 15 Terrace, Doral, Florida 33172. Contributions made by U.S.-based donors are tax deductible under the federal law. For questions, or to request a copy of our 501(c)3 designations, please contact our Gratitude Team at gratitude@monatglobal.com. Donations made by donors residing outside of the United States will not be eligible to claim a tax deduction.

description:
Marlborough Tech Community Morning Tea: Shaping Our Future, Marlborough’s tech community has huge potential, and this kōrero is about shaping the next chapter together. We believe our region’s tech future will be stronger when everyone has a seat at the table, and we’re committed to making space for all perspectives to be heard.
Event details
📅 Date: Thursday 18 September 2025
🕘 Time: 10:00 am - 12:00 pm
📍 Location: Te Au Pūngao, cnr Arthur & Seymour Streets
Free to attend, registration is essential for catering purposes.
Join us for morning tea at Te Au Pūngao to connect with others working in technology, innovation, and startups, and to help set the direction for Marlborough’s tech future.
We’ll be talking about:
Making coworking more accessible for sole contractors, early-stage founders, and startups
Creating regular opportunities for local students to get hands-on support from industry experts
Forming a Marlborough Tech Steering Group to guide our community and develop a Tech Community Charter
This is an open kōrero guided by the principle of equity of voice. Whether this is your first tech event or your fiftieth, you belong here. We know it can feel daunting to walk into a new space, so our team will be at the door to welcome you and make introductions.
Everyone brings value to the conversation. Your background, culture, and lived experience help shape a stronger tech community.
Accessibility and inclusivity:
On-site parking, elevator, and accessible bathrooms
Welcoming to LGBTQIA+ community
Attendees are encouraged to bring a friend
Come along, share your ideas, and help build a connected and collaborative tech community in Marlborough.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Microsoft Excel Intermediate +, Microsoft Excel Intermediate +
👉#MSExcel Intermediate+ Workshop - Blenheim - Thursday 09 October 2025, 9am to 2:30pm - Rangitane House, Level 4.

Includes Lunch, refreshments and a PDF shortcuts

📢Do you want to learn the true capabilities of what Microsoft Excel can do?
📢Do you want to be better and more confident at using Excel?
📢Would you like to learn how to complete tedious tasks more efficiently?

PRE-REQUISITE: We don’t start at the beginner's level, therefore; you must already be a an advanced beginner to intermediate user of Microsoft Excel. If you are not, we also offer an Excel Absolute Beginner workshop and a Beginners to Intermediate workshop.

Our 5.5 hour workshop has been designed for current users of Excel that want to learn more of the intermediate + functions of Excel. You will learn everything you need to know to create small to large spreadsheets within your business, including working with multi sheets, formatting, formulas, functions, diagrams, graphs etc. We will give you the confidence to quickly create any spreadsheet you will require in business.

Our workshop is delivered in Microsoft Office 365 - compatible with Office 2010 upwards (please note that there may be minor differences). Mac is not compatible.

You will need to bring your own device (with Office 2010 upwards). If you are unable to bring your own device, please let us know prior to the workshop and we will arrange one for you.
label: Business & Networking

description:
NAWIC Wellington Annual Regional Meeting 2025, Join us at the NAWIC Wellington Annual Regional Meeting to show your support and share your ideas.
The current NAWIC Wellington Committee excited to welcome members to attend the Annual Regional Meeting (ARM) where we come together as a chapter to reflect on our achievements, discuss ongoing projects, and plan for the future. This meeting is a fantastic opportunity to connect with fellow members, share insights, and contribute to the growth and success of our organisation.
Along with the formalities we will review the past 12 months and look forward to the year ahead. We want to hear your feedback and discuss how you can contribute to the success of our organisation.
We are keen to hear from you if you:
Have an interest in joining the Committee
Have ideas for inspirational speakers or other types of events
Can offer access for site visits and/or venues for our events
Can give your time to represent NAWIC to speak at schools/career days
If you are unable to attend but interested in providing your feedback, you can contact us at rsvpwgtn@nawic.org.nz
DATE & TIME: 5:30pm, Tuesday 7 October
VENUE: TBIG, Level 13, 215 Lambton Quay
REGISTRATIONS: NAWIC members only, who can attend in person or online. Registration required.  Anyone is welcome to join NAWIC here
Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Nelson - Empower Her Networking - Powerful Email Marketing, NELSON - Moutere Hills Restaurant and Cellar Door
Monthly Topic: Powerful Email Marketing
Hosted by: Bryony Richardson
This month, we’re diving into Powerful Email Marketing, because your inbox might be the most underestimated goldmine in your business. Whether you’re building community, driving sales, or nurturing long-term clients, email marketing allows you to connect on a deeper level (without having to battle the unpredictable social media algorithm).
In September, we’ll be sharing ideas, swapping tips, and uncovering what makes a newsletter not just opened but loved. From juicy subject lines to irresistible calls-to-action, get ready to rethink the power of your email list.
Want to get your ticket for FREE?
Are you a woman in business looking for a supportive community to help you connect, grow, and learn?
As an Inner Circle member, you can attend as many of our networking hubs as you like for FREE! This includes our hubs across Auckland, NZ, Australia and the UK. Enjoy unlimited access to our netwokring events and take full advantage of the community and networking opportunities.
Join the Inner Circle
Join the Inner Circle to unlock even more benefits:
Monthly Masterclasses: Learn from industry experts on topics that will elevate your business and mindset.
Accountability Calls: Stay on track with our supportive community and achieve your goals.
Personal Branding Opportunities: Create your own masterclasses and shine as an expert.
Exclusive Discounts: Enjoy special rates on Empower Her events and live workshops.
Vibrant Community: Share your journey, get support, and celebrate your successes with empowering women.
Join the Inner Circle now and become part of a wonderful community of women in business who are ready to build their dream life and business.
Empower Her is a global female networking community, that offers a welcoming and safe environment for women of all business backgrounds and experiences.
Whether you're just starting out with new business ideas or have years of experience under your belt, all are welcome! Empower Her provides a safe space where you can share your business with others, connect with like-minded women in business, and prioritise collaboration over competition.
Our groups value the power of connection, and we believe that together, we can achieve more than we ever could alone. That's why we're committed to fostering a supportive community that empowers each member to reach their full potential. Our groups are focused on connection, inspiring stories, celebrating each other's successes and sharing our vulnerable moments.
Join our free community
The Inner Circle
Follow us on Instagram
Empower Her Co-Founders Victoria and Charlotte are highly passionate and dedicated to empowering female leaders in the business world. By joining Empower Her, you will not only expand your professional network but also gain access to a supportive community of like-minded individuals who are committed to helping each other succeed.Find out more about us and check up our upcoming events on our website.

Monthly Topic: Powerful Email Marketing
Hosted by: Bryony Richardson
This month, we’re diving into Powerful Email Marketing, because your inbox might be the most underestimated goldmine in your business. Whether you’re building community, driving sales, or nurturing long-term clients, email marketing allows you to connect on a deeper level (without having to battle the unpredictable social media algorithm).
In September, we’ll be sharing ideas, swapping tips, and uncovering what makes a newsletter not just opened but loved. From juicy subject lines to irresistible calls-to-action, get ready to rethink the power of your email list.
Want to get your ticket for FREE?
Are you a woman in business looking for a supportive community to help you connect, grow, and learn?
As an Inner Circle member, you can attend as many of our networking hubs as you like for FREE! This includes our hubs across Auckland, NZ, Australia and the UK. Enjoy unlimited access to our netwokring events and take full advantage of the community and networking opportunities.
Join the Inner Circle
Join the Inner Circle to unlock even more benefits:
Monthly Masterclasses: Learn from industry experts on topics that will elevate your business and mindset.
Accountability Calls: Stay on track with our supportive community and achieve your goals.
Personal Branding Opportunities: Create your own masterclasses and shine as an expert.
Exclusive Discounts: Enjoy special rates on Empower Her events and live workshops.
Vibrant Community: Share your journey, get support, and celebrate your successes with empowering women.
Join the Inner Circle now and become part of a wonderful community of women in business who are ready to build their dream life and business.
Empower Her is a global female networking community, that offers a welcoming and safe environment for women of all business backgrounds and experiences.
Whether you're just starting out with new business ideas or have years of experience under your belt, all are welcome! Empower Her provides a safe space where you can share your business with others, connect with like-minded women in business, and prioritise collaboration over competition.
Our groups value the power of connection, and we believe that together, we can achieve more than we ever could alone. That's why we're committed to fostering a supportive community that empowers each member to reach their full potential. Our groups are focused on connection, inspiring stories, celebrating each other's successes and sharing our vulnerable moments.
Join our free community
The Inner Circle
Follow us on Instagram
Empower Her Co-Founders Victoria and Charlotte are highly passionate and dedicated to empowering female leaders in the business world. By joining Empower Her, you will not only expand your professional network but also gain access to a supportive community of like-minded individuals who are committed to helping each other succeed.Find out more about us and check up our upcoming events on our website.

description:
Painless Presenting, Full day presentation skills workshop in Wellington. Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
Who's it for?
You work in a technical field. You’re great at your job — but struggle to get your ideas across the business.
You often:
Dive into technical detail that loses or confuses your audience
Overload people with too much information, which makes it harder to get the results you need
Find it tough to explain complex areas of your role in a way others can easily understand
Spend hours planning presentations, yet still feel stiff and uncomfortable when delivering
Feel nervous when presenting, and wish you could speak with more ease and confidence
If this sounds like you, Painless Presenting will help you cut through complexity, present clearly, and build the confidence you know is vital for your career growth.
What you will learn:
A proven step by step process that will take the pain out of planning presentations and set the foundations for becoming a more engaging, natural and effective business presenter.

Participants are taught how to write a valuable business presentation, how to manage their nerves, design useful visuals and are given key delivery techniques to help deliver their presentations in a natural and engaging way.
You will come away with:
an understanding of how to use the SpeakerMap™ system, a step by step, proven approach to planning presentations quickly and effectively
a new appreciation of purpose when speaking
an understanding of how to quickly design useful presentation visuals
how to easily overcome the problems of speaking too fast, um-ing and ah-ing, and losing your place
a tailored strategy to dissolve the anxiety that so often accompanies presenting
three delivery tricks that will help you come across as credible and confident
Note: You will not need to present to the group on this course. If you are interested in a more intensive training option, including one on one coaching, check out our 2 day workshop The Effective Speaker.
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8
label: Business & Networking

description:
Menopause The Musical, Described as the ultimate ladies’ night out, Menopause the Musical has been delivering laughs across the globe for 10 years. Now the fun-filled musical about ‘the change’ returns to Wellington for one night.  
Set in a department store, four women meet by chance while shopping for a black lace bra. Though they couldn’t be more different, they quickly discover a shared bond over memory loss, hot flushes, night sweats, and mood swings. What follows is a hilarious, heartwarming musical told with love, laughter, and the greatest hits of the 60s, 70s, and 80s. The laughter-filled 90-minute production gets audiences out of their seats dancing and singing along to clever parodies of beloved pop classics. 
Winner of over 40 Tony Awards, Menopause the Musical has entertained more than 17 million fans worldwide. It’s been translated into nine languages and performed in more than 500 cities. The show’s enduring appeal lies in its honesty, hilarity and heart. It celebrates women everywhere and turns shared experiences into shared joy.

description:
Telescope Mastery, Our Telescope Course is back!

You already own a telescope, but...

If you already have a telescope and would like to learn more about how to use it, how to collimate it and any other maintenance they need, what type of eyepieces are the best to buy and any other equipment.

BRING YOUR TELESCOPE ALONG!
OR

You don't have a telescope, but...

would like to learn how to use one, don't fret! We have 14, and you can learn all about them.

Your instructor:
Sam, our resident astrophysicist.

Sam is skilled in explaining the intricacies of telescope operation and makes learning both accessible and engaging. Our course offers hands-on experience with our diverse collection of 14 telescopes, ranging from classic reflectors to sophisticated refractors and versatile catadioptrics.

Where: Star Safari Observatory - 10 minutes from Martinborough


There's no "but" after our course. You'll know exactly:

- Where to start?

- What to do?

- How to get the best out of your telescope?

- What must you consider if you wish to plunge into deep-sky astrophotography?

You get:
A collimation cap - no more guesswork on how to collimate your telescope. With this tool, you can keep your telescope sharp.

Tea and coffee - refreshments.

Bring your lunch and a picnic blanket! We have a spectacular setting at Star Safari Observatory, and we will stop for a lunch break to enjoy our Moon garden and the surroundings.

Take the giant leap; reach for the stars!

At the end of the course, you'll learn all about the types of telescopes available and mounts, attachments, and eyepieces. We cover the whole lot. We have been using telescopes for a long time and now have an excellent range for our public sessions and at our home observatory.

We're not affiliated with retailers, so our advice is unbiased and based on our years of experience with lugging telescopes around the world, maintaining them and using them.

Brain development, sleep, device use and how, as parents we can have more understanding about what is going on for teens, and how we can make better parenting decisions.

Please note there is NO childcare available at this event.

description:
One Giant Leap for Slothkind, It's been a while since Neil Armsloth and Buzz Lightyear set theirs claw onto the surface of the moon... some say the footage was faked. Others even claim it was shot in the Moon Bar green room. All we know is the sloths are ready to blow the lid off the greatest cover-up in cosmic history - with a night of undeniably real tunes and bass heavy enough to shake the craters.

Join the investigation as these slow-moving sound scientists drop interstellar basslines, smoky skanks and lunar licks straight from the sea of tranquility (or maybe Raumati).

Bring your tinfoil hats, your dancing shoes and an open mind - because the truth is out there somewhere... and it sounds incredible.

description:
Poroporoaki for Rosalie & Welcome to Elizabeth & Shaquille, Kia ora e te whānau EHF,
You're invited to a very special evening!
Join us on Wednesday 27 August at 5:30pm for a heart-filled poroporoaki, a chance to celebrate Rosalie Nelson, and to officially welcome our new Co-Executive Directors, Elizabeth McNaughton and Shaquille Shortland.
📍 Te Wharewaka Function Centre, Wellington
🕔 Doors open at 5:00pm | Welcome begins at 5:30pm sharp
🕢 Event concludes by 7:30pm
👔 Dress: Business casual
To RSVP (button)
To register to join online (button)
This will be a joyful evening of reflection, reconnection and looking ahead. Whether you're joining us in person or online, we’d love to have you in the room (or on the screen!) as we mark this milestone in the life of the Fellowship. You are also welcome to bring your partner.
In te ao Māori, a poroporoaki is more than a farewell; it's a ritual of transition and gratitude. A moment to steady the waka, acknowledge the hands that have guided it, and prepare together for the voyage ahead.
We’ll honour Rosalie’s contribution, and we’ll raise a glass to Elizabeth and Shaquille as they step into their new roles. Expect warmth, good company, big-hearted kōrero and a few surprises too.
If you're planning to attend in person and haven’t yet booked travel, now’s a good time to do so.

Ngā manaakitanga,
The EHF Board

description:
Project Management 101, Dates:Wednesday 5 November, 9am-4.30pm & Thursday 6 November , 9am-4.30pm
Presenter: Paul Sutton, Nonsuch.
This two-day instructor led course has been designed to introduce the concepts of Project Management to help ensure a common understanding – regardless of whether you are a project manager, sponsor, team member or coordinator. The course covers the unique language, principles and tools of project management and builds a case for their application back at the workplace. This course will ensure you are equipped to manage your projects efficiently and successfully.
Ideal for individuals who have no previous experience with project management, or those looking for a refresher. Also ideal for those wishing to develop an understanding of project management as they progress into Project Administration and/or Project Coordination.
Learning Outcomes
At the completion of the 2-day course, you will:
Have a common understanding of what a project is and how it is different from day-to-day, business as usual work
Understand key terminology, principles and tools related to project management including how adaptive (Agile) and predictive (Waterfall) methodologies are different and how they work together
Understand the difference between project objectives, outputs, and outcomes
Learn and practice how to plan a project, based an output planning approach utilising Output Breakdown Structures, Output Flow Diagrams
Learn how to produce a project schedule including various estimation techniques
Gain practical techniques related to time, scope, cost, and quality
Learn practical techniques related to resourcing and costing on projects
Understand the importance of project quality and how to plan for it
Understand your role in a project and learn tips and techniques to help you manage your time and priorities
Understand a typical project organisation and the roles and responsibilities for each member of the Project Team and Project Steering Committee
Learn about the importance of stakeholders and how to use a stakeholder analysis to produce a robust Communications & Engagement Plan
Gain awareness of Risk Management including the difference between risks and issues
Have a general understanding of benefits, their importance to projects, and how to identify and quantify them
Talk through lots of real-life project examples to cement the learnings and identify traps to avoid.
Have a general understanding of the differences between project, programme, and portfolio management
No prerequisite is required for attendance on this session, but any prior experience or knowledge of project management will be a definite advantage
This session is a mixture of theory and discussion and practical group-based learning involving post-it notes, markers, flip chart paper. An easy to understand and practical case study is used throughout the course. No laptops are required, all learning resources are supplied.

Click Here for more info and to register

description:
Living With Advanced Prostate Cancer (Wellington), Advances in approaches to advanced prostate cancer over the past decade have been significant, with new therapies, research discoveries, and innovations leading to improved outcomes and quality of life for men living with advanced prostate cancer, and their families.
Join us for an informative and supportive evening exploring these advances, with leading specialists who will explain updates on systemic therapy, radiotherapy, theranostics, imaging, and survivorship — how these approaches connect or co-exist, and their possible inclusion in the treatment pathway.
Designed for men living with advanced prostate cancer, their families, whānau, and carers, as well as health professionals, this free event offers the chance to learn, ask questions, and connect with others who understand the journey.
Guest Speaker: Anne O'Donnell | Medical Oncologist
This event is proudly supported by Johnson & Johnson.

Quotemonster Roadshow: Palmerston North, Want to sharpen your expertise and take your business further? Join us for an engaging event created specifically for financial advisers.
This year’s sessions will cover three vital areas—Business Insurance research and advice, Personal Insurance research, and KiwiSaver research—giving you the latest insights, tools, and strategies to deliver even better client outcomes.
Why attend?
Be the first to experience new research updates and platform enhancements
Hear from industry experts and collect valuable CPD credits
Build connections with peers while enjoying complimentary catering
Unlock extended free trials, exclusive to attendees
Make a difference - You show up on the day, we'll give back: we’ll donate $20 on your behalf to your choice of Ronald McDonald House, The Salvation Army, or Bowel Cancer New Zealand when you select your chosen charity on the feedback form after the event.
Stay tuned for speaker announcements coming soon.
Arrive from 9:15am for tea, coffee, and networking. Sessions begin promptly at 9:30am. Please register for each session you would like to attend.

description:
Manage Your Expectations | Circa Theatre, You decide the ending...
Solo performer Eliza Sanders has a simple task: to tell you everything that will happen in the show, so you can decide if you would like to see it. Nothing is ever so simple.
This genre-defying work of dance, theatre, live film, clown and absurd philosophising takes the idea of the ‘trigger warning’ to its absurdist extreme to question how ‘informed’ consent can really be, and asking ‘How much do you really want to know?’
Created and performed by multi-award-winning maverick of the stage, Eliza Sanders, Manage Your Expectations helps us to see the limits of the power to communicate and our failures to say what we mean. Through movement, multimedia, and razor-sharp wit, it examines the impossibility of perfect communication, musing on the influence of context, identity and personal history while creating something beautiful from our collective mess.
"Clever, witty, evocative, subversive, immersive, despairing, poignant, personal and universal" — Deirdre Tarrant, Theatreview, 2024
"Beautifully vulnerable" - Chloe Jaques, Theatreview, 2024
Full of vigour, energy, chaos and a hint of confrontation, Manage Your Expectations is a mind (and body) bending show about how we connect in an increasingly complex world. And you decide the ending…
Content warning: this show contains explicit content, mild coarse language, heavy nudity, themes of abortion and rape.
WINNER: Best Performer, Whangārei Fringe 2024
WINNER: Outstanding Solo Performance, NZ Fringe 2024
WINNER: San Diego Tour Ready, NZ Fringe 2024
NOMINATION: Best in Fringe, NZ Fringe 2024
NOMINATION: Most Innovative Work, NZ Fringe 2024
NOMINATION: Sydney Tour Ready, NZ Fringe 2024
NOMINATION: Auckland Tour Ready, NZ Fringe 2024
NOMINATION: Melbourne Tour Ready, NZ Fringe 2024
NOMINATION: Adelaide Tour Ready, NZ Fringe 2024
NOMINATION: Most Original Production, Wellington Theatre Awards 2024

description:
The Wellington Calling Open Mic: Featuring The English Locust!, WELLINGTON's premier event venue Whisky and Wood is hosting its 6th open mic event: Wellington Calling and we're looking for diverse acts to contribute!

The open mic event takes place Sunday Nov 9 at the new time of 5:30pm.

Located in the heart of the city at 60 Cambridge terrace, Whisky and Wood exudes industrial elegance with New-York loft vibes featuring washed-brick walls, soaring high ceilings, skylights and a wooden bar area.

Each performer gets the chance to have a six- minute set with a microphone, guitar and keyboard provided.

This is an originals only event. We want to encourage new creative voices to be heard.

“We want to provide a positive and encouraging environment for established and fledgling acts to shine in. Its a pretty inspiring place to perform,” says host Steven Hood.

Each performer will need to sign up in person before 5pm and registrations of interest need to be emailed to openwandw@gmail.com before Nov 9.

The feature act is The English Locust, a folk and delta blues musician who has been described as Bob Dylan in goth. His technical playing, smart lyrics and tight songwriting is impressive, to say the least.

Entry is with Koha.

Light food and drinks will be available to purchase.

What: Wellington Calling Open Mic
When: Nov 9, 5:30PM
Where: 60 Cambridge Terrace
Cost: Koha

description:
Stage 2 Health and Safety Representatives, The purpose of this two-day course is to extend the skill level of H&S Representatives. Stage 2 training focuses on specific risk and hazard identification and controls, approved Codes of Practice and using accident data to identify trends and develop preventative actions across the core elements of your workplace H&S system.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for people who have completed the Stage 1 course and are interested in taking their skills to the next level. It would also be useful for anyone who would like to know about the requirements for the role or who have employees in these positions.

Learning outcomes
Identify and report on links to productivity due to improved health and safety practices.
Determine injury causal factors from incident reports and notifiable events.
Provide detailed feedback to H&S Committee meetings for further action.

description:
Rheem training in Wellington - Afternoon, We've added this additional afternoon event in Wellington to deliver free local product training.
This season of Rheem Training for Tradies events will provide background knowledge of product updates and new models. We’ll cover operation, installation requirements and clear-up some myths relating to installation practices, and warranty.
Topics covered:
Heat pump water heaters –
Benefits, current range, installation, service and warranty
Gas continuous flow –
New model updates, installation, commissioning, service, fault-finding and warranty
Electric storage cylinders –
Benefits of model types for harsh water areas, installation and warranty
Myth busting facts –
installation and warranty requirements
Boiling water –
Lazer and Zip models explained, live demonstration of Lazer operation, sequence of operation explained to help with fault-finding
Refreshments will be provided.
Please select the number of free tickets required as the event has limited numbers.
There's no need to print free tickets, your place is secure once booked!

Heat Pump water heating

description:
Self Promotion for Business Owners, First impressions count! 
Present yourself as an approachable, confident and competent business owner to attract new clients.
Overview:
Highly interactive in-person workshop, ensuring you action and refine your learnings immediately amidst a safe supportive learning environment.
Our goal is to make a natural strong first impression and spark further conversation with potential clients. We will cover crafting a compelling narrative, identifying a target audience, and practicing impactful delivery.
Key learnings:
Understand basic sales skills and the psychology around self-promotion
Manage your nerves
Refine your message
Become savvy in articulating your USP (unique selling proposition)
Learn what to say when and how using powerful words and body language
Receive on the spot expert coaching and feedback
Work on your voice modulation, posture, and gestures to ooze professionalism
 Previous Workshop Attendee:
"Big thanks to Angelika Barnes for her course on "Self Promotion'. I would highly recommend her. We learnt so much and had a great time doing so! The workshop helped me immensely in developing a clear, concise & compelling way of presenting and promoting myself in future business environments. Angelika is a great presenter."
Luke Swart, Nelson
Presenter Bio:
With a background in sales and communication as trainer for the Banking Academy in Cologne, Germany and roles in both operational and people management, Angelika has maintained her focus on empowering people through highly engaging experiential workshops and 1:1 coaching sessions.
Angelika empowers people to express themselves with confidence and is looking forward to sharing gems that help others succeed.
To register - visit https://www.abcangelikabarnescoaching.com/funded
You could be eligible for up to75% funding through the Regional Business Partner Network (RBPN) Growth Advisors, e.g. Rose Ryan call 03 577 9575 or email rose@mcoc.org.nz o

description:
Stage 2 Health and Safety Representatives, The purpose of this two-day course is to extend the skill level of H&S Representatives. Stage 2 training focuses on specific risk and hazard identification and controls, approved Codes of Practice and using accident data to identify trends and develop preventative actions across the core elements of your workplace H&S system.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for people who have completed the Stage 1 course and are interested in taking their skills to the next level. It would also be useful for anyone who would like to know about the requirements for the role or who have employees in these positions.

Learning outcomes
Identify and report on links to productivity due to improved health and safety practices.
Determine injury causal factors from incident reports and notifiable events.
Provide detailed feedback to H&S Committee meetings for further action.

description:
Startup World Cup New Zealand Final, Startup World Cup New Zealand Final
For the first time ever, Kāpiti will host the Startup World Cup New Zealand Final, powered by Pegasus Tech Ventures – the world’s largest startup pitch competition.

Startups from across the motu will go head-to-head in front of a live audience and expert judging panel at the beautiful Te Raukura ki Kāpiti. The winner will receive flights and support to pitch on the global stage in Silicon Valley on 17 October 2025, competing for a USD $1 million investment prize.

This inaugural event is more than a pitch night – it’s a high-energy celebration of New Zealand’s creativity, capability, and ambition. Expect standout founder pitches, insight from leading judges, and a vibrant crowd of innovators, investors, and changemakers.

For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email or call 049740535 during office hours.

description:
TENZ Conference 2025, TENZ Conference 2025
TENZ invites you to our 2025 Conference - Inspiring Ākonga Empowering Kaiako, to be held at Wellington East Girls' College, 131 Austin Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011.

The conference is designed for teachers and researchers at all levels of technology education and will provide opportunities to connect with, and learn from, other members of the community as well as get up to date with new products, tools and opportunities that support students’ learning in technology.

Register here: https://tenz.org.nz/2025-conference/

With over 50 sessions spanning the full spectrum of technology education - from food, textiles, DVC, and STEAM to digital, vocational, and emerging tech - there’s something for every kaiako, at every level. Dive into workshops on AI, AR, and rockets; explore neuro inclusion, culturally sustaining practice, and curriculum integration; get practical with tools like Minecraft, WorldPainter, and Brisk; or collaborate on pathways, assessment, and cross-curricular design thinking. Whether you're refining your NCEA practice, reigniting creativity, or discovering new ways to inspire ākonga, these sessions are designed to spark ideas, deepen confidence, and empower you to lead change in your classroom and community. This is your chance to connect, create, and be part of shaping the future of technology education in Aotearoa.
label: Business & Networking

description:
The Effective Speaker, Wellington, 18th & 19th November, 2025, 1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations):
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council
“This course not only met my expectations, but it completely exceeded them. This has been one of the most transformative courses I’ve attended. Jane totally revolutionised the way I now approach presentations. Having felt fear in the past each time I have to present to large groups, for the first time I now feel like I have the tools, understanding and ability to approach presentations and conquer my fear. I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor
"I have never been in such a well-run course (I've done a lot) Jane was amazing she held our attention from start to finish each day. I feel we all learnt so much and I will definitely be taking her advice on how I can improve myself. This course was well above what I expected, Jane had a great way of communicating. Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

“The course is awesome. The balance between talk time, practical learning and feedback is perfect. The trainer really made the course for me - she is sensitive and responsive to people’s needs and is genuine in her approach to give the learners as much out of the time as possible. A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation

description:
New beginnings, New hope. Faith Responses in a Changing World, Join us for an inspiring interfaith panel discussion featuring speakers from the Muslim, Jewish, and Christian traditions. As the world continues to face rapid change, how do our faiths help us respond with hope, compassion, and renewal?
This is the second Wellington event in the Abrahamic Interfaith Dialogue series, proudly presented by the Pearl of the Islands Foundation in collaboration with the Wellington Abrahamic Council.
Light refreshments will be provided
Come along to listen, reflect, and be part of a meaningful conversation. All are welcome.

description:
The Moonlit Market at The Atom - A playful experiment in entrepreneurial leadership, Date: Wednesday 15 October
Time: Doors open 5pm, adventure begins 5:30pm sharp. We’ll wrap up around 7:30pm.
Location: The Atom, Rutherford House, Victoria University, Wellington
Cost: Free (but only 25 places - first in, first served)
Step into a fantasy world where business plans mingle with strange enchantments and the market is never what it seems.
This event is designed with entrepreneurial leadership in mind - for anyone curious about the messy reality of building ideas and leading through uncertainty. If you’ve ever wondered what it really takes to test, fail, and adapt on the fly, you’ll feel right at home.
You’ll take on a fantasy character and join a small team of fellow entrepreneurs-in-disguise. Together, you’ll:
Interview strange and unpredictable NPCs to gather intel.
Dream up bizarre products that might just make you rich.
Build your idea with limited time and energy tokens.
Roll the dice and see what magical mishaps or unexpected opportunities change your fate.
The market is chaotic, the customers are fickle, and your product could become a cult sensation - or a village-wide joke.
This playful experience is more than just fun and games. You’ll get a taste of:
Leading through uncertainty
Making decisions with incomplete information
Collaborating under pressure
Turning setbacks into opportunities (or at least good stories)
No business experience required - just bring your imagination, your sense of humour, and your willingness to play.
