description:
The Smarter Ways to Win Clients For Your Wellington Health Biz In 2026, The Smarter Ways to Win Clients For Your Wellington Health Biz In 2026
Grow your Wellington health business and attract fresh new clients ahead of 2026 by leveraging the latest website tools, tricks and tactics…

About this Event





Join Us at This Year's LIVE marketing Workshop And Get The Latest Website Tactics, Tools & Tricks to Grow Your Wellington Health Practice Heading Into 2026...

Help us celebrate The Wellness Directory’s 16th year anniversary and learn the smarter ways to win clients from your website... without any confusing web jargon and 'tech-aches'!


Did you know our average attention span sits at a whopping 8 seconds right now - one less than that of a goldfish? 🫧🐠
...If you're struggling to keep your website visitors engaged and generate regular, reliable client bookings then this workshop could be divine timing for your health business. If promoting your services across socials feels like a constant uphill battle and a drain on your time, energy and vibrational then this 16th year workshop is definitely for you!
At this interactive workshop, we’ll be revealing the same methods that other NZ businesses currently pay digital agencies thousands of dollars to learn and access.
These are little known and highly effective tactics and tools that will help your practice stand out in an increasingly noisy and competitive web space, ahead of 2026.




After attending this one-off Wellington workshop you will be able to;


✅ Generate regular client enquiries with by using THE one effective engagement tool for keeping web visitors on your website. They will be excited and curious to learn more about you and the services you provide.
✅ Finally discover what your prospects actually do on your website; where they mouse over your page, how far they scroll down and which pages they spend the most amount of time checking out your health biz.
✅ Find out why almost every health business is set up to fail in Google and how you can leverage their regular updates (13 times per day on average!) to rank your website higher than your friendly competitors, and make 2026 your best client year yet...
✅ And lots more including how to make a lasting first impression online, the highest ranking sites to have your health business listed on for free, etc..,

We’re once again excited to level the playing field and empower your health business with these higher level tactics, website tools and actionable tips that anyone can use, whatever the current level of your tech skills.
Come along to our 16th Year birthday workshop and find out how to consistently boost your website traffic, engagement and client bookings over the coming weeks.

*Your workshop ticket gives you access to;
The latest website tactics, tools and tricks for Wellington health professionals
Comprehensive workshop booklet to customise the content for your own business
Morning tea and coffee
FREE parking
PLUS...
🎁 $500 of Celebratory Gifts with The Wellness Directory... just for attending!

*Limited seats are available and this event always fills fast.

Reserve your HALF-PRICE EARLYBIRD SEAT on this page while tickets are still available and avoid missing out later!





💬 What Other Kiwi Health Professionals Say About This Workshop


I wasn't sure whether to come to this event or not today however I'm very glad I did!
-Stephanie Hills Counselling

Great tricks for re-posting content with my own contact details on it and advice around creating lots of our own content. It's given me a kickstart into actually creating posts and putting myself out there on social media more. I would definitely recommend this to other health professionals.
Jonathan's expertise has helped me to understand what is likely to get me the best results now - together with some useful hints on how to up my hit rate on google searches and I've already noticed a lift in my hit rate!
-Deborah Williams (Tides of Change)

I’m glad the focus was not only on social media. I appreciated other ways to engage such as live chat and how to maximise my business on Google. Simple and cost effective tips for a small business owner.
Also appreciated knowing the top sites my business should be listed on and that my info must be consistent across listings. This was good value and time well spent. The material was relevant for my business and aligned with my needs.
-Lisa Bojarski (Four Leaves Nutritional Psychology)


**Our 10x Workshop Ticket Guarantee**
Having run over 30 marketing workshops for health businesses since 2009, we're highly confident that this event will transform the way you think about your current online presence and inspire you to attain far greater results heading into 2026.
If for any reason whatsoever, this experience isn't one of the most valuable and insightful marketing events you've attended in the past 10 years, we'll refund your ticket so that you can enjoy the material, refreshments and workshop booklet on us... no questions asked!

Thank you so much for the workshop. It's the best investment I've made in my business promotion in a long time!
Really appreciated your feedback on my current promo material - increased my confidence in what I am doing and also pointed me where to make a few small 'tweaks'. So helpful!!
The workshop was interesting, well paced and above all practical and usable. Thank you so much.

description:
The Tradie Roadshow 2025 - Johnsonville!, The Tradie Roadshow - 2025!
Come join us at the Johnsonville Rugby Club for an exciting event tailored just for tradies like you! Learn valuable tips and tricks to boost your business and increase your success in 2026. Network with fellow tradies and industry experts to gain insights and grow your professional circle. Don't miss out on this opportunity to take your trade to the next level!


Key Topics & Talking Points

Quote Smarter, Win More
How to make your quotes stand out from the competition with simple, professional templates.
Using free/low-cost quoting tools to speed up response time (and why speed wins jobs).
Adding small touches (images, guarantees, payment links) that boost acceptance rates.

Lead Tracking Made Easy
Simple ways to track every enquiry so none fall through the cracks.
Using a basic CRM or spreadsheet to stay on top of follow-ups.
How to automate reminders so you never forget to reply.

Booking Without the Back-and-Forth
How to let customers book jobs or quotes online, even outside work hours.
Tools to sync bookings with your calendar automatically.
Why offering easy booking options can double your conversion rates.

Boosting Your Online Presence
Making Google Reviews work for you — and how to get them without pestering.
Setting up a simple “digital business card” (or Quickr app) for instant credibility.
Quick wins on Facebook & Instagram that take 10 minutes a week.

Following Up Like a Pro
The 3-day rule for follow-ups — and why it secures more jobs.
Automating polite reminders for quotes and overdue invoices.
Staying front-of-mind without being pushy.

Why It’s Impactful for 2026

Customers expect fast, simple communication — these tools make it effortless.
You can compete with bigger companies without hiring extra staff.
Every strategy here is low-cost or free, and takes less than 1 hour to set up.

This event is free, just bring a mate and your questions to the Johnsonville Rugby Club.

Registration for the event is recommended so we can determine numbers.
label: Business & Networking

description:
The Power of Successful Cross-Sectoral Collaboration: A Real-World Example, From Pilot to Powerhouse: The BEATS Research Journey
Presented by Dr Sandra Mandic
In a world where complex challenges demand bold collaboration, the BEATS Research Programme stands as a beacon of what’s possible when sectors unite with purpose.
Join Dr Sandra Mandic as she shares the remarkable 10-year journey of BEATS—an award-winning, interdisciplinary initiative that brought together academia, local government, schools, and communities across Dunedin. From its humble beginnings in 2013 to its international recognition by 2023, BEATS exemplifies the transformative power of shared vision, strategic leadership, and cross-sectoral teamwork.
In this session, you’ll discover:
🔍 How BEATS advanced scientific knowledge while serving real-world needs
🤝 What made its partnerships thrive across disciplines and institutions
🧭 Key lessons in leadership, adaptability, and long-term sustainability
🚀 Insights to inspire your own collaborative projects and research endeavours
Whether you're in education, policy, research, or community development, this talk offers a compelling blueprint for building impactful, resilient collaborations.
Explore the full story at AGILE Research – BEATS Programme
About Sandy
Dr Sandra Mandic, PhD, PMP is a transformational leader, innovator and award-winning researcher and author. Sandra’s personal and professional journey spans nine cities across five countries and three continents – including Europe, Canada, United States and New Zealand. She speaks four languages and has experience of working in academia, government and business sectors. Sandra was the founder and lead researcher on the award-winning BEATS Research Programme (2013-2023). She is also the founder and the director of the research consultancy AGILE Research Ltd. and the creator of the Compass Guide Research Training resources which currently include four books and over dozen research training and project management courses.
More information about Dr Mandic’s background and the link to her brief curriculum vitae:
https://agileresearch.nz/about-the-author/

description:
The Workplace Rituals Deck Facilitator Masterclass, Build culture by design, not by default - one ritual at a time.
Facilitate meaningful culture change and create connection through the power of workplace rituals.
This masterclass is for people who want to build stronger, more connected workplace cultures — and are ready to turn values and intentions into real, daily action.
Whether you're a leader, culture champion, facilitator, or change consultant, this training will give you the tools and confidence to run your own Workplace Rituals Workshops using the WRD (Workplace Rituals Deck).
Led by the co-creators of the deck, Lotty Roberts and Lorissa Garcia, this is a hands-on learning experience rooted in emotional culture, intentional design, and purposeful leadership.
In this Masterclass, you'll learn:
What rituals are and why they are important
Why rituals matter in workplaces
The difference between habits and rituals
Indepth knowledge of each of the 4 parts of the deck and why they are important
How to use our PARR model to craft rituals that stick
How to run the Rituals Audit
How to guide groups through ideation, crafting and action
Lotty & Lorissa's tips and tricks for using the deck first hand, along with the story and background behind the deck.
You'll walk away as a Certified Workplace Rituals Deck Practitioner, with confidence to run rituals sessions with your own teams or clients.
What's Included:
3.5 hour in person masterclass
Co-led by the WRD creators: Lotty Roberts & Lorissa Garcia
Certification as a WRD Practitioner
Digital Toolkit
Option to purchase with or without a deck.
Who it’s for:
Leaders & Team Managers
Culture Champions
Small business owners wanting to create an intentional culture as they scale
HR, OD, and Change Practitioners
Leadership Development Consultants
Facilitators & Coaches
Anyone who wants to turn values into action and create emotionally intelligent, connected teams and workplaces
Why Join? Because culture doesn't live in a document. It lives in the small, intentional things we do every day. This masterclass gives you the tools and confidence to help others design those moments — and build workplaces where people feel connected, seen and supported.
Culture happens with or without you - rituals help make it intentional.
Presented by the WRD Co-creators:
Lorissa (founder of Assembly Culture) and Lotty Roberts (founder of MiND.U) met through their shared work in emotional culture, leadership, and change - and quickly became friends as well as collaborators.
After years of working with teams and leaders, they kept noticing the same thing: workshops sparked insight, but translating that energy into everyday action was where things fell short.
So they created The Workplace Rituals Deck - a practical, human way to close the gap between knowing and doing. It’s full of simple, powerful rituals to help teams shape a culture that’s not just talked about, but genuinely felt.
Ticket Options:
Masterclass Only – $299 NZD
Masterclass + WRD Deck – $529 NZD (Deck provided on the day at in-person events.)
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break.
Date and time
29th October 2025
9:00 AM – 12:30 PM NZST
Location
Willeston Conference Centre
Level 11  
15 Willeston Street
Call Active House
Wellington 6011
New Zealand 
View Map
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately we do not offer refunds for this workshop.
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify the host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop and have purchased a deck we will send that to you along with the digital toolkit.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
Wellington Before9: Responsible AI - have we figured out what that means in practice?, Join us for "Responsible AI - have we figured out what that means in practice?," an engaging Before9 (Breakfast event) discussing the latest strategic direction of the technology in Aotearoa New Zealand.
New Zealand's first national AI strategy has arrived, aiming to boost productivity and encourage the uptake of AI "with confidence." But as we move forward, a critical question remains: what does "responsible AI" actually look like in practice for businesses and organisations in Aotearoa? This panel discussion will delve into the nuances of the government's new strategy, exploring its impact on our collective journey. Our panel will unpack the challenges and opportunities presented by a "light-touch" regulatory approach and discuss how we can build a uniquely Kiwi framework for responsible AI in New Zealand.
Our panel will be made up of the following individuals:
Zoe Udy, Deputy Chair at TUANZ
Sasha Vlassoff, Senior Policy Advisor at InternetNZ
Plus one other
Zoe in particular will be able to give an update from our meeting with the Parliamentary cross-party caucus on AI.
We look forward to hosting you at this Before9.  This event is free for members of InternetNZ and TUANZ.  This is a number limited event to 30 individuals so make sure you register early.
Please note the formalities will start at 7:45am but you can arrive any time after 7:30am.

description:
6-12 In person PLD, 6-12 In person PLD
The story of Communication and Signs is one of the five great stories which scaffold the learning in Montessori classrooms for the 6-12 year old child. It traces the beginnings of human communication and the development of writing.

How can we as educators encourage writing in our Montessori environments and ensure collaborations and an understanding of the basic writing processes, bring success and enthusiasm to the telling of powerful stories?

What are some of the stumbling blocks for children when researching? How can we provide strategies and structure to enable lively and informative information writing?

In this day-long face to face workshop, with a focus on guidance for narrative and information writing, participants will be invited into the world of learning to write. Strategies and exercises to stimulate interest and action for writers will be given, alongside challenges and advanced crafting lessons for more fluent writers in 6-9 and 9-12 classrooms. We will examine elements of structuring, elaboration, character and place, revision, and author techniques. Note taking and writing for research will be included in an information writing session.

Day 2: Sunday 14th September
Come prepared to share your collective wisdom while we align NZC History curriculum to what we do in our classrooms to ensure that everything is covered. By September we will also have a better idea of where the conventional system is headed with the new-look maths coming out. We will spend time unpacking the the WHY we do what we do.

This is an opportunity for you to discuss, share ideas and gain ideas for ways forward.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
'WOMB WOMEN' Workshop for Women, IMAGINE...100 THOUSAND GRANDMOTHERS SPANNING BACK THROUGH 2.5 MILLION YEARS OF HUMANITY. ONE WOMAN GIVING BIRTH TO THE NEXT, ON AND ON THROUGH TIME, UNTIL HERE AND NOW.

This is AN INVITATION TO COME PLAY, to create with your own hands little Womb Women in honour of your own matriarchal lineage … with hands that have been created from the DNA of all your ancestors before you.
As I sit and sculpt each woman, I become deeply aware that the bone and flesh of my own hands hold the DNA of all my grandmothers. How many of them had their own stories of shaping clay, forming sculptural figures, moulding pots .. what was it my grandmother of 200 thousand years ago created I wonder. 
Through the evolution of humanity, the hands of approximately 100 thousand womb to womb women of my unique bloodline have given birth to my own. Our shared DNA forms these hands which are now shaping clay.
Each one of us has our own special womb to womb lineage, with a unique tone particular only to us, perhaps similar to another, however no one female whakapapa is truly the same.  
Perhaps you will have a particular mother or grandmother in mind as you create, imbuing their passed down wisdom into the clay figurine, perhaps the little woman you make will symbolize your entire line, calling up the flavour of your own unique lineage, or perhaps she is you and represents your own story … or maybe she will hold for you the wisdom of the ancient mother that resides within us all. 
DO COME JOIN US for an afternoon of making your own little womb women.
NO EXPERIENCE NEEDED, simply bring a curiosity and willingness to play, surrounded by other humans doing just the same.
PRACTACALITIES,
bring a cushion and blanket (you may prefer to sit comfortably on the floor as you make - there will also be tables and chairs available)
if you are already familiar with clay and have your own favorite hand tools please feel free to bring these
snacks and hot/cold beverages will be available
Workshop cost includes supplies, materials and firing. I will fire your creation then post it back to you, therefore postage will be extra and determined once packaged up.
PLEASE NOTE!!! This booking is for FRIDAY 5TH SEPTEMBER
                                              ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

description:
6-12 In person PLD, 6-12 In person PLD
The story of Communication and Signs is one of the five great stories which scaffold the learning in Montessori classrooms for the 6-12 year old child. It traces the beginnings of human communication and the development of writing.

How can we as educators encourage writing in our Montessori environments and ensure collaborations and an understanding of the basic writing processes, bring success and enthusiasm to the telling of powerful stories?

What are some of the stumbling blocks for children when researching? How can we provide strategies and structure to enable lively and informative information writing?

In this day-long face to face workshop, with a focus on guidance for narrative and information writing, participants will be invited into the world of learning to write. Strategies and exercises to stimulate interest and action for writers will be given, alongside challenges and advanced crafting lessons for more fluent writers in 6-9 and 9-12 classrooms. We will examine elements of structuring, elaboration, character and place, revision, and author techniques. Note taking and writing for research will be included in an information writing session.

Day 2: Sunday 14th September
Come prepared to share your collective wisdom while we align NZC History curriculum to what we do in our classrooms to ensure that everything is covered. By September we will also have a better idea of where the conventional system is headed with the new-look maths coming out. We will spend time unpacking the the WHY we do what we do.

This is an opportunity for you to discuss, share ideas and gain ideas for ways forward.

Info about the teacher:

Guinean percussionist Sibo Bangoura grew up in Matam – the heart of Conakry’s arts precinct – surrounded by a family of griots. His mother was a singer and his father abalafon player. Sibo absorbed the rhythm from his infancy and began to study percussion formally at the age of 12. At 14, he joined Boka Junior ensemble and then played with Ballet Matam for many years, until he moved to Australia.

Sibo currently resides in Sydney and travels to China, Japan, Singapore and Thailand to teach and perform. He plays with his brothers Mohamed and Epizo Bangoura and has a successful 8-piece band Keyim Ba

description:
Advanced Flush Setting in Two Days, Advanced Flush Setting in Two Days
This workshop is ideal for advanced students who have already learned how to set cabochon stones. Over two three-hour sessions, 20 and 27 September, 10am-1pm, you will be given an understanding of the technique of setting faceted stones using a setting burr, hammers, punches and burnishing tools. This is the first step in learning to flush set facet cut stones so they sit below the surface of the metal.

Session 1 will cover the technique, demonstrations and the basics of preparing and cutting the setting. Students will be shown how to set their stones, and may begin to do this in class, but will then go on to repeat and practice the technique in their own time.
They can do this at home, or for a small extra cost, can stay on at the studio to practice setting for the afternoon.

Session 2 will pick up on the setting techniques, reminding and refining essential steps in the process. Troubleshooting can be covered in this class, as well as learning to clean up the settings. The principles of this setting technique will be covered in a few different scenarios, as some students may wish to take this skill into different styles or directions.

The option for students to have a half-day bench hire after class will also apply to this session.

What is provided: class fees cover your practice metal (copper) and stones (CZ) and detailed handouts that are useful for you to take away to refer to when practising and honing your skills.

Correctly sized drills and setting burrs will be provided in class, but students must purchase their own burrs for practice after class and any future bench hires. These are available for purchase in the studio.

What to bring: Advanced students can bring projects to set stones into, but please note the metal must be at least 2mm thick and we do not allow brass to be used as a project or practice for beginners. The metal must be copper or sterling silver.

Students should bring either a craft magnifier or magnifying lenses/glasses. If you have your own flex shaft tool you plan to use at home for drilling and setting, please also bring this along so that your tutor can advise on the best way to use it. We have two drilling machines in the studio, and these must be shared between the students, so if you have a machine, do bring it.

Practice bench hire after class $20 per person (till 4pm) must be booked in advance.

Workshop fee $195, Early bird $175 till 24 August.

description:
Ask an Astrobiologist, Are we alone in the Universe?  Ask a NASA astrobiologist! 
Event Overview
In 2025, we mark a decade of astrobiology in Aotearoa New Zealand—a field of science that asks the biggest questions of all:
How did life begin?
Are we alone in the Universe?
What is our future beyond Earth?
We also mark 150 years of US-NZ scientific partnership. What better way to honour these two milestones than with a public talk by three eminent NASA astrobiologists and science communicators!
Join Dr Sanjoy Som, Dr Graham Lau, and Sarah Marcotte as they tell us about exciting current developments in astrobiology, plus get a chance to ask YOUR burning questions about life, aliens and the Solar System. 
Guest Speakers
🔹 Dr Graham Lau – “The Cosmobiologist”
Dr. Graham Lau, “the Cosmobiologist,” is an astrobiologist, science communicator, and host of NASA’s Ask an Astrobiologist. As Director of Communications at Blue Marble Space, he blends research, outreach, and education, inspiring global audiences. His Arctic geomicrobiology work informs life-detection strategies for Mars, Europa, and beyond.  
🔹 Dr Sanjoy Som
Dr. Sanjoy Som, planetary scientist and founder of the Blue Marble Science Institute of Science, studies planetary environments from early Earth to Mars. His work combines geochemistry, field expeditions, and science communication, fostering global partnerships in astrobiology while inspiring public engagement with the science of planetary habitability.  
🔹 Sarah Marcotte
Sarah Marcotte is NASA STEM Engagement Network lead at JPL, managing the Solar System Ambassadors Program. A specialist in Mars and planetary mission outreach, she makes complex space science engaging for public audiences through events, media, and educational programs.  
Proudly Presented By
New Zealand Astrobiology Network (NZAN)
Victoria University of Wellington
SpacewardBound New Zealand
With generous support from the US Embassy in New Zealand
🎟️ Reserve your seat now and be part of the conversation about life in the Universe!

description:
Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party (with free lesson), Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party (with free lesson)
🔥 Please note: the event is free but it can only continue if we support the Southern Cross by buying food or drinks 🔥


🌟 Wellington’s favourite monthly Bachata Latin dance party 🌟


Join us for an awesome mix of bachata, focusing on the best sensual tracks and remixes, along with salsa and a smattering of kizomba and zouk. We welcome everyone, from the absolute beginner to the most experienced dancer. We’re all about the joy of social dancing together.

And what makes a free party with great people even better? A free beginners’ bachata lesson with some of Wellington‘s best Latin dance teachers. If you’ve never danced bachata, Latin dance or even any other dance style before then this is the perfect lesson for you. We will have you dancing like a pro in no time!

Bailamos Bachata is hosted free of charge by the Southern Cross. They love the atmosphere we bring but we also need to support them in return. We’re asking everyone attending to purchase soft drinks, food or alcohol from the bar. It’s vital we show our gratitude.

1800-1830 social
1830-1900 free lesson
1900-2100 social

Q&A
Q. What is bachata?
A. Bachata is a popular and fun Latin couples dance. It started in the Dominican Republic, then travelled to Europe and the rest of the world. It now includes a wide range of music styles and dance influences and is still changing and evolving.

Q. I haven’t danced before, is that a problem?
A. Not at all! That’s exactly what the lesson is for – everyone has to start somewhere and we’re a very welcoming crowd for beginners.

Q. Is bachata a difficult dance to learn?
A. Its origins as a party/community dance mean the basics can be learnt quite quickly, so you’ll be enjoying yourself in no time.

Q. Who are the capital bachata collective?
A. We are the combined Wellington dance schools and people teaching bachata and we really want to share this dance with everyone. We love bachata, we love our community and we want to share it with you
￼

description:
Being Tangata Tiriti: a Pākehā Project Taster #2—Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Being Tangata Tiriti: a Pākehā Project Taster
A one-day workshop exploring the beautiful restorative work of being tangata Tiriti in Aotearoa.
Who can we be for each other?
———————
We live in discombobulating times. And cracks are showing everywhere. So much that we thought was secure is shifting and changing. 
But here in Aotearoa, we have an extraordinary pou—Te Tiriti o Waitangi.
Come along for a day of depth; exploring the amazing potential that the relational space of Te Tiriti has for us all. This one is for tangata Tiriti who are deeply committed to an ethic of restoration in Aotearoa and want to go beyond an intellectual understanding.
Join Rebecca and Mel from The Pākehā Project for this one-day workshop exploring the mahi we as tangata Tiriti can do in the journey towards a Tiriti-led future. Using practices of Haumanu, a healing-centred approach to systems change, we’ll be inquiring into our own roles in reweaving the relational fabric that Te Tiriti o Waitangi offered to all people in Aotearoa, but that did not happen at the time.
We invite you into a space for gently inquiring into your unique place in the system rewiring itself. How do we show up where Māori are calling us to be? We'll be exploring relationality and worldview; the nervous system as map for working with activation; systemic racism, the orthodox Western worldview—its whakapapa and how it shows up in ourselves, our systems and society; and our roles in restorative systems change for a Tiriti-based future. It will be interactive, embodied, and nourishing.
Let's create islands of coherence in this turbulent world.
We'll host you upstairs at Vogelmorn Bowling Club, in the beautiful hills of Brooklyn, Te Whanganui-a-Tara. There'll be delicious kai, and a chance to resource yourself, in communion with others. We are so looking forward to welcoming you.
—————————————————————————
About the facilitators
Rebecca Sinclair (Pākehā—Scottish, English)
Rebecca is a facilitator, coach, and complex systems geek - helping her fellow Pākehā come back into the flow of life, and let go of colonial patterns that separate us from ourselves, each other, and te taiao. She is fascinated by the intangible, the improper and the in-between and how everything is always so much more extraordinary than we might think. She is an experienced tertiary educator, Co-founder of The Pākehā Project, Haumanu coach with Centre for Social Impact, a certified Warm Data Lab Host with the International Bateson Institute, and Honorary Research Fellow at Toi Rauwhārangi, College of Creative Arts, Massey University.
Mel Hare (Pākehā— Irish)
Mel is a highly experienced facilitator, consultant and leadership coach. Trained through Sydney-based IECL, Mel is an alum of the Pākehā Project Leadership Journey and a Haumanu coach, and weaves this critical perspective into her practice. She is deeply committed to restorative and relational ways of working and being. Mel was born in Sydney Australia, and her ancestors immigrated from Ireland. She acknowledges the Gadigal people of the Eora Nation, the traditional custodians of the land on which she grew up. Now her heart is in Aotearoa, where she lives in Wellington with her family.
Workshop prices
We are offering choice around what you pay for this workshop. 
Consider Option A ($250 + GST), if you:
own the home you live in
have investments or a retirement account
travel recreationally
have access to resources in times of need
work part time by choice
have a relatively high degree of earning power due to level of education (or gender and racial privilege, class background, etc.) Even if you are not currently exercising your earning power, we ask you to recognise this as a choice.
Consider Option B ($400 + GST), if you:
can access professional development budgets from your workplace or organisation for this workshop
are in a position to ‘pay it forward’ to cover the cost of those who are paying what they can
Consider Option C (pay what you can),  if you:
have significant personal levels of debt
are an elder with limited financial support
are an unpaid community organizer
are out of work, a student or otherwise limited financially.

description:
Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners Block B, Connect with other like minded people that have a love of dance.
Brazilian Zouk was developed in Rio de Janeiro in the mid 90s, and is now becoming more and more popular
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DfhRHnEAbak
..............
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! It is based on the original Lambada dance but adapted to more modern music with a slow-quick-quick beat. It can be danced to a wide variety of music including R&B, Rock and Pop.
In this block of 5 classes you will discover the fundamental techniques, movements and sequences of Brazilian Zouk to get you up and running on the dance floor.
This includes:
Week 1: Passo basico
Week 2: Lateral
Week 3: Io-Io
Week 4: Bonus
Week 5: Combination
They are designed so you can start this block as a complete newbie, or you can continue on as an existing student from the last block.
There are 4 blocks of classes (A, B, C, D) in the complete Fundamentals course. Once these are done, you can progress to the Improvers classes.

TUESDAY 4th NOVEMBER:
Savvy.B (Krump Foundations) @ 6:00PM - 7:30PM
"Mani Tuaga aka Savvy.B | Mr. Powerpuff | Savage Street Beast | Twin $A’B is a movement artist who specialises in the street style of Krump. With over 9 years of experience across Oceania, he bases his successes on staying true to his style, movement and authentic self. Savvy.B remains future focused on longevity so he can serve the dance community by sharing knowledge handed down from some of the greatest Krumpers known both nationally and abroad."
Open Jamz (Choreography) @ 7:30PM - 9:00PM
“Openjamz is a collective born from friendship, held together by movement, and opened wide for anyone who wants to step inside.
It is a home more than a studio — a place where we teach each other, learn from each other, and let the music guide us.
Here, classes are not just lessons, they are exchanges. Jams are not just sessions, they are conversations”
WEDNESDAY 5th NOVEMBER:
Nay Nay (Waacking Choreography) @ 6:00PM - 7:15PM
“E noho ana au ki te Whanganui a Tara engari nō Tāmaki Makaurau ki te Tonga me Kirikiriroa ahau
He kaikanikani au nō Projekt Team me Two and a Half Brownies hoki
He uri ahau nō Ngāti Ranginui 
Ko Renee tōku ingoa
Tēnā tātou e te whānau. I have had the privilege to dance for over 15 years starting in the choreography scene with my first crew Hopskotch and in the NZ battle scene. Dance became more than just a skill set or a way to perform - it became a gateway to community, to service, to traveling to countries I never thought I'd see, a way to connect and a way to express. I am honoured to impart my experiences in my journey with yours. Mauri ora.”
OPEN COMMUNITY CYPHER (Facilitated by Shifting Centre) @ 7:30PM - 9:30PM
The Cypher is a practice of discovery and navigation. It is held with love and care, and is built for dancers to freely decipher their emotions, dreams, discoveries and more. A safe space for dancers, artists and humans looking for a space to connect. Open for all and FREE of charge.

description:
Calligratherapy - Beginners, Calligratherapy combines science journalist James Nestor's theory on proper breathing with the philosophy of ancient Chinese calligraphy to promote a state of optimal wellbeing. Over five weeks, you will develop and practice the awareness of healthy breathing while learning new techniques of Chinese soft brush calligraphy covering five different scripts.

Description
Many of us live sedentary lifestyles, sitting for up to eight hours or more a day hunched over our keyboard - all the while rarely taking a proper breath! Even if we wanted to take a deep enriching breath into the lower lobes of our lungs, we are limited due to our posture. Often due to the stresses and strains of a busy work and life balance, our unconscious brain can develop a pattern of holding, irregular and shadow breaths.

Does this sound like your experience?

Not being able to breathe properly is the key cause of many chronic respiratory diseases (Nestor, 2020)

Calligratherapy combines science journalist James Nestor's theory on proper breathing with the philosophy of ancient Chinese calligraphy to promote a state of optimal wellbeing.

Calligratherapy has been developed specifically for those who have never practiced calligraphy before and who are interested in deriving the benefits without having to learn the language or all the characters. It integrates the simple and intuitive act of inhaling and exhaling into calligraphy practice with Eastern philosophy behind it.

A range of different breathing exercises are embedded into each 90-minute session focusing on different calligraphy scripts. Over the five weeks, you will develop and practice the awareness of healthy breathing, while learning new techniques of Chinese soft brush calligraphy covering five different scripts.

All materials included in course fee.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

Start a new creative practice in Chinese soft brush calligraphy
Develop your own mindfulness strategy
Better manage everyday stress levels and access a calm, empowered and positive state of mind
Find ways to explore eastern philosophy and develop deeper connections with your spiritual self.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".


Duration 5 weeks, Thu 5:30 PM – 7:00 PM

description:
Chain Maille Workshop, Chain Maille Workshop
Learn the ins and outs of chain maille and create your own piece in this seven class course!

About this Event

Our medieval materials expert Achille is ready to be your chain maille master. In this seven class course you will hone in on the chain weaves that incite awe and be bestowed with the agency to create a wearable piece or majestic object of your own design. On the mysterious journey towards mastery, Achille will take you through everything from the dexterity of proper ring closing, to practicing resolve through the depths of theory and mathematics that allow you to design and execute a piece of your very own creation. This is the perfect course to begin your foray into the craft of chain maille.
This course it taught by medieval enthusiast Achille. He is a creature of curiosity and crepes, having spent the last 14 years skulking around the capital publishing “woke leftist paper” as a founder of 5ever books. He has conquered our hearts, minds, and the specialty cheese departments of the local supermarkets. Achille is a master of chain maille, now offering to teach his craft to those willing to take up the challenge.
Some materials and tools are supplied. Depending on the project you choose to create there may be extra material costs, as well as the option to purchase tools for personal use. You are welcome to bring your own bent nose pliers and wire cutters if you have them.
There are variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances! Note that this ticket is a commitment to the entire seven week course. No chain maille experience is required, just a will to delve into the depths of metal weaves. If you're unsure about committing to this craft, perhaps keep an eye out for a one off 101 chain maille class that may come in the future.

Week 02 - 25th SeptemberPlay and Exploration

description:
Cake Decorating Workshop, Description
Cale Decorating Workshop

Join cake expert, Lina, for a hands-on cake building and decorating workshop where creativity meets craftsmanship!

With over 20 years of experience in the culinary and hospitality industries - from managing restaurants across Europe and Asia to running her own cake design business - Lina brings not only technical expertise, but also a genuine passion for sharing the joy of decorating.

Known for her friendly, engaging style and eye for detail, Lina will guide you through each step of the process - from building cakes and decorating including palette knife and gum-paste techniques, to using buttercream and creating a centrepiece.

Whether you're a complete beginner or simply want to sharpen your decorating skills, you'll leave with new techniques, confidence, and of course, your own edible masterpiece.

Let’s make something beautiful - and delicious - together!

You will leave with a tall 6” decorated cake in its own cake box to take home and enjoy. All ingredients included in course fee - just bring an apron and a couple of teatowels.

description:
Chain Maille Workshop, Chain Maille Workshop
Learn the ins and outs of chain maille and create your own piece in this seven class course!

About this Event

Our medieval materials expert Achille is ready to be your chain maille master. In this seven class course you will hone in on the chain weaves that incite awe and be bestowed with the agency to create a wearable piece or majestic object of your own design. On the mysterious journey towards mastery, Achille will take you through everything from the dexterity of proper ring closing, to practicing resolve through the depths of theory and mathematics that allow you to design and execute a piece of your very own creation. This is the perfect course to begin your foray into the craft of chain maille.
This course it taught by medieval enthusiast Achille. He is a creature of curiosity and crepes, having spent the last 14 years skulking around the capital publishing “woke leftist paper” as a founder of 5ever books. He has conquered our hearts, minds, and the specialty cheese departments of the local supermarkets. Achille is a master of chain maille, now offering to teach his craft to those willing to take up the challenge.
Some materials and tools are supplied. Depending on the project you choose to create there may be extra material costs, as well as the option to purchase tools for personal use. You are welcome to bring your own bent nose pliers and wire cutters if you have them.
There are variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances! description:
Clay Creations: Incense Holders, Clay Creations: Incense Holders
Settle in for a cosy evening of creativity, good company, and delicious food.
In this hands-on workshop, everyone will be guided step-by-step to make their own incense holder from air-dry clay — no pottery wheel or kiln needed. The design inspiration for the night will be a dreamy moon-and-stars theme, but there’s plenty of room for personal flair. Those who love to freestyle can create their own unique style, while those who prefer a little direction can simply follow along and enjoy the process.
It’s an easy-going, beginner-friendly space where conversations flow, laughter is encouraged, and there’s something grounding about feeling clay in your hands. It’s a chance to step away from the usual routine, relax into a slower pace, and take joy in making something from scratch.
After the crafting is done, the evening continues with a beautiful plant-based dinner and dessert shared together — wholesome food to round out a wholesome night. Everyone will head home with their own handmade incense holder, a full belly, and that cozy, satisfied feeling that comes from a night spent creating and connecting.

description:
Chess - Learn to Play, Chess – Learn to Play
Starting from the beginning you will discover how to play the 3000-year-old game of Chess. You will learn the principles that guide decision making in all parts of the game, learn algebraic notation and the ability to not only play a game anywhere, anytime, but also knowledge of where and how to play - both online and in person.

Description
Chess is an ancient game of strategy and analysis that hones concentration and focus, as you master the skills allowing you to win at this competitive recreation.

Join tutor, Ryan Hill to learn how to play this game from the beginning.

You will quickly go from understanding the basics to being able to engage in playing confidently and discover where to go for further training or to carry on playing – both in person and online.

Over 600 million people play this game that has remained popular throughout the ages – why don’t you become one of them!

Bring pen and paper to take notes.

By the end of this course you will be able to:

*Be able to use all of the chess pieces to play the game
*Be able to recount and use some of the most common openings and traps
*Recognise where to go for further training or to play
*Develop increasing levels of confidence in your ability to play and possibly win

description:
Cooking - Singapore Nyonya Food, Love scrumptious Nyonya or Peranakan food? Combining Chinese, Malay and other influences, come and discover how to make your own Nyonya cuisine. Some communal ingredients supplied, a list of other ingredients will be sent out before the course starts (approx cost $35).

Description
Create some classic mouth-watering and flavourful Nyonya dishes. Come and discover how to blend ingredients with distinct spices and cooking techniques. You can easily replicate these dishes at home.

Some ingredients supplied but a list of additional ingredients needed (approximate cost $35) will be sent out when course numbers are confirmed.

Please bring an apron, dish cloth, sharp knife, tea towels and containers to take food home.

Target audience: Adventurous food lovers!

Note: Nuts and gluten will be used in some recipes - this course is not suitable for vegetarians.

By the end of the course, you’ll have:
- Made a selection of Nyonya dishes to take home.
- Become more familiar with using the various spices.
- Understood more about the Nyonya cooking.
- Become more confident to cook Nyonya food at home.

Note: Our cooking courses are designed to provide a collaborative and immersive learning experience where learners often work in pairs and/or groups. While we wish to create an inclusive environment for all participants, it is important to note that our courses are unable to accommodate specific food allergies or deviate from the preplanned dishes and menus.

Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Basic cooking skills required.

description:
Cooking Classes, Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
Please contact for booking: indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

So just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!

description:
Dolores Mosquera Wellington New Zealand May 2026, Day 1 – May 10, 2026 (9:00am–4:30pm)
Topic: Working with Dissociative Parts and Their Voices in Complex Trauma and Dissociative Disorders
Overview:
This seminar focuses on adapting EMDR for individuals with dissociative disorders, using the Trauma-Informed Relational Approach for Dissociative Parts (TADP) Dolores has developed. It provides strategies for working with dissociative parts and their voices and integrating a trauma-informed approach to inner conflict safely from early treatment stages.
Key Learning Points:
·         Identifying and working with dissociative parts and their voices.
·         Understanding the function and purpose of “hostile” parts.
·         Addressing dissociative phobias through EMDR informed techniques.
·         Managing resistance and treatment impasses.
·         Structuring work with dissociative parts effectively.
Program Description:
After many early cautions about the potential dangers of using EMDR with individuals suffering from dissociative disorders, limited methods have been offered for adapting standard EMDR procedures to this specific population. Based on these early cautions, EMDR is still considered by many clinicians as limited to the treatment of traumatic memories in high-functioning dissociative clients and only after a long preparation phase that depends on other treatment modalities. Confined by this conceptualisation, the use of EMDR is too often limited, and many survivors of severe traumatisation are unable to benefit from EMDR reprocessing and, if at all, only much later in the treatment process.
Dolores Mosquera developed (with AnabelGonzalez, M.D.) the Progressive Approach model for treating complex trauma and dissociation (2012) and the Trauma-Informed Relational Approach for Dissociative Parts (TADP) (2019, 2025). Using this trauma and AIP-informed models, clinicians can safely utilise a wide range of EMDR interventions (including BLS) from early in the preparatory phase of treatment for patients with dissociative disorders.
In this seminar, she will present her current practice of working with clients, including video demonstrations. Mosquera's deft clinical skills and ground-breaking innovative thinking teach a middle ground between "dissociation blind" aggressive EMDR interventions and overly cautious delays to the use of EMDR reprocessing.
Many dissociative clients have difficulty with hostile, critical voices. The internal conflict is sometimes so intense that the person even has difficulty carrying on an ordinary conversation. One factor that affects this conflict is how the patient deals with the voices or parts of the self.
Key Program Content:
Identify the internal system of dissociation and internal voices that are hostile and critical
How to read the function and purpose behind the saboteur parts of self
Using compassion and understanding to help deal with dissociative phobias within the internal system
Skills to reduce impasses and resistance that may complicate or reduce the efficacy of the treatment
Specific steps to organize the work with hostile parts and voices
 Days 2–3 – May 11–12, 2026 (9:00am–4:30pm)
Topic: From Fragmentation to Integration: A Master Class in Treating Complex Trauma and Dissociation
Format: 2-Day Masterclass: Three Clinical Cases from Start to Finish
Across two days, Dolores will present three distinct new cases illustrating varying levels of dissociation — including one with frequent switching and no initial Adult Self. Each session is interactive, highlighting the therapeutic process from assessment to completion.
Over two immersive days, this advanced master class offers a rare opportunity to observe and analyse complete therapeutic processes under the expert guidance of Dolores Mosquera.

Dolores will present three new and distinct clinical cases, each representing different manifestations of complex trauma and dissociation — including one client who experiences frequent switching and begins therapy without an integrated adult self.
Participants will follow these clients’ journeys from the initial stages of therapy through to treatment completion, gaining deep insight into decision-making, pacing, and the integration of EMDR strategies within complex systems. The format is designed to be highly interactive and reflective, combining video demonstrations, live commentary, and group discussion to deepen understanding of safe, flexible, and attuned clinical practice when working with dissociative clients.
This master class is ideal for clinicians seeking to refine their skills, expand their conceptual framework, and enhance clinical confidence when navigating the challenges of trauma-related dissociation.
Additional Details
·         Eligibility: Must have completed at least Part One of EMDR Basic Training (University of Otago or equivalent).
·         Certification: Participants receive a Professional Development Certificate of Attendance.
·         Dietary needs: Provided upon registration.
·         Parking: Paid on-site parking available.
·         Accommodation: Discounted rates at a local hotel (discount code to be posted on the event site).

description:
Crochet - Christmas Special!, In this half day crochet special, you will get the patterns to make stars, and icicles, mini wreaths, a mini Christmas jumper, Christmas tree and gifts bunting and a cute mini Christmas hat. Please bring some 4 or 8 ply smooth yarn and a crochet hook - see full description for suitable types of yarn.

Description

Join Monique in this half-day crochet workshop where you will learn how to crochet a range of little projects suitable for the holiday season. Choose from stars, icicles, mini wreaths and Christmas jumpers, Christmas trees and a mini Santa hat! There will be a booklet of patterns for you to take home, to enable you to complete in your own time the projects that you didn’t have time to make during the workshop.

You will also learn how to crochet and decorate Christmas baubles! While you might not finish all the patterns this day, the aim is to have a go at making as many as possible!

You will need to know some basic crochet stitches such as single and double crochet. You’ll also need to have some understanding of how to read a pattern and work with diagrams, as taught in the beginners’ crochet course.

Please bring yarn that you enjoy working with (cotton, acrylic or wool, 4ply or 8 ply) in a variety of colours (red, white and green, a neutral colour for the mouse, and glittery yarns are all good options for the Christmas projects) and a matching crochet hook. You’ll also need a pair of scissors and a darning needle.

description:
Free Postpartum Exercise Class, Are you a mum ready to sparkle, rebuild, and find your strength after having your baby?
The Village NZ and Sparkle Fitness invite you to join a revitalising postpartum exercise class with Sierra Ryland, owner of Sparkle Fitness, at Karori Rec Centre, Wellington!

Sierra is a MumSafe, REPs (Registered Exercise Professional) and Safe Return to Exercise certified personal trainer, running and triathlon coach, and owner of Sparkle Fitness. As a mum herself, she knows how important it is to feel strong and confident in your body while also balancing the demands of motherhood.

This class offers a gentle, supportive approach to rebuilding your strength, focusing on pelvic floor health, core restoration, and functional movement. Whether you’re returning to exercise or just starting, this class is your space to recharge, connect, and feel at home in your body again.

What can you expect from this class?
- A 45min session
- This class will focus on the pelvic floor and restoring your core by teaching you proper cueing to help you activate the right muscles. A fantastic opportunity to make sure you start to heal and strengthen from the inside out.
- Functional strength and cardio exercises so that you can be confident each day.
- Small group size: up to 10 mums per class.
- A chance to connect with other Mum's like you, in a small and comfortable environment.
- Go at your own pace. No pressure! We will focus on working at the pace the level you are comfortable with. No counting reps or how much you can lift!
- Morning tea provided after the session and a chance to chat and ask questions.
What do you need to bring with you?
- You! Babies are welcome if you need to bring them along.
- A workout mat and your own water bottle.

This class is FREE, but registration is essential! Spaces are limited so register now to secure your spot https://wix.to/eWOqgl9
Proudly supported and funded by The Village NZ/Wright Family Foundation
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Financial Planning for Retirement, Financially successful people don’t achieve their wealth by accident – they make and execute clear plans. Your retirement is on the horizon and research shows you’re most likely nowhere near financially ready for the retirement you desire and deserve! Get a complete and utterly practical financial plan, so you can have the retirement you want.

Massey University's annual Retirement Expenditure Guidelines study (2019) found:

Just 40% of pre-retirees believed they were well-prepared for retirement, and 57% considered retirement to be a concern. They also confirmed, New Zealand Superannuation is not sufficient to fund the retirement most people want.
Ministry of Social Development (2020):

22% of all people receiving New Zealand Superannuation also receive additional support payments, with over 44,000 superannuants receiving additional accommodation support, and if you needed to obtain Government-assisted accommodation, at the end of March 2020, more than 16,300 households were waiting for state or social housing.

Living in a motel or boarding house with strangers (who may have other vulnerable backgrounds) is not an ideal or safe location to spend your retirement years. But for many, it is the only option they can afford.

If you have not planned for your retirement, then this course is you!

This course has been developed for people in their 50s or 60s that are looking at retirement and have no idea if they can financially survive it: what to do, what $’s they need, how or where they can generate additional income, or even where to go to get help.

It is targeted towards those that still have some time (for some - not much) to make adjustments, learn some basic financial skills, make some big decisions, and positively influence the quality of their pending retirement.

You will be introduced to a simple step by step guide to developing a financial plan for retirement.

You will work through a case study in class, and can then go away and repeat the process with your own data/details. You will be provided with comprehensive course notes to enable you to update the case study information with your own information.

At each step, key considerations and financial concepts will be defined, explained and discussed to help you understand the financial requirements of retirement.

Are you ready for the retirement lifestyle you hoped or dreamed of? If not, then this course is for you.

Disclaimer: The tutors are not financial advisors. No investments, products nor specific recommendations will be provided. A step by step planning process will be taught by working through a case study. Key considerations that should be used by the participants when looking at their own options to bridge the financial gap between what is available through superannuation and what is required to meet lifestyle goals will be provided and discussed. Product names may be used in examples and explanations to help participants understand the financial concepts and the planning process.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

1 Day
Presented by Paul and Mary-Ellen Gadd.

Light, fresh, and packed with vibrant Vietnamese herbs – Gỏi Cuốn (Fresh Summer Rolls) are the perfect summer treat. Join us for a fun and hands-on class to learn how to make this iconic dish from scratch.

✨ Perfect for:
✅ Foodies & beginners alike
✅ Families, students, and community members
✅ Anyone curious about Vietnamese culture or healthy cooking!

⸻

🎉 Come roll, dip, and taste the magic of Vietnamese cuisine in a welcoming and relaxed setting.

📢 Remember: Registrations open one week before the event. First come, first served!

description:
Financial Planning for Retirement, Financially successful people don’t achieve their wealth by accident – they make and execute clear plans. Your retirement is on the horizon and research shows you’re most likely nowhere near financially ready for the retirement you desire and deserve! Get a complete and utterly practical financial plan, so you can have the retirement you want.

Massey University's annual Retirement Expenditure Guidelines study (2019) found:

Just 40% of pre-retirees believed they were well-prepared for retirement, and 57% considered retirement to be a concern. They also confirmed, New Zealand Superannuation is not sufficient to fund the retirement most people want.
Ministry of Social Development (2020):

22% of all people receiving New Zealand Superannuation also receive additional support payments, with over 44,000 superannuants receiving additional accommodation support, and if you needed to obtain Government-assisted accommodation, at the end of March 2020, more than 16,300 households were waiting for state or social housing.

Living in a motel or boarding house with strangers (who may have other vulnerable backgrounds) is not an ideal or safe location to spend your retirement years. But for many, it is the only option they can afford.

description:
GRAND MARAMA BALL WORKSHOP, In the lead up to The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball, join us for a night dedicated to the foundations of ballroom, commentating and Vogue Fem. This is the first time international guest Icons and Legends will host these workshops in Aotearoa, so you don’t want to miss this opportunity.
Connect, learn, and build community through a series of workshops designed to deepen your understanding of the categories, the essence, and the history that make ballroom what it is. 
Whether you're planning to walk at The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball, support from the sidelines, or just want to better understand the culture, this workshop is your opportunity to learn directly from those who’ve helped to shape the landscape of Ballroom internationally and here within Aotearoa.

Strictly no heels.
Schedule:
Vogue Fem & Choreography by Icon Arturo Mulan (NYC Father of the International House of Miyake-Mugler) 
Get into the technique, musicality, and expression behind one of ballroom’s most celebrated styles from the one and only Icon Arturo Mulan Miyake Mugler.
Commentator Workshop by Icon Tantine Matyouz Royalty (International Godmother of the International House of Gorgeous Gucci)
Discover the art of the mic: timing, tone, and the voice that moves the room.
Essence by Legendary Overall Founding Mother Jaycee Iman (AKL, NZ / SYD, AUS)

description:
Freedom and Responsibility in Science - WELLINGTON, Join the Royal Society Te Apārangi for a wide-ranging panel discussion about the many threats to the integrity of science around the world, how they can be addressed, and New Zealand’s place in the global context. The panel will feature expert guest speakers from the International Science Council’s (ISC) Committee for Freedom and Responsibility in Science.
Science today faces many challenges: Scientific and academic freedoms are declining worldwide as anti-science ideology becomes imbedded in many of the world’s governments; state obligations towards enabling science as a human right remain chronically ignored; irresponsible scientific conduct and governance of all kinds increasingly undermine science from within; and the tally of wars and crises which rob the world of the scientific talent held by entire nations is growing year by year.
At precisely the moment when scientific progress on some of the existential threats to humanity is most urgent, science itself is under more pressure than perhaps ever before. So, what can we do?
About the ISC Committee for Freedom and Responsibility in Science:
The Committee monitors trends related to scientific and academic freedom globally, advises the ISC on official statements and positions, and advocates for the Principles of Freedom and Responsibility in Science. The Committee also engages in major projects at the intersection of science, human rights, and philosophy, such as the ISC’s recent interpretation of The Right to Participate in and Benefit from Science.
Event details:
5:40pm - Doors open
6:00pm - Panel discussion
7:15pm - Networking with drinks and canapés till 8:15pm

description:
Fundamentals of Drawing for Tweens and Teens, In this course you will learn the basics of structure and perspective so you can draw anything you like. Returning students are assigned additional challenges in order to promote continuous development of their drawing journey.

We'll be drawing on paper with pencils and pens. There's a strong emphasis on learning structure and perspective drawing, with the aim to feel more confident in drawing anything - real or imagined. We will be drawing things from real life, from photos and from our imagination.

What you will learn in the class.
- Perspective - learning the basics to help draw forms and spaces convincingly.
- Using perspective to draw organic forms.
- The structure of human faces - Constructing the face to understand it.
- The structure of human figures - Drawing the body from the skeleton out.
- The structure of animal and creature bodies - Seeing the similarities to humans.
- Shading and shadows - Understanding light as it hits objects.
- Composition - Arranging elements in your picture.
- Using different B&W mediums like pencils, pens, inks.

This course is catered to ages 10 years or older. Materials included.

Tuesdays after school, 14 October - 2 December, 3:45 - 5:15 pm.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Get Animated! Stop-motion Animation Workshop, Get Animated! Stop-motion Animation Workshop
Ever wanted to try your hand at stop-motion animation and bring inanimate objects to life? Now you can!

Join animator Steffen Kreft and storyteller and poet William Connor for a practical, hands-on workshop that will inspire and enable you to make your own magical stop-motion worlds and movies at home.

Supported by Wairarapa Library Service.

You’ll need to download an app on your smartphone, bring a desk-lamp, a snack, your fully charged smart-phone and charger, a steady hand and an open mind. All other materials provided.

Here's the (free) app to download on your smartphone:
i-Phone:
https://apps.apple.com/nz/app/stop-motion-studio/id441651297
Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.cateater.stopmotionstudio&pli=1

Ages 12 and up welcome – no prior experience required.
Places are limited to 16, so get animated!

Workshop 1-4pm, then a break, and at 5.30pm, we'll screen everyone's work.

Registration is required.
To register your interest, please email <events.waiword>.

About the tutors:

WILLIAM CONNOR
William Connor studied German, English literature, and Theatre at Victoria University in Welling-ton, where he completed his Master’s in creative writing in 2016. He lives between Berlin and Greytown, and works as a teacher, translator, editor, writer, and puppeteer. He has published numerous poems and short stories in several anthologies and journals, has written and per-formed in a number of plays that have toured New Zealand and Germany, and is the writer and cocreator of the intercultural comedy web-series Lifeswap, which explores and celebrates the differences between the German and New Zealand cultures.

STEFFEN KREFT
Steffen Kreft is an animation film director, illustrator, marionette maker and puppeteer. He was born in Münster, Germany and is currently living in Greytown in the Wairarapa.
When he first moved to New Zealand in 2007, he did his Masters in design at Massey University and co-founded the animation company National Park Studios in 2010. He taught design, animation and puppet making at Massey University and The Learning Connexion. In 2012, he directed and organised the Greytown Arts Festival and directed and made marionettes for the award winning adult puppet show “The Kitchen at the End of the World”. In 2014, Steffen and his partner William moved to Berlin for a few years where they started the popular animated web series Lifeswap about the cultural differences between New Zealand and Germany.
Now, he spends his time making short films for organisations like the French/German TV channel Arte, several New Zealand ministries, German museums and start-up companies or creates giant puppets and mesmerising marionette shows for festivals. He is also building a beautiful tiny house on wheels – apparently his most creatively challenging as well as satisfying project yet.
He has a passion for making things with his hands and while his projects are so varied, he can be very proud of the attention to detail that is obvious in all of his work.

</events.waiword>

description:
Hands-on Sourdough Workshop (Neil's), Sourdough for Beginners - $120 (paid via internet banking)
Come join us for a hands-on, in-person sourdough workshop at Willow Corner Collective headquarters (aka my home)! This workshop is currently the only hands-on sourdough workshop being offered in the Nelson region - I teach and demonstrate to you and then you get to mix and practice on your own dough as we go along.
Whether you're a seasoned baker or a beginner, this event is perfect for anyone looking to master the art of making sourdough bread, learning from someone who has 10+ years of experience. Perhaps you've found all the Youtube tutorials and Instagram how-to's overwhelming and are keen to learn via an in-person class. Then this is for you! I've baked hundreds of loaves in the last year alone, sold at a market, and hosted a pop-up shop. However, my passion really lies with teaching others to bake their own sourdough in their own homes, for their own families (or small businesses - one day!).You will be taught, demonstrated to, and then you get to have a go yourself; whilst learning my tips and tricks along the way. Plus we finish by sampling some delicious, fresh artisan sourdough with some favourite toppings!
You'll go home with all you need to make a good loaf of sourdough bread:
Knowledge
Student Guide, including recipes and troubleshoot guide
Bowl, liner, bowl scraper, and razor blade... all the tools you'd need to make sourdough
Dough made in class to bake the next day at home, to wow your family/friends
Confidence to continue the process yourself
Healthy, bubbling starter to continue your journey at home
Continued support and encouragement via our own private Facebook community group, for class attendees only
Note: You will have your dough to take home after the workshop that will need shaping around 6-8pm, so please ensure that will work for you that day.Also, please double check the date when booking. If for some reason you are unable to attend on the day, due to time constraints, I am unable to refund your ticket. I am happy for you to send someone in your place, though. In extenuating circumstances I may be able to hold your ticket for a future workshop; this is decided on a case-by-case basis.
*Payment to clear in bank account two days after ticket bought, after which time your ticket will be released on to someone else. Please pay immediately upon purchasing ticket.
**All workshop info you need to know ahead of time is in the confirmation email. Please ensure you read this down to the bottom.
***I recommend you already have a pair of digital scales, and a cast iron dutch oven at home to bake your loaf with as this makes the best, artisan sourdough, with great rise. Alternatively, a large, lidded casserole dish or enamel roasting pan work also. (The lids are a necessity).
"Sarah’s sour dough class is for real life! Achieve beautiful delicious bread easily in your own kitchen. Sarah teaches you how to fit sourdough into your busy life. She clearly and passionately gives the essential information, tips and tricks to make your own loaf. I loved getting to have a go at each step in the process. I love Sarah’s catchy philosophy “The goal is good bread, not perfect bread.” This took all the pressure off, for me, and I left the class empowered with all the knowledge and skills needed to give it a go at home. I appreciated the thoughtful and well prepared resources Sarah gave us. Thank you!" - Megan
"Sourdough with Sarah was a delight! From feeling overwhelmed and giving up on the idea of ever making my own loaf of sourdough, to dancing with joy as i watch a beautiful perfect sourdough loaf get nice and golden in the homewood stove!The information was packaged in bite sizes with hands on practice in between, where we all got to experience each step of the whole process, which was cleverly condensed and prepared so that despite normally having waits in between, we were able to see it all play out in a short few hours!The process was beautifully organised with attention to detail that had us fawning, came away feeling so blessed and privileged!Sarah's glowing personality made all the information feel easy and palatable, it was so fun!Such a lovely time, great environment to learn with ease." -Melody

description:
Yin and Sound with Kellie and Chelsea, Yin and Sound with Kellie and Chelsea
Join Kellie and Chelsea for a blissful afternoon of gentle yin yoga and sound.

Together, they have a unique passion for creating a container that allows you to deeply rest and nourish your whole self. Kellie and Chelsea's offerings are a sensory sanctuary. They allow participants the space to deeply rest and balance and reconnect with their nervous systems, using the power of yoga and sound. If you're looking to deeply nurture your inner landscape, this is the perfect invitation.

This collaborative offering is a two hour live soundscape, featuring a 60 minute yin yoga nidra and guided meditation.

Allow your body to unravel in gentle, guided somatic yin yoga movements, encouraging deep relaxation and release, all while you are enveloped in the bliss of soothing, gentle sound vibrations.

Together, Kellie and Chelsea have a beautiful collection of sound tools and instruments, including but not limited to:

Two full sets of crystal singing bowls

The handpan and its earthy, resonant tones

Angelic harp melodies

Soft and gentle wind chimes

The shruti box and acoustic guitar, coupled with voice activation and sacred mantra

Come as you are, all are welcome.

With love,

Chelsea and Kellie

**

Please note: You will need a yoga mat, drink bottle, warm blanket, comfortable clothes and a pillow.

To secure your space, book here:- https://events.humanitix.com/copy-of-yin-yoga-and-soundscape-with-kellie-and-chelsea?_gl=1*aofc9a*_gcl_au*MTcyOTcyODUuMTc1OTQ1NTczNw..*_ga*MTk5OTc1NDMwOC4xNzU5NDU1NzM4*_ga_LHKW5FR9N6*czE3NjEyNTgxNjEkbzkkZzEkdDE3NjEyNTg1MjMkajYwJGwwJGgw&fbclid=PAVERFWAOIqcJleHRuA2FlbQIxMQBzcnRjBmFwcF9pZA8xMjQwMjQ1NzQyODc0MTQIY2FsbHNpdGUCMTUAAaeEjUB9RUt90EG547TtqghogUusIalzFYd207BQ9POwY5Apu0BcOiDd6kvUmQ_aem_sx4_O9J9PrTuY8Dne4tAdw

description:
Hataitai community centre Raranga, Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Hataitai Centre & Community House, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Pihinga (Beginners): 11:30am – 1:30pm (pack down starts at 1:15pm)
• Tuākana (Returners): 1:00pm – 4:30pm (pack down starts at 4:00pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.
