description:
Day of the Dead - Dia de los Muertos Celebration, Day of the Dead - Dia de los Muertos Celebration
¡Celebra con nosotros el Día de los Muertos con música, baile, comida tradicional y altares conmemorativos!

About this Event

Welcome to the Day of the Dead - Dia de los Muertos Celebration at AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing! Join us for a vibrant and colorful event filled with traditional live music, storytelling, rituals for remembering the dead and delicious prehispanic Mexican cacao drink. Honour your loved ones at our ofrenda, or altar, and learn more from our faciltator, Claudio Escutia, about this rich cultural tradition.
Let's come together to celebrate life and remember those who have passed in a joyful and meaningful way. Don't miss out on this special celebration!
What to Expect:
Cleansing copal and herbal welcoming.
An opening ceremony to acknowledge the Tlalmanalli (offering and altar) with the deep sound of the conch shell in the four directions and drums sounds.
History of the day of the dead celebration.
Explanation of the altar, and the main elements for an ofrenda.
Storytelling: learn of Mexican legends like Catrinas and Xoloitzcuintle (the Mexican dog that helps the dead to find their way to Mictlan, the Aztec underword).
Remembering and sharing histories about the loved ones that passed away (optional but encouraged) 
Traditional Mexican chants for remembering the loved ones 
Atole de Chocolate, a traditional prehispanic drink - amazing in flavour, consumed cold or hot
Music to invoke emotion and imagery of contemplative natural and mystical environments
Finish with a shamanic atmosphere of relaxation and traditional chants.

description:
Saya Gray, Karen Nyame KG + Mā, Drunken Piano, Banished Music and The Others Way festival are hyped to announce a huge debut NZ appearance on Friday 28th November 2025 for Canada’s Saya Gray at Wellington’s stunning Meow Nui. Support comes from UK producer DJ Karen Nyame KG and Te Whanganui-a-Tara local artist Mā.

Taking the stage in Wellington ahead of her Others Way Festival appearance the next night, Saya Gray will be performing material from her excellent record released earlier this year SAYA.

Saya Gray has earned a reputation for electric, hypnotic live performances, leaping between instruments and genres, beguiling and entrancing her audiences.

“The alt-pop experimentalist delivered a mesmerizing, emotional performance with a triumphant sense of self” – Range Magazine

Watch her NPR Tiny Desk performance here.

Sharing the Meow Nui stage with Saya is UK DJ, producer, vocalist Karen Nyame KG.

“Channeling a deeply rooted attachment to the African diaspora, KG’s innovative and percussive assemblage of dance music spanned amapiano, afrobeats, uk funky, gqom and beyond.” – Resident Advisor

You can check our her boiler room set at Primavera here.

Rounding out the evening is local artist Mā. With their second album “Blame It On The Weather” being released earlier this year, Mā told RNZ “I’d rather talk about how we can move forward, how we can evolve, how we can work together better”.

Don’t miss this celebratory evening of creative expression and artistic genius. With Saya Gray and KG performing for the first time in New Zealand

Expect campy chaos, cheeky banter, and dazzling performances woven between bingo rounds that’ll have you screaming “BINGO!” louder than your last breakup. RubyDax will keep you on your toes with her razor-sharp wit, outrageous outfits, and the kind of sass only Palmy’s fiercest queen can deliver.

Whether you’re in it to win it or just here for the vibes, Drag Bingo is the perfect beginning of Palmy Drag Fest week with fix of fun, friends, and fierce local drag. Prizes, surprises, and scandal guaranteed.

Plus the best of all is the amazing Venue! The best Pizza in town is at Tony's Pizza and together with their fabulous drinks you know it is sure to be a good time!

Get your tickets now!

description:
Echoes of Home: A Musical Journey Across Time, Echoes of Home: A Musical Journey Across Time
An emotional musical journey that brings us back to childhood memories and the timeless charm of traditional Vietnamese melodies

About this Event

Event Information
Some days remind us who we are and where we come from — when an entire nation moves as one to honour Independence.
To celebrate the 80th Anniversary of Vietnam’s National Day (2 September), Viet Hub NZ proudly presents
“Echoes of Home – A Musical Across Time”

This free concert is a heartfelt journey through the sounds of Vietnamese history — from nostalgic childhood songs to powerful wartime ballads and modern melodies of pride and hope. All performances will include English subtitles, making it easy for everyone to follow along and connect with the stories.
Whether you’re Vietnamese or simply curious about a different culture, this is a wonderful opportunity to experience the warmth, resilience, and beauty of Vietnam through music and storytelling.



🎁 Raffle with Over $300 in Prizes
Don’t miss our special raffle on the day. Tickets will be available at the venue for $5 and $10. Payment can be made in cash or by bank transfer.

💛 Support Viet Hub NZ
This event is free to attend, but if you believe in what we do and want to help us continue running community workshops, cultural events, and youth-led initiatives — please consider making a donation.
👉 Donate here: https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/viet-hub-nz-rooted-in-culture-powered-by-community
Your koha helps keep our work going, rooted in culture, powered by community.

description:
Unlock Secrets of Natures Wisdom, Unlock Secrets of Natures Wisdom
Rose McKenzie & Nicole McKinnon - open your world of wellness!

First Light Flower Essences of New Zealand® - Unlock the Secrets of Nature’s Sacred Wisdom with Rose McKenzie

Have you ever wondered what a flower essence truly is? Or how it can support profound transformation at every level of your being?

Join us for an illuminating introduction to First Light Flower Essences of New Zealand®, revered as Sacred Plant Medicines for the soul. More than just remedies, these vibrational essences are potent allies in the journey toward holistic healing and self-realisation.

In this special session, we’ll delve into Nature’s Healing Matrix©, a powerful framework that reveals how these essences work in harmony with the natural world to support balance, healing, and inner evolution.

Discover how these sacred tools can help you to:
🌿 Transform emotional imbalances, outdated mindsets, and deep-seated conditioning
🌿 Clear trauma held in the energy field and cellular memory
🌿 Energise, protect, and harmonise the chakra system
🌿 Release fear, limiting beliefs, and inherited patterns stored in your DNA
🌿 Support your soul’s purpose and evolutionary path

Whether you’re new to vibrational medicine or ready to deepen your journey, this experience offers a beautiful gateway into the healing intelligence of the plant kingdom.

Come with curiosity—leave with insight, inspiration, and a deeper connection to the sacred rhythms of nature.

Each guest will receive a complimentary bottle of an acute flower essence formula.
My talk will be supported by a powerpoint presentation Email

Second part of the evening ✨

Holistic Beauty Therapist & Founder of Phorest Inspired Skincare with Nicole McKinnon

Nicole is a holistic beauty therapist with over 30 years of experience, based in her peaceful home salon in Paremata. With a deep belief in the power of intuitive, supportive skincare, she helps women reconnect with themselves and their skin as they age—focusing not on “fixing” wrinkles, but on nurturing vitality, health, and self-confidence.

Alongside her hands-on expertise, Nicole has completed post-graduate studies in cosmetic chemistry and product development, allowing her to blend science with soul in her practice. Her Phorest Inspired Skincare approach is centered in daily grounding rituals and moments of pause—encouraging women to take time for themselves and honour the natural changes in their skin.

In her upcoming talk, Nicole shares how simple, intentional skincare can become a powerful act of self-care and renewal.

Booking Cost: $30 per person

https://www.artandlivingspace.nz/bookings

For further information contact: Nancy 027 276 2786

description:
FRUIT LOOP FESTIVAL, Fruit Loop Festival
Marlborough’s freshest music festival!
About the Festival
Fruit Loop Festival is Marlborough’s juiciest new summer gig! A full-blown celebration of music and dance, kicking off under the sun and well into the night. Think open-air energy - blending Marlborough's summer magic with a full-scale music festival. An insane line-up of DJs and live performers with production to match! From the first drop to the final track, it's where the beat hits harder and the drinks taste sweeter.
Fresh, wild, fierce - Fruit Loop is the party Marlborough has been waiting for.
The Line-Up
DICK JOHNSON: The heart of NZ’s electronic scene, Dick Johnson is a true house music heavyweight. With remixes for global icons like Fatboy Slim and Claude VonStroke, plus Kiwi favourites L.A.B and Tiki Taane, he’s spent over two decades electrifying dancefloors worldwide. A relentless force behind the decks - and music director for Synthony - Dick brings the fire every time.
SIN: Co-host of George FM Drive, Sin is plugged into the pulse of the dance scene and has quickly become a revered authority on all things electronica. She’s torn up stages at Rhythm & Vines, Homegrown, Hidden Valley, and international festivals from Fiji to the UK. With supports for legends like Fatboy Slim, Groove Armada, and Netsky, Sin brings high-energy house, techno, and ravey curveballs to every set.
KITA MEAN: Kita Mean is New Zealand’s award-winning drag superstar, known for her infectious charm, razor-sharp wit, and high-camp aesthetic. With a career spanning 15+ years across stages and screens worldwide, she’s wowed audiences from Aotearoa and Australia to London, Canada, the USA, and beyond. Winner of the very first RuPaul’s Drag Race Down Under and co-owner of the iconic Caluzzi Cabaret, Kita continues to dazzle with colourful looks, flawless mug, and hilarious timing. Quirky, kooky, kitsch, and quick - Kita Mean isn’t just a queen, she’s an experience.
PETE GREEN: Originally from the UK, Pete is part of the vinyl-digging collective Rare Specimens. His love for deep, worldly electronic sounds brings low-end warmth and an infectious energy to the dancefloor. Along the way, he’s supported artists such as Crazy P, Psychemagik, Audio Jack, and Christopher Tubbs, playing festivals and parties from Creamfields and Rhythm & Alps to Tempo Schmempo. Expect a set seasoned with Italo, ambient, and deep house flavours, dusted with disco, and finished with a splash of techno.
Event Details
Date: Saturday 28 March 2026
Time: 2pm - 10pm
Location: The Fancy Cow, Marlborough
R18 event - Photo identification will be required.
Return Bus Service:
Getting to and from the festival is easy with our return bus service. Pick-up points will include Redwoodtown Woolworths, Seymour Square, and Countdown Springlands. Purchase a return bus ticket when you nab your ticket.
A full timetable and bus information will be announced closer to the event.
Parking is strictly limited at the festival. Drop off recommended.
Tickets
Tickets are limited — don’t wait. Secure yours now!
Door sales may be available.
Have your ticket open and ready to be scanned at the gate.
Kaupapa
Fruit Loop is a safe, inclusive space where everyone belongs. If you can’t celebrate diversity, respect others, and bring good vibes, this festival isn’t for you.
Harassment or discrimination of any kind will not be tolerated. Anyone behaving this way will be removed.
Refunds and Cancellations
Fruit Loop Festival is a rain or shine event. The festival will proceed regardless of weather conditions, except in circumstances where safety is compromised or conditions make it impossible for the event to continue.
No refunds will be given for changes to the programme, line-up, or advertised performers.
Stay Connected
Follow us for line-up drops, updates and key event information: @fruitloopfestival on Instagram

description:
For Singing's sake Festival, Join community choirs from the Wellington region for a day of singing, sharing, and learning , all while having fun getting to know each other. Experience the magic of mass singing and the energy of performing for and cheering each other. Our song leaders for the inaugural year of this Festival are Susie Hardie (Hutt Valley Community Choir, Andrea Robinson (Khandallah Singers), and Lala Simpson (Wellington Community Choir and Kotaba Voices). We will start the day as a mass choir to learn 3 songs for our combined performance, then in the afternoon we will present a FREE public concert featuring each choir and our mass choir. We are looking forward to singing with you!
Please bring: a drink bottle, keep cups, comfortable clothing for rehearsals, performance attire for the concert, and your own lunch.
Schedule for the day:
10 am -arrivals and first combined rehearsal 
11:00- morning tea break (provided)
11:15 – Combined rehearsal (sectional)
11:40– combined rehearsal
12:30– lunch (Please bring your own)
1:00 – combined rehearsal and individual choirs practice getting on and off stage
2:00- break
2:30 – concert begins
4:00 – finish

description:
Folk in the Vines 2025 - December 6th, Join us for an afternoon of music and wine. We invite you to bring your own picnic food, pre-order one of Le Grá’s delish platters (pictured below) with your ticket or decide on the day. Our caravan bar will be set up for all beverage needs – Le Grá wines, cocktails, a selection of beers, ciders and non-alcoholic sodas. No BYO drinks please.

And for the music!

Kyan – a local lad who is making his place in the music world. He and his band took out the ‘next in line’ annual music event in Otepoti. He’ll be playing as a solo act for us with some of his original music and covers.

Another local and one of our absolute favourites, Michael Krishnan Jones, will keep toes a-tapping with his acoustic guitar and legendary voice. From his Johnny Cash impression known throughout the land, expect folky covers from the 60’s through to the present day, Scott McKenzie through to George Ezra. We love Mike!

And to take us home – The Noodles. Based in Wellington and the Wairarapa, and entertaining us for the last 20 years, the Noodles are one of the most selected cover bands, so get ready to Party with The Noodles! They promise to serve up a high-energy blend of Rock, Pop, and Party anthems, guaranteed to get you moving and singing along. With their infectious energy, tight musicianship and catchy hooks, The Noodles are a perfect recipe for our afternoon of fun in the sun.

description:
Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt, Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt 🐎
Proudly sponsored by Hutt City Council
📍 Dowse Square & Lower Hutt Town Hall
📅 Saturday, 31 January 2026
🕚 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM
Join us for a colourful, family-friendly Lunar New Year Festival in the heart of Lower Hutt!
Organised by Viet Hub NZ and proudly sponsored by Hutt City Council, this outdoor cultural festival celebrates not only Vietnamese Tết but also embraces wider Lunar New Year traditions from diverse communities across Aotearoa.
Let’s gallop into the Year of the Horse together through music, food, stories, and joyful celebration!
🎭 What to Expect:
Outdoor Cultural Market: Featuring authentic street food, handmade crafts, and local community stalls
Live Stage Performances: Lion dance, drumming, cultural dances, and musical acts throughout the day
Cultural Games & Crafts: Hands-on activities like calligraphy, lantern making, and Vietnamese folk games
Storytelling Exhibition: An indoor showcase of migration stories, heritage, and identity from local residents
Traditional Costume Photo Corner: Indoor area to take photos in Vietnamese and cultural New Year outfits
Family Fun: Face painting, interactive workshops, lucky draws, and more.
🎟️ Tickets:
Free General Admission – Register to stay updated and be entered in giveaways
Optional Donation – Help us grow this community-led festival and support ongoing Viet Hub NZ programme
💛 Why You Should Come:
This is Lower Hutt’s largest, most inclusive Lunar New Year celebration, designed for all ages and backgrounds. Whether you’re reconnecting with your heritage or discovering new traditions — everyone is welcome.
📢 Stay Connected:
Follow us on Facebook or visit www.viethubnz.org
📧 Contact us: hello@viethubnz.org
🫶 This event is made possible thanks to the generous support of Hutt City Council and our amazing volunteers, artists, and community partners.

description:
Dancesplash 2025, ArtSplash is a week-long festival, held every two years, that celebrates tāmariki and rangatahi experiencing performance on the big stage in dance and choir concerts. This year, we have two separate groups performing – one at ArtSplash and the other at DanceSplash.
Mrs Long and Mr Graff have a hard-working troupe of dancers training to perform on Thursday 28 August at the 5pm show, held at the Opera House.
This is a new venue for the show, what a treat! This group will be heading into town by 8:15am for the dress rehearsal, before returning to school to catch their breath. They’ll head back in together on the bus and will be ready to head home with their spectator parents at the conclusion of the show. Watch this space for more details and how you can help.
Tickets are now on sale. You can purchase them via the Ticketmaster website. NOTE: Due to limited seating and a high number of schools involved, there is a limit of TWO tickets per performer. Don’t miss out!

description:
Tui Express, Tui Express
Mainline Steam’s popular Tui Brewery trip returns with Steam locomotive Jb1236 (Joanne) and the fleet of Ao carriages featuring large panoramic windows, air conditioning and heating.

Travel from Plimmerton through Pukerua Bay overlooking the stunning coast line with views of Kapiti Island as we proceed north through Kapiti into the country side of the Manawatu. We pass through the Manawatu Gorge with spectacular views of the river and the remnants of the old highway now bypassed by the new The Te Ahu a Turanga highway over the Tararua ranges.

Our buffet carriage will have food and drinks available for purchase during the trip.

Upon arrival at Mangatainoka, a bus will transfer you to the Tui Brewery or feel free to take the 10-minute walk to the Brewery.

Our hosts at the Tui Brewery will serve a gourmet BBQ lunch in the original Flagon room with a complimentary drink (beer, cider, Sav) and you will receive the Mangatainoka Passport full of vouchers to redeem at the Brewery. Please purchase the lunch option when booking your train tickets.

Timetable:

Depart Plimmerton 7:45am Return 6:35pm

Depart Paraparaumu 8:25am Return 6:10pm

Depart Otaki 9:15am Return 5:25pm

Depart Levin 9:50am Return 4:55pm

Depart Palmerston North 10:50am Return 4:05pm

Depart Mangatainoka 2:25pm

Please be at your boarding station 10 minutes prior to departure with your tickets ready.

Tickets Prices

From Plimmerton or Paraparaumu: Adult $145. Child (under 16) $85

From Otaki or Levin: Adult $125. Child (under 16) $65

From Palmerston North: Adult $85. Child (under 16) $50

Tui Brewery BBQ Lunch and complementary drink: Adult $45. Child (under 16) $20

Our carriages may not be suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us at: or 04 233 8131.

description:
Great Sounds Great Festival 2025, Eyegum Music Collective presents GREAT SOUNDS GREAT, a multi-venue music and arts festival taking over Pōneke's Cuba Street precinct for one night only on Saturday 6 September 2025. Showcasing 40 of Aotearoa's best artists across 10 neighbouring venues, this is one big party you shouldn't miss.

Eyegum has worked hard to curate a programme that is sure to offer something for everyone, from first time gig-goers to seasoned live music obsessives. The eclectic lineup includes perennial indie maestros The Bats, capital hometown heroes The Phoenix Foundation, hip hop superstar JessB, troubadour-turned-party starter Anthonie Tonnon, captivating genre-bender Reb Fountain, the incredible local-by-way-of-Naarm Jen Cloher, plus a selection of up-and-coming artists handpicked from Eyegum's Free Wednesday weekly showcase series, and everything in between. There will also be plenty more to be announced soon.

Excitingly for 2025, we will be adding three new venues: St Peter's on Willis, Flying Nun Records and 13 Garrett Street (sponsored by Radio Active), as well as a travelling electronic stage curated by Tonic Collective. This means more artists and music to experience in a variety of special and unique spaces throughout the night.

Ticket holders will receive a wristband that will give them access to each of the participating venues throughout the event. Information on how to pick up wristbands will be provided to ticket holders closer to the time.

Tickets are on sale now at eyegum.co.nz/great-sounds-great

description:
Heritage Festival - Self-guided Tour of Truby King Park, Discover the hidden history of Truby King Park—scan, stroll, and uncover stories with your smartphone.

Step into a garden full of stories, some inspiring, some surprising. From cherry trees and hospital wards to the people who shaped New Zealand’s early healthcare, follow the QR trail to uncover the layers of Truby King Park’s past.

Health & Safety
This is a self-guided experience. Please explore within your limits. Wear good shoes and dress for the weather.

Parts of the park may be cordoned off for your safety. Please respect the cordons. Paths and steps may be slippery when wet.

description:
Great Sounds Great festival 2025, Great Sounds Great festival 2025
Eyegum Music Collective presents GREAT SOUNDS GREAT, a multi-venue music and arts festival taking over Pōneke's Cuba Street precinct for one night only on Saturday 6 September 2025. Showcasing 40 of Aotearoa's best artists across 10 neighbouring venues, this is one big party you shouldn't miss.

Eyegum has worked hard to curate a programme that is sure to offer something for everyone, from first time gig-goers to seasoned live music obsessives. The eclectic lineup includes perennial indie maestros The Bats, capital hometown heroes The Phoenix Foundation, hip hop superstar JessB, troubadour-turned-party starter Anthonie Tonnon, captivating genre-bender Reb Fountain, the incredible local-by-way-of-Naarm Jen Cloher, plus a selection of up-and-coming artists handpicked from Eyegum's Free Wednesday weekly showcase series, and everything in between. There will also be plenty more to be announced soon.

Excitingly for 2025, we will be adding three new venues: St Peter's on Willis, Flying Nun Records and 13 Garrett Street (sponsored by Radio Active), as well as a travelling electronic stage curated by Tonic Collective. This means more artists and music to experience in a variety of special and unique spaces throughout the night.

Ticket holders will receive a wristband that will give them access to each of the participating venues throughout the event. Information on how to pick up wristbands will be provided to ticket holders closer to the time.

Tickets are on sale now at eyegum.co.nz/great-sounds-great

When: from 3pm Saturday 6 September 2025
Where: San Fran, Meow, Valhalla, Rogue & Vagabond, Bedlam & Squalor, Hotel Bristol (2 stages), St Peter's on Willis, Flying Nun Records, 13 Garrett St, and more
Who: The lineup will include Amira, Anthonie Tonnon, Asset, Baby Zionov, Bad Taste, BADTAB, Baeoli, Bathysphere, The Bats, By A Damn Sight, Cindy, Cruelly, DJ Kristen Stewart, Dropper, Eveline Breaker, Goya, Half/Angel, Hans Pucket, Iris Little, Jazmine Mary, Jen Cloher, JessB, JHL, Jim Nothing, Jordan Hamel, Leah Dodd, LEAO, Louisa Nicklin, Mystery Waitress, Nam Chucks, The Phoenix Foundation, Reb Fountain, Rebecca Hawkes, Robert Scott, Shayne P Carter (solo), Sig Wilder & Friends, Sofia Machray, Space Bats, Attack!, The Spectre Collective: live-scored cinema, $tacey Lee, Star Time, UMU.

description:
Irish Cultural Festival, Irish Cultural Festival
Join the Fun at the Community Cultural Festival! 🍀

Get ready for an unforgettable afternoon of celebration, culture, and community spirit!

The Hutt Valley Irish Society invites you to a lively Community Cultural Festival filled with the heart and soul of Irish tradition—and plenty of fun for everyone.

🎶 Live Irish Music to get your toes tapping
💃 Traditional Irish Dance performances that will amaze and inspire
🏐 Irish Sports Demos—give Gaelic games a go!
🍞 Soda Bread Making—watch, learn, and taste! Have a go for koha!
🧒 Children's Activities—face painting, crafts, and games galore
🧬 Genealogy Info Booth—trace your roots and explore your heritage

Whether you've got Irish roots or just a love for good craic, there's something for all ages at this community celebration. Entry is free—bring your friends, family, and your dancing shoes!

Don't miss out—let's make it a day to remember!

Thanks to sponsor support from- Hutt Mana Charitable Trust and the Wellington Irish Community Trust and all the participating groups that are going to make this day.

description:
Japanese Film Festival Wellington 2025, The Embassy of Japan, in cooperation with the Japan Foundation, is very pleased to announce the return of the Japanese Film Festival to Wellington!

The Japanese Film Festival is an annual event held to encourage the growth of Japanese culture and understanding in New Zealand. Each year, we try to give the people of New Zealand some insight into the culture, customs, and traditions of Japan, alongside what is popular with Japanese society today, through film.

Please refer to the details at our website.

Wellington, Roxy Cinema: 26-28 September 2025
*Bookings required/Booking fee $2.01 via the Japanese Film Festival 2025 website above.

description:
Kaiwhakaataata Māra | Garden Performers, Kaiwhakaataata Māra | Garden Performers
Keep your eyes and ears open for pop-up performances scattered across two of Wellington’s most beautiful gardens. Talented artists will appear spontaneously as you wander through Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush and the Botanic Garden ki Paekākā, bringing music, storytelling, and theatre to life in unexpected places for Te Wā o te Kōanga, Spring Festival 2025.


Botanic Garden ki Paekākā - Love Birds
Brought to you by the Shakespeare Globe Centre New Zealand
Join us at Puriri Lawn for interactive readings celebrating Shakespeare and spring at 11:30am and 2:30pm, with roaming performers delighting visitors in between.

Come dressed to impress for our bird costume competition, with judging at 12pm and 3pm following the readings. Feathers, colours, and creativity encouraged!


Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush - Meet the Moa
With String Bean Puppets
Come meet Nunu, the friendly moa puppet! Nunu will be roaming the garden during two special sessions: 11:00–11:45am and 12:15–1:00pm. Feed him some leaves, give him a cuddle, and enjoy this fun, interactive experience bringing Wellington’s prehistoric past to life.


This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.

description:
Kapiti Strawberry Festival 2025, Welcome to the 2025 Kapiti Strawberry Festival!

The Sweetest Festival on the Kapiti Coast.

During November and December thousands of delicious strawberry sundaes will be sold around the region to raise funds for Mary Potter Hospice to help keep the hospice service free.

The Hospice provides some of the best quality specialist care in the world for people facing terminal illness and their families.

Come along to Kapiti Primary School in Paraparaumu on Saturday 15 November from 9.30am and celebrate spring and help us to keep hospice services free.

Things to do and see:
Strawberries and ice cream
Sausage sizzle
Face painting
Food trucks
Bouncy castles
Loads of kids entertainment (which can be enjoyed by the whole family)
Entertainment throughout the day on the big stage
Loads of stalls selling a variety of items.
Grab those Christmas bargains and get your photo taken with Santa.

Check out the website and the Facebook page for more information.
https://www.facebook.com/KapitiStrawberryFestival

Come along - it will be fun family day out and you will be supporting a great cause.

This Festival would not be able to run without the generosity of the amazing Red Sponsors - Pak'nSave Kapiti, Mixed Media Design, Beach FM and Mills Albert.

Gold coin donation on gate entry.
label: Festivals

description:
Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026, Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026
Get ready, Kapiti – something bold, creative, and totally unforgettable is coming your way. On Saturday, 7th March 2026, the Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival makes its explosive return at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, bringing together the ultimate fusion of ink, art, and live entertainment for one epic day of creativity and connection. Whether you're a tattoo enthusiast, an art lover, or someone who thrives in high-energy, artistic environments, this festival is your ticket to something truly extraordinary.

This isn’t just another tattoo expo — it’s a full-blown creative takeover. Expect to see over 40 talented artists under one roof, from the regions leading tattooists to visionary painters, sculptors, illustrators, and local craftspeople. You’ll witness live tattooing, explore interactive art installations, shop handcrafted works, and dive into workshops designed to spark your imagination. Plus, with non-stop local entertainment on the main stage — from musicians to performers and DJs — the atmosphere will be electric from start to finish.

What makes this event truly special? It’s powered by the team at Kapiti Castles — the creative minds behind the popular Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo. Known for producing vibrant, community-driven experiences, Kapiti Castles has crafted this festival as a platform for creative expression, community connection, and artistic inspiration. Whether you're an artist looking to grow your brand or a visitor eager to explore the region’s creative heartbeat, this is your moment.

The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival is more than an event — it’s a movement. It’s a chance to meet incredible artists, get inspired, celebrate culture, and maybe even walk away with some fresh ink. With something for everyone — from art collectors to curious newcomers — this is a must-attend event for 2026.

So mark your calendars for 7th March, gather your crew, and get your tickets now. The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026 is where creativity comes alive, and you won’t want to miss being part of it. Tickets are on sale now — don’t miss your chance to be part of Kapiti’s boldest new festival.

description:
Keep Hush X Twisted Frequency | Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, Keep Hush X Twisted Frequency | Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington
Twisted Frequency is teaming up with Keep Hush to bring a slice of Aotearoa’s outdoor festival culture into the city and broadcast to the world.

For the uninitiated, Keep Hush started as an intimate underground club night in London and has grown into a global platform celebrating underground dance music through live streams, pop-ups, and parties in unexpected places.

These folks have such a fantastic kaupapa that resonates deeply with what we are doing down here in Aotearoa and we couldn't be more stoked to work with them and share a bit of the Twisted community's creative passion with the world.

Featuring a carefully selected lineup of talent who are dedicated to creating original homegrown tunes, all representing a unique aspect of the country’s bass music melting pot. This will be a journey of sound from dub-infused taonga pūoro to home mulled jungle breaks and all stops between.

description:
Marlborough Lines Classic Fighters Airshow 2027, Marlborough Lines Classic Fighters – ‘Putting on the Ritz’
We’re bringing the glamour back bigger and better for 2027!
Step into the golden age of aviation as the skies sparkle with the elegance of the 1920s and 1930s. Marvel at breathtaking aerobatics, feel the thrill as legendary WW2 warbirds take command overhead, and soak up the glamour of a bygone era.
Beyond the flying action, enjoy a weekend packed with classic cars, fireworks, fantastic food, live entertainment, and family fun. It’s a celebration you won’t want to miss!
🎟️ Tickets now available online – choose a single-day ticket for any day you prefer, or take advantage of our new multi-day passes. A Friday ticket includes the full day’s program plus the spectacular Twilight Extreme.
Join us in Marlborough for a show that promises to be unforgettable – we can’t wait to see you there!
label: Festivals

description:
Martinborough Music Festival 2025, Bringing the world to Martinborough for chamber music in the heart of South Wairarapa.

Join us for four exciting concerts over three days, featuring stunning New Zealand and international artists including Natalia Lomeiko (violin), Yuri Zhislin (violin/viola), Matthias Balzat and Ashley Brown (cello), Jian Liu (piano), Wilma Smith and Donald Armstrong (violin), Simon Brew (saxophone) and Caroline Henbest (viola).

These artists will bring to life extraordinary works including Zoltán Kodály's Duo for Violin and Cello, Op. 7; JS Bach's Goldberg Variations for string trio; Shostakovich's Piano Quintet in G minor, Op. 57 and Mozart's String Quintet No. 5 in D major, K.593.

The Sunday afternoon concert will also include the world premiere of Shifting Worlds, a piano quintet by renowned New Zealand composer Louise Webster, who has special ties with South Wairarapa.

Visit martinboroughmusicfestival.co.nz for more information about artists, programmes and links to ticket sales.

description:
NZ Brewers Fest, NZ Brewers Fest is moving to April!
Lining up with Fresh Hop season, we will be bringing the all the incredible beers, outstanding entertainment and delicious kai you expect, with a fresh hop twist!
Save the date and watch this space for more info, coming soon!

TICKETS ON SALE SOON!

Drinks!
It wouldn’t be NZBF without great beer, and this year 20 of Aotearoa’s best breweries will descend on Brewtown to pour every style you could possibly desire, from crisp Lagers, cold IPAs and hoppy Pale Ales, to funky Sours, smoky Porters, rich Pastry Stouts – and everything in between!
Visit Brewtown’s own custom Unimog Bar for 13 beers handpicked by our craft beer experts, but get in quick – we only have 1 keg of each, and they won’t last long!
New for this year! Step into our cocktail bar for some seriously scrumptious spirits! Our mixologists have been hard at work creating some delicious drops just for you.
We’re bringing in some of the best wines the Wairarapa has to offer, so whether you prefer a crisp Sauv, a fruity Pinot or a refreshing Frosé there will be something to enjoy.
Still not enough for you? Then head down to the Everything Else Bar, for NZ crafted ciders, as well as bourbon, rum, gin and vodka alongside a range of low and no alcohol beers, cocktails and soft drinks.

Kai!
The NZBF food court hosts the region’s top foodies, bringing you big, bold, flavour-packed festival eats that’ll satisfy every craving.
Watch this space as we announce our festive foodie lineup!

Entertainment!

Lose yourself in a cabaret of the bizarre, where the performances are as dark as they are dazzling.
Witness the brutal thrill of buhurt armoured combat, as warriors face off in full medieval kit in a raw display of might and mayhem.

Dance the day away at the main stage, as Welly’s top talent smash out tune after tune, all building up to a headline show from Brewtown favourites, The Blueprint.

Grab your mates and get stuck in at the Games Zone, where a bit of friendly rivalry meets festive fun, and the loser buys the next round.

With affordable return coaches from Welly and Petone and great discounts for group tickets it's scarily easy to get involved!

Thanks to the generous support of Masterton Trust Lands Trust and Trust House Limited, the festival is returning for its third successful year!

Join us in the Green Space at Queen Elizabeth Park (beside Kids Own Playground) on Saturday 6 September, 10.30am – 2.00pm.

Enjoy stalls, music, food, and performances from a wide variety of cultural groups in Masterton. It’s completely free and family-friendly, so mark your calendars and come celebrate with us!

description:
NZ Brewers Fest - Monster Mash, NZ Brewers Fest - Monster Mash
🦇A Day of Decadence, Darkness and Delights 🕷️

Join us from midday until the shadows stretch long, as Brewtown transforms into a haunted haven of unholy delights for NZ Brewers Fest 2025 – Monster Mash!

🍻Fiendishly good Beer!
It wouldn’t be NZBF without great beer, and this year 20 of Aotearoa’s best breweries will descend on Brewtown to pour every style you could possibly desire, from crisp Lagers, cold IPAs and hoppy Pale Ales, to funky Sours, smoky Porters, rich Pastry Stouts – and everything in between!

Visit Brewtown’s own custom Unimog Bar for 13 beers handpicked by our craft beer experts, but get in quick – we only have 1 keg of each, and they won’t last long!

🍸Haunting Spirits & Wine!
New for this year! Step into our haunted cocktail bar for some seriously spooky spirits! Our mixologists have been hard at work creating some devilishly delicious drops just for you.

We’re bringing in some of the best wines the Wairarapa has to offer, so whether you prefer a crisp Sauv, a fruity Pinot or a refreshing Frosé there will be something to enjoy.

Still not enough for you? Then head down to the Everything Else Bar, for NZ crafted ciders, as well as bourbon, rum, gin and vodka alongside a range of low and no alcohol beers, cocktails and soft drinks.

🌮Monstrously Good Kai!
The NZBF food court hosts the region’s top foodies, bringing you big, bold, flavour-packed festival eats that’ll satisfy both the living and the undead.
Watch this space as we announce our festive foodie lineup!

⚔️Enthralling Entertainment!
Lose yourself in a cabaret of the bizarre, where the performances are as dark as they are dazzling. Expect sultry burlesque, twisted characters and moments that will thrill, chill, and have you begging for more.

Witness the brutal thrill of buhurt armoured combat, as warriors face off in full medieval kit in a raw display of might and mayhem.

Dance the day away at the main stage, as Welly’s top talent smash out tune after tune, all building up to a headline show from Brewtown favourites, The Blueprint – as they bring a special set just for Monster Mash! Trust us, you haven’t seen them like this before…

Grab your mates and get stuck in at the Games Zone, where a bit of friendly rivalry meets festive fun, and the loser buys the next round.

Enjoy dressing up? Go all out in your most terrifying, theatrical or jaw-dropping costume — and you might just take out the crown in our epic Best Dressed Competition, with spooky-good prizes up for grabs.

With affordable return coaches from Welly and Petone and great discounts for group tickets it's scarily easy to get involved!
🎃 R18
label: Festivals

description:
NZ Drum & Dance Camp, NZ Drum & Dance Camp
Join us this 24th to 27th October for a West African musical immersion at our annual NZ Drum Dance Camp.

Set amidst 38 acres of native bushland just a short drive from Wellington, this weekend is a celebration of unity, rhythm, and the soul-stirring power of African drum and dance, curated for the NZ African drumming community.

We are excited to announce that Epizo Bangoura will be back to join us again in 2025!

Epizo Bangoura is a celebrated master musician from Guinea, West Africa, known for his extraordinary versatility on the Kora (African harp), Balafon (African tuned percussion), and Djembe/Duns.

Epizo will be joined by Ghanaian Master Drummer Yaw Asumadu and special guest Jimi Dale.

Camp Highlights:

♪ Djembe and Dunun Workshops: Suitable for all skill levels, from enthusiastic beginners to advanced drummers, guided by our awesome team of teachers.
♪ Traditional Dance: with the effervescent Epizo Bangoura.
♪ Group Jams and Musical Sessions: Strengthen communal bonds through captivating group jams and impromptu musical sessions.
♪ Tranquil Setting: Enjoy the native bushland environ - build mind, body and spirit whilst enhancing our weekend of music and togetherness.
♪ Catering – Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included on Saturday and Sunday, as well as breakfast Monday. Please bring a shared (pre-prepared) plate for Friday evening kai.

Featured Instructors:

Epizo Bangoura: A master of the djembe and traditional dance, Epizo brings profound knowledge and vibrant energy, embodying the essence of West African music and dance.

Yaw Asumadu: A Master Drummer from Ghana, Yaw has performed globally and taught African drumming for 25 years, collaborating with legendary artists.

Jimi Dale: A pioneer of African music in NZ, Jimi has been teaching African Drum and Dance classes since 1995 and formed the world music and dance group, Tamani. We are excited to have Jimi back again teaching us a dun dance piece.

Pricing Details:
♪ Early Bird: $450 (Reserve by Sunday 31st August 2025)
♪ Adult rate: $495
♪ Kids 9 – 14 years old: $250
♪ Kids 8 and under: $175
♪ Family Packages available on request
♪ Single Day & night $220 (includes 3 meals and full day tuition)
♪ Drum Hire: $15

Event Schedule Snapshot:
♪ Friday, 24th October: Arrive from 4pm - A warm welcome sets the stage for a weekend filled with rhythm and learning.
Bring a share plate for dinner.
♪ Saturday, 25th October: Engage in enriching drum and dance workshops. Participants will be grouped into their appropriate levels.
♪ Sunday, 26th October: Continue your musical journey with drum and dance sessions, leading to a group performance that encapsulates the weekend’s shared experiences.
♪ Monday, 27th October: Morning All in Drum & Dance ceremony, then it's time to hit the road.

FAQs
♪ Getting Ready: Bring your drum (if available), snacks for the weekend, dance-appropriate shoes, sleeping gear (pillowcase & sheet, sleeping bag/ doona), warm clothes, and an eager spirit.
♪ Beginners are warmly welcomed – our camp is a nurturing space for newcomers to discover the joy of African drumming and dance, bolstered by a supportive community.

For more information and tickets -
https://africandrumming.co.nz/tours-and-retreats/nz-drum-dance-camp/

More questions?
Contact - Tulletha at or call: 028 474 1123

description:
POP Go the Festival Singers: Island Bay Presbyterian Church, The Festival Singers invite you to a enjoy unforgettable music in POP go the Festival Singers – a dazzling celebration of popular songs from the 1920s right through to today. Expect energy, variety, and entertainment as we journey through swing, rock ’n’ roll, Motown, disco, soft rock, and contemporary pop.
The programme sparkles with classics and favourites: a Beach Boys Medley full of surfside sunshine, Ruru Karaitiana’s iconic Blue Smoke, Elvis Presley’s Hound Dog, and Bobby Darin’s Beyond the Sea. We’ll groove with Pharrell Williams’ Happy, cheer to Survivor’s Eye of the Tiger, and celebrate Kiwi pride in Crowded House’s Weather with You. Heartfelt beauty shines through Simon and Garfunkel’s Bridge Over Troubled Water and Billy Joel’s And So It Goes, while fun abounds with The Lion Sleeps Tonight and Gershwin’s sultry Summertime.
Swing makes its mark with Glenn Miller’s Chattanooga Choo Choo and In the Mood, while a rousing Queen Medley and an exuberant ABBA Medley bring the concert to a thrilling close. Along the way, enjoy contemporary sparkle with Dua Lipa’s Levitating and the timeless artistry of these unforgettable hits.
With the incomparable Jonathan Berkahn at the piano, every piece shines with character and style. This concert promises nostalgia, joy, and toe-tapping fun – a true trip down memory lane with something for everyone.
Join us and be part of a celebration of music that entertains, connects, and uplifts.

Celebrate: 7 - 13 September 2025

The 2025 theme for Papua New Guinea Pidgin Language Week is 'Lukautim, strongim na kirapim tokples na pasin blo tubuna - Preserve, revitalise and promote our language and culture'.

You are invited to join the formal flag raising ceremony, at the Performing Arts Centre inside Pātaka Art + Museum.

There will be morning tea and refreshments following the ceremony.

description:
Men's Circle: Authentic Relating, Men's Circle: Authentic Relating
A safe, supportive space for men to connect, share openly, and build authentic community through honest conversation and mutual respect

About this Event

Men’s Circle: Authentic Relating
A supportive space for men to come together, connect, and explore life’s challenges in community. This circle welcomes men at all stages — whether you’re navigating change, looking for connection, or simply want a place to be heard.
Engage in open, honest conversations and experience the kind of connection that’s rare but meaningful. There’s no expectation to speak — your presence alone is valued. The circle follows a respectful, non-judgmental format, prioritizing safety, confidentiality, and authenticity.
Optional Plant-Based Dinner
After the circle, stay for a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert ($15). Sharing a meal is a simple way to extend the sense of community and connection. This gathering is offered on a non-profit basis.





Join us after this free event for an optional plant-based dinner and dessert for only $15 (or $5 for students).





Meet Andre and Sri Jiva, your hosts
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. Over the years, Andre has come to value the power of sitting in circle—of men coming together in honesty, vulnerability, and presence to witness and support one another. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.
Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.





Agenda


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:15 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 06:15 PM - 07:15 PM
Men's Circle: Authentic Relating
Host: Andre

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:15 PM
Optional Plant-based dinner and dessert!

description:
Rathkeale Christmas Fete 2025, Welcome to the Rathkeale Christmas Fête 2025! Walk through the gates of Rathkeale College on 1st November and be welcomed by a diverse range of colourful stalls, the aroma of freshy cooked food and plenty of festive inspiration.

Now in its 22nd year, the Christmas Fête has become a must-do event on the Wairarapa spring calendar. Stallholders travel from around the North Island to sell their wares and offer Christmas shoppers loads of inspiration. From festive decorations, clothing, arts and crafts, to flowers, toys and plants – there is something for everyone.

Gourmet food is always a highlight at the Fête - think freshly made gourmet burgers, lamb & mint sausages, wraps, curry, salads, and the ever-popular berries & ice-cream - there is always a huge variety of flavours to tempt the taste buds. Devonshire Teas and home baking served in the Rathkeale Homestead rose garden is a time-honoured tradition while refreshing cold drinks can be sipped on as visitors listen to live music performed by students at various times throughout the day. The popular Christmas cake stall features again this year - but visitors are encouraged to get in early as the cakes often sell out by midday.

The beauty of this Fête is that it’s a day out for the whole family. In addition to the 120 plus stalls, there is plenty to entertain the children including facepainting and magic shows throughout the day.

Visitors can also explore the beautiful, expansive grounds of Rathkeale College including the school gardens designed by Alfred Buxton, the Greek Amphitheatre and the 3km eco-trail which weaves through large stands of native trees, including ancient kahikatea.

Eftpos is available, but we strongly recommend that visitors bring cash.

Koha/gold coin entry.
Rathkeale College is a five-minute drive north of Masterton in the Wairarapa.

description:
Rathkeale College Christmas Fête 2025, Rathkeale College Christmas Fête 2025
Welcome to the Rathkeale Christmas Fête 2025!
Now in its 22nd year, the Fête offers shoppers loads of inspiration. Stallholders will be selling festive decorations, clothing, arts and crafts, as well as flowers, toys and plants – there is something for everyone.
Gourmet food is also a highlight – with freshly made gourmet burgers, lamb & mint sausages, wraps, curry, salads, and the ever-popular berries and icecream available for purchase. Devonshire Tea served in the Rathkeale Homestead rose garden is a time-honoured tradition while refreshing cold drinks can be sipped on as visitors listen to live music performed by students at various times throughout the day. The popular home baking stall features again this year, and visitors are encouraged to get in early as the Christmas cakes, in particular, often sell out by midday.
The beauty of this Fête is it is a day out for the whole family. In addition to the 120 plus indoor and outdoor stalls, there is plenty to entertain the children with face painting and three magic shows during the day to round out the fun.
Visitors can meander around the beautiful campus and enjoy the unique surroundings including the school gardens designed by Alfred Buxton, the Greek Amphitheatre and the 3km eco-trail which weaves through large stands of native trees, including ancient kahikatea.
The Christmas Fête is the school’s biggest fundraiser of the year and comes about thanks to an amazing collaboration between the Friends of Rathkeale College, staff and students.

description:
Enjoy Singing? Open Night with Hutt City Chorale, Join us for a fun night of choral singing. Come along to our open night at St Marks Church, 58 Woburn Road, Lower Hutt. You will be very welcome to join us in our warm ups and singing.

We’ll provide you with music for the evening. Meet our fun and creative Music Director Jonathan Berkahn and talented pianist Phillip O’Malley plus our friendly choir, for an enjoyable evening of singing.

We start the evening with our vocal warm ups at 7.15pm, sing beautiful music together, stop for a delicious supper half way through, then continue singing until 9.15pm. If you would like to return, you can join us for up to four free visits. After that time, you can decide whether you would like to join Hutt City Chorale as a member.

We welcome new members and invite you to join us in 2025. Contact Prue, our chairperson, with any questions huttcitychorale@gmail.com or visit www.facebook.com/HuttCityChorale. We look forward to seeing you there and singing together. Join us for an enjoyable evening.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Resonant Rave, ✨ A Night for the High Vibe Dancers ✨
Love the energy of a club night — the music, the lights, the freedom — but not the hangover?
Craving that connected dance floor feeling… completely sober?
Welcome to our Resonant Rave — where we get high on music, movement, and community. 🪩💫
No booze required — just pure vibes, connection, and the freedom to be fully you.
Whether you’re sober, sober-curious, or simply want to experience dance in a new, elevated way — this night is for you.
Come dance. Come connect. Come as you are.
Expect bass-laden melodic grooves, warm smiles, and the kind of connection that happens when everyone’s really there.
Move sober. Dance deeper.
Let the resonance move through you.
🎧 With special guest DJ:
SORCHALULA
Mysterious, mercurial and multi-faceted. SorchaLula has as many shades to her music as she does to her personality. A dynamic producer/DJ, she flows from slinky sensuality, to fierce filth, to the uncompromising underground. Every set features her original tracks, many melting with honeyed vocals by singer Samuel (Cecilia’s Crop). In tune with what the body needs, she entwines beauty with bravery, sinuous melodies with hefty bass, lush peaks with decadent darkness.
She has played many top festivals around Aotearoa: Northern Bass, Shipwrecked Festival, Twisted Frequency, Aum Festival NYE, CubaDupa, Taniwha’s Den and more. She is highly rated by some of the biggest names in the scene for her taste, depth, and intuitive understanding of dancefloors. As founder of The Sensonauts she created events exploring the senses, music, dance, and music education with a focus on inclusivity.
Link to music
https://soundcloud.com/sorchalula
🪩
🎧 As well as:
KIMBA JADE
Kimba Jade has been lighting up dancefloors for over 20 years with her signature blend of deep, funky, and globally inspired grooves. A master of musical journeying, Kimba weaves bass-driven beats with tribal, melodic, and soulful sounds that move both body and spirit.
With a deep passion for Ecstatic Dance and the power of music to connect and uplift, Kimba brings that same vibrant, heart-opening energy into clubs and bars. Her favourite styles to play are Tech House infused with Indie Dance and Techno, blending rhythms with emotive melodies to create a sound that’s both driving and deeply immersive.
After years of spinning in Sydney and Auckland’s underground scene — from conscious dance floors to late-night sessions — Kimba is now based in Wellington, bringing her signature fusion of rhythm, soul, and bass to local venues. Whether behind the decks at a festival, Ecstatic Dance, or a packed club night, Kimba’s passion is the same: to create an unforgettable atmosphere where freedom, rhythm, and connection collide.
Link to music
https://soundcloud.com/kimba
@djkimbajade
🪩
label: Festivals

description:
Tartan Up The Green, Tartan Up The Green
Gather up the clan and join us here at Brewtown Upper Hutt – Tartan Up The Green is back for 2025!

Are you ready to be blown away by the power of the Pipes and Drums as Tartan Up The Green returns this October 4th for another rousing rendition of Bagpiping, Highland Drumming and Dancing!

Our mates from RNZPBA Wellington Hawkes Bay are back to curate their all-new take on traditional pipe and drum comps with some of the finest musicians in the country.

Join us on The Greenspace for our very own family friendly, FREE to attend salute to those earth-shaking instruments of war (literally) and all things Highlands and Islands!

It won’t just be Pipers and Drummers competing for glory. Brewtown is delighted to welcome some bonnie boogying in the form of Scottish Highland Dancing, as dancers from up and down the country wow the crowd with traditional dance.

A true showcase of strength and stamina, Highland Dancing is highly technical and recognised as a sport by the Sport Council of Scotland…waltzing this aint!

So, get behind these incredible young athletes and show your support at this years Tartan Up The Green!

Get ready for a night full of Bollywood glamour, music, and dance at THE GRAND BOLLYWOOD NIGHT - it's going to be epic!

About this Event

Welcome to THE GRAND BOLLYWOOD NIGHT!

Come join us at Martini on Jackson Bar & Restaurant for a night filled with Bollywood music, dancing, and fun! Get ready to groove to the beats of your favorite Bollywood hits and enjoy delicious drinks and food in a vibrant atmosphere.

Whether you're a seasoned Bollywood enthusiast or just looking for a lively night out, this event is perfect for everyone. So grab your friends, put on your dancing shoes, and get ready to experience a night of Bollywood magic!

description:
THREE JOYFUL HOUSES - AOTEAROA FESTIVAL OF ARCHITECTURE - SUNDAY 28TH SEPTEMBER, THREE JOYFUL HOUSES by IAN ATHFIELD
SUNDAY 28TH SEPTEMBER @ FUTUNA CHAPEL - KARORI
Three joyful houses, three families and three client stories about the commissioning, designing, building and living in homes designed by Ian Athfield.
SPENCER and DIANE LOGAN
1974 - 1978
WINDY POINT – EASTBOURNE
Photographer unknown
Spencer Logan and his wife Diane will talk about the commissioning of their first new home, its design, construction, the cleaning of thousands of bricks, and living in this unique collection of a pair of recycled brick towers with timber clad ‘saddlebags’. 
ROSS, CUSHLA and TESS JAMIESON
1974 - 1978
MAHINA BAY
Ross and Cushla have lived in their home on the Eastern hills above Mahina Bay for 48 years. They will, along with their youngest daughter, recount their experiences of working with Ian Athfield in the commissioning of the design of their home, the construction process and then living in this hillside hugging collection of building, and how this home may have influenced their living and the raising of a family of four children.
JONATHAN CUSTANCE   - THE CUSTANCE HOUSE 1981 – 1982
HAVELOCK NORTH
“The Custance House replaced an early modern home that burnt to the ground in 1981 leaving only the swimming pool unscathed.  Ray and Ann Custance, who were friends of the Athfields, sought a bold replacement.  With their son, industrial and interior designer Jonathan Custance, they prepared a four page brief for a new building….. “
Text taken from Athfield Architects by Julia Gatley 2012 AUP.
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work.
The Futuna Trust is a charitable organisation and all funds raised from the Futuna Lecture Series go towards the ongoing care, maintenance and operation of Futuna Chapel and also to support various initiatives undertaken by the Trust. 
BOOKINGS ARE ESSENTIAL TO ATTEND THIS EVENT
There will be 15 Design CPD points available for NZ registered architects attending the event. Please include your NZRAB registration number when registering for Architect tickets

description:
Spring Candle Making or Wreath Making Workshop, Come and join us for a creative, relaxing and social candle making or wreath making workshop.
We provide all the equipment and materials in a two-hour workshop.

At each candle making workshop, participants will make a medium sized candle (a choice of new or vintage containers) and two tea light candles. During wreath making workshops, participants will make either a dried or fresh floral wreath.

Light refreshments are provided.

description:
Te Papa Foundation Gala, Te Papa Foundation Gala
Wellington’s premier fundraising event, the Te Papa Foundation Gala brings together Aotearoa New Zealand’s leading supporters of arts and culture for one spectacular night in the museum.

🖼️ Enjoy handcrafted cocktails, discover new favourites in the Toi Art galleries, savour an exquisite three-course dinner paired with premium local wines, bid in our live charity auction, and then dance to live performances from acclaimed local musicians.

👋🏼Thanks to Webb’s, the Gala features a special live auction of once-in-a-lifetime experiences, including Sake & sushi with Dick Frizzell, a stunning carving by Tim Steel (Ngāi Tahu), and luxury escapes.

🎟️Tickets cost $3,000 for a table of ten, or $300 per person.

🌱All proceeds from the Gala supports Te Papa’s work across art, culture, history, science, and nature, ensuring that our much-loved national museum continues to thrive for generations to come.

💸Can’t make it? Our digital auction will be hosted by Webb’s from 28 August until 10 September. More information at tepapa.nz/gala.

description:
Taste Kāpiti, Taste Kāpiti
Celebrate your year with Taste!
A boutique beverage mini fest created to celebrate the unique flavours and producers of Aotearoa’s regions.

With successful events in Whanganui, Kāpiti, and now Tauranga, each Taste Festival is thoughtfully curated to bring together local producers, food trucks and live music in a beautiful outdoor setting.
Founded and run by event professionals with a passion for local culture and connection, Taste K`apiti is a high-quality food and drink experience in a vibrant and relaxed setting that doubles as a perfect end-of-year celebration for friends & families, teams & businesses.
Want to elevate your Taste experience? Check out our VIP/Corporate tickets/tables.
Includes:
A festive lunch, two signature cocktails, and access to our exclusive VIP area – complete with premium seating, shade, and great vibes.
Join us on the beautiful waterfront to eat well, drink local, and celebrate the best of the season!

description:
Capital Gymnastics - Preschool Gymnastics (casual session), Capital Gymnastics - Preschool Gymnastics (casual session)
Is your little one full of energy and always on the move? Our Casual Preschool Gymnastics Classes are the perfect way to let them explore, play, and develop movement skills in a fun, unstructured environment.

Every Monday & Tuesday
9:30 AM – 10:15 AM
$10 per session
Capital Gymnastics

This is a casual, unstructured class – ideal for preschoolers of all ages. No bookings required! Just drop in and enjoy a relaxed session where kids can roll, climb, bounce, and build coordination, balance, and spatial awareness.

Our qualified coaches provide a safe and friendly space for your child to move freely and have fun.

No need to book – just come along!

description:
Havelock Mussel & Seafood Festival 2026, Havelock Mussel & Seafood Festival 2026
Marking its 22nd year, the Havelock Mussel & Seafood Festival has been an integral part of Marlborough's vibrant summers and is back Saturday the 14th of March!

Indulge in the freshest catches straight from the ocean and savour the mouthwatering flavours of Marlborough's finest seafood delicacies.

Experience live music from kiwi legends & local artists, cooking demonstrations from local experts and Celebrity Chef, fascinating industry displays, and a Kids Zone to keep the little ones entertained. And, of course, be part of our Guinness World record attempt for mussel opening!

For our out-of-town festival-goers, worry not! We have arranged convenient transport options as ticket add-ons, ensuring a safe journey to and from the event.

More than just a festival, we are a community-minded, not-for-profit event with a mission to celebrate and support the local seafood industry.

By joining us, you contribute to a cause that gives back to the heart of the local community.

Let's celebrate the bounty of the ocean together!

Tickets Live 1st November - www.havelockmusselfestival.co.nz

Poverty in Aotearoa New Zealand - A discussion of two new BWB Texts: Pakukore and Hardship and Hope
Speakers include Rebecca Macfie, Tracey McIntosh, Brigitte Bönisch-Brednich and Caroline Mareko
Thursday 11 September

Rutherford House
33 Bunny Street
Wellington
Doors open from 5.30pm, event starts 6pm
Nau mai, haere mai. Public event, no RVSP needed.
Contact info@bwb.co.nz for more information.
Rebecca Macfie is appearing in other centres, see: www.bwb.co.nz/events
This event is supported by the Stout Research Centre for New Zealand Studies. Unity Books will be selling the texts on the night.

description:
DILLI-24, A North Indian feast crafted by long-time Loretta head chef Chandrika Khullar.
Named after her hometown of Delhi and her home postcode, this special menu is a deeply personal tribute to her upbringing and a childhood immersed in the rich culinary traditions of North India. Chandrika brings the heart and soul of Delhi to Wellington with a generous, share-style multi-course menu featuring bountiful vegetarian plates and an exceptional lamb raan.

Expect an explosion of flavour, with exotic spice blends, saffron, citrus and native berries woven into every dish. In North India, condiment is king, and this feast will be served with a vibrant array of chutneys, pickles and relishes. To complete the experience, Chandrika has also designed a beautifully curated drinks menu to complement the bold and fragrant dishes.
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026, The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026
Details to follow closer to time, but already got a few new ideas for the 2026 edition.

***

Description from Inaugural 2025 Edition FYI:

I would like to acknowledge the support of The Island Bay Festival, which will be celebrating its 40th year of bringing the community together this year, and thank them for giving me a space in The Park this Sunday at The Day in The Bay to showcase and celebrate The Italians of Island Bay, their history and their contributiion to the community, business and culture.

#supportlocal
#celebratelocal
#celebratecommunity
#islandbayfestival

The majority of Island Bay Italians are Neapolitan from the hill top town of Massa Lubrense and surrounds on the Sorrentine Peninsula, followed by Sicilians from the small volcanic island of Stromboli in the Aeolean sea.

When you think of The Italians of Island Bay you might think of their involvement and contribution to the Fishing and Food (and related) Industries, but it goes much wider than that..

In alphabetic order as to not to offend. NB: list a work in progress.

- academics
- accountants
- artists
- authors
- builders
- cinema
- electricians
- exporters
- film makers
- financial advisors
- fishermen
- footballers
- hairdressers
- hoteliers
- importers
- journalists
- lawyers
- lecturers
- lawn bowlers
- management consultants
- martial arts instructors
- mozzarella makers
- musicians
- olympic medalist
- opera singers
- photographers
- plumbers
- poets
- property developers
- public servants
- publishers
- quantity surveyors
- realaters
- restauranteurs
- scholars
- seamstresses
- secretaries
- retailers
- tailors
- teachers
- tomatoe growers
- volunteers
- wine makers
- wholesalers

Books that will on display:

- Alle Fine del Mondo by Paul Elenio
- Le Famiglie Strombolani by
- Food & Family by
- Family Business by Vincent Moleta
- Angelina by Gerard Hindmarsh
- Unsheltered by Clare Moleta
- Umberto Saba : poetry & prose selected & translated, with notes by Vincent Moleta

Just a few days to go till the big Day in the Bay on Sunday. I'm unexpectedly in Perth for family reasons, so have had to piece this together organically long distance, with the help and contribution of my mum's childhood girlfriends from The Bay, for which I'm extremely greatfull.

My Back-Story:

On my mother's side I'm double 4th generation Strombolana-Kiwi and 2nd generation Dutch-Kiwi on my father's side (RIP).. thus my long and unusual name..

Rosina Maria Giuseppina van der Aa.

All 4 of my biz-nonni (great grandparents) bravely sailed to the ends of the earth (alle fine del mondo) in search of a better future.

My maternal great grandfather (Bartolo Barnao) and his elder brother(Giuseppe) initially fished and slept under their fishing boat in Makara, before returning with their Strombolane wives who were also siblings (Giuseppina and Maria Concetta Pirera) to set up shop literally (a fish shop) in Palmerston North before then moving to No 64 The Parade Island Bay when my Nonna Rosina was 17 circa 1934.

My paternal great grandparents (Angelina Criscillo and Vincenzo Moleta) along with Vincenzo's brother (Antonino) and Angelina's cousin (Rosa) settled and tamed D'urville. My Nonno (Leslie George Moleta) spotted my Nonna (Rosina Elvira Barnao) at the Zino-Toscano wedding where she was a bridesmaid. They had two children, both named after their grandparents as was the tradition. My uncle Vincent Bartolo and my mother Maria Josephine The rest as they say is Family Business..

description:
Titahi Bay Surf Hui, Titahi Bay Surf Hui – About the Day
The Titahi Bay Surf Hui is a celebration of surf and community at the Bay. From beginners catching their first waves to advanced surfers pushing limits, everyone’s welcome. Surf heats will run all day with trophies, prizes, and spot prizes up for grabs.
On land, the iconic boatsheds and Mana Island backdrop set the vibe with music, food, and good times. The Hui is about more than just competition — it’s about celebrating the Bay and bringing whānau and friends together.
Save the date – Saturday 11th October 2025.
Registration will be available soon via LiveHeats.
Follow, like, and share our Facebook page to stay up to date with comp news, registration, and event updates.
Keen to support? We’re welcoming local sponsors — reach out if you’d like to get involved.
label: Festivals

description:
Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show, Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show
Featuring Tributes to: Pantera, Ozzy Osbourne, Megadeth, Faith No More and more bands TBA.

About this Event



Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: A Memorial for Metal Legends

Rail Records, Wildkiwi Distillery, Women's Refuge, and Riockstock present a monumental night of heavy metal in honor of two of the genre's most important and beloved figures: the legendary guitarist "Dimebag" Darrell Abbott of Pantera, and the recently departed Godfather of Metal, Ozzy Osbourne.
Join us on Saturday, December 6th, 2025, at Wildkiwi in Upper Hutt for a memorial show that will shake the foundations. This date holds a special importance to us metal heads, falling just three days after what would have been Ozzy's 77th birthday (December 3rd) and just two days before the anniversary of Dimebag's tragic passing (December 8th, 2004), giving us all a chance to raise a glass and celebrate both legends in the loudest way possible.
This is a night to pay tribute to the artists who defined a generation of heavy music. From Dimebag's revolutionary groove and unmistakable harmonic squeals to Ozzy's haunting vocals and iconic stage presence, their impact is eternal. We invite the metal community to come together for an unforgettable evening of remembrance, unity, and blistering riffs.


The Lineup
Prepare for a full-throttle sonic assault from four of New Zealand's premier tribute acts, performing the anthems that have become the soundtrack to our lives:
•Hell's Wrath delivering the ferocious power of Pantera
•Zombie Stomp (ft. Danny Rascal) channeling the madness of Ozzy Osbourne
•Angel Dust performing the eclectic genius of Faith No More
•Demon Foetal Harvest unleashing the thrash mastery of Megadeth
(More acts to be announced!)


Event Details
•Date: Saturday, December 6, 2025
•Venue: Wildkiwi, Unit 13/27 Blenheim Street, Maidstone, Upper Hutt
•Time: Doors open at 6:00 PM
•Age Restriction: This is a strictly R18 event. ID will be required.
•Charity: We will be accepting donations at the event and at point of sale on behalf of Women's Refuge. Your support is greatly appreciated.


Ticket Information
Secure your spot to witness this massive tribute event. Tickets are on sale now!
•$20 Early Bird (+GST/BF) - Limited quantity available! Grab them before they're gone.
•$30 General Admission (+GST/BF)
•$40 Door Sales/Lates (If not sold out prior)


VIP Table Experience - Only 6 Available!
For the ultimate night out, gather your crew and secure a VIP table.
Price: $240 per table (includes 6 tickets - works out to $40 per person)
Perks:
•Guaranteed reserved seating for your group of 6.
•Early venue access from 4:00 PM to settle in and have a meal.
•10% discount on delicious bar food from the Wildkiwi kitchen.
•First dibs on the merch table.
•Check out soundcheck and meet the bands (where possible).


Limited Edition Merchandise
•Exclusive Event T-Shirt: $30
•Commemorate this special night with a limited edition T-shirt. There are only 20 of these shirts being made, so this is a true collector's item. Available as a ticket add-on. Don't miss out!
This show is a tribute, a memorial, and a celebration. Get your tickets now and be part of a historic night for New Zealand's metal scene.
Full ticketing TnCs: https://www.railrecords.net/ticketing-tncs

description:
The Runholder Presents A Boutique Festival of Wine, Gin, Food & Music, The Runholder Presents A Boutique Festival of Wine, Gin, Food & Music
Join us under a canopy of trees for an unforgettable afternoon that blends flavour, sound & celebration. Set against the stunning backdrop of Martinborough’s rolling hills and vines, this curated gathering brings together our favourite makers, movers, and shakers - ready to pour, plate, and play their hearts out.

Sip iconic artisan wines, swirl small-batch gin and savour signature gourmet bites by culinary legends.

On stage we welcome the soulful stylings and powerhouse vocals of Hollie Smith, the retro glam and infectious energy of The Beat Girls, and the genre-spinning magic of Sweet Mix Kids, interspersed with sets from DJ Takas. The only thing smoother than the wine is the soundtrack.

Our Saturday session promises an elevated, intimate atmosphere - where the wine flows, the beats drop, and the good vibes carry you through an afternoon of dancing, right into sunset.

With invited friends: Martinborough Vineyard, Te Kairanga, Escarpment, Ata Rangi, Schubert, Palliser Estate, Halite Wines, Lighthouse Gin, Mt Difficulty, Vavasour, Martinborough Brewery, Antipodes Water, The Crab Shack, Wharekauhau Estate, Shed 5, SOUL Bar & Bistro and Martin Bosley's Oyster Saloon.

Elevate your festival experience with VIP hosting at The Runholder Cottage. Indulge in premium and library wines poured by the winemakers themselves, impeccably paired with gourmet food offerings from Auckland Viaduct’s iconic SOUL Bar & Bistro. As a VIP guest, you’ll enjoy all-inclusive food and beverage with menu service for any onsite vendor, exclusive access to the dedicated VIP area with priority stage sightlines and premium hosting amenities for your comfort and convenience.

Take advantage of easy transportation options with return bus add-ons from Wellington, Masterton, Carterton, Greytown & Featherston ($30-$60), and free shuttles to and from Martinborough Square, so you can sip responsibly.

label: Festivals

description:
FRUIT LOOP FESTIVAL, Fruit Loop Festival
Marlborough’s freshest music festival!
About the Festival
Fruit Loop Festival is Marlborough’s juiciest new summer gig! A full-blown celebration of music and dance, kicking off under the sun and well into the night. Think open-air energy - blending Marlborough's summer magic with a full-scale music festival. An insane line-up of DJs and live performers with production to match! From the first drop to the final track, it's where the beat hits harder and the drinks taste sweeter.
Fresh, wild, fierce - Fruit Loop is the party Marlborough has been waiting for.
The Line-Up
DICK JOHNSON: The heart of NZ’s electronic scene, Dick Johnson is a true house music heavyweight. With remixes for global icons like Fatboy Slim and Claude VonStroke, plus Kiwi favourites L.A.B and Tiki Taane, he’s spent over two decades electrifying dancefloors worldwide. A relentless force behind the decks - and music director for Synthony - Dick brings the fire every time.
SIN: Co-host of George FM Drive, Sin is plugged into the pulse of the dance scene and has quickly become a revered authority on all things electronica. She’s torn up stages at Rhythm & Vines, Homegrown, Hidden Valley, and international festivals from Fiji to the UK. With supports for legends like Fatboy Slim, Groove Armada, and Netsky, Sin brings high-energy house, techno, and ravey curveballs to every set.
KITA MEAN: Kita Mean is New Zealand’s award-winning drag superstar, known for her infectious charm, razor-sharp wit, and high-camp aesthetic. With a career spanning 15+ years across stages and screens worldwide, she’s wowed audiences from Aotearoa and Australia to London, Canada, the USA, and beyond. Winner of the very first RuPaul’s Drag Race Down Under and co-owner of the iconic Caluzzi Cabaret, Kita continues to dazzle with colourful looks, flawless mug, and hilarious timing. Quirky, kooky, kitsch, and quick - Kita Mean isn’t just a queen, she’s an experience.
PETE GREEN: Originally from the UK, Pete is part of the vinyl-digging collective Rare Specimens. His love for deep, worldly electronic sounds brings low-end warmth and an infectious energy to the dancefloor. Along the way, he’s supported artists such as Crazy P, Psychemagik, Audio Jack, and Christopher Tubbs, playing festivals and parties from Creamfields and Rhythm & Alps to Tempo Schmempo. Expect a set seasoned with Italo, ambient, and deep house flavours, dusted with disco, and finished with a splash of techno.
Event Details
Date: Saturday 28 March 2026
Time: 2pm - 10pm
Location: The Fancy Cow, Marlborough
R18 event - Photo identification will be required.
Return Bus Service:
Getting to and from the festival is easy with our return bus service. Pick-up points will include Redwoodtown Woolworths, Seymour Square, and Countdown Springlands. Purchase a return bus ticket when you nab your ticket.
A full timetable and bus information will be announced closer to the event.
Parking is strictly limited at the festival. Drop off recommended.
Tickets
Tickets are limited — don’t wait. Secure yours now!
Door sales may be available.
Have your ticket open and ready to be scanned at the gate.
Kaupapa
Fruit Loop is a safe, inclusive space where everyone belongs. If you can’t celebrate diversity, respect others, and bring good vibes, this festival isn’t for you.
Harassment or discrimination of any kind will not be tolerated. Anyone behaving this way will be removed.
Refunds and Cancellations
Fruit Loop Festival is a rain or shine event. The festival will proceed regardless of weather conditions, except in circumstances where safety is compromised or conditions make it impossible for the event to continue.
No refunds will be given for changes to the programme, line-up, or advertised performers.
Stay Connected
Follow us for line-up drops, updates and key event information: @fruitloopfestival on Instagram
