description:
Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show, Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show
Featuring Tributes to: Pantera, Ozzy Osbourne, Megadeth, Faith No More and more bands TBA.

About this Event



Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: A Memorial for Metal Legends

Rail Records, Wildkiwi Distillery, Women's Refuge, and Riockstock present a monumental night of heavy metal in honor of two of the genre's most important and beloved figures: the legendary guitarist "Dimebag" Darrell Abbott of Pantera, and the recently departed Godfather of Metal, Ozzy Osbourne.
Join us on Saturday, December 6th, 2025, at Wildkiwi in Upper Hutt for a memorial show that will shake the foundations. This date holds a special importance to us metal heads, falling just three days after what would have been Ozzy's 77th birthday (December 3rd) and just two days before the anniversary of Dimebag's tragic passing (December 8th, 2004), giving us all a chance to raise a glass and celebrate both legends in the loudest way possible.
This is a night to pay tribute to the artists who defined a generation of heavy music. From Dimebag's revolutionary groove and unmistakable harmonic squeals to Ozzy's haunting vocals and iconic stage presence, their impact is eternal. We invite the metal community to come together for an unforgettable evening of remembrance, unity, and blistering riffs.


The Lineup
Prepare for a full-throttle sonic assault from four of New Zealand's premier tribute acts, performing the anthems that have become the soundtrack to our lives:
•Hell's Wrath delivering the ferocious power of Pantera
•Zombie Stomp (ft. Danny Rascal) channeling the madness of Ozzy Osbourne
•Angel Dust performing the eclectic genius of Faith No More
•Demon Foetal Harvest unleashing the thrash mastery of Megadeth
(More acts to be announced!)


Event Details
•Date: Saturday, December 6, 2025
•Venue: Wildkiwi, Unit 13/27 Blenheim Street, Maidstone, Upper Hutt
•Time: Doors open at 6:00 PM
•Age Restriction: This is a strictly R18 event. ID will be required.
•Charity: We will be accepting donations at the event and at point of sale on behalf of Women's Refuge. Your support is greatly appreciated.


Ticket Information
Secure your spot to witness this massive tribute event. Tickets are on sale now!
•$20 Early Bird (+GST/BF) - Limited quantity available! Grab them before they're gone.
•$30 General Admission (+GST/BF)
•$40 Door Sales/Lates (If not sold out prior)


VIP Table Experience - Only 6 Available!
For the ultimate night out, gather your crew and secure a VIP table.
Price: $240 per table (includes 6 tickets - works out to $40 per person)
Perks:
•Guaranteed reserved seating for your group of 6.
•Early venue access from 4:00 PM to settle in and have a meal.
•10% discount on delicious bar food from the Wildkiwi kitchen.
•First dibs on the merch table.
•Check out soundcheck and meet the bands (where possible).


Limited Edition Merchandise
•Exclusive Event T-Shirt: $30
•Commemorate this special night with a limited edition T-shirt. There are only 20 of these shirts being made, so this is a true collector's item. Available as a ticket add-on. Don't miss out!
This show is a tribute, a memorial, and a celebration. Get your tickets now and be part of a historic night for New Zealand's metal scene.
Full ticketing TnCs: https://www.railrecords.net/ticketing-tncs

description:
Wellington Folk Festival - 60th Anniversary Edition, Enjoy a holiday weekend of music, dance, craft and folky fun at the beautiful Brooklields Outdoor Education Centre in Moore’s valley, Waimuiomata.

The site opens at noon on Friday and the action runs until late late late on Sunday evening. There will be:
Concerts by our headline guests on the Main stage;
Artist workshops,
Ceili and dance sessions,
Craft stalls on the Village Green, and
A youth programme; plus
opportunities to participate in open mics, invitation concerts, jams, sing arounds and the Festival Choir.

Our headline guest performers will be:
We Mavericks
Adam and Marika
Fiona Ross
Klezmer Rebs
Rhys Crimmin
Two if by Sea
The Trenwiths
For information about them see - https://wellingtonfolkfestival.org.nz/2025-festival-guests/

You can go “full immersion” by camping or sharing a bunkhouse for the whole weekend or treat it as a day or evening (or both) family outing. There is no charge for children under the age of 13 (but they must be accompanied by a responsible adult). The full range of ticket options and prices is available at https://events.humanitix.com/wellington-folk-festival-2025-our-60th?

description:
⚡BowieTown Featherston - enter the Bowie Universe, ⚡BowieTown Featherston - enter the Bowie Universe
☆ BOWIETOWN FEATHERSTON ☆
⚡Enter the Bowie universe!⚡

This September, Featherston transforms into BowieTown for the very first time – a full weekend celebrating the music, artistry, and magic of David Bowie. Expect live music, dance, creativity, food, and plenty of ways to let your inner Ziggy shine.

📅 Friday 26 – Sunday 28 September 2025
Featherston, Wairarapa


📍 Here’s what’s happening across the weekend 📍

⭐ Bowie-oke
Last Post Restaurant & Bar (Featherston RSA) 🎤 Friday 26 Sept, 7.30 pm ‘til late
Bowie karaoke to kick things off!
Event link https://www.facebook.com/share/1TdhZKFpvH/


⭐ Bowie Cocktails & Desserts
Brac & Bow 🍸🍰 Friday 26 – Sunday 28 Sept
Sweet and stylish, Bowie-style.


⭐ Featherston Library Display
30 Books Recommended by Bowie 📚 Friday 26 & Saturday 27 Sept.
Discover what the Thin White Duke read.


⭐ Bowie Collage Pop-Up Craft (Family Fun)
Featherston Library 🎨 Saturday 27 Sept, 10 – 11 am.
Kids (and big kids) welcome.


⭐ Bowie Barkers Dog Party
Dorset Square 🐾 Saturday 27 Sept, 11 am.
Walk & Bark + bring/swap/donate/buy dog gear. Hosted by Madame Mutts.


⭐ Bowie Art Bash + Portrait Exhibition
ANZAC Hal l🎨 Saturday 27 Sept 1 – 3 pm
Life drawing with Bowie models (bring your own gear), $10 cash entry. Plus a Bowie Portrait Exhibition with works for sale (free entry).


⭐ Bowie Pizzas
The Last Post Restaurant & Bar (Featherston RSA) 🍕 Saturday 27 Sept from 5 pm
Thin-crust Ziggy-style deliciousness!


⭐ BOWIE BLASTOFF CONCERT + AFTERPARTY
ANZAC Hall 🚀 Saturday 27 Sept 7 pm
Entry $20 (cash only, door sales)
*️⃣ Live performances from Mad Honey, The Davids, Taza Manaza, Tangle Dance Community, Justine Rose Kingdon, Fräulein Sylvia, and Hugo Del Mar.
*️⃣ Followed by the Blastoff Afterparty – put on your red shoes and dance, dance, dance to Bowie + beyond with DJ Nyx. (Alcohol-free event.)
Event link https://www.facebook.com/share/1GKm5wibcF/


⭐ The Davids Flashmob Dance
The Squircle (beside Featherston Fresh Choice Carpark) 💃 Sunday 28 Sept 1.30 pm.
Don’t miss this surprise Bowie moment!


⭐ Bowie Storytime with Penny Griffin
Chicken & Frog Bookshop 📖 Sunday 28 Sept, 2 pm
Bowie books read aloud for kids of all ages – with special guest star “Angus.”


⭐ Bowie Feast
At Brac & Bow 🍽️ Sunday 28 Sept 6 pm
Bowie Roast Dinners, Preprandial Bowie Cocktails, and Bowie-inspired Desserts.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

✨ Plus all weekend: check out Bowie-era books in Featherston Booktown and browse vintage Bowie bric-a-brac in local shops.


⚡ Featherston will NEVER be the SAME. Step inside the starman’s world — only at BowieTown 2025.

Join us for a magical night at the movies with a special fundraiser screening of Wicked Part Two – supporting local parents of twins, triplets and more.

This fun night out has a powerful purpose: To raise funds for Multiple Hutt Valley's mental health care support pack, which will provide access to professional counselling services for parents of multiples who are struggling. Your ticket also supports other key initiatives from Multiples Hutt Valley, including grocery vouchers, cleaning services and milestone celebrations for families of multiples.

description:
All That Heaven Allows, Details
Directed by Douglas Sirk
Starring Rock Hudson, Jane Wyman
70th Anniversary

--- Cary Scott is a well-to-do widow gradually re-entering a social life amongst her mostly dull country club peers. Her only apparent enjoyment in life comes from weekend visits from her college-age children. Cary then meets a handsome younger man, Ron, who owns a small landscaping business. A follower of Henry David Thoreau's Walden, Ron enjoys a life focused on nature and is deliberately uninterested in the gossipy opinions of others. Their romance causes clashes and tensions between Cary, her children, and the country club. ---

This is a TEA TIME TALKIE screening where a delicious Devonshire Tea* awaits for upgraded tickets holders (a cup of tea and traditional homemade scones with cream and jam). This is served upstairs in the Grand Lobby during the intermission.

Admit only tickets are available for $15 or you can upgrade to include a Devonshire Tea for $24.

*No dietaries catered for.

Schedule:
2:35pm – Cinema doors open
2:45pm – Feature starts
3:15pm – Intermission, Devonshire Tea available for collection upstairs in the Grand Lobby
3:30pm – Feature resumes
label: Film & Media

description:
A Special School Holiday Screening: The Lost Tiger, This spring, the Māoriland Hub turns into a cosy little theatre for seven weeks of kiriata and kōrero. From September to November, a selection of Thursdays will be your chance to slow down, sink into a beanbag, sit back in a chair, and lose yourself in the magic of cinema. Bring your own pillow and blanket if you wish! - Door sales available!

This one is our special School Holiday screening - something fun for you and the kids to do, and on a budget. Afterwards, we'll chat with Chantelle Murray about her processes in bringing to life The Lost Tiger and what it means for her as an Indigenous woman in film.

*The Lost Tiger Synopsis:*
Teo is a plucky young tiger and one of the last of his kind. Found abandoned and wearing a mysterious crystal necklace, he is adopted into a big, boisterous kangaroo family of travelling wrestlers. After receiving visions from an unfamiliar land, Teo must suddenly embark on an epic quest to reconnect with his heritage and save his homeland from the clutches of destruction. Features the voices of Rhys Darby (Flight of the Conchords), Celeste Barber (Runt), and Thomas Weatherall (Heartbreak High).
label: Film & Media

description:
Jewellery Making In 4 Weeks - Sunday Afternoons, This inspiring Sunday afternoon jewellery blocks are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment! The course starts on Sun 2 November and runs for 4 weeks until Sun 23 November, 2pm-5pm.

Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on quickly to working in silver. An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items.

Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.

These blocks are also a great way for existing students or more advanced makers to join into a class in our well-equipped warm and bright studio!

Basic materials are supplied and there are extra materials available to purchase as you need in class.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Pauatahanui Inlet Triennial Cockle Survey, Pauatahanui Inlet Triennial Cockle Survey
It’s fun and educational and family friendly. It takes 2-3 hours.
BBQ to follow.

You will be counting and measuring the cockles on the mudflats to help us assess the Inlet’s ecological health. You don’t need any
knowledge or previous experience — we show you what to do. We provide equipment. All you need to bring are gumboots, old clothes, weatherproof gear.

TO KNOW MORE
Contact: or visit: www.gopi.org.nz.
label: Health & Wellness

description:

We will be screening a selection of films from Wellington filmmakers and some of the best and most fun in this year’s programme. Celebrate short films and the people who make them! Hear introductions from some of the filmmakers. Tickets include a glass of wine and snacks on arrival.

Films start at 7:30pm - drinks and canapés start at 6.30pm.
Rating: to be advised

More details to come...
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Christmas Karma, From visionary British director Gurinder Chadha (Bend It Like Beckham, Blinded By The Light), Christmas Karma sees ones of history’s greatest novels - Charles Dickens’ A Christmas Carol transformed into a joyous, colourful, feel-good Christmas musical that celebrates modern-day London and all of its vibrant communities and cultures. With an all-star cast and music from Gary Barlow, Nitin Sawhney and Shaznay Lewis, the film features an eclectic soundtrack influenced by gospel, bhangra, carols, rap and classic pop songs. Christmas Karma is a festive British classic for our times, and for generations to come, that promotes a strong message to be kind, choose love and celebrate the present.

Rating
Violence & coarse language
Director
Gurinder Chadha
Cast
Kunal Nayyar, Eva Longoria, Billy Porter, Boy George, Hugh Bonneville, Danny Dyer, Pixie Lott, Leo Suter
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Gerry Adams: A Ballymurphy Man, - WINNER: Best International Documentary, Galway Film Fleadh -

Irish republican leader Gerry Adams is one of the most controversial political leaders and visionaries of our time, having led the people of the North of Ireland from conflict to peace.

Adams was a critical voice in the decision taken independently by the IRA to lay down their arms after their twenty-five-year war against the British. Imprisoned and shot, he was demonised and censored by dominant media as a subversive and a terrorist.

Ultimately, the British and their allies were forced to recognize his legitimacy and negotiate with him - and his party Sinn Féin - the Irish peace accord known as ‘The Good Friday Agreement’.

Today, Adams supports the next generations on their peaceful and inclusive path toward Irish unity.

An intensely private man, protecting his family from the public eye, Adams tell his story for the first time in this eye-opening documentary. Interwoven with his words, a wealth of imagery of what is one of the most documented conflicts of our time gives an insight into Adams’ world - relaxed, informal, and uncensored.
Director
Trisha Ziff
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Glenrothan, When his beloved Chicago blues club burns down, Donal (Cumming) returns to his family-owned whisky distillery in the Scottish Highlands for the first time in nearly 40 years.

Donal didn’t leave Scotland on the best terms, having wound up in a violent exchange with his brother Sandy (Cox) and their father on the day of their mother’s funeral.

Joined by his daughter Amy (Alexandra Shipp, Barbie), Donal returns to his homeland in the hopes of making amends with his brother. But with old wounds running deep and the fate of the family business on the line, can inner peace finally be found before it’s too late?

Written by David Ashton (The Last King of Scotland) and accomplished TV writer Jeff Murphy (Hinterland), Glenrothan explores the complexities of familial bonds, set against the proud and timeless tradition of whisky making.

Cumming gives one of his best on-screen performances, opposite Cox who brings gravitas to every scene - both in front of and behind the camera.
Director
Brian Cox
Cast
Alan Cumming, Brian Cox, Shirley Henderson, Alexandra Shipp
label: Film & Media

description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Mandala Yoga Studio, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Mandala Yoga Studio
**Experience the Magic of Sound Healing with Claudio Escutia – First Time in Mandala Yoga**

Discover the transformative power of sound at *Mandala Yoga Studio* with the multi-instrumentalist **Claudio Escutia** in his first time **Sound Healing Experience** in Paremata. This is your chance to unwind, recharge, and immerse yourself in a deeply restorative sonic journey like no other.

### **An Evening of Deep Relaxation & Inner Harmony**
Claudio masterfully blends the resonant vibrations of **Gongs, Crystal & Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other sacred instruments**, creating an immersive soundscape that soothes the nervous system, quietens the mind, and opens the heart.

- **Feel the sound** as much as you hear it—every note washes through you, releasing tension and restoring balance.
- **No experience needed**—just lie back, breathe, and let the waves of harmonic sound carry you into deep relaxation.
- **A rare opportunity** to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing vibrations—right here in Paremata!

### **What to Bring?**
Bring your own yoga or camping mat, pillow and blanket for ultimate comfort. Come in cozy clothes, ready to melt into the sound.

### **Why You’ll Love This Experience**
✨ **First time ever in Paremata!** Don’t miss this exclusive event.
✨ **Perfect for stress relief, deep relaxation, and emotional renewal.**
✨ **Limited spaces**—these sessions often sell out fast!

### **About Claudio Escutia**
A world traveler and sound alchemist, Claudio’s journey has taken him from **Mexico City to Montreal, Kathmandu to Wellington**, studying classical guitar, jazz, and ancient sound healing traditions. His music is a bridge between cultures—blending **Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs, and Voice** into a meditative, heart-opening experience.

**Curious to hear his sound?**
🎶 **Listen here:**
[SoundCloud]( https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds) | [Instagram]( https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing) | [Facebook]( https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio)

**Don’t wait—secure your spot now!** 🌿
*Spaces are limited, and this one-of-a-kind experience won’t last long.*

📍 **Mandala Yoga Studio,110 Paremata Road,Porirua**
📅 **[Saturday 13th of December 5pm - 7pm ]**
💲 **[$49 ]** Early bird price of $45 for first 10 bookings.

*Come as you are. Leave transformed.*
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Spinal Tap II: The End Continues, The long-awaited sequel to the comedy classic This is Spinal Tap is here to turn the Festival up to 11!

Forty-one years after the release of the original groundbreaking mockumentary, the now estranged bandmates David St. Hubbins, Nigel Tufnel, and Derek Smalls (Michael McKean, Christopher Guest, and Harry Shearer) are forced to reunite for one final concert.

Spinal Tap II: The End Continues also marks the resurrection of documentarian Marty Di Bergi (Rob Reiner), who once again tries to capture his favourite metal gods as they contemplate mortality—and the hope that their 12th drummer doesn’t join them in The Great Beyond.

Joined by music royalty Paul McCartney and Elton John, Spinal Tap wrestles with their checkered past to put on a concert that they hope will solidify their place in the pantheon of rock ’n’ roll.
Rating
Offensive language & sexual references
Director
Rob Reiner
Cast
Christopher Guest, Michael McKean, Harry Shearer, Rob Reiner
label: Film & Media

description:
Watercolour Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Christmas Bauble, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: First drink is NOT included in the ticket price

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - The Golden Spurtle, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Edinburgh International Film Festival 2025 -
- OFFICIAL SELECTION: Telluride Film Festival 2025 -
Dating back to neolithic times, few culinary traditions have survived as long as the hearty bowl of morning porridge. Despite its simple recipe of oats, salt and water there is a lot that can vary.

Each year the sleepy highland village of Carrbridge awakens with excitement as locals and competitors from around the globe vie for the honour of winning The Golden Spurtle in the World Porridge Making Championships.

For ageing, charismatic, and soon-to-retire protagonist Charlie Miller, this competition means so much more than just a bowl of steaming oats. With ailing health but a responsibility to his fellow porridge committee members, Charlie is on a mission to secure the future of the championships – and his own legacy.

Against the backdrop of the breathtaking Scottish Highlands and infused with whimsical humour of an eclectic cast, The Golden Spurtle captures the humanity of village life and those who visit with spurtle in hand.
Director
Constantine Costi
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - The Choral, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Toronto International Film Festival 2025 -

From BAFTA-and-Tony-winning writer Alan Bennett and director Nicholas Hytner, the team behind The History Boys and The Lady in the Van, The Choral explores the humour and humanity at the heart of a community facing an uncertain future.

Academy Award® nominee and BAFTA-winner Ralph Fiennes heads up a cracking cast of character actors in this touching period piece.

As war rages on the Western Front, the Choral Society in Ramsden, Yorkshire has lost most of its men to the army. The Choral’s ambitious committee, determined to press ahead, decides to recruit local young males to swell their ranks.

They must also engage a new chorus master, and despite their suspicions that he has something to hide, their best bet seems to be Dr. Henry Guthrie (Fiennes) – driven, uncompromising, and recently returned from a career in Germany.

As conscription papers start to arrive, the whole community discovers that the best response to the chaos that is laying waste to their lives is to make music together.

With a knockout performance from the always-reliable Fiennes, and a compelling story to boot, The Choral is guaranteed to be a hit at this year’s Festival. Book your tickets quickly to avoid disappointment!

Director: Nicholas Hytner
Cast: Ralph Fiennes, Roger Allam, Mark Addy, Alun Armstrong
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Twiggy, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: BFI London Film Festival 2024 -

An intimate, star-studded dive into the birth of an icon, and everything that followed, Twiggy is a look at the life of the greatest ‘it-girl’ of all time.

Director Sadie Frost follows up her 2021 documentary Quant with another deep dive into the story of a fashion legend. This time it’s the model and cultural icon Dame Lesley Lawson - better known as Twiggy.

This slick documentary features a combination of fascinating archival footage and new interviews with stars such as Dustin Hoffman, Paul McCartney, Charlotte Tilbury, Joanna Lumley, and many more.

Telling her story for the first time herself, Twiggy is an exploration of the model’s upbringing, career, relationships, and everything else that has made her the woman she is today.
Director:
Sadie Frost
Cast:
Twiggy, Dustin Hoffman, Paul McCartney, Joanna Lumley
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Words of War, From James Strong, director of the acclaimed mini-series Mr Bates vs The Post Office, Words of War tells the powerful true story of world-renowned journalist and human rights activist Anna Politkovskaya.

Maxine Peake (also starring in I Swear at this year’s Festival) expertly portrays Politkovskaya’s brave crusade, putting her life in jeopardy by fighting to be an independent voice of truth for the Russian people. She refused to give up reporting on the war in Chechnya despite numerous acts of intimidation and violence, including being poisoned.

Sparring with Peake on the silver screen is Jason Isaacs, in the role of Politkovskaya’s husband Sasha - a TV journalist who can barely hide his jealousy of his wife’s success. Irish screen legend Ciarán Hinds also joins the cast as Dmitry Muratov, Anna’s editor of the independent paper Novaya Gazeta.

Politkovskaya’s legacy lives on, and her story serves as a reminder of the importance of protecting the right to report the news without fear of death or reprisal.

Director: James Strong
Cast: Maxine Peake, Ciarán Hinds, Jason Isaacs
label: Film & Media

description:
Combined Guilds Xmas Party WELLINGTON, It’s been another interesting year for Aotearoa’s screen industry, now it’s time to reflect, raise a glass, and celebrate together!
Join the writers, directors, editors, actors, stunties, crew, producers, postproduction and VFX magicians and all the screen creators who keep the cameras rolling and the stories flowing.
The Combined Guilds Xmas Parties are your chance to reconnect with old friends, meet new collaborators, and enjoy a well-earned festive catch-up with good people who get it.
 What’s included:
Your $10 ticket covers a bar tab and snacks
A warm, welcoming mix of industry whānau across all screen guilds
The perfect chance to unwind, swap stories, and toast to another creative year
Whether you’ve been on set, in post, behind the scenes, or in front of the camera, come celebrate the people who make Aotearoa’s screen industry what it is, one big circus family.
Tickets: $10 per person – includes bar tab + snacks
Dress code: Come as you are (festive flair welcome!)
label: Film & Media

description:
Dear Gentlemen, Movie Spotlight
Dear Gentlemen / Estimados señores
Country: Colombia
Genre: Drama
Audio: Spanish
Subtitles: English
Synopsis: Dear Gentlemen brings to light the little-known sufraggist movement in Colombia. Set in 1954, the film follows Esmeralda Arboleda, a fiercely intelligent leader who sparks a revolution in a society deeply rooted in patriarchal traditions – a revolution that culminates in a fierce and decisve debate. A women group embarks on a historic struggle to bring the issue of women’s right to vote before the National Constituent Assembly. With bold marches, radio appearances, and a brilliant media strategy that puts them on the front page, they achieve their goal, but the real challenge begins during the debate, where they face fierce opposition. Esmeralda Arboleda must endure personal attacks from the assembly members, and just as she is about to speak, she receives a heartbreaking call: her son has suffered a serious accident. She is torn between her duty as a mother and her commitment to the cause, with an unfavorable outcome. Although all seems to be lost, her perseverance leads to a historic victory when women’s suffrage is finally approved, marking a turning point in Colombia’s history.
Rated: PG - Parental Guidance Recommended for younger viewers
Free Entry | RSVP required |
label: Film & Media

Film Talks at Aratoi presents The Mummy (1932), Film Talks at Aratoi presents The Mummy (1932)
Get ready for a night of cinematic chills and festive frights! This year, Film Talks dives into 1930s Hollywood Gothic Horror with the legendary Universal Classic Monsters series.
Part two of the trilogy is The Mummy (1932) — starring Boris Karloff in one of his most iconic roles. With its haunting tale of ancient curses, forbidden love, and timeless terror, this Gothic classic remains a spellbinding piece of Hollywood horror history.
Venue: Aratoi, 12 Bruce Street, Masterton
Doors open: 6:45 pm | Film starts: 7 pm, Tuesday 28 September
Running time: 73 minutes
Recommended: Ages 9+
Reserve you seats. Koha welcome — suggested $5. Your contribution helps keep Film Talks alive and accessible for our community.
Presented by Film Talks, in association with Aratoi Museum of Art and History.
Step into the shadows… and uncover the timeless horror of The Mummy!

description:
Introduction to Lettterpress, This three and a half hour course is the perfect introduction to the traditional method of printing with lead type. Letterpress was the main method of printing for over 500 years from Johannes Gutenburg’s 1450s bible to recent times.

Letterpress has seen a huge revival in the United States and Britain while locally a number of artists and craftsmen have maintained the tradition. The three dimensional nature of letterpress is the perfect antidote to the flatness of digital print. This class will give you an insight into how the equipment, materials and techniques work.

The course will cover basic typography, composition, layout and letterpress techniques such as lockup, inking and paper selection on Adana tabletop platens and other proof presses as time allows.

Venue: WCBA. Wellington Centre for Book Arts, Woolstore Building, 262 Thorndon Quay, Wellington

Time: 9.00-12.30pm Sunday 12th October, 2025.

Cost: $85 (less 10% for members) includes 3.5 hours tuition, materials and letterpress booklet. Places are limited and can only be confirmed by payment.

Enrolments to: info@theprintingmuseum.org.nz

description:
Film Talks at Aratoi presents The Bride of Frankenstein (1935), Film Talks at Aratoi presents The Bride of Frankenstein (1935)
Halloween Film Night 2025
Get ready for a night of cinematic chills and festive frights! Since 2022, Film Talks’ Halloween Film Night has brought Wairarapa audiences together to celebrate classic horror in a fun, immersive atmosphere.
This year, on Halloween night, we continue our journey into 1930s Hollywood Gothic Horror with The Bride of Frankenstein (1935) — the third and penultimate film in our Universal Classic Monsters trilogy. James Whale’s masterpiece combines Gothic atmosphere, unforgettable imagery, and a surprising touch of dark humour, making it one of the most celebrated horror films of all time.
Venue: Aratoi, 12 Bruce Street, Masterton
Doors open: 6:45 pm | Film starts: 7 pm
Running time: 75 minutes
Recommended: Ages 9+
Costumes encouraged! Spot prizes will be awarded for the best dressed, adding to the spirit of the night. Bring friends, family, or come on your own and join a community of film lovers for playful scares, shared laughs, and a celebration of classic cinema.
Reserve Your Seats. Koha welcome — suggested $5. Your contribution helps keep Film Talks alive and accessible for our community.
Presented by Film Talks, and Aratoi, in association with the Wellington Heritage Festival.
Step into the shadows this Halloween… and don’t miss this haunting Gothic classic!
label: Film & Media

description:
Frankenstein for The Circus Hub, Hi Wellington Community,
We are the Wellington Circus Hub, a not-for-profit charity dedicated to preserving the art of circus here in Wellington. 
We unfortunately must leave our current space at Te Whaea. By attending our Frankenstein Fundraiser, you will help us secure the future of the circus in Wellington. We aim to preserve the skills, the equipment, and most importantly, the community, so that when the next opportunity arises, we are ready to rebuild stronger than before.
For many, The Circus Hub isn’t just a space – it’s a second home – a place to grow strength, confidence, creativity, and real connection. 
Thank you for your support, and every little bit counts.
About Frankenstein:
Come and watch Guillermo del Toro adapt Mary Shelley’s classic tale of Victor Frankenstein, with a brilliant but egotistical scientist who brings a creature to life in a monstrous experiment.
Movie Starts: 5:45, Suggested Arrival Time: 5:30.
For more information, visit:
https://www.circus.org.nz/ Or find us on Facebook ‘The Circus Hub’
And to donate further, we have a give a little page:
https://givealittle.co.nz/org/wellington-circus-trust

description:
French Film Screening - Chien de la Casse, 🎬 Join us for a screening of Chien de la casse (Junkyard Dog) - a gritty and quietly powerful French drama exploring friendship, masculinity, and emotional repression in a small town in France.
The plot 👉 In a sleepy village in the South of France, Dog and Mirales have been inseparable since childhood. Their bond is strong but also marked by teasing and power games - until a new arrival, Elsa, disrupts the dynamic. As Dog starts to drift toward this budding romance, Mirales is left grappling with jealousy, vulnerability, and the fear of being left behind.
The trailer 👉 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tCv83D3CQOY
Chien de la casse is a nuanced and touching debut feature by Jean-Baptiste Durand - a subtle portrait of male friendship, emotional fragility, and the unspoken tensions of rural life.
This film is rated R13 – Restricted to persons 13 years and over (Violence, offensive language, drug use & sex scenes).
📅 Friday, 05 September 2025 - 6pm
📍 Alliance Française, 78 Victoria Street, Wellington
🎥 French VO with English Subtitles
🎟️ Free entry, Koha donation
label: Film & Media

description:
Throwing Muses, Throwing Muses - one of the most acclaimed US college bands of the 1990s - will perform two New Zealand shows in December.


The band has announced concerts at San Fran, Wellington on 9 December, and Double Whammy in Auckland on 10 December.
Throwing Muses' Aotearoa tour is part of New Zealand promoter Plus1 Touring's 25th anniversary celebrations.
These are Throwing Muses' first shows in New Zealand since 1994.
Formed by Kristin Hersh with high school friends, the band pioneered a new alternative sound, releasing a string of critically celebrated albums and touring the world.
Throwing Muses - featuring Kristin Hersh, David Narcizo and Bernard Georges - recently released new album ‘Moonlight Concessions’ which has been described by Pitchfork Magazine as: “A stunning return to form”.
‘Moonlight Concessions’ goes back to basics, a return for Throwing Muses to their esoteric off-kilter best courtesy of Kristin’s pin-sharp sketches and their suitably abrasive musical arrangements. The album follows ‘Sun Racket’ from 2020, a heady set filled with tough and tender tales spiked with surreal imagery.
Don't miss Throwing Muses performing their career-spanning concerts in Auckland and Wellington in December.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Halloween Film Night 2025, Film Talks Presents: Halloween Film Night 2025
Get ready for a night of cinematic chills and festive frights! Since 2022, Film Talks’ Halloween Film Night has brought Wairarapa audiences together to explore classic horror films in a fun, immersive atmosphere. Over the past three years, we’ve journeyed through the shadows of 1920s German Expressionist cinema, and this year we step into 1930s Hollywood Gothic Horror with Universal Pictures’ The Bride of Frankenstein (1935)—a Gothic horror classic with unforgettable visuals, thrilling storytelling, and timeless appeal.
Doors open at 6:45 pm, and the movie begins at 7 pm at Aratoi, 12 Bruce Street, Masterton. Running time: 75 minutes.
Costumes are encouraged, with spot prizes for the best dressed, making it a night that’s as much about fun and community as it is about film. Perfect for families, friends, and cinephiles, the event promises shared laughs, playful scares, and a celebration of classic cinema. The film is not rated but recommended for ages 9+.
Book tickets to reserve your seat. Koha welcome: suggested $5. Your contribution helps support the event and keep Film Talks experiences running for the community.
Presented by Film Talks, in association with the Wellington Heritage Festival. This is an evening you won’t want to miss!

description:
Gaza Surf Club - Wellington film screening, 🌊 Gaza Surf Club - Film Screening & Fundraiser 🌊
Join us for a community screening at Vogelmorn (Upstairs) Wednesday Nov 26th at 7.30pm.
Gaza Surf Club offers insight into the lives of the Palestinian surfing community and their connection to the sea, as well as the ongoing struggles of living under a military occupation. 
Tickets are koha / pay what you can style and will go directly to supporting Sabah Abu Ghanem (a surfer featured in the film) and her family.
What to know for the screening
This is a relaxed event for all those (surfing community or not) who would like to support Sabah and raise awareness about the challenges of attempting to surf under Israeli military occupation in Gaza. 
The venue won't be operating its restaurant during the screening so you are encouraged to BYO snacks or dinner if you wish.
Unfortunately the venue is not wheelchair accessible.
About Sabah
Sabah has been surfing since she was a little girl and has been featured in several documentaries (including Gaza Surf Club). She was taught by her father, Rajab Abu Ghanem who is a renowned fisherman and surfer in Gaza. It was Sabah's dream to start the first girls swim and surf club in Gaza.
Now 26, Sabah has three children and her focus is on the survival of her family.
Here is a link to a recent article she is featured in if you want to follow her journey:
https://www.nytimes.com/2025/10/19/world/middleeast/gaza-city-israel-hamas-cease-fire.html
For more information on Gaza Surf Club, or to support other members of the Gaza surfing community, follow @surfersforpalestine and check out the Gaza Surf Club website.
If you have any questions, reach out to me (Adriana Bird) via instagram @adriana_bird
Hope to see you on Wednesday 26th Nov!
label: Film & Media

description:
He Pō Kiriata: Kneecap, This spring, the Māoriland Hub turns into a cosy little theatre for seven weeks of kiriata and kōrero. From September to November, a selection of Thursday nights will be your chance to slow down, sink into a beanbag, sit back in a chair, and lose yourself in the magic of cinema. Bring your own pillow and blanket if you wish!

KNEECAP Synopsis:

When fate brings Belfast school teacher JJ into the Orbit of self confessed ‘low life scum’ Naoise and Liam Og, the needle drops on a hip hop act like no other. Rapping in their native language KNEECAP fast becomes the unlikely figurehead of a civil rights movement to save their mother tongue. But the trio must first overcome police, paramilitaries and politicians trying to silence their defiant sound - whilst their anarchic approach to life often makes them their own worst enemies.

In this fiercely original sex, drugs and hip-hop biotic KNEECAP play themselves laying down a global rallying cry for the defense of native cultures.

Stay for a chat afterwards where we talk all things activism and what that means today.

When:
Thursday, October 16 2025
Event start: 7:30pm
Q&A session with tea and cookies after the screening.

See you soon!
This screening is R16.

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Islands, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Berlin International Film Festival 2025 -

Tom (Sam Riley, Control) is the tennis coach at a luxurious island hotel, filling his time between lessons with booze and brief affairs. The arrival of the Maguire family pulls Tom out of his normal routine and he strikes up a relationship with Anne (Stacy Martin, The Brutalist), her husband Dave (Jack Farthing, Spencer) and their son Anton. Tom is unable to shake the feeling that he has met Anne before, and this tension grows between them until one night, Dave goes missing and the police investigation points to both Anne and Tom as suspects. With Islands, Festival audiences are in for a “scorching, sun-frazzled Hitchcockian delight” (The Standard).

description:
Jenin Jenin Screening, This spring from the 28th of August to the 2nd of October we will be screening a series of excellent Palestinian films, old and new, every week at two/fiftyseven on Willis Street, with ticket sales going to the Gazan mutual aid group The Sameer Project.
The Sameer Project is an on-the-ground aid organisation organised by Palestinians in the diaspora, which crowdfunds in order to provide tents, medical care and direct cash aid to those most affected in Gaza. They can be found on Instagram at @thesameerproject.
More information:
Jenin Jenin includes testimony from Jenin residents after the Israeli army’s Defensive Shield operation, during which the city and camp were the scenes of fierce fighting. The operation ended with Jenin flattened and scores of Palestinians killed. Palestinians as well as numerous human rights groups accused Israel of committing war crimes in the April 2002 attack on the refugee camp. The sad question forces itself on the spectator: What will become of a country, a people when its children are confronted with war and violence from a very early age?
label: Film & Media

description:
Martial Law Film Screening, In remembrance of the victims of human rights violations and extrajudicial killings during the Martial Law in the Philippines, please join us for a free/koha screening of the "Batas Militar" documentary in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.
NOTE: For a list of trigger warnings, please see this document. Since we will be viewing and discussing potentially sensitive topics, the event will have an Open Door Policy, which means that you may leave the venue any time, for any reason, and will not be judged for doing so.
WHAT IS MARTIAL LAW?
"Martial law refers to the replacement of civil rule by military rule. This may be characterized by curfews, the dispensation of military tribunal rulings on civilians, and the suspension of the privilege of the writ of habeas corpus. The writ of habeas corpus, which in Latin refers to “having the body”, is a citizen’s protection against unlawful imprisonment. This is suspended in times of crisis to expedite justice" (Martial Law Museum).
WHY IS IT IMPORTANT TO TALK ABOUT TODAY?
Human rights violations and extrajudicial killings are still on-going in the Philippines under President Bongbong Marcos, the son of the dictator Ferdinand Marcos Sr. who proclaimed Martial Law in 1972, and Vice President Sara Duterte, the daughter of former President Rodrigo Duterte who spearheaded the violent War on Drugs in 2016 (Karapatan).
WHY WOULD I WANT TO JOIN THE FILM SCREENING?
The film screening is for anyone who is keen to learn about the Martial Law Era, wants to share their experience during the Martial Law (or something similar) through group discussion, wants to meet new people, wants to watch a Philippine film/documentary, or just wants to have snacks.
I WANT TO JOIN BUT I'M FROM TĀMAKI MAKAURAU / CHRISTCHURCH / THE PHILIPPINES.
We will stream the film through Zoom for viewers outside Te Whanganui-a-Tara, however, there may be internet and other technical difficulties during the event itself. Also please make sure to select the "Online" ticket option when RSVPing.
HOW MUCH IS THE TICKET?
The film screening is free but we appreciate koha for the venue/snacks/donations to Philippine non-governmental organisations (NGOs).
NOTE: This is an LGBTQ+ friendly event.
label: Film & Media

description:
Kiss Me Deadly, Details
Directed by Robert Aldrich
Starring Ralph Meeker, Marian Carr, Albert Dekker, Paul Stewart
70th Anniversary

--- One evening, private detective Mike Hammer picks up a hitchhiker who's standing on the highway wearing only a trench coat. They're stopped farther on by strangers who knock out Mike and murder the young woman. Although warned not to investigate by the police, Mike and his girlfriend and assistant, Velda (Maxine Cooper), become ensnared in a dark plot involving scientist Dr. Soberin (Albert Dekker) and Christina's terrified roommate, Lily (Gaby Rodgers). ---

This is a TEA TIME TALKIE screening where a delicious Devonshire Tea* awaits for upgraded tickets holders (a cup of tea and traditional homemade scones with cream and jam). This is served upstairs in the Grand Lobby during the intermission.

Admit only tickets are available for $15 or you can upgrade to include a Devonshire Tea for $24.

50th Anniversary

--- A comedic send-up of the grim circumstances of the Middle Ages as told through the story of King Arthur and framed by a modern-day murder investigation. When the mythical king of the Britons leads his knights on a quest for the Holy Grail, they face a wide array of horrors, including a persistent Black Knight, a three-headed giant, a cadre of shrubbery-challenged knights, the perilous Castle Anthrax, a killer rabbit, a house of virgins, and a handful of rude Frenchmen. ---

description:
Yin Yoga & Cacao | Winds of Change, Yin Yoga & Cacao | Winds of Change
✨ Yin Yoga & Cacao : Winds of Change

🗓 Sunday 23 Nov | 4:00–6:00pm | 📍Body Restore Clinic

The Wild Winds of Spring have been stirring us. What if we use the wind element as the messenger it is, and tune into its wishes for us? Let us ground, stretch & pause so as to listen to what is needed at this time of great planetary change & transformation.

Join us for heart-opening cacao followed by a slow, nourishing yin yoga practice designed to support the body, mind, and spirit in addressing our inner guidance within.

This gathering is an invitation to:
🍃 Surrender to the winds of change, letting them clear what no longer belongs
🌬 Hear the bodies wisdom, wisdom held within
🌿 Support the physical body by stretching muscles, addressing fascia system & your energy bodies, to harmonize inner movement with outer flow
🕯 Ground through stillness, even as the world swirls around you

All are welcome. No prior yoga experience needed, arrive as you are.

Whether you're seeking clarity, longing for renewal, or simply wishing for space to pause and breathe, you are welcome here.

Expect cacao, soft unfolding, soul-nourishing stillness, and deep rest.

$35 per person | Limited spots
Bookings essential – https://beyourownguru.me/yin-yoga-classes/

Wear something comfy, bring a journal if you’d like to write, and anything else that helps you feel grounded and at ease.


About Your Host – Heidi 🌟

Hi, I’m Heidi! With 20 years of experience in holistic health, I bring together a unique blend of practices, including Yin Yoga, energy healing, and health coaching, to help people to move towards a balanced, aligned life. I’m all about slowing down, tuning in, and reconnecting with what truly matters.

This **Yin Yoga & Cacao Afternoon** is my way of creating a space where you can pause, nurture yourself, and experience the magic of stillness and heart-opening rituals. Yin Yoga gently stretches and nourishes your body, while ceremonial cacao deepens your connection to your heart and intuition.

description:
Mystery 35mm Movie Marathon, Details
UPDATE - We have added some Half Marathon ticket options for those can't make the whole event. You can either select 'Daytime' or 'Evening' which will let you watch three features total. Daytime tickets are from 1:30pm until the dinner break (around 7:00pm). Evening are from the dinner break until the end of the last film.

Surprise we are running a 35mm Mystery Marathon very soon! We have had some exciting news that we cannot share for now but as a result we must move our beautiful 35mm from its usual location into storage for a bit. We are not sure when it will be set back up so to celebrate we are running a marathon of six 35mm features across one Saturday!

We will kick off the first film at 1:30pm sharp on Saturday and will have a short dinner break after the third film. All going to plan we should be done by around 12:30am.

In terms of the features, we have films from the 1960s through to the early 2000s with a mix of comedies, sci-fi, horror and cult classics! Granted not all of these films would be considered masterpieces but there is nothing more fun than sitting in a crowd not knowing what could be coming next!

We will have a snack menu you can pre-order before the first film so aim to arrive around 1:00pm to order. The breaks between films will be very short (probably just enough time for the projectionist to thread up the next film) so make sure you come prepared for back-to-back screenings.

This event has strictly no digital projection, it’s all film all the time. Now in theory it should all playback without a hitch as we are bringing in some of the best projectionist’s Wellington has. But 35mm is a strange beast that can sometimes throw up the odd issue.

Full marathon tickets (Admit) are $50
Half Marathon - Daytime are $30
Half Marathon - Evening are $30

Seating is general admission and cinema entrance will be determined by earliest ticket purchase times.
label: Film & Media

description:
Water Casting - Spring, This is a super quick 3-hour session, and is great fun to do with family or friends.
Water casting is a really hands-on low-tech casting method that results in surprising and fun little forms that can be turned into pendants with amazing textures and shapes.
You will be guided through melting silver and pouring it into water to create little charms.
Experiment with pouring at different heights to create different shapes.
Choose one or a few of your favourites to have drilled and turn into simple pendants or earrings, or new charms for your bracelets!
We will use hardened jump rings to attach your water-cast pieces to either colourful cord or you can choose sterling silver chains which you can purchase for extra.
The technique will be demonstrated with important health and safety practices, then students will be guided to do at least a couple of casts, and should expect to have at least one successful item to clean up and finish in the class.
A basic amount of metal allowance of a small amount of silver is included in your course costs, and if your projects go over that amount you can pay for the metal you use on the day via internet banking or cash.
This course is open to complete beginners and advanced makers. Extra materials such as chains and findings are available to purchase.
For health and safety reasons class participants must wear sturdy, closed toe shoes and have their hair tied back.
Workshop fee $128, Early bird $115 till 17 August.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
NZ Mountain Film Festival 2025 - Awards Night, A collection of New Zealand-made mountain films - brought to you by the Vic Uni Tramping Club, Wellington Tramping and Mountaineering Club, and of course the New Zealand Mountain Film and Book Festival!

Awards Night: Thursday 25 Sep (doors open at 6:00pm, films start at 6:30pm):

- Footprints on Katmai (22 mins) Max Romey, USA. Following his grandmother's footsteps to one
of the most remote and bear-strewn beaches in Alaska, painter Max Romey discovers that an
ocean of problems is closer to home than he could have imagined. BEST FILM ON THE ENVIRONMENT
- Alone Across Gola (20 mins) Jude Kriwald, UK, NZ Premiere. Stranded in Liberia’s Gola
rainforest, filmmaker Jude Kriwald faces hunger, isolation, robbery and disappearing trails. A raw
tale of one man’s solo, self-filmed journey chasing a childhood dream. With only a bike and a
tent, Jude pushes the limits of survival and self-discovery. BEST ADVENTUROUS SPORTS & LIFESTYLES
- Zahir (36 mins) Julien Nadiras, Switzerland, subtitles. Katherine and Eline take on an iconic rock
route, accessing it by bike. Their all-eco ascent tests endurance, nerve, and friendship, with long
runouts and tiny holds pushing them to the edge.
- Body of a Line (10 mins) Henna Taylor, subtitles, USA. A cleverly animated short film that
morphs into real life as Madaleine undertakes an intimate and creative journey to climb a difficult
rock route, with original music and poetry. BEST SHORT FILM
- Trango (46 mins) Leo Hoorn, USA. After a two-year attempt, ski mountaineers ski the first
descent of the Great Trango Glacier. They navigate risk, grapple with grief, and face physical
danger as they push the limits of human experience. Unspoken trust and support within their
expedition team allows them to face the unimaginable together. GRAND PRIZE FILM

Total running time: 120 minutes + 15 minute intermission.
label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: Deaf, A woman navigates the experience of motherhood as a deaf person in a hearing world in Eva Libertad’s crowd-pleasing, feel-good drama which collected the Panaroma Audience Award at Berlin this year.

Based on the award-winning short of the same name, Spanish filmmaker Eva Libertad’s debut follows couple Ángela and Héctor as they make the transition into parenthood. Ángela is deaf. Héctor is not. When she tells them she’s pregnant, her own parents can’t hide their shock – loving but concerned that their daughter will be unable to tackle the task of motherhood. Will the baby be born deaf? Uncertainty abounds as the due date draws closer, and it’s not just Ángela’s parents who are beginning to have doubts.

The foundations for the film’s narrative derive from the personal experiences of first-time actor Miriam Garlo, Libertad’s own sister, as she began to contemplate motherhood as a deaf woman. When surrounded by her other deaf friends, Ángela is comfortable, alive, vibrant within a community that supports her. Around the local mums in the park, or her husband’s friends, isolation sets in with a painful immediacy that anyone who has ever struggled to understand the language in a foreign country will know all too well. A poignant story bound by the chemistry of its leads, deafness is woven into the film as a lived experience, not a defining label. — Matt Bloomfield
label: Film & Media

description:
Mount Brewing Co Showcase @ Monkfish, We’re warming up to Beervana weekend in style at Monkfish Bottleshop & Fillery!
From 4:30pm into the night, we’ll be pouring a curated lineup of Mount Brewing Co’s finest, fresh, bold, and ready to set the tone for the days ahead.
Swing by if you're in town for an exclusive tasting before the big festival hits. No fuss, just seriously good beer.

description:
NZIFF: Deaf, A woman navigates the experience of motherhood as a deaf person in a hearing world in Eva Libertad’s crowd-pleasing, feel-good drama which collected the Panaroma Audience Award at Berlin this year.

label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: Dreams (Sex Love), A teenage girl recounts her crush for her teacher through the pages of a memoir. The winner of the Golden Bear 2025 is a lucid and tender chronicle of the unforgettable experience of first love.

Originally intended as the second chapter in his trilogy and released in Norway as such, Dag Johan Haugerud’s Dreams ended up premiering internationally as the last. But it secured a fitting crown to the trilogy, by winning the Best Film at the 2025 Berlinale, thus inducting Haugerud among world class auteurs.

Dreams emanates from two of Haugerud’s passions: literature, as he first gained prominence in his homeland as writer, and the cinema of French master Éric Rohmer, distinguished by sentimental skirmishes brimful of finely written dialogues.

The film’s protagonist and narrator is Johanne, a 17-year-old student who falls for her new French teacher Johanna. Johanne manages to get close to her crush, who nonchalantly ignores how her student’s devotion is veering into affection. Yet, this chronicle of first love is told in a voice over reflecting the memoir that Johanne wrote on her experience – meaning that things may or may not have happened as she says. The memoir is also read by the girl’s mother and grandmother who muse on the girl’s literary talent and provide a layer of irony and melancholy to an unfathomably lucid and tender chronicle of the universal and unforgettable experience of first love. — Paolo Bertolin
label: Film & Media

description:
NZ Mountain Film Festival 2025 - Pure NZ Night, A collection of New Zealand-made mountain films - brought to you by the Vic Uni Tramping Club, Wellington Tramping and Mountaineering Club, and of course the New Zealand Mountain Film and Book Festival!


Pedals To Powder (28 mins) Nick Kowalski, NZ. Two women cycle to every ski field in Aotearoa
in one wild season, braving storms and exhaustion—uncovering a hidden world of independent
ski culture along the way.
All in or Nothing (24 mins) Gordon Duff, NZ. Up against 120 riders with full support crews, a
young athlete only has himself to rely on. Follow his gruelling six days as he attempts to win the
overall title at the NZ MTB Rally. BEST DOCUMENTARY
Riverbound - The Storybook Has Just Begun (13 mins) Dylan Gerschwitz & Deane Parker,
NZ, World Premiere. Yak, a former pro kayaker now paraplegic, takes on Class 3 rapids in the
Upper Buller Gorge. Can packrafting restore his freedom—and redefine who gets to run wild
rivers? FESTIVAL SPIRIT AWARD
As One - The MHS Adventure Racing Team (15 mins) Louie Burger, NZ, World Premiere.
This uplifting documentary follows nine Motueka High students on a wild, 40-hour adventure
racing from the West Coast home—raising funds for World Vision with grit, laughs, and heart.
Spirit of the West (12 mins) Pedro Pimentel, NZ, World Premiere. Set against New Zealand’s
wild West Coast, this film captures the spirit of the Old Ghost Ultra—where community, resilience,
and grit collide in a transformative celebration of people and place. COMMUNITY SPIRIT
AWARD
Rakiura Solo (13 mins) Michael Beckmann, NZ. A tough solo hike around the 130km North West
Circuit on Stewart Island/Rakiura. Beyond the challenge, what makes this island truly special is
its rich wildlife. An ambient film without dialogue.
Waiatoto (20 mins) Josh Morgan & Jasper Gibson, NZ. This film tells the story of a traverse
across the Southern Alps through packraft, skis and tramping. Starting at the Matukituki, the route
went via Tititea, the Volta Glacier, and the Waiatoto, to the Tasman Sea. BEST NZ MADE FILM


Total running time: 125 minutes + 15 minute intermission.
label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: Dreams (Sex Love), A teenage girl recounts her crush for her teacher through the pages of a memoir. The winner of the Golden Bear 2025 is a lucid and tender chronicle of the unforgettable experience of first love.

Originally intended as the second chapter in his trilogy and released in Norway as such, Dag Johan Haugerud’s Dreams ended up premiering internationally as the last. label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: Sentimental Value, This film may touch on the familiar theme of how artists draw from their own lives, but Renate Reinsve and Stellan Skarsgard bring incredible tenderness to a story that is ultimately about what children and parents never say to one another — and whether those lifelong silences can ever be broken.
Collaborating again with frequent co-writer Eskil Vogt (now also a successful director), Trier fashions a nuanced look at both a troubled family and a dysfunctional film industry. (Gustav’s comeback project will be distributed through Netflix, and the divisive streamer is the target of a couple of the screenplay’s better barbs.) Much of Sentimental Value takes place in the Borg family’s home, and an efficient flashback, framed as an essay Nora wrote as a girl, explains how they have lived in the house for generations… That slightly fading family home becomes an apt metaphor for the weathered bond Nora, Agnes and Gustav share, although Reinsve’s fragile performance articulates the festering resentment she feels toward her absent father.
Trier’s third picture to screen at Cannes, after 2021’s The Worst Person In The World’s breakout lead Reinsve won Best Actress, the reunion of director and star will entice arthouse crowds… and those seeking a smart, thoughtful tearjerker should be pleased with this sentimental but farfrom-mawkish film.” — Tom Grierson, Screen Daily
label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: Lesbian Space Princess, Set in a gay-laxy far, far away this crowd pleasing and proudly queer Aussie adult animation delights with its vivid, candy-coloured palette, kinky sense of humour and catchy, upbeat musical numbers.

Dumped on her 23rd birthday for being too clingy, anxious Princess Saira (Shabana Azeez) may yet again endure the humiliation of standing in the Singles Zone at the annual Lesbian Ball. The young space princess has led a sheltered life and even holds the title of Most Boring Royal in the History of Clitopolis, where she lives with her glamorous Queen mums. But when a trio of Straight White Maliens kidnaps her ex, Kiki (Bernie Van Tiel), Saira must leave the safety of gay space to rescue her by bringing the Maliens the most powerful weapon known to lesbian kind, the Royal Labrys. However, there is a slight problem… she doesn’t have it.

Travelling in a bigoted spaceship from the 21st century, Saira’s inter-gay-lactic quest is a laugh-out-loud, kinky adventure.

Fans of Adventure Time and Steven Universe will adore the vibrant animation and captivating characters in this rip-roaring debut feature, which won top LGBTQIA+ honours at Berlin this year. — Madison Marshall
label: Film & Media

Q Space Festive Wrap-Up Lunch, Q Space Festive Wrap-Up Lunch

Let’s celebrate the year together before we break for the holidays! It’s the perfect chance to connect with the community, reflect on the year, and get into the holiday spirit. Feel free to bring along a festive accessory or wear something cheerful.

Sweet Axe Throwing Co. have trained staff in how to guide blind and low vision people, so we want to give the opportunity to our community to try an activity they may not normally consider.
Ages: 12+

RSVP's essential
Contact Dan on 0273594473 for more information
Don't forget our AGM is also on this Saturday (6th September)!

Circus of the Night - October, Circus of the Night - October

Produced by Athena Rose, with acts from Wellington's best circus performer
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Screenprinting taster workshop Nov 15th - print a tote bag, Design and screenprint your own tote bag, no experience needed!
Join artist and designer Greta Menzies for a fun, hands-on introduction to screenprinting using paper stencils.
In this 2-hour session you’ll design and cut your own stencil, then print your artwork onto a tote bag (included in your ticket).
Want to make extras? See the 'what's included' section below.
What you’ll learn
How to create and screenprint your own design using paper stencils
Tips and tricks from Greta’s years of experience as an artist and textile designer
(Greta is happy to answer any questions about printing methods and help you find resources)

What’s included
All materials provided, including one tote bag
Extra tote bags will be available on the day for $6 each. They make great gifts!
You’re also welcome to bring your own light-coloured fabric or fabric item to print on, just make sure it’s at least 50% natural fibre (cotton or linen is ideal).
The max print size is A3.
Can I print more than one bag? Or multiple colours?
Once your design is on the screen you can print a few multiples if you'd like.
The workshop is set up for participants to make one bag with a single colour print, but depending on how fast you work, (if there is time) you are welcome to add another colour.

Who it’s for
This workshop is for anyone curious about screenprinting, no experience required.
All ages welcome! (Under 13s will need an adult to join them.)
Accessibility
The space is wheelchair accessible.
The process is adaptable for all abilities. If you can use scissors, that's excellent, tearing paper also works. Greta is happy to help with cutting if needed.
Details
Date: Saturday November 15th, 2025
Time: 10.30am - 12.30pm
Location: Mt Cook School, 160 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
Cost: $85 per person
Class size: Max of 10 participants
What to bring
Yourself and your ideas!
Wear clothes you don’t mind getting a little paint on (or bring an apron)
Optional: light-coloured fabric item to print on (at least 50% natural fibre, cotton or linen is ideal)
Water bottle and snacks if you like
Extra tote bags available on the day for $6 each
(random colours and limited selection, unless you want to email me ahead of time and order something specific: greta.menzies@gmail.com)
About Greta
Greta Menzies is an artist and designer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has taught art and design workshops since 2015, in galleries, schools, community studios, and at Massey University. Greta first started screenprinting with stencils in her garage at 17, making hoodies and t-shirts for her mates. Over the last few years, she’s refined her accessible, low-impact printing method while teaching school groups - and now it’s time for all ages to have a go!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
NZIFF: Twinless, A grieving brother finds an unlikely connection at a support group for siblings who have lost a twin, but his burgeoning bromance threatens to turn into something darker in this uncomfortably sharp-witted comedy.

When his brother is suddenly killed in a car accident, estranged sibling Roman (Dylan O’Brien) suffers the unique pain of being permanently severed from his twin. Inseparable in childhood, the brothers drifted apart as adults, brother Rocky (also O’Brien) living out and proud in Portland while Roman lived a (decidedly hetero) tradie life in hometown Idaho. It seems he’ll never have the chance to work through his complicated feelings towards his twin until stumbling upon a bereavement group for just such a purpose.

There he meets Dennis (James Sweeney). Neurotic, sarcastic, gay, he’s the opposite that attracts as the pair bond over trauma and a deep need for attachment. They quickly become each other’s emotional support twin-surrogate, on call for late night grocery trips, afterwork bitch sessions, and road trip singalongs. But odd couple bliss can’t last, as Dennis has more than friendship in mind, Roman grapples with explosive anger issues, and dark secrets inevitably come to light.

Sweeny’s sophomore effort as writer, director, and co-star walks an entertaining balance between discomfort and hilarity. With finely calibrated performances from both leads, Twinless is witty, warped, and surprisingly warm hearted. — Adrian Hatwell
label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: The Teacher Who Promised the Sea, A progressive teacher brings new methods to a village in Burgos on the eve of the Spanish Civil War, whilst in present day Catalonia a woman searches for answers as to the whereabouts of her great-grandfather’s remains.

Catalan filmmaker Patricia Font takes us to 1930s Spain by way of real-life educator Antonio Benaiges, assigned to teach in the small village of Bañuelos de Bureba. Intertwined with these flashback sequences are scenes from present day Catalonia and Burgos where Ariadna, the granddaughter of one of Antonio's pupils, seeks to locate ancestral remains at the mass graves of La Pedraja.

Antonio’s leftist leanings and critiques of the new Francoist government anger the more conservative townsfolk, particularly the town mayor. This is despite his daughter being one of the pupils benefiting most from the free expression encouraged by Antonio’s Freinet method teachings. Meanwhile, Ariadna teeters between hope and despair in her search for closure – a human vessel embodying the plight of a nation still wrestling with the consequences of a brutal conflict.

The closing credits remark that the remains of 12,000 people have been exhumed across the country. Like Ariadna, the film attempts to seek answers from the horrors of a war that took place almost a century ago – one driven by political sentiments that feel unsettlingly familiar as some of today’s most powerful nations shift towards fascism. — Matt Bloomfield
label: Film & Media

Tom Sainsbury: Lessons Not Learnt | Paraparaumu, Tom Sainsbury: Lessons Not Learnt | Paraparaumu

description:
Eastern Hutt School XMAS Twilight Gala, Eastern Hutt School XMAS Twilight Gala
Every three years, our school transforms into a buzzing hub of excitement to raise funds and celebrate the heart of our vibrant community. This year, we’re going bigger, brighter, and more fun-filled than ever before!

✨ Here’s what awaits you:

Fun for all ages – bounce high on giant inflatables, race on Little Driver ride-on cars, battle it out in Nerf wars, and so much more!

Tasty treats – savour a tempting range of delights from food trucks and refreshment stalls.

A huge thank you to our Diamond Sponsor, Kylie Wilson – Ray White, for helping make this unforgettable night possible.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
NZIFF: War Stories Our Mothers Never Told Us, Seven women reflect on the emotional cataclysm of World War II in Dame Gaylene Preston’s landmark contribution to the collective memory of Aotearoa, which has lost none of its raw power on its 30th anniversary.

When young New Zealanders were mobilised as soldiers and sent across the globe to join the frontlines of Britain’s fight against Nazi Germany, the turbulence of the Second World War travelled back into South Pacific living rooms. Distance and death became everyday realities for Kiwis at home – and caused griefs that were at times taboo and suppressed.

Dame Gaylene Preston frames seven women, including her own mother, against a black background that creates a stage for their candid, unadorned and surprisingly intimate wartime recollections, as they look back from the 90s in interviews conducted by oral historian Judith Fyfe. The acclaimed documentary, which combines these shared testimonies with personal photographs and newsreel clips, conveys the immense pressure to conform to the value of stoic sacrifice for the cause under the scrutinising eye of neighbours, and reveals lesser-seen layers of resilience.

Marriages in the first flush of romance were cut short, pregnancies were navigated alone, conscientious objectors were met with ostracisation and American servicemen scorned, in a nation united around support of their boys in combat overseas – a state of affairs in which women were often granted little voice, as they took on more labour, and absorbed life-changing losses. — Carmen Gray
label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: What Marielle Knows, Panic around a new digital Big Brother era underpins a clever, absurdist send-up of bourgeois hypocrisy, as a married couple are put on the spot by their daughter’s all-pervasive telepathy.

Germany has a thorny history with mass intelligence gathering, and a continued vigilance around data privacy – and anxiety. Director Frédéric Hambalek taps into it with satirical, ribald flair and a twist of the fantastical in a sharp domestic parable for a new era of global surveillance paranoia.

Julia (Julia Jentsch) is precariously close to a full-blown affair with the workmate she flirts with on smoking breaks. Her husband Tobias (Felix Kramer) dreams of getting even with a publishing house colleague who undercuts his authority in editorial design meetings. When their teenager Marielle (Laeni Geiseler) is slapped by a school friend over an insult, the impact leaves her with the sudden telepathic ability to see everything her parents do throughout the day – a development that spells disaster for the household, as dishonesty can no longer sustain the veneer of stable marital contentment.

As the family descends into a desperate, riotous war of manipulation, they must experiment with new moral codes. Is radical honesty and defiance the best course of action, or should they stifle egos and instincts in line with their preferred image? Better yet, can Marielle’s new powers be curbed? — Carmen Gray
label: Film & Media

description:
Ocean Film Festival World Tour - Wellington Thurs 12 Mar 26 6:30pm, Immerse yourself in a breathtaking 3-hour journey through the world's most spectacular marine environments. The Ocean Film Festival World Tour presents an extraordinary collection of short films that capture the raw beauty, untamed power, and majesty of our oceans.
These carefully curated films showcase stunning cinematography from surface to depths, transporting audiences into underwater realms and atop towering waves. Experience the ocean through the eyes of passionate divers, fearless surfers, dedicated swimmers, and pioneering oceanographers who live for the sea's call.
Featuring spectacular underwater scenes, heart-stopping wave sequences captured from impossible angles, and intimate portraits of ocean adventurers, each film is a visual masterpiece.
Through compelling narratives and breathtaking footage, the festival celebrates both the ocean's majesty and the remarkable creatures that call it home. The Ocean Film Festival World Tour is an unforgettable celebration that inspires audiences to marvel at the sea's beauty while fostering a deeper understanding of our connection to these precious marine ecosystems.
Find out more at https://www.oceanfilmfestivalworldtour.com/
SORRY NO REFUNDS : SEATING IS NOT ALLOCATED.
ONE SCREENING ONLY IN WELLINGTON
Photo credit: EvieWilderness
label: Film & Media

description:
Perfect Days, Come along to our free Japanese Film night, co-organised with the Japan Foundation, Sydney!

Synopsis
Hirayama seems utterly content with his simple life as a cleaner of toilets in Tokyo. Outside of his very structured everyday routine he enjoys his passion for music and for books. And he loves trees and takes photos of them. A series of unexpected encounters gradually reveal more of his past. A deeply moving and poetic reflection on finding beauty in the everyday world around us.
Director: Wim Wenders / Classification: M / Year: 2023 / Genre: Drama
Language: Japanese with English subtitles

Copyright:© 2023 Master Mind Ltd.

A short Japan Video Topics DVD will be shown from 5:15pm before the start of the film at 5:30pm. Free admission is based on a first-come, first-served basis, with a full theatre capacity of 40 people. No food is permitted in the theatre
label: Film & Media

description:
Porirua: 'Pike River' Film Fundraiser, Join us for a fundraiser screening of Pike River. Based on the Pike River Mine disaster of 2010, the story follows the subsequent, years-long battle for justice led by Anna Osborne (played by Melanie Lynskey) and Sonya Rockhouse (played by Robyn Malcolm), two friends whose respective husband and son—along with 27 other workers—were killed during an underground explosion.
We will be fundraising to support our local campaigns. A portion of the money raised will be going towards supporting Resene workers who are fighting for a living wage at the Naenae paint factory. Our community has rallied to tautoko these workers in their fight for fairness and a living wage!
Please bring cash along to participate in the raffle and purchase one of our limited edition Living Wage teatowels.
Find out more about the Living Wage Movement's work in Greater Wellington:
Living Wage Schools - the campaign for a living wage for school cleaners, groundskeepers, and canteen workers.
A Living Wage for Resene - Resene paint is well-known local brand, but workers at their factory in Naenae don't get paid a living wage! As a community we are standing with the Resene Workers in their fight for fairness. Sign the petition to show your support for Resen Workers and to keep updated on community actions: Living Wage for Resene - Together
label: Film & Media

description:
Pike River: Wellington Brass Fundraiser, We’re excited to invite you to a special advanced screening of the powerful new film Pike River. This exclusive preview is a fundraiser to support Wellington Brass Band as we prepare to represent New Zealand at the World Championships in Kerkrade, Holland.
Pike River: Wellington Brass Fundraiser
Lighthouse Cuba, 29 Wigan St, Wellington
Tuesday 21 October, 5:45pm
General admission: $28.92 each ($25.00 + $3.92 fees) – Book now on Eventfinda
This is a unique opportunity to see the film before its general release. We’re especially proud that the film’s director, Rob Sarkies, and producer, Vicky Pope, have a family connection to our band — their son plays in our Buzzing Brass Youth Band. Vicky will be giving a short introduction before the screening.
We’d love for you to join us for this special night of cinema and music community spirit. Every ticket sold directly helps our journey to the world stage.
label: Film & Media
