description:
Reels for Meals: Rocky Horror Picture Show 50th Anniversary Re-Release, October's Reels for Meals movie fundraiser is Rocky Horror Picture Show 50th Anniversary Re-Release.
The cult classic returns in a stunning new 4K restoration for its landmark anniversary.
Based on the stage musical by Richard O’Brien, The Rocky Horror Picture Show shattered conventions with its bold characters, flamboyant style, and infectious rock ’n’ roll soundtrack.
When a newly engaged couple’s (Barry Bostwick and Susan Sarandon) car breaks down on a rainy night, they wind up in the creepy castle of Dr. Frank-N-Furter (Tim Curry). There, they have an adventure that will thrill you, chill you and fulfil you like never before!

All profits from this movie fundraiser go to the Lower Hutt Foodbank.
label: Film & Media

description:
Reels for Meals: Wicked: For Good, November's Reels for Meals movie fundraiser is Wicked: For Good.
Last year’s global cinematic cultural sensation, which became the most successful Broadway film adaptation of all time, now reaches its epic, electrifying, emotional conclusion in Wicked: For Good.
The final chapter of the untold story of the witches of Oz begins with Elphaba (Cynthia Erivo) and Glinda (Ariana Grande) estranged and living with the consequences of their choices.
Elphaba, now demonised as The Wicked Witch of the West, lives in exile, hidden within the Ozian forest while continuing her fight for the freedom of Oz’s silenced Animals and desperately trying to expose the truth she knows about The Wizard (Jeff Goldblum).
Glinda, meanwhile, has become the glamorous symbol of Goodness for all of Oz, living at the palace in Emerald City and revelling in the perks of fame and popularity. Under the instruction of Madame Morrible (Michelle Yeoh), Glinda is deployed to serve as an effervescent comfort to Oz, reassuring the masses that all is well under the rule of The Wizard.
As Glinda’s stardom expands and she prepares to marry Prince Fiyero (Jonathan Bailey) in a spectacular Ozian wedding, she is haunted by her separation from Elphaba. She attempts to broker a conciliation between Elphaba and The Wizard, but those efforts will fail, driving Elphaba and Glinda only further apart. The aftershocks will transform Boq (Ethan Slater) and Fiyero forever, and threaten the safety of Elphaba’s sister, Nessarose (Marissa Bode), when a girl from Kansas comes crashing into all their lives.
As an angry mob rises against the Wicked Witch, Glinda and Elphaba will need to come together one final time. With their singular friendship now the fulcrum of their futures, they will need to truly see each other, with honesty and empathy, if they are to change themselves, and all of Oz, for good.

All profits from this movie fundraiser go to the Lower Hutt Foodbank.
label: Film & Media

description:
Reels for Meals: Prime Minister, September's Reels for Meals movie fundraiser is Prime Minister.
In August 2017, in the lead-up to national elections, Jacinda Ardern unexpectedly became New Zealand’s opposition party leader. She had just turned 37. Two frenetic months later, she was Prime Minister. Just before the final vote was in, she discovered she was pregnant. She would become only the second head of state in history to give birth while in office.
Ardern quickly became one of the most recognisable leaders in the world. She drew global attention from people craving a sensitive and compassionate approach to the critical issues of our time. In private, she struggled with being a mother and proving herself to a public skeptical of women’s leadership. A series of crises - the Christchurch massacre, pandemic lockdowns, and disinformation-fueled protests outside Parliament - would test that leadership and the feminine touch she brought to it. She resigned from office in January 2023, shocking her supporters and critics alike.
Going behind the scenes of her administration and her private life, Prime Minister follows Jacinda for seven years as she is catapulted to the top of New Zealand politics, becomes a feminist political icon, resigns suddenly from office and continues to champion the fight against isolationism, fear, and the distortion of truth. Intimate home footage shot by her husband and audio interviews that Jacinda did while in office give us unparalleled access. Along with in-depth contemporaneous interviews, these form the emotional backbone of the story, giving viewers an unfiltered window into her years in power.

All profits from this movie fundraiser go to the Lower Hutt Foodbank.
label: Film & Media

Step back into the world of vampires and werewolves, celebrating Bella's birthday on September the 13th we're bringing Twilight back on cinemas. Edward is a vampire whose family does not drink blood, and Bella, far from being frightened, enters into a dangerous romance with her immortal soulmate. ---

description:
Seen The Film - Wellington, NZ. A Fundraiser for Te Aro School., We live in an age where, as parents and caregivers, there is more information than ever before. How much screen time is the right amount of screen time for our children? How best can we manage our children's daily meltdowns? Time in, time out, clear boundaries, feel all the feelings - what's best? We are hearing more and more reactive advice on how best to manage our children, yet we are missing the root cause and solution.
SEEN is a groundbreaking feature-length documentary that not only explores the transformative power of personal healing for parents, but also delves into the scientifically supported effects of such healing on parenting and its impact on child brain development.
movie trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZPQXpw6kT0
movie website with all the beautiful info: https://seenthefilm.com/
https://www.eventbrite.com.au/.../seen-the-film...
"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”

description:
Roxy Retro | Danger: Diabolik, The suave, psychedelic-era thief called Diabolik can't get enough of life's good - or glittery - things. Not when there are currency shipments to steal from under the noses of snooty government officials and priceless jewels to lift from the boudoirs of the superrich. The elusive scoundrel finds plenty of ways to live up to his name in this tongue-in-cheek, live-action caper inspired by Europe's popular Diabolik comics. He clambers up walls, zaps a press conference with Exhilaration Gas, smacks a confession out of a crimelord while freefalling with him from an airplane, and pulls off the heist of a twenty-ton gold ingot. Impossible? No, diabolical - Danger: Diabolik, to be exact!
Presented in 4K
label: Film & Media

description:
Silent Movies LIVE' at the Central Hawke's Bay Museum, As a part of the national tour with Chamber Music New Zealand, the team from ‘The Old Dairy Factory’,
bring three movies to life: 'The Kid', 'The Pawn Shop' and 'A Dog’s Life', all with new fresh music of today, composed by David Selfe.
This magical fusion of cinema and live performance transcends generations, offering both nostalgic
charm and contemporary artistry. The Central Hawke’s Bay Museum provides an intimate, historic
setting for this unforgettable evening where timeless humor meets world-class musicianship.
Witness Chaplin’s genius as you’ve never experienced before - through the alchemy of silent film and the thrilling immediacy of live music.
This event is part of The Spring Fling Festival - a series of standout events through September and October, capturing the essence of springtime in Central Hawke's Bay!
Spring Fling events span from Ōtāne to Takapau, Tikokino to Pōrangahau, and offer plenty of variety for visitors to experience the very best Central Hawke's Bay.
However, you choose to enjoy the Spring Fling, we look forward to hosting you in this beautiful part of Hawke's Bay, with warm Central Hawke's Bay hospitality.

description:
Soundtrack to a Coup d'Etat - Free Screening (Congo Week), Please join us for a free/koha in-person film screening of "Soundtrack to a Coup d'Etat", to raise awareness for Congo Week. There will also be an optional group discussion and light kai/food provided (feel free to bring your own snacks too).
You can find more info below (including how to support if you can't attend).
NOTE: As we will be viewing and discussing potentially sensitive topics, this event will have an Open Door Policy. You may leave the venue at any time, for any reason, and will not be judged for doing so.
ABOUT THE DOCUMENTARY FILM:
"Jazz and decolonisation are entwined in this historical rollercoaster, that rewrites the Cold War episode that led musicians Abbey Lincoln and Max Roach to crash the UN Security Council, in protest against the murder of Patrice Lumumba."
WHAT IS CONGO WEEK?
Congo Week is on 19-25 October, where we commemorate the millions of lives lost in this ongoing genocide in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC). It is also a time to celebrate the enormous humanity and environmental potential the beautiful country DRC has.
WHY ARE WE HOSTING THIS IN TE WHANGANUI-A-TARA, AOTEAROA (WELLINGTON, NEW ZEALAND)?
We are holding community film screenings during Congo Week to talk to each other as a community, and to help each other learn. As we support other causes/issues in Aotearoa/NZ and worldwide, we would like to increase solidarity for Congolese people.
We are buying, consuming, and benefitting from tech products/AI usage through child slavery and genocide of Congo. As long as there are customers of minerals found in the DRC, corporations will have an incentive to continue exploiting Congolese people for these minerals to be used in jewellery, batteries, e-cigarettes, and tech products like our phones and computers.
HOW MUCH IS THE TICKET?
The film screening is free but we appreciate koha for the Panzi Foundation (more info below).
WHY WOULD I WANT TO JOIN THE FILM SCREENING?
The film screening is for anyone keen to learn/watch a documentary film, wants to share their experience through optional group discussion, or wants to meet new people.
This event welcomes people from all walks of life who are willing to learn, listen, or contribute (LGBTQ+ friendly).
Between 5pm and 6pm: Set up tables and chairs
6pm-6:15pm: Karakia, health and safety, organisers' introductions, brief explanation on Congo Week
6:15pm-8:30pm: "Soundtrack to a Coup d'Etat" screening (people can come and go at any time)
8:30pm-8:45pm: Break/moment of silence
8:45pm-9:45pm: Group discussion with optional participation (each person to say their thoughts for 3 mins or less)
9:45pm-10pm: Pack down chairs and leave the room tidy
WILL THERE BE MORE IN-PERSON/VIRTUAL FILM SCREENINGS IN THE FUTURE?
Yes, will most likely be in 2026 instead of this year. We would love to collaborate with other people/groups, so we can share our skills and knowledge collectively.
I CAN'T ATTEND. HOW CAN I SUPPORT?
Please spread the word via social media stories, reposting, wheatpasting, or sharing to people who don't use social media (Instagram post here).
If you click RSVP, there is an option to donate without getting a ticket. We sincerely appreciate this.
You can RSVP to the 23 Oct 2025 film screening here.
If you click "Contact host" below, feel free to send us your email address and we can email resources after the event, e.g.:
Use refurbished tech products (instead of new ones)
Alternatives to Google/Microsoft mail/maps/calendar/forms/etc
Alternatives to Spotify/Apple Music
Reducing generative artificial intelligence (Gen AI) usage at work/personal life
If using Google as your search engine, add "-ai" at the end of your searches (to stop showing AI results)
Actions and Instagram accounts to follow
WHERE WILL THE KOHA GO TOWARDS?
Koha that we receive will go to the Panzi Foundation.
The Panzi Foundation has opened hospitals, mobile clinics, and the City of Joy, a sanctuary where women learn healing, empowerment and leadership through their traumas. Rape is a weapon of war used against the Congolese people.
The Panzi Foundation is one of the largest African-led nonprofits and is committed to addressing the devastating impacts of sexual and gender based violence through a holistic, survivor-centred approach.
The Panzi Foundation was founded by Dr. Denis Mukwege, who is considered one of the leading experts in injuries of rape and was awarded a Nobel Peace Prize in 2018, 6 years after an assassination attempt on his life.
WHO ARE THE EVENT ORGANISERS?
This event is organised by ordinary community members affiliated with Te Tai-Tētēkura (an indigenous, youth-led group in Aotearoa/NZ).
Te Tai-Tētēkura is founded on the principles of revolution through education and restoration of power to the people. They hold a foundational community-based kaupapa that prioritises uplifting, connecting, and empowering our communities.
Te Tai-Tētēkura's founding is based on the socialist and revolutionary politics of the Black Panther Party, which rose to prominence during the Black Power Movement in the U.S. They combine the Black Panther Party's ideas with Te Tiriti o Waitangi, and their own landback and decolonisation principles.
Through community initiatives, Te Tai-Tētēkura shows the people that we as a community can take care of our society.
We stand in solidarity with indigenous peoples in Aotearoa/NZ, the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), and across the world facing injustice.
Please click "Contact host" if you have questions/feedback/concerns or if you can't attend anymore.
label: Film & Media

description:
Sing Sing Film Fundraiser - Arts in Corrections Network, Join Arts Access Aotearoa for a powerful evening of film and purpose as we screen the critically acclaimed movie Sing Sing — based on a true story of redemption, creativity and the transformative power of the arts within the prison system.
Sing Sing tells the story of incarcerated men who find hope and humanity through a prison theatre programme. It reflects the values Arts Access Aotearoa upholds: that the arts can break down walls, build confidence and create change, inside and out.
Tickets are $25 and proceeds support the Arts in Corrections Network.
Before the screening, you will hear from actor, playwright and musician Jamie McCaskill (of the Māori Sidesteps musical comedy group), and playwright and columnist Dave Armstrong. Together, they led a powerful theatre and storytelling course at Whanganui Prison, supporting and transformation behind the wire.
Come along and support us to continue this important work.
About Arts in Corrections
Arts programmes in prisons can be powerful pathways to healing and change. They help people restore their sense of identity, build resilience and develop skills that support rehabilitation and reintegration into the community. By nurturing creative potential and cultural identity these programmes foster personal transformation.
Arts Access Aotearoa leads a national network that supports Corrections staff and community educators and groups to design and deliver meaningful arts programmes in prisons and Community Corrections..
label: Film & Media

description:
Tea Time Talkies | Kiss Me Deadly, 70th Anniversary
--- One evening, private detective Mike Hammer picks up a hitchhiker who's standing on the highway wearing only a trench coat. They're stopped farther on by strangers who knock out Mike and murder the young woman. Although warned not to investigate by the police, Mike and his girlfriend and assistant, Velda (Maxine Cooper), become ensnared in a dark plot involving scientist Dr. Soberin (Albert Dekker) and Christina's terrified roommate, Lily (Gaby Rodgers). ---
This is a TEA TIME TALKIE screening where a delicious Devonshire Tea* awaits for upgraded tickets holders (a cup of tea and traditional homemade scones with cream and jam). This is served upstairs in the Grand Lobby during the intermission.
Admit only tickets are available for $15 or you can upgrade to include a Devonshire Tea for $24.
*No dietaries catered for.
Schedule:
2:20pm – Cinema doors open
2:30pm – Feature starts
3:15pm – Intermission, Devonshire Tea available for collection upstairs in the Grand Lobby
3:30pm – Feature resumes

description:
Āhuru Kai Kōhua Poaka: Burger Wellington, The boil-up is a dish of love, traditionally made in big pots for whānau and friends. It brings people together. Te Papa wanted to capture the essence of this traditional Māori kai and give it a gourmet twist.

Traditional boil-up pork roulade, with Pagro lettuce and tomato, puha mousseline, and horopito aioli in a toasted Brezelmania watercress milk bun, with hand-cut kūmara fries, mānuka honey aioli, a shot of bone broth, and a heart-shaped raspberry framboise dessert.

Join us at the Te Papa Cafe on Level 1, walk-ins welcome. Reserve your spot by booking now.

Please note we aren’t able to accommodate dietary requirements.

A tuneful, heartwarming story, it is based on the real life story of the Von Trapp Family singers, one of the world's best-known concert groups in the era immediately preceding World War II. Julie Andrews plays the role of Maria, the tomboyish postulant at an Austrian abbey who becomes a governess in the home of a widowed naval captain with seven children, and brings a new love of life and music into the home.

description:
Tea Time Travellers | Marie Antoinette, Step back in time with Tea Time Travellers - A blast from the past series, celebrating cinema classics and new releases with a Roxy twist.
This month, we go back to France in the 1770’s. Marie Antoinette follows the life of the young archduchess, from her wedding in the Palace of Versailles to her demise in the French Revolution.
Enjoy a tea-infused mocktail, served alongside a mini flight sweet and savoury treats. Perfect for an afternoon treat.
The ticket price of $45 includes the film admission, sweet and savoury mini treats*, and cocktail or mocktail. Standard ticketing also available at this screening which does not include the food and drink.
*No dietaries catered for.
An Austrian teenager (Kirsten Dunst) marries the Dauphin (Jason Schwartzman) of France and becomes that country's queen following the death of King Louis XV (Judy Davis) in 1774. Years later, after a life of luxury and privilege, Marie Antoinette loses her head during the French Revolution.
Presented in 4K
label: Film & Media

description:
Terror-Fi Presents: BLACK PHONE 2 (First Public Screening - Wellington), The Grabber returns! We’re excited to bring you the first public screening of BLACK PHONE 2, the highly anticipated sequel to 2021’s horror hit ‘The Black Phone’.
Ethan Hawke’s terrifying Grabber channels his inner Freddy Krueger as he seeks vengeance on Finn and Gwen from beyond the grave. Upping the stakes and pushing things in a new direction, BP2 is a ‘must see’ in a dark cinema full of poeple. So grab your popcorn and be prepared to lose a lot of it to the horror gods!
Come to the cinema early to enjoy our exclusive cocktail and custom pre-show. We’ll also be previewing some of the upcoming Terror-Fi 2025 films, ahead of the festival launch at the end of the month!
“Determined to solve the mystery and end the torment for both her and her brother, Gwen persuades Finn to visit the camp during a winter storm. There, she uncovers a shattering intersection between The Grabber and her own family’s history. Together, she and Finn must confront a killer who has grown more powerful in death and more significant to them than either could imagine.”
label: Film & Media

description:
Terror-Fi Presents: THE LONG WALK (NZ Premiere - Wellington), How far could you go? Be the first in New Zealand see the stunning new dystopian thriller/horror THE LONG WALK – from the mind of Stephen King.
“A group of teenage boys compete in an annual contest known as The Long Walk, and keep walking faster than three miles per hour — or risk being shot.”
Early reviews back up claims that this intense and emotional exploration of boyhood is one of the most powerful Stephen King adaptations ever made – one that will stay with you long after you leave the cinema.
Based on King’s 1979 novel, the film is co-written by JT Mollner (‘Strange Darling’) and directed by Francis Lawrence (‘Constantine’, ‘The Hunger Games’ franchise) – features a sensational young cast alongside living legend Mark Hamill as our sinister antagonist.
Come to the cinema early to enjoy our themed lobby and custom pre-show… and don’t forget to drink plenty of water beforehand
Directed by Francis Lawrence, THE LONG WALK stars Cooper Hoffman (‘Licorice Pizza’, ’Saturday Night’), David Johnson (‘Alien: Romulus’), Garrett Wareing (‘Dead Sea’), Judy Greer (‘Halloween’), and Mark Hamill (‘Star Wars’).
Huge thanks to the team at StudioCanal NZ for this exclusive.

description:
The Lot Fundraiser Pub Quiz, Join us for a fun night of trivia and drinks at The Lot fundraiser Pub Quiz - let's raise some money together!

We are a bunch of Maessey University students and we need you help to fund our third year student film The Lot.

The film follows Riley and her boyfriend Jay, as they attempt to purchase snacks for a party. However, their arrogance and lack of communication turns a simple task into the unraveling of their relationship.
The film is a comical narrative that pokes fun at miscommunication and microaggression, and ends (literally) in a big mess. I hope audiences are able to share a laugh and see a bit of themselves in the characters: whether it’s the cashier who’s just trying to make it through his shift, or the partner who’s completely had it with their relationship.
label: Film & Media

description:
The Last Sky Film Screening, This spring from the 28th of August to the 2nd of October we will be screening a series of excellent Palestinian films, old and new, every week at two/fiftyseven on Willis Street, with ticket sales going to the Gazan mutual aid group The Sameer Project.
The Sameer Project is an on-the-ground aid organisation organised by Palestinians in the diaspora, which crowdfunds in order to provide tents, medical care and direct cash aid to those most affected in Gaza. They can be found on Instagram at @thesameerproject.
More information about The Last Sky, screening on the 4th of September can be found at https://www.thelastskyfilm.com/.

description:
Folk B*tch Trio - Wellington, Folk Bitch Trio - 'Now Would Be A Good Time' Album Tour with special guest Georgia Knight

Now Would Be A Good Time, the debut album by Folk Bitch Trio, tells vivid, visceral stories. Their music sounds familiar, and it’s built on a foundation of the music they’ve loved throughout their lives–gnarled Americana, classic rock, piquant, clear-eyed balladry. But the songs are modern, youthful, singing acutely through dissociative daydreams and galling breakups, sexual fantasies and media overload, all the petty resentments and minor humiliations of being in your early twenties in the 2020s.

Heide Peverelle (they/them), Jeanie Pilkington (she/her) and Gracie Sinclair (she/her) have known each other since high school, and first started singing together five years ago. Peverelle recalls sending Pilkington a heartbroken—in their words “bad”—song they had written called “Edie”; Pilkington remembers the song differently. “I felt so inspired that my teenage peer had written something so honest and original,” she recalls. It wasn’t long before she messaged Peverelle and Sinclair, asking if they’d be interested in starting a “folk bitch trio.” As soon as they started singing together, their connection deepened, and “the chemistry of being inspired by each other was evident from the get-go,” says Sinclair.

Listening to Folk Bitch Trio, it’s clear that this is a band of three distinct points of view, with contrasting and complementary backgrounds and visions. Pilkington grew up with two musician parents and brings formative memories of watching them perform, of listening to Gillian Welch and Lucinda Williams, and of her own imagined path as a career musician. Peverelle spends their spare time making art and furniture; those hobbies, as well as their love of pop music old and new, articulate a love for the tactile, the home-grown and the hand-made. Sinclair is the self-proclaimed jester of the group, but her taste skews dark, gothic, baroque and dramatic, expressed as a love of opera and ballet as well as musicians as wide-ranging as Patti Smith, Nirvana and Tchaikovsky.

Folk music has a bad habit of being presented as a deathly serious concern. It’s the music you cry to, it’s overly sacred, it’s solemnly considered by critic-historians. But Folk Bitch Trio have a shared sense of humour that is embedded deep in their music and that sets it alight, safe from the self-serious traps of the genre. Now Would Be A Good Time is funny and darkly ironic in the manner of writers like Mary Gaitskill or Otessa Moshfegh. On “Gods A Different Sword” they crack that “My body keeps the score/But if you tell me that you need it/I can get up off my floor,” a nod to the clichéd, over-referenced millennial self-help book, as they wryly sing about sex within earshot of housemates, and wring sexual innuendo from physics terminology
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Age on the Go 2025, Age on the Go 2025
Organised by Horowhenua District Council, the 2025 Age on the Go Expo is the largest event of its kind in the region, featuring dozens of stalls offering information and education for the hundreds of visitors who attend.

Held as part of the Horowhenua Age Friendly Communities Strategy, the expo supports our vision that older people in Horowhenua are empowered to make choices that enable them to live well and age well. The event promotes positive ageing by showcasing activities and services that support good health, connection and wellbeing for older residents.

The expo will take place at the Horowhenua Events Centre, 33 Victoria Street, Levin, from 10am to 2pm.

Before 7:45pm: Set up
7:45-8pm: Karakia, health and safety, organisers' introductions, brief explanation on Congo Week
8pm-9:30pm: "This Is Congo" screening (people can come and go at any time)
9:30pm-9:40pm: Moment of silence/meditation
9:40pm-10pm: Quick group discussion with optional participation (TBC if we can extend)
By 10pm: Pack down
WILL THERE BE MORE IN-PERSON/VIRTUAL FILM SCREENINGS IN THE FUTURE?
Yes, will most likely be in 2026 instead of this year. We would love to collaborate with other people/groups, so we can share our skills and knowledge collectively.
I CAN'T ATTEND. HOW CAN I SUPPORT?
Please spread the word via social media stories, reposting, wheatpasting, or sharing to people who don't use social media (Instagram post here).
If you click RSVP, there is an option to donate without getting a ticket. We sincerely appreciate this.
You can RSVP to the 22 Oct 2025 film screening here.
If you click "Contact host" below, feel free to send us your email address and we can email resources after the event, e.g.:
Use refurbished tech products (instead of new ones)
Alternatives to Google/Microsoft mail/maps/calendar/forms/etc
Alternatives to Spotify/Apple Music
Reducing generative artificial intelligence (Gen AI) usage at work/personal life
If using Google as your search engine, add "-ai" at the end of your searches (to stop showing AI results)
Actions and Instagram accounts to follow
WHERE WILL THE KOHA GO TOWARDS?
Koha that we receive will go to the Panzi Foundation.
The Panzi Foundation has opened hospitals, mobile clinics, and the City of Joy, a sanctuary where women learn healing, empowerment and leadership through their traumas. Rape is a weapon of war used against the Congolese people.
The Panzi Foundation is one of the largest African-led nonprofits and is committed to addressing the devastating impacts of sexual and gender based violence through a holistic, survivor-centred approach.
The Panzi Foundation was founded by Dr. Denis Mukwege, who is considered one of the leading experts in injuries of rape and was awarded a Nobel Peace Prize in 2018, 6 years after an assassination attempt on his life.
WHO ARE THE EVENT ORGANISERS?
This event is organised by ordinary community members affiliated with Te Tai-Tētēkura (an indigenous, youth-led group in Aotearoa/NZ).
Te Tai-Tētēkura is founded on the principles of revolution through education and restoration of power to the people. They hold a foundational community-based kaupapa that prioritises uplifting, connecting, and empowering our communities.
Te Tai-Tētēkura's founding is based on the socialist and revolutionary politics of the Black Panther Party, which rose to prominence during the Black Power Movement in the U.S. They combine the Black Panther Party's ideas with Te Tiriti o Waitangi, and their own landback and decolonisation principles.
Through community initiatives, Te Tai-Tētēkura shows the people that we as a community can take care of our society.
We stand in solidarity with indigenous peoples in Aotearoa/NZ, the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), and across the world facing injustice.
Please click "Contact host" if you have questions/feedback/concerns or if you can't attend anymore.

description:
Peanut Slab, Peanut Slab is an electrifying five-piece band from Kuku Beach in the Horowhenua, ready to take the New Zealand music scene by storm. They deliver a captivating fusion of reggae, rock, pop, disco, and timeless classics, ensuring every performance is a high-energy celebration.
Renowned for their spot-on covers and infectious stage presence, we have a knack for keeping the dance floor alive and buzzing.

We have a large venue, but it still has a capacity limit. Be early to secure your ticket. We are keeping the cost down to $20 to enable as many of your members, locals and Peanut Slab supporters to attend as possible.

Some more info on Peanut Slab:
Over the past 5 years they have played at any event you can think of and feature regularly at Finns Gastro Bar in Taupo, where we will be hosting this upcoming New Years Eve to a full capacity crowd. They are well experienced in playing Weddings, Birthdays, Clubs, Functions, and Events, and have supported many community causes and fundraisers.

With a remarkable collective experience of over 100 years in the live music industry, they are not just a band; they are an musical experience, priding themselves on creating memorable moments and connecting with our audience through their passion for music.

We are proud to support them as artists and are excited that they will be joining us on 20th December.

Ngā mihi
Ōtaki Club and RSA

Note - If you’re looking for high-quality entertainment around, then look no further than Peanut Slab Music. Get in to secure them for your next function. Gary Hibbs
K26 Productions, 022 197 6827, K26productionsnz@gmail.com

description:
Spring Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop 12th October 2025, Join expert forager Felicity Joy of Wild Botanica for a comprehensive Wild Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop in the beautiful community gardens of Mount Victoria, Wellington.
This inspiring experience will open your eyes to the abundance of edible wild plants growing right under your nose.
We’ll unlock the secrets of foraging, connecting with the land, and turning humble "weeds" into delicious, nourishing food. You’ll gain confidence in identifying common edible plants, learn their botanical names, and understand their medicinal and nutritional benefits. We’ll also explore ethical foraging practices, how to spot toxic lookalikes, and share simple, practical ways to incorporate wild foods into your daily meals.
This isn’t just about food: it’s about sustainability, resilience, and reconnecting with the environment in a meaningful way. You'll leave with a deeper appreciation for the land, new skills to support local food security, and the knowledge to make your own simple meals from wild ingredients.
Class sizes are limited, so book early to secure your spot.
For more details and bookings, visit
www.wildbotanica.co.nz
follow @wild.botanica.nz on social media.
For questions, email felicity@wildbotanica.co.nz.
Join my email newsletter to hear about upcoming foraging workshops: https://www.wildbotanica.co.nz/pages/newsletter

description:
The World of Nelsito, Movie Spotlight
The World of Nelsito / El Mundo de Nelsito
Country: Cuba
Genre: Drama
Audio: Spanish
Subtitles: English
Synopsis: Dramatic comedy that introduces us to Nelsito, a 16-year-old autistic boy. After running away from home, he is the victim of a car accident. From his stretcher and through his imaginary pen, Nelsito reveals the dark and hidden side of all those he lives with and those around him: perverse children, murderous women, adorable swindling girls… Now recovered, Nelsito returns home. There we will meet those same characters, now simple neighbours, real, everyday people, but which are the real ones, those common mortals or the ones he has imagined?
Rated: M - Suitable for mature audineces 16 years and over.
Note: Violence, sexual violence & offensive language.
Free Entry | RSVP required |

description:
Twilight, Details
Directed by Catherine Hardwicke
Starring Anna Kendrick, Robert Pattinson, Kristen Stewart, Billy Burke, Taylor Lautner
Step back into the world of vampires and werewolves, celebrating Bella's birthday on September the 13th we're bringing Twilight back on cinemas. To revive this love triangle debate, what would you be sipping? 'Team Edward' and 'Team Jacob' cocktails available to pre-order with your tickets. Can't decide? We'll have enough to upgrade you that night.

--- High-school student Bella Swan, always a bit of a misfit, doesn't expect life to change much when she moves from sunny Arizona to rainy Washington state. Then she meets Edward Cullen, a handsome but mysterious teen whose eyes seem to peer directly into her soul. Edward is a vampire whose family does not drink blood, and Bella, far from being frightened, enters into a dangerous romance with her immortal soulmate. ---

description:
Top of the South Film Festival Red Carpet Screening & Awards Night, Top of the South Film Festival Red Carpet Screening & Awards Night
The Top of the South Film Festival (TSFF) returns for it's 11th annual edition. With three days of celebratory events throughout Nelson & Marlborough, this is a chance to walk the red carpet, share food and drinks, and mingle with the celebrities before premiering the 2025 selection of the best short films created both in the Top of the South region and throughout the rest of the country. From thrillers and dramas to westerns, animated comedies and documentaries—this year’s screenings contain entertainment for all.

SUNDAY 19 OCTOBER
10:30am-12:30pm - Bus Tour: Join locations manager & scout Dylan Poihipi in a tour around Marlborough as we discuss the art & technicalities of locations for film. Departing from ASB Theatre Marlborough.
2-3:45pm - Regional Screening: a curated collection of short films produced within the Top of the South region. The Anderson, ASB Theatre Marlborough.
5:30pm - Red Carpet screening & awards night. Doors open at 5:30pm with canapes in the foyer, followed by a curated collection of national and local short films at 6:30pm. The presentation of awards begins at 8:30pm. The Anderson, ASB Theatre Marlborough.

All festival proceeds are donated to the Top of the South Film Production Society, which provides financial support to its members who pursue the art of filmmaking in our Top of the South region.

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presents REAR WINDOW (1954), Welcome to the Wairarapa Cinematheque
Film lovers in the Wairarapa have a new home for cinema. The Wairarapa Cinematheque launches in 2025 with a curated programme of classics, contemporary gems, and cult favourites — films you rarely get to see on the big screen.
2025 Screening Programme
Sunday 28 September, 7:30pm – Rear Window (1954)
Alfred Hitchcock’s suspense masterpiece starring James Stewart and Grace Kelly.
Sunday 26 October, 7:30pm – Rochelle (2024) & Bellbird (2019)
Two powerful New Zealand films showcasing extraordinary local storytelling.
Sunday 30 November, 7:30pm – Run Lola Run (1998)
A thrilling, kinetic ride through fate, love, and chance in this German cult classic.
Ticket Options
Three Movie Membership – the best value! Secure your seat for all three screenings and enjoy the full Cinematheque experience. Membership cards will be issued at our first screening, which is REAR WINDOW (1954). Please arrive 15 minutes early to collect your membership cards/ticket.
Single Ticket – perfect for sampling the magic on opening night.
Tickets are available through Humanitix or cash door sales on the night.
Join us in celebrating film, artistry, and community in the Wairarapa.
label: Film & Media

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presents ROCHELLE (2024) + BELLBIRD (2019), Welcome to the Wairarapa Cinematheque
Film lovers in the Wairarapa have a new home for cinema. The Wairarapa Cinematheque launches in 2025 with a curated programme of classics, contemporary gems, and cult favourites — films you rarely get to see on the big screen.
Rochelle (2024) & Bellbird (2019) – Double Feature | Wairarapa Cinematheque
✨ Two powerful New Zealand films, one unforgettable evening on the big screen.
🎥 Rochelle (2024)
A brazen young man takes it upon himself to send his friend’s busted-up car, Rochelle, out in style by entering it in a local demolition derby. But to get there, he needs help from an unexpected source. A bold and surprising new story of friendship, loyalty, and going out with a bang.
🎥 Bellbird (2019)
Set in the heart of rural New Zealand, Bellbird is a tender, funny, and deeply human story of a father and son finding their way after loss. Warm, beautifully observed, and filled with aroha, it’s a heartfelt portrait of resilience, family, and community.
📅 Date & Time: Sunday 26 October, 7:30pm
📍 Location: Regent 3 Cinemas, Masterton
Tickets:
If you purchased a Three Movie Membership on Opening Night, you’re covered — just show your card at the door.
Single tickets are $15 each, available via Humanitix or at the door.
Join us for an unforgettable evening of extraordinary local storytelling, celebrating the richness of Aotearoa cinema on the big screen.

description:
Poetry Slam: Regional Heat #1, This PIM event is a Poetry Slam! The first of three regional heats leading to the regional finals at the National Library on October 11th.
This Poetry In Motion Slam is the first heat for the 2025 Wellington Poetry Slam Champs. The top three scoring poets from this event will gain a spot in the regional finals!
Poets who want to sign up for the slam, please drop an email to:
travis.cottreau@gmail.com
subject: slam heat #1
What is a slam?
A Poetry Slam is a competitive poetry event where poets compete for points. Five random audience members are tasked with being the judges and they score each poem out of 10 to one decimal place.
The number of poets involved and number of rounds can change event-to-event, but there are some universal rules – no props, no costumes, poems must be three minutes or less, poets must read original work, and no punching down or hate speech.
Price on the door is $5
The top four poets from each heat will go through to the Wellington Poetry Slam Champs at the National Library of New Zealand on October 11th.
Other heats:
Sunday the 21st Sept
Thursday the 2nd October
Finals: Saturday, 11th October.

The screening will be introduced by the Director of ActionStation, Kassie Hartendorp.

Presented by Manatū Taonga Ministry for Culture and Heritage in partnership with the National Library of New Zealand Te Puna Mātauranga o Aotearoa and Ngā Taonga Sound & Vision.

description:
9 September Whisky Tasting, Whisky Tasting: 9 September 2025
Hosted by Matt Mueller
In September, we'll get back on track, away from the International Whiskies of our August tasting, and on to the Eastern Highlands of Scotland: Glendronach.
Named for the valley of the brambles surrounding the distillery, Glendronach was the second distillery to gain a legal whisky license, and is currently under the stewardship of Dr. Rachel Barrie, a legend in the whisky industry. Dr Barrie has recently revamped the Glendronach lineup, and we're going to see how she's doing: we'll try the previous 12 and 15 year--old bottlings against her new releases. She's worked her magic at Ben Riach, and we'll see how she's doing at Glendronach (I suspect quite well!). Additionally, we'll try the highland peated Glendronach, a departure from the familiar smokey peat of Islay. We'll expect a sweeter, softer style, bolstered by some sherry maturation.
Please join me for this wonderful tasting of Glendronachs:
Tuesday, September 9
7:30pm Start time (arrive early to get a beer and a seat)
$60 per person
Seatoun Clubhouse (16 Dundas Street, Seatoun)
See you then,
Matt
Matt & the Clubhouse Team

*** Please note you need to be a member or a guest of a member to attend. Details on how to pay subs is below***

description:
A hāngi to remember, A hāngi to remember
Enjoy a delicious hāngi by P&S Kai, relax to live music and learn about the 1975 Land March coming to Porirua.

𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝟬𝟰 𝟮𝟯𝟳 𝟭𝟱𝟭𝟭 𝘁𝗼 𝗽𝗮𝘆 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗮 𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗱𝗶𝘁 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝗼𝗿 𝘃𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘁 𝗣𝗮̄𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗮 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗽𝗿𝗲-𝗽𝘂𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗵𝗮̄𝗻𝗴𝗶 𝗯𝘆 𝟯 𝗢𝗰𝘁𝗼𝗯𝗲𝗿. Be in quick! (Hāngi will not be available to purchase on the day)

$16 for a hāngi. Two options available:
Original: Chicken drumstick and pork belly, heaps of vegetables and stuffing.

50 years ago, Porirua welcomed thousands of marchers from the 1975 Land March. The marchers along with Dame Whine Cooper were welcomed with steaming delicious hangi and the legendary manaakitanga of Ngāti Toa and the Porirua Community before they delivered their message to Parliament.
To honour this significant time of unity and manaakitanga join us for ‘A hāngi to remember’.
Pick up your hangi, enjoy live music and visit the exhibition Not One More Acre: Remembering the 1975 Land March

https://pataka.org.nz/whats-on/events/a-hangi-to-remember/

description:
Art Flow: Dine & Discover, Join us for another exclusive evening celebrating art and cuisine at DoubleTree by Hilton Wellington. Experience the perfect blend of creative expression and culinary excellence as we bring together the artists behind our successful 'Art Flow' exhibition for an intimate dining experience.

Your evening begins at Grazie Italian restaurant with a welcome drink, followed by a carefully curated three course dinner. Our featured artist, Min Kim, will share insights into her beautiful art and offer a unique perspective on her creative process and inspiration with a live art demonstration between the main course and dessert. The journey continues when you’ll indulge in a dessert presented by Le Cordon Bleu, followed by the demonstrated artwork being auctioned towards the end of the evening. This intimate setting provides the perfect opportunity to engage with Min Kim while enjoying exceptional cuisine followed by a guided tour through our hotel’s art-adorned interior.

Event Details:
- Welcome drink on arrival
- Mix & Mingle – meet Min Kim
- A live art demonstration by Min Kim with the completed artwork being auctioned the same night
- Three-course dinner at Grazie Italian Restaurant with the dessert prepared by Le Cordon Bleu
- Guided art tour with our featured artists

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience art beyond the canvas and celebrate the intersection of visual and culinary artistry.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Christmas Carols 2025 - Back At Brewtown!, Due to massive demand we're excited to announce that Christmas Carols are BACK AT BREWTOWN!

We missed you all so much last year that we couldn't go another without bringing you the best Christmas Carols experience in Upper Hutt!

So get ready to rock out with Nick Tansley and his Christmas Caravan…and there may even be a visit from the big guy in the red suit himself.

We've teamed up with the excellent folk at Alliance Fire & Security and Empire Roofing Ltd & Construction to be able to make this FREE to attend! How is awesome is that!

Gather the crew, the Carols are fun for the whole Whanau - gates open at 1pm, show kicks off at 2pm.

Deck chairs are all good.
No picnic blankets please (to make sure there is plenty of space for everyone!)
No outside food and drinks (except water bottles) we'll have plenty of local foodies for you to enjoy and the Brewtown Bar pouring a refreshing range of beverages.

Check out the work of our partners

Roofing Company Upper Hutt, Wellington - Empire Roofing - https://empireroofing.nz/

Alliance – Fire and Security - https://www.alliancefs.co.nz/

description:
Aurora Distillery Gin Experience, Create, make and take home your own gin with us at our Gin Experience sessions at our beautiful Wairarapa site, just 10 minutes from Martinborough. Our experienced distillery staff are on hand throughout to guide you through the process and give as much or as little advice as you want. We have hundreds of satisfied customers who have made some really exciting gins.

You’ll begin by foraging in the distillery gardens then we move to the gin-making room to learn about the gin making process and the ingredients involved. You’ll sample loads of botanicals then you will choose what you want to put in your very own gin recipe. After weighing out your recipe, you’ll move to your very own still and begin distilling!

While your gin is distilling, we’ll do a gin tasting of some of our own Arrival brand gins and some surprises from our other spirits.

At the end of the session you’ll bottle and seal your own 500ml bottle of gin to take home!

Please note each Experience attendee must have their own ticket. To ensure all participants have a great time and get our full attention we cannot accept spectators.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Arizona Flashback, Dust off the denim, dig out the flip phones and get ready to rewind time. Two Grey is bringing back Arizona Bar & Grill for a limited-time pop-up.

Welcome to The Arizona Flashback, a throwback to the late '90s and early 2000s that revives the flavours, energy and atmosphere of the iconic Arizona Bar & Grill. Known as a go-to spot for after-work drinks, late-night bites, birthday celebrations and casual catch-ups, Arizona was a place where people came together over great food and good times.

Now, its beloved Southwestern-style dishes and all-day menu return — not just as a delicious nod to the past, but as a celebration of shared moments, laughter and connection.

Immerse yourself in the full Y2K dining experience, complete with retro beats, neon lights and the return of Arizona’s famous Spin the Wheel game for a dash of playful nostalgia.
label: Food & Drink

If not already stated and confirmed at the time of reservation, guest numbers must be confirmed 48 hours prior to arrival.

High Tea reservations cancelled within 24 hours prior to arrival will incur a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.

description: Breakfast Club, For one morning only – Loosie’s Superette is opening for breakfast, serving a comfort-filled menu with banging tunes and endless caffeine. Think trayfuls of fluffy pancakes, bacon and egg muffins, crispy hash browns drowned in maple syrup, and bottomless drip coffee to keep things rolling. Add a cheeky mimosa or two, and you’ve got the perfect start to your weekend. Whether you’re with your brunch crew, shaking off a hangover, or chasing the crispy bits, this is a morning made for indulgence. It’s all about good food, loud laughs, and that first sip of something strong with your best mates by your side. No rules, no rush - just tunes pumping, trays piling up, and that warm, familiar feeling of a proper brunch done right.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Bar Blanc de Blancs with Martin Bosley's Oyster Saloon, Alexia's special annual Blanc de Blancs celebration returns for a 4th edition with the release of the 2021 vintage of our world famous (in Greytown) Méthode Traditionnelle!

After four years of patient making and aging, the corks on the most sparkly of all our wines are ready to be popped and the liquid gold consumed on the Alexia terrace!

The man, the myth, the mollusc maestro Martin Bosley is back with his Oyster Saloon between 12pm - 3pm shucking fresh oysters for the occasion so get in early for these or miss out!

Oysters not your thing? Fear not, the Alexia kitchen will also be turning out some delicious delights to match to your Blanc de Blancs – everyone will be happy!

It’s always a great day when the new vintage of Blanc de Blancs starts flowing and we’re quietly delighted with how the 2021 vintage is looking!

Essential Details:
- Alexia Urban Winery, 197 West Street, Greytown.
- Leashed dogs ok!
- No bookings required, just turn up. Want oysters? Get there before 3pm.
- Parking onsite, on the street, and lots of parking for bikes. 15 minute walk from Greytown centre.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Bakery & Brewery, Step into the world of baking and brewing with this unforgettable experience. Join owner Tim Tracey at the Dough Bakery HQ for an interactive hands-on class where you'll master the art of sourdough. Learn the techniques behind creating the perfect loaf, from mixing to baking, in this immersive workshop.

After you’ve perfected your sourdough skills, it’s time to head over to Upper Hutt’s Brewtown via the Tradesman Entrance, where you’ll get an exclusive tour of Boneface Brewery. Discover the secrets behind their craft beers, and enjoy an inside look at the brewing process, from hops to pint.

The adventure culminates with a delicious BBQ smoked-meat dinner, where you can unwind, savouring expertly smoked meats in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Whether you’re a culinary enthusiast, a craft beer lover, or simply in search of a great night out, this event offers a perfect blend of hands-on cooking, beer appreciation, and mouthwatering food.

This is your chance to learn from the best and indulge in an evening of flavour and fun!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Jumanji, Details
Directed by Joe Johnston
Starring Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst, Bonnie Hunt
30th Anniversary

--- A magical board game unleashes a world of adventure on siblings Peter (Bradley Pierce) and Judy Shepherd (Kirsten Dunst). While exploring an old mansion, the youngsters find a curious, jungle-themed game called Jumanji in the attic. When they start playing, they free Alan Parrish (Robin Williams), who's been stuck in the game's inner world for decades. If they win Jumanji, the kids can free Alan for good -- but that means braving giant bugs, ill-mannered monkeys and even stampeding rhinos! ---

Upgrade your ticket to the FEAST YOUR EYES | BRUNCH EDITION (FYE) experience which includes themed brunch bap and drink

At Feast Your Eyes, cinephiles and foodies will be treated to a movie and food experience in the cinema, a great way to start your Sunday afternoon.

Admit only tickets are $15, but you can upgrade to a Feast Your Eyes tickets for $45. All Feast Your Eyes tickets include a breakfast roll and brunch cocktail or mocktail.

Schedule:

11:20am – Cinema doors open
11:30am – Quick intro
11:35am – Feature begins

*No dietaries catered for

Presented in 4K

description:
Chance Luck & Magic 2024 Release, Be the first to taste Chance, Luck & Magic 2024, the latest iteration of one of our proudest achievements.

On Saturday 18 October, you can come and taste the beer in our Wild Workshop, the place where it was made. Brewers Pete and Dave will be on hand from 2pm to raise the first toast and tell you all a little about how this year’s blend came to be. We’ll also pull a couple of other goodies from the cellar to keep you and CLM company.

And, to top it off, our friends at Nomames Tacos will be here for the edible pairings.

This beer is the ultimate expression of Wild Workshop’s inner-city terroir, and the 2024 bottle is no different; a blend of five years of 100% spontaneously fermented brews, aged in French oak. The result is a complex and truly unique drop that harnesses the natural character of Pōneke.

We love this beer, and we’re so chuffed that other people do too - we’re very honoured that Chance, Luck & Magic, in its various vintages, has garnered global recognition and become one of our most prestigious creations:
Silver medals at both the 2023 and 2024 World Beer Cup (huge!)
Four consecutive gold medals at the New Zealand Beer Awards, as well as two trophies for Champion European Ale, and the Champion Beer title in 2022
Champion International Beer at the 2024 Australian International Beer Awards

The release of each new edition has become a landmark annual event for us, a chance to take a moment and appreciate the beautiful things that come from the wild workings of the environment.

Come and celebrate with us!
label: Food & Drink

description:
WineDogs - Martinborough, We’re back – and it’s going to be better than ever.
Love Wine?
Love Dogs?
Then Winedogs is a must-do on your calendar this spring.

After selling out in 2023 and again in 2024, we’re heading to Luna Estate in Martinborough for our Wairarapa debut on Sunday 26 October 2025 – and we’re bringing the full winedogs experience with us.

Whether you're a past guest or brand new to the pack, this is your chance to join a community of dog lovers, wine drinkers, and people who know how to spend a Sunday in style.

Date: Sunday 26 October 2025
Time: 10am – 5pm
Location: Luna Estate Winery, Martinborough

What to expect:
Sip stroll and socialise with your pup this Spring at Luna Estate Vineyard! Enjoy a walk around Martinborough’s most picturesque vineyard with wine and dog treats along the way, followed by a dog friendly festival!
And the fun doesn’t stop after the walk.

We’ll have:
Fashion parades (yes, for the dogs too)
Prizes for best-dressed dog and best matching human/dog pair
Photo booths
Food trucks, music, wine, and chill zones to kick back for the afternoon
You don’t need to own a dog to come – you just have to love dogs.

Ticket Options:
Early Dog Admission: $50 – SOLD OUT
General Admission: $65
VIP Ticket: $150 – includes exclusive area, VIP menu, Luna Sparkling Wine, premium dog treats and a few surprises

Book now and don’t miss out →
A round of a-paws to our hosts, Luna Estate, for welcoming the winedogs crew to their incredible vineyard. This is one event you’ll want to be part of – whether you’re returning for another round, or joining us for the first time.

See you (and your dog) there.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Chocoholics and connection seekers, � Sweet gals’ day out alert! �
Join your fellow Tribe gals for a delicious morning at the Wellington Chocolate Factory! We’ll:
� Craft three of our very own chocolate bars
� Sip on a dreamy hot chocolate
� Go behind the scenes to see how our fave treat is made
� Sat 23 Aug 2025

description:
Andy Binns: Immersive-event Designer, In this final Creative Mornings event for 2025, our guest speaker will be, Andy Binns. Andy is an immersive-event designer, transforming spaces into unique, powerful, sensory experiences. With some basic equipment, he founded Hype Entertainment (@HypeEntertainmentNZ) in 2010. Operating out of his parents’ garage, growing it into a creative enterprise known for one-of-a-kind installations that capture international attention.
Andy’s journey has been one of continual growth and discovery, professionally and personally. Guided by a strong spiritual side and a firm faith in synchronicity and symbolism, he is driven by simple desires:
• To inspire awe as people walk into a space
• To lift the energy in a room
• To design projects that make a positive impact
Through his creations, Andy reminds us that design can be a form of meditation- that, “true magic happens when art, nature, and spirit meet”.
Come along for this immersive and inspiring talk, meet like minded creatives, enjoy a light breakfast and register your spot today.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Christmas Feast for Two – A Magical Dinner Experience, Christmas Feast for Two – A Magical Dinner Experience

Celebrate the joy of Christmas with an intimate dining experience designed just for two. Le Ciel invites you to indulge in a festive evening filled with warmth, flavour, and sparkle — a beautiful way to share the season’s magic.

Each table for two will be adorned with candlelight, evergreen touches, and a hint of gold. Our specially curated five-course Christmas menu brings together the nostalgia of traditional holiday dishes and the elegance of modern cuisine. Expect luxurious flavours, handcrafted details, and a little surprise treat to take home.

Whether it’s a romantic evening, a celebration with a dear friend, or a thoughtful gift experience, this dinner promises to be one to remember.

Available Dates: December 24th – 28th
Seating Times: 7:00 PM
Pricing: $120 per pair ($60 per person)

Bookings are essential — limited tables available each night.

A festive evening celebrating Kiwi flavours with a refined holiday twist.

description:
Club Tropicana, This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour. Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington. No passport required.

The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair. Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry. Save room for dessert: pineapple upside-down pudding or a coconut rum fondue to bring the tropical fantasy to a sweet finale. Behind the bar, the tiki and kava-spiked cocktails flow freely, from Blue Hawaiian’s to retro rum punches, all dressed to impress with flamingo stirrers, umbrellas and tropical garnishes.

A golden-age soundtrack sets the mood, featuring the smooth calypso of Harry Belafonte, beachy vibes from The Beach Boys, and sun-drenched classics by Astrud Gilberto.

Club Tropicana is a winter getaway, fun and fabulously over the top.
label: Food & Drink

description:
DILLI-24, A North Indian feast crafted by long-time Loretta head chef Chandrika Khullar.
Named after her hometown of Delhi and her home postcode, this special menu is a deeply personal tribute to her upbringing and a childhood immersed in the rich culinary traditions of North India. Chandrika brings the heart and soul of Delhi to Wellington with a generous, share-style multi-course menu featuring bountiful vegetarian plates and an exceptional lamb raan.

Expect an explosion of flavour, with exotic spice blends, saffron, citrus and native berries woven into every dish. In North India, condiment is king, and this feast will be served with a vibrant array of chutneys, pickles and relishes. To complete the experience, Chandrika has also designed a beautifully curated drinks menu to complement the bold and fragrant dishes.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Discover Te Muna - Go behind the scenes, Join us for a unique full day experience immersing yourself in the viticulture, wine making and wines of Te Muna valley. This spectacular valley lies nine kilometres east of Martinborough. Visit the vineyards, meet the producers, go behind the scenes and taste the wines where they are made.

We will pick you up from the Martinborough Square at 9.30 am to start your day at Big Sky Wines. Founders, viticulturists, and winemakers Katherine Jacobs and Jeremy Corban will give you a first look at their 2025 ferments, which have been produced from their organic vineyard. We will then take you to tour Blue Earth Estate vineyard and olive grove and enjoy a long lunch, accompanied by a glass of wine of course. From there we will take you to the stunning winery at Escarpment, and then to explore the beautiful terraced Craggy Range vineyard and taste their wines among the vines, both of which are not normally open to the public. We will finish the day with some of the other Te Muna producers joining us to share their wines and their stories. It will be a day of discovery - the place, the people and the wines of the beautiful Te Muna Valley.

Tickets are strictly limited to 18 people.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Wellington Waterfront Photo Walk with Sony Scene, Join me for a photo walk along Wellington's waterfront.
Keen for an excuse to get your camera out and explore? Join us for a relaxed stroll around the Wellington waterfront on a Saturday morning.
Meet other photographers, see how other's approach a scene, or just enjoy the company while you practice getting to know your camera better.
Our location for this photo walk will take in Wellington's waterfront for an hour, starting at Freyberg Pool at Oriental Bay and heading around to Te Papa and the pier.
Every registered participant who attends the photo walk goes into the Scene Festival draw to win a trip to Rome!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Doughnuts & HOT FOOD at The Animal Medical Centre, Each Wednesday afternoon, Family Kitchen with Mark and The Animal Medical Centre team up to offer you sourdough doughnuts & hot, delicious, affordable meals.
Set up outside the clinic in a black gazebo, from 2:30pm, we sell sourdough doughnuts in six flavours, mini-celebratory doughnuts, plus a hot dish.
We thought it's time again for a curry, so it's a chicken saag with rice and garlic sourdough bread as our hot dish.
Our sourdough doughnuts are priced at $22 for a box of 4 or $6 each. We also offer mini-celebratory doughnuts, a box of all six flavours for $25. The main hot dish is priced at a very reasonable $18 per portion.
EFTPOS is available.
If you want to pre-order, go to our website https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/weekly-menu/
We really appreciate The Animal Medical Centre allowing us to sell outside their new business.
Should you require an excellent veterinary service, contact the team at NEW Animal Medical Centre
https://www.animalmedicalcentre.co.nz/
Family Kitchen with Mark also offers catering. You can visit our website to see our packages if you have a function or require in-house dining. Our doughnuts are also available for purchase Monday to Saturday. Call or message us by 8pm to pick up orders throughout the week.
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/grazing-tables-theme.../
My website has a list of flavours and ingredients for each doughnut. Search weekly menus.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Dragons Is My Uso, Chef Jessica Tang and legendary home chefs Litia Lefaoseu and Iutita Mallon are drawing on the century long fusion of Chinese and Samoan cuisine and the way food expresses love, ai, and alofa. In the late 1800s, small numbers of Chinese settled in Samoa and became part of a growing multicultural community. There they influenced local customs, made an enduring contribution to Samoan cuisine introducing contemporary favourites such as sapasui (chop suey), keke pua‘a (pork buns) and of course laisa (rice). 

Dragons celebrate this cultural and culinary fusion by showcasing these favourites and presenting new dishes highlighting the shared love of culinary staples such as taro and noodles, rice, fish, and pork, the magnificent spectrum of Chinese herbs, spices and flavours. Through cooking and sharing food together the chefs honour their culinary heritage, strengthen our connections to one another and celebrate the big and little moments in life. This is a shared-style meal, served banquet style on lazy Susan turntables. 
Dragons is My Uso was one of the sell-out hits of the 2024 festival - don't miss out!

Discounted tables for 10 available for $1000, so get the whole aiga together!
label: Food & Drink

description: Cognac vs Armagnac, Noble Rot sommelier Maciej Zimny has a undeniable passion for brandy, and he is yearning to share that with you. Maciej will guide you on an educational journey through this fascinating world focusing on the most prestigious French regions for brandy production: Cognac and Armagnac. He’ll provide detailed insight into the appellations, distillation and ageing processes, differences in oak maturation and why one region focuses on vintage expressions while the other ages blends for several years in barrel. But don’t worry, this isn’t a classroom affair—they'll be pouring 8 different spirits paired to a unique three-course menu to showcase Maciej’s knowledge, and he’ll even teach you the sommelier’s techniques for how to taste spirits correctly. Fall in love with brandy, find your favourite and next time you’re ordering a nightcap you can show off your new-found knowledge to your friends.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Grace Petrie, UK protest singer Grace Petrie has become a force on the international folk scene, known for her razor-sharp lyrics, fierce politics and laugh-out-loud wit on stage. Often compared to Billy Bragg, she writes songs that rally, comfort and cut straight to the bone, tackling themes of feminism, queer identity and social justice with passion and bite. 
Since touring New Zealand in 2020 with The Guilty Feminist, Grace has won a loyal following here, drawn to both her firebrand politics and her disarming charm. Her breakout single Black Tie became a queer anthem, streaming over 1.2 million times and drawing praise from MOJO, The Observer and The New Yorker.
Her latest album Build Something Better, produced by Frank Turner, topped the UK folk charts and confirmed what fans already knew: Grace Petrie is one of Britain’s most vital, uncompromising and entertaining songwriters.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
FILIPINO RESTAURANT WEEK, From October 20 to 26, 2025, Filipino cuisine will take center stage in Auckland, Wellington, Christchurch, and Dunedin for the first Filipino Restaurant Week (FRW). This week-long event introduces foodies to the rich and diverse flavors of the Philippines, with Filipino restaurants showcasing traditional and modern dishes that tell stories of heritage and community.
Participating restaurants will offer fixed-price menus featuring Filipino dishes like adobo, kare-kare, and halo-halo, giving diners a chance to experience the rich culinary traditions shaped by centuries of history. These menus highlight the unique fusion of indigenous ingredients and global influences in Filipino cooking.
Filipino Restaurant Week is a celebration of heritage, an invitation to unity, and a singular opportunity to savor Filipino cuisine. It celebrates New Zealand’s diverse cultural tapestry, deepens cross-cultural understanding, and strengthens community through the universal connection of food.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Everybody Eats x Cliftons: Dinner in the Sky, Dinner in the Sky: Celebrating Five Years of Impact
Join us for a spectacular one-night-only celebration as Everybody Eats marks five years of community impact in Wellington — hosted high above the city at Cliftons Wellington.
This special fundraising event brings together the partners, supporters, and champions who have helped transform rescued food into thousands of delicious meals served with dignity. With every plate, you’ve made Aotearoa a more connected, more nourished place — and now it’s time to celebrate the journey we’ve shared and the future we’re building together.
Suspended above Wellington’s breathtaking skyline, guests will indulge in a three-course menu while taking in sweeping views across our beautiful city. We can’t wait to raise a glass with you to five years of impact, the people who made it possible, and the exciting heights still to come.
What’s Included
• A three-course elevated dining experience with breathtaking views above the city
• A selection of wine is included with your meal, optional additional beverages available to purchase from the bar
• Entry to our Wonderful Weekend Experience raffle, with tickets from $20
• Special guests yet to be announced

description:
DJMALLGOTH / Sanctit(t)y_ROMance / BONDST, DJMALLGOTH / Sanctit(t)y_ROMance / BONDST
DJMALLGOTH is a drummer, VJ and music producer from Bristol, UK, creating a sound which both pushes sonic boundaries in production, and revives sounds that have undeservingly left the zeitgeist of modern electronic music. The forefront of the show is live percussion, with all drum breaks played out on a kit in time with heavy, morphing basslines and twisted, chopped vocals.

https://www.youtube.com/@heyyitsbenji

---

Sanctit(t)y_ROMance is a noise/dance project by Sophia Frudd. Harsh Drum Beats over echoing, billowy syncopations of desperate fallen angels, covered in tar. Aching, squealing one-liners to seethe and dwell in.

https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1996462460

---

BONDST makes their first foray into live electronic performance, with members combining their interests of free improvisation as Integument, shared love of techno parties, and hardware fetishist production. Expect morphing feedback loops driven by kick drums across instinct-led structures.

https://www.instagram.com/bondst.nz/

$15 presales via UTR
$20 on door

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

description:
Feed Your Senses, Step into an immersive experience where nature’s core elements — stone, clay, wood, water, fire, and air — are brought to life through a dynamic fusion of artistic mediums. Explore interactive installations and captivating performances that engage all of your senses with visual art, sculpture, sound, and more. Throughout the evening, enjoy six unique canapés and six meticulously crafted drinks, each inspired by the work of a different artist. Each exhibit reflects the raw power and beauty of the natural world, as local artists push boundaries to bring these elements to life in real-time.

As you journey through Foxglove’s Secret Wardrobe, you'll be surrounded by live artistry unfolding around you, creating an environment filled with raw creativity and vibrant energy. Aphrodisiac-inspired canapés and expertly paired beverages complement the visual experience, bringing each artist’s medium to life while celebrating Wellington’s rich and diverse creative community.

This culinary and sensory pairing will transport you deeper into the world of artistry, blending food and creativity in unexpected and delightful ways.

This event goes beyond simple exhibition — it’s a celebration of Wellington's local talent where the boundaries between food, art, and sensory experience are beautifully blurred. Whether you’re an art aficionado or a culinary enthusiast, this immersive experience promises to engage your senses in an unforgettable way.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Festive High Tea, Join us for an afternoon of festive elegance and indulge in the spirit of the holidays with a selection of holiday-inspired treats, perfectly paired with bottomless T.W.G. Tea.
Available Fridays, Saturdays & Sundays | 14th November - 21st December
$65 per person
MENU
Santa's Turkey & cranberry finger sandwich

Chocolate and berry delice

A children's menu is available for under 12's and is priced at $25 per child.
Please note that our Festive High Tea menu cannot be adapted to accommodate dietary or allergy restrictions.
Our Classic High Tea menu can be adapted to vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free diets. Please select the appropriate menu for each guest when making your booking.
Terms & Conditions
Our Festive High Tea cannot be modified for dietary requirements. However, our Classic High Tea is available in a Vegetarian, Vegan and Gluten Free version.
Please note, we are unable to accommodate dietary requirements without prior notice.
If not already stated and confirmed at the time of reservation, guest numbers must be confirmed 48 hours prior to arrival.
A credit card must be provided at the time of reservation to secure the booking.
High Tea reservations cancelled within 24 hours prior to arrival will incur a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.
No-shows will be charged a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.
Decreases in attendee numbers will not be accepted within 24 hours before arrival, and charges will apply based on the confirmed final count.

description:
COMEDY NIGHT Fundraiser for Paekakariki Playcentre (R18), COMEDY NIGHT Fundraiser for Paekakariki Playcentre (R18)
Paekakariki Playcentre are holding a comedy night on Friday 14 November, with some of Wellington’s top comedians, as a fundraiser for a whanau trip to Kapiti Island, early in the New Year.

$30 / 2 for $60!!
Seriously good value for four great performers.

Book via Humanitix (BOOKINGS OPENING SOON)
Doors 6.45pm - Show 7.30pm
Cash bar, Nibbles available


Rhian Wood-Hill (MC) is an award-winning comedian whose storytelling has led him to 2 successful new Zealand tours and cruise ship performances.


Sera Devcich
Sera is known for her quick wit and no-holds-barred honesty. Winner of Best Comedian at the Welly Awards, she’s made her mark on shows like 7 Days, The Project, and the NZ Comedy Gala, as well as lighting up stages at top venues and festivals across the country. Sera’s comedy is fearless, clever, and always relatable, with stories drawn from real life that audiences can’t get enough of. Her energy and authenticity have earned her a cult following and a reputation as one of the most exciting voices in Kiwi comedy.

“There is something undeniably grounded about the way Devcich spins her tales... She is so honest about her moral inconsistencies that she gives us permission to accept our own messes…”
THEATREVIEW


Fergus Aitken
Well known as ‘NZ’s Loudest Mime’ Mr Fungus, Fergus’s stand-up work has seen him headline and host numerous comedy clubs and corporate functions throughout Aotearoa. He’s also a Playcentre Dad again, he’s just that fertile.

“Manic physicality… knicker wettingly funny… Fergus Aitken is right up there with the BEST” THEATREVIEW


Li'i Alaimoana (Headline act)
Award-winning and 2017 Billy T Award Nominated stand-up comedian Li'i Alaimoana hails from the capital city. The New Zealand-born Samoan's performances abroad include a stint in Canada, and a tour of Australia. His musical comedy seduces while throwing comedic punchlines making him a favourite throughout New Zealand.

description:
Foraged Flavours : From Wild Greens to Plate, Foraged Flavours : From Wild Greens to Plate
~ Foraged Flavours: From Wild Greens to Plate ~

Step into a full-day, hands-on workshop at Mangaroa Farms, just 40 minutes from Wellington with Expert Forager Felicity Joy from Wild Botanica.

You’ll explore seasonal edible wild greens, learning to identify them, discover their properties, and turn your foraged finds into simple, delicious creations. In the farm’s fully equipped kitchen, you’ll make a range of hands-on preparations: fresh wild green spreads, infused butters, vibrant salads, and pickled or preserved treats, all designed to showcase the flavours of the season.

During the day, we’ll enjoy a shared wild feast together, tasting the seasonal dishes you’ve prepared in a relaxed, beautiful farm setting. This workshop is interactive, practical, and sensory, a chance to deepen your foraging skills, connect with nature, and celebrate the flavours of the wild. All ingredients, tools, and guidance are provided, so you can fully immerse yourself in the experience.

Perfect for those who’ve already attended Wild Botanica’s Foraging Workshops, this is the next step: taking your wild plant knowledge into the kitchen. Also suitable for total beginners, no experience needed.

When: Saturday 18th October
Time: 10 am – 3 pm (5-hour immersive experience)
Location: Mangaroa Farms, 40 minutes from Wellington

What’s included:
~ Full-day, hands-on experience: foraging, plant ID, cooking, and tasting
~ Access to a fully equipped kitchen and all tools
~ Guidance from an expert forager and cook
~ A shared wild feast using seasonal foraged ingredients prepared during the workshop
~ Educational insights into the nutritional, medicinal, and culinary properties of wild greens
~ Beautiful farm setting for a relaxed, sensory experience

Don't delay, call your friends and book your tickets now to avoid missing out:

https://www.wildbotanica.co.nz/collections/foraging-workshops/products/foragedflavours

p.s. book your tickets by 20 September to receive $20 off each ticket. Just use the code EARLYBIRD at checkout.

description:
Garage Project x Glou Glou - Milk Bar!, Garage Project & Glou Glou present - Milk Bar!
Showcasing beer’s sweeter side, letting the malt shine. description:
High Tea at Le Cordon Bleu | 29 NOVEMBER 2025, High Tea at Le Cordon Bleu | 29 NOVEMBER 2025
Experience an exquisite selection of the finest French Pâtisserie prepared by our highly creative & talented Diplôme de Pâtisserie students.

About this Event

Experience an exquisite selection of the finest French Pâtisserie prepared by our highly creative and talented Le Cordon Bleu New Zealand Diplôme de Pâtisserie students. Tickets are allocated for specific days and seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time-slot you have booked for.
Kiwiana Edition: This High Tea is a speciality menu inspired by classic kiwi treats, enjoy a collection of old favourites with a Le Cordon Bleu spin.

Ticket Information:
IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables are arranged per order. If you purchase tickets separately you need to e-mail to advise which other ticket holders you wish to be seated with.
Date: Friday 29th November. (other sessions are also available, to purchase tickets for these events please click here and select your chosen date. Tickets are non-transferable, please ensure you purchase tickets for the correct date.)
Price: $45 per person includes High Tea and complimentary Tea and Coffee.
Booking Times: 11.30am | 12:00pm | 2:30pm | 3:00pm
Tickets are allocated for specific days and seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time you have booked for.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu High Tea experience is one hour. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' collection of French Pâtisserie.
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations, or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.



What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Pâtisserie programme. In the dining room we have our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students serving you and putting their theory skills into practice.
Brasserie & High Tea Refund Policy
• No refunds are provided unless the event is cancelled by Le Cordon Bleu NZ.
• Customers can arrange for someone else to take their place.
