description:
Habit Mastery Series: Goal Setting for the New Year, Habit Mastery Series: Goal Setting for the New Year
Prepare for the new year with this interactive goal-setting workshop designed to help you clarify aspirations build a success-driven mindset

About this Event



Habit Mastery Series: Goal Setting for the New Year

The new year is fast approaching! Discover how to unlock your potential with this interactive goal-setting workshop so you can smash those new year’s resolutions. Learn how to clarify aspirations, set goals, and develop a success-driven mindset. Gain practical tools to turn dreams into actionable plans through hands-on exercises and expert insights.
This workshop is ideal for professionals, entrepreneurs, students, and anyone seeking clarity and direction in their personal or professional life.
Key Takeaways:
The psychology of goal setting
Creating goals
Overcoming obstacles and staying motivated
Tracking progress and adjusting strategies
Harnessing visualization and mindset for success
Join us for:
Discussions & Exercises: Interactive learning and goal-setting activities
Expert Insights: Best practices from experienced facilitators
Networking: Connect with like-minded individuals





The session will be followed by a delicious plant-based dinner together, all included in your ticket!






Meet Your Host: Nava
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!

Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

Habit Mastery Series: Goal setting for the New Year
Host: Nava

Plant-based dinner and dessert

description:
Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall, $20 -tickets via link: https://events.humanitix.com/gong-bath-at.../tickets
*Limited door sales for $25*
*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket - or whatever it is you need to feel most warm and comfortable *
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.

During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.

Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.

Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.

Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground.

**THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 40 PEOPLE ONLY**

Disclaimer
Gong baths are safe and supportive for most people. However, please consult your doctor or mental health professional before attending if you:
-have a pacemaker or other implanted medical device
-live with epilepsy or a sound-sensitive condition
-are in the first trimester of pregnancy
-are experiencing severe or unmanaged mental health challenges (such as psychosis, schizophrenia, or PTSD)
If you have recent injuries, surgeries, or other health concerns, let me know so we can make sure you’re comfortable.
Everyone responds differently to sound. If at any point during the session you feel overwhelmed or uncomfortable, you are welcome to sit up, move gently, or step outside. Your wellbeing always comes first.

description:
Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time, Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
You don’t need more hours in the day — you just need to stop spending them on the wrong things.
You’re busy. I get it. There’s just no time for the things that you really want to do, right?
"Buy Back Your Time" is a 1-hour interactive workshop for anyone who wants to reclaim their time, energy, and focus — without burnout or hustle culture.
In this session, you'll learn:
Why time management is really attention management
How to shift from reacting to designing your days
Practical tools to create space for what actually matters
How to identify & eliminate your biggest time-wasters
You’ll walk away with a simple plan to buy back your time — and start investing it in your goals, your growth, and your life.
Meet your host, Nava
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. description:
Gut Health - With Nutritionist Lucy Edwards, Gut Health - With Nutritionist Lucy Edwards
Do you suffer from bloating, constipation, stomach cramps, weight gain, stubborn fat, or a low mood? Or do you just want you and your family to be healthier?

Did you know your gut influences every aspect of you health and wellbeing?

In this fun, relaxing, educational and interactive workshop, you will learn from one of New Zealand's leading Nutritionists Lucy Edwards. Lucy will guide you through some easy and effective tips that you can use to improve your health today. You will also be provided organic herbal teas to sip on chosen especially for gut health.

More about your host Nutritionist Lucy Edwards
A qualified Nutritionist, Natural Therapist and health and wellness expert with more than 20 years experience. She is also an author of 'The Grumbles' a children's book about having a positive mindset.

Lucy is also available to provide workshops and wellness retreats both in person and online, on a range of health-related topics. She will tailor these to suit the participants and the topics they are most interested in or concerned about, such as popular diet and exercise trends and the research around these, or information regarding Health and Nutrition in general. Some of her high end clients include Shortland Street Actors, International Comedians, Olympic Athletes and NZ Army Fitness Instructors.

description:
Healing Trauma and the Nervous System- Ancient wisdom for modern resilience, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Healing Trauma and the Nervous System- Ancient wisdom for modern resilience
Stress and struggle leave their mark on both body and mind, sometimes in ways we can’t easily undo. Just as knots form in the body, impressions and tensions accumulate in the mind. While we can’t change the past, the Bhagavad-gita teaches that we can shape our future—what we choose to cultivate now carries us forward.
In this one-hour workshop, we’ll explore how philosophical and spiritual wisdom can help us rise above the tangles of trauma and anxiety. Through practical insights, open discussion, and guidance from the Gita’s philosophy, we’ll look at how to build resilience—not only by steadying the nervous system, but by exploring the deeper self beyond the changing body and mind.
Meet your host, Sivananda
Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.
6.15pm Tuesday 28th of October
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

Healthy Hospo The Stress Reset: Breathwork and Breakfast. Wellington, The Stress Reset: Breathework and Breakfast for Hospo
November is one of the busiest times of year in hospitality.
And while you’re looking after everyone else, we want to make sure someone is looking after you!
Join us for a morning, hosted at Awhi Studio, to give you a chance to de-stress and set yourself up before the peak season.
What to expect:
10.00am: A chilled out yoga session with Julie Sayasane, local Wellinton hospo legend and yoga teacher.
10.45am: A workshop and breathwork session with resident Healthy Hospo Presenter Josh Fankhauser where you’ll learn more about stress and experience the physiological effects of working with the breathe.
11.30am: Relax, and connect with other hospo over Havana Coffee and The Oatery Breakfast Bowls.
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $40 per person is fully sponsored.
Yoga Mats are provided but please bring a notebook and pen.
Spaces are limited to 30, and as these are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!

description:
HineHau Breathwork for Women: Workshop, Join Shannon Rose for this unique three-hour workshop—breathwork for wāhine.
Through story, breath, and reflection, you’ll learn and experience the power of your breath as a wāhine: to cleanse, to create, and to consciously live in alignment with who you are. Open to wāhine of all cultures who are ready to experience the healing power of Te Hā — the sacred breath.
In this workshop, you’ll be safely guided on a journey of remembrance, reconnection, and reclamation. Expect to come away feeling grounded, rejuvenated, and more at home in your body.
What’s Included:
*Karakia to open and close our space
*Purākau — Māori creation stories on the whakapapa of the breath
*Kōrero — how intentional breathing helps to align your mauri, wairua and mana
*Working with the nervous system to support manifestation and creativity
*BreathWav™ Journey — a 70-minute circular connected breath practice for release, alignment, and deep connection
*Journaling & Reflection to integrate what arises
Please bring:
Water, a journal and an eye mask
HineHau Breathwork for Women
With Shannon Rose
Saturday 25th October 2026, 11.45am-2.45pm | Awhi Yoga
Price: $65
Nau mai, haere mai!
About Shannon Rose:
Ngāti Porou ki Harataunga, Ngāti Whakaue, Ngāti Whakahemo, Tūhourangi, Scotland, Croatia, England. Shannon Rose has been immersed in the practice of breath since 2017 and is recognised as one of the pioneers of breathwork in Aotearoa. She is the founder of HineHau, a breathwork training kaupapa supporting wāhine to step into leadership and facilitation through the breath. HineHau teaches breathwork through a Te Ao Māori lens to wahine, offering 200-hour practitioner certifications.
Since beginning her practice in 2017, Shannon has been part of the early wave of facilitators bringing the transformative power of breathwork to Aotearoa. Her approach is both deeply spiritual and deeply human, making the breath accessible as a tool for healing, alignment, and reconnection.
Through HineHau (formerly Elevare), Shannon has trained over 50 practitioners in the BreathWav™ modality, a practice that works with the full spectrum of the breath to release, restore, and reawaken. At the heart of her work is a commitment to weaving whakapapa, story, and ceremony into modern practice, creating spaces where wāhine can return to themselves with clarity and confidence.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Humans: Why & What To Do, Humans: Why & What To Do
An evening of inspiration & indulgence! Talk by Devamrita Swami followed by a plant-powered dinner & dessert.

We’re the most connected generation in history — and somehow the loneliest. We’ve built more technology than any civilisation before us — and still can’t solve our basic problems. We talk endlessly about progress — while the planet burns and mental health plummets.

What if the trouble isn’t just what we’re doing… but that we’ve forgotten why we’re doing it?

In this bold talk, Devamrita Swami — a world-traveling monk, strategist, and social critic — unpacks the mess we’re in and asks the questions most of us avoid: Why are we here? And what should we actually be doing about it?

Afterwards, stick around for a plant-based dinner and dessert — fresh, colourful, and made to share. Grab a plate, grab a seat, and dive into real conversations with people who are curious, open-minded, and up for something different.

Meet Devamrita Swami, your host
Devamrita Swami is an educator, author, and monk who has spent over forty years exploring and sharing the wisdom of bhakti-yoga. He brings ancient Vedic teachings to life, effortlessly navigating the latest research in archaeology, consciousness, ancient history, neuroscience, social science, and psychology. Author of Searching for Vedic India and Hiding in Unnatural Happiness, he combines philosophy with practical insights on happiness, wellbeing, and personal fulfillment. For anyone seeking to channel the human drive for fulfilment in a meaningful and sustainable way, Devamrita Swami offers clear, engaging, and indispensable wisdom.

Tired, craving, & overspending? You are not alone.

Join renowned nutritionist and wellness expert Lucy Edwards, along with special guest multi-award-winning mortgage adviser and financial educator Zebunisso Alimova.

Together the will guide you through this practical, eye-opening, and fun session.

They'll unpack the real reasons behind energy crashes, mood swings, and impulse spending—especially during high-stress times like buying a home, navigating a separation, or managing the chaos of family and work life.

We’ll cover:

-How your hormones (and blood sugar) affect your spending habits
-The link between stress, emotional eating, and financial decision-making
-Food swaps and simple nutrition hacks for better energy and mood stability
-Financial mindset tips to reduce panic spending and increase financial control
-Q&A time with both a Nutritionist and a Mortgage Adviser

This is not just another boring money talk... or another nutrition lecture. It’s real-life, relatable, and designed for women who are juggling a lot – and want practical tools to feel better, spend smarter, and thrive.

Who This Is For:
-First home buyers
-Busy mums
-Women navigating life changes (separation, career shifts, etc.)
-Anyone feeling financially or physically drained right now

Spots are limited – reserve yours today and take the first step toward balancing your hormones, hunger, and homeownership dreams!

description:
Improving the Behaviour and Engagement of Boys Conference, Be part of a groundbreaking national conference, hosted by the Australian-based Positive Masculinity Foundation in collaboration with the Wellington College Research Centre.
Across Aotearoa and the world, many boys are feeling disengaged and excluded from the classroom. This event brings together educators, coaches, counsellors, and mentors for a day of meaningful conversations, keynote presentations, and practical breakout sessions focused on improving boys’ engagement, behaviour, and social connectedness.
Why attend?
Learn practical strategies to connect with boys and young men
Gain insights on classroom engagement, behaviour management, and building respect
Discover how to harness student culture and involve parents/whānau
Hear from world-class experts in education, leadership, and boys’ development
Speakers include:
Dr Ray Swann — Executive Director, Positive Masculinity Foundation
Dr Mark Dowley — Author, The Classroom Management Handbook
Kristen Molloy — Associate Head, The Crowther Centre
Ingrid Howren — Leadership Coach & +M Curriculum Specialist
Dr Aaron Columbus — Deputy Principal Teaching & Learning, Wellington College
Special Keynote: Professor Matt Englar-Carlson — Co-Director, Center for Men and Boys, California State University, leading expert on positive masculinity and mental health
Details:
Ticket includes morning tea & lunch
Accommodation advice available for out-of-town attendees (contact Dr Aaron Columbus at Wellington College)
This is a rare opportunity to learn from international leaders and collaborate with peers passionate about helping boys thrive.

Join renowned nutritionist and wellness expert Lucy Edwards, along with special guest multi-award-winning mortgage adviser and financial educator Zebunisso Alimova.

Together the will guide you through this practical, eye-opening, and fun session.

They'll unpack the real reasons behind energy crashes, mood swings, and impulse spending—especially during high-stress times like buying a home, navigating a separation, or managing the chaos of family and work life.

We’ll cover:

-How your hormones (and blood sugar) affect your spending habits
-The link between stress, emotional eating, and financial decision-making
-Food swaps and simple nutrition hacks for better energy and mood stability
-Financial mindset tips to reduce panic spending and increase financial control
-Q&A time with both a Nutritionist and a Mortgage Adviser

This is not just another boring money talk... or another nutrition lecture. It’s real-life, relatable, and designed for women who are juggling a lot – and want practical tools to feel better, spend smarter, and thrive.

Who This Is For:
-First home buyers
-Busy mums
-Women navigating life changes (separation, career shifts, etc.)
-Anyone feeling financially or physically drained right now

Spots are limited – reserve yours today and take the first step toward balancing your hormones, hunger, and homeownership dreams!

description:
Introduction to Acceptance and Commitment Therapy Workshop - November 2025, Introduction to Acceptance and Commitment Therapy Workshop - November 2025
A 2-day introductory, experiential ACT workshop for clinicians.

About this Event

Growing research about ACT demonstrates its efficacy for a wide range of diagnoses and life problems. It helps people accept their internal experiences while moving towards the life they value.
At this experiential workshop you will establish a foundational understanding of Psychological Flexibility, develop skills for using ACT and learn about Relational Frame Theory (RFT).
Over the two days you will learn how to:
help clients hold their painful thoughts and emotions gently; identify and actively move towards their values; and develop awareness of the present moment and their capacity to observe it.
develop a therapeutic relationship in which support can be provided compassionately and flexibly.
formulate life struggles from an ACT perspective.
practice ACT exercises and relate the concepts back to your own life and clinical experiences.
meet clients where they are and foster their willingness to change.
This workshop is fully catered with vegetarian food.
Giselle Bahr and Ben Sedley are clinical psychologists and co-founders of ACT Wellington. They have been using ACT for over 15 years, and have been trained and supervised by many leading ACT therapists and researchers. Giselle and Ben have both worked at Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services, in Private Practice with adults and adolescents, and in the clinical psychology programme at Victoria University. Giselle has developed and facilitated ACT groups for parents and adults, and served on the Board of ANZ ACBS. Ben is the author of Stuff That Sucks: Accepting what you can’t change and committing to what you can, the co-author of Stuff That's Loud: A teen's guide to unspiralling when OCD gets noisy (with Lisa Coyne) and is an ACBS Peer Reviewed ACT Trainer.


QUESTIONS AND MORE INFORMATION
How can I contact the organiser with any questions?
Please get in touch if you have any questions about this training. You can email us at:

Can I have a GST Receipt?
If your employer requires a GST receipt from you, please email us and we will send you one.

What's the refund policy?
A refund is available until 30 days before the workshop. This includes all costs except for the eventbrite nonrefundable fee.
A 50% refund is available until 14 days before the workshop.
From 14 days before the workshop, your ticket is non-refundable but fully transferrable. To transfer your ticket to another attendee contact us with the new details.
Full refunds will be made if the event cannot proceed due to Covid19 restrictions, or attendees are unable to travel to the event due to Covid19 restrictions.

description:
Inner infrastructure for Outer Resilience, In times of polycrisis and uncertainty, more people are coming around to the need not for more information, but for integration and presence.
This 90-minute session offers a safe, grounded space to slow down, reconnect with ourselves, and explore the inner terrain of change-making, and of our relational space.
As Rumi reminds us: “Yesterday I was clever and tried to change the world; today I am wise and am changing myself.”
Building our inner infrastructure - our relationship with self, with our feelings, with others and with nature - is foundational to how we show up in the world.
We will begin by discussing research into how distraction or numbing our discomfort is an intelligent and common short-term survival strategy, but in fact is one which limits our long-term capacity to connect, lead and evolve. We will then guide participants in somatic practices to offer accessible ways to reconnect with your agency.
During this session, you will gain tools to increase your inner awareness, expand your bandwidth of awareness, and integrate emotion, sensation, and story. Together we’ll explore the role of perception in our orientation to life and the choices we make, how our narratives can connect us with our agency, the power of curiosity, and dive into how our relational presence can often have more impact than our opinions.
This session is an invitation to restore connection, calm, and courage, to become more whole, more fully human, and more ready for what this moment is asking of us.
About your host
Freda is a curator, engagement practitioner, and connector, who works at the intersection of social change, community-building, and inner development. She is the Founder of the Goodlife Collective, which curates spaces that build connection, wellbeing and collective wisdom.
Drawing on yoga teaching, somatic practices and adult development, Freda is interested in how we build our inner infrastructure - the capacity to work through discomfort, reconnect with our agency, and bring greater presence to relationships. Her background is in psychology, environmental-science and design, and she loves nerding out on ideas and conversations about unlocking our collective potential.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Ask an Astrobiologist, Are we alone in the Universe?  Ask a NASA astrobiologist! 
Event Overview
In 2025, we mark a decade of astrobiology in Aotearoa New Zealand—a field of science that asks the biggest questions of all:
How did life begin?
Are we alone in the Universe?
What is our future beyond Earth?
We also mark 150 years of US-NZ scientific partnership. What better way to honour these two milestones than with a public talk by three eminent NASA astrobiologists and science communicators!
Join Dr Sanjoy Som, Dr Graham Lau, and Sarah Marcotte as they tell us about exciting current developments in astrobiology, plus get a chance to ask YOUR burning questions about life, aliens and the Solar System. 
Guest Speakers
🔹 Dr Graham Lau – “The Cosmobiologist”
Dr. Graham Lau, “the Cosmobiologist,” is an astrobiologist, science communicator, and host of NASA’s Ask an Astrobiologist. As Director of Communications at Blue Marble Space, he blends research, outreach, and education, inspiring global audiences. His Arctic geomicrobiology work informs life-detection strategies for Mars, Europa, and beyond.  
🔹 Dr Sanjoy Som
Dr. Sanjoy Som, planetary scientist and founder of the Blue Marble Science Institute of Science, studies planetary environments from early Earth to Mars. His work combines geochemistry, field expeditions, and science communication, fostering global partnerships in astrobiology while inspiring public engagement with the science of planetary habitability.  
🔹 Sarah Marcotte
Sarah Marcotte is NASA STEM Engagement Network lead at JPL, managing the Solar System Ambassadors Program. A specialist in Mars and planetary mission outreach, she makes complex space science engaging for public audiences through events, media, and educational programs.  
Proudly Presented By
New Zealand Astrobiology Network (NZAN)
Victoria University of Wellington
SpacewardBound New Zealand
With generous support from the US Embassy in New Zealand
🎟️ Reserve your seat now and be part of the conversation about life in the Universe!

Mangatainoka Motors Hot Rod Car Day, Mangatainoka Motors Hot Rod Car Day
Attention all petrolheads! Buckle up for a rip-roaring day at our Car Days, where you can flaunt your sweet ride to fellow enthusiasts and the public alike. Plus, you'll have the chance to compete for some epic prizes that are sure to rev your engine!

Get ready to soak up the atmosphere with live music, delicious grub, and a refreshing ale. Swing by the Histui Museum for a bit of nostalgia, or hit up the Tui Shop for some merch to show off your Tui pride. Or, if you’re feeling laid-back, just kick back, relax, and let the crowd admire your ride while you swap stories with mates and family.

PRIZE CATEGORIES:

We’ve got a treasure trove of fantastic prizes up for grabs! From Most Original to the ever-coveted Star of the Show, there’s something for everyone!

- Most Original – For the ride that makes jaws drop!

- Local Star – Must be from Wairarapa or Tararua (home turf pride, baby!)

- Furthest Travelled – For those brave enough to put some serious miles on the clock!

- People’s Choice – Because the crowd knows best!

- Star of the Show – Walk away with a whopping $500 Tui voucher! (You know you want it!)

KEY TIMINGS FOR THE DAY:

- 09:00 AM - Gates open for cars (let the engines roar!)

- 10:00 AM - Gates open for the public (let the ogling commence!)

- 10:45 AM - All competing cars to be parked (no late arrivals, please!)

- 11:00 AM - Registrations close (don’t miss out!)

- 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Judging takes place (bring your A-game!)

- 12:30 PM - Prize giving (who will take home the glory?)

- 4:00 PM - Tui Brewery closes (but we do it all again the following month!)

PRE-REGISTER YOUR VEHICLE:

Why wait? Pre-register your vehicle or bike now for just $10 online. Just jump onto the website and on the day you can just park up, and flash your email confirmation on your dashboard. Easy peasy! Just head to https://www.tuihq.co.nz/mangatainoka-motors/

And if you forget to pre-register? No sweat! You can still sign up on the day.

All proceeds from registrations go towards the Mangatainoka Motors Reserve Restoration Project. It’s a win-win!

So, gather your crew, polish that ride, and join us for a day of laughter, camaraderie, and, of course, some seriously sweet wheels. We can’t wait to see you there!

description:
Katie Knowles PAM, Title:
Self-Disclosure of Sexual Dysfunction to Romantic Partners.

Abstract:
Sexual dysfunctions (e.g., distress about levels of desire, arousal, orgasm, or sexual pain) are linked with poorer individual and relational wellbeing. Disclosing these dysfunctions to a romantic partner helps to mitigate these effects, however, such disclosures also risk rejection or relationship conflict. Existing models of disclosure do not adequately capture the complexities of disclosing sexual dysfunction, such as how costs and benefits are weighed simultaneously, the role of contextual factors, or how partner responses shape future disclosures. Three studies test a model of people’s disclosure of sexual dysfunction. Study 1 reports a thematic analysis of people’s social scripts about disclosing sexual dysfunction. Subsequent studies will test the influence of positive and negative partner responses and develop a scale to measure the anticipated costs and benefits of disclosing dysfunctions. Altogether, these studies build a framework explaining how and when people will disclose sexual dysfunction to romantic partners.
Primary supervisor: Dr Matt Hammond
Second supervisor: Dr Ally Gibson
Staff and postgraduate students are cordially invited to attend. There will be an opportunity at the end of the presentation for audience to observe the panel questioning the candidate about the presentation and proposed research, and for audience members themselves to ask questions of the candidate.

description:
Master Your Mornings: A Routine That Works, Master Your Mornings: a Routine That Works
Take charge of your mornings and set yourself up for a productive, goal-driven day. A well-designed morning routine can give you focus, fuel your ambition, and create momentum that carries through everything you do. In this workshop, you’ll learn how to build a routine that fits your life and drives your success.

Dive into the science behind effective morning habits, pick up practical strategies for building routines that stick, and explore proven techniques to stay motivated and on track. Whether your goal is to enhance productivity, improve wellbeing, or cultivate mindfulness, this workshop gives you the tools to turn your mornings into a launchpad for long-term achievements.

What you’ll gain:

Understand the psychology behind morning habits and why they matter

Discover how to design a morning routine tailored to your personal and professional aspirations

Learn time-tested strategies for consistency and maintaining motivation

Build a morning routine that sets you up for success, every single day

Leave this workshop with a clear, actionable morning routine that empowers you to take control of your day, and more importantly, your future.

Start each day with intention, clarity, and the momentum to reach your goals

Meet Nava, your host

Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After eight exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!

In this engaging evening with Chaitanya Charan, a monk and internationally acclaimed speaker, you’ll discover practical tools to quiet mental noise, sharpen focus, and make clear, confident choices. Drawing on timeless wisdom and modern psychology, he’ll share insights to help you understand your thought patterns, break free from unhelpful mental loops, and channel your mind’s energy in a positive direction.
Set in our welcoming and creative space, this event blends inspiration with connection. After the talk, enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert — a perfect chance to unwind, reflect, and connect with like-minded people over great food.
Check out the menu!

Spaghetti with Roasted capsicum & Sun-dried tomatoes
Stuffed Focaccia Bread
Fresh Pear Salad
Lemon Poppyseed Cake
Meet Chaitanya Charan, your host
With warmth, insight, and humour, Chaitanya Charan has a way of opening minds and perspectives. A monk for over 25 years, he has dedicated his life to exploring how we think, decide, and live — and how to do it with more clarity and purpose. He has spoken in more than 30 countries, from Ivy League universities to grassroots gatherings, engaging audiences with his clear thinking, relatable stories, and practical strategies. An accomplished author and speaker, Chaitanya Charan offers insights that challenge perspectives, spark reflection, and inspire real change.

description:
Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection, Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection
The Men’s Circle is a free, supportive gathering for men to connect, share openly, and grow together. Whether you're navigating life changes, seeking community, or simply wanting a space to be heard, you're welcome here.
Expect honest conversations and the kind of connection that’s rare but necessary. No pressure to speak—just your presence is enough. We follow a respectful, non-judgmental format that prioritizes safety, confidentiality, and authenticity.
Optional Plant-Based Dinner
Stay afterwards for a nourishing, plant-based dinner and dessert ($15). Sharing a meal is a powerful way to extend the connection beyond the circle. This gathering is not run for profit—Andre is simply passionate about creating spaces for genuine connection.
What to Expect in the Circle:
Gathering in Circle: We sit in a circle to foster a sense of unity and equality.
Centering In: A short meditation or silence helps us arrive and ground.
Talking Object: A shared object moves around—only the person holding it speaks.
Optional Sharing: Speak if you feel moved. You’re always welcome to pass.
Active Listening: No interruptions, advice, or feedback—just presence.
Confidentiality: What's shared in the circle, stays in the circle.
Our Shared Agreements:
Speak from the “I”: Share from your own experience, not on behalf of others.
No fixing or judging: This is not a space to solve, but to witness.
Be present: Share what’s alive for you right now.
Respect and trust: We uphold a culture of care, confidentiality, and non-judgment.
Meet Andre, your host
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. Over the years, Andre has come to value the power of sitting in circle—of men coming together in honesty, vulnerability, and presence to witness and support one another. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.

Booking for Thursday is recommended!

https://bit.ly/eventTickets

Expect honest conversations and the kind of connection that’s rare but necessary. No pressure to speak—just your presence is enough. We follow a respectful, non-judgmental format that prioritizes safety, confidentiality, and authenticity.

description:
Men's Group Tuesday 4 Nov, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

Join the event waitlist if meetings are full - a space often comes up!

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

description:
Monthly Reiki Circle – Wellington | Energy Detox & Cleansing, September Theme: Energy Detox & Cleansing
Join us for a monthly gathering of healing, alignment, and community.
This circle is designed to help you release stagnant energy, restore balance, and connect deeply with yourself and others through Reiki-infused practices and guided meditation.
What you will experience:• Reiki healing to clear energetic congestion• Guided meditation for detox and renewal• Crystal grid activation to amplify cleansing energy• Oracle card pull for guidance• Closing integration with Blue Lotus Tea, Seasonal Fruit, and Shared Kai
This is a safe and supportive space for both beginners and experienced Reiki practitioners. Come as you are – leave feeling lighter, clearer, and more aligned.
What to Bring
A yoga mat or something comfortable to sit/lie on
A cushion or blanket for extra comfort
A water bottle to stay hydrated
A journal and pen if you’d like to reflect after the circle
An open heart and intention for what you wish to release or receive
Optional: crystals, talismans, or personal items you’d like to charge in the Reiki circle or place near the crystal grid.
Details:When: Every first Thursday of the month, 6:00 PMWhere: Te Aro Ashtanga, Left Bank, Cuba Street, WellingtonEnergy Exchange: $35
Spots are limited – reserve your place today.
Walk away with:
A lighter body and mind, free from stagnant energy
A calmer nervous system and deeper inner stillness
Insights from guided meditation and oracle reflection
Nourishment through Blue Lotus Tea, seasonal fruit, and shared kai
A sense of belonging within a like-minded community
Renewed clarity, alignment, and energy to carry forward

description:
Neural Calm Reset: Tapping for Your Nervous System, If moments of calm slip away as the day goes on, this workshop is designed to change that.

You’ll discover how to take control of your nervous system and cultivate a calm state that feels natural — all through a clear, 3-step framework.

This is not mindfulness. But a practice drawing on principles of memory biology and cognitive reconsolidation to help you interrupt stress signals at their source - the meaning level, where your nervous system responds to life’s challenges.

Calm becomes repeatable, a reliable part of everyday life.

You’ll walk away with a simple, 15-minute daily sequence built around three key steps:

* Tapping to deactivate the stress signal — a gentle, evidence-based technique to reset your nervous system.

* Bright-Side Rewrite Journal — shift your perspective and build empowering mental patterns.

* Inner Dialogue Reframe — transform the way you talk to yourself, supporting lasting calm and clarity.

Plus - your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert

Meet Krishnaloka, your host

Krishnaloka is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and psychology. As a mind technician trained in autaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

description:
Men’s Circle: Real Conversations, Men’s Circle: Real Conversations
In a world where men are often expected to have everything figured out, this gathering offers a space to be genuine, not perfect.

About this Event

Men’s Circle: Real Conversations
In a society where men are expected to always have it together, this space is for being honest, not perfect.
This is a free offering but there’s the option to stay for an amazing plant-based dinner ($15). There’s no pressure to join, but sitting down to eat together is a simple, powerful way to deepen the sense of connection. Andre & Sri Jiva aren’t running this circle for profit and they are genuinely invested in creating real, meaningful spaces for men to connect.
The Men’s Circle is a gathering where men are able to connect in a safe, supportive space to share experiences, express emotions, and foster personal growth. Free from societal expectations of stoicism or self-sufficiency. Through open sharing and mutual support, participants are empowered to build resilience, self-reflection, and a stronger sense of identity and purpose.
Structure of the Circle
Gathering in a Circle: Participants sit in a circle to symbolize equality and unity.A short meditation or moment of silence may be included to help everyone arrive and connect.
Talking Object: A sharing stick or object is placed in the center. Only the personholding the object may speak, ensuring uninterrupted sharing.
Open Sharing: Anyone may choose to share while holding the object. Sharing is op-tional, and passing is always respected.
Active Listening: While one person shares, others listen attentively without speaking,interrupting, or offering advice. The focus is on witnessing and being present.
No Judgments or Advice: Participants refrain from judging or offering unsolicitedadvice, creating a safe space for authentic expression.
Closing: The circle may conclude with a group reflection, a moment of gratitude, or a simple acknowledgment of the shared experience.
Circle Agreements
Supportive Environment: We are here to uplift and support one another, fosteringtrust and brotherhood.
Focus on the Present: Share whats alive for you now, focusing on your emotions and experiences to deepen emotional awareness.
Use "I" Statements: Speak from your personal perspective using "I" statements topromote authenticity and responsibility. Avoid generalizations like "we" or "us."
No Judgment or fixing: Refrain from judging others sharing or offering unsolicitedadvice, ensuring a safe and non-critical space.
Confidentiality: What is shared in the circle stays in the circle. You may discuss your own experience outside the group, but keep others details private.




Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!

What’s on the menu?
Creamy Farfalle Pasta with Plant-Based Bacon
Toasted Bruschetta with “Cheese”, Tomato and Parsley
Fresh Salad with Balsamic Vinegar
Berry Vanilla Muffins with Whipped Cream




Meet Your Hosts: Andre and Sri Jiva
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.
Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.




Agenda


🕑: 05:30 PM - 05:45 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 05:45 PM - 07:15 PM
Men's Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection
Host: Andre

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:15 PM
Plant-based dinner and dessert!
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Nutrition - Masterton Cancer Support Group, Nutrition - Masterton Cancer Support Group
The Cancer support groups offered by Wairarapa Cancer Society are a great place for people navigating cancer to connect with others who have gone through similar experiences.

These groups provide a safe and supportive environment where individuals can share their emotions, experiences, and knowledge.

Not only do these support groups offer a sense of belonging and understanding, but they also provide practical advice, encouragement, and hope during what can be a difficult and challenging time.

This group provides an inclusive and open environment for individuals to attend and participate in the discussion topic. There is no pressure or expectation for attendees to stay for the entire open floor support session.

Structure of group meetings as follows.

- Welcome
- Topic presented and discussed.
- Open floor support
- Closing

This month our focus is on nutrition to support cancer prevention and recovery during treatment. We’ll look at how food choices can help maintain energy, support overall wellbeing, and aid the body through treatment and beyond.

All are welcome. If you would like particular questions covered in the session, please let me know ahead of time.

The support group places a strong emphasis on maintaining the confidentiality and ensuring the safety of attendees.

Please RSVP
There is no cost to attend this meeting.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind, Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point? This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction. Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.


Meet your host, Sivananda
Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.
6.15pm Tuesday 19th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

description:
Posture Perfection Is Possible, Are you a computer slouch, feeling stiff and tense at work? Do you find it difficult to maintain a good posture? Does your posture cause back, neck or shoulder tension? Would you like to enjoy more freedom in everyday activities?

Under the guidance of an experienced teacher, we'll explore movement in ways that help you reduce tense unhelpful habits. Movement lessons are done on the floor or sitting on a chair and are based on the pioneering work of Israeli physicist and engineer Dr. Moshe Feldenkrais. This workshop is suitable for all ages (over 16) and fitness levels.

Outcomes
By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to:
- Identify and reduce muscle tension
- Move with more lightness and freedom
- Improve your posture
- Describe some basic anatomy
- Have tools to use at home and at work

Bring two blankets (or a mat and a blanket) and wear loose, warm and comfortable clothing. Tea and coffee provided but bring your lunch.

Please note that instructions are given verbally rather than by demonstration, so good hearing and understanding of English is required.

1 Day
Presented by Sue Field.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Pilates + Connect (4 weeks), Ever wanted to try Pilates? But don't know where to start or fear doing it alone?
Join us for a progressive Pilates series where you'll build strength, confidence, and connection week by week. Meet new people, make new friends.

RSVP here: https://heymates.com/wellington/social-pilates-4-weeks/

Entry: $12.50 - reserves your spot and supports the platform.
Exact location is shared via email once you have paid/joined via site.

This 5 consecutive weeks of Multi-Level Reformer Pilates series is designed for all abilities — whether you’re new to Pilates or an experienced mover, you'll receive tailored guidance to suit your individual needs.

Enjoy a supportive, welcoming environment with personalised attention in our intimate classes (max 8 participants). Each session will energise and challenge you, helping to build strength, flexibility, and balance in a sustainable way.

After the session, you are welcome to stay or visit a cafe nearby with the group to continue the conversations and connections.

Schedule:
- Sat. 04 Oct 2025 01.30pm
- Sat. 11 Oct 2025 01.30pm
- Sat. 18 Oct 2025 01.30pm
- Sat. 25 Oct 2025 01.30pm

Please Note: While we do our best to be flexible, we are unable to offer reschedules or make-up sessions for any missed classes within this 5-week consecutive block. For health and safety reasons, classes are also non-transferable and cannot be passed on to another person.

RSVP is a must through our website.

People in your group are there to socialise, connect and have fun. Who knows? You might just discover your new BFF!

See you there!

description:
Real Talk Kāpiti, Real Talk Kāpiti
We are excited to announce that we are bringing Real Talk to Kāpiti. We can’t wait to share space with you all!
🔥Saturday 29th November
🔥11am to 3pm (doors open at 10.30am)
🔥Te Raukura ki Kāpiti, 34a Raumati Road,
Kapiti College, Paraparaumu

This is a FREE event for Rangatahi (14-25years) and also FREE for Rangatahi Service Providers, Kaiako, anyone that works with our rangatahi, Tāngata whaikaha and whaiora.
Click here to register for your tickets:
https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/2025/real-talk-kapiti/paraparaumu

Real Talk Kōrero

We take our audience on a journey, a journey of laughter, a journey of tears, and a journey with absolute passion and purpose.
We create a safe space to speak about what we have experienced in our lives, and that we don’t have to be whakamā, we don’t have to live in silence, we don’t have to hide our secrets anymore.
Because when we speak – we heal, when we speak we free ourselves, and when we speak – we provide inspiration and hope for others.

We provide the following at each event:

❤️Inspiring kaikōrero
❤️Free kai and refreshments
❤️Opportunity to win some incredible prizes on the day
❤️FREE Real Talk pukapuka for every rangatahi in the audience

The subjects covered in our kōrero start with but are not limited to the subjects listed below:

⚫️Suicide and triggers and coping mechanisms
⚫️Mental Health awareness
⚫️Sexual, physical abuse and domestic violence
⚫️Being raised in gang affiliated environments
⚫️Drug and alcohol addiction
⚫️Teen pregnancy & pregnancy loss
⚫️Death & grief
⚫️Takatāpui & tangata whaikaha
⚫️Discrimination – racial, gender, sexual orientation
⚫️Relationship breakdowns
⚫️Career & business aspirations
⚫️Standing strong in who you are

We have a great line up of powerhouse, inspirational kaikōrero/speakers on the day:
🔥Pairama Wright – TikTok sensation
🔥Pania Te Paiho – Wāhine Toa Hunting & Hākuturi
🔥Peleti Oli – Youth Advocate

description:
Release and Replenish: A journey with Art and Yoga, Step into a space designed for deepening, replenishment, and self-discovery. Our workshops carefully combine yoga, mantra, breath, and creative expression to offer tools you can take into your own life and practice. Guided by experienced, mature facilitators, each session is thoughtfully crafted to engage all your senses, nurturing the body, mind, and spirit. Suitable for all levels, the experience is holistic, embodied, and gently transformative. Take a journey, slow down, and allow time and space for insight, creativity, and connection.
This workshop is a women-only space, led by women who know the cost of giving more than you receive.
In this self-empowering process, you will be supported to let go as much as you can, so you have a sense of spaciousness and can then bring in what it is you are currently seeking.

description:
Sapphic Somatics: A Queer Embodiment Workshop, Somatic: Of or relating to the body, particularly the perception of physical sensations and internal experiences

What does it feel like to exist in a queer body? This workshop aims to help sapphic women and gender minorities find joy, freedom, and connection through somatic exercises that help you embody and embrace your queerness. You will leave feeling confident in your ability to take up space, tapped into your self-expression, and connected to the experiences of your sapphic community.

Here’s a rundown of what to expect:
- Opening Exercise: Guided somatic movements to loosen up your body
- Community Connection: Rotating conversations with other participants about queer embodiment
- Yoga Flow: Creative 30 minute class to explore presence and connect to your self-expression
- Guided Meditation: A relaxing combination of breathwork and visualisation to cultivate safety in your body
- Closing Connection: Gentle and grounding partner stretches (optional) and group reflections

No prior experience with yoga or somatic exercises necessary! All you need to attend is an open attitude, a desire to connect with your body, and a willingness to share your experience with other sapphics. Yoga mats and all other props will be provided. While this workshop dives into your embodied expression of sapphic identity/sexuality, none of the content is sexual in nature and the small amount of physical touch with other participants is completely optional.

The workshop is facilitated by Megan Edwards, creator of Golden Hour Gigs and a 500CYT trauma-informed yoga teacher. This event is intended specifically for queer women and gender minorities. No TERFS no SWERFS.

Content consideration: Because this workshop focuses on finding joy/pleasure/freedom in your body, it might not be suited for anyone experiencing intense dysphoria. With that said, you are welcome to explore discomfort and work on integrating challenging feelings. Megan is trained in movement techniques to lead you away from anything too activating and help you find safety in your body.

Accessibility: Awhi Yoga Studios has an elevator and is wheelchair accessible. There are plenty of gender neutral bathrooms and cosy spaces to rest if you need a break from the workshop at any time. If you want to attend but are concerned about the level of movement required, please email the organiser with any mobility questions at goldenhourgigz@gmail.com
label: Health & Wellness

description:
SOMATIC Boot Camp with Miri Naad, Get unstuck, release, move, breathe, sweat, dance and shake … FEEL ALIVE AGAIN! We are going deeper starting this EQUINOX. Join my 4 Sundays Somatic Boot Camp!
This particular SOMATIC YOGA program is to assist you in getting unstuck, opening your energetic potential and learn real grounded foundational tools to help you stay Human ;) 
These sessions are designed to work deeply and subtly in decluttering stagnant energy in your nervous system due to adrenal response to life stressors, control programs, and repressed life force. 
Decompress the Vagus Nerve, release trauma (any adaptive response to change, stresses the nervous system) deprogram the PSOA, access your inner fire, creative expression, voice, and power, through holistic movements, breath work, and bioenergetic movement.
 4 Sunday weekly group sessions 1.5 hrs -  Starting Sunday 21st of  September 2025  for 4 Sundays  at 4:30pm-6pm 
Venue Ridgway School, Mornington rd, Brooklyn. 
Price is for x4 sessions at $120  and $80 unwaged /student. 
you can also bring cash on the day but commit to all sessions please. 
We will work together in an unstructured, un-linear way, yet utilizing classic temple practices which include kundalini yoga postures and breath, rebirthing breath technology, mantra, EFT (tapping) TRE (trauma/tension release), and *Divadassi temple holistic dance flow. 
Unlocking inner body technology through breath, trembling, movement, and subtle holistic dance and mudras (activation or access codes within our body organic technology) 
This is a very intuitive and holistic approach, tailored specifically to what your body is asking and needing, initiation or strengthening your relationship with your body at all levels, physical, emotional, mental, and energetic self.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Self-Hypnosis - Hypnotise Yourself, A practical workshop that will introduce you to a structured and easy-to-follow method to take yourself into hypnosis and use it to your benefit. Let go of old habits and form new ones, brighten your future, excel in your career and create excellence.

Description
Self-hypnosis is a fantastic self-development tool. It can also be used for controlling pain, accelerated healing, letting go of limiting behaviours and a number of other applications. This workshop will provide you with a good insight into the world of hypnosis, demystify it and dispel the myths that surround it.

You’ll learn a structured method of taking yourself into hypnosis (informed by scientific research), some of the classic applications of self-hypnosis and evidence-based skills that will convince you without doubt of your ability to hypnotise yourself.

By the end of the workshop, you’ll be able to:
- Define and discuss hypnosis
- Practice self-hypnosis
- Create and write hypnosis scripts for personal change
- Use the language of self-hypnosis
- Relax hypnotically to deep levels

Tea and coffee provided but bring your lunch, pen and paper.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

1 day, Sat 9:00 AM – 3:30 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Tony Yuile
$115 incl. GST

description:
CMNZ Series: Takács Quartet (Wellington), Celebrating their 50th anniversary in 2025, the Takács Quartet are among the world’s top tier chamber ensembles.
PROGRAMME
* Joseph Haydn | String Quartet in G minor, Op. 74, No. 3 “The Rider”
* Nokuthula Ngwenyama | Flow
* Ludwig van Beethoven | String Quartet No. 9 in C major, Op. 59 No. 3
ARTISTS
Edward Dusinberre, Violin
Harumi Rhodes, Violin
Richard O’Neill, Viola
András Fejér, Cello
Lauded for their recordings of Joseph Haydn’s String Quartets, the Takács Quartet will open their programme with Op. 74, No. 3, known as The Rider – a reference to the galloping licks in the finale, and will finish with Ludwig van Beethoven’s glorious No. 9, Op. 59 No. 3, Razumovsky.
Between these two tōtara of the string quartet repertoire, the Takács Quartet will present a new work - Flow by American solo violist and composer, Nokuthula Ngwenyama, that seeks to express the creation of the universe as it expanded out from a primeval atom 13.7 billion years ago.
Come in and out of silence
Tone swirling in the balance.
Nothing, then everything
Waving into space.
Then light
And after a longer while
Air.
And now sixteen strings manually animated
Vibrating through time.
Nokuthula Ngwenyama

description:
Soundhealing & Yin Yoga, Soundhealing & Yin Yoga
Soundhealing & Yin Yoga
Step out of the rush and into a different pace. This session blends the long-held stillness of yin yoga with the raw, resonant tones of sound healing — creating space to drop tension, quiet the noise, and tune back into yourself.

Yin invites you to hold shapes for several minutes, not to push but to soften — giving your body time to open and your mind time to settle. Layered with live sound frequencies, the practice becomes a sensory journey that restores balance on a deeper level.

Emma brings a trauma-informed approach to yin, shaped by her own journey of self-growth and a belief in nourishing the body as a pathway to connection. Alongside Nizaad’s immersive soundscapes, the evening is less about performance and more about presence.

We’ll close the night by sharing a plant-based dinner and dessert — food to ground the experience in real connection.

All levels welcome.

Meet Emma, your yoga teacher
Emma holds a 100-hour trauma-informed Yin Yoga teacher certification, blending her corporate experience with a deep understanding of self-care. Emma's classes are designed to help create a safe space where you can relax and connect with your body. Her approach to teaching yin is purposeful, driven by a strong desire to empower students through mindful and compassionate practices. Her journey is rooted in self-growth and connection, with a strong focus on nourishing the body as an essential part of this.

Meet Nizaad, your sound healer
Nizaad holding a Reiki-infused Sound Journey designed to support deep rest and realignment. Blending the healing frequencies of crystal singing bowls alongside other sacred instruments, her sessions are rooted in the belief that sound and energy are medicine. Coming from a lineage of energy healers, she weaves gentle Reiki throughout the session to support subtle energetic balance and emotional release. Participants simply need to lie down and allow the sound and energy to wash over them, inviting a calm, restorative space to reconnect with the body and return to balance.

What’s on the menu?

Creamy farfalle pasta with plant-based bacon

Toasted bruschetta with cheese, tomato and parsley

Fresh salad with balsamic vinegar

Berry vanilla muffins with whipped cream

description:
Steps To Success - The tools to unlocking your potential, Steps To Success is a seminar, helping you be the best you can be. No matter what aspect in your life you want to level up, this workshop has the recipe to start living life at your best. You don't even have to be a member of the Fitness Portal. Just need to have a mind willing to learn.
What:
This seminar is a fundraiser to get the Rocking Robins Top team to Nationals this year in Rotorua.
When: August 29th 2025 6pm
Where: Tawa Fitness Portal
Cost: $25 Per ticket
Purchase your ticket here: https://docs.google.com/.../1FAIpQLSfMyBy9iQsriz.../viewform
Bonus: Each ticket comes with a $5 voucher to the Fitness Portal Cafe.
Sausage Sizzle: There will be a sausage running during the sausage sizzle so you won't go hungry.
Please make payment into the following account:
Account Name: Rocking Robins Rock N Roll Club
Account #: 06-0773-0877111-00
Particulars: STS
Reference: First + Last Name

What is this event?
Rotate through each 20–30 min session (with 5-min breaks between):
1. Mindset & Visualization – Mental prep and visualization with Jordan
2. Injury Prevention - Progressive load and how to avoid injury with Devin Glover
3. Fuel your body right - Talking fueling and supplements thanks to Scorpion Supplements with Rebekah Glover and Liz Monrad
BBQ will be running on the night so be sure to bring your loose coins!!
Proceeds from this event go towards helping the Rocking Robins top team get to national in October!!
Meet your hosts:
Jordan Shearer: Coach. Trainer. Space-holder for rebels, dreamers, and high end performers.
Jordan is the founder of Being You, a coaching practice grounded in authenticity, connection, courage, simplicity, and going rogue. She blends her background in mental health, life coaching, and human behavior with no-fluff, deeply human approach to performance. Having competed herself, Jordan understands the pressure that comes with stepping out, showing up, and giving your best when it counts. Jordan has coached competitive gymnasts, doctors, dancers, and first responders (to name a few) - people who need to stay mentally strong in high-performance spaces.
Devin Glover: Owner and Founder of The Fitness Portal Limited. Devin has been a personal trainer for 10+ years, and has competed either Nationally or Internationally in the following sports: Underwater Hockey, Olympic Weightlifting, Rock N Roll Dancing, CrossFit, Swimming and has dabbled in endurance sports like Ironman and Road cycling.
Rebekah Glover: Rebekah has gone through a huge lifestyle transformation. After losing over 30kgs and keeping it off, she became a Weight Watchers coach, then she started personal training in 2021. Rebekah has learnt through trial and error, about how important it is to fuel correctly to achieve your goals and that it isn't always about weight loss. If you you want to perform you need to fuel correctly. She is now an avid runner and competes Nationally in Rock n Roll Dancing, after only three years of dancing she holds one national title, and two regional titles.

Purchase your ticket here: https://docs.google.com/.../1FAIpQLSfMyBy9iQsriz.../viewform
Bonus: Each ticket comes with a $5 voucher to the Fitness Portal Cafe.
Sausage Sizzle: There will be a sausage running during the sausage sizzle so you won't go hungry.
Please make payment into the following account:
Account Name: Rocking Robins Rock N Roll Club
Account #: 06-0773-0877111-00
Particulars: STS
Reference: First + Last Name

What is this event?
Rotate through each 20–30 min session (with 5-min breaks between):
1. Mindset & Visualization – Mental prep and performance focus with Jordan
2. Injury Prevention - Progressive load and how to avoid injury with Devin Glover
3. Fuel your body right - Talking fueling and supplements thanks to Scorpion Supplements with Rebekah Glover and Liz Monrad
BBQ will be running on the night so be sure to bring your loose coins!!
Proceeds from this event go towards helping the Rocking Robins top team get to national in October!!
Meet your hosts:
Jordan Shearer: Coach. Trainer. Space-holder for rebels, dreamers, and high end performers.
Jordan is the founder of Being You, a coaching practice grounded in authenticity, connection, courage, simplicity, and going rogue. She blends her background in mental health, life coaching, and human behavior with no-fluff, deeply human approach to performance. Having competed herself, Jordan understands the pressure that comes with stepping out, showing up, and giving your best when it counts. Jordan has coached competitive gymnasts, doctors, dancers, and first responders (to name a few) - people who need to stay mentally strong in high-performance spaces.
Devin Glover: Owner and Founder of The Fitness Portal Limited. Devin has been a personal trainer for 10+ years, and has competed either Nationally or Internationally in the following sports: Underwater Hockey, Olympic Weightlifting, Rock N Roll Dancing, CrossFit, Swimming and has dabbled in endurance sports like Ironman and Road cycling.
Rebekah Glover: Rebekah has gone through a huge lifestyle transformation. After losing over 30kgs and keeping it off, she became a Weight Watchers coach, then she started personal training in 2021. Rebekah has learnt through trial and error, about how important it is to fuel correctly to achieve your goals and that it isn't always about weight loss. If you you want to perform you need to fuel correctly. She is now an avid runner and competes Nationally in Rock n Roll Dancing, after only three years of dancing she holds one national title, and two regional titles.

description:
Tap for Uprooting the Past — Let Go & Move Forward, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Workshop Series: Uprooting the Past — Let Go & Move Forward
Sometimes the past doesn't stay in the past. It lives in our thoughts, our reactions, our choices—quietly shaping the way we move through life. But what if we could uproot those old patterns, make peace with what was, and step forward with clarity and purpose?
This transformative series brings together four unique workshops, each offering a different lens on the same powerful journey: letting go, healing, and moving forward.
Across four sessions with different facilitators, you'll explore diverse approaches to:
Uprooting the past — Releasing what no longer serves you
Making peace — Finding closure and compassion for yourself
Gaining new perspectives — Seeing your story through fresh eyes
Learning and growing — Integrating wisdom that moves you forward
Creating a powerful pathway toward freedom, peace, and new beginnings.
Meet your host, Krishnaloka
Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.
6.15pm Tuesday 4th of November
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

description:
Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Kiriwhakapapa Loop Track, This guided walk follows the 2km Kiriwhakapapa Loop Track in Tararua Forest Park, about 16km north of Masterton. The track is well-graded with a gentle 50m incline and includes bridges across the Kiriwhakapapa Stream. Walkers will pass through regenerating native forest and a stand of exotic Redwoods.

The walk will take approximately 2 hours and is led by members of the Masterton Tramping Club and Wairarapa Walking Festival Committee, who will also provide information about other tracks in the area.

Walk details:
Meet at 13 Church Street (carpark next to Masterton Police Station) if you’d like to carpool. The track is generally flat, with a 50m incline. Note uneven forest floor and tree roots. No cellphone coverage in the area.
