description:
Grand Opening Lucas Oil Superstock & Super Saloon Series, Grand Opening Lucas Oil Superstock & Super Saloon Series
The days are getting longer and that can only mean one thing - Speedway is about to roar back into life! The 2025/26 season at Robertson Prestige International Speedway thunders back into action on Saturday 25th October at 6:30pm with a HUGE night of entertainment.

The midnight oil is being burned in sheds and workshops all over the country, as competitors and crews race to be ready for the massive summer of speedway action ahead. With new cars and new drivers plus all your favourites, the opening night is going to be huge on the dirt oval at the Robertson Prestige International Speedway.

The familiar roar of Superstocks hitting the dirt is an institution in Palmerston North and a quality field of these fearless drivers are ready to set the tone for the season racing in the Lucas Oil SuperStock Shootout Series! Metal crunching Stockcars never disappoint with plenty of new cars, new paint schemes, and wild designs - these are the backbone of the sport and always are dedicated to putting on a sensational show for the fans!

Spectacular Super Saloons will hit the dirt for the Lucas Oil Super Saloon Shootout Series and put on a thrilling show racing side by side! The return of your favourite Historic Stockcars from yester-year will bring back all the memories of the days gone by. Add in Minisprints and the future of Speedway Youth Ministocks round out what is expected to be a massive, high adrenaline filled opening night of the 2025/26 Speedway Season.

Its double points night, which is an excellent chance for competitors to get some early runs on the board in the Travel Managers Group Season Points Chase. Points are awarded for a top six placing in every non-championship race throughout the season, and overall victory in any of the classes is a major achievement, and a tribute to a driver's consistency throughout the season.

Classes in action are Superstocks, Stockcars, Super Saloons, Minisprints, Historic Stockcars, and Youth Ministocks – PN Registered Cars only.

Drivers, please follow the below link to register your intention to compete at the Opening night of the 2025/26 season. Please note Youth Ministocks are only open to Palmerston North Speedway registered competitors only.

https://www.pnspeedway.co.nz/forms/25-10-2025

Admission prices are $30 for an Adult (16 years and over), $10 for Children aged 8-15, and $70 for a Family pass of 2 adults and up to four children. Kids aged 7 and under are FREE.

Tickets are available to pre-purchase online from www.eventfinda.co.nz, (tickets purchased incur an additional service fee) or on race day from Gate 1 (Waldegrave Street), Gate 2 (Cuba Street - Bridge) and Gate 3 (Cook Street) from 5.30pm.

Racing Starts 6.30pm.

Click here to view a full list of the Arena terms and conditions of entry https://venuespn.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Terms-and-Conditions-of-Entry-2023.pdf
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Goblin Games - Edge of Eternities - Store Championship (Standard), Join us at Goblin Games on Saturday 6th of September for our Magic the Gathering Edge of Eternities Standard Store Championship! Bring along your standard legal constructed deck and play for your chance to win some absolutely incredible promo's!
Format: Standard
Date: 06/09/2025
Time: 11:00am
Rules Enforcement Level: Regular

description:
Glow in the dark titiwai tours - New Zealand glow worms, A fascinating tour into the world of titiwai, New Zealand's glow worms, in Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā. This outdoor night-time tour takes about an hour, and all are welcome to join. If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 7 years and older.
Meet at the Founders’ entrance to Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā on Glenmore Street. Please bring your ticket, a torch, and an umbrella if it’s raining. We'll see you there!
This tour is operated by the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden.
Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.
• Ticket Transfers: If you can’t attend your booked tour, we will put you on a future tour, subject to availability. Please contact us as soon as possible to arrange this.
• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.
For any changes or enquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at Treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.

description:
Haunted Hop & Halloween Bar Crawl Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Haunted Hop & Halloween Bar Crawl Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
Party all weekend in Wellington! The Haunted Hop & Halloween Bar Crawl Weekend Pass gets you into the best bars on Oct 31 & Nov 1.

About this Event






👻🎃Haunted Hop + Halloween Bar Crawl Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025 👻🎃
Two nights. One ticket. The ultimate Halloween takeover. The Weekend Pass gives you entry to both of Wellington’s biggest Halloween crawls — the Haunted Hop Bar Crawl on Friday, October 31st, and the Halloween Bar Crawl on Saturday, November 1st. Back-to-back nights of costumes, cocktails, and chaos, all across the Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs.
Friday kicks off with the Haunted Hop, a massive crawl where costumed partygoers pack the streets and every venue becomes a Halloween hotspot. Saturday turns up the volume with the Halloween Bar Crawl, bringing out DJs, dance floors, and spooky specials to close out the weekend in style.
Why settle for one night when you can crawl through both?





WEEKEND PASS HIGHLIGHTS
🎟️ Two Crawls, One Wristband – Admission to both Friday + Saturday events.
🎶 Live Music & DJs – Halloween hits, party anthems, and dance-floor energy all weekend.
🍸 Exclusive Drink Specials – Spooky cocktails, eerie shots, and bar-only deals.
👻 Costumes Everywhere – From scary to sexy to over-the-top — your outfit gets two nights to shine.
📍 Multiple Venues Each Night – 4+ bars and clubs, all within walking distance.



HOW IT WORKS
1️⃣ Check-In: Collect your weekend wristband at the designated starting venue (7:30–10:30 PM, both nights).
2️⃣ Crawl the City: Explore participating bars and clubs between 8:30–11:30 PM at your own pace.
3️⃣ Final Party: Join the crowd at the closing venue from 11:30 PM–2 AM for the ultimate send-off.





WHAT’S INCLUDED
🎟️ Admission to both Friday + Saturday crawls
🚫 No cover charges at any participating venues
📱 Digital crawl maps for both nights
🎶 DJs & live music at every stop
🍹 Themed drink and shot specials
🕺 Huge closing parties each night



PARTICIPATING VENUES
The full lineup of bars and nightclubs will be revealed closer to the event. Each venue offers its own Halloween theme, entertainment, and drink specials for crawl guests.


🎃 Hundreds of Halloween lovers, back-to-back nights, and the best nightlife Wellington has to offer. Whether you’re creeping through the Haunted Hop on Friday or shutting it down at Saturday’s finale, the Weekend Pass is your ticket to experience it all.
🚨 Early bird passes start at just $25. Lock in your plans now before prices rise.



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so you don’t miss out.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Bar List. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

description:
JETAA Wellington - Brewkaiwa August @ The Welsh Dragon, We will be having our August Brewkaiwa at The Welsh Dragon, a cosy and quirky pub nestled in the heart of the city. With its warm atmosphere, distinctive character, and range of drinks on offer, it’s the perfect spot to relax, chat, and connect.
Brewkaiwa is JETAA’s monthly casual meetup for anyone with any connection to Japan.
We’re a diverse group of people who have studied, worked, or lived in Japan or have been invited along by someone who has.
Come join us for a brew and stay for the kaiwa! Bring your friends!
***Japanese or alcohol consumption NOT REQUIRED!***
Brewkaiwaとは
一杯いかがですか？
JETAAがウェリントンで親睦会を開催するとどうなるのか？その結果、BREWKAIWA！
2020年に始まった、ブリューカイワは、ウェリントンの様々なバーで毎月開催されている飲み会です。大人気の国際交流グルップです！！！ 日本で働いたり、住んだり、旅行したことのある人達に人気のあるイベントです！！！お酒を飲んで、友達を出来、素敵なごちそうを食べ、おまけに異文化を知られます！
日本語が話せる外国人も良く参加しているので、日本語しか話せなくても全然大丈夫です！
是非来てください！

description:
Blenheim Gypsy Fair, Blenheim Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

description:
Soundscape Series: The Weather Machine, The Weather Machine brings an electrifying blend of soulful longing, theatrical glam, and retro-nostalgic indie rock to the stage. Their live shows are dynamic and heartfelt, weaving together lush arrangements, unexpected instrumentation, and soaring vocal performances. With violin, sax, clarinet, and layered harmonies in the mix, audiences can expect a genre-blurring experience that feels both intimate and cinematic. Whether it’s a delicate folk tune or a full-throttle rock anthem, The Weather Machine delivers each moment with passion, precision, and a deep love for musical storytelling.

The Weather Machine began as the brainchild of Portland, Oregon songwriter Slater Smith. What started as a DIY indie-folk project in the city’s vibrant underground scene has since evolved into a professional, internationally touring band. Over the years, they’ve shared stages with acts like The Lumineers, Alabama Shakes, and Cold War Kids. In 2021, Smith relocated to Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa, bringing the project with him and forming a new Wellington-based lineup. Now spanning two continents, The Weather Machine continues to expand its sound with a fresh, collaborative spirit.

About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers wanting more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.

Make friends & BlaBla Language Exchange Wellington - Every other Thursday - Recurrent event, Meet new people - Make international and local friends - Speak languages (mingle) - Have fun

................
Any question or request? Reach out to us on Instagram: www.instagram.com/blablalanguage
................
Join Our BlaBla Whatsapp Group: https://chat.whatsapp.com/LFeNVmzCnaG1BrHYpgBnqU
................
Stay updated via our Telegram channel: https://t.me/+n6e00r9ByRw0MmNk
................
Some guidelines for a delightful experience:
-
Our events are GRATIS, we will not charge you anything but You are asked to order a drink directly upon arrival to participate
(Mandatory).
-
Outside food and drinks are not allowed.
-
Please respect the venues staff and make sure to leave the place clean and tidy before you leave.
-
Be polite and respectful.
Please kindly note that venue staff or our organizers will ban you from our events and community without any warning if you don't respect it. We offer you opportunities to make friends and improve your language skills for free. Be nice enough to make things easy for us.
................
How it's working:
We are working with a mingle setup and we usually don't have designated language tables or areas.
English and the local language are typically spoken.
If you would like to speak other languages, please ask the organizers or seek participants who meet your language expectations.
................
Things to keep in mind before joining:
-
By attending our events, you consent to being photographed or filmed. Photos and videos taken during the events will be shared on our social media. If you do not wish to appear in the photos, please send us a private message as soon as possible on Instagram (@blablalanguage).
-
Remember to keep an eye on your belongings and prioritize your own well-being. We are not responsible for any lost items or personal issues.
................
/
Make a Difference with BlaBla: Volunteer as an Event Organizer (volunteering)!
These gatherings are brought to you by BlaBla Language Exchange, spanning over 150 cities across 5 continents. We are always looking for new organizers. More information and application here: https://www.blablalanguageexchange.com/event-organizers

/
Share your photography / video skills: Volunteer as photographer (volunteering)!
Are you a photo virtuoso or a video wizard?
Whether you're a pro or a passionate newbie, we want YOU!
No cash, but lots of laughs and fame (well, sort of). We'll even give you a virtual high-five!

description:
Mangatainoka Motors Hot Rod Car Day, Mangatainoka Motors Hot Rod Car Day
Attention all petrolheads! Buckle up for a rip-roaring day at our Car Days, where you can flaunt your sweet ride to fellow enthusiasts and the public alike. Plus, you'll have the chance to compete for some epic prizes that are sure to rev your engine!

Get ready to soak up the atmosphere with live music, delicious grub, and a refreshing ale. Swing by the Histui Museum for a bit of nostalgia, or hit up the Tui Shop for some merch to show off your Tui pride. Or, if you’re feeling laid-back, just kick back, relax, and let the crowd admire your ride while you swap stories with mates and family.

PRIZE CATEGORIES:

We’ve got a treasure trove of fantastic prizes up for grabs! From Most Original to the ever-coveted Star of the Show, there’s something for everyone!

- Most Original – For the ride that makes jaws drop!

- Local Star – Must be from Wairarapa or Tararua (home turf pride, baby!)

- Furthest Travelled – For those brave enough to put some serious miles on the clock!

- People’s Choice – Because the crowd knows best!

- Star of the Show – Walk away with a whopping $500 Tui voucher! (You know you want it!)

KEY TIMINGS FOR THE DAY:

- 09:00 AM - Gates open for cars (let the engines roar!)

- 10:00 AM - Gates open for the public (let the ogling commence!)

- 10:45 AM - All competing cars to be parked (no late arrivals, please!)

- 11:00 AM - Registrations close (don’t miss out!)

- 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Judging takes place (bring your A-game!)

- 12:30 PM - Prize giving (who will take home the glory?)

- 4:00 PM - Tui Brewery closes (but we do it all again the following month!)

PRE-REGISTER YOUR VEHICLE:

Why wait? Pre-register your vehicle or bike now for just $10 online. Just jump onto the website and on the day you can just park up, and flash your email confirmation on your dashboard. Easy peasy! Just head to https://www.tuihq.co.nz/mangatainoka-motors/

And if you forget to pre-register? No sweat! You can still sign up on the day.

All proceeds from registrations go towards the Mangatainoka Motors Reserve Restoration Project. It’s a win-win!

So, gather your crew, polish that ride, and join us for a day of laughter, camaraderie, and, of course, some seriously sweet wheels. We can’t wait to see you there!

description:
Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025, Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025
🐹 New Zealand Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025 – Upper Hutt

Get ready for the cutest competition in New Zealand – the Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025 happening in Upper Hutt on Saturday 11th October 2025. This one-of-a-kind event brings together pet lovers breeders and guinea pig enthusiasts from across the country for a full day celebrating our much-loved cavies.
Hosted by North Canterbury Guinea Pigs in collaboration with the Capital Cavy Club the show features two major events in one day:
🏆 Pedigree Guinea Pig Show – showcasing the very best cavies bred to national standards.
🐾 Pet Guinea Pig Show – where family pets take the spotlight for their charm personality and cuteness.
Whether you’re a seasoned exhibitor a first-time participant or simply a guinea pig fan this is the perfect opportunity to:
✅ Meet and connect with other guinea pig owners and breeders.
✅ Learn more about cavy care breeds and showing standards.
✅ Enjoy a fun family-friendly day out in the heart of Upper Hutt.
✅ See some of New Zealand’s most beautiful and beloved guinea pigs.

📍 Event Details:
Date: Saturday 11th October 2025
Venue: Upper Hutt Uniting Parish 1 Benzie Avenue Upper Hutt
Time: 9:30am arrival for the main show | Pet Show starts at 2:00pm

Exhibitors from all cavy clubs across New Zealand are welcome with special sections for junior members and pet owners.
With support from Topflite and hosted by North Canterbury Guinea Pigs the Nationwide Cavy Show is one of the biggest guinea pig events in New Zealand – and one you won’t want to miss!

NZBW After 5 Wellington 15.10.25, Let’s Party !!
BA5 Wednesday 15th October from 5.30pm for a 6pm start
Chamber of Commerce Level 3 / 15 Daly Street Lower Hutt
Come along and receive a complimentary Mocktail and Nibbles on arrival.
The evening includes how to
Make a fabulous Mocktail (the one your drinking)
Make your table and your home stylish for a party OR Christmas Party
Make great your home storage with an amazing range of homewares.
Your lovely hosts are
Andrea from Botanical Homeware
Carol from Foxy Teas
Lyndal from Little Lace Flower Company
 From Andrea
Discover fun and creative ways to use our decorative tins – from stylish storage solutions to thoughtful, unique gifting ideas. I’ll show you how these beautiful tins can be repurposed for every occasion, turning a simple container into a memorable gift or a charming piece for the home. I’ll offer 10% off for purchases made on the night and I’ll also have a raffle basket of tins. So, every purchase gets a raffle ticket.
From Carol 
Join Carol from Foxy Tea as she shares creative ways to enjoy herbal and fruit teas. Discover how to turn them into refreshing mocktails and explore simple, delicious ideas for using them in your cooking. I’ll offer a 15% discount for purchases on the night.
From Lyndal
In my presentation, I will show how you can create a range of stunning looks for your dinner table that won’t break the bank or involve hours of work. As I demonstrate how to put together each look, I will discuss some general planning and design ‘rules’ that make styling your table a breeze. Throughout the demonstration, I will use décor items that are available to hire from my hire stock - an easy, great value and eco-friendly option for decorating. For everyone attending the presentation, these items will be available for hire at a 30% discount (subject to availability). One lucky person will also win an $80 voucher to spend on décor hire for their next party or event.

description:
ETM Course Wellington, NZ: 7th – 9th November 2025, Emergency Trauma Management (ETM) is a 3-day face-to-face course that teaches trauma reception and resuscitation from the Australasian Emergency Medicine perspective, with a focus on practical trauma resuscitation, trauma team-leading and trauma team-member skills. Our course has a strong focus on communication in particular resuscitation room management, the shared mental model and closed loop communication.
We are relevant to nursing and medical staff who work in trauma centres, metropolitan, regional and remote environments.

description:
New Zealand Game Developers Conference, New Zealand Game Developers Conference
This is more than just a conference; it’s a celebration of Aotearoa’s amazing game dev community.

Our theme for this year is The People at the Heart of Games and is inspired by the well-known Māori proverb “He aha te mea nui o te ao? He tangata, he tangata, he tangata” (What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people), emphasising the human side of game development.

It speaks to the importance of community, collaboration and the people who shape our industry - developers, storytellers, players, and cultural guardians.

We’ll have inspiring talks, engaging workshops, and vibrant panel discussions that highlight voices from all corners of our industry.

Whether you’re a veteran developer, an enthusiastic gamer, or just starting your journey, NZGDC 2025 is the perfect place to forge new friendships, exchange ideas, and ignite your creativity!

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Waikanae Beach - Beneath the Blue, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Waikanae Beach! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: First drink is included in the ticket price.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
Wellington Walk the Waterfront, Wellington Walk the Waterfront
Top Up Together

As part of Mental Health Awareness Week’s Be Active day, the Aotearoa Mental Health Collective invites you to join us for an evening of movement, connection and community.
We’ll gather at The Lounge at St John's Bar, Wellington from 5.30 pm for a warm welcome and a chance to connect. Then at 6 pm we'll take a walk along the beautiful Wellington waterfront, returning to The Lounge at St John's around 6.45 pm.
After the walk, you’ll have the opportunity to share a meal or snacks of your choice, deepen connections, and continue the conversation in a relaxed setting. As this is a free event, you’ll order and pay for any food and drinks yourself and can choose from the wide range on offer at St John's Bar.
Walking alongside others and taking the time to connect can boost our wellbeing, reduce stress, lift our mood and strengthen our sense of belonging.
Spaces are limited, so secure your spot today.
We look forward to connecting, walking and topping up our wellbeing together this Mental Health Awareness week.

With thanks to St John's Bar, who have generously provided the venue for this free event.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Bowls and BBQ for Big Brothers Big Sisters Wellington, Bowls and BBQ for Big Brothers Big Sisters Wellington
Picture this - it's a warm summer evening in Lyall Bay, you're at the bowling green with a bunch of friends and colleagues, the BBQ is fired up, you've got a drink in hand, and you know your whole evening is helping Wellington's rangatahi thrive.

That’s what Bowls & BBQ Wellington is all about.

So, grab your friends, call your colleagues, rally your flatmates, and roll up for a fun night of bowling and BBQ-ing in support of Big Brothers Big Sisters.

Throughout the evening, you'll be able to enjoy:
🎳 A friendly lawn bowls tournament. No experience is necessary (in fact, it’s usually more fun that way!)
🌭 A classic Kiwi BBQ dinner. A great chance to eat, relax, and catch up
👋 Good company - meet others from local businesses and community groups.
🎁 A charity auction with the chance to bid on food hampers, jewellery, and experiences from generous local sponsors

Tickets are just $50 each, or $200 for a team of 4. This includes entry to our bowling tournament, plus a dinner afterwards.

https://www.bowlsandbbq.co.nz/wellington/

description:
Eco Dye Workshop, Eco Dye Workshop
Impressions of Nature on Silk

Eco dyeing, also known as leaf or eco print, is a gentle, alchemical process where the natural pigments of leaves are transferred directly onto fabric, creating one-of-a-kind botanical imprints.

Join me for a full day of slow making and discovery as we explore this beautiful dialogue between nature and cloth. In the morning, we’ll forage around the hall, gathering leaves and foliage that speak to us. You’ll learn how to prepare and bundle silk with plant materials, drawing out colours and patterns from the landscape itself.

In the afternoon, you’ll design and dye your own silk scarf — a wearable memory of place and season, marked by the delicate traces of nature’s touch.

You will learn

• which plants and fibres work best for this method
• how to use an iron mordant to enhance colour and detail
• different bundling techniques and approaches

All materials and tools will be provided for use during the workshop.

Your workshop fee includes silk fabrics to explore and experiment with, one silk scarf to design and dye, and a detailed handout with information on mordants, dye plants, tips, and useful resources.

A ‘what to bring’ list (including suggestions for clothing and optional items) will be sent out closer to the workshop date.

Booking through my website (see link above)

Location

27A Elizabeth Street (Art and Craft Society)
Waikane
Kāpiti

description:
Read to Kurī, Join us and our doggy guests from Canine Friends Pet Therapy for Read to Kurī at the library. You can book a 15-minute session to sit with one of our friendly dogs and read your favourite book, or one you've found at the library.
Read to Kurī aims to help children improve their literacy, self-confidence, and self-esteem in a relaxed, non-judgemental environment. This programme is perfect for tamariki aged 5+ who would like to practice their reading skills while making a new canine friend at the library.
To book your session, please call the library on 04 477 6151, or email johnsonville.library@wcc.govt.nz with your preferred date and time.
Bookings are for 15 minutes only. After you have booked, library staff will be in contact informing you what time to arrive for your session.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Piha Sunset, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Sunset Guided Tour, Experience Stonehenge Aotearoa at its most breathtaking — as the sun dips below the Wairarapa horizon.
Our Sunset Guided Tour blends astronomy, storytelling, and the natural beauty of twilight for an evening you will never forget.

Led by one of our knowledgeable guides, this 90-minute experience explores how ancient cultures used the Sun to track time and mark the turning of the seasons. You’ll discover the scientific and cultural thinking behind the Henge’s unique Southern Hemisphere design before watching the sunset alignment from inside the stone circle.

Weather permitting, you’ll witness how the setting Sun interacts with the structure — a striking moment that links ancient knowledge with the rhythms of the natural world.

Duration and Schedule
• Allow: Approximately 90 minutes
• Start Time: Begins one hour before sunset
• Availability: Offered any day with advance booking
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Saturday Serve, Saturday Serve at Ivy Bar
Wellington, are you ready to be SERVED?
Ivy Bar brings you a night of fierce drag, unstoppable energy, and show-stopping talent.
Featuring the dazzling Ms. Leading, the ever-glamorous Bobby Bottle Blonde, and a very special guest all the way from Canada, bringing that international sparkle to our stage.
Expect jaw-dropping performances, laughs, and a whole lot of queer magic—this is one show you don’t want to miss.
Saturday Night
Ivy Bar & Cabaret – Wellington’s Favourite Queer Bar
Get your friends, grab your tickets, and let’s turn the night into a SERVE!

description:
Pokemon: League Cup @ Cerberus Games, Pokemon: League Cup @ Cerberus Games
Pokémon TCG League Cup tournaments give players an opportunity to earn Championship Points and practice their skills for larger competitions.

Here are the details:

Entry Fee: $25.00
Format: Standard
Tournament Structure: 3-5 Rounds Swiss followed by a Top 4/8 Cut Single Elimination

Decklists will be required. You may fill out a deck registration form on paper or submit one digitally to:


Each participant will receive a booster pack and a Pokemon Prize Packs on entry. A booster pack will be added to the Top Placers Prize Pool per participant.

The champion of each age division will be awarded one (1) League Cup-Branded Champion playmat.

Pokemon Trainer Club and Player ID will be required to participate. Don't have one? You can create an ID at the following link:

https://join.pokemon.com/

Championship points are also awarded. Refer to the website for more information.

https://www.pokemon.com/us/play-pokemon/pokemon-events/pokemon-tournaments/tcg-league-cup/

A fun family event with prizes and local pet-focused stalls. This is a new take on a dog show and is located in the Wairarapa.

description:
Labour Weekend Market, Labour Weekend Market
There’s nothing more fun than a stroll around the Labour Weekend Sunday Riversdale Beach Market.
Visit a collection of local growers, bakers and producers and find unique, one-of-a-kind items.
So pop us on your Wairarapa playlist!

Want to sell you art, produce, plants or crafts? Stalls are limited to 40 spots and more than half are already booked again. Stalls are $20 each for a 3m x 3m spot.
Email to receive a booking form.
Be aware, this is the only way to reserve a spot - scammers will pretend to offer places.

Stall fees are donated to the Riversdale Beach Lifesaving Club.

PS Bring cash as there is no ATM at the beach.

#Wairarapa #RiversdaleBeachRocks #Market #Fun #Family #BeachLife #Gifts #ChristmasShopping
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Powell Hut Slow Overnight Stay, This is a mid week tramp to beat any rush.
This event is aimed for people wanting to get up to this hut and stay the night as a group but NOT have the stress or pressure to break any speed limits.
The start time is set early to give the maximum amount of walking time to reach the hut destination. Typically it is a 3-4hr walk but even with a huge amount of breaks we will be arriving just in time to have lunch at the top.
There will be regular posted stopping points along the way at Rocky Mt Lookout and again at Mt House Shelter.
You will be in charge of yourself through the trip but we will be there to answer questions and provide the entertainment like always

This is a fully serviced hut with water, gas cooking and a lovely wood burner to heat the hut during our stay.
The walking distance is 7.3km on a well formed track in most parts and formed stairs.
The elevation gain is approximately 500m which brings you to the hut which sits at 1200m above sea level.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington, Escape to the Dramatic Coast: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
Are you looking for a unique and unforgettable day trip from Wellington?
Imagine yourself surrounded by breathtaking coastal scenery, watching playful seals in their natural habitat, and standing in the shadow of a historic lighthouse with panoramic ocean views.
As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.
What's in store for you:
Personalized Pick-up & Drop-off: Enjoy the convenience of being picked up and dropped off directly from your Wellington accommodation.
Scenic Coastal Drive: Relax in comfort as we journey through picturesque landscapes, including the stunning Remutaka Hill Road and the rugged Wairarapa coastline.
Marvel at the Putangirua Pinnacles: Explore the otherworldly rock formations made famous by "Lord of the Rings."
Encounter the Cape Palliser Seal Colony: Witness a thriving colony of New Zealand fur seals up close (from a safe and respectful distance).
Discover the Iconic Cape Palliser Lighthouse: Climb (or admire from below) the iconic red and white striped lighthouse and soak in the incredible views.
Flexible & Relaxed Pace: This is your private tour, so we'll move at a comfortable pace and can tailor the day to your interests.
Gourmet Options Available (upon request & additional cost): Elevate your experience with a pre-arranged gourmet picnic lunch or inquire about other bespoke dining options featuring local flavors.
Expert Guidance: Benefit from my local knowledge, insights into the region's history, geology, and wildlife, ensuring a truly engaging experience.
Perfect for Photography Enthusiasts: Capture stunning photos of dramatic landscapes and unique wildlife.
Who is this tour for?
This private Cape Palliser day trip is ideal for:
Individuals seeking a solo adventure.
Couples looking for a romantic and scenic escape.
Families wanting a memorable and educational day out.
Anyone who appreciates beautiful scenery, wildlife encounters, and a relaxed, personalized travel experience.
Those who value quality and are happy to invest in a private tour.
Date & Time: Flexible - Contact me to discuss your preferred dates and times.
Duration: Approximately 8-9 hours (can be adjusted slightly based on your preferences).
Price: Pricing is tailored to the number of people in your group and any additional requests (e.g., gourmet lunch). Please message me for a personalized quote.
Booking:
Send me a direct message to discuss your preferred dates, group size, and any specific interests you may have. I'm happy to answer any questions and create a bespoke itinerary for you.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to experience the magic of Cape Palliser on your own terms!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Radio Hauraki 'The Big Show' • Beervana Warm Up Show, We’re going BIG to warm up for the BIGGEST beer weekend in the capital.
Next Thursday, @radiohaurakinz are bringing The Big Show to Lyall Bay - broadcasting their @beervananz Warm-Up Show live from Parrotdog Bar.
Roll in early to score one of 100 FREE Backbone Tees and hang with The Big Show crew. Then pull up a stump for a cold pint of Parrotdog, perfectly paired with dinner from two Wellington food icons – @oikoshellenic and @tommytomato.
@oikoshellenic will be serving charcoal-grilled chicken, slow-cooked lamb, and charred eggplant, all tucked into their house-made pita.
@tommytomato will be firing up the @gozney for slices of hot, crispy pizza.
On the sounds we have DJ Karl Gebbie.
On tap we’ll be pouring our brand-new Alcoholic Ginger Beer, alongside all the usual suspects.
See you next week!
#parrotdogbar #haurakinz #thebigshow #beervanawarmup #nice
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Draw It Out - Adult workshop, A gentle yet powerful tool for wellness (adults 18+) to access inner guidance.

Theme: Welcoming new possibilities
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.

This single workshop focuses on the theme of welcoming new possibilities, great if you are going through change, wanting to transition or entering a new phase.

Date
This is a single workshop
6.15pm-7.30pm
Monday 29 September

Cost
$46 total

Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.

This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.

About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.

“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”

For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.

Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
The Extravaganza Fair - Lower Hutt, The Extravaganza Fair - Lower Hutt
🎪✨ ROLL UP, ROLL UP – THE EXTRAVAGANZA FAIR IS BACK! ✨🎪

🎉 Celebrating 11 epic years of magical mayhem on the road! 🎉

New Zealand’s biggest and most fabulous travelling fair is rolling back into town – and you’re invited!

We’re bringing grassroots charm, vintage flair, and old-school fun to town – a joyride for all ages! Whether you’re 5 or 95, there’s something here to make your heart happy.

💫 FREE ENTRY for kids! Gold coin for adults – that’s it!

description:
Social Sewing Saturday - September, Social Sewing Saturday - September
Join us for a fun day of sewing and socializing this September at Social Sewing Saturday - make new friends and create something amazing tog

About this Event

Social Sewing Saturday - September
Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts! Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew. Bring your latest project or start something new - either way, you'll have a blast chatting with fellow sewing enthusiasts. Bring your current project or get inspired by others' creations at our friendly gathering. Share tips, tricks, and stories while working on our projects together.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. Please bring an extension lead and multipoint box if you have one. (Don't worry, though—we have some in the centre, too!) We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. You are welcome to come along and work on hand-sewing projects.
A kitchen is available on site and supermarkets as well as cafes are very close by.
Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC. (Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups)
Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)

description:
Friday Laughs with Lesa Macleod-Whiting and El Jaguar, Saturday Laughs at the Royal Hotel brings top comedy talent to the heart of Featherston

This month's show features -
El Jaguar
Canadian comedy act El Jaguar is coming to wrestle his way into hilarity. From Canada, to New Zealand, and throughout Australia, El Jaguar is making a name for himself on the comedy scene using only his fast wits and tight lycra.
From the dusty streets of central America, rising triumphant as the luchador everyone wanted to be in the World Wrestling Federation circa 1990, then into obscurity: El Jaguar is making a comeback… and it’s going to be hilarious.

And MC Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee
Lesa is a Wellington-based writer, improviser and comedian. She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest. She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.
Winner – Best Newcomer – 2020 Wellington Comedy Awards Nominated – Best Newcomer (Lower North Island) – 2020 NZ Comedy Guild Awards

More acts to be announced!

This event brought to you with support from TrustHouse Ltd

description:
Spank 2025 - New Zealand's wildest fetish dance & play party, Spank 2025 - New Zealand's wildest fetish dance & play party
Get Ready for the Hottest Night of the Year at SPANK!

About this Event

Are you ready to unleash your wildest desires and dance the night away? Prepare for an electrifying experience that will push the boundaries of pleasure and indulge your senses like never before! SPANK, the ultimate kinky dance and play party, is back and it's bigger, bolder, and naughtier than ever!

What to Expect: 🎶 Groove to the Sensual Beats: our DJ will be spinning the sexiest deep house music all night long, setting the mood for an unforgettable evening of uninhibited fun.
🔥 Explore the Play Area and Darkroom: Dive into a world of sensory exploration with dedicated play zones and a tantalizingly mysterious darkroom.
🌈 Embrace Diverse Desires: A smorgasbord of sexualities, kinks, fetishes, and fantasies will come together for a night of unapologetic self-expression and connection.
Consent is Key: SPANK is a full permission safe space operating under the model of consent. We believe in empowering you to explore your sexuality freely, while respecting the boundaries of others. Remember, your desires are valid, but you must obtain explicit consent before engaging with others. Respect their boundaries and maintain a safe and enjoyable environment for everyone.
Unparalleled Experience: With our commitment to safety and enjoyment, we proudly offer you an electrifying event that promises to be both thrilling and secure. Join us for a unique Labour weekend celebration that will leave you breathless and craving for more.
Dress to Impress: 👗 Fetish Attire Compulsory: Dress up in your most tantalising kink and fetish costumes! Show off your unique style and embrace your inner desires. No jeans and jimmies allowed – this is your chance to shine and explore your fantasies.
🧥 Coat Check Available: Don't worry about your coats or extra clothing; we've got you covered with a convenient coat check service.
Join the Party: Are you ready to dive into a night of unbridled passion and wild dance moves? Sign up on the night with your name and email address to participate in the interactive play activity. Secure your spot for a night of unforgettable memories!


Please Note: We uphold a strict code of conduct and dress, and we reserve the right to remove anyone from the event at any time, for any reason, without a refund. We are dedicated to maintaining a safe and enjoyable environment for all attendees.

Don't miss out on this one-of-a-kind event where your desires are embraced and your fantasies come to life. Get ready to SPANK yourself into a world of ecstasy!


See you on the dance floor, The SPANK Team
Spank You Very Much!

description:
The Coven Ball: Leather & Lace, The Coven Ball is Back – And Naughtier Than Ever!

Get ready to unleash your inner vixen at Coven: Leather & Lace – our most seductive event of the year returns for its second spellbinding edition!

Expect a night full of provocative delights: dazzling burlesque performances, flash tattoos, a spanking booth (yes, really!), and tantalizing treats lurking around every dark corner. And don’t forget – there are spot prizes for the fiercest looks, so bring your best Leather or Lace fantasy.

Who’s it for?
Coven is a celebration crafted exclusively for queer women and gender minorities. Whether you’re sapphic, trans, nonbinary, genderqueer – this is your night to shine.

Evening Highlights:
- 7pm Cocktail Hour: Fabulous arrival photos, sip on our sexy drink specials and soak in the vibes with live sapphic music.
- An evening of entertainment from burlesque, to the kinkier kind, and flash tattoos by an incredible local artist
- Our infamous dessert grazing table

Tickets are strictly limited – and they WILL sell out. Secure yours now and don’t miss the queer event everyone will be talking about.

Coming Solo? You’re Not Alone.
Don’t be nervous if you’re planning to come on your own – Coven is built for connection. Whether it’s your first queer event or your hundredth, you’ll be surrounded by a community that gets it. From the moment you arrive, there’ll be friendly faces, welcoming vibes, and plenty of chances to mingle, and connect. Coven is about belonging – and there’s a place here for you.

Coven Kaupapa
For queer women and gender minorities, spaces like this are rare, vital, and sometimes, life-changing. In a world that constantly centers cishet norms, Coven offers a space where we are the default – where you can fully show up as yourself, be seen, celebrated and surrounded by YOUR community.

For many in our Coven, this is one of the only opportunities we feel comfortable enough to experience nightlife free from the male gaze, tokenism, fear, or the need to shrink ourselves to fit in. It’s a space where sapphic, trans, nonbinary, and gender-diverse people aren’t just welcomed – we are centered. It’s for those who are often pushed to the margins, who rarely feel represented in “inclusive” spaces that still cater to the mainstream.

This night exists because we need it – and because we create it, together.

Accessibility
The event is held upstairs at Whisky & Wood, a stunning venue with gender-neutral bathrooms and lift access (note there is a small bump as you enter). Staff will be ready to help if needed. Have specific accessibility needs? Reach out directly at hello@whiskyandwood.co.nz.

Community Tickets
We want Coven to be for everyone. At checkout, consider donating toward our community ticket fund. Can’t afford a ticket? Email willysmackntush@gmail.com with the subject “Free for Me” and your preferred name. We’ll be gifting free tickets on Friday 18 October.

If you made it this far... Good girl / Good they / Good boy / Good YOU!
Get ready for a night of queer joy, sexy surprises, and community magic.

description:
The Napier Escape, Saturday 23rd August 2025 – Learn, Indulge or Explore in Napier
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.
A Deco Deep Dive
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.

Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options. Choose from the following to enhance your day:
A Deco Deep Dive
The City’s Art Deco heritage is a defining feature of the city, shaped by a remarkable chapter in its history. After a devastating earthquake in 1931 levelled much of the city, Napier was rebuilt in the architectural style of the time—Art Deco.
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
Sip, Savour, and Soak in the Views
Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.
Crab Farm Winery was established in the early 1980’s with the first vintage under the Crab Farm Winery label released in 1987. The land at Crab Farm has been in the Jardine family for over 100 years. Originally purchased without viewing beforehand – Hamish Jardine’s great grandfather was alarmed to find his new land was actually partially underwater. With tidal pools, rushes and hundreds of Crabs, the family jokingly named it ‘Crab Farm’.
Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace. Wander among world-famous Art Deco buildings, stroll the scenic Marine Parade, or relax at a local café with a Hawke’s Bay treat. Visit MTG Hawke’s Bay for a dose of culture, browse boutique shops, or admire the colourful street art. It’s your chance to soak up Napier’s unique charm your way.
For all timetable, pricing & more information - head to www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Marlborough Tech Community Morning Tea: Shaping Our Future, Marlborough’s tech community has huge potential, and this kōrero is about shaping the next chapter together. We believe our region’s tech future will be stronger when everyone has a seat at the table, and we’re committed to making space for all perspectives to be heard.
Event details
📅 Date: Thursday 18 September 2025
🕘 Time: 10:00 am - 12:00 pm
📍 Location: Te Au Pūngao, cnr Arthur & Seymour Streets
Free to attend, registration is essential for catering purposes.
Join us for morning tea at Te Au Pūngao to connect with others working in technology, innovation, and startups, and to help set the direction for Marlborough’s tech future.
We’ll be talking about:
Making coworking more accessible for sole contractors, early-stage founders, and startups
Creating regular opportunities for local students to get hands-on support from industry experts
Forming a Marlborough Tech Steering Group to guide our community and develop a Tech Community Charter
This is an open kōrero guided by the principle of equity of voice. Whether this is your first tech event or your fiftieth, you belong here. We know it can feel daunting to walk into a new space, so our team will be at the door to welcome you and make introductions.
Everyone brings value to the conversation. Your background, culture, and lived experience help shape a stronger tech community.
Accessibility and inclusivity:
On-site parking, elevator, and accessible bathrooms
Welcoming to LGBTQIA+ community
Attendees are encouraged to bring a friend
Come along, share your ideas, and help build a connected and collaborative tech community in Marlborough.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Unity Book Club September 2025 | Flesh, About the book: 
A propulsive, hypnotic novel about a man who is unravelled by a series of events beyond his grasp.
Fifteen-year-old István lives with his mother in a quiet apartment complex in Hungary. New to the town and shy, he is unfamiliar with the social rituals at school and soon becomes isolated, with his neighbour – a married woman close to his mother’s age – as his only companion. These encounters shift into a clandestine relationship that István himself can barely understand, and his life soon spirals out of control.
As the years pass, he is carried gradually upwards on the twenty-first century’s tides of money and power, moving from the army to the company of London’s super-rich, with his own competing impulses for love, intimacy, status and wealth winning him unimaginable riches, until they threaten to undo him completely.
Spare and penetrating, Flesh is the finest novel yet by a master of realism, asking profound questions about what drives a life: what makes it worth living, and what breaks it.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In September we will be discussing Flesh by David Szalay.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.
label: Hobbies & Interests

Rotten Luck Fermentation Club Special CHEESE-MAKING – Pop-up Parlour 2025, Rotten Luck Fermentation Club Special CHEESE-MAKING – Pop-up Parlour 2025
The Rotten Luck Club is at the Pop-up Parlour!

Come along for a 2 hour cheese-making demonstration and tasting session! Local enthusiast Erin will guide us through the process and share her love for all things cheese.

• What - 2 hr workshop where you'll be shown how to making a fresh batch of cheese (probably halloumi and maybe also paneer), and everyone can take some home.
• When - 2pm-4pm, 28 September 2025
• Where - St Marks, 98 Rāwhiti Road, Pukerua Bay (opposite school)
• Cost - $10 per person BOOK NOW ( https://tinyurl.com/5n7twce7)
• What to bring? Anything yummy for the tasting session. Bonus points if it is home made.
• Who - Kids welcome to join but they will need their own ticket and must be supervised by a caregiver at all times.

We will also have a tasting session of different types of cheeses for everyone to sample.

Bring any questions you have and you'll be able to look at the range of equipment used too. Will have tips and tricks for setting up at home, including sourcing the right type of milk and getting your hands on some rennet.


Other Rotten Luck Fermentation Club events at the Pop-up:

- Sauerkraut & Kimchi (Rangatahi & Adults) $10. https://tinyurl.com/7myhk5v9
- Bread-making $20 https://tinyurl.com/yfkderv7
- Recipe Discovery @ PKB Library, free https://tinyurl.com/byswfp93
- Sauerkraut & Kimchi (Kids) $10 https://tinyurl.com/4hdapf3b
- Whiskey-making @RSA $20 https://tinyurl.com/2a26z3yt

All paid events are helping to fundraise for the Pop-up Parlour.

The bar at the RSA will be open for further alcohol purchases. Please do not bring your own alcohol to the venue.

Note, no paywave facilities. Cash and card only. Do not drink and drive - arrange a lift if you are drinking alcohol. Pukerua Bay Hub will not be liable for any unruly behaviour.


____________________________________
WHAT IS THE POP-UP PARLOUR?
A chance to create and connect in our pop-up community space. From 1-30 September we've got a jam-packed schedule with 65+ events for kids, families, rangatahi and adults to learn, hang out and have fun.

Check out all the free/koha events too -
https://www.pkbhub.org.nz/whatson

Let us keep close together, not far apart.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Mr. Halloween Bachelor | PopRox at the Hannah Playhouse, Join Frankenstein this Halloween as he searches for his next bride (or groom) at the Hannah Playhouse in a one-night-only red rose spectacular!
Mr. Halloween Bachelor is the much awaited sequel to PopRox's iconic 2024 show 'Ms. Christmas Bachelorette'. Prepare for even more characters "played to perfection" from professionally reviewed "hot" improvisers and the return of the iconic J'accquzzi.
PopRox is an improv-comedy troupe based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Best known for their monthly shows at Circa Theatre and their iconic sell-out seasons (Farce Onion and A Very PopRox Christmas).
Please make sure you arrive with plenty of time before the show starts to find your seat and to grab a drink from the onsite bar!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Unity Book Club September 2025 | Flesh, About the book: 
A propulsive, hypnotic novel about a man who is unravelled by a series of events beyond his grasp.
Fifteen-year-old István lives with his mother in a quiet apartment complex in Hungary. New to the town and shy, he is unfamiliar with the social rituals at school and soon becomes isolated, with his neighbour – a married woman close to his mother’s age – as his only companion. These encounters shift into a clandestine relationship that István himself can barely understand, and his life soon spirals out of control.
As the years pass, he is carried gradually upwards on the twenty-first century’s tides of money and power, moving from the army to the company of London’s super-rich, with his own competing impulses for love, intimacy, status and wealth winning him unimaginable riches, until they threaten to undo him completely.
Spare and penetrating, Flesh is the finest novel yet by a master of realism, asking profound questions about what drives a life: what makes it worth living, and what breaks it.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In September we will be discussing Flesh by David Szalay.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
WCC "Tequila and Salsa night!", Hello again bartenders from all walks of life! Brush up on your Tequila knowledge and your Salsa recipes because the next Wellington Cocktail Competition is just around the corner!
As to the theme for this WCC, it is “Tequila and Salsa food pairing” The hero spirit this time around will be a surprise tequila on the night, but I can tell you it will be a reposado. The catch is, you have to pair it with a salsa that you make yourself. There are no limits on the style of cocktail you want this time around, so get creative!
If you would like to participate, get in touch with me or Dan ASAp as we were running low on time to organize this time around.
Minimum 30ml of Tequila must be used in the drink and as always must be the hero spirit of the night.
You will be making two drinks for the judges to try and 5 minutes to make two servings of your cocktail and serve your salsa.
The judges may also be coerced with bribes and favours during your presentation.
The event will be on 28th of September and the competition will start at 6pm.
If you have any questions about the competition, please ask either me or Dan.
The main aim of this cocktail competition is to help those who may not have entered comps before, gain a bit of confidence and experience, or for people who haven’t entered a comp in a while, to shake off those cobwebs.
It also a chance to meet new people and introduce newcomers to the Wellington bar scene. Most of all the idea is to have fun!
Each competitor will have 5 minutes to make and present two servings of their drink.
All Tequila and corn chips for your salsa will be provided, but you will have to source your own ingredients including citrus and sugar syrup. Glassware and ice will be provided, you are more than welcome to bring specialty equipment and ingredients, however you will be marked on how easy your drink is to replicate.
The competition will be judged by a panel of 3 judges. While knowing your stuff is important, brand knowledge is not the key here. This comp is to engage bartenders in a fun comp environment, so drink and personality are just as important.
Competitors will be first come first serve, so message either me or Dan if you want to be entered, there are 10 spots for the night and there will be prizes for the winner.
There will be drink deals on the night, and make sure you bring your friends, workmates, parents ect ect to cheer you on and heckle the other competitors…
See you all there!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
WCC x Rittenhouse & Elijah Craig "The Return of the Mellowcorn", Hello again bartenders from all walks of life! Prepare for beer matches and the return of the king because Mellowcorn is coming back to NZ!
As to the theme for this WCC, it is “The Mellowcorn and Rye Happy Meal.” This time around, I would like you to come up with what’s known as a Happy Meal, which is a cocktail, a shot and a beer. You will have the choice of either the Elijah Craig small batch or Elijah Craig Straight Rye Whiskey for the cocktail in question and I will say there are no limits on the cocktail you create.
The catch is you will be pairing it with a shot of either Rittenhouse Rye or Mellowcorn as well as a canned beer of your choosing. We will be supplying the spirits, but you must provide the beer and whatever ingredients you need for the cocktail.
If you would like to participate, get in touch with me or Dan sometime in the next month and I will announce our competitors closer towards the time.
Minimum 30mls of Elijah Craig Small Batch or Elijah Craig Rye must be used in the drink and as always must be the hero spirit of the night.
You will be making two servings of your cocktail for the judges to try and 5 minutes to make both as well as serve your shot and beer.
The judges may also be coerced with bribes and favours during your presentation.
The event will be on 27th of October at Crumpet and the competition will start at 6pm.
If you have any questions about the competition, please ask either me or Dan.
The main aim of this cocktail competition is to help those who may not have entered comps before, gain a bit of confidence and experience, or for people who haven’t entered a comp in a while, to shake off those cobwebs.
It also a chance to meet new people and introduce newcomers to the Wellington bar scene. Most of all the idea is to have fun!
Each competitor will have 5 minutes to make and present two servings of their drink.
All Elijah Craig, Rittenhouse and Mellowcorn stock will be provided, but you will have to source your own ingredients including citrus, sugar syrup and your beer match. Glassware and ice will be provided, you are more than welcome to bring specialty equipment and ingredients, however you will be marked on how easy your drink is to replicate.
The competition will be judged by a panel of 3 judges. While knowing your stuff is important, brand knowledge is not the key here. This comp is to engage bartenders in a fun comp environment, so drink and personality are just as important.
Competitors will be first come first serve, so message either me or Dan if you want to be entered, there are 10 spots for the night and there will be prizes for the top 3.
There will be drink deals on the night, and make sure you bring your friends, workmates, parents ect ect to cheer you on and heckle the other competitors…
See you all there!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
WAITLIST ONLY - Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy, TICKETS ON SALE NOW!
Tickets for the Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy are officially on sale as of today (1 August) until 1 October, unless they sell out prior. So don't leave it till the last minute!
Priority will be given to financial members of Club Garibaldi and Club Italia Nelson.
Non-members will be wait-listed in order of application date and confirmed after the 1 October cutoff.
The cost of the tickets are as follows:
Financial Club Members (from both Clubs):
- 12 years and over: $25.00pp
- 6–11 years old: $12.50pp
- under 5 years: Fre
Non-Members:
- 12 years and over: $50.00pp
- 6-11 years old: $25.00pp
- under 5 years: Free
Please email, text or call Rosina to secure your tickets now.
rosina.vanderaa@gmail.com
021-621-245
Once your FY25/26 membership status has been confirmed, Rosina will send you the bank account details.
A presto!
Photo courtesy of The Pines.
***
Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy
Each year Club Garibaldi of Wellington and Club Italia of Nelson interact through a soccer game between representatives of the two clubs.
The game is in memory of Aldo Cuccurullo, a young member of Club Italia who tragically died at a very young age.
Aldo was known as a gentle giant who gave of his time not only to play rugby league himself, but also to coach children.
The game, as you would expect of Italian football, is a tense one. Member supporters of each club travel to be at the game but the weekend is as much an opportunity to socialise and build friendships as it is to play football.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL, WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL
Hi everyone - welcome to the WSKN Christmas SKISL / Paddle to Mana!

On Saturday 13th December we will have a Christmas event on Mana Island, departing Titahi Bay at 10am (so arriving at 9:30) getting to Mana around 10:40, keen ones can do stuff prior to lunch around 12:00, then there might be groups that head back at different time slots, but we can work that out on the day. Return could therefore either be 1:30 or 2:30 with the latest return to Titahi Bay being 3pm.

We've made this event later than the normal SKISL so that it's easier for folks to drive down from Palmerston North, and also because it is a lunch event.

The lawn on Mana is really nice, sheltered and pleasant and there are also good walks. Mana is of course a sanctuary so you must check your boats for any wildlife especially ants that may have gotten in past the hatches. Also we cannot have any fires

Plan B: If weather nukes Mana, we'll try for Green Point or Onehunga Bay in Whitireia Park by driving there.

Plan C: We will postpone to 21 December
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Kids Market - Pop-up Parlour 2025, Kids Market - Pop-up Parlour 2025
Come along and support our young entrepreneurs!

TAKING REGISTRATIONS NOW!!
https://tinyurl.com/yc6myufk

The Kids Market is part of the Pukerua Bay Hub Pop-up Parlour. It is a great opportunity for children up to 16 years of age to show their entrepreneurial spirit and sell their own handmade crafts, baking, good quality used toys, clothes, books etc.

Customers, bring your cash on the day.

Event details
• What - Trading for 2hr and 2hrs of setup/packdown
• When - 12 – 3pm Sunday 14th September 2025
Set up from 10.30pm. Trading 12-3pm. Pack-up to be complete by 4pm.
• Where - St Marks, 98 Rawhiti Road, Porirua, 5026 (opposite the school)
• Cost - koha per table, collected on the day

• What to bring?
A table will be provided to each stall, we recommend you bring a tablecloth. You must bring your own float as there is no access to ATM, eftpos, or power at the stalls. Please no free items as this may affect other children’s sales.

Stalls are limited to two people each and a supervising parent must be onsite at all times.

LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE.

For more information email
____________________________________
WHAT IS THE POP-UP PARLOUR?
A chance to create and connect in our pop-up community space. From 1-30 September we've got a jam-packed schedule with 65+ events for kids, families, rangatahi and adults to learn, hang out and have fun.

Check out all the free/koha events too -
https://www.pkbhub.org.nz/whatson

Waiho i te toipoto, kaua i te toi roa –
Let us keep close together, not far apart.
label: Kids & Parents

WTF Cruise to Laid Out at the Lake 2025, WTF Cruise to Laid Out at the Lake 2025
WTF CRUISE TO LAID OUT
FRIDAY 17TH OCTOBER 2025

OFFICIAL CRUISE TIMELINE & DETAILS

If you are coming on the cruise can you please PM the WTF page with your,
Name:
Rego:
Phone Number:
Emergency Contact Info:

Just so we know who's there should something happen

On the day we will attempt to update this event page with our progress so you can join part way along the journey

Friday 17th October:

10:00am - Leave Plimmerton Weigh Station (get there early)

12:00pm - Leave Bulls (lunch stop, fuel stop for those that need it)

2:15pm - Leaving Waiouru (fuel stop)

4:00pm - Leave Turangi for Taupo

5:00pm - Approx arrival & end of cruise debrief
(Kaimanawa Reserve) behind the Fire Station on Rifle Range Rd, it goes without saying but don't drive on the grass.

This will be an alcohol free cruise so please drive sensibly and obey the road rules. Drive responsibly and maintain safe following distances.

description:
Watercolour Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Christmas Bauble, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: First drink is NOT included in the ticket price

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.
label: Hobbies & Interests
