description:
Watercolour and Wine Night in Wellington - Oh Deer!, Turn wine into watercolour! Take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other, and let’s paint a watercolour masterpiece!

Join us for a beginner's watercolour painting event full of fluid colour mixing and delicate brushwork where you’ll craft your own bespoke watercolour artwork. One of our watercolour experts will guide step-by-step through the watercolour process and will encourage you to add your own unique touch.

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
World Chase Tag Casual Game Night, World Chase Tag Casual Game Night
Come play Chase Tag at the Kilbirnie Recreation Center.

Come along to our casual game sessions. These will be open to anyone wanting to play and will be social, casual based rather than keeping score. We will play various versions of tag games: such as Ultimate Tag (which involves multiple evaders), Flight Club (which involves king of the hill format), and Chase-Off (the team version, as seen in World Chase Tag competition videos).
World Chase Tag was formed by Christian Devaux in 2012 after a game of Tag with his son in their back garden. A year later, he was joined by his brother, Damien, and together they set about turning the oldest game into the newest sport.


Cost:
-$4.50


Contact us:
-Email: Jay at , or Max at
-Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/capitalchasetag


Join the facebook community:
- https://www.facebook.com/groups/capitaltag


Join the news mailing list:
- https://share.hsforms.com/1iqBPGtFCRcWnu7SFo2rI0wrikam

description:
Wellington Frocktails 2025, Wellington Frocktails 2025
Frocktails: a night of sewcialising, cocktails, delicious snacks and fantastic me-mades!

About this Event

Wellington Frocktails, with our headline sponsor The Fabric Store, celebrates the making of garments. Whether you sew, knit, crochet or stitch, September 6th is the evening to show off your proudest make! Frocktails is a worldwide movement, celebrating me-mades for over 10 years.
Mingle with new sewing friends and say cheers over a shared passion of this craft. Whether you're an expert or beginner, this event is for you.
Included in the ticket price is a welcome cocktail (or non-alcoholic beverage), second beverage, light refreshments, a goodie bag and the chance to win one of the many sewing related prizes. A photographer will be on hand to capture the event and all of your wonderful me-mades! With exclusive use of the venue, the option to purchase other beverages will be available.
You will need to be 18+ to attend this event.

Please note: A photographer is present at this event. Photos taken may be used for marketing purposes in future event promotions
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Wow Train Vip Experience Ex Auckland: SOLD OUT, **SOLD OUT** - but limited tickets are still currently available for the Christchurch to Wellington WOW Train and Ferry Experience

Transcend the ordinary on a journey like no other, to a show like no other. This extraordinary experience brings you the Greatest Stages on Earth.

Departing 2nd October, 2025

Beginning in Auckland or Hamilton, you'll witness the unique landscapes of the North Island aboard the Northern Explorer WOW Train. A very special service, full of all things WOW, you'll be treated to a VIP welcome, special WOW garment appearances with accompanying commentary, a WOW goodie bag and full catering during your journey. In Wellington, your journey ascends yet further with premium 'Gold' seats at the World of WearableArt (WOW) Show. This is a WOW experience like no other!

You'll love this break
If you are looking for the ultimate WOW Show experience, then this is the ticket!

Indulge your senses with a unique WOW Train experience through the volcanic heart of the North Island on your way to our stunning capital, Wellington. There, you will continue your journey into the extraordinary with a Gold ticket to see the 2025 World of WearableArt Show.

This magical 3-day experience is set to be one of the greatest journeys of all time!

Inclusions
A 'Gold' ticket for the WOW Show performance on Friday 3 October and a WOW Show Programme
Exclusive WOW Train journey aboard the Northern Explorer on 2 October (where everyone on board will be going to WOW in Wellington!)
Onboard WOW entertainment and goodie bag
Morning tea, lunch, and afternoon tea aboard the train
2-nights accommodation including breakfast
Hotel transfer
Return flight with Air New Zealand

From NZ$1995 per adult
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
FILIPINO RESTAURANT WEEK at Faithful Flavours, FILIPINO RESTAURANT WEEK 2025
A culinary celebration presented in partnership with the Philippine Embassy in New Zealand
It’s the week we’ve all been waiting for!
From October 20 – 26, Faithful Flavours joins Filipino restaurants across Auckland, Wellington, and Christchurch to celebrate the rich taste of the Philippines right here in New Zealand.
Experience Our Official Entry: “ISLA TO TABLE - A Culinary Journey Across the Philippine Archipelago.”
Enjoy a special three-course set menu featuring:
Sizzling Bulalo – The hearty north of Luzon
Kinilaw Duo – The vibrant center of Visayas
Bibingka Cheesecake – The bold south of Mindanao
All for $48 NZD per person.
Visit us at 4 Chews Lane, Wellington CBD.
Available during our opening hours, Tuesday to Saturday, 7 AM to 10 PM.
BOOK NOW and RESERVE YOUR TABLE
Tag your food buddies, bring your appetite, and celebrate the flavours that feel like home.
#FaithfulFlavours #FilipinoRestaurantWeek2025 #KainNa #PHinNZ #PhilippineEmbassyNZ #WellingtonEats #SupportLocalNZ #FilipinoFoodNZ
label: Food & Drink

description:
2025 Open Day and Plant Sale, Our annual open day with entry by donation and fundraising plant sale is always a popular event!
The house will be open 10am-4pm with entry by donation, including our current exhibition '75 Tinakori Road: 'This marvel had come to the lane".
From 10am plants from our garden raised by our wonderful volunteers will be sold as a fundraiser for Katherine Mansfield House & Garden. Plants priced from $5. Cash and card accepted, you may like to bring a box or bag to carry your plants home in.
At 11am Gabor Toth, local and New Zealand history specialist at Wellington City Libraries, will give a talk about Thorndon during the years Katherine Mansfield and her family lived on Tinakori Road.
Throughout the day you'll be able to see members of Wellington Urban Sketchers creating new works.
At 2pm the Wellington Embroiderers' Guild will host our monthly Stitching Circle, feel free to bring along your WIP (work in progress) and join in!
label: Markets & Fairs

description:

description:
Age on the Go 2025, Age on the Go 2025
Organised by Horowhenua District Council, the 2025 Age on the Go Expo is the largest event of its kind in the region, featuring dozens of stalls offering information and education for the hundreds of visitors who attend.

Held as part of the Horowhenua Age Friendly Communities Strategy, the expo supports our vision that older people in Horowhenua are empowered to make choices that enable them to live well and age well. The event promotes positive ageing by showcasing activities and services that support good health, connection and wellbeing for older residents.

The expo will take place at the Horowhenua Events Centre, 33 Victoria Street, Levin, from 10am to 2pm.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Workshop Jiu Jitsu Christmas Party 2025, Let's celebrate another awesome year of being part of Workshop Jiu Jitsu. Spend more vertical, and sweet smelling, time with your grapple-family than you ever have before
There'll be too much food, strange music and some inspiring awards. Pat might even do an interpretive knee rehab dance
Bring your special people, we'd love to meet them. Sandy Taylor and the fab Jiu Jitsu Academy are joining us too. Children always welcome

Held as part of the Horowhenua Age Friendly Communities Strategy, the expo supports our vision that older people in Horowhenua are empowered to make choices that enable them to live well and age well. Building AI Teams: The Future of IT Leadership, The Future of IT Leadership Starts Here
AI is moving fast. The question is: who will steer the future?
Join us for an exclusive Building AI Teams: The Future of IT Leadership roadshow event designed to give you the talent insights, strategies, and tools to build AI-ready teams and shape tomorrow’s workforce.

Why Attend?
This free event delivers practical, future-focused value:
Insights into employment and workforce trends
A clear view of today’s AI leadership challenges
Guidance on how AI is reshaping the future of work

What You’ll Gain
Market Intelligence with Sarah Harland and the Absolute IT team
Access exclusive findings from their IT Job Market Report + IT Salary & Benefits Guide. Discover how workforce shifts, emerging skills, and technology adoption are shaping New Zealand’s IT landscape.
AI-Ready Foundations with Mark Watson, Information Leadership
Go beyond the hype. Learn the core technical prerequisites needed to adopt AI securely, effectively, and at scale.
Panel Discussion led by Sophie Harland, Information Leadership: Building Tomorrow’s Teams
Hear from peers and experts on what it really takes to future-proof your teams – combining the right skills, systems, and strategies.

Walk Away With
From market intelligence to AI foundations to practical team-building strategies – you’ll leave with the keys to leading tomorrow.
Free to attend
Exclusive insights you won’t find elsewhere
Actionable takeaways for IT leaders
No sales pitch

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: John Rae, Award-winning composer and musician John Rae invites you to an
enchanting evening of Celtic-inspired music that promises to get your feet tapping and your ears thumping. This large ensemble draws on both new and traditional melodies, reimagined in a style that reflects Rae’s cultural roots and personal musical journey. Experience a vibrant celebration of Celtic heritage through engaging rhythms and rich harmonies that showcase the versatility and depth of contemporary Celtic music.
John has recorded over 30 albums as a leader and side man including two BBC Jazz Albums of the Year (2003 and 2004). He has performed with the Scottish National Jazz Orchestra, was the first ever Jazz Composer in Residence at Victoria University, has written music for the NZSO/Wellington Jazz Orchestra and RNZAF Concert Band, and has toured internationally with his eclectic chamber ensemble "The Troubles".
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

Christmas Community Garage Sale, Come along to our Christmas Community Garage Sale — a great morning out for the whole family! Browse through a wide range of quality second-hand items including household goods, books, toys, games, puzzles, CDs, and more. You’ll also find stalls from local entrepreneurs and people raising funds for good causes — the perfect chance to support small ventures and community initiatives while picking up some Christmas bargains.

Christmas Market at The Pines!, It’s Beginning to Look a Lot Like Christmas… at The Pines Market!
Foxtail Events is thrilled to bring the magic back with the Christmas Market at The Pines — and this year, it's going to be more festive, more sparkly, and more joyful than ever!
Step into a holiday wonderland filled with twinkling lights, merry music, and the scent of cinnamon, pine, and freshly baked goodies wafting through the air. This is your chance to soak up all the Christmas cheer while checking off your gift list in the most magical way possible.

description:
White Christmas - a Cocktail Soirée, Welcome to White Christmas. A festive night out - minus the clichés.
All the sparkle, candlelight, and Christmas magic - just better dressed.
We’re turning Whisky & Wood into a modern Christmas soirée dressed in white, cream, and crimson (with a touch of gold). Think curated cocktails, sharp fits, and that “last big night before the holidays” kind of energy.
Expect a room full of style, a soundtrack that starts perfect for catching up and ends on the dancefloor, and cocktails that taste as good as they look.
Whether you’re still in Welly or sneaking back for one more night out, this is your reason to celebrate the year - properly.
What to Expect
✨ DJs and live music - smooth early, party late
🍸 Curated festive cocktails & premium bites
📸 Photo moments (because you’ll look too good not to)
🎁 Tiered tickets for those who want more than the standard night out
Tickets
🎟 General Admission - $59 Early Bird / $69 Final
Entry, light festive bites, a welcome glass of bubbly, and entertainment all night.
💎 Premium Experience - $95 Early Bird / $109 Final
Everything in GA plus a 2-hour open bar (7:30-9:30PM; select RTDs, beers, wines + 2 festive cocktails), a reserved leaner or table, and a small take-home gift.
✨ A reserved leaner or table awaits - just tell us who you’re celebrating with when you book.
Dress Code
White and cream with hints of red or gold - refined, stylish, and photo-ready. A little sparkle never hurts.
Music
Early evening DJ set, live music 8:30-9:30PM, then the DJs take it up a notch.
⚠️ Responsible service applies - one drink per person at a time.
⚠️ Strictly an 18+ event.

description:
Doughnuts & Katsu Chicken @ The Churton Park Craft Market, This is a great day out with heaps of things going on at the craft market, a festive cheer, and lots of fun and laughter.
We haven't run a stall in well over a year, with this being our first.
On the day, we'll have sourdough doughnuts and Katsu chicken available. Eftpos is always at our sales.
If you'd like to pre-order, go to our website, order, and then pick up on the day.
We also make mini-celebratory doughnuts, which are 70% the size of our originals, in a boxed selection of all six flavours.
All products can be pre-ordered and picked up on Saturday through our website, or purchased on the day.
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/weekly-menu/
Eftpos and Paywave are always available.
Our regular doughnuts cost $6 each or $22 for a box of 4 doughnuts.
We also offer catering at Family Kitchen with Mark, so if you have a function or need for in-house dining, check out all our packages on our website.
Order our doughnuts from Monday to Saturday. Message Mark the day before (by 8 pm) and arrange pick up from 06:30.
All our doughnuts contain a lively sourdough & biga starter, for a fuller flavour profile and a springy texture.
Have you tried our sourdough doughnuts yet?
Our doughnuts can be pre-ordered and picked up on the day to avoid disappointment (should we run out).
With a new flavour every two weeks, we've created over 200 combinations since we started selling three years ago.
Support has been phenomenal, and we thank everyone so very much indeed for the weekly sales.
Our doughnuts do contain gluten and dairy. Due to production separation when producing dietary doughnuts, we've decided as a company that we won't make any of our doughnuts gluten-free or dairy-free for the time being.
We cater to all special dietary requirements with options available on all of our catering packages.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Kōrero Paki, Kōrero Paki
Performed by Kōrero Paki

Crack open a cold one and get set for a night of mean kōrero and wild comedy from this spontaneous tira whakaari. Delight as our performers talk sh*t, share off the cuff stories, and take the show to wild places through improv. Like all good garage parties, this show will be jam-packed with crack up storytelling, cheeky banter, and plenty of laughs.

Kōrero Paki debuted at NZIF 2024 and had a successful run at the 2025 NZ International Comedy Festival.

Featuring:

Mo (Mamaeroa) Munn
Q Potts
Kipling DC
Lachlan Bowker
Viki Moananu

Kōrero Paki is a Māori and Pacifica improv group who have performed in the NZ International Comedy Fest and the NZ Improv Festival. A group of improvisers and stand up comedians, Kōrero Paki is focused on comedic storytelling improv.

The show contains adult themes and strong language. As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
Ready to Ride: Bike Basics Maintenance Workshop, Learn the basics of bike maintenance at Te Aro Zero Waste!
Want to feel more confident looking after your bike? This hands-on workshop facilitated by EkeRua ReBicycle is the perfect place to start. Whether you’re a daily commuter, weekend rider, or just pulling an old bike out of the shed, EkeRua ReBicycle will walk you through the essentials to keep your wheels spinning smoothly.
This workshop will cover how to:
- Maintain and clean your chain
- Deal with a puncture and change a tyre
- Check your bike is safe and road-ready
You’re encouraged to bring your own bike so you can learn by doing, but it’s totally fine if you don’t - there will be demonstrations and plenty of chances to get involved.

Spaces are limited so book your space online through our website to come along and get your hands a little dirty, and leave with the practical skills to keep your bike in great shape. No prior experience needed - just a willingness to learn!
https://sustaintrust.org.nz/our-events/ready-to-ride-bike-basics-maintenance-workshop
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
September Full Moon Drumming, Please remember this is a ZERO WASTE and *NO ALCOHOL* community gathering.
Kia ora!
Full Moon Drumming Wellington is a registered public event with the Wellington City Council. We are a group of humans from all walks of life who gather under the full moon each month to connect through drumming and dance around the fire. This gathering is participatory, that means if you made it to the circle you are part of the circle. As in Africa, there is no audience! Everyone is invited to participate as part of the ‘chorus’ (singing/clapping), dancing, or drumming.
The event is weather permitting, we check the forecast a few days prior and aim to make a decision the day before the event, although this is not possible and sometimes we make the decision on the day. All updates are posted on the event page.
This gathering is entirely run by volunteers, if you'd like to contribute in any way please get in touch.
There are a few things that we need help with:
- FIREWOOD: Please bring dry firewood as a koha, no wood no fire! Please NOTE we DO NOT burn pallets (due to nails) or treated timber. Driftwood from nearby south coast beaches is often abundant, feel free to post or reach out if you have a vehicle and are keen to help gather firewood on the day of the event.
- BEAUTIFYING THE CIRCLE SPACE: Anyone has fairy lights, oil burners, or is keen to make some signs?
NOTE: We hold a fire permit for this event. For safety reasons we don't allow participants to feed the fire, and while is generally okay to roast some marshmallows early in the evening we don't allow the use the fire for cooking or heating food.
This is an **ALCOHOL FREE EVENT**, please help us uphold this kaupapa and remind those who are unaware and might be new to the event. As hosts we are responsible for your safety and we take that responsibility seriously, especially given that the event is authorised through both fire and event permits. Large, public, all ages gatherings require administration and logistics so please respect this and the guidelines provided.
Princess Bay is within Taputeranga Marine Reserve (https://octopus.org.nz/taputeranga-marine-reserve), we are welcomed to gather each month in this special place so let’s all make sure there is NO RUBBISH LEFT BEHIND and that we take care of the space. Dogs are NOT ALLOWED at the gathering - there are Korora (Blue Pinguins) nesting under the rocks nearby and we've had issues with dogs in the past.
Children are welcome at the fire, though, especially after dark, please make sure that all children have adult supervision, that the supervisors are aware of the children they are looking after, and that the children are aware of who is looking after them.
Feel free to bring:
- Your friends.
- Drums or any percussive instrument.
- Warm clothing; jackets and wool blankets are good.
- Something to seat on (otherwise sand is often wet)
- Drinking water.
- Food, tea to share.
- Your lovely selves.
- Fire spinning kit and fuel.
FIRE SPINNERS: Please take all precautionary safety measures and make sure to set up fire-spinning downwind from the fire circle.
PARKING: There's a parking lot a few hundred meters from the fire circle where there's also public toilets. Please also be aware of our neighbors driveway opposite the stairway and do not park directly in front of it.
CARPOOLING: If you don't have a way to get to Princess Bay, or if you have spare seats in your car, feel free to post it on the event page. The less cars driving the better.
Feel free to share the event page and send an event invite to whomever you feel would be interested, not everyone sees the notifications and advertising
label: Community & Culture

description:
Featherston Christmas Parade 2025, Get ready for a festive celebration in the heart of Featherston!

Decorate your ride-on mower or tractor, gather your friends, dress up in your best holiday style, and join the fun as the parade brings cheer to Featherston’s main street (SH2/Fitzherbert Street). The procession sets off from the corner of Revan and Wakefield Streets, travelling north along SH2 and finishing at Clifford Square.

Everyone is welcome — whether you’re marching, riding, or simply soaking up the atmosphere. Participation is FREE, so bring your creativity and festive spirit!

After the parade, make a day of it. Stay for lunch at one of Featherston’s cosy cafés, bakeries, or eateries, or turn it into a weekend getaway exploring South Wairarapa’s boutique shops, vineyards, coastal scenery, and country walks.

Not dressing up? That’s fine too — come along as a spectator, line the main street, and cheer on the parade participants as Featherston comes alive with Christmas joy complete with Santa in his sleigh.

Participants need to register here: https://form.jotform.com/252601211051841
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Farrago Bazaar: An Immersive experience, Farrago Bazaar: An Immersive experience
Red Scare Theatre Company is proud to present Farrago Bazaar, an original Immersive theatre production with live action role-play elements. Unlike traditional theatre, you will be right in the middle of the action, and will have the power to shape the direction of the story.

400 years after the collapse of capitalism, the town of Farrago is preparing for its annual festival, where visitors from tribes across the continent will join to share food, stories and ideas. Parents and children are reunited; forbidden lovers search for each other; survivors of capitalism's last stronghold seek refuge. Amongst the six intertwining main narratives, the audience members each play characters from the visiting tribes and are free to shape the story as they see fit.

The culmination of artistic director Cassandra Tse’s PhD work into Immersive theatre and marking 12 years of Red Scare Theatre Company, Farrago Bazaar is the company’s most ambitious work yet, with a cast of twenty performers making up the various tribes of this post-post-apocalyptic world.

During the show, audiences can be drawn in to scripted storylines or create their own. As well as exploring the Bazaar – Innermost Gardens, transformed into a bustling market with secrets around every corner – they’ll be treated to a Farragonian feast.

Farrago Bazaar is a one-day experience with only two performances, on Saturday 22nd November: a matinee at 2pm and an evening show at 7pm.

Tickets are available now at https://www.redscare.co.nz/farrago-bazaar
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Whenua Tapu Crematorium Open Day, Whenua Tapu Crematorium Open Day
Built in 1982, Whenua Tapu Crematorium is a beautiful facility that has served thousands of families.

Hear about the history of the chapel and what it’s like to operate a crematorium from the staff that operate it. You can also do a walk-through of the crematorium (optional).

Cremation is the common choice is NZ when it comes to death, with over 70% of Kiwis choosing it. Traditionally Māori and Pacifica families always chose burial, however there is a slow change happening in that space also. We are passionate about de mystifying what cremation is so families can feel informed about the choices they make.

Come along as we open Whenua Tapu Crematorium to the public and answer any questions you may have.


Cost: Free
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/whenua-tapu-crematorium-open-day/


Health & Safety:
Fire alarms on site, first aid kit on site. Staff will act as wardens in emergency.

Plenty of parking on site and toilets on site too.

description:
Hutt City Night Market - Dowse Square - 11 Sepember 2025, Hutt City Night Market - Dowse Square - 11 Sepember 2025
Hutt City Night Market

📍 Location: Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt
📅 Date: Thursday, 11 September 2025
🕓 Time: 4:00 PM – 8:00 PM
💥 Cost: Free Entry

🌙✨ Join us for the Hutt City Night Market – a new weekly night market bringing food, flavour, and fun to the heart of Lower Hutt!

Come down to Dowse Square every Thursday from 4–8PM, rain or shine, and enjoy a handpicked line up of local food trucks serving a delicious range of cuisines. It’s the perfect way to unwind after work, catch up with friends and whānau, and support small local businesses.

Expect:
🍔 Tasty street food from around the world
🎶 Laid-back vibes and community spirit
🛍️ A weekly night out to look forward to

📢 We’ll be announcing weekly vendor line ups and tasty updates on our Wellington Street Eats Hub Facebook page — so be sure to like and follow us to stay in the loop!

This is just the beginning — we’ll be at Dowse Square for the first 4 weeks, before moving to our long-term home on Daly Street by the Riverbank Carpark with even more food trucks!

Bring your appetite, tell your mates, and we’ll see you there!

#HuttCityNightMarket #LowerHuttEats #StreetFoodVibes #SupportLocal #NightMarketNZ

Comedy icon GISH is back with a brand-new tour across Aotearoa. For over 20 years, GISH has been one of New Zealand’s most beloved comedians, famous for his outrageous parodies that mix six strings with dodgy things. Get ready for a night where no song is safe. Joining him is Canadian freestyle sensation Jesse Firebrand, a razor-sharp musical comedian known for lightning-fast improvisation comedy songs, tearing through the Australian scene, with no one in New Zealand doing what he does. Your host for the night is Anthony Wilson, an Auckland-based comic and crowd favourite who has performed across Aotearoa, Australia, and the UK, known for quick wit, polished storytelling, and pub-worthy tales. There will also be a special guest on the night.

Foxtail Events is beyond excited to bring the beloved Botanist Market to the Kāpiti Coast for the very first time — and we can’t wait to share it with you! Join us at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall for a lush, leafy celebration of all things green, gorgeous, and garden-inspired.

Whether you're a seasoned plant whisperer or simply love beautiful spaces filled with botanical charm, this market is your perfect winter escape!

Expect a vibrant mix of:
* Indoor & outdoor plants
* Botanical art, fashion & homewares
* Ceramics, planters & garden decor
* Natural skincare & eco beauty products
* Seedlings, garden tools & plant accessories
... and so much more!

This is more than just a market — it’s a community of plant lovers, creatives, and eco-conscious makers coming together in one gorgeous space.

Come see why the Botanist Market has captured hearts across Wellington — and now, it's your turn, Kāpiti! Bring a friend, bring your plant wishlist, and don’t miss this brand new local gem.

description:
Brank Bjork Trio: Wellington, Brant Bjork has spent over a quarter of a century at the heart of California’s desert rock scene. From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable. Over the past two decades, he has produced albums for other artists, launched numerous side projects, built an extensive solo career as a singer, guitarist, and bandleader, and founded his own record label. His story is one of relentless, boundary-pushing creativity.

In 2024, Bjork re-formed the Brant Bjork Trio, teaming up with Michael Amster (Nebula, Mondo Generator) on drums and longtime friend—and desert rock pioneer—Mario Lalli on bass.

In 2025, the trio heads to New Zealand for three exclusive shows celebrating their latest album, Once Upon a Time in the Desert. This is a rare chance to catch a true icon of desert rock live—an experience not to be missed.

Joining them on all three dates are Australian rockers Full Tone Generator. Born on the beaches of Australia by Andy Fernando and brought to life in the Californian desert, Full Tone Generator brings the heat with a powerful blend of riff-heavy rock and raw energy.

Secure your tickets today!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Kāpiti Food Fair 2025, All FOODIES and your tribe are invited to an exciting and indulgent day out that leaves a lasting impression on food lovers that will have you returning year after year. We take pride in our offering of GOOD food, GOOD music, and GREAT company for food enthusiasts – the ultimate Food Festival with something for everyone backed with a great vibe and professional entertainment to enjoy all day long!
On the menu for 2025 ……. up to 250 vendor sites including an off licence Liquor Zone, a licenced Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage, ANZ Kāpiti Kitchen Demo Stage, Kāpiti Ice Cream Dining Room, FREE Kid’s Zone, ZEAL Zone buskers, roving street performers and much more!
GETTING THERE: Walk | Bike | Drive | FREE bus from Paraparaumu Railway Station
ALL WELCOME + crowd friendly dogs on lead
LOOK out for the NEW shady picnic zone!
THAMES PACIFIC MAIN STAGE
9:45 AM – 9:50 AM | Official Mayoral Opening
10:00 AM – 10:30 AM | Devon Welch Music
10:45 AM – 11:15 AM | Intercite
11:45 AM – 12:45 PM | Jody & the Stowaways
1:15 PM – 2:15 PM | The Beat Girls
2:45 PM – 3:45 PM | The Relatives
4:15 PM – 5:15 PM | Love Shack
MERCHANDISE: $3 Bags, $5 T-towels, $10 Aprons (not sold online)
NOTE: Humanitix booking fees will be added to the cost of your ticket and paid at check-out.  Booking fees cover Humanitix costs, and everything else goes to their education projects that help to change lives.  Kāpiti Food Fair supports Manaiakalani Education Trust for Māori, Pasifika, and disadvantaged learners in Aotearoa to increase student outcomes and get equal access to digital education.
TOP TIPS for a FANTASTIC DAY at the Kāpiti Food Fair
Bring a gold coin for parking donations.
Pack a hat and sunscreen – complimentary SPF is available if you need it.
Bring a picnic blanket to relax, enjoy the ambiance, and savor your treats with plenty of seating and a NEW shaded picnic spot under the trees.
BYO your own chair if you wish and a chilly bin for purchases!
Plan your foodie route with the Site Map >>
Visit the Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage and relax over a craft brew, wine, local cocktails and delicious cider while enjoying the vibe of the 80's to 90's revival party all day long!  Children are welcome with their parent or guardian.  CHEERS to that!
MOST vendors accept EFTPOS or bank transfer.  BYO cash as there is no ATM available.
THANK YOU SPONSORS
Kāpiti Food Fair is a recipient of the Kāpiti Major Events Fund and is supported by numerous local businesses in-kind and reduced cost of services.  The Fair is a commercial event however we have a social agenda too.  We choose to support Kāpiti Community Patrol, Kāpiti Rotary Charitable Trust, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets, Paekākāriki Surf Lifesavers, Paraparaumu College, and Work Ready Kāpiti to help run key logistics on the day. 
Kāpiti Food Fair Ltd is privately owned and operated by Helene Judge and Jeanine van Kradenburg.  The Fair reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.
#KFF2025 #FoodFestival #KāpitiFoodFair #SomethingForEveryone #VisitKāpiti
Website >> | Facebook >> | Instagram >> | YouTube >> | TikTok >>

description:
Āhuru Mōwai Trust High Sensory Session, Āhuru Mōwai Trust High Sensory Sessions are held weekly at Chipmunks Playland Tawa.
Session Details:
When: Thursdays (Yes, even in the school holidays!)
Time: 5:30pm-8:00pm
Cost: $10 per family (immediate, not extended)
Who: children/young adults with special needs and their parents, guardians, family members, carers, siblings.
On Thursday's we also host Music Therapy Taster Sessions with our friends from the Little Musical Caravan. There is an additional activity fee of $5 per child to participate in that activity and a booking is required, If you are interested in these sessions register your interest directly with LMC via https://www.littlemusicalcaravan.co.nz/contact/
If you are looking to have a birthday celebration at one of these sessions please txt Paul on 0272787087, or message us in advance. We would also encourage you to make use of a party room to host additional guests (an extra charge would apply to guests)
Come along in any dynamic that suits the family, to these relaxed and open sessions for families and kids living with special needs of all kinds.
Although we cannot cater to everyone's needs, we will do our best to support families to overcome obstacles to attend the sensory sessions.
Please speak with trustees regarding concerns.
(I.D or needs verification may be required at Trustee discretion).
Disclaimer: WE WILL GENTLY AND KINDLY TURN AWAY ANYONE WE FEEL SHOULD NOT BE THERE, AND WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO DO SO.

description:
MARKET DAY - Wellington Office Clear-out Friday 12th Cuba Street, Everything must go - Market Day sale, beautiful items for sale on Cuba Street.
We’re moving!! After 10 years, Dev Academy is moving from Cuba Street to two/fiftyseven on Willis Street. We’re excited to be running bootcamps from their lush socially conscious space in the city from Oct.
But first, we need your help to pack down our Cuba Street campus. We are hosting a MARKET DAY where you can pick up stuff for your home or office!
We have couches, desks, plants, art, monitors, noise-cancelling stations, kitchen gear, and all sorts of Dev Academy treasures – all cared for, and ready for new homes
- Desks for all prices , couches $50-150
- Monitors starting at $30 and plants from $25
- And noise-cancelling stations from $100
- All negotiable and bulk prices available
Please note
- Payment by cash or bank transfer (no cards)
- Take your goodies home on the day - or organise collection with the team
Come for the bargains, stay for a last walk through an iconic piece of Wellington’s tech education history. Together, let’s celebrate the impact this space has had and send it off with aroha

description:
Mangaroa Farms Open Day 2025, Mangaroa Farms Open Day 2025
It’s that time again whānau - Open Day is back at Mangaroa Farms 🙌🏽🌻☀️

Join us Saturday 1st November from 9am - 3pm for a full day of music, kai, community, and whenua. Our last Open Day saw over 1500 people through the gates - this time we’re aiming for even bigger.

FEATURING:
- Garden tours with Cam & team (these always sell out so book your spot on our website
- Permaculture orchard tours & explore our first polyculture maze
- Live music from Casual Healing & friends
- Farm-fresh kai featuring our famous smoked lamb buns, sausages, veggies & more
- Market stalls, Coffee cart & other artisan producers
- Farm demos, including sheep dogs, ponies & more
- Kids zone, crafts & a range of activities
- Access to our full 4km Farm Trail Loop

General entry is FREE.
Garden tours $20 (kids come free).

So bring along the whole whānau, meet the animals, soak up the vibes, and enjoy a real day on the farm.

Volunteer spots are open too. If you want to get involved, email or head to the link in our bio.

Our Farm Shop will be open all day from 9am - 5pm, with fresh produce, local goods, and regenerative meat from our pastures.

Register here https://store.mangaroa.org/products/mangaroa-farms-open-day-sat-1st-november

📍 Visit us at Mangaroa Farm Shop / Kete Kai, 98 Whitemans Valley Road, Upper Hutt

#mangaroafarms #openday #regenerativeagriculture #whanau #upperhutt #farmshop #soilhealth #localfood

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presents REAR WINDOW (1954), Welcome to the Wairarapa Cinematheque
Film lovers in the Wairarapa have a new home for cinema. The Wairarapa Cinematheque launches in 2025 with a curated programme of classics, contemporary gems, and cult favourites — films you rarely get to see on the big screen.
2025 Screening Programme
Sunday 28 September, 7:30pm – Rear Window (1954)
Alfred Hitchcock’s suspense masterpiece starring James Stewart and Grace Kelly.
Sunday 26 October, 7:30pm – Rochelle (2024) & Bellbird (2019)
Two powerful New Zealand films showcasing extraordinary local storytelling.
Sunday 30 November, 7:30pm – Run Lola Run (1998)
A thrilling, kinetic ride through fate, love, and chance in this German cult classic.
Ticket Options
Three Movie Membership – the best value! Secure your seat for all three screenings and enjoy the full Cinematheque experience. Membership cards will be issued at our first screening, which is REAR WINDOW (1954). Please arrive 15 minutes early to collect your membership cards/ticket.
Single Ticket – perfect for sampling the magic on opening night.
Tickets are available through Humanitix or cash door sales on the night.
Join us in celebrating film, artistry, and community in the Wairarapa.
label: Film & Media

description:
Electra Business After Five - MONDAY 22 September 2025, September Electra BA5 Showcase 
Woodhaven Gardens 
Join us for an exclusive behind-the-scenes experience at Woodhaven Gardens, one of Horowhenua’s largest and most community-minded businesses.

Join us for a rare behind-the-scenes look at Woodhaven Gardens, one of Horowhenua’s largest and most innovative businesses.
Founded in 1978, Woodhaven now spans 1,800+ hectares, grows over 20 vegetable varieties, and employs 250+ staff. 
Discover how they combine tech innovation, sustainability, and community investment to contribute $30–35M annually to Horowhenua’s GDP.

Speakers:
Emma Clarke – Woodhaven Gardens: Innovation, sustainability, and community impact.
Deborah Manning ONZM – Founder of KiwiHarvest & NZ Food Network: Transforming NZ’s food rescue and sustainability landscape.
You are invited to view Woodhaven's operations from 5.30-6 pm before the speakers begin. 
Deborah Manning ONZM, Lawyer turned social entrepreneur who is a trailblazer in sustainability and food security, transforming New Zealand’s food rescue landscape through her venture KiwiHarvest, and the New Zealand Food Network. In 2025, Deborah was awarded the New Zealand Sustainability Leader of the Year Award at the Kiwibank New Zealander of the Year Awards.
Horowhenua Mana Kai Network, born from a January 2025 hui on rising food insecurity, the Mana Kai Network connects local kai initiatives to create long-term change. Hear how this community-led, Council-supported collaboration is improving food access and equity across Horowhenua.
WOODHAVEN GARDENS
44 Joblins Road, Levin
Monday 22nd September 2025
5.30-7 pm  

This event is in partnership with Woodhaven Gardens, Horowhenua District Council, Mana Kai and Muaūpoko Tribal Authority.

Tickets $10pp
(No door sales. High-vis vests provided – no high heels please.)

description:
Old St Paul's Craft & Curio Market, Discover Wellington’s Most Enchanting Market!
Set against the breathtaking backdrop of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most iconic heritage landmarks, the Old St Paul’s Craft & Curio Market is a boutique shopping experience like no other.
As part of this year’s Wellington Heritage Festival, the grounds of Old St Paul’s will be transformed into a vibrant marketplace filled with handpicked stalls offering treasures and treats you won’t find anywhere else. Explore lovingly crafted leather goods, upcycled garments, wellness creations, handmade chocolates, collectibles and curiosities, houseplants, dyed wool, children’s accessories, fine embroidery, jams and preserves, artisan breads and baked goods, Christmas decorations, candles, and so much more.
But it’s not just shopping – this is a day steeped in atmosphere. The lawn and forecourt will come alive with heritage-themed games and activities, alongside captivating live demonstrations from the Wellington Embroiderers’ Guild and the Wellington Combined Society of Bellringers.
With its central location just minutes from the Railway Station and bus hub – and plenty of on-street parking – this is your chance to enjoy a heritage day out that’s easy to get to, and unforgettable once you arrive.
Fun for the whole whānau, supporting the ongoing care of this national treasure.
Schedule:
Guided tours of Old St Paul's: 10.30am/11.30am
Wellington Combined Society of Bellringers demonstration: 12.00pm-12.45pm
Wellington Embroiderers' Guild stitching demonstration: 10.00am-2.00pm
Organ performance: 1.00pm-2.00pm
Koha entry. Refreshments available.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Open Day at Kumutoto Forest, The Kumutoto Restoration Project is celebrating one year of restoration at the Kumutoto ngahere and awa and we would like to celebrate with you! Join us on Sunday 14 September from 10am - 2pm for a day of engaging workshops and activities!!
This is a kids-friendly day, with a childrens workstation, forbuilding and other family activities.
Workshops and acitvities include...
• Invertebrate studies
• Water testing
• Understanding fish passageways
• Stormwater networks
• Karaka berry foraging
• DIY Tracking tunnels
The day will also have a food truck and guided tours of the awa and forest trap line.
Come and celebrate the first year restoring the mauri and mana of this wāhi tūpuna urban stream and forest.

description:
Ecstatic Dance Wellington, Ecstatic Dance Wellington
💫 Move. Release. Connect. The first Ecstatic Dance Wellington is here — come celebrate our launch at Vogelmorn with DJ Kimba Jade on the decks. 🌙❤️

🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington – Launch Event ✨🌟

With DJ Kimba Jade @ Vogelmorn, Wellington

Kimba Jade & Bernie Cruise are thrilled to bring Ecstatic Dance Wellington to life! 🎉 This is the launch event, and we can’t wait to co-create the first of many transformational dance journeys with you.

💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.

Please note, that this Ecstatic Dance is not verbally guided, we let the music guide you 😊. Dance freely how your body moves you.

🎶 This Dance Floor
Guided by DJ Kimba Jade, expect an immersive journey through deep bass, tribal rhythms, and global soundscapes that awaken both body and spirit. With over 24 years behind the decks—including 8 years dedicated to Ecstatic Dance—Kimba crafts transformative spaces of joy, release, and connection. Originally from Auckland, she curated Alchemic Dance Floor events for 5 years, now co-runs the Ecstatic Dance Festival, and leads Alchemic Ecstatic Dance DJ Trainings. She’s thrilled to share her magic and move with you on the dance floor!

🎶 The Sound System
Here at Ecstatic Dance Wellington, we believe in using a phat sound system with lots of bass for our dances. We will be bringing an ultra vibey and super bassy experience for you!


🗓 Event Details
📍 Vogelmorn, 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington
🕖 7:00pm – Opening Circle
🕢 7:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 8:45pm – Closing Circle
🕘 9:00pm – Chai & Chocolate (for those wanting to socialise)

🎟 Tickets
$25 online
https://events.humanitix.com/ecstatic-dance-wellington

$30 cash on the door

**If you would like to come but are unwaged or struggling, please send us a message directly, we'd love to help.

☀️ Extra Info
- Beanbags are provided for the end relaxation.
- Doors will open at 6.45pm for you to socialise in the lobby, we'll start promptly at 7pm.

We are very much looking forward to joining the conscious dance community in Wellington and sharing our magic.

❤️ What to Bring

Water bottle

Loose, comfy clothes

Warm layers for afterwards

A friend!

🌟 Guidelines

Drug & alcohol free event

Silence on the dance floor

No phones/cameras on the dance floor

Respect the space & each other 😊

🎧 Tune into Kimba’s ED sets:
Mixcloud: https://www.mixcloud.com/kimbajade/

✨ Come help us launch Ecstatic Dance Wellington — a night of music, movement & magic. ✨

description:
Lunch & Learn with David Trubridge, Join us for a very special Teulo Lunch & Learn, where design, sustainability, and community regeneration come together.
Hosted by Häfele and Teulo, this intimate event features internationally renowned designer David Trubridge and the global launch of his newest portable light: Dusk.
Enjoy lunch and conversation with peers from across the design and construction industry, with MC DK guiding the session.
What to Expect
Keynote: Think Like a Tree
In his 20-minute talk on biophilic design, David Trubridge shares how we can learn from trees and forests to design healthier, more sustainable spaces.
Film Screening: Think Like a Forest
This short film from Pure Advantage highlights the Recloaking Papatūānuku movement, an ambitious initiative to restore more than 2 million hectares of native forest and wetland in Aotearoa. Featuring Sam the Trap Man and local kaitiaki, it’s both an inspiration and a call to action.
Global Launch: The Dusk Lamp
Be among the first to experience Dusk, David’s most portable light yet, inspired by his collaboration with Pure Salt’s Tamatea Art Project in Fiordland. A new short documentary will showcase the story behind the design and the environmental partnership that shaped it. A portion of all sales will support Pure Salt’s conservation efforts in Dusky Sound.
Local Conservation Panel
Hear from organisations leading vital regeneration work, including the Maraetōtara Tree Trust, Esk River planting projects, and Te Mata Peak Park restoration, and learn how you can get involved.
Why Attend?
This Lunch & Learn is more than a product launch or film screening — it’s a chance to connect with the design community, hear from one of New Zealand’s most iconic designers, and explore practical steps toward a regenerative future.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Plant Sale, I have had great success with NZ and imported seed propagation this year so we have a wonderful range of plants ready to go in the ground now.
Some varieties are extremely limited due to the cost of the imported seed and the tiny amount of seeds per packet (only 5 in some cases).
We will be accepting preorders by messenger so get in quick if you don't want to miss out on these special plants.
Please note: Our garden will not be open during the plant sale. We aim to open in approximately 5 weeks but it depends how the tulips progress.
As other plants reach maturity we will make them available for sale on our open days. We have decided to have a pre season sale to make room for more beauties.
Abutilon - a range of mixed colours including peach, rose and lemon.
Dwarf Agapanthus - a fine leaved pale blue variety. Great for edging paths and beds. Will not take over.
Aubretia - Lavender trailing plant for rock walls and garden edges.
Arabis - White blooming Spring groundcover
Ajuga - Pink and purple varieties. Great November blooming groundcover for damp areas.
Aster - Early summer flowering variety in blue/lavender
Calamintha - new for us so I shall borrow the Chiltern seeds description. This is a most pleasant plant for your border or herb garden. Heavily scented with a fragrance described as pennyroyal-like, it is an erect perennial with small, somewhat hairy leaves. In summer it bears numerous whorled spikes of tiny blue flowers with long purple bracts. The herb can be used for flavouring. Flowers the first year from seed. 1½ft (45cm).
Campanula glomerata - deep purple
Cerastium - grey trailing leaves smothered in white blooms in Spring. (These have just been cut back)
Cerinthe - By popular demand. Technically an annual but a non invasive self sowing one so once its in your garden you'll have more each year. Glaucous foliage and interesting pendular purple blooms.
Dianthus - Grey leaves and red blooms
Erigeron multiradiatus - A beautiful evergreen groundcover with yellow centred purple/blue daisies from late spring.
Erysimum - a specialty for us as we love them so much. What's not to love? Front to mid border, semi shrubby evergreen perennial, glorious scented blooms and we have individual named colours.
Ivory, Purple bi-colour, Fire King, Vulcan, Ellen Willmott, Primrose, Ruby gem, Siberian allionii and the brand new Tangerine Titan.
Euphorbia - golden foam. Another newbie for us but we love the the chartreuse euphorbias add to the garden so we had to give it a go.
Euphorbia characias - the blue leaved evergreen semi shrubs with huge chartreuse heads that grace our garden every spring.
Geum - Yes, you guessed it, another favourite of ours. We have a good stock of the common types plus some more unusual ones.
Tall - Yellow, Red and Orange (Firestorm).
Dwarf - Deep orange/red, Lemon with hints of pink, blush (very pale pink) and the original geum rivale in a beautiful coppery peach.
Lunaria (Honesty). Two types available. Chedglow the purple leaf version that has taken Chelsea by storm the last couple of years. Variegata - the green leaves become edged in white in their second year before blooming with the typical mauve flowers.
Lysimachia nummularis - yellow creeping jenny. Great lime leaf trailing plant for part shady damp areas. One only.
Orlaya grandiflora - another favourite among designers. A self sowing annual that will provide weeks of beautiful white lacecap flowers. Perfect for filling in border spaces until the summer perennials fill in or to give a light airy feel to meadows and spring plantings. Seedlings will return year after year.
Pelargonium - Deep red
Pulmonaria - Raspberry splash
Romulea - small bulbs grow fine grassy leaves before erupting into a mass of deep rosy purple crocus type flowers in late spring.
Scabiosa - another specialty plant for us as they provide such amazing flower power all summer and autumn. They are not frost hardy but are perennial in sheltered spots for at least 3 years. Enjoy the flowers and at the end of the season collect several packets worth of seed to multiply your stock.
Named varieties available:
Snowmaiden - white, Black Knight - deep maroon, Beaujolias Bonnets - a gorgeous blend of pink, white and burgundy on the same flower, Burgundy beau - a new one this year, Salmon Queen - the most delicious shade of salmon pink. Pale yellow Fata morgana, and blue ones will be available later in the season.
Stachys officinalis - dark pink flowered evergreen groundcover. Perfect for the front of garden beds and rock gardens.
Sissyrinchium blue eyed grass. Low grassy leaves burst in to a mass of blue star shaped flowers in Spring.
Sedum mexicana - a bright lime evergreen succulent groundcover. Perfect for supporting bold tulips in spring and bright perennials in summer.
Sedum Mr Goodbud. A slightly pinker version than the well known Autumn joy.
Sparaxia - very special maroon flowers. Couple only.
Symphytum grandiflora - low-lying evergreen groundcover with medium sized leaves and stunning cream bell flowers all through spring. Excellent spreading plant for difficult to grow areas such as the shade of evergreen trees.
Urospermum - sown last spring and flowered for the first time in summer. Don't be put off by its dandelion looking leaves. This is a beauty with huge lemon flowers ( yes again like a dandelion but oh so much more beautiful). It has survived a wet winter in our gravel garden and also in soil. Definitely not a weed!
Violets - green leaf with white scented flowers and the later flowering purple leaved Viola labadorica with purple flowers.

description:
Steiner School Fair 2025, Nau Mai Haere Mai ki te Raphael House Steiner School Fair. The School Fair is our major annual fundraiser hosted by the school community. Its purpose is to celebrate the school’s education and culture with the wider Wellington Community.

Each year students, teachers and parents work together to transform the school environment. Activities, displays, artistic presentations, gift stalls and food offerings provide a venue for community engagement that is a highlight on the school’s annual calendar.

Dive into a world of magic and imagination at our Annual Fair! Join us for a day fueled by holistic education, creative adventures and community togetherness.

Throughout the year, parents, students and teachers get together to transform our school into a mystical, sensory wonderland.

Explore and shop from a delightful array of unique, handcrafted crafts, toys, and Seasonal treats. This is where nature, creativity and heartwarming experiences come together to nurture young minds and inspire families.

Kindergarten parents create small gifts, from natural, materials which the young child will receive in the Little Peoples room. The handwork room is lovingly and thoughtfully prepared with the sensory experiences and impressions of the young child in mind.

Other parents are busy with tasks like creating Christmas crackers and decorations and researching new and exciting tantalizing recipes for the two cafes.

The Teaching faculty gathers students' work, from Kindergarten to Class 12 (Year 13), which are on display in the Eurythmy Room. If you have ever wondered what a main lesson book is you are bound to find one, or more, here!

To ensure there is fun for everyone we even create games to play both indoors and out. Then to add to the atmosphere during the day you will hear the sound of music and singing, and even some dancing while enjoying an organic coffee. The School Fair is a great day for all.

Skip the traffic - There is very limited parking around the school area, so please make use of our Fair Shuttle Bus - every 30 minutes to and from Melling Station. Gold coin per person per trip.

description:
Water Casting - Spring, This is a super quick 3-hour session, and is great fun to do with family or friends.
Water casting is a really hands-on low-tech casting method that results in surprising and fun little forms that can be turned into pendants with amazing textures and shapes.
You will be guided through melting silver and pouring it into water to create little charms.
Experiment with pouring at different heights to create different shapes.
Choose one or a few of your favourites to have drilled and turn into simple pendants or earrings, or new charms for your bracelets!
We will use hardened jump rings to attach your water-cast pieces to either colourful cord or you can choose sterling silver chains which you can purchase for extra.
The technique will be demonstrated with important health and safety practices, then students will be guided to do at least a couple of casts, and should expect to have at least one successful item to clean up and finish in the class.
A basic amount of metal allowance of a small amount of silver is included in your course costs, and if your projects go over that amount you can pay for the metal you use on the day via internet banking or cash.
This course is open to complete beginners and advanced makers. Extra materials such as chains and findings are available to purchase.
For health and safety reasons class participants must wear sturdy, closed toe shoes and have their hair tied back.
Workshop fee $128, Early bird $115 till 17 August.

description:
Trap-NZ Workshop, Trap-NZ Workshop
Join us for a hands-on workshop that empowers you to make a difference in your backyard and beyond!



Whether you're a seasoned trapper or just starting out, this free community event will teach you how to use TRAP NZ, New Zealand’s leading predator control platform.



Reino Grundling will show you how to track pests, record trap data, and support conservation efforts that protect our precious native species like kiwi, tūī, and kererū.

📍 Where: Carterton Courthouse, Holloway Street Carterton
📅 When: Saturday 20 September 2025 10am -12 noon
🎟️ Cost: Free
🧰 Bring: Smartphone or tablet (if you have one), enthusiasm, and questions!

What you'll gain:

Tips for setting and managing traps effectively

Skills to use TRAP NZ for recording and reporting activity

Knowledge about the impact of predator control on local biodiversity

Connections with like-minded conservation champions

🌱 Let’s work together to protect what makes Aotearoa unique. Light refreshments provided. This workshop is made possible with funding from WBS.

Spots are limited — register now by emailing
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
The Mad Hatter's Market Express, The Mad Hatter's Market Express

Journey with Steam Inc on this return trip to the Woodville Mad Hatter's Market Day!

Bring the family up into the heart of the Manawatu on the steam train, and enjoy a fun filled day at Woodville's famed Mad Hatter's Market Day. Hauled by Ja 1271, our 1956 built steam locomotive. Join the train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin or Palmerston North. Upon arrival at Woodville, there is the option to walk up to the square, or travel by shuttle bus up.

Woodville 150th Mad Hatter's Day
Since 2017, the local Woodville community have hosted this special event in the heart of the township celebrating all thing's 'mad'! Bring the kids along for a children's tea party and old time games - with a particular focus on steampunk. Featuring live music, over 70 market stalls and most importantly - the annual Crazy Hat Competition! Last year, people on our train took away 1st place!

Spot prizes are to be given out throughout the day for best costumes and hats, and an array of vouchers will also be up for grabs!

Please be at your boarding station minimum 10 minutes prior ready to roll, with your tickets, carriage number and seating allocations at the ready.

Please note that if booking online, our booking system does add on a small percentage to the above fares. Steam Incorporated does not see this revenue.

Mad Hatters Menu
The wonderful team has put together an array of food trucks for all to enjoy at the market, and you can also support the local cafes of Woodville township. There will also be tea/coffee available on board the train, along with some alcoholic beverages and light snacks.

We can cater for larger group bookings - these are best dealt with directly through us by emailing admin@steaminc.org.nz or contacting 0800 783 264.

Book the Mad Hatters Market Express!
All seating is reserved and allocated on these special experiences. Prior booking is essential.

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!

🎉 Celebrating 11 epic years of magical mayhem on the road! 🎉

New Zealand’s biggest and most fabulous travelling fair is rolling back into town – and you’re invited!

We’re bringing grassroots charm, vintage flair, and old-school fun to town – a joyride for all ages! Whether you’re 5 or 95, there’s something here to make your heart happy.

💫 FREE ENTRY for kids! Gold coin for adults – that’s it!
Get ready for a weekend packed full of FREE entertainment the whole whānau will love.

Expect a kaleidoscope of colour, creativity, and community vibes with:

description:
The Waikanae Beach Monthly Indoor Market, Enjoy a Sunday outing with your family by visiting this great Community Market where you will discover handmade treasures and local creativity by highly talented stallholders where every piece tells a story.

You will find a huge variety of quality items and GIFTS plus local natural Honey, Prenzels, Oils and Sauces.

Bring the Kids along so they can meet local author Michael Peryer and view his latest Children's Adventure Books. Jane will also be there with her hand made Crochet Toys along with Helen and her incredible range of Children's Dress Ups and Dolls Clothes.

Meet up with Friends and enjoy a day out on the Kapiti Coast and visit this great friendly Community Market then spend the rest of the day at other events and attractions including a visit to our awesome cafes.

Don't miss it... support local!
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Thorndon Fair 2025, Thorndon Fair 2025
Wellington’s iconic street fair is back!

Since 1977, the Thorndon Fair has been a highlight of the capital’s summer calendar — and in 2025, we’re bringing the energy, creativity and community spirit back to the streets of Thorndon.

With over 250 stallholders from across Aotearoa, this is your chance to discover:
🖼️ Unique art and crafts
🍴 Delicious food and drink
👚 Fashion, accessories and lifestyle products
📚 Books, gifts, toys, and treats for pets
🌿 Outdoor and experience products
🎶 Live music and entertainment all day

Whether you're shopping, looking for a fun day out with the whānau, or just love a good local market — there’s something for everyone.

Around 40% of our stallholders travel 100km or more to be here, so many of the products you’ll find are unique to Wellington on the day.

🎈 Follow our page for sneak peeks, giveaways, and stallholder showcases as we count down to the big day.
📲 Click "Going" and invite your friends — let's make this our biggest fair yet!

description:
Wellington Branch - Pre-Conference Networking Event, Will you be in town for the CIPS NZ Procurement Futures Conference 2025 on Thursday 30 October?
Don't miss an opportunity to start your networking early... 💬 
Catch up with people you already know, meet new faces and exchange ideas before discovering what’s next for the Procurement and Supply profession at the Conference.
Event Details:
📅 Date: Wednesday 29 October 
🕒 Time: 5:30pm - 7:30pm (NZDT)
📍 Location: Foxglove Bar & Kitchen - 33 Queens Wharf, Wellington, 6011
If you haven't got your tickets for the CIPS NZ Procurement Futures Conference yet, there are still some available, purchase today so you don't miss out!

Please be sure to register so we can ensure we secure enough space at the venue.
Registering for this event will opt you in to receive a post event feedback survey. We appreciate any feedback you are willing to provide CIPS and your local branch to help the continuous improvements of events. There is no obligation to complete this survey.

description:
Titahi Bay Christmas Fair, Titahi Bay Christmas Fair
Welcome to the annual Titahi Bay Christmas Fair, join us on the 21st December at Kura Park, Titahi Bay from 10am to 3pm for a fun family day out just on Christmas.

Our gold coin gate fundraiser this year is Wellington Free Ambulance, look out for the buckets at the gates, please dig a little deep every dollar helps.

We have a great selection of children's entertainment rides and over 160 stallholders showcasing their quality artisan crafted goods.

Fair day is a good time top stock up on those sauces and condiments, crackers from our local artisan food stalls for the BBQ season or as gifts this Christmas.

Join us for brunch/lunch with over 30 foodies covering every corner of the globe to tempt those taste buds.

Friendly reminder to bring some cash as some stalls and foodies do not have eftpos and we are some distance to the nearest atm .

See you on the 21st December

description:
Upper Hutt Car Boot Sale, Join us on Saturday 18 October 2025 from 10am to 1pm for a fun-filled morning of buying and selling.

Get ready for a fantastic opportunity to declutter and turn your unwanted items into someone else’s treasure. The Car Boot Sale at RACE Trentham is the perfect event to have a declutter and earn some extra Christmas cash.

Or, if you’re on the hunt for a bargain, this is your moment! Find hidden gems, and support local sellers – all in one fun morning out! Wander through a great mix of second-hand goods, vintage treasures, pre-loved clothing, books, toys, homewares and more. With something different in every boot, you never know what you’ll come across. You know what they say one man's trash is another man's treasure.

description:
2025 Poetry Competition | Open mic poetry night, It’s not Tomorrow | Āpōpō yet, but it will be soon. Our libraries are celebrating Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day with an Open Mic Night at Paraparaumu Library.
This year we received 219 poems for our annual ‘If you’re a poet we want to know it’ competition and we'll be announcing the winners at the event. You'll also be able to purchase your very own copy of the 2025 print edition of Tomorrow | Āpōpō, an anthology of poetry entered in this year's competition.
Come along to share a poem or simply enjoy the lyrical lines penned by our local poets at this friendly and inclusive event.

description:
Wainuiomata Artisan Craft Market (20/09/25), Wainuiomata Artisan Craft Market (20/09/25)
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans while creating opportunities to engage with Wainuiomata’s community and identity.

description:
Carols in Mahara Place from Kāpiti Chorale, Carols in Mahara Place from Kāpiti Chorale
🎄 Carols in Mahara Place

Come and enjoy an hour of Christmas music in the heart of Waikanae! ✨

Kāpiti Chorale will be singing in Mahara Place on Saturday 13 December from 10am to 11am, in collaboration with the Waikanae Business Association. It is a free and easygoing event, lovely if you are spending your morning in Waikanae.

Ann-Marie Stapp will be directing and Wes Brown will be accompanying the choir on keyboard. The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming. Last year people gathered around the square, children wandered closer to listen and the whole place felt warm and festive.

Stay for a song or stay for the whole hour. We would love to share a bit of Christmas cheer with you and hope to see you there! 🎶

description:
Wellington Baby Expo 2026, Wellington Baby Expo 2026
NZ Baby Expo is coming to Wellington for another fantastic show! Discover all you need to know for you, your pregnancy or young child.

About this Event


WELLINGTON - 6th & 7th June
Lower Hutt Events Centre, 9am - 4pm daily.
Free Tickets Online for a limited time (Valid for single use on any expo day)
$5 adult door sales available
Win spot prizes just by being there from 2pm – 4pm

Get your Free Ticket Online and automatically go in the draw to WIN an Edwards & Co Olive Bundle valued at $2320

Expo Info
Discover all you need to know for yourself, your pregnancy or your young child.

description:
Wairarapa Bookshop Hop 2025, The best booksellers in Wairarapa have come together to give you the ultimate book-lovers day out in celebration of New Zealand Bookshop Day.

This year, you can collect stamps from 13 new and used Wairarapa Bookshops and enjoy a range of other bookish events all day long.

One of the (many) great things about Wairarapa is we have 13 fantastic bookshops all within an easy 30 minute drive of one another, so it's entirely possible for you to hop around all 13 bookshops in a single day.

Celebrate NZ Bookshop Day with a Wairarapa wide Bookshop Hop. It's your chance to win lots of prizes and stock up your bookshelf.

STEP 1:
Pick up an official passport from any of the participating bookshops - available from all participating stores from Friday October 10th.

STEP 2:
Collect a stamp from each store you visit and make a purchase. Each stamp is an entry into the prize draws for $1,000 in bookshop vouchers.

STEP 3:
Leave your stamped entry with the last bookshop you visit.

This event happens rain or shine!

Register for free to stay up to date and for an extra chance to win a prize: bookshopday.nz/

description:
Wellington City Libraries' Clawsome Annual Book Sale, 26–29 Sept 2025 | 10am–4pm
St Patrick’s College Hall, Kilbirnie
There’ll be everything from tall tails and non-fiction to pukapuka for the kids so it’s a purrfect time to start, or maybe complete, your own collection. Pre-loved, good condition items are sold as is, with no refunds.
Sale tables are replenished more often than a cat licks its whiskers, so you’ll want to keep coming back…just like the proverbial cat.
We’re feline generous - with some items priced from as low as 50 cents. Others are between $1−$5 or individually marked. Cash and Eftpos payment options are available.
The hall is accessible and reasonably close to buses, with parking on-site and on-street.
Avid, curious, and occasional readers - everyone is welcome. See you at the book sale!

description:
2025 Big Bash with Orchestra Wellington, 2025 Big Bash with Orchestra Wellington
✨REGISTRATION IS OPEN!✨

Follow this link to register for the 2025 Big Bash:

Complete the registration form and check your E-mail to receive the link to music PDFs.

ABOUT THE BIG BASH

First held in 2020, Orchestra Wellington's Big Bash is an annual mass play-in event which brings together hundreds of instrumentalists from across the Wellington region in a glorious afternoon of music-making.

Conducted by Orchestra Wellington's Music Director Marc Taddei, together we will rehearse then perform a selection of much-loved works. This year's repertoire includes Tchaikovsky's Romeo & Juliet Fantasy Overture and 1812 Overture!

Anyone is welcome to come along and watch both the rehearsal and the performance entirely for FREE. Rehearsal runs from 1-3pm with the concert starting at 3:30pm.

FOR PARTICIPANTS:
There are some important things to note before you arrive for this year's Big Bash:

👉 Location: Lower Hutt Events Centre at 30c Laings Road, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010.

👉 Timings: Please arrive no later than 12:45pm. Rehearsal runs from 1-3pm, then a short break before our free concert for community, family, and friends at 3:30pm.

👉 Bring with you: Your instrument(s), a music stand, a pencil, and any mutes or accessories that may be required (as per your part).

👉 This year's repertoire includes Tchaikovsky's Romeo & Juliet Fantasy Overture and 1812 Overture! Complete the registration form and check your E-mail to receive the link to music PDFs.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
midweek melters 004 ft. phrase, baeoli, gunn & zante, Your favourite midweek dnb night is back!
Midweek Melters 004 featuring PHRASE, BAEOLI, GUNN & ZANTE
We took a break last month for the warehouse rave, but now we’re heading back to Valhalla for the first Thursday of October. Inspired by tales of old and the days back when people used to party all week, we’re bringing some of that madness back into the fold with a hand picked lineup of some our favourite drum n bass/jungle selectors.
Free early birds are available online.. lock in and prepare for another night of quality tuneage!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Alexandr Misko - The International Guitar Sensation LIVE at Old St Paul’s | Wellington, The international guitar sensation brings his groundbreaking stage show to New Zealand shores for the very first time!
May 31 at Old St Paul's, Wellington
2:30pm doors / 3:00pm show
Seated Concert
FAMILY FRIENDLY with $20 tickets for under 18s
Hailed as “the future of guitar” (Total Guitar), Misko is a globally renowned virtuoso known for his jaw-dropping technique, emotional depth, and genre-defying style. Fusing classical precision with elements of jazz, rock, and modern fingerstyle, his performances are both technically astonishing and deeply moving.
Misko’s self-taught, boundary-pushing approach has captivated millions online, earning him a massive global following and praise from some of the world’s top music publications. With lightning-fast fingerpicking, percussive tapping, and masterful arrangements, he transforms a single acoustic guitar into an entire musical universe — live and without loops.
A must-see for fans of instrumental brilliance, next-level guitar playing, and world-class musical storytelling!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY
“Misko is the future of guitar.” — Total Guitar
“A one-of-a-kind performance that will leave you speechless.” — The Guardian
“Alexandr Misko redefines guitar playing with every note he plays.” — MusicRadar
“A mesmerizing display of technical brilliance and raw emotion.” — Rolling Stone “A true guitar prodigy.” — Guitar World
“An artist who combines virtuosic technique with deep musical expression.” — Guitar Player
Tickets are VERY limited for these intimate concerts — don’t miss out on seeing live music at its finest!
Old St Paul’s is a stunning example of Gothic Revival architecture, constructed entirely from native timbers and consecrated in 1866. Its soaring wooden arches, stained glass windows, and rich acoustics make it a sought-after venue for a variety of events. The church offers seating for up to 460 guests, with facilities including a grand piano, organ, and a bar licence. While on-site catering isn't available, nearby venues such as Loaves & Fishes Hall, the Royal Society of New Zealand, and the Thistle Inn provide excellent options for receptions and gatherings. Located at 34 Mulgrave Street in Thorndon, Old St Paul’s is easily accessible by public transport and offers a serene setting for weddings, concerts, memorials, and other significant events.

description:
Comfy Concert 5 at The Long Hall - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble performance for Arohanui Strings+, � Join us for an afternoon of beautiful music and community spirit! �
Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View! Relax with a cuppa while listening to expertly curated chamber music featuring Helene, Rolf, and top musicians at an intimate venue in one of Wellington’s most stunning locations.
Helen Pohl (violin) and Rolf Gjelsten (cello), as the Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, are getting together with friends to play a series of intimate concerts that support some of their favourite causes – Arohanui Strings+ included (www.arohanuistrings.org).
Comfy Concert No.5 with Bridget Douglas (flute) and Victoria Jaenecke (viola) on August 30, 2025, playing:
Tabea Squire - Daydream and Dance for violin and cello
JS Bach – Sonata No. 1 in G minor for violin solo
Heitor Villa-Lobos – The Jet Whistle for flute and cello
WA Mozart – Flute Quartet in D Major
(programmes and artists may change - but hopefully not!)
The Comfy Concert series
The Comfy Concerts is a series of four beautiful concert experiences with two dates to benefit Kaibosh (20 September and 16 November) and two dates to benefit Arohanui Strings+ (Saturday 30 August and 18 October).
Thank you to Helene, Rolf and musicians of The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, for generously donating time and talent in support Arohanui Strings+ and Kaibosh!
Learn more about these charities: arohanuistrings.org and kaibosh.org.nz
Location
The Long Hall overlooks Point Jerningham with views of Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington Harbour. See the Google map location.
You can park on Maida Vale Rd or on Roseneath School tennis court and follow the signs. Or on foot or bike, use the footpath up from Carlton Gore Road or from Maida Vale Road near Roseneath School.
Dress warmly, and maybe bring a cushion and some slippers, as it's shoes off to protect the new floor.
It's going to be a wonderful afternoon of fabulous music, while supporting the next generation of musicians through raising funds for two fabulous charities.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again, Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again
Our upcoming Echoes of Home invites audiences on a musical and storytelling journey that traces the emotional path of every migrant — from the laughter of childhood to the quiet ache of distance and the enduring warmth of return.

Through five evocative chapters of live music, dance, and performance, the show unfolds as a tapestry of memory and identity — celebrating resilience, cultural pride, and the beauty of belonging.

It begins with “Tuổi Thơ Bé Nhỏ” (Childhood Memories), a tender glimpse into early life in Vietnam, filled with playfulness and sunshine.
Then comes “Thời Học Sinh” (School Days), where friendship, curiosity, and the vibrant pulse of youth take centre stage.
“Trưởng Thành” (Adulthood) follows, echoing the courage to grow, dream, and chase life’s horizons.
The story deepens with “Xa Quê Lập Nghiệp” (Life Abroad) — a heartfelt portrait of those who leave home to build a new life, balancing hope and longing.
Finally, “Nhớ Nhung Tìm Về” (Longing and Return) closes the circle, where nostalgia meets gratitude and the heart finds its way home again.

Blending traditional Vietnamese melodies with modern artistry, Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again is more than a performance — it is a bridge between generations, a celebration of roots, and an embrace of the shared human journey toward belonging.
