description:
Aunty Records Presents: Mark Farina [USA] with Benny Salvador, Aunty Records Presents: Mark Farina [USA] with Benny Salvador
Get ready, Wellington—one of the most influential figures in house music is landing in the capital for a night of deep grooves, soulful rhythms, and undeniable dancefloor magic at Meow NUI.

===Tickets on sale Friday 22 August at 12.00PM====

Mark Farina is a global dance music icon whose name resonates across the scene. Known for his Mushroom Jazz series, deep house sets, and marathon all-night performances, Farina has built a career on innovation, consistency, and a relentless touring schedule of over 100 shows a year. He has collaborated with legendary venues and record labels, showcasing both classic and new school producers in his sets.

With his recent YouTube series with Defected Records and continued worldwide performances, Farina connects with both longtime fans and new audiences alike, delivering unforgettable journeys through house, jazz-infused grooves, and eclectic beats.

Supporting him is Wellington’s Benny Salvador — one of New Zealand’s most exciting young talents. A DJ, producer, multi-instrumentalist, radio host, and event promoter, Benny has shared stages with Marcellus Pittman and Courtesy and played major festivals including Splore, Beacon, and Catacombs. He has recorded mixes for Planet Trip Records, NTS, Balamii, Related Articles, and Friendly Potential Radio, and released music on Racquet Club, Rush Hour, Love Above Records, Juke Bounce Werk, and his own Aunty Records. Benny’s eclectic sets blend house, techno, disco-funk, dub, and electro, drawing on jazz and funk influences while showcasing his crate-digging, collaborative approach.

This is a rare chance to experience two generations of dance music mastery under one roof. From Farina’s world-renowned grooves to Benny’s forward-thinking, genre-spanning sets, the night promises a journey through sound that will move the floor and leave a lasting impression. For fans of house, jazz-infused beats, and cutting-edge underground sounds, this is a must-attend event at Meow Nui.

Saturday 18th October
Doors 9:30 PM
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Ato To Ghana Fundraising Gig, AKWAABA!

Please come and support Ato on his journey getting back to Ghana!

Ato Kwamena is a composer and a percussionist from the Cape Coast in Ghana.
Inspired by West African highlife music, he has performed with numerous Aotearoa groups, including Culture Embassy, Orchestra of Spheres, ISKRA and Lord Echo.

Ato's mum recently passed away and we're fundraising money for a flight back home, so he can be with his family.

RAS JUDAH AND THE CULTURE EMBASSY

a 10-piece NZ band of varying cultural backgrounds, hence the name.
The cultural diversity of the band is reflected in the sound of the music
a fusion of African styles, Reggae/Ska, Jazz and Afro-Latin rhythms.

We describe our sound as Afrocentric-World Music as much of what we play is based on African rhythms and songs, which is where our lead-singer ‘Ras Judah’ and two of our master drummers come from (Botswana, Ghana and Tanzania respectively), plus Roots Reggae. Though everyone contributes their own culturally inspired sound, with other band members from Cuba, England and Japan, and others with Greek, Kiwiana and jazz backgrounds. Not just a musical treat representing many parts of the world, but also a visual one; a carnival of ethnic diversity and collaboration on stage!

ISKRA

Iskra are an otherworldly quartet heralding from Te Whanganui-a-Tara formed by saxophonist Josh Buckler and featuring Simon Grove (Niko Ne Zna) on helicon, Ato Kwamena (Culture Embassy) on percussion and David McGurk (Planet Hunter) on drums.

Inspired by the likes of Sons of Kemet and the London jazz scene, they bring driving grooves, soaring melodies and the fire of afro-beat, Balkan music and a style that is best described as brass-house. Think dance party at the end of the world, when the last lights have gone out

description:
Bob McNeill and Emily Roughton, Bob McNeill and Emily Roughton
Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton are two of New Zealand's best-known folk musicians. They bring their deep musical connection to festivals across New Zealand, playing their favourite songs and tunes collected over years of playing together at festivals, stages and late into the night at kitchen tables.
Based in Wellington, Bob is one of NZ's best known folk songwriters. His songs have been covered by artists in NZ, Australia, the UK and USA. New Zealand Musician magazine compared his songwriting to Bruce Springsteen and Mark Knopfler; the Dominion Post likened him to Jackson Brown, James Taylor, Luka Bloom and Dougie Ma­cLean. A guitarist, he is known for both his open-tuned acoustic fingerstyle style and electric guitar playing. He has toured widely in NZ, Australia, Canada, Ireland, the UK and USA. His latest album, released in June 2024, is Lost Stars, an extended release on CD and download featuring new recordings and rarities, with Emily on violin and piano.
From Whangarei, Emily is a virtuoso violinist inspired by the Scottish tradition and the modern trad movement. Classically trained, she is infinitely adaptable with her gorgeous stylings and fiery tune playing and the perfect foil for Bob's lyrical songs.
Don't miss a chance to see these two consummate musicians share their footstomping collection of banging tunes, favourite songs and stolen moments from the last 20 years.
Tickets $25 from Eventfinda or book by text to 02102361951
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Beoga New Zealand 2026 | Wellington, Acclaimed Irish band Beoga will make their long-awaited return to New Zealand in January 2026, performing two intimate headline shows in Auckland and Wellington.
Known for their adventurous spirit and willingness to chart new musical territory, Beoga have redefined the possibilities of Irish traditional music. Their global reach was cemented through collaborations with Ed Sheeran on the record-breaking ÷ (Divide) album, including the smash hits “Galway Girl” and “Nancy Mulligan.” The former has now surpassed 1.4 billion streams on Spotify alone.
After a four-year hiatus from touring and releasing music, Beoga made a powerful comeback earlier this year with their new album Phases, released in June. The band went on to perform at Glastonbury and Coachella, where they shared the stage with Shaboozey, Alex Warren, and Ed Sheeran at his now-famous Old Phone Pub pop-up experience.
With a GRAMMY nomination, international tours, and collaborations with some of the biggest names in music, Beoga have established themselves as one of Ireland’s most exciting and genre-blurring acts. Their sound fuses accordion, fiddle, keyboards, guitars, and vocals into a vibrant, modern take on Irish roots music that feels both timeless and new.

San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

description:
Walt Quizney @ 1852, Wellington, Hakuna Matata, it means no worries for the rest of your days. And we've got Saturday 20th Sept all figured out for you!
Join us at 7pm for a Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious evening of Quizney themed trivia at 1852 Pub & Kitchen, Wellington!
Sport your best costume, brush up on your movie knowledge (including Pixar) and get ready to put all those years of watching "Quizney" to good use. Oh, did we mention we're having a sing-a-long round where you'll need to remember the lyrics of your favourite song lyrics?
In true Gee Quiz fashion, we'll also have fantastically-fun bonus games including our legendary but stressful Alphabetical round, where your team will negotiate 26 fast-fire questions as the time tick down, plus Last Prince and Princess Standing and The Line Up!
This quiz would not be complete without you, so book tickets today. A team ticket (up to 6 players) is $90).
Booking link: https://www.trybooking.com/nz/YMK
***Minors must be accompanied with parent or legal guardian***

description:
CARBON/02, After the intense CARBON premiere at bSpace in 2024 we are excited to announce CARBON02.
CARBON02 is your journey to dawn through new rhythmic and hypnotic realms - Join us for an unforgettable night of intense, transportive, contemporary techno. The CARBON crew aim to give you a music-first night of the finest, freshest techno from around the globe - Each DJ bringing a powerhouse showcase of their personal definitions of the genre.
CARBON02 brings together a potent line-up of the finest techno DJS in New Zealand : a rare combination and a legendary night not to be repeated. We will be slowly raising the heat over the night, challenging you to delve deeper, dance harder and experience techno as it was intended.
Close your eyes, forget your name, forget the world, return to the source.
DJ Coda is the godfather of techno in New Zealand. With a career that spans decades, he isn’t just a DJ but a dedicated promoter and one of the trustees of NZ’s longest running student radio station, Radio Active.  DJ Coda is a master of his craft and never fails to deliver.

Ned Raw (formerly tjaden) a legend in the 90’s techno scene, delivers an intensity unmatched in Australasia. Decades of experience can be heard and felt in the sonic journeys he delivers.

CYXQRD is a producer and DJ, his music is played globally and represents the new-breed of New Zealand techno artists. Purveyor of deep, soulful techno that is felt as much as heard.

F.Huk guaranteed to deliver the freshest, grooviest techno
This is a free, limited ticket event (with koha entry on the night)
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Candlelit Concerts - it's a night out that feels good and does good!, 🌙 Candlelit Concert Series — Summer Edition
Step into an evening of warmth, wonder, and world-class music. Once each season, our historic local church transforms into an intimate haven softly lit by 800 flickering candles. Pause, breathe, and connect in a truly magical atmosphere.
✨ What to Expect
Ease into the evening with local wines, dessert nibbles, and gentle background music by a talented youth musician. Then, as dusk settles, enjoy 75 minutes of exquisite acoustic music, curated to uplift and inspire.
🎶 Guest Artists: Saxcess
New Zealand’s premier saxophone quartet, Saxcess, delivers a rich kaleidoscope of sounds  swing, classical, tango, cutting-edge NZ contemporary, and much more. For decades, they’ve delighted audiences young and old across Aotearoa and beyond.
Saxcess members:
Debbie Rawson (soprano/alto)
Richard Marin (soprano/alto)
Franz Ombler (tenor)
Rachel Collingridge (baritone)
Let your ears travel the world, from the bold energy of Latin American saxophone pieces to the inventive sounds of New Zealand compositions.
Founded and led by Debbie Rawson, Saxcess is a project-based collective that has toured nationwide for nearly 30 years and have played all major Arts Festivals in Aotearoa, and performed original NZ compositions at Saxophone Congresses in Australia, Belgium, and the USA.
🎹 Pre-Concert Performance (8:15–8:30pm)
Be captivated by rising young pianist Kasra Mitchell-Kouttab, 15, whose talent and passion for classical music have already impressed audiences far beyond his years.
🕯️ Event Details
Doors: 8:00pm | Pre-show: 8:15pm | Main concert: 8:30–9:45pm
Venue: Historic local church, transformed by candlelight
Tickets: $35 | Limited to 100 guests — bookings essential
💛 Music That Feels Good and Does Good
Each concert supports local community programmes — so your night out helps make a difference.
Whether for the spellbinding music, magical setting, or sense of connection, this is an evening you’ll never forget — and one you’ll return to season after season.
✨ Book your tickets now!
(Adults only; please no children under 10.)

description:
Capital Blues Concert Series: The Carol Bean Ensemble, Carol Bean brings her encyclopedic blues knowledge and West Coast roots to the Capital Blues stage, fronting a powerhouse ensemble with Deane Hunter (guitar), Andrew Richardson (drums), Elliotte Fuimaono (bass), and Duncan Haynes (keyboard). Showcasing songs from blues legends like Ma Rainey, Elmore James, Memphis Minnie, and Jimmy Reed, alongside contemporary voices such as Etta James (from Carol’s hometown of Los Angeles), Eliza Gilkyson, Debbie Davies, and Angela Strehli from Austin, Texas. And yes—Clarence “Gatemouth” Brown is in the mix.
Carol’s sets are known for their depth and feel—steamy slow burners, up-tempo grooves, and tunes you didn’t know you needed. She’s gathered bands like Blue Highways and The Dirty River Band, and has been a fixture in Wellington’s blues scene since 2008. Her credits include Lady Sings the Blues, Wild Women of Wellington, and ALL of the blues festivals in Aotearoa.
Born in England and raised in LA, Carol was shaped by the West Coast music of the ’60s and the acoustic blues of Mississippi John Hurt, Mance Lipscomb, and Lightnin’ Hopkins. She studied with Ry Cooder, who helped her acquire the vintage Martin guitar she still plays today.
This gig is part of the Capital Blues Concert Series—Sunday afternoons built for listening, relaxing, and reconnecting. Come down, grab a drink, and settle in. Members discounts apply!
Photo: Reef Reid
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Christine Wang and Rachel Thomson -- Violin and Piano, Join us for Ravel's Violin and Piano Sonata No. 2 and de Falla's Suite Populaire Espagnole based on “Siete canciones populares españolas,” along with Ginastera's hauntingly beautiful Pampeana No. 1, Op. 16 - Rhapsody for Violin and Piano.

Christine Wang, violin

Christine has been a member of the second violin section of New Zealand Symphony Orchestra since 2022. She holds a Bachelor of Music from Eastman School of Music and Master of Music at Rice University, studying under Oleh Krysa and Kathleen Winkler respectively. Before coming to New Zealand, Christine was Assistant Concertmaster of San Antonio Symphony and has worked in orchestras in the United States and Australia.

Rachel Thomson, piano

Rachel Thomson was born in Dunedin, New Zealand, and grew up in Wellington where she began her piano studies with her mother. She went on to study with Judith Clark, graduating from Victoria University of Wellington before continuing her studies at the Cleveland Institute of Music in the United States, where she gained a doctorate in piano performance. Rachel regularly performs with some of the country’s leading musicians. She has toured on numerous occasions for Chamber Music New Zealand and is a member of various chamber ensembles including the Koru Trio. She has worked as an orchestral pianist with the NZSO, Orchestra Wellington, and the Christchurch Symphony Orchestra. Rachel is also active as a teacher, adjudicator and accompanist, and is a music examiner for Trinity College London.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Colette Rivers - The Backyard Wonder tour, Colette Rivers - The Backyard Wonder tour
Indie-Folk Artist Colette Rivers and her band will be performing her intimate new album, The Backyard Wonder.

Independent artist Colette Rivers is releasing her second full-length album, The Backyard Wonder, an intimate exploration of healing, change, and the quiet beauty of ordinary moments.

This album holds special meaning for Rivers: after being diagnosed with cancer in July 2023, her planned sophomore release had to take a back seat to recovery. But when the cancer returned in early 2025, she felt compelled to finish and release the album, not just as a legacy project, also as a celebration after hard times, with a focus on how “you can find the wonder in life, even in your backyard.”

A lifelong creative, Rivers records, mixes, and produces in her home studio in Masterton, and plays every instrument heard on The Backyard Wonder. Her debut album, Memory Lake (2020), was shaped by early years spent in the US, and her move to Taupō at age 11; this was followed by a nationwide tour. Now based in the Wairarapa and working as a secondary school drama teacher, Rivers continues to move between solo performance and full band sets, while staying rooted in the acoustic traditions that define her sound.

With her right arm partially paralysed following recent treatment, Rivers has gathered a group of close friends to help bring the songs of The Backyard Wonder to life (especially its intricate fingerpicking parts) for a run of live shows. She’ll be touring the Wellington and Wairarapa regions from August through October, finishing with a set at the Wellington Folk Festival.

For updates, and behind-the-scenes glimpses, visit www.coletteriversmusic.com or follow @colettemusic on Instagram and Facebook.

Opening for Rivers are artists:

Phil Masters
Phil Lively-Masters is an experienced, well travelled singer songwriter who specialises in writing the sort of Sun Kissed West Coast Laurel Canyon Americana that made Neil Young, Stephen Stills and the Byrds famous. With a powerful, honey soaked voice that has won praise and support slots from legendary American country rock pioneers like The Jayhawks and original cosmic cowboy Steve Young, Phil has 20 years worth of road worn original songs to pull on, including tracks from the critically acclaimed CANYON RYDE album 'Free To Be' and some choice country rock covers to weave a spell on any listener.

Saali Marks
A singer, songwriter, guitarist and multi-instrumentalist, Saali Marks hails originally from the
South Island, but has made Wairarapa his home for the last 20 years, where he lives on a farm
with his family and teaches music at Kuranui College.
Saali has played in numerous bands over the years, in a wide range of styles from proto-punk
to psychedelic dub, covers, originals and fully improvised music with no discernible genre, on
stages throughout Aotearoa since 1991. Currently he fronts the Wellington ska band Battleska
Galactica.
Throughout and alongside it all Saali has indulged his love for songwriting and solo
performing, developing a unique style, rooted in folk and blues, and inspired by greats from
across the decades. A skilled guitarist, Saali rarely plays straight ahead chords, and an
education in jazz has informed his ear for harmony, the beauty of dissonance, tension and
resolution, with unconventional song structures, alternate tunings and intriguing melodies.
Although not adverse to penning the odd love song, most of Saali’s lyrics tend to focus on
other aspects of the human condition, from religion and politics to our relationships with the
environment and our own minds.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Comfy Concert 5 at The Long Hall - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble performance for Arohanui Strings+, � Join us for an afternoon of beautiful music and community spirit! �
Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View! Relax with a cuppa while listening to expertly curated chamber music featuring Helene, Rolf, and top musicians at an intimate venue in one of Wellington’s most stunning locations.
Helen Pohl (violin) and Rolf Gjelsten (cello), as the Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, are getting together with friends to play a series of intimate concerts that support some of their favourite causes – Arohanui Strings+ included (www.arohanuistrings.org).
Comfy Concert No.5 with Bridget Douglas (flute) and Victoria Jaenecke (viola) on August 30, 2025, playing:
Tabea Squire - Daydream and Dance for violin and cello
JS Bach – Sonata No. 1 in G minor for violin solo
Heitor Villa-Lobos – The Jet Whistle for flute and cello
WA Mozart – Flute Quartet in D Major
(programmes and artists may change - but hopefully not!)
The Comfy Concert series
The Comfy Concerts is a series of four beautiful concert experiences with two dates to benefit Kaibosh (20 September and 16 November) and two dates to benefit Arohanui Strings+ (Saturday 30 August and 18 October).
Thank you to Helene, Rolf and musicians of The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, for generously donating time and talent in support Arohanui Strings+ and Kaibosh!
Learn more about these charities: arohanuistrings.org and kaibosh.org.nz
Location
The Long Hall overlooks Point Jerningham with views of Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington Harbour. See the Google map location.
You can park on Maida Vale Rd or on Roseneath School tennis court and follow the signs. Or on foot or bike, use the footpath up from Carlton Gore Road or from Maida Vale Road near Roseneath School.
Dress warmly, and maybe bring a cushion and some slippers, as it's shoes off to protect the new floor.
It's going to be a wonderful afternoon of fabulous music, while supporting the next generation of musicians through raising funds for two fabulous charities.

description:
Crazy Ladies, Pamela Browne has organised a 25 year reunion for her four best friends from High School. From the moment Kay, now a chocoholic gun-toting funeral director arrives, the wheels begin falling off Pamela’s meticulously planned weekend.
Added to the mix is Sandy, who is now a Nun, Dianne, married the school nerd and is a mother of eight sons, Rachel, a runaway teenager on a mission to dig up some dirt on her mother, and Shaun, the greasy motel janitor, who ends up in a compromising position in the ladies’ wardrobe.
Guns, gags, cuffs, crucifixes, sleaze-balls , slander, pizza and pinot – everything you need for a great weekend reunion!

description:
Cowboy Dan: Dreams That Feel Like Falling Aotearoa Album Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington, Cowboy Dan: Dreams That Feel Like Falling Aotearoa Album Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington
Tāmaki Makaurau jangle rockers Cowboy Dan are releasing their debut full length album; Dreams That Feel Like Falling. The album drops 19 September on streaming & vinyl.

Never overblown or overproduced, Dreams That Feel Like Falling is direct and intimate. 11 tracks of warmth, sincerity and brashness that strike a balance of breeze and overdrive.

To celebrate the release, Cowboy Dan are heading out for a run of shows throughout Te Ika-a-Māui in September and October.

This Te Whanganui-a-Tara will be the second outing in the capital for Cowboy Dan, who are delighted to bring Echo Children along for the ride from Tāmaki to share their special tunes and infectous harmoines, along with Te Whanganui-a-Tara local legends Search For Yeti...STACKED!

Once aptly described as The Bats on the right amount of Red Bull, Cowboy Dan has been treating audiences across the motu to energetic, emotionally charged tunes since 2015. Their live shows have consistently delivered good times to fans and new friends alike.

Off the back of two delightful EPs: We Will Hesitate, When We Eventually Wait (2017, Mixed by Jonathan Pearce); Sentimental Now That We're Leaving (2021, Mixed by Rohan Evans), the debut LP, Dreams That Feel Like Falling, is a continuation and a few steps forward, showcasing the bands expansive sonic pallet, with a mix of distortion, introspection, heart and bite.

Search For Yeti draws from a deep range of influences to create a sound that achieves the difficult feat of being hugely atmospheric and diverse while also being hook laden. This is an act that captures people with their onstage energy — and gets them talking afterwards about the songs that they just heard.

Following in the long tradition of innovative Aotearoa indie bands, Echo Children craft a distinctive sound by melding psychedelic pop harmonies with sharp alt-country songwriting.

Gather your pals and get ready for good times! A thursday, sure, but what a chance to digest some upbeat goodness hailing from the big smoke and with some local goodness to boot.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Folk B*tch Trio - Wellington, Folk Bitch Trio - 'Now Would Be A Good Time' Album Tour with special guest Georgia Knight

Now Would Be A Good Time, the debut album by Folk Bitch Trio, tells vivid, visceral stories. Their music sounds familiar, and it’s built on a foundation of the music they’ve loved throughout their lives–gnarled Americana, classic rock, piquant, clear-eyed balladry. But the songs are modern, youthful, singing acutely through dissociative daydreams and galling breakups, sexual fantasies and media overload, all the petty resentments and minor humiliations of being in your early twenties in the 2020s.

Heide Peverelle (they/them), Jeanie Pilkington (she/her) and Gracie Sinclair (she/her) have known each other since high school, and first started singing together five years ago. Peverelle recalls sending Pilkington a heartbroken—in their words “bad”—song they had written called “Edie”; Pilkington remembers the song differently. “I felt so inspired that my teenage peer had written something so honest and original,” she recalls. It wasn’t long before she messaged Peverelle and Sinclair, asking if they’d be interested in starting a “folk bitch trio.” As soon as they started singing together, their connection deepened, and “the chemistry of being inspired by each other was evident from the get-go,” says Sinclair.

Listening to Folk Bitch Trio, it’s clear that this is a band of three distinct points of view, with contrasting and complementary backgrounds and visions. Pilkington grew up with two musician parents and brings formative memories of watching them perform, of listening to Gillian Welch and Lucinda Williams, and of her own imagined path as a career musician. Peverelle spends their spare time making art and furniture; those hobbies, as well as their love of pop music old and new, articulate a love for the tactile, the home-grown and the hand-made. Sinclair is the self-proclaimed jester of the group, but her taste skews dark, gothic, baroque and dramatic, expressed as a love of opera and ballet as well as musicians as wide-ranging as Patti Smith, Nirvana and Tchaikovsky.

Folk music has a bad habit of being presented as a deathly serious concern. It’s the music you cry to, it’s overly sacred, it’s solemnly considered by critic-historians. But Folk Bitch Trio have a shared sense of humour that is embedded deep in their music and that sets it alight, safe from the self-serious traps of the genre. Now Would Be A Good Time is funny and darkly ironic in the manner of writers like Mary Gaitskill or Otessa Moshfegh. On “Gods A Different Sword” they crack that “My body keeps the score/But if you tell me that you need it/I can get up off my floor,” a nod to the clichéd, over-referenced millennial self-help book, as they wryly sing about sex within earshot of housemates, and wring sexual innuendo from physics terminology
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Comfy Concert 5 at The Long Hall - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble performance for Arohanui Strings+, � Join us for an afternoon of beautiful music and community spirit! �
Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View! Relax with a cuppa while listening to expertly curated chamber music featuring Helene, Rolf, and top musicians at an intimate venue in one of Wellington’s most stunning locations.
Helen Pohl (violin) and Rolf Gjelsten (cello), as the Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, are getting together with friends to play a series of intimate concerts that support some of their favourite causes – Arohanui Strings+ included (www.arohanuistrings.org).
Comfy Concert No.5 with Bridget Douglas (flute) and Victoria Jaenecke (viola) on August 30, 2025, playing:
Tabea Squire - Daydream and Dance for violin and cello
JS Bach – Sonata No. 1 in G minor for violin solo
Heitor Villa-Lobos – The Jet Whistle for flute and cello
WA Mozart – Flute Quartet in D Major
(programmes and artists may change - but hopefully not!)
The Comfy Concert series
The Comfy Concerts is a series of four beautiful concert experiences with two dates to benefit Kaibosh (20 September and 16 November) and two dates to benefit Arohanui Strings+ (Saturday 30 August and 18 October).
Thank you to Helene, Rolf and musicians of The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, for generously donating time and talent in support Arohanui Strings+ and Kaibosh!
Learn more about these charities: arohanuistrings.org and kaibosh.org.nz
Location
The Long Hall overlooks Point Jerningham with views of Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington Harbour. See the Google map location.
You can park on Maida Vale Rd or on Roseneath School tennis court and follow the signs. Or on foot or bike, use the footpath up from Carlton Gore Road or from Maida Vale Road near Roseneath School.
Dress warmly, and maybe bring a cushion and some slippers, as it's shoes off to protect the new floor.
It's going to be a wonderful afternoon of fabulous music, while supporting the next generation of musicians through raising funds for two fabulous charities.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Daniel Champagne (Australia) LIVE at Martinborough Town Hall (7pm Show), Show #1
Second show announced by popular demand!
The young virtuoso recently described as “the finest guitar player of this generation” has spent the past few years selling out shows all over the globe and will be bringing his dynamite live act back to New Zealand in 2025 for a series of intimate regional concerts!
Seated show
Family friendly  
Cheaper $15 tickets for under 18s because live music is for everyone!
BYO (non alcoholic) drinks and nibbles 
October 19, 2025 @ Martinborough Town Hall
Doors open from 6:30pm / show starts at 7:00pm (8:10pm finish) 
Tickets are VERY limited. DON'T miss out!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY..
“The word Prodigy seems to entirely fall short of this soft-spoken young man’s skills, he coaxes sounds and melodies out of his instrument that literally drop jaws.”
The Calgary Herald, CANADA

“Today I saw the future of Folk – Festival goers flocking in the thousands towards the main stage to witness a young musical phenomenon from Australia dish out an absolute show-stopper.” The Firefly Column, USA

“Daniel Champagne is a crossroads. Fusing the strong traditions of Blues, Folk and other roots art with pop showmanship and admirable lyrical ability. I firmly believe that he will become an ambassador for roots music in a time where it desperately needs representation.” The Indie Blender, CANADA

“reinventing roots guitar” Rhythms Magazine, AUSTRALIA“Watching Daniel Champagne perform is a once in a lifetime experience. He is a true prodigy that plays like no one else could possibly play unless they spent at least two lifetimes studying the art.” BW Review, NEW ZEALAND

“Daniel Champagne exudes a natural ease on stage, as he sings poignant lyrics and beautifully crafted melodies that invariably whisk the heart up with grand romanticism. Coupled with an exhilarating guitar talent that transcends mere acoustic playing to replicate a whole band, Champagne is just magical” Themusic.com.au, AUSTRALIA

"You feel as if he just invented the instrument yesterday and was discovering its possibilities afresh” Ted Gioia (American jazz critic and music historian)

description:
STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 4 2025, What is STEAMS?
STEAMS is an integrated learning programme covering Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Maths, and Society. It focuses on real-world skills, critical thinking, collaboration, and creativity through hands-on, project-based learning—not play-based, but purposeful exploration without rigid time constraints.
Students are immersed in engaging, age-appropriate activities that encourage curiosity, innovation, and independent learning.
Key Benefits:
Students in STEAMS learn to:
Think creatively and critically
Collaborate and communicate effectively
Connect ideas across disciplines
Take ownership of their learning
Explore without pressure
Understand real-world applications
When & Where?
Weekly classes during school terms, based on age group and location:
Blenheim-Waterlea Racecourse
Class Times:
Little STEAMerS (Ages 5–6): TUES 11:30am–2:45pm
STEAMS Jr (Ages 7–9): TUES 9:00am–2:45pm
STEAMS Sr (Ages 10–13): THURS 9:00am–2:45pm
Cost
Trial (3 weeks): Pay via Humanitix (non-refundable)
Ongoing: $75/day (incl. GST)
Little STEAMerS: $30/day
Scholarships: 25% off for financial need (not available for Little STEAMerS)
School Absence?
Inform your child’s regular school—they’re attending STEAMS School. Most schools are supportive, and students should be marked as justified.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Cushion Concert with Yury Gezentsvey, IAS Cushion Concerts presents local bands in the intimate environment of historic Inverlochy House. Join us as Principal Violinist, Yury Gezentsvey, performs some of Telemann's baroque Violin Fantasias for solo violin, as part of the opening celebration of Inverlochy’s Fundraiser exhibition.


Born in 1952 in Kiev, Ukraine (USSR at the time), Yury Gezentsvey graduated from the Gniessin Institute of Music in Moscow (1974). He emigrated to Chicago, USA (1979) where he was Concertmaster of the Chicago Civic Orchestra, before being engaged as Concertmaster of the Caracas Philharmonic Orchestra in Venezuela (1980), where he also formed a Chamber Ensemble with American pianist Harriet Serr (most acclaimed resident pianist in Venezuela, who also became his mother-in-law). Yury was appointed Principal First Violinist of the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra (1985) and, together with his wife Desirée and their three daughters, he made his new home in Wellington.

Yury has become a valued member of the music world in New Zealand, having taken part in several International Festivals of the Arts in Wellington as a Chamber Music Violinist. As the leader of the Dominion Quartet, he recorded all 17 string quartets by Alfred Hill (NAXOS).

Since his retirement from the NZSO at the end of 2022, he has been enjoying playing with Orchestra Wellington, teaching, and treasuring family life with Desiree, their children and six Kiwi grandchildren.

Visit (violinart.co.nz) for more information about Yury.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Marine Life VR Experience, Dive beneath the surface and explore Wellington’s Blue Belt - no snorkel required!

Using virtual reality headsets, take a few minutes these school holidays to see the underwater world through the eyes of a scuba diver: swim through the deep reefs of Kapiti Island, be surrounded by schools of fish at Whitireia Park, glide through the lush marine forests of Taputeranga Marine Reserve, and explore a shipwreck! Expect close encounters with octopus, vibrant sea life and even a cute shark with the team from Explore Your Coast!

This free, drop-in event is suitable for the whole family and will be held in the Zealandia Visitor Centre Foyer. Regular admission fees to the sanctuary apply and overflow carparking is available at Birdwood Street during the busy school holiday period.

To learn more about our local underwater forests visit Explore Your Coast at https://exploreyourcoast.co.nz/
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Khandallah Spring Market, Step into spring and join us at the twilight Khandallah Spring Market, hosted by Foxtail Events!

Nestled against the charming backdrop of Khandallah Town Hall, this vibrant market is the perfect place to explore an eclectic mix of arts, crafts, plants, and unique gifts.

Discover a wide variety of high-quality items from talented local stallholders, including:

• Beautiful plants, fresh flowers, and seedlings
• Handcrafted jewellery, clothing, bags, and accessories
• Cozy crochet and knitted toys, wool products, and homewares
• Scented candles, skincare, soaps, and wheat bags
• Pottery, ceramics, wooden products, and carvings
• Pet accessories, baby and children's items, and much more!

Come enjoy the evening sun, sample delicious local food, and get a head start on your holiday shopping!

Most stalls will accept cash or Eftpos, but it's best to bring cash as well.

We look forward to seeing you there!

description:
Elton John vs Billy Joel *NZ Tribute* Petone Club, NZ’s Award-winning hit tribute show “Elton John vs. Billy Joel” are coming to perform an intimate show at the Petone Club Udy Street as part of their NZ-WIDE TOUR!

Doors 7pm , show starts 7.30pm sharp

After wildly successful sell-out shows across New Zealand, join Cam and Sam for an intimate night out as they wow audiences both young and old performing the greatest hits of Elton John and Billy Joel LIVE! Piano Man, Rocket Man, Uptown Girl, Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, We didn’t start the fire, Bennie and the Jets, She’s always a woman, Crocodile Rock and many many more.

Your favourite Elton and Billy songs are in safe hands with Cam and Sam, these professional touring NZ musicians have performed on live national television, commercial radio and featured in the NZ Music Charts in careers spanning two decades. This amazing Piano Man extravaganza features astonishing costumes, two grand pianos in black and white, plus plenty of banter and all the songs you love.

Let's face it, Elton John and Billy Joel require little introduction, their music has provided a soundtrack for generations of loving fans. Englishman Sir Elton John has sold over 300 million records, making him one of the best-selling music artists of all time. He has more than fifty Top 40 hits on the UK Singles Chart and US Billboard Hot 100, including seven number-ones in the UK and nine in the US, as well as seven consecutive number-one albums in the US.

American Billy Joel has sold more than 150 million records and ranks as one of the most popular recording artists and respected entertainers in the world. Joel has had 33 Top 40 hits and 23 Grammy nominations. In 1999 he was inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame and has received the Recording Industry Association of America Diamond Award, presented for albums that have sold over 10 million copies.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
One Night, Two Lit Events, ONE NIGHT, TWO LIT EVENTS
Bad Diaries Salon + Starling’s 10th Birthday
Verb is thrilled to host two sparkling events in one night this November with our tremendous friends, Bad Diaries Salon and Starling. A fresh batch of bad diaries will start the evening, followed by a line-up of not one, not ten, but twenty poets in celebration of Starling’s 20th issue and 10th birthday.

You have the option of coming to either event but you know you want to come to both. There will be cake! 
___
Friday 7 November at Meow. 
Tickets: $15 for one event / $25 for both. 
Verb Community members receive a 10% discount (check your ReVerb e-newsletter for the discount code, or email community@verbwellington.nz)
BAD DIARIES SALON – STAR 
6pm – 7pm, Friday 7 November at Meow
Tickets: $15 (or purchase the double-bill ticket for $25 and go to Starling’s birthday party, too)
Four courageous, starry writers – Kate Camp, Jo Randerson, Michelle Duff and Elizabeth Knox – read from their unpublished diaries on the salon theme, STAR. This is Verb's eighth annual edition of Bad Diaries Salon, hosted by Tracy Farr. What happens in salon stays in salon, so come, witness, celebrate.
Bad Diaries Salon is raw, raucous, unedited and candid: the written word, rediscovered and shared.
Starling: RELAY
7.30pm–9pm, Friday 7 November at Meow
Tickets: $15 (or purchase the double-bill ticket for $25 and go to Bad Diaries Salon, too)
Join us to celebrate TEN YEARS of Starling with a relay of readers from Issue 20 through to Issue 1. An evening of infectious energy, this is also the sign-off for editors Francis Cooke and Louise Wallace, handing over to the incomparable Tate Fountain and Maddie Ballard. A new chapter of Starling awaits!

description:
Funky Fridays Vol.7 - Not My Sister, Libbi K, Ben-Jammin, Funky Fridays Vol.7 - Not My Sister, Libbi K, Ben-Jammin
We're back for another night of house techno disco bass & more at Moon with Funky Fridays Vol. 7!
Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene Funky Friday is more than just a night out—it’s a space for music lovers dancers and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. Each edition features a rotating lineup of talented DJs both local and international ensuring a fresh and unique experience every time.
Come with an open mind and leave with tired feet.
This edition features legends Libby K Ben-Jammin & our host Not My Sister!
$10 presales available now via UTR or $15 on the door.
Times:
9-10 Not My Sister
10-11.30 Libby K
11.30-1 Ben Jammin
1-2 Not My Sister
-------------------------------------------------------
NOT MY SISTER
Not My Sister is a house music DJ born and raised in a little town in the north of Italy. Now based in Wellington she started this project in 2024 and recently she has been lighting up dance floors across New Zealand you may have already come across her sets at Twisted Frequency Kiwiburn Earthbeat Cuba Dupa Arkadien and other events across the country. Influenced by funk and disco with a special focus on vocals and anything groovy Not My Sister brings high energy and uplifting sets. Constantly developing as an artist she always brings fun and passion to the dance floors. Expect a delightful fusion of melodic basslines blending soulful tech garage and deep house sounds.
www.soundcloud.com/not-my-sister
www.facebook.com/notmysista
www.instangram.com/not.my.sister

LIBBY K
From the vibrant streets of Wellington Libby's fascination with music began at an early age with the smooth sultry
sounds of the clarinet and piano. Fast forward to her 20s where she stumbled into the hypnotic world of techno in
Berlin and a passion for 4/4 was ignited.
With a deep appreciation for the power of music to transform Libby finds the greatest joy on a dance floor where
the magic of music brings people together and gives us the freedom to be ourselves. Her sets are filled with
uplifting emotive and tantalising sounds of downtempo house and techno. Mixed with intention and a whole lot
of love **
https://soundcloud.com/libby_k
https://www.instagram.com/libbykdj/
https://www.facebook.com/libbykmusic
https://www.twitch.tv/libbykdj

BEN-JAMMIN
Originally from Bristol UK Ben was immersed in soundsystem culture from an early age. He started collecting vinyl in his teens and developed a passion for the heavier side of electronic music. With his formative years spent mixing vinyl studying African percussion and playing drums and recording for rock/rap group Band of Crooks he moved on to play with some of the best underground DJ's producers and musicians in Aotearoa Australia and UK. Ben has played a myriad of parties and events including Newtown Festival Cuba Dupa Kiwi Burn Little Monsters Insomnia Toots Suite Festival (Salmonella Dub Laughton Kora Pheonix Foundation) Breakaway Magical Doof Bus (Paige Julia Y SorchalulaYoung Gho$t House MD) Cuba Dupa Sydney Rd Street Festival (Melbourne) Cafe Blue (UK) Castros (UK).
Ben-Jammin can do what is needed to keep a dancefloor alive comfortably switching between genres to suit the mood.
Always armed with bags of bass heavy treats expect a selection of new classic and surprise music to help you release your spirit into the world.

Perfect for date night, catch-ups, or just floating solo through the sound waves. Wednesdays at Moon are the place to orbit
This week we have a Jazz Fest special featuring Free Status!
Free Status is a jazz fusion band blending the melodic richness of Herbie Hancock and 70s jazz-funk with an electronic edge inspired by Moby. Their sound is both nostalgic and forward-looking, offering high-energy grooves and inventive compositions.
At the helm is Tommy David (keys), a rising talent whose original works have earned competition recognition and seen him share stages with acts like Dire Straits Legacy Band, Nazareth, and Hello Sailor. Joining him are seasoned rhythm players Behzad Karakia (drums) and Tyler Diprose (bass), both respected for their work alongside Aotearoa’s jazz greats.
The frontline features James Dawes (alto sax), fresh from selection for an international touring ensemble, and Sam Voyle (keys/sax), a longtime collaborator of Tommy’s with standout performances at the America’s Cup and major festivals.
Together, Free Status delivers a vibrant, genre-bending live experience you won’t forget.
Follow Free Status: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61575737812566

description:
Funky Fridays Vol.8 - Not My Sister, K-otik, Kimba Jade, Stolen Tuesday, Funky Fridays Vol.8 - Not My Sister, K-otik, Kimba Jade, Stolen Tuesday
We're back for another night of house, techno, disco, bass & more at Moon with Funky Fridays Vol. 8!
Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene, Funky Friday is more than just a night out, it’s a space for music lovers, dancers, and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. Each edition features a rotating lineup of talented DJs, both local and international, ensuring a fresh and unique experience every time.
Come with an open mind and leave with tired feet.
This edition features legends Stolen Tuesday, Kimba Jade, K-otik and Not My Sister
$10 presales available now via UTR, or $15 on the door.

Times:
9-10 Not My Sister
10-11 Stolen Tuesday
11-12 Kimba Jade
12.1 K-otik
1-2 Not My Sister
-------------------------------------------------------

NOT MY SISTER
Hailing from Italy and rooted in Wellington’s vibrant scene, Not My Sister burst onto the scene in 2024 and has quickly become one of Aotearoa’s most exciting rising DJs. In such a short time, she’s already lit up dance floors across the country, playing at festivals like Twisted Frequency, CubaDupa, Taniwha’s Den, and supporting international acts such as KC Lights.

She also holds a radio residency at Wellington’s iconic Radio Active, where her show dives deep into the world of house and underground sounds.

Heavily influenced by funk and disco, and driven by a love for vocals and all things groovy, Not My Sister delivers high-energy, uplifting sets full of passion and playfulness. She weaves together melodic basslines with soulful, tech, garage, and deep house elements, always keeping the crowd moving.

SoundCloud: www.soundcloud.com/not-my-sister
Facebook: www.facebook.com/notmysista
Instagram: www.instagram.com/not.my.sister
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@not.my.sister

STOLEN TUESDAY
Stolen Tuesday started life as a house music club dancer in the UK 20 years
ago, and has spent the last 10 years DJing at Wanaka and Queenstown's best
establishments, bringing her unique energy to create magical dance floors.
Since residing in New Zealand, she has previously split her time living between Great Barrier island and Wanaka, spreading the love through her weekly radio shows on Wanaka Beats and Aotea FM. Not shy of the underground scene, you will also find Stolen Tuesday getting down off grid and playing at bush doofs.
Best known for dropping all things bassy which exude an element of fun matching her own high energy, guest appearances on Base FM (Auckland) alongside well known Auckland DJs have helped showcase her enthusiasm and talent.
With a style ranging from glitter box style disco and funk, to dirty after hours Tech House and all things in between, including the occasional breaks/ghetto funk set, it’s no surprise that She has been a regular on the South Island festival scene where she has been happy warming up or playing after notable international artists. She has also played at Otherlanz and remotely at Great Barrier Island’s new Wingman festival.

Stolen Tuesday now resides in Wellington and whilst fairly new to the city has already played several times for both the 'Open air' brand at Carlucci land and with Wellington renowned 'Little monsters' notably shaking things up at this year's Newtown festival.
Although not one to take herself too seriously, Stolen Tuesday knows it all comes down to the music and having a good time!

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/user-720686581

KIMBA JADE
Kimba Jade has been lighting up dancefloors for over 20 years with her signature blend of deep, funky, and globally inspired grooves. A master of musical journeying, she weaves bass-driven beats with tribal, melodic, and soulful sounds that move both body and spirit.

With a deep passion for Ecstatic Dance and the power of music to connect and uplift, Kimba brings that same vibrant energy into clubs and bars. Her sets fuse Tech House, Indie Dance, and Techno, blending driving rhythms with emotive melodies to create an atmosphere that’s both immersive and electric.

After years in Sydney and Auckland’s underground scenes, Kimba now calls Wellington home—bringing her unique mix of rhythm, soul, and bass to local dance floors.

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/kimba
Facebook: www.facebook.com/kimbadj/
Instangram: @djkimbajade

K-OTIK
Based in Wellington, New Zealand, K-otiK is a multi-genre DJ. His sound spans house, tech house, bass house, and techno — laced with heavy vocals and thumping basslines. With a cheeky stage presence and high energy behind the decks, K-otiK takes crowds on journeys that balance careful curation with unexpected twists. A regular on RadioActive FM and part of Wellington’s Open Air collective, he’s built a reputation for spreading joy through music. For K-otiK, music does not discriminate — it’s the universal language that brings people together.

Instangram: @dj_kotik_nz
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Greg Crayford's Jazz Night for 20th August - Erna Ferry, Kia ora jazz lover,
This coming week at Wellington’s longest-running jazz residency Greg is thrilled to bring one of Aotearoa’s top vocalists to the stage – the one and only Erna Ferry.
About Erna
Erna, associated primarily with the mighty Rodger Fox Big Band, is a Jazz’n’Blues afficionado from Manawatū.
Erna started her career in amateur musical theatre, discovering, alas, that a thespian she was not - but that she loved to sing! She has performed at all the leading NZ jazz clubs and festivals throughout the country and includes as highlights her ‘tribute to Peggy Lee’ show that toured throughout NZ, and playing support for Al Jarreau and George Benson – not to mention performing at the Monterey Jazz Festival in California with the RFBB.
Erna loves to sing the blues and works regularly with a Whanganui blues band called “Blues Buffet” – and now and then teams up with Wellington vocalist Julie Lamb under the moniker of “Two Bluesy Blondes”.
On a good day she also plays a mean harmonica.
We are SOOOO looking forward to her engagement at The Realm with her ‘A’ team of musicians:
• Oscar Laven (saxophones)
• Duncan Haynes (piano)
• Rory McCartney (bass)
• Greg Crayford (drums and host)
Join us!
Table bookings 04 974 2207 or info.therealm@nzvenueco.nz or therealm.co.nz and click on ‘book a table’
Great ambience, good company, superb kai and stellar music. What more could a jazz fan want?
Jamming and sit-ins more than welcome. Bring your horn/axe/favourite toy.
Hope to see you there
Mark your diary!
Twenty Years of Realm Jazz Variety Concert/Gig – Many Acts!
30th August 2025 from 2pm-10pm
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Kapiti Spring Spin Disc Golf Pop-Up!, Kapiti Spring Spin Disc Golf Pop-Up!
Kapiti Spring Spin Disc Golf Pop-Up!

Celebrate spring with a spin! Whether you're a disc golf regular or just curious, this pop-up event is your chance to play, learn, and connect in one of Kapiti’s most scenic reserves.

🎯 What’s Happening:
All-ages, all-skill-level disc golf—no limits, just play!
Hire out gear and learn the basics from local players.
Relaxed, social vibe—bring friends, family, or come solo!

🧭 Where:
Pukekawa Reserve, Waikanae — a beautiful open space perfect for a casual round and springtime hangs.

🛠️ What to Bring:
Comfortable shoes
Water bottle
Your own discs (or hire some on-site!)
No toilet facilities currently available onsite.

💚 Support the Future of Disc Golf in Kapiti
Koha (donations) will be accepted on the day.
All contributions go directly toward building a permanent nine-hole disc golf course at Pukekawa Reserve.
A suggested koha of $20 or more helps make this vision a reality — but any amount is appreciated.

No registration needed — just show up and spin!
Follow this event for updates and weather info.
label: Sports & Fitness

description:
HED PE | Still ‘Broke’ New Zealand Tour | with Nonpoint, Celebrating the 25th anniversary of their landmark album Broke, the band will deliver a full-throttle set packed with fan favourites like Bartender, Killing Time, and Feel Good;  which featured none other than Serj Tankian (System of a Down) and Morgan Lander (Kittie) on the album.
Critics hailed Broke as a “magnum opus of rap, funk, hip hop, and metal” (UnEarthed), while Sputnikmusic praised its “excellent”RATM meets hip-hop genre fusion and raw emotional punch. Whilst RateYourMusic users described the album as “hedonistic, energetic, vulgar, rhythmic, urban, and heavy,” capturing the raw essence of its sound and attitude. With over 450,000 copies sold worldwide, Broke remains a defining moment in the nu-metal era and this tour is your chance to relive it live.
Expect pounding riffs, funk-infused grooves, and the unmistakable flow of frontman Jahred Gomes, whose stage presence turns every show into a riotous celebration of rebellion and rhythm. From their self-titled debut in 1997 to their latest release New and Improved, (HED) P.E. continues to evolve while staying true to their anti-establishment roots.
With an incredible career spanning nearly three decades, Nonpoint has long been a force to be reckoned with in the nu-metal/rap-rock genre. Known for legendary live performances and explosive tracks such as Bullet with a Name, What a Day, Ruthless, and more, the band has consistently captivated audiences with infectious riffs, compelling lyrics, and an uncompromising raw energy. Their discography and stagecraft have made them staples at rock radio and fixtures on festival lineups, earning them a dedicated international following.
This is not nostalgia, it’s a full-blown sonic nu-metal assault. Don’t miss (HED) P.E. and NONPOINT as they rip through New Zealand with setlists that traverse decades, defy genres, and unleash pure, unfiltered chaos!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
John Campbell’s Destiny Church Investigation: Part 2 Under His Command, John Campbell investigated Destiny Church in a five-part documentary screened in April this year.
Join us to watch Part 2 of John Campbell’s Destiny Church investigation. John Campbell highlights some consistent themes of Brian Tamaki's Destiny Church: far-right prejudices, manifest anger, and hatred.
In Auckland on 21 June, Destiny Church organised a march to take "a bold public stand for Christian values, Kiwi identity and the future of this nation".
On Saturday, 13 September, Brian Tamaki attended the London “Unite the Kingdom” protest organised by far-right political activist Tommy Robinson that claimed to celebrate 'free speech', but also contained chants of hate, racist conspiracy theories, and Christian nationalist slogans. Among disturbing scenes, some people in the crowd ripped up a flag that read 'Secular Humanism'. To them, the very idea that people of all backgrounds and beliefs can live together with equality and respect is something to fear and destroy. For decades, the far right in the USA has painted humanism as a bogeyman, blaming it for liberal values, the rights of women, and the rights of LGBT people. It shows that those who thrive on fear are deliberately targeting the very values that underpin human rights and human dignity. Humanism is not a fringe or ‘woke’ idea. It is about fairness. It is about reason. It is about believing in the good that people are capable of when they are free to live their lives without fear or prejudice. These protests, which Brian Tamaki is supporting, are a show of force from those who wish to undo progress, to divide communities, and to undermine cherished freedoms.
We have a growing concern for secular values in our community. We cannot be silent. It is essential to keep compassion alive in public life and politics. After watching the documentary, we will discuss our concerns and how we might respond.
Time: Oct 6, 2025 06:30 PM Auckland, Wellington
Join Zoom Meeting
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/88183700512...
label: Community & Culture

description:
Handel's Messiah, Celebrate the festive season with a magnificent performance of Handel’s Messiah on Saturday, 13 December, at 7:30 pm in the Michael Fowler Centre. Presented by Orpheus Choir Wellington in collaboration with Orchestra Wellington, this timeless masterpiece has been a beacon of holiday joy for centuries, blending grandeur, beauty, and drama in equal measure.

Under the direction of Brent Stewart, Music Director of Orpheus Choir Wellington and one of New Zealand’s leading conductors, this performance promises to capture the full brilliance of Handel’s most beloved work. From the exuberance of Worthy is the Lamb to the powerful The Trumpet Shall Sound and the transcendent Hallelujah Chorus, Messiah is a musical journey that inspires and uplifts like no other.

Joining Brent is a stellar lineup of soloists. Emma Pearson, recognised for her captivating performances on international stages, brings brilliance and artistry. Mezzo-soprano Maaike Christie-Beekman adds depth and warmth with her rich, expressive voice. Rising tenor Lila LJ Crichton contributes freshness and flair, while Lexus Song Quest winner Joel Amosa grounds the quartet with his commanding bass.

The Michael Fowler Centre, renowned for its superb acoustics and stunning architecture, provides the perfect setting for this extraordinary concert. With its sweeping choruses, unforgettable arias, and sheer emotional power, Messiah is the ultimate way to mark the festive season.

Come and join us for an evening of musical brilliance that will have you saying, Hallelujah!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Hihi and The Stitchbirds at Wellington Bluegrass Society, Hihi and The Stitchbirds are going from strength to strength. The songwriting is flowing and evolving, new instruments are being acquired, and the band are excited for what might happen next. After a packed out EP launch last year for their EP On A Good Day, they are thrilled to be returning to Wellington Bluegrass Society at Abandoned Petone on Saturday 1st November. Their next dream is to record a full album of their original songs - perhaps on another good day in Wellington!

Hihi and The Stitchbirds are: Elena Saunders - vocals and vibes, Chris Goldsbury - guitar, clarinet and vocals, Tessa Luff - guitar, banjo ukulele and vocals, Matt Hutton - bass ukulele and vocals, and Ellie Stewart - fiddle and vocals.

Two acts will also perform on the night. First is Tessa Luff, who is the main song-writing powerhouse behind Hihi and The Stitchbirds. With natural musicality pulsing through her veins, Tessa experiments with melody and rhythm and brings an ethereal mix of life’s raw highs and lows to her songwriting. For the very first time she will perform her works solo and the audience are in for a rare treat.

Second are The Elderflower Experiment, a charming trio of singer-songwriters priding themselves in story-telling through song. They combine tight vocal harmonies with folk inspired strings, to take you on journeys of love and loss and the spaces in between.

The Elderflower Experiment are:
Tessa Luff - vocals and guitar, Ellie Stewart - vocals and fiddle, and Elena Saunders - vocals and vibes.

description:
Hogsnort Bulldogs Goodtime Band, Hogsnort Bulldogs Goodtime Band are back with a new show featuring more of their skiffle-pop n’ jug music!

The band, that includes original stars from the sixties and seventies hit bands, Hogsnort Rupert, Bulldogs Allstar Goodtime Band and Dave and the Dynamos, is excited to be back on the Kāpiti coast to perform their energetic and fun-filled show.

Founding members, Dave Luther, Kevin Findlater and Neil Worboys, have collaborated with other great Wellington musicians to develop the “Hogsnort Bulldogs Goodtime Band”. During their two hour show the band perform all their great chart-topping hits from the era including ‘Pretty Girl’, ‘Miss September,’ ‘Aunty Alice Bought Us This’, ‘Everyone Knows’ and ‘Life Begins at Forty’. Other well-known skiffle and jug band songs, blues and popular standards are also featured. After very successful shows across 2023 and 2024, the guys are looking forward to performing once again on the Kāpiti Coast in 2025.

Videos featuring many of the songs they’ll be performing can be viewed on the band’s website: www.hogsnortbulldogs.co.nz and on YouTube.

Support act, Andrew and Kirsten London, are celebrated Kāpiti musicians and entertainers who’ve played everywhere from Dubai to Dannevirke. They have released a number of very successful albums of original material with a humorous focus on the unpredictable nature of day to day life.

--

For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email kiaora@teraukura.nz or call 04)9740535 during office hours.

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Louisa Williamson, The ninth concert in this series of Aotearoa composers features the multi-talented saxophonist/composer Louisa Williamson.

Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other.  Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo.

"This commission opportunity has come at a perfect time for me to process some recent grief and pain that’s inhabited my circles. Whilst composing this music, I’ve thought about ideas around mental health, specifically with youth in Aotearoa, and also honouring some friends who have passed. I think artists have the ability to turn heartbreak into beauty, and this music is an attempt at that. Although the inspiration which generated the music is heavy, the performance itself will hopefully feel light and reflective (turning heartbreak into beauty = darkness into light!), and will embrace and celebrate the talents of the musicians who are playing. I’ve brought together a beautiful group of people who I know will handle this music with care and fortitude"

Bryn van Vliet - alto/flute
Tyaan Singh - alto sax
Louisa Williamson - tenor/flute
Eilish Wilson - baritone sax
Sylvester Green - trumpet
Kaia Johnstone - trumpet
Kaito Walley - trombone
Jakob Elijas - trombone
Anna Lee - euphonium
Sam Zhu - tuba
Leonardo Coghini - piano
Jacob Hurst - bass
Max Sheehan - drums

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15 from Humanitix.com, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz in Martinborough 2025, Big Band Brings Back the Swing
Jazz in Martinborough 2025

Jazz in Martinborough is thrilled to be bringing you the Royal New Zealand Airforce Jazz Orchestra as our feature act on Saturday at the festival for 2025.

“We’re delighted to be able to fill the stage with a full-sized big band of fabulous musicians, and the Town Hall with the fantastic sounds of the big band era,” says Jazz in Martinborough Music Director Lee Quayle.

Jazz in Martinborough is back for their 13th edition during the first weekend in September with ticketed shows on Friday 5th and Saturday 6th and other gigs around town as usual. “The RNZAF Jazz Orchestra will be one of our ticketed gigs, featuring on the Saturday evening,” says Lee. “And on Friday night we invite you to Be Transported back in time to a speak easy club with the superb swing and blues combo that is April’s Fools,” adds Lee.

Staying true to the tradition of swing and improvisation the RNZAF Jazz Orchestra draws on their own rich history dating back to the original ‘swing era’. The Orchestra is a national trailblazer in big band history and features New Zealand compositions, and a classic repertoire from the golden era of big band swing jazz of Ellington and Basie.

The band benefits from a depth of talent that most military bands around the world would only dream of and is made up of Wellington’s most exceptional musicians.

“The line-up will be a who’s who of the Wellington jazz scene,” says Lee. “It’s a while since we had a big band at the festival, so we’re elated to have the Airforce Jazz Orchestra back with us again. They last played at the festival in 2014. Many of the band members have been here since, but not as part of a big band,” says Lee.

Be Transported by April’s Fools
Imagine stepping back in time to a speak easy club. A smoky, dimly lit room where the anticipation is electric but the vibe is laid-back and relaxed. . .

From the stage a jazz swing and blues band begins to play, their instruments blending seamlessly in a harmonious symphony of sound. The rhythm section, with its upright bass and snare drums, lays down a groove that's impossible to resist, while the saxophone punctuates the air with soulful notes.

At. the forefront stands a captivating female singer, her voice rich and velvety, weaving tales of heartache, joy, and everything in between. Her vocal prowess brings both swing and blues to life, effortlessly moving from sultry, slow blues ballads to energetic, foot-tapping swing numbers.

This band doesn't just play music; they create an experience that transports the audience to another era, where the essence of jazz and blues reigns supreme.

Welcome to an evening of superb swing jazz and blues brought to you by the band that is April’s Fools. “We’re absolutely wrapt to be bringing this ultra-talented and experienced combo to the festival,” says Music Director Lee Quayle. “Whenever, and wherever this group of musicians have played reviewers have to search the thesaurus for new superlatives to describe the show, and audiences leave reluctantly, but happy.”

April’s Fools are April Phillips (vocals), Greg Crayford (drums), Zak Dikvert (guitar), Nicholas Bauke-Maunsell (saxophone), Miles Crayford (keyboards) and RoryMacartney (bass). They will be playing at Jazz in Martinborough on Friday 5 September 2025 as the opening of the ticketed festival gigs to be held in the Town Hall.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Free Status, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Free Status is a jazz fusion band, drawing melodic inspiration from iconic artists like Herbie Hancock and 70s jazz/funk legends with electronic flair inspired by artists like Moby.

At the heart of Free Status is Tommy David on keys, an accomplished musician/composer in the early stages of his career. He has earned recognition in numerous jazz competitions and supported legendary rock acts such as Dire Straits Legacy Band, Nazareth, Hello Sailor, and plays with popular rockabilly band, Recliner Rockers. With composition at the center of his artistry, he can't wait to share the exciting and genuine compositions he has created.

The rhythm section features Behzad Karakia (drums) and Tyler Diprose (bass), both veterans of performances with many of New Zealand's jazz greats.

On lead alto sax is James Dawes, recently selected for an international touring band on a year-long cruise. His versatility extends well beyond jazz.

On keys is Sam Voyle, whose primary instrument is tenor saxophone. Performing with Tommy since their school days, he has built a strong musical bond that has led to major appearances, including the America's Cup main stage and high-profile corporate events.

On vocals is Melody Lui-Webster, an award-winning singer and accomplished musical theatre performer and actor, with numerous professional stage and television roles.

Thank you for watching!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
KinoFest goes Wellington - Greetings from Mars, KinoFest goes Wellington!
After a successful run in Auckland, the Goethe-Institut New Zealand is bringing KinoFest to Wellington with two special screenings.

On 13 December 2025, we present Greetings from Mars — a heartwarming and imaginative coming-of-age story.
Ten-year-old Tom is different: he hates change, loud noises, and anything red. When he’s sent to spend six weeks with his siblings at their grandparents’ house, he transforms the experience into a full-blown Mars mission. Along the way, Tom discovers unexpected courage, connection, and new sides of himself.

A tender and humorous film about family, neurodiversity, and the power of imagination — perfect for audiences of all ages.

The screening starts at 4:00 PM, but feel free to join us from 3:30 PM for snacks and drinks in the foyer.

Greetings from Mars: Family, 2024, 82 minutes
German with English subtitles
Suitable from 6 years of age.
label: Film & Media

description:
KITA - Love Lives Here **revival + OHIMESAMA BREAKS, KITA 
Bass-heavy psych-pop

- KITA - lands on MOON for the first time in a few years, with live projection from Lucy Mila, and lights from The Doc Cave-Lynch! opening + closing BY OHIMESAMA BREAKS! Punctual departure, don't miss the take-off. A preview of their TWISTED FREQUENCY show.

8pm Doors / Opening by OHIMESAMA BREAKS
8:45pm - KITA -
10:15 Closing by OHIMESAMA BREAKS

Since releasing and touring their LOVE LIVES HERE EP in late 2023, the last two years have seen front-woman Nikita Tu-Bryant shoot and wrap her debut film featuring - KITA -
This summer, they are reviving their LOVE LIVES HERE Tour show with some added spice** in anticipation of their upcoming release of Tu-Bryant’s film.
Inspired by their EP LOVE LIVES HERE, the trilingual art-house film [ LOVE LIVES HERE ] is to be screened in 2026 on the film festival circuit around the globe.

Melding inspirations of folk, soul and psychedelia with the guitar and spirited storytelling of musician-actor Nikita Tu-Bryant (Avatar 2, Far North TV Series); the thick lushness of Moog bass synth and Fender Rhodes from Ed Zuccollo (Zuke); and the filthy drive and barking drums of Rick Cranson (Little Bushman) - KITA - have long-since solidified themselves as a must-see live band with a massive sound.
Over the years, you may have seen - KITA - main-stage with sets at SPLORE and WOMAD to the Wairarapa coasts at Tora Bombora and 121 Festival. Since their inception - KITA - have released 2 EPs and a debut album produced by Grammy-award winning Italian producer Tommaso Colliva (MUSE, RAZORLIGHT).

“ • KITA • are a vision straight from a synth-pop dream…the self-titled album • KITA • is a masterpiece ” - Muzic.net.nz

“To experience a • KITA • gig is to witness a stellar example of 3 strong musical identities ... fusing together to create a synergy and oneness unparalleled on the scene today.”
— Adam Page (WizardTone Studios AUSTRALIA)

The upcoming film is to be translated for a live cinema-stage show in late 2026 featuring live music from • KITA • playing a whole new original soundtrack, alongside a chorus of performers that echo the action and music on screen.

“ • KITA • have firmly established a reputation for their exceptional live performances, and their ability to connect people through music and storytelling.” - Ambient Light
label: Music & Concerts

description:
LVDF tickets, “Virtuosos” (The Guardian)
International jazz supergroup LVDF bring their genre-bending, globally informed sound to New Zealand for an exclusive appearance at the Wellington Jazz Festival.
All acclaimed bandleaders in their own right, LVDF is a cross-cultural quartet featuring Myele Manzanza (NZ/UK) on drums, Alex Hitchcock (USA/UK) on saxophone, Michelangelo Scandroglio (ITALY) on double bass and special guest Daniel Hayles (NZ) on piano and synths (stepping in for Maria Chiara Argirò). Their fresh sound fuses jazz with electronic textures, global rhythms and raw improvisation.
With Wellington-raised Myele Manzanza returning from London for this special hometown performance, LVDF will perform his groundbreaking Festival commission Music for a Multi-Polar World. This bold new work explores shifting global narratives through sound and draws on events from Brexit to the conflicts in Gaza, Sudan and Congo. Manzanza reflects “I’ve noticed how much the geopolitical shifts have unsettled and angered me, as well as shifting and widening my views on the world, and giving me some things to be hopeful for amidst change.” The work channels both the uncertainty and hope of a rapidly changing world.
The set will also feature tracks from LVDF’s upcoming self-titled EP - a bold and electric statement from a group as diverse in experience as it is unified in vision.
Only in Wellington - don’t miss the debut of one of modern jazz’s most exciting new ensembles, live at Meow Nui.
Commissioned by Wellington Jazz Festival
This LVDF performance is supported by Help Musicians UK, Embassy of Italy, Wellington & Comites Nuova Zelanda
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Dancing & Drinking Society, DADS return to The Undercurrent!

The Dancing & Drinking Society (or DADS for short), is New Zealand’s premier exponent of authentic 1920s dance Jazz with Rags, Rambles, Shuffles, Drags and Blues from the juke joints, speakeasies, woolsheds and Memorial Halls of 1920s New Zealand.

DADS have been bringing their swing blues sounds to dance floors and craft beer bars across the capital since late 1913. When they take to the stage, guitar, horns, vocals, and kick drum blend as The Society present their favourite old rarities with exactly the sort of vigour you want for some stress relieving dance times. They’ve cultivated a decent reputation for generous and open-hearted live performance.

If you feel like a decent drink and a leg shake or two, this would make for a pretty good option.

With Adrian Jensen, Daniel Yeabsley, Blair Latham, and now Michael Costello!

See: ⁦https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rlWe4fbd-O4⁩

Thursday 4th December
Doors 7pm/ Gig 7:30pm
$20
Tickets available online and on the door

Snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

We’ll see you there ☆
label: Hobbies & Interests
