description:
The Beatniks x IVY - NZ Tour 2025 - Wellington, ‘IVY’ and ‘The Beatniks’, two of the biggest independent artists coming out of Ōtepoti, are both known for their highly-captivating live performances. Melancholic in one instance, and packed full of noisy energy the next - now geared up with new material to showcase, the art-rock and surf-punk stylings of each of these young acts are tighter than ever.
‘IVY’ are held in the highest of regards when it comes to emerging kiwi artists. Nestling within the realm of dark and brooding tones, and immense, layered chorus, IVY know how to deliver a powerful and emotionally-resonant set; their sharp growth has quickly turned heads nationwide. From appearing on festival lineups such as Snow machine and OUSA Ori, playing with the Dunedin Youth Orchestra, and earning the SRN 2024 People’s Choice Award, IVY are ready to take their breathtaking art-rock performance around Aotearoa for the first time.
‘The Beatniks’ have been playing together since 2021, and have quickly become a ‘must-see’ live act within Aotearoa. After playing large-scale festivals last year, such as Rhythm & Alps, their recent release has delivered a more mature sound. Yet still soaked in their signature surf-grunge style. Having not toured the North Island since their debut album ‘Archetype’ in 2023, they’re ready to show you a whole new layer of alt-rock spirit on the stage.

SET TIMES:
7pm - Doors Open
7:30pm - Half/Angel
8:30pm - IVY
9:50pm - The Beatniks
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly., Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly.
At MOX, we're a small, family-run business based in beautiful Aotearoa, New Zealand. Founded and led by two partners who've shared life's journey for over 25 years, we bring a unique blend of personal commitment and professional expertise to every interaction.

We're not your typical consultants. Instead, we're hands-on experts in procurement and contract management, driven by a desire to create real, lasting change. Our mission is to empower businesses of all sizes, helping you secure the best deals, avoid pitfalls, and gain the kind of commercial protection usually reserved for the big players. We believe in enabling your success by ensuring your contracts and purchasing processes truly work for you.

Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly.

Procurement Case Studies - The Bad: How things can go wrong and cost you $$$.
Contract Myth Busting - The Ugly: Why we should embrace contracts; they aren’t “ugly”.
Best Practice - The Good: How good procurement & contracts will “save the day” and protect your business.
Contract Counselling: Tell us about your “bad(s)”. We will guide you on how you can make it “good”.
We have an amazing new innovation that we want to introduce at the session (during the Best Practice part) called Kitset Contract. Kitset Contract is going to empower sole traders & small to medium sized enterprises to truly be able to create and use their own contracts; Allowing them to better protect their business and their hard earned $$$.

Everyone who attends the session will receive a discount code meaning their first contract will be only $49.99 (a $100 discount).

RSVP Here: https://www.kapitichamber.org.nz/events#!event/2025/8/5/l-d-procurement-contract-myths-8211-the-good-the-bad-the-ugly
label: Business & Networking

description:
Testpot presents - Friends Of Friends at Breaker Bay Hall, Testpot presents - Friends Of Friends
Wellington alternative indie rock trio Testpot present Friends of Friends. An afternoon-into-evening celebration of music, community, and connection. From afternoon grooves to electric evening highlights, this is more than just a gig; it’s a gathering, a celebration, and one we'd love you to join us for.
Pack a picnic, bring the whole family, bring your mates, bring drinks, bring a smile.
Friends of Friends is celebrating the connections that hold us together. Every band on the line-up is connected through friendships, side projects, and shared stages, making this a rare chance to see a community of musicians in one place.
So come meet some new friends, old friends, hang out with and get to know:
PLANET
BEANS AND DON
SAM R SAFFERY
BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO
TESTPOT
AGATHA PANTHA
KINGSTON HIGH ALL STARS
Experience all of these great bands in the beautiful and iconic setting of Breaker Bay Hall.
BYO friend, food and drinks.
Seatoun village is a stone's throw away, so just nip out, grab some cold ones and some fish and chips or something to bring back to the hall and enjoy.
Can't wait to see you there.
* * * * T E S T P O T * * F R I E N D S * *O F * *F R I E N D S * * * *
PLANET - A mix of traditional bagpipe airs with post punk riffs and a dollop of vaudevillian good humour. It could be world music, it could be underground indie rock. It could be psychedelic folk music. But it's always approachable and certainly a lot of fun.
https://planetband.nz
BEANS AND DON - A dynamic duo beautifully sculpting a path of folky ballads through love, loss, and much, much more.
https://www.facebook.com/.../Don-and-The.../61552936937584/
SAM R SAFFERY - From rural New Zealand to the subways and bodegas of New York, Samuel R. Saffery’s musical journey is unquestionably linked to place and movement.
Blending indie folk, alternative rock, and classical influences, his songs are delivered with a distinctive, melodic voice, as haunting as it is sweet.
Instagram: www.instagram.com/slamsafari
Bandcamp: www.samuelsaffery.com
Twitter: @samuelsaffery
BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO - A six-piece herd of instrument addicts play a mix of electronic and acoustic to produce pop-rock that is equal parts playful and whimsical. Catchy indie-pop licks, lush harmonies, and hooks that stick, the enigmatic, multi-faceted group Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo – so good they named the band three times.
https://www.facebook.com/buffalobuffalobuffaloband/
TESTPOT - Alternative indie rock trio colliding sonic inspirations from bands such as Radiohead, Animals as Leaders, and Duran Duran. A sonic commentary on social media, corruption, AI, surveillance, and the other goodies we’re all told we have to live with. A side project of Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo member Hayden Overton, joined by the talented Scott Roy and the percussive brilliance of Lachie Kendric, doing whatever it is we do.
AGATHA PANTHA - Expect the unexpected from Wellington-based Agatha Pantha - a folk/rock four-piece whose sounds range from bouncing rhythms to dark, tangled ballads to anthemic rock numbers. The product of four unlikely allies joined by musical fortitude and lived experience, here to provide a therapeutic soundtrack to the everyday.
https://agathapantha.bandcamp.com
KINGSTON HIGH ALL STARS - The Kingston High All Stars are a Wellington-based band founded by 5 friends who are inspired by the brilliant, hypnotic and incredibly rhythmic music coming out of the Western Sahara. KHAS has since developed their signature style, blending desert blues, psych-rock, middle eastern classical, reggae and funk.
https://on.soundcloud.com/AbWAV1ZLdrs7cgOvf2
https://www.facebook.com/.../Kingston-High-All-Stars.../
Links
planetband.nz/
https://www.facebook.com/.../Don-and-The.../61552936937584/
www.samuelsaffery.com
https://www.facebook.com/buffalobuffalobuffaloband/
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington, The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington
Ready to take these new tracks on the road, The Grogans new album Stagger is out, plus the band are excited to announce a headline tour across New Zealand. Exploring another side of The Grogans' music, Stagger is a patchwork of different sounds and sonic inspirations that all come together in the one album, "it came from this idea that it was a jagged and stylistically different album track to track", explain The Grogans.
Kicking off their tour at Loons in Christchurch on Wednesday 3 September, the band then head to Yonder in Queenstown on Thursday 4 September, San Fran in Wellington on Friday 5 September before wrapping up at Double Whammy Auckland on Saturday 6 September. Prior to their Aotearoa dates, the trio will also be playing a seven date tour throughout Australia along with stops in LA and New York for North American shows this June.

Capturing the magnetic energy of their live shows, Stagger touches on themes of mental health, taking care of yourself and your loved ones, the occasional love song, and more. As the catchy chorus first single and album opener ‘Oh Boy’ leads into
sonic powerhouse of a tune ‘Come Up (Goes Down)’, ‘In My Heart’ slows it down to a new easy listening direction, followed by ‘Have a Little Dream’ - as dreamy as the title suggests - and the big open echoed instrumentation of ‘Once In A While’. Adding new textural effects in ‘Roll Back’ and last single ‘Roundabout’, ‘Happier Man’ dips into a heavier psych realm with a reminder that "striving to be a better and happier person should be a goal for everyone." ‘Worry About Everything’ is an upbeat tune sure to have you worrying about nothing, and feel good album closer ‘All My Days’ ends on a more serious note that outlines the beauty and the beast of live music and the personal struggles that come with the lifestyle and touring.

Tickets go on sale 12pm, Wednesday 28 May.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The RVMES Album Tour live at Meow, Wellington w/ Devon Welch & Fortuna (DJ), Come down for an epic night in the heart of Wellington with. The RVMES (pronounced The Rooms for the new). These lads are a high energy alt-rock band from Tāmaki Makaurau Auckland who are releasing their fourth album Boundary Issues and hitting the road for a 9-date tour around Aotearoa.
SUPPORT FROM!
Devon Welch
An Auckland based alternative funk fusion up-and-comer. They lay down 70s funk grooves blended with hip-hop production and live showmanship that'll set your heart on fire
Fortuna
Growing up in Germany with a vibrant family of musicians with Italian and African heritage. Fortuna's passion for music and dance was ignited from an early age
Her adventurous spirit and love for experimentation have now driven her to promote her own events in Wellington. With her mesmerizing and melodic beats, Fortuna takes to the decks, captivating audiences with her hypnotic and uplifting sounds.
- http://for-tunes.com
- http://fortuna.for-tunes.com/
ROY (93silva)
Freshly returned to the Pōneke shores from his hometown-Taranaki, 93silva returns with a suitcase full of bouncy rhythms, groovy basslines, and infectious vocal dubs. With a sound that’s constantly evolving.
93silva is here to keep you guessing, keep you sweating, and most of all—keep you dancing.
Fortuna and 93silva will be performing together and we cannot wait to see what they come up with!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Walk in the Dark Carterton, This session is held at the Carterton Golf Course.

Step into the beauty of the night with this unique new offering for the Wairarapa Walking Festival. Hosted on the manicured grounds of a local golf course, this gentle evening stroll allows you to experience the magic of darkness without worrying about uneven paddocks or rough terrain.

As we walk together, the transition from dusk to dark will naturally unfold, helping us acclimatise to the night. For those new to walking in the dark, handy red-light torches will be provided to keep you comfortable. This is less about distance and more about slowing down, stepping slightly outside of your comfort zone, and embracing the calm of night.

Along the way, we’ll reflect on the value of darkness - its role in history, its impact on wellbeing, and its importance for the environment. We’ll then pause to share hot chocolate and, if the skies are clear, look up in awe at a canopy of stars. With star charts in hand, we’ll explore what the November night skies have to offer and why protecting them matters.

The evening concludes with simple, practical ways we can all help preserve our night skies - because our environment doesn’t end at the treetops, it stretches all the way to the stars.

Photo credits: Jet Productions
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
The Racket Lounge: Evolve, The Racket Lounge: Evolve
Come along to the FINAL Racket Lounge concert for 2025 to hear some brand new music written by local composers and soak in the good vibes!

🎸 The Racket Lounge: Evolve
📅 Wednesday 8 October, 6.30pm
🎟 Book now through the link above


Last year the NZSQ Trust launched the Racket Lounge, a concert series for classical and jazz musicians with experience ranging from students to pros to freely express their creativity in a non-traditional concert setting. It was a huge success, with over 250 audience members and 52 artists over our four sessions. Audiences were raving about the musical variety and great talent they found at the Racket Lounge, and as one audience member commented; “Well done…do it again!” So, we listened, and the Racket Lounge is back for round two! Once again hosted at Bedlam & Squalor (above the Rogue & Vagabond), we welcome audiences, composers and performers back for another four concerts full of innovative, fun, and chill music. From classical to pop covers, video game soundtracks to original compositions, there's something for everyone to sink their teeth into at The Racket Lounge!

Even if you've never been to a classical music concert before, this one is for you. With a 'Choose your price' model you can afford to give it a go - and you might even find something you like!

A Flexible Price, So You Can Take A Chance on Something New:
Our prices range from $5 to $100, just pick the ticket price you feel like paying. At The Racket Lounge, we believe everyone should have access to high-quality but affordable art. If you're a bit strapped for cash right now, but still want a good night out, no worries! Just book yourself a $5 ticket! If you can afford to pay a little more and want to do some good for your community, then pick one of our higher ticket prices and rest assured that your dollars are going towards funding great, accessible art in your city.

All proceeds from ticket sales will go directly into presenting the next Racket Lounge, including paying musicians and artists, hiring instruments and marketing costs. Plus, by choosing a higher price point, you're ensuring that we're able to continue to offer tickets at a lower price point for those who need it.

Please note: Bedlam & Squalor is a licenced venue, so under 18s must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Everyone must bring ID.

Supported by Wellington City Council.

description:
This week! Pig Destroyer + Glassblower + Post Natal Abortion- Wellington - San Fran, PIG DESTROYER Australian & New Zealand Tour
September 2nd – 14th, 2025
with guests WORMROT – Australia only
Sept 2nd – Perth, Amplifier Bar w/ Bile Cannon, Allocer*
Sept 4th – Adelaide, Lion Arts Factory w/ Meth Leppard
Sept 5th – Melbourne, Max Watts w/ Tongue Scum
Sept 6th – Sydney, The Factory Theatre w/ Crown Street Militia
Sept 7th – Canberra, The Baso w/ Blight Worms
Sept 9th – Brisbane, The Triffid w/ Awful Noise
Sept 10th – Townsville, The Warehouse w/ Varrim*
Sept 12th – Auckland, Galatos w/ Imperial Slave, Sawnoff*
Sept 13th – Christchurch, Loons w/ Vixen Execution, Unyielding Desolation*
Sept 14th – Wellington, San Fran w/ Glassblower, Post Natal Abortion*
*Wormrot not appearing in Perth, Townsville or NZ
TICKETS ON SALE at:
PERTH, MELBOURNE, CANBERRA, TOWNSVILLE – www.oztix.com.au
ADELAIDE, SYDNEY, BRISBANE - www.moshtix.com.au
AUCKLAND - https://galatos.co.nz
CHRISTCHURCH - www.undertheradar.co.nz
WELLINGTON - https://moshtix.co.nz
PIG DESTROYER boil metal down to its muscle, sinew, and bone - razor-sharp guitar, percussive pummelling, and a lone, stark howl - and use them to commit a vicious assault. The lyrics paint loathsome, frightening images of pitch-black self-hatred and the frailty of the human experience. These musical manifestations only serve to cement their already legendary status. Having not been in Australia and New Zealand since 2008, PIG DESTROYER’s long overwaited return has just one goal. To unnerve the unprepared with a deranged, grisly intensity which very few, if any, can match.
Recently reforming to the original line-up, Singapore’s WORMROT resume their genius in unleashing exquisite noise together, with the announcement of a new album 'TNT'. Grinding faces with the best of them, their performances are intense, spectacular, furious, with a barrage of unrelenting, head-caving abuse, honed by a singular determination to destroy the competition.
www.facebook.com/TheRealPigDestroyer

www.facebook.com/wormrot

www.swdpresents.com
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – Vogelmorn, Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – big hearts, remarkable songs – on stage, with a collection of brand new tunes.
Doors at 7
Music at 7.30
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com
-----------------
Tom Cunliffe writes folk songs like short films; vivid, offbeat, and full of heart. Based in Tamaki Makaurau, Auckland, he crafts lyrical worlds, with a guitar tuned sideways and a voice that balances gravity with joy.
Cunliffe has supported a number of internationally renowned artists including M. Ward, Grace Cummings, and Reb Fountain, bringing his mix of warmth, wit, and slow-burning intensity to stages near and far.
-----------------
"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”
“The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com”
Ali Whitton is an Aotearoa-born, Yorkshire-raised and now Wellington based singer-songwriter who is stepping into his own as an artist. Ali is an artist who refuses to let go, blending raw storytelling with a sound shaped by decades of experience and dedication to his craft.
Performing for years under the name Lost Bird, Ali built a reputation for writing heartfelt, melancholic folk-pop, playing everywhere from Wellington bars to stadium stages — including opening for Ed Sheeran in Auckland in 2018.
Now, after years of performing behind an alias, Ali is stepping forward under his own name, embracing his identity as an artist with an invigorated sense of purpose, and tackling his artistry with newfound confidence and clarity.
-----------------
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours.

description:
TRC Tractors Manawatu Offroad Racing Championship, TRC Tractors Manawatu Offroad Racing Championship
Entry form is live:

Back again for 2025, the TRC Tractors Manawatu Offroad Racing Championship! This year, we are doing it a little differently - each class will take part in four heats as usual, but two of these will be 'Quick Fire Sprints' (5 laps) and two will be 'Super Sprints' (9 laps). That is over 40km of racing, for bugger all cost!
Entry fee: Adult Classes $50 / KiwiTrucks $30. Spectator entry by gold coin donation.
Be part of an action-packed day of short course racing at everyone's favourite offroad racing track!
This event gets bigger each year with drivers descending on Feilding from across the North Island. Will a local regain the title, or will another out-of-towner take it away in 2025?
One thing is for sure - you've got to be in it to win it!

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Milford Sound, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Traskforce! ft. Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin, Traskforce! ft. Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin
Two of Wellington’s most enthralling vocalists perform with a powerhouse octet in a celebration of the sublime songs of the jazz repertoire.

Tickets here!
https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/98187/Traskforce!-Ft.-Wallace-Gollan-And-Eugene-Wolfin.utr

Starring Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin on vocals, the octet will present a fizzing set of big band swing, Broadway hits, and gorgeous ballads. Hear the fine lyricism of the 20th century sung by two of Wellington’s most exciting performers.

Exhilarating original compositions and arrangements will tug at your feelings in new and compelling ways. Daring solos from some of the finest musicians in the country will awe and shock you as the turbulent horns sing out.

Witness the union of big band attitude and chamber music intimacy as this very special band play their hearts out to you.


The performers:

Consistently connecting the dots between genres and influences, Wallace Gollan’s artistic identity has become uniquely recognizable, with her jazz training and distinct harmonies captivating audiences around the globe.

For the last 8 years vocalist Eugene Wolfin has been a regular of Wellington music scene performing in a wide variety of genres including Jazz, Blues, and Rock ’n’ Roll. He has had a hand in a few local Musical Theatre productions performing lead roles in ‘Chess’ and the modern hit ‘If/Then', and is a regular in front of Jazz Orchestras including the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band and the Rodger Fox Big Band.

Traskforce! is bandleader Alex Trask’s most swinging musical organisation. They play fresh arrangements of original compositions, classic swing, and Broadway love songs. This includes songs from the Basie repertoire, Bob Mintzer, Oliver Nelson, Quincey Jones, and Lionel Bart's Oliver! to name a few. The five horn arrangements allow for the power of a big band and the subtlety of a quartet to shine side by side. The band is made up of Wellington’s top players, including members of the Rodger Rox Big Band, the RNZAF band, NZSM faculty, and rising stars.


Door sales $20, Pre-sales $15, Student/Concession $10


Personnel:

Wallace Gollan – vocals
Eugene Wolfin – vocals
Alex Trask – alto saxophone, arrangements
Mike Taylor – trumpet
Oscar Laven – tenor saxophone
Kaito Walley – trombone
Daniel Yeabsley – baritone saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
John Rae – drums
label: Music & Concerts

description:
the Jesus Lizard, After initially calling it a day in 1999, the Jesus Lizard officially return full time to save us from the current state of musical mediocrity with their latest album, Rack. A blistering resurgence of the so-called ‘noise rock’ they helped define alongside contemporaries Big Black, Flipper, The Birthday Party, with their previous and most noted albums Head, Goat and Liar. For those of us who live in fear of the reunion album and subsequent tour, the Jesus Lizard thankfully display not only the same chaotic and dark nihilism of their earlier careers but also the maturity and seasoning of a band riding a wave of renewed and reinvigorated form.

Once slated by famed engineer Steve Albini as “the greatest band I’ve ever seen’ the Jesus Lizard not only lived up to this lofty praise in their prime but continue to do so in their advancing years. David Yow still leads the charge as the maniacally possessed frontman entering crowds with reckless abandon and a stamina that much younger vocalists would kill for. The original rhythm section of David Wm Sims and Mac McNeilly further continue to prove why they were and are the best bass & drum combo since Jones and Bonham, anchoring the ship as Captain Yow and first mate Denison navigate the wild seas of their songs. And while he may not always feature (as he rightly should) on many modern music journalists ‘best guitarists lists’, Duane Denison could perhaps be the most innovative and idiosyncratic punk rock guitarist EVER. However, each member is a sum of their parts but combined they are as Albini also once said “the purest melding of the sublime and profane.”

Whether you are a longtime disciple of the Jesus Lizard, seeing them when last here in ‘98, or perhaps your fandom is more recent and have only seen videos of their legendary live performances, you will know that these shows are not to be missed.

Saturday 11th October 2025 - The Tuning Fork, Auckland (All ages)

Sunday 12th October 2025 - San Fran, Wellington (R18 unless accompanied by your legal guardian)
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal, Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal
Wendyhouse are Bryce Galloway and Daniel Powell (AKA Mr Pudding and EE monk). The pair met at the Elam School of Fine Arts. Wendyhouse got their name from debut performances at Art Space (Tāmaki Makaurau) where they sang songs set in the year 2032 from inside a Wendy house (Soundwatch ’92). A prolific creative period followed before EE monk relocated to Europe in 1995. Wendyhouse output has been somewhat sporadic ever since, but with EE monk’s recent return, the pair have returned to performing live.

Wendyhouse music was initially played on toy musical instruments, the kind that fit inside a Wendy house. Real instruments were added as the band moved out of the house and onto the stage.

The music is best described as lo fi inverted pop music, with lyrics about unlikely topics. For example, the two newest songs in the Wendyhouse are an existential treatise on real estate and a love/hate ode to Futurist Luigi Russolo. Guitar, toy keyboard and vocals are the Wendyhouse instruments of choice.

---


DSLB

DSLB is the solo project of Chrissie Butler (the shouty bass playing half of the now sleeping duo, mr sterile Assembly). An offshoot from Chrissie's other band Ditzy Squall, DSLB (Ditzy Squall's Lunch Box) is a showcase for a love of long endings and the hum things make when you hold them close to your ear. Performed live, DSLB is an improvised mash-up of ancient record players, purring keyboards, kitchen utensils and found objects. Soundtracks for short films and hand drawn comics are also residents in the lunch box. Recordings are released by skirted Records.

https://skirtedrecords.com/dslb/

---

vegetable.machine.animal

New solo project courtesy of Mr Sterile, in which living fungal and plantlife inform a modular synthesiser with biofeedback. This signal acts upon the synth changing the pitch, tone, rate and more in the delivery of sound. These ‘curated’ sounds are then responded to with percussion. VMA explores the intersections between spontaneous playing, electronic music, and science-informed inter-species collaboration.

https://mrsterileassembly.bandcamp.com/album/my-daughter-the-spider


$17.50 presales available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Nuclear Disarmament in a Nuclear Free New Zealand: Why it still matters, New Zealand is recognised as a global leader in nuclear disarmament, with its 1987 Nuclear
Free Zone, Disarmament, and Arms Control Act becoming a defining feature of the country’s
national identity. The establishment of a nuclear free zone has served as inspiration
worldwide, yet, despite this, the nuclear issue remains relevant to New Zealand. As long as
nuclear weapons exist, their environmental, humanitarian and geopolitical impacts extend far
beyond the borders of nuclear weapon states.
This panel and fireside chat seeks to situate New Zealand’s position within the global
nuclear landscape, exploring why the issue continues to matter to a nuclear free country,
highlighting the interconnected impacts of these weapons, whilst also considering New
Zealand’s role as a disarmament leader.
label: Government & Politics

description:
Pride In Place: Creating a Community Walk Tour, Join the team from Walk Tours NZ for a free and inspiring presentation on how to create and run your own non-profit community walk tour.

Over the past seven years, Walk Tours NZ has delivered more than 100 community tours around central Wellington, focusing on the city’s rich LGBTQIA+ Rainbow heritage.

This event goes behind the scenes of creating a walk tour and is perfect for anyone passionate about bringing place-based history to light – whether it’s Rainbow histories or a topic of your own choosing.

Hosts Roger Smith and Gareth Watkins will guide you through the key ingredients of a successful non-profit walk tour – including identifying interesting stops, crafting compelling narratives, and being an engaging host – even if you’ve never done it before!

Bring your curiosity, enthusiasm and ideas, and discover why walk tours offer a unique form of living history – and how the experience can build community and connect people. No previous walk tour experience is necessary, and all are welcome.

The Queen Elizabeth II Pukeahu Education Centre (formerly the Home of Compassion Crèche) in Pukeahu Park has limited space, so registration is essential.
Please sign-up here: https://walktours.nz/book

This free community event is part of the Aotearoa Festival of Architecture 2025, organised by Walk Tours NZ in collaboration with the New Zealand Institute of Architects (Wellington Branch).
label: Community & Culture

description:
An Invitation to Love, You’re invited!
Cantoris is excited to announce our second concert for 2025: An Invitation to Love.
Romantic love, sacred love, and even friendship will be captured through the works of Tallis, Ireland, Whitacre, and the shimmering centrepiece of Lauridsen’s ‘Nocturnes’.
New works by Wellington’s own Jonathan Berkahn sit alongside a vibrant selection of madrigals that capture the joy, longing, and playful spirit that love inspires.
We cannot wait to perform and share our love of this music with you!
Sunday 7th September | 3pm
St Peter’s Anglican Church | 211 Willis Street, Pōneke
Tickets are available NOW at the link in our bio. See you soon

description:
A good time to sing!, There is so much going on in the world right now, and that can be overwhelming! Now is a good time to sing. A good time to get together and feel the power of community and connection through singing.
Sing for renewal and hope. Sing for harmony, joy, and inspiration. Sing for healing. Sing to regain your strength and empower others.
Spend the day at the serene sanctuary that is the Home of Compassion in Island Bay and restore yourself.
We will breathe together, listen, create beautiful sounds, let go of our worries, and lift each other up to a sense of fulfillment and joy.
And for the perfect finishing touch, a delicious lunch and morning tea are all included. All you need to do is come along!
Jonathan Berkahn and Lala Simpson have been working together, leading workshops and performing for many years. They are both highly skilled song leaders that lead from the heart and joyfully share their gifts. You will be in safe hands.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Aotearoa Interfaith Forum 2025, Aotearoa Interfaith Forum 2025
Please join us for our hybrid Interfaith Forum, with in-person meetings in Wellington, Christchurch, Dunedin, and further hubs!

Saturday, 13 September 2025 from 5:30 to 8:30PM


The Wellington Interfaith Council is hosting a hybrid online national forum for our community this year. We understand travel costs can be a barrier to in-person gatherings, so we're creating a unique way to connect!

The forum will be opened by two accomplished speakers. Then, each regional council will host their own in-person meeting, simultaneously linking up online for a shared discussion (kaupapa). This allows local interfaith members to gather in a convenient local location, connecting to the national screen and video via Zoom.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Art @ The Cathedral: Celebrate the Fabric, Exquisite pieces of needlework are on display and in use every day at Wellington Cathedral of St Paul: beautifully decorated fabrics that hang at the front of the altars, spectacular robes and stoles worn by priests at services, and fine linens used at every service of Holy Communion. You’ll learn much about this remarkable fabric artistry when Jo Dixey talks to the Friends of Wellington Cathedral of St Paul and guests on Wednesday, 24 September at 10.30 am.
Jo is an internationally regarded embroiderer who graduated from the Royal School of Needlework and now lives permanently in New Zealand. She teaches, exhibits and sells her work, as well as accepting commissions. She has had contracts from the film industry, working on the Disney film Mulan and most recently on season 1 of Lord of the Rings TV series. Jo’s collection of embroidered 3D viruses, created during the 2020 Covid lockdown, are now on display in The Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

description:
Bach Choir, Nota Bene, Chiesa Ensemble - Bach's Christmas Oratorio, The Bach Choir of Wellington, in collaboration with Nota Bene and the Chiesa Ensemble, presents Bach’s Christmas Oratorio (Parts I, II, III & VI).

Bach’s Christmas Oratorio, BWV 248, is a spiritually rich masterpiece composed during 1723 and 1724 and first performed in its entirety during the Christmas season of 1734–1735 while Bach was serving in Leipzig. Drawing on earlier secular cantatas and a now-lost church cantata (BWV 248a), this oratorio weaves together a vibrant tapestry of sacred music celebrating the birth of Christ.

This performance features four of the six cantatas:

Part I opens with a dazzling transformation of secular music into sacred celebration. Drums, strings, winds, and triumphant trumpets set the stage for the Evangelist’s narration and a sequence of expressive recitatives and arias, including the beloved “Bereite dich, Zion” and the majestic “Großer Herr, o starker König.” Chorales, including the Passion Chorale, frame the cantata with solemn beauty.

Part II begins with a pastoral, tender tone, portraying the shepherds’ encounter with the angel. The sinfonia evokes a rustic charm with oboes and flutes, leading into serene chorales and the exquisite slumber aria, where the flute hovers like a halo above the alto voice. The cantata concludes with a joyful “Glory to God” and a reprise of “Vom Himmel hoch.”

Part III returns to grandeur with trumpets and drums, as the shepherds journey to Bethlehem. The Evangelist’s narration is interwoven with contemplative chorales, a duet for soprano and bass, and an aria reflecting Mary’s inner thoughts. The cantata closes with a reprise of its opening chorus, reinforcing its celebratory tone.

Part VI, written for Epiphany, shifts to a darker mood as the story turns to Herod’s treachery. The music is dramatic and unpredictable, mirroring the tension of the narrative. The arias and recitatives explore divine power and moral conflict, culminating in a triumphant final chorus embedded with the Passion Chorale—symbolically linking Christ’s birth to his eventual sacrifice.

This is the first time in over a decade the Christmas Oratorio is being performed in Wellington, making this a special opportunity to experience one of Bach’s most joyful and profound creations. We hope you will join us for an evening of radiant music and festive spirit.

description:
Awaken the Healer Within with Linda Nevin, Awaken the Healer Within with Linda Nevin
Linda’s extraordinary gifts have transformed lives from New Zealand to far-reaching corners of the world.

What makes Linda truly unique is not only the depth of her power, but her heart. With warmth, compassion, and a frequency that transcends space and time, she works gently yet profoundly—dissolving blocks, releasing old patterns, and awakening the body’s natural capacity to heal. Whether in person or online, Linda’s presence is felt deeply; her signature Infusion Healing blends vibration, color, crystals, and music to create experiences that are as extraordinary as they are transformative.

Clients describe her as “a guardian angel watching over you” — her healing energy both subtle and powerful, leaving you lighter, clearer, and more alive than ever before.

Discover the healing power that already lives within you.
Join us for a fun day of energy awakening, connection, and personal transformation in this in-person workshop designed to activate your innate healing abilities.

Whether you're brand new to energy healing or already on your path, this hands-on experience will leave you feeling grounded, empowered, and lit up with possibility.

What to Expect
This interactive experience is a joyful deep dive into the world of Infusion Healing — a unique blend of frequency, intention, imagery, and energy movement. You'll learn how to sense, shift, and send healing energy using simple yet powerful techniques that you can use daily to uplift yourself and others.

During the workshop you’ll learn how to feel energy in your hands and scan the body for imbalances. Create and send Infusion Balls of healing energy. Work with the body’s meridian system to release negative emotions. Infuse positive frequencies from Mother Earths’ healing basket. Work with totem, spirit and power animals.

You’ll Leave With
A deeper trust in your intuitive healing gifts. The ability to give and receive healing energy. Your own personalised energy infusion tools. A feeling of calm, clarity, and energetic confidence to enjoy the benefits of energy healing.

No prior experience is necessary — just a willingness to explore your own healing potential.
Come with curiosity. Leave with tools, insights, and an elevated energetic state you can return to anytime.

Please BYO lunch, morning tea provided.

Spaces are limited. Reserve your place now and step into your healing power.

Cost: $120
Book: https://www.lindanevin.com/services

Email:

Website: https://www.lindanevin.com

Venue: the pavilion room @ the art and living space, 17 Bradey Road, Pauatahanui

Newtown Festival 2026, Rātapu, Tuawaru o Poutū-te-rangi
Waiata | Kai | Ahurea | Mahi Toi
Aotearoa’s biggest and best free music festival and street fair returns for its 32nd year! A shining calendar highlight, Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most colourful suburb invites everyone to come along to their favourite street party. From dawn to dusk, the streets are packed with people of all ages, stages, backgrounds, cultures, locals, visitors, whānau and friends. The beloved Newtown Festival brings you more than 420 stalls, 200 artists, 1000 performers, 16 stages, and heaps of activities for the whole whānau. Join us in a celebration with a mass concentration and extravaganza of local cultural identity, creative expression, and a day of community togetherness and joy.

description:
CTRL_ALT_DEL, CTRL_ALT_DEL
Can we CTRL ourselves? ALT our reality? Or must we DEL everything else?

About this Event


Strap in for this emotional rollercoaster! Let voice, music and movement take you through a journey of resilience and self-discovery, to a wild, high-energy house party, to a powerful exploration of love, grief, and revenge. Three stories; one powerful connection.

Note to God - Jjohn Nickle
Note to God follows five individuals in therapy, each facing personal struggles. As they bond through shared pain, healing begins — until a twist tests their trust. A moving musical about connection, resilience, and finding hope in life’s darkest moments.
My House - Olivia Watts
My House is a high-energy show that takes you on a Saturday night and shows the heart of a house party. From the first guest to the final beat, experience explosive choreography, unforgettable characters, and music that moves your soul. It’s more than a party, it’s My House.
No Way Back? - Bryce Blackmore
No Way Back? explores one man’s experience with loss and what it means for his humanity. When everything is ripped away, how do we respond? In the wake of tragedy, we all face a choice: confront the pain and move forward or let it consume us.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Cacao and Soundscape with Kellie and Chelsea, This offering seeks to hold you in a space where you will be wrapped in warmth, and the healing alchemy of sound for two restorative hours. This will be an evening of inward reflection and deep nervous system nourishment, an opportunity to down regulate and tend to your inner world landscape.
The evening will begin with a cacao ritual and gently guided yoga nidra. Then guests will be cocooned in blankets, eye masks & bathed in sound alchemy for 90 uninterrupted minutes.
Chelsea and Kellie weave a story utilising an array of instruments in their collaborative offerings, as well as their love of voice activation and the power of mantra.
Over the course of this event, you will encounter the alchemic sounds of:
Two full sets of crystal singing bowls
The handpan and its earthy, resonant tones
Angelic harp melodies
Shamanic drumming
Soft and gentle wind chimes
Crystal pyramid and alchemy bowl with deep, ancient resonant frequencies
The shruti box and acoustic guitar, coupled with voice activation and sacred mantra
Previous attendees have described Kellie and Chelsea's soundscape journeys as unique, powerful, mesmerising and deeply soothing.

There is something so special about gathering with intention, to allow sound to move through you, to soften you, to bring you back home to yourself. We cannot wait to welcome you into the studio.

With all our love,
Chelsea & Kellie
Xx

description:
Blessing of the Animals, Show your love and appreciation for your pet and all animals, great and small, by joining us for the Annual Blessing of the Animals ceremony!
Unite with families, canines, and other creatures great and small, for the special opportunity to have your pets blessed.
At this joyous event, you can celebrate and give thanks for our companion animals and recognise the life of St. Francis of Assisi, their patron Saint. You can also light a candle in remembrance.
It also marks World Animal Day, celebrated on 4th October.
All pets are welcome – whether it is dogs, horses and donkeys on leads, cats in carriers, or birds and other small critters in cages.
This event is free and open to everyone, and all ages.
Please note: There will be a lot of animals, people and noise at this blessing. If your animal is not comfortable in this type of situation you may decide it is best to leave them at home. Instead, please bring a photo of your pet to have blessed.

description:
JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series #1, JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series #1
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing twice monthly session starting on November 28th!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are on the second and Fourth Friday of each month (between November 28th and March 28th 2026) and are held in the Meeting / Supper Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

INTRODUCING - SPECIAL WELCOME OFFER - TWO PEOPLE FOR $90 (You don't have to be a couple) - Book through bank transfer or message me directly

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

Booking Details
Investment: $55

Sesssion - 7pm -8.30pm on Fridays
in 2025 - 28/11, 12/12,
in 2026 - 30/1, 13/2. 27/2, 14/3, 28/3

Bookings can be made by bank transfer
to account in name of Heartsong Healing (via Hnry), 12-3245-0322503-37. Reference YIN . MONTH . 25 and YOUR NAME

OR PAY FOR ONE OR MORE PLACE BY CARD HERE - https://buy.stripe.com/14k3g1fIa3cJboQdRI

OR BUY THREE TICKETS FOR $150 HERE -

https://buy.stripe.com/00gg2N8fI6oV3Wo9Bt

and please confirm your payment by email to . Thank you.

Policy:
depending on booking numbers, if you need to cancel your place you may be able to transfer ticket to the next month once. We reserve the right to refuse transfer or refund if cancelled within 48 hours

description:
EYA Presents: The Bible and the Sacraments Bible Study, What are the Sacraments? Where do they come from? What do they mean? And why are they so central to our Catholic Faith?
In The Bible and the Sacraments, you’ll discover the deeply biblical roots of the Seven Sacraments and how they are more than mere Church rituals, but streams of life flowing from the living Body of Christ.
Throughout this study, you’ll discover how God has always dealt with His people through “sacraments,” and how the sacraments of the Old Testament find their ultimate fulfillment in the Seven Sacraments instituted by Christ and celebrated in the Catholic Church to this day.
Eucharistia Young Adults (EYA) introduces our second Bible study for 2025! This eleven-lesson Bible study by St Paul Center will delve into the beauty of the sacraments of the Catholic Church.
Please bring your Bible, journal, pen - and of course, your lovely self! Bring your friends, co-workers, family members, the more the merrier!
__________________
Every Wednesday | 16 July 2025 - 08 October 2025
St Mary's of the Angels Parish Hall
Everyone is most welcome!

description:
There Once Was a Boy..., Written and performed by Robert Lloyd

A boy is stranded at sea. A storm bears down on him, and, in what he believes are his final moments, he ponders his life and the choice he made to come here—to explore what’s over the curious horizon—and wonders: Was this a mistake? There once was a boy… is a fun, poetic performance for tweens, teens and their whānau. This live “pop-up book” explores curiosity, courage, and finding light in the darkness.

Recommended for audiences aged 10+. Contains flashing lights.

This show was created as part of the TAHI Festival 2025 Creative Residency programme, in partnership with Creative NZ, PAYPA and Toi Poneke Arts Centre.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Encounter Summit, Encounter Summit
A 2-day event during the school holidays for Year 7-13. Get ready for amazing worship, games, great sermons and connection.

About this Event

We are excited to invite your teenager to be part of our Encounter Summit - a two-day event designed for our next generation, from Year 7 to Year 13, filled with faith, fun, and fellowship. This summit is a powerful opportunity for young people to grow spiritually, encounter God in a fresh way, build lasting friendships, and create unforgettable memories.
We are thrilled to welcome Brodie McDowell, Youth Pastor at Elim Tauranga and the Elim National Youth Leader. Brodie is an inspiring communicator with a passion for reaching young people, and we believe his ministry will have a significant and lasting impact on our next generation.
Dates:
Friday 3 October 2025 - 10:00 AM to 9:00 PM

description:
Face of the Feminine, ~ FACE OF THE FEMININE ~
She is it all!

Two women, one powerful celebration of the feminine. An evening of embodiment, bringing to life the rich depth and diversity the feminine nature beholds.

You are invited to join Jennifer (Jennifer Moss Joy) and Marigold (Marama Medicine) for an evening traversing the diverse landscape of the feminine.

Through the body and voice, you will witness song, sound, ancient language, movement, storyweaving and expression, as we venture through the feminine village together hand in hand, walking ourselves and each other home.

PS: it’s a show, you are the audience, we do stuff, you watch….

Includes nudity and strong language.
---------------------------------------------------------

About Jennifer: Jennifer is a musician, photographer, and soulful guide who celebrates the beauty of the human journey. Through music, images, and deep presence, she helps women embrace aging, honor their uniqueness, and discover joy in every season of life.

At the heart of her work is a devotion to joy, authenticity, and connection.

She's busting with excitement to be bringing this delicious offering to the stage with gorgeous Marigold.
------------------------------------------------------------

About Marigold: Marigold is a weaver of the Feminine, Temple Keeper, and Priestess.

She holds many years experience working with the mysteries of the Feminine - she is a Yoni Massage Practitioner, Mother, Midwife, and Witch, working with energies of the unseen and the human form.

Her mission is to raise the Feminine in all beings. The Feminine being the key holder to our innate body wisdom, medicine and healing.

She is honoured to work with and bring this Feminine offering to the stage with Jennifer!

description:
From Source 2025, From Source 2025
From Source
A space to activate and remember your innate, divine connection to Source. This is an invitation to access your unique blueprint and align with what is required for your evolution. Through alchemical technology, sound vibrations, and breathwork, we inspire a divine collaboration within the cells of your mind, body, and soul.

Our last event was an incredible success, and due to the deep transformations that unfolded, we are bringing it back in October 2025 for another powerful gathering.

We are honored to have an incredible lineup of contributors, each weaving their threads of wisdom and magic to co-create a weekend of deep activation and restorative integration. The modalities and offerings will include:

✨ Triple Cone Orgonite Technology, Merkabar Activation & Sound Healing – Jason Hotton

✨ Voice Activation & Live Medicine Music – Joydah Mae

✨ Breathwork & Meditation – OM Shanti Shanti

✨ Crystal Bowls – Lucine Sounds

✨ Cacao – Awa Aroha

✨ Nourishing Food – Anthea Carr

✨ Space Holder – Leah Pomeroy

Together, we will journey through these realms of wisdom—let’s see what Source has in store for us this weekend.

Event Details
📅 Two-Day Immersion – Your ticket includes both days
🕚 Saturday, Oct 11 | 11:00 AM - 8:00 PM
🕙 Sunday, Oct 12 | 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM

Ticket Tiers
🎟 First Round – $222 (15 passes only) - SECURE ASAP

description:
Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio, Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio
We invite you to a special evening of Sacred Harmonic Sound with multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia. This immersive sound journey offers a deeply restorative experience that invites you to settle into stillness, reconnect with the heart, and explore a sense of inner spaciousness through vibration and tone.
Claudio skilfully layers the sounds of gongs, crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other traditional instruments, enhanced through high-quality audio equipment so the sound can be both heard and felt throughout your body.
Harmonic sound and vibration offer the nervous system a chance to truly rest. In this state of relaxation, the thinking mind softens, and we find connection to citta — the heart-mind. From this place, silence arises naturally through the vehicle of sound.
This experience is open to everyone. No previous yoga or meditation practice is needed.

What to bring:
You are welcome to bring your own yoga mat, though studio mats are also available. We will provide bolsters, blankets, and eye pillows for your comfort.

Booking is essential — spaces are limited and this event often fills quickly.

About Claudio
Claudio is a multi-instrumentalist musician originally from Mexico City and now based in Wellington. Born into a family of musicians, he began playing music at a young age and later studied classical guitar. His journey led him to Montreal, where he explored jazz, world music, and spiritual sound traditions.

Extensive travels in Asia and Europe deepened his connection with Indian music and yogic philosophy. He studied Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu and Varanasi, and has since worked with a wide range of instruments including the sitar, esraj, bansuri, harmonium, flutes, gongs, and voice.

Claudio’s work blends technical skill, deep presence, and a profound respect for the healing power of sound.

Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:
SoundCloud https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds
Instagram https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing
Facebook https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio

description:
Schubert Octet with Aroha String Quartet and Friends, For this programme we are joined by four wonderful guest artists - Nick Walshe (clarinet), Justin Sun (bassoon), Alexander Hambleton (horn) and Oleksandr Gunchenko (double bass) - to present a programme enlivened by the varied timbres of wind instruments.

Beginning with the Mozart String Quartet in B-flat K589 we move on to 'Serenata in vano' for Clarinet, Bassoon, Horn, Cello & Double Bass by Danish composer Carl Nielsen. This characterful work depicts a short and unsuccessful attempt at seduction. We finish with Schubert's mighty and virtuosic Octet, a work filled with jaunty dances, singable melodies and heart-rending moments.

Aroha String Quartet:
Haihong Liu & Konstanze Artmann - violins
Zhongxian Jin - viola
Robert Ibell - cello
Acclaimed as demonstrating "accomplished brilliance, soulfulness and sublime intensity in perfect balance and tonal unity" (The Dominion Post), the Aroha String Quartet is firmly established as one of New Zealand's finest chamber music ensembles. Founded in 2004, this versatile Wellington-based quartet is known for its passionate musicality, impressive technique, and multicultural innovation.

Nick Walshe - clarinet
Nick Walshe is a clarinettist, music teacher and arts administrator based in Te Whanganui a Tara/Wellington. He is currently section principal clarinet with Orchestra Wellington, and co-principal clarinet with the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band and also maintains a busy studio of clarinet and saxophone students, privately and in high schools.Nick works as a freelance musician for organisations such as the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Stroma New Music Ensemble, and the Capital Theatre Trust.

Justin Sun - bassoon
Justin was born and raised in Canberra, Australia, and began playing the bassoon at age 12. After completing his studies in 2018, he was appointed Principal Bassoon of the Aarhus Symphony Orchestra in Denmark, where he worked for 3 years before being appointed Associate Principal Bassoon of the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra in 2021. He has performed as guest principal with many orchestras worldwide, including Sydney Symphony, Australian Opera and Ballet, Scottish Chamber, Royal Philharmonic and BBC Symphony.

Alexander Hambleton - horn
Before joining the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Alex studied and worked in the UK and Sweden.
Alex spent eight years as a member of the Gothenburg Opera Orchestra, in addition to touring and recording with the Swedish Chamber Orchestra.

Oleksandr Gunchenko - double bass
Oleksandr was born in Kiev, Ukraine, where he studied at Lysenko School of Music and Tchaikovsky Conservatory. He became a member of the National Philharmonic Symphony Orchestra at the age of 19 and at the age of 20 gained a position with the National Chamber Orchestra of Ukraine. Oleksandr joined the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra in 2007. He is a member of the contemporary ensemble Stroma, and also regularly performs solo recitals.

description:
Kāpiti Food Fair 2025, All FOODIES and your tribe are invited to an exciting and indulgent day out that leaves a lasting impression on food lovers that will have you returning year after year. We take pride in our offering of GOOD food, GOOD music, and GREAT company for food enthusiasts – the ultimate Food Festival with something for everyone backed with a great vibe and professional entertainment to enjoy all day long!
On the menu for 2025 ……. up to 250 vendor sites including an off licence Liquor Zone, a licenced Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage, ANZ Kāpiti Kitchen Demo Stage, Kāpiti Ice Cream Dining Room, FREE Kid’s Zone, ZEAL Zone buskers, roving street performers and much more!
GETTING THERE: Walk | Bike | Drive | FREE bus from Paraparaumu Railway Station
ALL WELCOME + crowd friendly dogs on lead
LOOK out for the NEW shady picnic zone!
THAMES PACIFIC MAIN STAGE
9:45 AM – 9:50 AM | Official Mayoral Opening
10:00 AM – 10:30 AM | Devon Welch Music
10:45 AM – 11:15 AM | Intercite
11:45 AM – 12:45 PM | Jody & the Stowaways
1:15 PM – 2:15 PM | The Beat Girls
2:45 PM – 3:45 PM | The Relatives
4:15 PM – 5:15 PM | Love Shack
MERCHANDISE: $3 Bags, $5 T-towels, $10 Aprons (not sold online)
NOTE: Humanitix booking fees will be added to the cost of your ticket and paid at check-out.  Booking fees cover Humanitix costs, and everything else goes to their education projects that help to change lives.  Kāpiti Food Fair supports Manaiakalani Education Trust for Māori, Pasifika, and disadvantaged learners in Aotearoa to increase student outcomes and get equal access to digital education.
TOP TIPS for a FANTASTIC DAY at the Kāpiti Food Fair
Bring a gold coin for parking donations.
Pack a hat and sunscreen – complimentary SPF is available if you need it.
Bring a picnic blanket to relax, enjoy the ambiance, and savor your treats with plenty of seating and a NEW shaded picnic spot under the trees.
BYO your own chair if you wish and a chilly bin for purchases!
Plan your foodie route with the Site Map >>
Visit the Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage and relax over a craft brew, wine, local cocktails and delicious cider while enjoying the vibe of the 80's to 90's revival party all day long!  Children are welcome with their parent or guardian.  CHEERS to that!
MOST vendors accept EFTPOS or bank transfer.  BYO cash as there is no ATM available.
THANK YOU SPONSORS
Kāpiti Food Fair is a recipient of the Kāpiti Major Events Fund and is supported by numerous local businesses in-kind and reduced cost of services.  The Fair is a commercial event however we have a social agenda too.  We choose to support Kāpiti Community Patrol, Kāpiti Rotary Charitable Trust, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets, Paekākāriki Surf Lifesavers, Paraparaumu College, and Work Ready Kāpiti to help run key logistics on the day. 
Kāpiti Food Fair Ltd is privately owned and operated by Helene Judge and Jeanine van Kradenburg.  The Fair reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.
#KFF2025 #FoodFestival #KāpitiFoodFair #SomethingForEveryone #VisitKāpiti

description:
Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu, Come and be held in a ceremony of sound.
Sunday 14th, from 2:22 PM to 4:04 PM at Lotus Yoga, Papamaru, an immersive Sound Journey awaits you.
This is a time and space to breathe, release, and be nurtured by the deep vibrations of medicinal instruments including Didgeridoo, HandPan, Jaw Harps, Shamanic Drone Flute, Shamanic Drum, Mongolian Throat Singing (Sygyt and Khoomei), and more — all amplified and layered through a loop station.
Comfortably lying down, you’ll be guided on a relaxing, clearing, and rejuvenating inner journey. This transformative experience supports your nervous system, helping to release tension and restore calm and presence.
Benefits of Sound Healing
Mental clarity and emotional balance
Deep relaxation and revitalization
Enhanced focus and memory
Better sleep quality
Strengthened immune response
Boosted creativity
Heightened self-awareness and environmental sensitivity
What to Bring
Comfortable clothing
A mattress, pillow, blanket, eye mask — anything to support your full comfort
Water bottle
An open heart
Event Guidelines
To create a held and focused space:
Please silence your phone before entering
Arrive on time — we recommend 2:12 for a smooth, grounded start. Doors close at 2:22 PM sharp.
This offering is part of the Kohael Project, where I (Justin) and fellow co-creators offer well-being practices in exchange for koha or donation — supporting personal transformation and collective healing.
More info : https://kohael.com/
Live music and more : https://www.youtube.com/@kohaelproject/playlists
https://www.instagram.com/kohaelproject/
Support the project and the Kohael Truck : https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/kohaelprojectonwheels
Thank you for reading, and see you soon.
With gratitude and love,
Justin

description:
Letting Go: A ritual for fresh starts, Letting Go: A ritual for fresh starts
If you’ve been through a redundancy, restructure, or a big shift in your working life - or if you’ve been out of work for a while and are looking ahead to something new - this gathering is for you.
We’ll spend an hour outdoors (weather permitting) in a gentle, guided ritual to help you release some of the heaviness that comes with change and open up to what’s next. You can expect moments of quiet reflection, light movement, and simple nature-based activities designed to connect you with yourself, the land, and a sense of possibility. There’s no chanting, costumes, or anything too out-there - just a safe, thoughtful space to mark what you’ve been through and welcome in the next chapter.
The ritual will be hosted by Tamara Buckland - Leadership Strategist, Chief People Officer, and Druid - who blends leadership wisdom with nature-based practices to create meaningful, accessible experiences for people in transition.
After the ritual, we’ll wander to Picnic Café for coffee or tea (you’ll just need to cover your own drink) for those who’d like to keep connecting.
Details
📅 Friday 29 August (rain date: Friday 5 September)
🕛 12:00–1:00pm ritual
☕ 1:00pm coffee/tea at Picnic Café

description:
Light Language Healing Transmission, Light Language Healing Transmission
Susan Crystal Diamond is inviting you to join her circle for a sound and light language multidimensional transmission that will guide you to a deeper inner alignment through channeled light codes and wisdom to receive more peace and love.

In this sacred seated space you will be guided through gentle breath opening you to receive source energy, practice a fun intuitive exercise, choose an oracle card, receive a channeled light language activation to either release, activate, expand or heal for your highest good.

Experience this journey with Susan, which will support your inner strength and invite you into a state of divine neutrality. This relaxing, uplifting experience is designed to help you navigate the changes we are all facing offering a new template for peace and balance and return to your true nature.

Please note this is a seated event however you are welcome to bring a mat and blanket to lay down for the transmission, wear layered clothing for comfort and bring a water bottle.

Energy exchange $30 021 608913 To book
Transfer payment to 06-0773-0271726-00

Susan is a seasoned practitioner and channel of light with decades of experience in the healing arts bringing experience, wisdom and compassion to her work. Over the last 10 years Susan has refined her unique gifts of light language which she brings through for private clients and in group sessions. Her light language is a powerful tool working on subtle energetic levels to assist individuals in transforming on a cellular level and connecting to their higher selves. Paired with sound instruments Susans sessions are always unique and intuitively guided.

Susans’ commitment to guiding souls with humility and compassion has made her a trusted source of support and wisdom in the healing community. Allow her to help you navigate your own journey with grace and light.

In the circle we will weave our unique soul essence together to experience the oneness of our new earth frequency.

description:
Mexican Prehispanic Experience at AWHI, Join Claudio in his Mexican project called Xochipilli´s Eye. Xochipilli (Pronounce: Zo-chee-pee-lee) is the Mexica god of music, flowers, arts, and sacred plants.
Claudio´s last trip home to Mexico was full of inspiration, reconnecting him to his ancestral roots in Mexico City. He was fortunate to meet a prehispanic musician and instrument maker who plays and crafts beautiful traditional instruments. Claudio returned to NZ with many special new instruments; and continues to be inspired and guided by the cultural wealth, wisdom, and knowledge of the ancient cultures of the Americas.
This event will be extraordinary and unique. You will learn about Mexican prehispanic cosmology and spirituality. Experience simple and powerful rituals together with unique musical instruments used by Olmecs, Toltecs, Aztecs, and Mayans. The instruments include clay flutes, clay drums, medicine drums, ocarinas, wooden flutes, shells, and shakers skilfully arranged to create magical shamanic atmospheres.
We will be sharing Cacao which is an energetic traditional Mexican prehispanic drinks that help open the heart, reconnect with the earth element, ignite your fire, and get you up and moving.
What to expect:
Cleansing copal and herbal welcoming.
Talk about the use of music in the ancient times.
An opening ceremony to acknowledge the Tlalmanalli (offering and altar) with the deep sound of the conch shell in the four directions.
Cacao ceremony: Claudio will offer the cacao drink as a connection with the earth, to yourself, and the moment.
Live music that invokes many emotions and imagery, from contemplative natural and mystical environments to uplifting and empowering rhythms. You are free to project and explore within and/ or express and liberate projecting outwards.
We will finish with a shamanic atmosphere relaxation and close the event with a traditional chant.
No previous experience is required.
What to bring:
Wear comfortable clothing! Bring an open heart and a mind ready to learn and receive. You are also welcome to bring a fruit and or a flower to contribute to the altar.
Date & Time: Saturday, April 13th, 6-7:30pm
Location: AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing, Level 2, 15 Johnston Street, Wellington Central
Investment: $55

description:
Monk and munchies, Monk & Munchies is where plant-based eats meet meaningful conversation.
‌
We’ve got mantra music to set the vibe, a live Q&A with Chaitanya Charan on Living Spirituality, and a plant-based dinner. Think stuffed-crust pizza, wedges, Hawaiian skewers, fresh salad, topped off with chocolate mudcake with ice cream and mocktails!


We’re super stoked to host Chaitanya Charan in Wellington! He’s a monk, global speaker, and author of over 25 books, and has shared his insights at top universities like Yale and Princeton, as well as companies including Microsoft and Intel. What really sets him apart is how practical and relatable his wisdom is—making timeless teachings easy to apply to everyday life. Take this chance to meet a monk in person and hear his insights firsthand!
Good food, live beats, and insights that will leave you with something to think about.

description:
Tea Time Travellers | Marie Antoinette, Step back in time with Tea Time Travellers - A blast from the past series, celebrating cinema classics and new releases with a Roxy twist.
This month, we go back to France in the 1770’s. Marie Antoinette follows the life of the young archduchess, from her wedding in the Palace of Versailles to her demise in the French Revolution.
Enjoy a tea-infused mocktail, served alongside a mini flight sweet and savoury treats. Perfect for an afternoon treat.
The ticket price of $45 includes the film admission, sweet and savoury mini treats*, and cocktail or mocktail. Standard ticketing also available at this screening which does not include the food and drink.
*No dietaries catered for.
An Austrian teenager (Kirsten Dunst) marries the Dauphin (Jason Schwartzman) of France and becomes that country's queen following the death of King Louis XV (Judy Davis) in 1774. Years later, after a life of luxury and privilege, Marie Antoinette loses her head during the French Revolution.
Presented in 4K

Monthly Astro Meetup, Wellington's Monthly Astrology Meetup
A Monthly gathering for all Astrologers, enthusiasts, and the astro curious - All Welcome!
Featuring a new speaker/topic each month.
This month: Jayn Verkerk - Finding our Locations
We all have places that we vibe with, and those we don't. Which places in the world do you align with – for work, holiday or relocation?
For this session I will share techniques(using astro.com) that I've learnt in readings. Bring along your chart and we can map it onto the earth to locate your best places for travel or relocation, and generally share experiences of location and astrology.
Jayn Verkerk is a mostly modern astrologer. Self-taught, along with courses with Graham Ibell, she was active at the Wellington Astrology Centre. Jayn is a researcher with a PhD in critical digital humanities and creative practice.    
$10 entry fee, includes tea, snacks and presentation.
For more info, contact Erika at erikaegrant@gmail.com

In this workshop, we’ll explore how the mounts of your hand reveal the influence of different planetary energies, such as Jupiter’s connection to ambition and Saturn’s role in discipline. Each mount reflects unique qualities and patterns of behaviour, offering insight into your personal traits and how you navigate challenges.
By the end of the session, you’ll have a good understanding of how these planetary energies can be identified and interpreted in your own hands. You’ll leave with practical tools to start reading these energies, providing a deeper appreciation for how planetary forces shape different aspects of your life
Whether you're new to palmistry or looking to broaden your knowledge, this workshop will offer valuable insights into the planetary dimension of palm reading.

description:
River City Express, Travel to the beautiful river side town of Whanganui, hauled by both steam locomotive Ja 1271 and heritage diesel electric locomotive, Da 1410. Choose between doing your own thing, or jumping on a serene cruise of the Whanganui River onboard the coal fired paddle steamer "PS Waimarie".

Leaving Kapiti as most others are still sound asleep, we quickly escape the coast and delve into the rurality of the Horowhenua. After a stop in Palmerston North we head up the trunk through the townships of Feilding and Marton before turning onto the Marton - New Plymouth railway line for the last stretch into Whanganui. After crossing the 290km long Whanganui River, we proceed slowly down the short 5km branch line taking us to Taupo Quay.

From here - it's up to you what you wish to do!

- Sail On The Queen Of The River - Waimarie
This option includes a river cruise aboard the coal-fired paddle steamer Waimarie, restored after 50 years submerged. The cruise features commentary on Whanganui’s river history, and you can view the boiler and possibly send a message via homing pigeon. The fare covers return train travel, bus transfers, and the cruise.

From Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin: Adult $199 / Child $179.
From Palmerston North/Fielding: Adult $179 / Child $159.
You can also add a picnic-style artisan lunch for two for $40.

OR

- Do Your Own Thing & Explore Whanganui
You’ll be transferred by bus to the Riverboat Centre and can explore Whanganui on foot or by hiring a vintage cruiser bike. Attractions include the Durie Hill Elevator, Riverboat Museum, NZ Glassworks, Motua Gardens, and local shops and eateries. A tram ride is also available for a small fee. This option includes train fare and bus transfers.

From Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin: Adult $149 / Child $129
From Palmerston North/Fielding: Adult $129 / Child $109

On the return journey, you can pre-order a meal served at your seat: chicken salad, mini baguette, and chocolate brownie. Cost is $30 per person, with vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free, and allergy-friendly options available.

description:
Pleiadian Encoded Attunement Circle | Wellington, Pleiadian Encoded Attunement Circle | Wellington
A Boutique Galactic Group Experience to Uplift, Activate & Attune Your Energy

Are you ready to connect with loving cosmic support, raise your vibration, and anchor powerful light codes that you can access again and again in your daily life?

Join me for a deeply transformative and high-frequency group healing and attunement experience — the Pleiadian Encoded Attunement Circle.
This sacred circle is designed to open your energy field to the uplifting and joyous frequency of the Pleiadians, guiding you into deeper alignment, soul activation, and vibrational expansion. Because I work and hold space within a high vibrational field, everyone present is able to access, attune to, and receive these elevated frequencies too - opening a gateway to higher states of awareness and multidimensional reconnection.
This is a multi-layered energetic journey that will support your soul’s evolution and empower you with tools to continue accessing these frequencies whenever you need them.

In Ancient Atlantean Times...
Healing was simple.
People would sit before sacred, light-infused paintings, allowing frequency, sound, and intention to restore balance and harmony.
I’m bringing this ancient practice back.

Join me for a group Healing Session in Wellington • a beautiful multidimensional experience for deep new-code absorption, renewal, and alignment. You’ll sit in sacred space before my Pleiadian Portal Painting, surrounded by gentle frequency music, sipping ceremonial Kakao, and immersed in high-vibrational energy.
Each person will receive a clearing and then be guided through a powerful meditation and activation, with time to journal and share afterwards.

• What’s Included in This Sacred Attunement Journey
• Individual Galactic Clearing
We begin by preparing your field for higher frequencies. Each participant will receive a personal energy clearing to release stagnant or lower vibrations, supported by channeled light language to open you to deeper transformation.

• Heart-Opening Kacao Ceremony
Once the clearing is complete, we’ll share a gentle ceremonial Kacao experience to expand the heart, deepen receptivity, and create a sacred container for Pleiadian frequencies to flow through.

“Raise Your Vibration” Pleiadian Wisdom Talk
I’ll share insights into who the Pleiadians are, their role in humanity’s awakening, and how their joyous, supportive energy can help you in everyday life. You’ll also receive simple, powerful tools to help you reconnect with this frequency long after our circle.

• Guided Meditation & Activation
We journey through a deeply guided meditation supported by my Pleiadian Encoded Artwork and light language transmissions. This works on a soul level to activate deeper layers of your light body, anchor wisdom, and align you with higher frequencies. The energetic transmission continues to integrate long after the session.

• Personal Angelic Attunement & Integration
To complete our journey, each participant will receive a personal ANGELIC attunement to anchor the frequencies received and integrate them into their unique energetic system, supporting lasting transformation and soul alignment.

• Why This Circle is Unique
This is an intimate, boutique-style event limited to just 10 participants to ensure a deeply personal and supportive experience for everyone. Smaller groups allow me to focus the energy on each individual, maximising the depth and potency of the transformation you’ll receive.
You will leave feeling uplifted, attuned, and supported — and with the ability to reconnect with these higher frequencies whenever you need.
To help extend and nurture the energy beyond the circle, supportive tools will be available and to order - including aura sprays, light-encoded scarves, and art prints, so you can continue to connect with and access the Pleiadian frequencies in your own space.

Event Details
Date: Sunday, 7 December 2025
Location: Whitby, Wellington (address supplied upon booking)
Time: 4:00 PM – 6:00 PM
Exchange: NZ$65
Maximum Group: 10 participants only — early booking is recommended.
label: Religion & Spirituality

You’re not learning steps or performing—you’re being invited into presence, curiosity, and feeling. With a focus on nervous system regulation, personal expression, and inner listening, somatic dance creates a nurturing space to come home to yourself.
