Jenna Joan is a somatic family constellation therapist, yoga teacher, and group facilitator who has been leading movement spaces for over 15 years. With a background in yoga, somatic dance, and therapeutic embodiment, her work blends play, authenticity, ancestral healing, and deep nervous system awareness. Jenna is also a cacao alchemist and ceremonial facilitator, known for creating safe, soulful spaces that invite freedom, connection, and inner exploration. She has been hosting workshops, retreats, and community events for nearly a decade, and also works 1:1 in more therapeutic settings.

𝐒𝐨𝐧𝐢𝐜 𝐒𝐮𝐭𝐫𝐚 | 𝐒𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜 𝐃𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐃𝐉
Sonic Sutra is a sound artist and somatic dance DJ who creates immersive musical journeys designed to support authentic movement, emotional release, and deep embodiment. With a focus on somatic dance and therapeutic soundscapes, their sets are intentionally curated to guide movers through an inner experience—honouring the body’s natural rhythms and the intelligence within. Their offerings create safe, accessible spaces for people of all bodies, backgrounds, and experience levels to explore movement, presence, and connection. Rooted in play, precision, and deep listening, Sonic Sutra brings music that moves beyond entertainment—into healing and transformation.

description:
Rangatiratanga for Life - Becoming the CEO of Yourself, The day is designed to stretch and grow you! In the whakatauākī of Tā Apirana Ngata (Ngāti Porou), E tipu, e rea, he exhorts us to 'grow and flourish'. Grow and flourish! More than survive, get by, do ok. Flourish! This day will explore ways to fully engage with the beautiful moemoeā this whakatauākī speaks to.
E Tipu, E Rea
E tipu e rea mō ngā rā o tō ao
Ko tō ringa ki ngā rākau a te Pākehā
Hei ora mō te tinana
Ko tō ngākau ki ngā taonga a ō tīpuna Māori
Hei tikitiki mō tō māhunga
Ko tō wairua ki tō atua, nāna nei ngā mea katoa
Grow and branch forth for the days destined to you
Your hands to the tools of the Pākehā for the welfare of your body
Your heart to the treasures of your ancestors as adornments for your brow
Your spirit to God, who made all things
— Sir Apirana Ngata

You may like to think about how the day can help you align your professional work-based objectives (often expressed as KPI’s) with your personal vision, mission and goals.
The aims of the Course are to:
1. To host a mana ake wānanga exploring your unique future;
2. To bring together a group of people interested in creating rangatiratanga in their lives;
3. To draw from mātauranga Māori to support participants to create a 12-month personal strategic plan (drawing on moemoeā, pūrakau and pūtake);
4. To facilitate learning using Māori learning and teaching styles;
5. To connect people to the power of lifelong learning; and,
6. To add to the network of dedicated, Treaty based nation builders who have the goal of 'Becoming a CEO' on their radar for themselves or someone they know, whether that be at the personal, whānau, hapῡ, iwi or organisational level.
Our programme is interactive and delivered through a range of teaching / learning techniques which also include: facilitation; small group discussion; critical analysis; reflection; and, reporting back.

description:
Real Power - Buddha Vajrapani empowerment and teachings, Real Power - Buddha Vajrapani empowerment and teachings
Buddha Vajrapani empowerment and teachings
with Kadam Birgit

Buddha Vajrapani is the Buddha of spiritual power, sometimes referred to as the Buddha of skillful means.
With the development of spiritual power, we possess the confidence, inner strength and skill not only to take on and defeat our own delusions, but to be of great benefit in helping free others from their delusions as well.
Nothing could be more meaningful.

The empowerment is a beautiful and inspiring guided meditation and ritual in which we are introduced to Buddha Vajrapani from whom we then receive many blessings, adding great power to our own practice as well as sowing seeds for our future attainment of enlightenment.

In the afternoon Kadam Birgit will give a commentary on the beautiful Tantric practice and sadhana of Buddha Vajrapani.

description:
Reiki Infused Sound Healing, Reiki Infused Sound Healing
Sink into a meditative sanctuary of stillness with Nizaad — a healing energy practitioner and space holder rooted in ancestral wisdom, sound, and ceremony.
Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert after the event - all included in your ticket!
This deeply calming experience weaves Reiki energy with the vibrational medicine of chakra-attuned crystal singing bowls, offering a journey inward through sound and sensation.
Held in a Reiki-activated field, it invites you to rest the body, quiet the mind, and shift brainwaves into a deeply relaxed state, supporting nervous system regulation and emotional balance.
Come as you are. Let the sound carry you into stillness, and the energy bring gentle release.
Mats, eye masks and pillows are provided but you are invited to bring anything extra to add comfort!
Meet Nizaad, your host
Nizaad holding a Reiki-infused Sound Journey designed to support deep rest and realignment. Blending the healing frequencies of crystal singing bowls alongside other sacred instruments, her sessions are rooted in the belief that sound and energy are medicine. Coming from a lineage of energy healers, she weaves gentle Reiki throughout the session to support subtle energetic balance and emotional release. Participants simply need to lie down and allow the sound and energy to wash over them, inviting a calm, restorative space to reconnect with the body and return to balance.

description:
SLOW REVOLUTION II w/ Casual Healing x Simloco x Hanwho LIVE at MOON, SLOW REVOLUTION II w/ Casual Healing x Simloco x Hanwho LIVE at MOON
we are here for you, for ourselves and for it all. Come all Jah one - individual in our togetherness, together in our uniqueness. Our personal messages and mauri and our collective vibrations and spontaneous moments of authentic expression. From vulnerability to mana, from stillness to ecstasy, the troughs and the crests, the eggs and the fluids. the dub and the deep, the groove pocket and the light tasty treats. well prepped to be enjoyed by all but also unprepped to be raw and pure. digested in reciprocity, fed by those sentients present souls, a gift. Its a Sunday funday, a gathering to reset the weekly cycle, go for a run, a swim, a sleep, take a breathe and connect with te taiao - do some mahi, something good.... for you or someone else and then you have the option of enriching this collective experience by gracing us with your essence, as we sink into the hum of the universe together within the stories of MOON 1. every day is but a little life. See you there, here and now. Hanno, Simon and Nikau x

description:
SOLSTICE FULL MOON SONG AND SOUND CEREMONY, SOLSTICE FULL MOON SONG AND SOUND CEREMONY
Come and Sing, Sound and Meditate!

Want to mark the important time of the Solstice full moon?

Come and join with us on Sunday the 7th December for a group ceremonial gathering in Paraparaumu.

We will explore sacred conscious sounding practices to balance and align the energy system, sing healing chants and songs from different traditions, and explore guided vocal improvisation for freedom, upliftment and joy!

Ceremonial cacao will be served with focus and healing inTention.

There will be guided journal prompts around the energy of the Solstice and the whole session will finish with a full sound healing.

Everyone is welcome and there is no need for any particular preparation or pre existing skill.

Please get in touch with any questions or to book. Come and enjoy Song, Chant, Sound and Healing!!

So looking forward to gathering for the Solstice Full Moon on December 7th. Come and join with us to invoke and celebrate the energies of balance and creation at this profound time of year.

This session will explore singing, chanting, sounding and conscious voice empowerment practices. We will also explore energy practices like Qigong and meditation. All within a ceremonial framework.

Everyone is welcome. Limited spaces. Get in touch soon

You are warmly invited to book to join this powerful sound and voice ceremony which will work with Spirit, the forces of Nature and Bryony's skill and expertise in creating sound for growth and transformation.

This is a special opportunity to tune into the sacred energies and potentialities of this time of the Solstice: opening us to balance, healing, nourishment, new growth and positive change.

Bryony will invoke and work with the healing power of the supportive energies of Spirit, ancestors and our highest Selves. Bryony's has an extensive background experience with Spirit, the Earth forces and sacred lands; these forces are central to her practice and Self.

She will lead you firstly in a process of meditation, conscious sounding, toning and singing healing chants.

This use of our voices to co-create a sacred group sound is uplifting and transformative and will support you in your process of healing, releasing and visioning.

There will be time for guided journaling and intention setting.

The second section of the workshop will be a focused and dedicated sound bath which will bring balance and deep relaxation, into a sense of stillness and peace. There can be a sense of gratitude and appreciation.

Both the conscious use of the voice and the sound healing have many benefits, which are verified by science and which can effect us positively on the physical, mental, emotional, energetic and spiritual levels. A document which has more information about these benefits can be provided on request.

All are welcome:
I look forward to sharing with you and supporting you in this ceremony.

Investment for full 2.5 hours

$77 - full price - https://buy.stripe.com/bIY9Ep67A00xdwYcND

$59 - concession - https://buy.stripe.com/8wMaItcvY6oV0Kc7ti

Please contact me if finances are a challenge for you and we can make it work for you to join.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Our Beloved Indigenous Vegetation - Guided Walk, In this approximately one-hour downhill walk we will obtain a perspective on several native plants from the ubiquitous, such as our well-known cabbage tree, kōwhai and podocarps, to lesser-knowns such as shrubby toroaro/mingimingi, Bartlett's rātā, Three Kings kaikōmako and Three Kings vine/akapukaea. We will also discuss the phenomenon of species radiation exemplified by Hebe and Kauri.

Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn.
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.

Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Simple Gifts - spirituals, folk songs and other delights, Simple Gifts - spirituals, folk songs and other delights
As winter comes to a close and the days get longer Hutt City Chorale is pleased to present our second concert for 2025. A concert for all the family. Conducted by our Music Director Jonathan Berkahn and accompanied by Phillip O'Malley on piano this concert has a wonderful selection of spirituals folk songs and a few special delights. Come and join us at St James Anglican Church in Central Lower Hutt for an afternoon of song followed by afternoon tea and a chance to mix and mingle with the choir and other members of the audience. Doors open at 1.30pm. Concert starts at 2.00pm. Tickets $15.00. Under 12 free. Tickets from choir members door sales or by emailing .
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Sika Sound Journey, This powerful experience is like a soundtrack that is crafted to go with your life.

Something between an ancient ceremony and a movie soundtrack.

Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket. Be prepared to drop into a deep space.

Door sales will be available if there is space. Advanced booking is recommended.

Sika's Sound Journeys are truly unique. They are sonic explorations that feature didgeridoos, drums, flutes, voice and orchestral elements. A collection of foraged sounds from objects he has recorded in nature, add even more textures. Many of his sounds are completely unrecognisable and abstract. Immersed in this cocoon of abstract sound, we can find ourselves in the most surprising places in our mind. In this timeless realm, beyond the normal limitations of rational reality, anything is possible.

An epic adventure deep inside yourself.

Journey to worlds within worlds on incredible sound waves.

Sika creates a safe space to relax deeply and connect with our inner guidance. This Sound Journey begins and ends with a short guided visualisation.

There will be two journeys with an interval. Most people choose to lie down, so once again, please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket to get really comfortable.

A journal is also recommended.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Singing Circle, Join the circle for gentle singing and connection. We will sing and chant to wrap ourselves and the world with songs of peace and compassion.
The songs are easy to pick up with very few words. You will be invited to sing some harmonies as you feel able and have the choice to pick the voice part that works best for you.
Enjoy vocal freedom in a relaxed and supportive environment. Sing for well-being and connection with the world. This session is FREE. KOHA welcome and optional to cover costs.
The Garden Room is situated at the back of St Peter's church. Please bring some flameless candles, a cushion or a blanket if you want to sit on the floor, and bottled water.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Astronomy on Tap, Astronomy on Tap
Experience the wonders of the Universe as you embark on an extraordinary journey into the vast depths of space and beyond.

This September at Astronomy on Tap, we’re diving into one of the biggest questions in science: Are we alone? Our theme is The Search for Life and Water. Wherever we find water on Earth, we find life. Could the same be true beyond our planet?

From icy moons in our Solar System to distant exoplanets, scientists are searching for the conditions that could support life. Join us as we explore the potential for discovering life in the universe and the technology helping us get closer to the answer.
Upon arrival, receive a drink and your first-class inflight snacks. Then sit back and relax in our digital full-dome planetarium as we explore the night sky. Complete your trip through the galaxy with the cash bar and a look through interactive exhibitions.

Whether you’re accompanied by a special someone, a friend, or embarking on a solo adventure, raise your glass to the stars and enjoy the stellar ride.

$45pp | 8PM – 10PM | R18 | Space Place

description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia
Immerse Yourself in a Journey of Sound & Stillness

Join us for a special evening of harmonizing pure sounds, inspiring music, and deep relaxation at our beautiful space. Let the transformative power of sound guide you into a state of peaceful awareness and inner connection.

- 5:00 PM – 7:00 PM, Saturday, 4th of October
- Investment: $49
- Book here: https://www.wellnessliving.com/rs/event/wild_wellbeing?k_class=100000004277

What to Expect
Give yourself the gift of stillness as you surrender to the healing vibrations of:
- Gongs • Tibetan & Crystal Singing Bowls
- Native American Flutes • Harmonium • Sitar & Esraj
- Bells • Mantra chanting • Sacred Silence

Claudio’s high-quality amplification ensures you *feel* the sound as much as you hear it, creating a fully immersive experience. Allow the waves of resonance to:
- Release physical, mental & emotional tension
- Guide you into deep meditation & heart-centered awareness
- Restore balance & invite inner peace

How to Prepare
- Bring a pillow, blanket, or anything to ensure comfort
- Come with an open heart and an intention (optional)
- Wear loose, cozy clothing

About Claudio Escutia
A 3rd-generation multinstrumentalist from Mexico City, Claudio’s journey spans classical guitar, jazz, and global spiritual traditions. Trained in Indian classical music and Tibetan sound healing (studied in Nepal and India), he brings over a decade of expertise as a Sound Healing practitioner. His music is a bridge between ancient wisdom and modern therapeutic soundscapes.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 6th of December, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 6th of December
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness. Discover the power of your own voice, mantra and silence working to find inner peace and contentment. Bring an intention, get comfortable and let the sound waves take over. Invite the sound to take you into a journey within, into your heart, to rest, to release physical, mental and emotional tension.

Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc..Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.

Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.


About Claudio: Claudio is a 3rd generation Multinstrumentalist Musician from Mexico City now based in Wellington. Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years. When he finished music school as a classical guitarist he moved to Montreal, Canada and explored new genres such a Jazz, World Music, and Spiritual Music. Traveling he discovered Indian Music and the Yoga Tradition and they became a very important influence on his career and lifestyle, and allowed him to study Music and Yoga with teachers in Europe and Asia. He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer. He has been playing the Tibetan bowls for more than 10 years now.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Mandala Yoga Studio, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Mandala Yoga Studio
**Experience the Magic of Sound Healing with Claudio Escutia – First Time in Mandala Yoga**

Discover the transformative power of sound at *Mandala Yoga Studio* with the multi-instrumentalist **Claudio Escutia** in his first time **Sound Healing Experience** in Paremata. This is your chance to unwind, recharge, and immerse yourself in a deeply restorative sonic journey like no other.

### **An Evening of Deep Relaxation & Inner Harmony**
Claudio masterfully blends the resonant vibrations of **Gongs, Crystal & Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other sacred instruments**, creating an immersive soundscape that soothes the nervous system, quietens the mind, and opens the heart.

- **Feel the sound** as much as you hear it—every note washes through you, releasing tension and restoring balance.
- **No experience needed**—just lie back, breathe, and let the waves of harmonic sound carry you into deep relaxation.
- **A rare opportunity** to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing vibrations—right here in Paremata!

### **What to Bring?**
Bring your own yoga or camping mat, pillow and blanket for ultimate comfort. Come in cozy clothes, ready to melt into the sound.

### **Why You’ll Love This Experience**
✨ **First time ever in Paremata!** Don’t miss this exclusive event.
✨ **Perfect for stress relief, deep relaxation, and emotional renewal.**
✨ **Limited spaces**—these sessions often sell out fast!

### **About Claudio Escutia**
A world traveler and sound alchemist, Claudio’s journey has taken him from **Mexico City to Montreal, Kathmandu to Wellington**, studying classical guitar, jazz, and ancient sound healing traditions. His music is a bridge between cultures—blending **Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs, and Voice** into a meditative, heart-opening experience.

**Curious to hear his sound?**
🎶 **Listen here:**
[SoundCloud]( https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds) | [Instagram]( https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing) | [Facebook]( https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio)

**Don’t wait—secure your spot now!** 🌿
*Spaces are limited, and this one-of-a-kind experience won’t last long.*

📍 **Mandala Yoga Studio,110 Paremata Road,Porirua**
📅 **[Saturday 13th of December 5pm - 7pm ]**
💲 **[$49 ]** Early bird price of $45 for first 10 bookings.

*Come as you are. Leave transformed.*

description:
Sound Healing Experience, Sound Healing Experience
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia

It’ll be a transcendent evening of Sacred Harmonic Sounds, where multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia will guide you through a deeply restorative sonic experience. Plus - there will be an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!

Let the vibrations of Gongs, Crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other ancient instruments wash over you—melting away tension, quieting the mind, and opening a doorway to inner stillness.

With Claudio’s masterful soundscapes, you’ll not only hear the music but feel it resonating through your body, inviting profound relaxation and a reconnection to your heart. No prior meditation or yoga experience is needed—just come as you are and let the sound carry you into a space of deep peace.

What to Bring?
Yoga mats, blankets & cushions are provided but you are also welcome to bring your own yoga mat and any extra cushions or any other comforts for the ultimate experience!

Why You Won’t Want to Miss This

A rare opportunity to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing sound

A deeply immersive, meditative experience—perfect for relaxation and renewal

Limited spaces

Meet Claudio Escutia, your host
Born into a musical family in Mexico City, Claudio’s lifelong passion for sound has taken him across the globe—from studying jazz in Montreal to mastering Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu. His music weaves together classical training, world instruments (Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, and more), and a deep reverence for sound as medicine.

Ready to unwind and recharge through the magic of vibration?

Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:

SoundCloud Claudio Escutia
Instagram Claudio Escutia Yoga and Sound Healing (@claudio_yoga_sound_healing)
Facebook Claudio Escutia Yoga - Sound Healing- Music

description:
Sound Healing Journey + Intro to Fascial Manuevers, Join me on an afternoon of Sound Healing and an introduction to Fascial Maneuvers.
We will be starting the afternoon at 5:15pm for half an hour of fascial manuevers (think stretch with gentle movement and breathing) to relax and get the body into rest mode, and at 5:45 we will start a 60-minute Sound healing Journey with crystal and Tibetan bowls, drums, voice, and more.
Seeing that the end of the year is approaching soon, I thought we could focus on letting the old (that no longer serves) out, to make space for the new in.
When? Sunday 30th November from 5:15-6:45
Where? Hataitai Centre (157 Hataitai Road, Hataitai, Wgn)
Suggested koha $20, but pay what you can.
Everybody is welcome. No previous experience in anything is required, only your presence.
Bring a mat, blanket, pillow, a friend, and/or anything you want to be comfy and warm!
Looking forward to sharing this afternoon with you!
You are welcome to RSVP via DM (Instagram or Facebook) or email me at soundhealingnz@gmail.com

description:
NZIFF: Went Up the Hill, An unsettling, sinister slow-burn thriller, Samuel Van Grinsven unites rising star Dacre Montgomery with Phantom Thread’s Vicky Krieps and New Zealand’s own Sarah Peirse for a supernatural chiller like no other.

In the icy, shadow-stricken world of Went Up the Hill’s Christchurch, it would seem that the death of Elizabeth, wife of Jill (Vicky Krieps), has taken with it warmth itself. The unexpected suicide of her partner has left her a hollowed-out shell – that is, until Jack (Dacre Montgomery), Elizabeth’s long-absent son, arrives at the funeral, apparently invited by Jill herself, though she does not remember doing so.

The circumstances of Jack’s long absence are unclear – all that is known is that Jack was given up for adoption at a very young age. Staying the night at Jill and Elizabeth’s oppressive, concrete-clad mountain abode, it quickly becomes clear that the spirit of Elizabeth has not yet departed – instead, she has gained the ability to possess both wife and son and is utilising this ability to linger and address the needs of either relationship. What initially seems to be a gift from beyond, however, begins to sour when long-hidden secrets of the past begin to emerge, and lines between the two begin to be crossed.

The sophomore feature of Samuel Van Grinsven, Went Up the Hill is a wintry, gothic affair, and a showcase for the untapped talents of Montgomery, who most will recognise as the golden-haired, ill-fated muscle mutt Billy from Stranger Things. Essentially a two-hander (with occasional, welcome interjection from Kiwi legend Sarah Peirse as Jack’s frosty, mystery-shrouded aunt), Van Grinsven tracks the trajectory of these two adrift people and the spirit between them – from unexpected refuge, to joy, to dread – with a purposeful, drip-fed escalation of tension. Questions of control, abuse and the lingering weight of past scars take hold, all while the usually pleasantly scenic Christchurch landscape is transformed into a suffocatingly claustrophobic ice prison. Van Grinsven’s muscular direction bears none of the flashy excesses of an emerging filmmaker – his vision emerges, stately, imposing and fully-formed. — Tom Augustine
label: Film & Media

description:
Real Power - Buddha Vajrapani empowerment and teachings, Real Power - Buddha Vajrapani empowerment and teachings
Buddha Vajrapani empowerment and teachings
with Kadam Birgit

Buddha Vajrapani is the Buddha of spiritual power, sometimes referred to as the Buddha of skillful means.
With the development of spiritual power, we possess the confidence, inner strength and skill not only to take on and defeat our own delusions, but to be of great benefit in helping free others from their delusions as well.
Nothing could be more meaningful.

The empowerment is a beautiful and inspiring guided meditation and ritual in which we are introduced to Buddha Vajrapani from whom we then receive many blessings, adding great power to our own practice as well as sowing seeds for our future attainment of enlightenment.

In the afternoon Kadam Birgit will give a commentary on the beautiful Tantric practice and sadhana of Buddha Vajrapani.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Summer Singing Retreat, Start the new year with intention in a fun and inclusive environment. The beginning of the year is a perfect time to get together and feel the power of community and connection through singing.
Sing for renewal and hope. Sing for harmony, joy, and inspiration. Sing for healing. Sing to regain your strength and empower others.
Spend the 2 days encircled by a community of like-minded people and focusing on your well-being through singing. Rest, connect, and restore. The weekend is carefully planned so there is plenty of time to sing and to rest in between.
We will breathe together, listen, create beautiful sounds, let go of our worries, and lift each other to a sense of fulfillment and joy. And to make the event even more special, Lala will be cooking an authentic Malagasy dinner on Saturday night (an experience not to be missed).
Jonathan Berkahn and Lala Simpson have been working together, leading workshops and performing for many years. They are both highly skilled song leaders who lead from the heart and joyfully share their gifts. You will be in safe hands. ALL SINGERS OF ALL LEVELS OF ABILITY ARE WELCOME!!!
Jonathan will teach a mix of pop, folk and original songs, and Lala will teach a mix of songs from South Africa, Georgia, Madagascar and community songs.
If you are coming from out of town, the Home of Compassion offers some accommodation with reasonable rates which includes breakfast. Please contact them directly to enquire islandbay@compassion.org.nz
SCHEDULE
Saturday, 17th of January: This first part of the retreat will be at the Island Bay Presbyterian Church. We will spend the day singing in the beautiful auditorium and share a Malagasy meal cooked by Lala at the end of the day. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and dinner provided. Please BYO lunch.
Sunday 18th of January: We will be singing in the Lyon Room at the Home of Compassion in Island Bay. We will finish the day singing the songs we learn through the weekend at a FREE community concert in the Chapel. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and lunch provided.
The Iskand Bay Presbyterian Church and the Home of Compassion are within walking distance of each other.
Bring a water bottle, swimming togs if you want to swim in Island Bay during lunch time, and a picnic mat for eating outside.

A Breath, Sound & Silence Journey ✨🌌🌬

Held by the Heavens | Bathed in Stillness | Anchored in Cosmic Light

𝗝𝗢𝗨𝗥𝗡𝗘𝗬 𝗕𝗘𝗬𝗢𝗡𝗗 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗩𝗘𝗜𝗟 — 𝗪𝗛𝗘𝗥𝗘 𝗦𝗢𝗨𝗟 𝗠𝗘𝗘𝗧𝗦 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗥𝗗𝗨𝗦𝗧 🌌🪐✨️🏕🌠

Nestled within a sacred Sanctuary under the starlit skies of Paraparaumu, you are invited to enter the realm of Ether — the invisible thread that weaves all of life. Here, the boundaries between body, breath, and spirit begin to dissolve into the spaciousness of the cosmos.

Cradled by silence, expanded through breath, and elevated by sound, this ceremony is a subtle, sacred transmission — a remembrance of your soul’s celestial origin.

This soulscape will guide you through:

• Gentle Breathwork to still the body and awaken presence
• Blue Lotus Ritual to open the heart and third eye
• Crystal Singing Bowls & Celestial Light Language
• Shamanic Gong encoded with Star Frequencies
• Intuitive Energy Transmissions

𝗕𝗟𝗨𝗘 𝗟𝗢𝗧𝗨𝗦 𝗥𝗜𝗧𝗨𝗔𝗟

Blue Lotus, known as the Flower of the Heavens, has been revered in ancient Egyptian and Eastern traditions as a plant of intuition, divination, and deep heart awakening. As you connect with the energy of Blue Lotus you are invited to soften your edges and expand your awareness into dream-like states — where insight, creativity, and emotional release naturally unfold. She is the guardian of the liminal realms, ushering you gently into etheric remembrance.

𝗕𝗘𝗡𝗘𝗙𝗜𝗧𝗦 𝗢𝗙 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗝𝗢𝗨𝗥𝗡𝗘𝗬:
• Deep Nervous System Regulation
• Heightened Intuition & Expanded Consciousness
• Enhanced Sleep & Dream States
• Emotional Release without Over-Processing

• Gentle Detoxification & Energetic Clearing
• Cellular Recalibration & Vibrational Healing
• Connection to Divine Feminine & Cosmic Womb
• Inner Peace, Stillness & Mental Clarity

𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗦𝗔𝗖𝗥𝗘𝗗 𝗦𝗔𝗡𝗖𝗧𝗨𝗔𝗥𝗬
Nestled in the hills beside the Lotus Yoga Centre rests a sacred Meditation Sanctuary
a place where many come to reconnect, find inner stillness, and bathe in peace.

Built in 1999, this Sanctuary serves as the spiritual heart of the Centre’s activities.
The location itself was chosen with great care, resting at the meeting point of powerful ley lines, its energy deeply aligned with Kapiti Island and the Maungakotukutuku ranges to the east.

The octagon-shaped structure is crafted from natural timbers, crowned with a glass pyramid roof that amplifies and channels healing energies. Around its frame, tinted windows radiate the seven colours of the rainbow—each one carrying a unique healing ray. On a bright day, the play of colours is nothing short of spectacular, filling the space with a living rainbow of light.

𝙒𝙃𝘼𝙏 𝙏𝙊 𝙀𝙓𝙋𝙀𝘾𝙏:
• Doors open at 3.00PM for grounding & Blue Lotus
• Ceremony opens with breath & intention-setting
• 60-minute sound and silence journey in the sacred SANCTUARY.
• Integration circle to gently return and reflect
• Closing around 5:30PM

Your only task is to arrive with presence and openness, ready to receive what is already waiting within you.

𝙒𝙃𝘼𝙏 𝙏𝙊 𝘽𝙍𝙄𝙉𝙂:

• Blanket & pillow for comfort

description:
The Greatest Story - A Group of Wise Teachers Returning, Public Talk & Workshop

Throughout history, especially at times of crisis, great spiritual teachers have emerged to show humanity the next step forward.

According to British artist, author and esotericist Benjamin Creme, a group of such spiritual teachers is now living in the modern world. Maitreya, the World Teacher, and his group The Masters of Wisdom are here - not as religious teachers - to inspire all people to create a civilisation based on sharing, justice and peace; and for humanity to act to do the work to share and save our world.

Humanity at spiritual crossroads

Humanity is at crossroads. One path into the future leads to increasing social and economic division, environmental destruction, war and planetary peril. The other path leads to increasing social harmony, economic and environmental balance, and a golden era of peace.


Maitreya’s priorities

To help humanity in its task of global transformation, Maitreya has formulated certain priorities. They cover the essential needs of all people, every woman, man and child: an adequate supply of food; housing for all; healthcare and education as basic universal rights. Other top priorities include the restoration of the environment and the establishment of peace.

The key to achieving these goals requires a major shift of present mind-set and thinking, structures and systems – and more equitable sharing of the world’s food and resources. To realise humanity is one global family and the planet is a living being. According to Maitreya: “Without sharing, there can be no justice; without justice, there can be no peace; without peace, there can be no future.”

~ followed by short Transmission Meditation session ~

Share International New Zealand. Contact (021) 261 2749
Access - entrance from Raumati Road/ walk - drive past Te Raukura ki Kāpiti / Kāpiti Performing Arts Centre

description:
Third Eye Hi-Fi Presents - Druid's Temple, Third Eye Hifi Presents:
Druids Temple
Rooted in the ancient traditions of the druids, this night channels the deep connection between land, spirit, and sound. The druids saw the earth as sacred — every tree, stone, and breath carrying rhythm and resonance. Their gatherings in the forests were not just rituals, but sonic ceremonies — where vibration, intention, and nature intertwined.
Carrying that lineage into the present, we gather once more — not in oak circles, but beneath the pulse of sub-bass and smoke. The dancefloor becomes our modern temple, a sacred space where frequencies align and collective energy moves as one.
Channeling ancient energy through modern frequencies, our array of homegrown and international artists bring their influence in the 130 / 140 bass music scene for an immersive experience to remember.
// Druids Line-Up //
Tamar
Clova
Tarantist
Kameano
Bvrbwyre
Steering Hippies
Decor by RabidFoam

Artwork by P-S-I

description:
V.U Meditation Journeys, V.U Meditation Journeys
To book for a space in the bell tent- click here https://loveyourself.co.nz/events/p/bell-tent-meditations-
To book to do the journey over Zoom - Click here https://loveyourself.co.nz/events/p/journey-meditations-zoom

Every Tuesday night we welcome you into the magic of the bell tent. The tent is lovely during the day, but as it gets dark, it takes on a magical feeling. Fairy lights and crystals lit by gently changing coloured lights. We have the fire going if it's cold, the sky curtain pulled if it's a clear night.

The evening starts with us welcoming in the Elements, the Directions and the web of life, into our sacred circle. Arniya then dances the energy in with Celestial Energy Movement, for the group. This creates a vortex of Divine power into the middle of the tent. Each person is linked into this Divine power, and receives a "top-up" of Divinity.
We then have an opportunity for each person to hold the Talking Stick and send positive energy to their life, or current experience, or to ask the Divine for help. This is completely optional. Throughout the evening, you will have opportunities to choose oracle cards to support your guidance through life.

At 8pm the Zoom people join our circle. They will get to choose an oracle card and be connected into the vortex of power in the tent. This always creates an energy of expansion within the group.
Arniya then gives a wee run down of any current energies influencing the planet, before she leads everyone on a Journey Meditation. Some weeks we to the V.U soul plane. Sometimes we travel to our inner world. Sometimes the guardians take us somewhere else entirely. Each journey is channelled to support the needs of whoever is present.
After the meditation, we say goodbye to our Zoom friends, close the energy on the circle and give thanks. After this journey is complete, we have a cup of tea - time for a chat or playing with oracle cards, enjoying each other’s company in the uplifted space.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
UNLEASH THE VOICES OF YOUR SUN AND MOON, UNLEASH THE VOICES OF YOUR SUN AND MOON
Book Soon for this special day workshop and explore and unleash the power of your Voice and Astrological Archetypes!!

We are blessed that Alignment Coach and Healer, Clare Babbage is visiting the Wellington Region from Napier, and collaborating with Voice Empowerment Coach and Healer, Bryony Rogers from Heartsong Healing, in this exciting, unique offering.

This workshop is a specially designed, transformative full day experience of Embodied Astrological Archetypes and Conscious Sound and Voice Practices.

BOOK HERE - https://buy.stripe.com/aEU3g1gMecNj2SkbJI

On the date of the full moon, the energies of the sun and the moon stand face to face — illuminating both our outer expression and our inner world.

In astrology, the sun represents our fullest expression, our vitality, and the way we are here to shine. The moon reveals our emotional landscape, our inner rhythms, and often the fears that arise when we dare to live that full expression. Together, they form a powerful dialogue between structure and flow, logic and emotion, masculine and feminine.

In this workshop, Clare will guide you into an embodied exploration of your own sun and moon, inviting you to feel these two archetypes within your body and notice where they support, resist, or balance each other.

Bryony will lead you into vocal practices that bring these energies into sound and voice — giving expression to what is often left unspoken. Through voice, you’ll release what holds you back and discover new harmony between your inner and outer selves.

This full moon is the perfect moment to unleash the voices of your sun and moon — and to step more fully into clarity, balance, and authentic expression.

The timing of this workshop gives you a unique opportunity to tune into these planets and benefit from their placement in the collective astrology.

The workshop will begin with the opportunity to explore powerful, enjoyable, accessible Voice Practices which open, align and strengthen your expression - and create physiological changes in your energy field.

We will then directly, bodily experience the energies of each of the Celestial Bodies through Embodied Astrology, guided by Clare.

We will integrate these energies, through further Voice Practices, including improvisation, healing chants and songs.

These two modalities will be carefully interwoven in an enjoyable, rich day's workshop that will benefit all participants.

There will be guided space in the workshop to integrate the energetic shifts and discoveries of both the Voice Practices and the Astrology.

This special workshop takes place on Saturday February 7th, 10am-4.30pm - we hope you can join us

At the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Paraparaumu.

INVESTMENT:

Your investment for this day is $233. Shared lunch.
Some concessions are available - please contact us by email .

Payment by card here - https://buy.stripe.com/aEU3g1gMecNj2SkbJI

Please contact us with any questions at all.

Wellington CBD Outreach & Evangelism, Join an experienced team of Young Adult leaders from local churches & Catalyst Movement for some Friday Night evangelism in the heart of Wellington
Meet at 8pm at Te Aro Park (Pigeon Park). We'll start with some outdoor worship & prayer together and then head out in pairs to talk with people about Jesus on Cuba & Courtenay
These times are always tonnes of fun and really fruitful. We'll pray for people, invite people to church on Sunday, and have some all round wholesome yarns. If never done evangelism before and want to give it a go, this is your chance! We'll walk through some basic training content and have a big experienced crew to partner off with. See you there!

description:
Wes Huff | Truth Matters Tour | Wellington, Wes Huff | Truth Matters Tour | Wellington
We're excited to invite you to an evening of insight and inspiration as we welcome Wes Huff for a special Thinking Matters event. Wes is a gifted communicator and seasoned apologist known for helping Christians confidently navigate questions of faith, reason, and truth in today's skeptical culture.

In this thought-provoking session, Wes will unpack key ideas that will challenge your thinking, deepen your understanding of the Christian worldview, and equip you to engage meaningfully with the world around you. Whether you're solid in your faith or wrestling with big questions, this night promises to be impactful and encouraging.

Don’t miss this unique opportunity to hear from Wes Huff and be part of a community passionate about truth.
One night only – reserve your spot now!

The course takes in all the sights - Te Papa, Whairepo Lagoon and the Well_ngton sign - as it follows the wide public esplanade around the harbour. description:
A Place of Firsts, Globally, citizens assemblies are widely used as an effective way to involve local people in deciding how to address complex issues such as climate change. Despite the repeated failure of standard policy processes, citizens assemblies have only recently made it to New Zealand. Register for this event to find out more about the Porirua Assembly on Climate and its innovations. 
Porirua is known for community-led innovations in governance and delivery, and the Porirua Assembly on Climate continued this tradition by being:
the first climate assembly in New Zealand,  
the first assembly co-designed and organised by an iwi authority and a community group, 
the first assembly process designed to honour Te Tiriti o Waitangi by using a tricameral design,  
the first New Zealand assembly to include children and young people, and 
by creating a new local governance body - the Porirua Community Leaders Forum - that sponsored the Assembly, holds its recommendations and can instigate ongoing community dialogue on local issues. 
Panellists will share learning on the Porirua Assembly’s innovations, talk about why the standard citizens assembly model was modified, dig into what enabled so many firsts and how these worked out in practice. They will reflect on this legacy and possible future impacts. Might these democratic innovations strengthen local democracy elsewhere in Aotearoa New Zealand? 
About the Host and Speakers
Jodi Watene is a Systems Change Lead at Te Rūnanga o Toa Rangatira Incorporated, was the project manager for the Porirua Assembly and is helping to establish a New Zealand Community of Practice on Indigenous Citizens’ Assemblies.
Makerita Makapelu is a Team Leader for Wesley Community Action in Porirua with a background in performing arts and youth work. She specialises in community-led development and grassroots systems change, and was one of the Porirua Assembly facilitators.  
Cally O'Neill was a participatory designer of community spaces until 2019 when she shifted her focus towards advocating for Te Tiriti-based deliberative democracy to address the climate and other contemporary crises. She is a founding member of Te Reo O Ngā Tāngata/The People Speak and was one of the Porirua Assembly facilitators. 
Future Unity, a youth climate group formed during the Assembly process will be represented by Orini Rokx-Taratu and Santino Morehu, who were participants in the Assembly’s youth and community streams.  
Emily Beausoleil is an Associate Professor at Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington. Her research as a political theorist centres on the dynamics, conditions and challenges of democratic engagement in diverse societies. She is conducting an independent evaluation of the Porirua Assembly process.

One Day. One Stage. One Cause.
This event is organised by kids in Pōneke to raise funds for kids in Palestine.
Join us for a one-day-only music fundraiser where young voices take centre stage to amplify hope and raise money for children in Palestine.
This isn’t just a concert, it’s a movement. Under-18 musicians, solo artists, and bands (some joined by over-18 allies) are coming together to rock out with purpose, showing that music knows no borders and compassion has no age limit.
These young performers are using their talents to stand in solidarity with kids just like them who are living through unimaginable circumstances.
Organiser Eddie 12: "We see children in Palestine who are being bombed and shot and are starving. We kids want to help. So that is what we are doing."
There will be stalls and crafting available for kids attending - Please come and support so we can raise money for Gaza's families.
100% of proceeds go directly to emergency aid and child-focused relief in Palestine - Convoys of Good and Kiwi Trust for Palestinian Childrens Relief.
Witness the next generation of artists and activists sharing the stage and raising their voices. Please support them with your attendance. Show them young people can make a difference.
Be part of an event where music becomes action, and community becomes change.

description:
Blenheim Trail Runners Presents - Crush The Vernon - V2, Blenheim Trail Runners Presents - Crush The Vernon - V2
The Second coming of the "Crush the Vernon" Vert Day is just around the corner, We had such a great time last time and its smack bang into the point where everyone needs elevation for events so i thought it would be silly not to bring it back!

"Crush the Vernon" is a couple of fun endurance challeges to get us up into the Wither Hills for a big vert day!
This event will push you to the red line, boasting both as much high-level uphill suffering as you can possibly endure whilst building a steady accumulation of regret over 6 hours on the trails.
It’s an event that's built to stretch the boundaries of what you think you can do uphill, but overall, it’s a chance to get out there and have some fun, whether solo or in a team. Whilst there is some faster efforts needed to come out on top of any of these “disciplines”, the aim of the game is just to get out there and enjoy yourself at whatever pace suits you.

The added extra this time is not only an extra hour, explained below, but the plan is to tie this into the elevation for a group effort for a BTR Everest Challenge, more details around this when I can get a team entry together, but really keen to try and pudh the limits of what has been done before.

Details:
Date: 26th October - Backup date is the week after
Time: 6am-1pm - (1 hr per week it too Hialry to conquer everest!)
Location: The Wither Hills, Basecamp: Sutherland Stream picnic area - this will be where we have the whiteboard & a bit of an "Aid station/Bag drop" situation going on.

Disciplines:
- "Vernon Vert Masters" Highest total elevation (solo/team) - pretty self explanatory, but between the hours of 6 am- 1pm any elevation in the Wither hills farm park accumulated within these hours on this day (solo or in a team) counts towards your total for the “Total Elevation” part of the challenge

- “Crush the Covenant” loop (solo/team) - Crush the covenant Loop is a 3.75km, 300m vert loop running from Sutherland Stream Picnic Area to the Mt Vernon Summit & then back down again, the loops can be run in whichever direction you would like, just be aware that this is a 2-way track and there will be a bit more traffic than you would usually see up on it. The aim of the game here is to get as many laps in as possible between 6 am-1pm; this will also count toward your elevation total for the "Vernon Vert Masters"

The Basics:
- This is an open event to anyone who wants to participate
- The event is open from 6am-1pm - any elevation in the Wither hills farm park accumulated within these hours on this day counts towards your total for the “Total Elevation” part of the challenge
- We will have a basecamp/aid station at the Sutherland stream picnic spot. This will be the hub for the meet-up and the start/finish line for the laps of “Crush the Covenant”.
- No minimum time, you can start whenever you like in the 6 am-1pm timeframe and go for as long as you would like.
-You can do as many laps/summits/cumulative elevation as you like/can within the timeframe.
- Teams - Teams can be between 2-5 people for the overall elevation challenge, and your total elevation will be your total accumulated. You will need to pre-register your team with Mikey before the day so that we can have you on the scoreboard.
- You will need to confirm your solo/teams total elevation with Basecamp by 1.30pm on the day, in person. If you are unable to do this for whatever reason, you will need to confirm and prove details via message or screenshots so we can add them to the total tally.


Who's up for some hills?



Disclaimer
We at Blenheim Trail Runners don’t see ourselves as event organisers and as such, do not have any consent or insurance; we deem this as a “Club Meet-up”.
With that, the expectation is that you are 100% responsible for yourself and take part at your own risk.
Be aware, as this isn't a formal event, there won't be any official timekeeping, marshals or trail markers. There will be DIY DIY-type whiteboard to note down your shared laps & elevation, and we will provide details via trail maps for the “Crush the Covenant” loop.
We are unable to provide any/can not be held responsible for: Urgent medical attention (we will however, assist wherever possible, there will be a first aid kit at base camp), nutrition, hydration ( there is public access throughout the hills and in two points on the “crush the Covenant” loop), the condition of the trail on the day or the weather.

description:
HineHau Breathwork for Women: Workshop, Join Shannon Rose for this unique three-hour workshop—breathwork for wāhine.
Through story, breath, and reflection, you’ll learn and experience the power of your breath as a wāhine: to cleanse, to create, and to consciously live in alignment with who you are. Open to wāhine of all cultures who are ready to experience the healing power of Te Hā — the sacred breath.
In this workshop, you’ll be safely guided on a journey of remembrance, reconnection, and reclamation. Expect to come away feeling grounded, rejuvenated, and more at home in your body.
What’s Included:
*Karakia to open and close our space
*Purākau — Māori creation stories on the whakapapa of the breath
*Kōrero — how intentional breathing helps to align your mauri, wairua and mana
*Working with the nervous system to support manifestation and creativity
*BreathWav™ Journey — a 70-minute circular connected breath practice for release, alignment, and deep connection
*Journaling & Reflection to integrate what arises
Please bring:
Water, a journal and an eye mask
HineHau Breathwork for Women
With Shannon Rose
Saturday 25th October 2026, 11.45am-2.45pm | Awhi Yoga
Price: $65
Nau mai, haere mai!
About Shannon Rose:
Ngāti Porou ki Harataunga, Ngāti Whakaue, Ngāti Whakahemo, Tūhourangi, Scotland, Croatia, England. Shannon Rose has been immersed in the practice of breath since 2017 and is recognised as one of the pioneers of breathwork in Aotearoa. She is the founder of HineHau, a breathwork training kaupapa supporting wāhine to step into leadership and facilitation through the breath. HineHau teaches breathwork through a Te Ao Māori lens to wahine, offering 200-hour practitioner certifications.
Since beginning her practice in 2017, Shannon has been part of the early wave of facilitators bringing the transformative power of breathwork to Aotearoa. Her approach is both deeply spiritual and deeply human, making the breath accessible as a tool for healing, alignment, and reconnection.
Through HineHau (formerly Elevare), Shannon has trained over 50 practitioners in the BreathWav™ modality, a practice that works with the full spectrum of the breath to release, restore, and reawaken. At the heart of her work is a commitment to weaving whakapapa, story, and ceremony into modern practice, creating spaces where wāhine can return to themselves with clarity and confidence.

description:
Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Pasifika Family Walk, Bring the whole whānau along for this fun and family-friendly evening walk led by Georgina from Pasifika o Wairarapa Trust. We’ll meet at the Netball Court carpark before following the riverside track towards Queen Elizabeth Park.

The walk includes a stop at the Kids’ Skate Park, where tamariki can bring their wheels and enjoy 15–20 minutes of riding time. From there, we’ll continue towards the duck pond, cross the bridge, and loop back to the Netball Courts. The route is mostly flat and will take around an hour, depending on the kids (and their wheels!).

This walk is perfect for families with children, schools, and less experienced walkers. For those wanting to avoid steps, there’s the option to return along the same riverside path.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Enchanted Park, Enchanted Park
Free fairy fun in the forest!

Bring the whānau for an enchanting afternoon in the Gums Loop Meadow at Wainuiomata Regional Park. This special summer event invites tamariki to explore nature, get creative, and learn about the native wildlife that calls this forest home.

Help us build a fairy garden in the forest where North Island brown kiwi live. Kids can paint rocks or create their own fairy doors. There will be facepainting and outdoor games. You're encouraged to bring fairy costumes and picnic lunches to enjoy in the meadow.

Our knowledgeable park ranger will be there (with fairy wings on) to answer questions and share stories about the park’s natural heritage.

The Remutaka Conservation Trust and Forest & Bird be on hand to teach tamariki about the kiwi who live in this park and the conservation work happening in the area.

Event Details:

Aimed at: Children aged 4–10

Accessibility: Tracks suitable for prams

Dogs: Allowed on a lead

What to bring: Picnic, costumes, and creativity!


Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of our regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Wainuiomata Regional Park is a special place for conservation. Greater Wellington’s work here protects freshwater sources, preserves ancient native forests, looks after historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers, like the Remutaka Conservation Trust, play a vital role in making this park a special place for everyone.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
In person Family Constellation Workshop in Wellington, Join the Transformative Family Constellation Workshop in Wellington, Facilitated by Ale!
Are you noticing repeated patterns in your life? Struggling with relationships or workplace challenges or seeking a profound shift? This one-day workshop offers a powerful opportunity to address the root causes of life’s challenges on a deep, soul level through the wisdom of your family system.
Experience the extraordinary healing modality discovered by Bert Hellinger as you connect with the morphogenetic field of family systems. By representing a family member in a constellation, you’ll witness firsthand the astonishing insights and transformations this approach provides.
Family Constellation Can Help You:
Uncover and resolve relationship difficulties.
Break free from patterns of conflict or limitation.
Reveal the soul-level causes of allergies, illnesses, accidents, or infertility.
Gain clarity and healing around any life circumstance that concerns you.
No prior experience or special skills are needed—just an open heart and a willingness to explore.
Seats are Limited—Reserve Your Spot Now!
Don’t miss this unique opportunity to uncover the hidden dynamics of your family system and take a transformative step forward.
EARLY BIRD SPECIAL PRICE!
>>>BOOK NOW to get the early bird special price of $88 instead of $111! Only the first 5 participants save $23 with the Early Bird on each booking<<<
Please reach out to 0210332049 or shiningsoul.nzar@gmail to book your spot!
We're looking forward to having you at the workshop!
In service to life with deep love,
Ale

description:
Bar Blanc de Blancs with Martin Bosley's Oyster Saloon, Alexia's special annual Blanc de Blancs celebration returns for a 4th edition with the release of the 2021 vintage of our world famous (in Greytown) Méthode Traditionnelle!

After four years of patient making and aging, the corks on the most sparkly of all our wines are ready to be popped and the liquid gold consumed on the Alexia terrace!

The man, the myth, the mollusc maestro Martin Bosley is back with his Oyster Saloon between 12pm - 3pm shucking fresh oysters for the occasion so get in early for these or miss out!

Oysters not your thing? Fear not, the Alexia kitchen will also be turning out some delicious delights to match to your Blanc de Blancs – everyone will be happy!

It’s always a great day when the new vintage of Blanc de Blancs starts flowing and we’re quietly delighted with how the 2021 vintage is looking!

Essential Details:
- Alexia Urban Winery, 197 West Street, Greytown.
- Leashed dogs ok!
- No bookings required, just turn up. Want oysters? Get there before 3pm.
- Parking onsite, on the street, and lots of parking for bikes. 15 minute walk from Greytown centre.

Erika Grant is a musician and astrologer with an interest in the healing properties of sound for mental and physical wellbeing, which she currently explores through her gong bathing practice.

(Image credit: Unarius Academy of Science)

description:
Dads Drags, DADS DRAGS – Fathers Day - Sunday 7th September 2025 - Masterton Motorplex

Get ready for one of the most popular events on our calendar – Dads Drags is back!
A fun day out where first-timers, regular racers, families, and fans all come together for a relaxed but action-packed day at the strip. Bring the daily driver or your classic or muscle car - you don't have to have a fast car to win! So long as it has a current WoF and Rego, a helmet (see links below for info) you can race all day!

Spectator Info:
Gate entry: Adults $20
14 years & under free (bring the kids!)

Full day of racing action, plus a great atmosphere for Father’s Day.

Racer Info:
Race entry: $50
Day licence available for $30 (if you don’t already hold a current licence)
Passenger rides allowed – you’ll need a completed passenger form, $20 per passenger.

Everyone racing (including passengers) must wear a compliant helmet, long sleeves, long pants, and enclosed shoes.

If you’re new to drag racing, check out our Getting Started guide on the website – it has all the details you’ll need to know before race day.

Hot Rod & Classic Car Display:
Preferential parking is available for hot rods and classics – roll up and be part of the show in the pits and display area.

Make this Father’s Day one to remember – whether you’re on the start line, riding shotgun, or watching from the stands, Dads Drags is the place to be this Fathers Day!

Forms & Info:
Entry Form: https://www.mastertonmotorplex.co.nz/storage/ENTRY-FORM-Dads-Drags-2025.pdf
Passenger Form: https://www.mastertonmotorplex.co.nz/storage/Passenger-Indemnity-Form-dads-drags-2025.pdf
Getting Started Guide: https://www.mastertonmotorplex.co.nz/getting-started/

description:
Faultline Fury 2025, Faultline Fury 2025
Faultline Fury is back for 2025 and registration opens for club members this evening at 6pm and non club member on 1 August 5pm.

4 rounds of play
Event Timing: Saturday 1st November and Sunday 2nd November 2025
Event Address: Harcourt Park - Upper Hutt
Contact us at:

The Event
Players will play a combination of 18 holes from two short but technical courses, (Harcourt Park and California Park). Course Map will be available closer to the time and will include the opportunity to play all of the harcourt holes in either a split round or full round depends on pool numbers.
The maximum number of participants will be capped at 90 people, so get in quick so you don't miss out (there will be a waitlist if required). Participants that register before the 10th August 2025 will be eligible to receive 5 free throws with the tech disc at the event.

Divisions and Cost:
MPO / FPO - $65
MA1 / FA1 / MA40 /FA40 / MA3 / FA3 - $55
MJ18 / FJ18 - $50

**Please note that Female Divisions will be offered equivalent to the mixed divisions for the first week of registration and then if no registrations received for these divisions the club organisation committee will consider consolidating these.

Lunch will not be provided this year instead all amateurs will receive a small players pack item approx $20 in value .


Registration via discgolfscene.com
https://www.discgolfscene.com/tournament/Faultline_Furry_2025

REFUND POLICY
Greater Wellington Disc Golf Club is responsible for all refunds and cancellations.

Refunds/ Withdrawals: Greater Wellington Disc Golf Club is responsible for all refunds/cancellations.
REFUND POLICY
100%: refund (excluding transaction and DG Scene fees) will be issued for anyone pulling out before 8pm on 1st of October.
50% refund (excluding transaction and DG Scene fees) will be issued for anyone pulling out before 8pm on Sunday 19th October.
Any withdrawals after 8:01pm Sunday 18th October will not be eligible for any refund unless the space can be filled with the waitlist. Players may transfer their entry to another person if there is no one on the waitlist.

Wellington Waterfront Photo Walk with Sony Scene, Join me for a photo walk along Wellington's waterfront.
Keen for an excuse to get your camera out and explore? Join us for a relaxed stroll around the Wellington waterfront on a Saturday morning.
Meet other photographers, see how other's approach a scene, or just enjoy the company while you practice getting to know your camera better.
Our location for this photo walk will take in Wellington's waterfront for an hour, starting at Freyberg Pool at Oriental Bay and heading around to Te Papa and the pier.
Every registered participant who attends the photo walk goes into the Scene Festival draw to win a trip to Rome!

Brace yourself — on Thursday 9th October, our axe lanes morph into a bone-rattling, armor-clanking cage of chaos! Watch as trained warriors clad in gleaming medieval armor unleash flying axes and clashing swords in a battle for ultimate bragging rights.

This isn’t your average Thursday night — it’s epic sword-swinging, axe-chopping, heart-pounding theatre you’ve gotta see to believe. Feel the thunder of steel, the roar of the crowd, and the thrill of knights battling for glory.

description:
Hoscar (Sept) Monthly GWDG club event, Hoscar (Sept) Monthly GWDG club event
Come and participate in the monthly (930am 1st Saturday of the month) round of Hoscar at Hikoikoi reserve Petone.

This month is the clubs designated fundraiser for the Lower Hutt region courses and also the club series event at Hikoikoi. Come and participate in both with a flexible start round of 18 for the club series and Ript revenge 18 for the fundraiser.

Hey Disc Golfers
Stay tuned for more details on the GWDG club upcoming fundraising event to help with further developments at Hikoikoi reserve and the installation of permanent baskets and tee pads at Poole Cresent reserve. None of this can be possible without the community support.
This is a weekend fundraiser put on by the Lower Hutt sub committee and will have spot prizes for participants across the weekend. Come play and have some fun with the sub committee and take on Ript Revenge.

Entry cost $10 per day so you can play Saturday or Sunday or both. Who will claim bragging rights

Coordinated by Lower Hutt sub committee in

description:
Festive High Tea, Join us for an afternoon of festive elegance and indulge in the spirit of the holidays with a selection of holiday-inspired treats, perfectly paired with bottomless T.W.G. Tea.
Available Fridays, Saturdays & Sundays | 14th November - 21st December
$65 per person
MENU
Santa's Turkey & cranberry finger sandwich
Ham, cheese & basil pinwheel
Smoked salmon mousse choux 'bauble'
Batata vada with spiced date chutney
Chocolate and berry delice
Mini Christmas 'tree' cake
Gingerbread macaron
Sticky date pudding with caramel sauce
Brandy-soaked cherry & orange scone with vanilla cream

A children's menu is available for under 12's and is priced at $25 per child.
Please note that our Festive High Tea menu cannot be adapted to accommodate dietary or allergy restrictions.
Our Classic High Tea menu can be adapted to vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free diets. Please select the appropriate menu for each guest when making your booking.
Terms & Conditions
Our Festive High Tea cannot be modified for dietary requirements. However, our Classic High Tea is available in a Vegetarian, Vegan and Gluten Free version.
Please note, we are unable to accommodate dietary requirements without prior notice.
If not already stated and confirmed at the time of reservation, guest numbers must be confirmed 48 hours prior to arrival.
A credit card must be provided at the time of reservation to secure the booking.
High Tea reservations cancelled within 24 hours prior to arrival will incur a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.
No-shows will be charged a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.
Decreases in attendee numbers will not be accepted within 24 hours before arrival, and charges will apply based on the confirmed final count.

description:
Te Aro Zero Waste Just Sew Repair Cafe, Join us for our Just Sew - November edition!

Got a tear, a missing button, or a hem that’s come undone? Don’t toss it - fix it! Our monthly Just Sew sessions are all about giving your clothing and textile items a second life. This is a great way to take climate action in your own life – and learn new skills along the way.

Book through our website and bring along 1-2 clothing or lightweight household items (cushion covers etc) for repair. We will have sewing machines, needles, thread, and a selection of patches and buttons ready for you. If you have something special you would like to use, feel free to bring it along.

Our skilled volunteers will be here to help with repairs such as holes, tears, hems and missing buttons. Whether you are completely new to sewing or just need a bit of guidance, we will support you through it.

These sessions are held at Te Aro Zero Waste on the first Saturday of every month, from 1-4 pm.

description:
Kinnoull Station led trailride, this is a led ride
The ride starts at a woodshed at kinnnoll station at the end of South Makara Road follow the red arrows and signs from maraka https://maps.app.goo.gl/Pf4mmd47n8fmPuH26
the ride starts at 10 riders briefing and shortly after that we leave don't be late
We will ride down to the beach to Long Gully and to the beach gates at terawhiti station
the track is made up of a lot of river crossings grass paddocks rocky roads sandy beaches and a hill climb with the most beautiful views of the South Island. . And We are going to have a game of beach drags. To see who's wellington's fastest Beach drag racer.
no dogs. no kids bikes no quads this event is for 16 year old and up 16 years must be accompanied by an adult at all times
full gear
adventure bikes must have knoblies because it's deep sand

description:
Kāpiti Run for Youth 2026, Kāpiti Run for Youth 2026
We’ve checked the tide timetable – Anchor your calendar now to take part in the 2026 Web Genius Kāpiti Run for Youth on Sunday 29 March 2026 – Raising funds for rangatahi in Kāpiti since 2011 while having fun strolling or running along the beautiful Kāpiti coastline. Kāpiti Run for Youth is a lively, family-friendly event focused on fostering community spirit and supporting organisations that encourage and uplift local young people. RAIN or SHINE, get ready to have fun!

We know Kāpiti Run for Youth helps to support amazing community work done by local fundraising partners. We have 13 incredible fundraising partners you can choose to support and raise funds for. We are very proud of them all and the work they do to uplift the youth of Kāpiti. Each partner brings something unique to the table, from providing essential resources and mentorship to creating spaces where young people can thrive. By supporting rangatahi through education, creativity, employment, and well-being initiatives, they ensure our youth are not just supported but empowered to reach their full potential. Our partners are creating a brighter tomorrow for the young people of Kāpiti!

In the beginning Kāpiti Run for Youth was created by Web Genius as their way as a local business to ‘give back’ to the community so, more than a decade on we can proudly say the event is sustainable and is popular with all sorts, young and old, the fit and not so fit. Kāpiti Run for Youth has raised $280,003 for rangatahi since inception in 2011. In 2025 the event raised $25,531 which was remarkable.

Kāpiti Run for Youth will be open for sign up early in January 2026 >> https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/signup

At that time, we will be seeking individuals and teams to get together to walk or run from Paraparaumu Beach (Maclean Park) to Raumati Beach and back. For those choosing the 12km walk or run, they will do two circuits of the course.

Choose your adventure – a 6km or 12km run or walk along the beautiful Kāpiti coastline. Whether it's a leisurely stroll or a mad dash to be the first across the finish, you choose the event that suits you best, and which of our amazing fundraising partners you're going to raise funds for. On race day grab your dog and your mates and head down to the beach for fun, family and fitness. Registration takes place from 8.30am to 9.45am with a briefing at 9.45am and all walkers and runners starting together at 10am.

Once your profile is set-up online, let your family, friends and work mates know so they can sponsor your efforts. We encourage every participant to raise $20 through sponsorship instead of paying an entry fee. All entrants receive regular campaigns to motivate their sponsorship efforts along the way.

Kāpiti Run for Youth prides itself on being a sustainable, family-friendly event that is all about supporting each other and having fun. Join your community for a feel-good morning on the beach. Your fundraising makes a difference in the lives of our young people! BYO sunhat, sunscreen, and water on the day, and there are sponsored spot prizes, treats for the kids, certificates for participating and free Paekākāriki Mini Pops for everyone at the end.

Checkout our FAQs over on our website >> https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/faqs

Closer to the event, go to our website to sign up or sponsor someone that you know who is participating >>
https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/search

All registrations and sponsorship are handled securely and confidentially on the Kāpiti Run for Youth website that is powered by Raisley and supported by Stripe online payments.

---------------------------------------------

BUSINESS SPONSORSHIP
Platinum $1,000+, Gold $500, Silver $250, Bronze $125 is available for businesses who want to support the underlying work of this event and rangatahi youth of Kāpiti. In 2025 we were grateful to 58 local business sponsors to the value of $15,125 that can be viewed on our website >> https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/sponsors

Sponsorship for the 2026 campaign will open late in January 2026

---------------------------------------------

FUNDRAISING MODEL
We focus on returning as much money as we can back to the Kāpiti community to those working with rangatahi. All funds raised are split 70% to the official Fundraising Partner chosen by the participant at the time of registration and 30% is retained towards running and promotion of the event.

FUNDRAISING PARTNERS
Birthright Kāpiti, Challenge for Change Kāpiti, Kāpiti Basketball Association, Kāpiti College, Kāpiti Kindness Trust, Kāpiti Youth Support, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets Kāpiti, Ōtaki College, Paraparaumu College, The Shed Project Kāpiti, Whirlwind Kāpiti, Work Ready Kāpiti, ZEAL Kāpiti >>
https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/fundraising-partners

---------------------------------------------

WELLNESS UPDATE
We operate within the Event Sector Voluntary Code. Please don’t attend if you are feeling unwell.

REGISTRATION DISCLAIMER
Kāpiti Run for Youth carries comprehensive Public Liability event insurance for a period of 48 hours that includes set-up, pack-down and during the event. We maintain an Accident & Incident Register at the Registration Gazebo and local GP, Paraparaumu Medical Centre, handle any medical emergency on the day of the event. We dial 111 if there is an incident beyond their resources.

We remind participants to take self-responsibility and those they are with when on the beach course and to alert officials as needed. It is important to listen to all instructions given on the day of the event at the pre-course briefing, and to report any incidents however minor they may seem. To report an incident, dial 027 244 9585.

PHOTOGRAPHY DISCLAIMER
Kāpiti Run for Youth reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.

---------------------------------------------

IN-KIND EVENT SPONSORS
24/7 Fitness, Beach FM, Captured By Friday Photography, Coffee to Die For, Kāpiti Business Projects, Kāpiti Chocolate Factory, Kāpiti Law, Kāpiti Party Hire, NZME, Paekākāriki Pops, Peter Jackson Plumbing, R-Line, Shoe Clinic, SignCraft Kāpiti, Speedy Signs Kāpiti-Porirua, Wellington Water Filters & Kāpiti Pure Water and Founder, Web Genius.

CAMPAIGN MANAGER:
Helene Judge | 027 244 9585

description:
Kāpiti Run for Youth 2026, Kāpiti Run for Youth 2026
We’ve checked the tide timetable – Anchor your calendar now to take part in the 2026 Web Genius Kāpiti Run for Youth on Sunday 29 March 2026 – Raising funds for rangatahi in Kāpiti since 2011 while having fun strolling or running along the beautiful Kāpiti coastline. Kāpiti Run for Youth is a lively, family-friendly event focused on fostering community spirit and supporting organisations that encourage and uplift local young people. RAIN or SHINE, get ready to have fun!

We know Kāpiti Run for Youth helps to support amazing community work done by local fundraising partners. We have 13 incredible fundraising partners you can choose to support and raise funds for. We are very proud of them all and the work they do to uplift the youth of Kāpiti. Each partner brings something unique to the table, from providing essential resources and mentorship to creating spaces where young people can thrive. By supporting rangatahi through education, creativity, employment, and well-being initiatives, they ensure our youth are not just supported but empowered to reach their full potential. Our partners are creating a brighter tomorrow for the young people of Kāpiti!

In the beginning Kāpiti Run for Youth was created by Web Genius as their way as a local business to ‘give back’ to the community so, more than a decade on we can proudly say the event is sustainable and is popular with all sorts, young and old, the fit and not so fit.
