description:
FLINT Wellington: Get to know a CxO, Ever wondered what it really takes to make it to the top? Join us for an evening of speed networking with some of Wellington’s most inspiring executives.
At Get to Know a CxO, you’ll have the chance to move around the room and chat one-on-one with a range of senior leaders. Expect candid conversations about their career journeys, lessons learned, and the moments that shaped their leadership.
This isn’t your typical panel event. It’s relaxed, interactive, and designed to help you connect directly with the people behind the titles. Whether you’re curious about leadership, thinking about your next move, or just love hearing great career stories, this event’s for you.
Come for the insights, stay for the connections ✨
📅 Wednesday 26 November, 5:30 PM
📍 Venue: KPMG - Level 6, 44 Bowen Street, Wellington
🎙️ Speakers: 
Anna Darling, GM People Experience at Sharesies
Phillip Whitmore, Partner - Digital at KPMG
Anna Mitchell, Executive General Manager, Frontier at Chorus
More to be announced!
Spots are limited, with FLINT members taking priority over non-members so register now to secure your spot!
We look forward to seeing you there.
_______________________
About FLINT
If you’re in the early stages of your career and you’re interested in digital technologies, come join the FLINT programme in your local city. We host events, webinars, podcasts and social catch ups that offer valuable networking, learning and growth opportunities. 
Find out more about the Wellington FLINT team here.
  Anna Mitchell, Executive General Manager, Frontier at Chorus
Anna is Executive General Manager, Frontier at Chorus, with accountabilities for fibre footprint growth, copper exit, property optimisation, and corporate affairs, as well as championing Chorus’ sustainability and digital equity ambitions. She brings broad expertise in telecommunications policy and leading strategic initiatives, with experience across both public and private sectors, including roles at Deloitte, SweeneyVesty, and as a senior advisor to a cabinet minister.
  Philip Whitmore, Partner, Cyber and Digital at KPMG
Philip is a Partner within KPMG Cyber with over 30 years’ experience across a broad range of cyber security disciplines. He has worked extensively in New Zealand, as well as throughout the wider Asia Pacific region.  His cyber security knowledge and experience is supported by his wider business consulting background, giving him the ability to readily translate cyber security risks into a business context. Philip’s experience saw him win the New Zealand Cyber Security Person of the Year award in 2023.
  Anna Darling, GM People Experience at Sharesies
Anna is an experienced HR leader with 15 years’ experience across the public and private sectors in New Zealand and the UK. Passionate about human-centred design, she focuses on creating meaningful employee experiences and driving diversity, equity, and inclusion. Anna is especially committed to increasing Māori and Pasifika representation in tech and expanding opportunities for underrepresented groups, drawing on her background in developing women’s rugby and promoting gender equity in sport in Aotearoa. She also serves on the Board of Nuku Ora and was part of the Sharesies team recognised as the Overall 2025 Best Place to Work in October.

description:
NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series- 2025 Round 4 - Faultline Wellington, Get your gains in the capital for the NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series grand finale. NiBS at Faultline in 2024 was the biggest climbing event ever in NZ so don’t miss out.
The NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series is all about having fun and giving it a go! Whether it’s your first climbing competition or you're a seasoned pro, you'll find challenges suited to your skill and confidence level, all within a friendly and supportive atmosphere.
Once the self-scored main rounds are done, the top 6 ranked female and male competitors in the open category advance to the finals. This is where the energy and music volume ramp up and we get to witness some incredible climbing from the best in the game.
Summary of Changes in 2025
- New online registration and scoring platform
- Scoring change, points awarded to each boulder divided by the number of successful tops
- Age group changes to reflect IFSC categories
- Finals format updated to 2025 IFSC Boulder rules
- Youth round (U11, U13, and U15 and caregivers) on Sunday morning
Please read the rules and info page below for more details on the changes: https://www.nibs.nz/rules-and-info
Don't forget to unleash your creative genius and set your own route using our amazing new logo! Try it here:
https://www.nibs.nz/routesetter

description:
Draw It Out - Parents of neurodivergent children block course, A unique space to support those who are supporting others.

Theme: For parents of neurodivergent children
Care for yourself so you can care for others, by processing emotions using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
Parenting can often feel isolating yet many are going through similar journeys. This 4-session block course is a safe space for parents of neurodivergent children to draw out their feelings, draw out their inner guidance, and draw on each other.

Dates
This block course consists of 4 workshops:
6.30pm-8.00pm
Thursday 13 November – Re-finding yourself
Thursday 20 November – Caring for your needs
Thursday 27 November - Self-compassion
Thursday 4 December – Seeing potential

Cost
$184 total ($46 per session)

Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.

About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz.

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
One New Zealand Warriors ANZAC Weekend, The One New Zealand Warriors and Sky Stadium are proud to invite you to the Ultimate Weekend Warriors Experience.
This exclusive experience will give the biggest Rugby League fans a unique opportunity to get closer to the action than ever before as the One New Zealand Warriors return to Sky Stadium on ANZAC weekend 2026. With a jam-packed schedule of behind-the-scenes access, enthralling events, and an epic showdown on the Saturday, it’s bound to be a weekend you won’t forget.
What’s Included:
Friday Night Welcome
Kick off the weekend with some of the biggest Warriors fans in the country! Start in the Warriors changing room, feel the hype build, and then emerge through the players tunnel with pyrotechnics, smoke, lights and music - experience entering Sky Stadium just as the teams themselves do. The entourage will then move up to Sky Stadiums’ premium lounges for snacks, a cash bar, and a Q&A from some legendary ex-Warriors.
Saturday Match Day Hospitality
Enjoy the Anzac Day match and entertainment with fellow Warriors fanatics from the comfort of one of our premium lounges. Included is a premium food offering, private seats with epic views and dedicated bar facilities.
Hosted by Warriors Legends
Throughout the weekend you’ll also be in the company of some of the Warriors greats. You’ll have ample opportunity to ask questions, get insights, tips and tricks, or hear a play by play of some of your favourite Warriors action moments straight from the source.
Exclusive Prizes
Be in to win some exclusive signed Warriors merchandise and other spot prizes over the course of the weekend as a cherry on top of a fantastic Ultimate Weekend Warriors Experience.
Don’t miss out! We expect tickets to go quick, so call up your mates and lock it in today.

description:
Porirua Parkrun, What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"

description:
Round 1 New Zealand Jetsprint Championship, Round 1 NZ Jetsprint Championship is back.

Love speed, the smell of methanol and the vibration of V8s then you won't want to miss the action of the V8 Jetsprints ... where high-speed adrenaline junkies make split-second decisions and hesitation could mean elevation (to an island or suspension in a fence that is!). Bring your family, bring a blanket and a picnic and be entertained by one of the fastest machines on the planet reaching speeds of 140km in under 2 seconds.

Watch as they navigate their way around the tight channels on the Kiwispan Jetsprint track which is about the size of a rugby field, all of the teams pushing hard for the ultimate glory of winning.

Food caravans will be an onsite, family-friendly event. Please no pets.

description:
Vorn and his Prog Consort, Vorn and his Prog Consort
Wellington legend Vorn Colgan has been writing and releasing extraordinary and odd popular music from bedrooms across Aotearoa and the world since 1999, a career which was scheduled to be cut short in 2019 by a terminal cancer diagnosis. 2023 saw him release his surprisingly non-posthumous hit The Late Album, and given his demonstrated inability to die he was left with maybe the world's most wonderful problem: what to record for his 10th album?

The answer is The Aeronaut, a 60ish minute meditation on Wellington, the universe, and everything, hewn from purest regionally-sourced prog rock and presented in a single baffling and hopefully pleasant serving. The Aeronaut is currently still a work in progress; this evening offers keen punters a chance to watch Vorn and his frighteningly good band (Nick Brown - Drums; Charley Davenport - Bass, Thomas Liggett - Violin) iron out the final kinks on a future Kiwi classic. Be there so you can say you were!

https://vornpowertool.bandcamp.com/


$17.50 presales available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

description:
Sealed Autocross - Round 3 - The Lost Duck, Neil's Wheels presents the continuation of our Autocross. With Winter now here, we're switching to Tarmac on the back half of the Masterton Drag strip. So no rain delays!
This is the final Round of a 3 Round Rubber Duck Series and is a WMSA Kim Naylor Round!
Online entries via Motorsport NZ and are open!
If you don't have a Motorsport NZ Login, get in touch and we'll be happy to help you out, nearer the event time we will upload a form you can fill out.
Treaded tyres only, so semi slicks are okay. No full slicks!
Helmet and overalls requirements haven't changed for events of this level. Just make sure you're wearing cotton or wool under it, and leather shoes please.
To avoid any refuelling rule headaches we suggest you bring your car with enough fuel already in it. There is a few choices of petrol stations close by in Masterton.
No competition licence required.
Car club membership required unless this is one of your first two events ever.
Please follow official guidance when travelling over the drag strip, and do so at low speed and maximum care when entering the track.
The pits are our usual spot on the grass. We are not to use the concrete pads.
$60 entry plus to possibility of some lunch provided. Will confirm nearer the day.

description:
September Shuffleboard Pairs Tournament, Come along to our monthly shuffleboard league!
Register here: https://www.meandoses.co.nz/shuffleboard
Shuffleboard pairs tournaments are 6pm to 9.30pm at the latest (usually earlier), the last Wednesday of each month.
Check out the league over at Challonge.com
https://challonge.com/communities/meanshuffle
Tournament Rules:
This is a double elimination format tournament. Teams must lose twice to be eliminated. Matches are played according to standard shuffleboard rules as can be read here:
https://www.theshufflehouse.com/.../how-to-play...
EXCEPT:
- There is a 10 MINUTE time limit each match.
- Matches are played FIRST TO TEN.
- In the event of a draw after the 10 minute time limit, a "Golden End" will be played. The winner of the Golden End wins the match.
- Pucks that do not pass the foul line are removed from play.
- The shuffleboard will be reset and resanded after each match.
- No sand will be added during a match.
- The final match is played first to 15 with no time limit - if time allows.
- Every "Hanger" is rewarded with a sweet treat!
PRIZES
1st place: $60 of Taproom Vouchers + 1st place ribbon + Your team name immortalised on the honours board
2nd place: $40 of Taproom Vouchers + 2nd place ribbon

I have sent PMs to everyone that commented in the chat that they were interested to confirm if they are attending or not. Please come back to me ASAP as I have a waiting list. If you are keen to go on the waiting list, please send me a PM so I can add you to the list.
The cost to hire the club is $200 so I will appreciate it if you can do a gold coin donation (or more if you are so inclined that we can give as tips to the bar staff) for every person that attends.
You can bring your own food/snacks for the game but all drinks are to be bought at the club. Knowing Peter (club manager), he will have a brandy and coke special again like last time. I will ask him for his latest drinks price list and post it here for you to see. Their prices are very reasonable.
Looking forward to seeing you all there in your best Bokke outfits as the warm up for the following weekend's game in Wellington!
As you may be aware, the Bokke will be playing two games in New Zealand in September. The first game will be in Auckland on 6 September and the second on 13 September right here in Wellington.
I have booked the Tawa Squash Club to watch the game on the 6th of September. Please mark the event as interested to get the notifications of what will be happening.

description:
NAWIC Wellington Annual Regional Meeting 2025, Join us at the NAWIC Wellington Annual Regional Meeting to show your support and share your ideas.
The current NAWIC Wellington Committee excited to welcome members to attend the Annual Regional Meeting (ARM) where we come together as a chapter to reflect on our achievements, discuss ongoing projects, and plan for the future. This meeting is a fantastic opportunity to connect with fellow members, share insights, and contribute to the growth and success of our organisation.
Along with the formalities we will review the past 12 months and look forward to the year ahead. We want to hear your feedback and discuss how you can contribute to the success of our organisation.
We are keen to hear from you if you:
Have an interest in joining the Committee
Have ideas for inspirational speakers or other types of events
Can offer access for site visits and/or venues for our events
Can give your time to represent NAWIC to speak at schools/career days
If you are unable to attend but interested in providing your feedback, you can contact us at rsvpwgtn@nawic.org.nz
DATE & TIME: 5:30pm, Tuesday 7 October
VENUE: TBIG, Level 13, 215 Lambton Quay
REGISTRATIONS: NAWIC members only, who can attend in person or online. Registration required.  Anyone is welcome to join NAWIC here
Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.

description:
TRC Tractors Manawatu Offroad Racing Championship, TRC Tractors Manawatu Offroad Racing Championship
Entry form is live:

Back again for 2025, the TRC Tractors Manawatu Offroad Racing Championship! This year, we are doing it a little differently - each class will take part in four heats as usual, but two of these will be 'Quick Fire Sprints' (5 laps) and two will be 'Super Sprints' (9 laps). That is over 40km of racing, for bugger all cost!
Entry fee: Adult Classes $50 / KiwiTrucks $30. Spectator entry by gold coin donation.
Be part of an action-packed day of short course racing at everyone's favourite offroad racing track!
This event gets bigger each year with drivers descending on Feilding from across the North Island. Will a local regain the title, or will another out-of-towner take it away in 2025?
One thing is for sure - you've got to be in it to win it!

description:
Te Ahumairangi Ten Thousand, Te Ahumairangi Ten Thousand is a fun opportunity for Wellington runners to work together in packs and support each other in running fast times and personal bests. It is also an opportunity for road or trail runners who have not run on the track before to try it out in a supportive environment.
Te Ahumairangi Ten Thousand is sponsored by Te Ahumairangi Investment Management. The race also serves as the Wellington 10,000m championship and the Wellington Masters 10000m championship.
Our indicative schedule for the evening:
6pm B Race (Provisionally, for athletes slower than 40 minutes)
7pm: 10000m relay (teams of up to 25 athletes plus one team manager)
8pm: A Race (Provisionally, for athletes faster than 40 minutes)
$10 entry subscription.
Please sign up to run even if you don’t want to run fast. It helps the runners who are targeting a personal best if they’re surrounded by friends and club members who are running alongside them.
Please let us know if you can help on the day. In particular, we want lap counters and pacers to support our runners (32 minutes, 35 minutes, 40 minutes, 45 minutes, 50 minutes, 55 Mins and 60 mins and other requested times).
Prizes
Top 5 Men and Women = $100 (1st) , $50 (2nd), $50 (3rd), $50 (4th), $50 (5th)
Age grade records = $100 for Wellington records and $400 for national age group records.
Spot prizes = 10 x $50
Fastest last lap = $100
Top club = $200 (5 + athletes to count, the club whose athletes are cumalitively closest to their seed time)
Commentators award = 3 x $100.
Relay = 25 x $10 Lifestyle Sports vouchers as prizes for the winning relay team.

description:
Toe the Line, Toe the Line
Welcome to Toe the line!

We are excited to announce that on 25 October 2025, we will be holding our first-ever Kickboxing Event at the Heretaunga College Sports hub.

This event marks the culmination of a 15-week fight camp that has involved a diverse group of our members – both adults and children – who have committed themselves to disciplined training, fitness, and personal growth. For many of them, this will be their first time stepping into the ring, and the event will be a proud moment not only for the participants, but also for their families, coaches, and the wider community.

Mark your calendars and spread the word - this is an event you won't want to miss. See you there!

This is a non-alcoholic event. Doors open 12:00 noon, first fight 12.30pm. Limited door sales.

description:
Hoarding Unpacked - Palmerston North, Variations of this training have been delivered across New Zealand and Australia since 2012. Each year the training is updated to include current research and trends within this very specialised field. Integral to this specialised training is the case examples and strategies that the facilitator has witnessed and used in her time working in the sector as a direct in-home support worker sustaining tenancies, a hoarding support group facilitator, a hoarding behaviour and strategist consultant for government bodies, and as a trainer developer and facilitator in this specialty field. Maire Barron the facilitator and developer of this training has over 20 years experience working in the human services field. Maire holds a Bachelors Degree in Social Sciences Majoring in Counselling among a plethora of other qualifications and trainings.
This training is aimed at a range of professions including but not limited to: housing and homelessness support workers, mental health, home care services, social workers, disability support, aged care, tenancy managers, cleaning services, council health and safety officers, fire safety services, child protection, animal rescue, and at times concerned family and friends have attended.
Course Outline:
Trauma informed approaches and considerations, DSMV addition and definition, statistics and characteristics, different types of hoarding, OH&S issues, at risk tenancies, children safety concerns, RSPCA, neighbours and council issues, strategies and examples for case coordination with multiple service providers, practical strategies for service users and therapeutic tools, real case examples used throughout to draw information from, links to helpful resources and websites, promotion of workers self-care and a focus on a reduction of vicarious trauma impacts.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Valiant Pro: Live @ The 162, Valiant Pro: Live @ The 162
Valiant Pro Wrestling returns to The 162 – September 27th!

New Zealand’s most consistent wrestling promotion is back at The 162 for another night of explosive, smash-mouth action you won’t want to miss! Valiant Pro continues to prove why it’s the best bang-for-your-buck entertainment anywhere in the country, delivering unforgettable moments for fans of all ages.

Fresh off the fallout from Valiant Pro: All Star Wrestling, tensions are higher than ever as rivalries explode and champions put everything on the line:
• Wellington Heritage Champion Pauly Spitfire defends his title and hometown pride.
• All Star Wrestling Champion “The Beast” Jade Priest brings chaos wherever he goes.
• Big Frank is on the hunt for revenge after being wronged at All Star Wrestling.
• Dev Kyro, Kyuss, and many more of New Zealand’s top wrestling stars will be in action!

Expect shocking twists, smash-mouth clashes, and the kind of electric atmosphere that only Valiant Pro Wrestling can deliver.

September 27th – The 162, Lower Hutt.

Be there live and witness why Valiant Pro Wrestling is the standard for professional wrestling in New Zealand!

description:
WHAC Presents: Honest 10 - 21 September 2025, WHAC Presents: Honest 10 - 21 September 2025
Join us at 8:30am on Sunday 21 September for the next edition of the Honest 10 taking in Wellington's beautiful waterfront. The Honest 10 is the perfect chance to test your 5km or 10km fitness and maybe have a go at walking or running PB.
EVERYONE IS WELCOME NO MATTER WHAT YOUR LEVEL OF FITNESS. The is an optional 8:15am early start for those who think they might need more time (eg over 70 mins for 10k)

Organised by WHAC, the Honest 10 provides a fast, fun and friendly environment. The race course has been officially measured and there will be pacers running 40min, 45min, 50min, 55min and 60min to help you run your best.

Cost: Just $10 for 10km, $5 for 5km!!

How to enter:
1. Pre-register by email (recommended) BEFORE 5PM on Saturday 20 Sept. Payment methods for pre-registrations include online bank transfer (an email with your reference will be sent back to you) or pay cash on the day.
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
Use "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"
OR
2. Sign up on the day from 8am (cash only).

Photos are free of charge and posted online (on the WHAC website) alongside results after the race. https://whac.org.nz/wp/honest-10/

Where: At the Whale's Tail next to Freyberg Pool, Oriental Bay

When: Registration from 8am. Race starts at 8:30am Sunday morning. Let us know when you register, if you request an early 8.15am start, eg if you are walking the 10km or are likely to run slower than 70mins.

***Pre-registration details***
Email the following details to BEFORE 5pm Saturday 20 Sept 🙂 You will receive a confirmation email back with your race number. If you select 'N' for prepaid, just bring cash to the race with you. If you select 'Y' for prepaid, pay via WHAC's bank account details below.
- Name
- Age
- 5km or 10km
- M, F or D (unfortunately we are currently unable to give age-calculated results for the gender-diverse (D) category, as our source currently only provides age-calculated result data for M and F)
- Phone number
- Prepay Y or N

BANK ACCOUNT DETAILS If you select "Y" for Prepay when you register via email, transfer your $10 entry fee (or $5 for 5k) to
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
using "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"

Looking forward to seeing you on Sunday 21 September :)
label: Sports & Fitness

description:
The "Other" Curriculum Roadshow - WELLINGTON, Multiple Choice: Wellington Screening and Education Discussion
Join the Aotearoa Educators Collective (AEC) for a pivotal evening of discussion focused on the future of education with colleagues in Wellington. We are proud to host a screening of the compelling documentary, Multiple Choice - see the trailer here.
This film explores the profound and often challenging impacts of high-stakes, standardised testing on students, teachers, and the entire education system. Following the screening, we will open up a vital conversation about how we assess, Curriculum reform, and celebrating what is great about what we are doing now in Aotearoa New Zealand.
Your Voice Matters
This event is a crucial opportunity for educators, policymakers, parents, and community members to engage directly with key issues shaping our local schools and kura. We aim to:
Spark informed discussion about the role of assessment and qualifications.
Reflect on the implications for the ongoing redevelopment of the New Zealand Curriculum, national testing, and NCEA.
Encourage collaboration across our sector to reimagine equitable, future-focused pathways for all learners.
The Event Plan
Come together for a social networking event and evening of insight, hosted at St Patrick’s College.
The event will include:
A screening of the documentary Multiple Choice (approx. 1 hour).
A dynamic DRAFT Panel Discussion featuring a mix of local and national leaders:
Panel Convenor - Mark Potter | Principal of Berhampore School
Ragne Maxwell | Principal of Porirua College
Lynda Knight | Principal of Glenview Primary School
An Audience Q&A to foster broad community dialogue.
This is your chance to connect with peers and contribute your perspective to the national conversation. Secure your spot today!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party (with free lesson), Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party (with free lesson)
🔥 Please note: the event is free but it can only continue if we support the Southern Cross by buying food or drinks 🔥


🌟 Wellington’s favourite monthly Bachata Latin dance party 🌟


Join us for an awesome mix of bachata, focusing on the best sensual tracks and remixes, along with salsa and a smattering of kizomba and zouk. We welcome everyone, from the absolute beginner to the most experienced dancer. We’re all about the joy of social dancing together.

And what makes a free party with great people even better? A free beginners’ bachata lesson with some of Wellington‘s best Latin dance teachers. If you’ve never danced bachata, Latin dance or even any other dance style before then this is the perfect lesson for you. We will have you dancing like a pro in no time!

Bailamos Bachata is hosted free of charge by the Southern Cross. They love the atmosphere we bring but we also need to support them in return. We’re asking everyone attending to purchase soft drinks, food or alcohol from the bar. It’s vital we show our gratitude.

1800-1830 social
1830-1900 free lesson
1900-2100 social

Q&A
Q. What is bachata?
A. Bachata is a popular and fun Latin couples dance. It started in the Dominican Republic, then travelled to Europe and the rest of the world. It now includes a wide range of music styles and dance influences and is still changing and evolving.

Q. I haven’t danced before, is that a problem?
A. Not at all! That’s exactly what the lesson is for – everyone has to start somewhere and we’re a very welcoming crowd for beginners.

Q. Is bachata a difficult dance to learn?
A. Its origins as a party/community dance mean the basics can be learnt quite quickly, so you’ll be enjoying yourself in no time.

Q. Who are the capital bachata collective?
A. We are the combined Wellington dance schools and people teaching bachata and we really want to share this dance with everyone. We love bachata, we love our community and we want to share it with you
￼
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
WellyForge#6, 10th Dec 2025 (Christmas Edition), Join us to help progress Wellington by bringing together science, tech & investors from across the city into an informal, fun and informative meet-up. The goal of the event is that you learn something new, meet someone new, have fun and we all start forging new paths ahead for Wellington.
Focus of the night is the KiwiNet award winners who are from Wellington. KiwiNet funds the commercialization of public research across 19 universities in NZ. So, your show will be:
1st Speaker: Dr Ben Mallett from the MacDiarmid and Robinson Research Institute (part of Victoria) who won the Breakthrough Innovator Award, and is a co-founder of JxB Space Systems.
Quickfire Speakers:
Maci Libby, Massey Design Graduate, founder of Wise Gear NZ, passionate about outdoor adventure
Suse Reynolds, KiwiNet Commercialization Icon Award Winner, and big start-up fan (investor & Director)
Lachlan Mead, Young Enterprise Scheme Award Winner, and founder of the Christmas Chaos card-game, yes, copies will be available!
2nd Speakers: Prof Rob Weinkove who leads the Malaghan Institute's CAR-T cell program which won the KiwiNet PwC Breakthrough Project Award, and John Robson CEO of BioOra, a spin-out from the Malaghan which recently raised $15m to accelerate roll-out of its cancer treatment.
The venue is bohemian bookstore, Undercurrent, a perfect venue for story telling but tickets are limited - so please reserve yours, but if you do end up not being able to come please return the ticket!
Join WellyForge
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Secure Development Training - September 2025, Have you been to a Kawaiicon and found yourself realising that you want to know more? Are you a curious developer who wants to know what happens if you prod a web application? Are you a QA looking to take the worst path possible through an app?
Maybe the PrivSec Secure Development Training is for you!
Agenda
The training is a one day course consisting of the following:
A detailed overview of the OWASP Top Ten Web Application vulnerabilities.
Multiple real world examples and case studies of exploited vulnerabilities.
Hands on experience exploiting these vulnerabilities on a custom web application
Techniques and tooling to identify and exploit these bug classes, using both source code analysis and dynamic testing techniques.
Remediation steps and techniques to mitigate and avoid these issues.
Outcomes
By the end of the day, you will have an understanding of tools and techniques used to compromise web applications and hands on experience in exploiting multiple vulnerabilities in the OWASP top ten.
About the Trainer
Training will be led by one of our Senior consultants, Jack Moran and supported by Sriram Jayaraman
Jack is a Senior Consultant at PrivSec Consulting. He has worked in the offensive security space for the better part of a decade, focusing on web and mobile application testing, along with code reviews and security configuration reviews. He has a number of CVEs credited to himself, and his enthusiasm towards security security is infectious.
Sriram is an ex-developer, turned security consultant. He has a strong background in web application penetration testing, along with code review. He has familiarity with several programming and scripting languages and frameworks such as Python, Javascript, PHP, Node.js, Angular and React.
Notes for the Day
Lunch and snacks will be provided. We will teach you how to hack.

description:
Sweat Reflect & Connect with Carolyn Patchell, Sweat – get those endorphins going!
Reflect – review our movements!
Connect – spend time with our classmates!
Sessions:
All Day 10.15am to 4pm $55
Morning 10.15am to 1pm $30
Afternoon 1.15pm to 4pm $30
Our day will start with a 30-minute Dance Fitness session that will include warm-ups but no cool down as we’ll head straight into a Tips and Tuition session. We’ll break down movements, go over cues and choreography, and look at how to increase or decrease intensity (or manage any injuries we might be carrying). We’ll take a break together and some healthy snacks will be provided along with hot drinks. We’ll then head into another Dance Fitness session where you can put your newfound knowledge to use (or just have some fun and party like it’s Friday night)! After a stretch and cooldown, we’ll do a bit of a wrap up over lunch (bring your own) and spend some time relaxing and chatting. Hot drinks will be available, or you can pop out if you need a barista made flat white!
If you’re not staying for the full day, we’ll say farewell after lunch and the rest of us will prepare to greet those coming in for the afternoon session.
The afternoon will start with a Strong Fit session which will contain elements of our Thursday night class. We’ll then move straight into a Tips and Tuition session which will look at all elements of our Strength Based Combo class. This will include form, technique, options, and how to maximise your weekly workouts. We’ll then take a break with some healthy (and easily digested) snacks before we power into a final Strong Fit session. Following the session, we’ll have a decent stretch and take the time to review what we’ve learned, chat amongst ourselves, and say farewell before our day concludes at 4pm.

This isn’t just about choreography — it’s also about embodying attitude, texture, and expression through movement that feels raw, connected, and alive.
Through isolations, foot work, and rhythm play, you’ll learn to bring hip hop’s strength and intention into Zouk’s softness and flow. We’ll explore how to shift energy, contrast smoothness with sharpness, and find your own unique flavour within the dance.
These concepts will be anchored in Zouk’s foundational movements, helping you integrate Hip Hop styling in a way that enhances connection, musicality, and body awareness.
This is an OPEN level deep dive, welcoming both newcomers and experienced dancers. Whether you’re looking to expand your styling or reconnect with your groove, this series invites you to move with rhythm, express with confidence, and dance with authentic flow.

description:
2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course, POCUS Fundamentals + EGLS
2 Days of Comprehensive POCUS education for Acute Care Clinicians
Take part in a flexible learning experience designed for real-world acute care:
Day 1: POCUS Fundamentals
Master the essentials – focus on AAA & eFAST.
Day 2: EGLS (Echo Guided Life Support)
Confidently assess and manage the shocked patient using focused cardiac and lung ultrasound.
Attend either day independently, or combine both for a complete acute care ultrasound experience.

Day 1 – POCUS Fundamentals
Focus on essential diagnostic ultrasound skills with Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA) & eFAST (extended Focused Assessment with Sonography in Trauma) modules. This is ideal for clinicians seeking to build confidence and competence in core applications that can be immediately applied in clinical practice.
https://www.emugs.org/pocusfundamentals
Day 2 – EGLS (Echo-Guided Life Support)
Take your resuscitation skills to the next level with EGLS. Learn a structured, protocolised approach to using cardiac and lung ultrasound in the assessment and management of shock and respiratory failure. This course is designed to empower acute care clinicians with the practical skills to make rapid, life-saving decisions.
https://www.emugs.org/egls
Combo of Fundamentals + EGLS - Whether you're new to ultrasound or looking to enhance your skills, this comprehensive two-day course  is ideal for acute care clinicians aiming to integrate POCUS into daily practice.
You'll cover the core emergency medicine ultrasound modules: FELS, eFAST, AAA, and lung. The course aligns with ACEM and ASUM credentialing requirements for core ultrasound modalities.
By the end, you'll be proficient in four essential techniques: focused echo in life support (FELS), extended FAST, aortic scanning, and lung/thoracic ultrasound.
The program includes online pre-course work, brief lectures, image review, hands-on scanning, and networking opportunities—all within a supportive learning environment.
Suitable for all experience levels:
ACEM trainees beginning their ultrasound journey
Acute care doctors looking to upskill
Clinicians in critical care, rural, and urgent care settings
Beginners will build a solid foundation; experienced users can refine skills with expert feedback

description:
Gingerbread House Masterclass for Two, Step into the magic of the season with Le Ciel’s Gingerbread House Masterclass for Two.

In this joyful, hands-on workshop, you and your partner will work together to build and decorate your very own festive gingerbread house. Our pastry chefs will guide you through every step — from assembling the spiced gingerbread walls to piping intricate icing details and adding those whimsical finishing touches.

Each station will be fully equipped with pre-baked gingerbread pieces, an array of colourful candies, royal icing, and everything you need to let your creativity shine. Sip on a comforting hot chocolate or mulled wine as holiday music fills the air, and create a show-stopping centrepiece to take home (if you can resist eating it first!).

Whether you’re looking for a fun date idea, a festive afternoon with a friend, or a family-friendly treat, this class is a perfect way to kick off the Christmas spirit.

$120 per pair | All materials included
Duration: 2 hours
Location: Le Ciel, 100 Tory street
Spaces are limited — book early to secure your spot for this festive favourite!

Includes:

Pre-baked gingerbread house pieces ready for assembly

Royal icing and a selection of edible decorations

A hot chocolate or mulled wine on arrival

Expert guidance from Le Ciel pastry chefs

A beautifully packaged gingerbread house to take home

Price: $120 per pair

description:
Spring Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop 12th October 2025, Join expert forager Felicity Joy of Wild Botanica for a comprehensive Wild Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop in the beautiful community gardens of Mount Victoria, Wellington.
This inspiring experience will open your eyes to the abundance of edible wild plants growing right under your nose.
We’ll unlock the secrets of foraging, connecting with the land, and turning humble "weeds" into delicious, nourishing food. You’ll gain confidence in identifying common edible plants, learn their botanical names, and understand their medicinal and nutritional benefits. We’ll also explore ethical foraging practices, how to spot toxic lookalikes, and share simple, practical ways to incorporate wild foods into your daily meals.
This isn’t just about food: it’s about sustainability, resilience, and reconnecting with the environment in a meaningful way. You'll leave with a deeper appreciation for the land, new skills to support local food security, and the knowledge to make your own simple meals from wild ingredients.
Class sizes are limited, so book early to secure your spot.
For more details and bookings, visit
www.wildbotanica.co.nz
follow @wild.botanica.nz on social media.
For questions, email felicity@wildbotanica.co.nz.
Join my email newsletter to hear about upcoming foraging workshops: https://www.wildbotanica.co.nz/pages/newsletter

description:
Painting in Oils, This class is open to all levels of students interested in exploring the possibilities of this traditional medium. The main exercises will be based on a still life, however students are free to explore subjects of their choice.

This course focuses on the technique of oil painting. You will learn to

- Choose a colour palette
- Choose and prepare supports on which to paint on with oils
- Create a composition according to the subject selected
- Learn how to render volume and form
- Learn expressive qualities of colour and brushwork
- Students will also learn to stretch their own canvas

If you want to explore the possibilities of painting in oils then this is the course for you.

Tuesday mornings 10 am - 1 pm, 14 October - 2 December.

Basic materials are included.

description:
The Cowpokers + Tyson Smith, THE COWPOKERS: Foot-tappin' Onekaka Swamp Rock, World Famous in Golden Bay!

Golden Bay's finest local boys are rounding up and riding North to bring their unique brand of rock, blues and ska to the capital. What if swamp rock wasn't born in Louisiana, but in Takaka you ask? What if Iggy Pop and the Stooges had been Marlborough dairy farmers? What if Hendrix had settled in a Tukurua art gallery selling homemade jewellery crafted from shells and bone? The answer to all these questions and more can be found at a Cowpokers gig: a raw, barn-storming, rural-rock-and-roll sensation that 23 years of gigging has utterly failed to hone, polish, or refine.

TYSON SMITH: Wellington-based guitarist/singer/songwriter Tyson Smith will be bringing his unique, original music combining elements of rock, blues, folk, world music and freeform improvisation.

Tyson has worked as a guitarist with acts ranging from the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra to vocalist Hollie Smith, before focusing on his own music in the last few years.
In 2024 he celebrated 10 years since the release of his album The Hollow Tree with Rick Cranson and Ed Zuccollo, and released his new single Wolves. Tyson has been performing regularly around various New Zealand venues and festivals with his raw and exciting sound both with the trio and solo (utilising multiple amps and a bass drum).

description:
Serenades Across Cultures, Join Lala Simpson (vocals), Dayle Anderson (piano), Richard Hardie on double bass, and Jonathan Berkahn (accordion) for an enchanting evening of music, where the soulful melodies of French chanson legends like Edith Piaf and Jacques Brel blend seamlessly with the haunting rhythms of Malagasy icons such as Bessa and Fanja Andriamanantena. Be serenaded by heartfelt songs of love, loss, and romance—an unforgettable night of timeless classics that capture the essence of passion and longing.

Join Us for an Unforgettable Concert Experience – A Night of Music with a Heartfelt Purpose!

Last year, as part of our Cultural Immersion Tour, I had the profound privilege of visiting Mamitiana Orphanage in Madagascar, alongside Stuart Simpson, Rose Ruane, and my nieces and nephews. Located on the eastern side of Antananarivo, the capital, the orphanage was founded by the incredible Madame Hary in 2012. What started as a humble project from her own home has grown into a haven for 54 children, some of whom were rescued from areas where twins are sadly believed to be cursed.

Despite the challenges, the orphanage continues to thrive, relying entirely on the kindness of visitors. They grow their own rice, maintain a small chicken farm, and have a vegetable garden to sustain themselves. But their greatest need is for ongoing support and resources to continue providing for these beautiful children.

By attending our concert, you’ll be helping make a direct impact on the lives of these children. All profits from this concert will go toward completing the construction of a much-needed training center and extra bedrooms at Mamitiana Orphanage in Madagascar, helping provide valuable education and support to the children in their care. In May this year, we raised over $4000 at a fundraising concert and $1700 on Givealittle. Help us raise $2500 more so they can finish the building before the arrival of the rainy season.

description:
Brynzilian Big Band - Wellington Jazz Festival, Brynzilian Big Band - Wellington Jazz Festival
The Brynzilian Big Band is a 17-piece powerhouse jazz orchestra founded and led by saxophonist Bryn van Vliet.

Based in Wellington, Bryn is a multi-disciplinary artist known for his dynamic career as an instrumentalist (saxophone, woodwinds, vocals), performer, composer, arranger, and educator.

As a founding member of TOI and former lead alto saxophonist for the Rodger Fox Big Band, he has earned a reputation as a versatile and sought-after musician.

The Brynzilian Big Band presents fresh, vibrant compositions inspired by iconic Brazilian music styles such as Samba, Bossa Nova, and Forró. Bryn’s writing reflects his deep affection for
Brazilian music, while honoring its traditional roots and spirit.

Featuring 17 of Wellington’s finest musicians, the Brynzilian Big Band promises a performance that will make you dance,
laugh, shout, cry — and maybe even hug your neighbour.

description:
Earth Tongue, Fresh off the announcement of their forthcoming third album Dungeon Vision, Aotearoa’s heavy-psych duo Earth Tongue return home this February for a run of six exclusive shows across the country. The tour comes off the back of the band’s whirlwind international touring cycle and gives fans the earliest chance to hear brand-new material. 
The first show lands on the day of Dungeon Vision’s release, playing at the Turner Centre, Kerikeri on Friday 13 February. They’ll follow that up in Auckland’s Double Whammy on Saturday 14 February and then Last Place, Hamilton on Sunday 15 February. The duo then travel south for a run in Dunedin at Pearl Diver on Thursday 19 February, Space Academy in Christchurch on Friday 20 February before heading to Wellington on Saturday 21 February to finish the tour at the iconic San Fran. 
Guitarist Gussie Larkin and drummer Ezra Simmons have been based in Berlin, writing and recording Dungeon Vision with Los Angeles garage-rock icon Ty Segall who together have captured Earth Tongue’s most immersive and ambitious work yet. With anticipation building after unveiling their towering title track ‘Dungeon Vision’ and its handcrafted, cinematic music video - Earth Tongue edge fans toward a set of shows which bring a fully realised Dungeon Vision experience.  
Earth Tongue - Dungeon Vision (Official Music Video)
With their world-building aesthetic, relentless energy and cemented spot as one of our most electrifying psych-rock acts, Earth Tongue are sure to provide an unforgettable show - celebrating the release of their most visionary record to date. Don’t miss them playing in Aotearoa this February.

description:
Star Time Live @ Meow, Star Time Live @ Meow
Wellington's own 10 piece Afrobeat Jazz powerhouse, Star Time, have been setting the city's dancefloors on fire since their debut at the WLG Jazz Festival in 2024. They have just come fresh out of the studio where they finalised their debut album, to be released later this year.

Star Time’s contagious on-stage energy and personality quirks tend to leave audience members stunned and begging for more, not to mention the urge to dance at their shows is stronger than life itself.

Rhythms hit like fireworks, locking hips and feet into motion whether you planned to move or not. Anyone who has been to a Star Time show can attest: the true stars of the night are undeniably the audience. The sheer levels of energy and uninhibited dance are nothing short of cinematic. The collective passion of the audience becomes an integral, unforgettable part of the band's Afrobeat Jazz experience.

Star Time is an all new emergence of fellow musicians from all around the country, linking with the experiences of fellow African musicians Francois Judah (lead vocals) and Modi Shemmi (percussion).

description:
Traskforce! Ft. Wallace Gollan And Eugene Wolfin, Two of Wellington’s most enthralling vocalists perform with a powerhouse octet in a celebration of the sublime songs of the jazz repertoire.

Starring Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin on vocals, the octet will present a fizzing set of big band swing, Broadway hits, and gorgeous ballads. Hear the fine lyricism of the 20th century sung by two of Wellington’s most exciting performers.

Exhilarating original compositions and arrangements will tug at your feelings in new and compelling ways. Daring solos from some of the finest musicians in the country will awe and shock you as the turbulent horns sing out.

Witness the union of big band attitude and chamber music intimacy as this very special band play their hearts out to you.

The performers:
Consistently connecting the dots between genres and influences, Wallace Gollan’s artistic identity has become uniquely recognizable, with her jazz training and distinct harmonies captivating audiences around the globe.

For the last 8 years vocalist Eugene Wolfin has been a regular of Wellington music scene performing in a wide variety of genres including Jazz, Blues, and Rock ’n’ Roll. He has had a hand in a few local Musical Theatre productions performing lead roles in ‘Chess’ and the modern hit ‘If/Then', and is a regular in front of Jazz Orchestras including the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band and the Rodger Fox Big Band.

Traskforce! is bandleader Alex Trask’s most swinging musical organisation. They play fresh arrangements of original compositions, classic swing, and Broadway love songs. This includes songs from the Basie repertoire, Bob Mintzer, Oliver Nelson, Quincey Jones, and Lionel Bart's Oliver! to name a few. The five horn arrangements allow for the power of a big band and the subtlety of a quartet to shine side by side. The band is made up of Wellington’s top players, including members of the Rodger Rox Big Band, the RNZAF band, NZSM faculty, and rising stars.

Personnel:
Wallace Gollan – vocals
Eugene Wolfin – vocals
Alex Trask – alto saxophone, arrangements
Mike Taylor – trumpet
Oscar Laven – tenor saxophone
Kaito Walley – trombone
Daniel Yeabsley – baritone saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
John Rae – drums

description:
Tony Lindsay (USA) with Stirling Hern, Tony Lindsay is a GRAMMY award-winning vocalist and was the lead singer for Carlos Santana. He performed with Santana during their most successful period, from 1995 to 2015, including singing on the 30m-seller, Supernatural.
Lindsay has also performed with many other world-leading acts including Steve Winwood, Al Jarreau, and Aretha Franklin.
“We know and we revere Donny Hathaway, Stevie Wonder and Ray Charles. Tony Lindsay is on par with all three of those,” says GRAMMY-winning producer Narada Michael Walden.
Local Wellington favourites Stirling Hern, provide the backing, featuring Michael Stirling (guitar and vocals), Geoffrey Hern (bass and vocals), Deane Hunter (guitar), and Andrew Richardson (drums) with special guests Andre Paris (saxophone), and Damian Forlong (trombone).
This is a one-off chance to get up close to a world-class vocalist, and multi-million selling artist.
Do not miss this one.

description:
Jazz Festival: Free Status, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Free Status is a jazz fusion band, drawing melodic inspiration from iconic artists like Herbie Hancock and 70s jazz/funk legends with electronic flair inspired by artists like Moby.

At the heart of Free Status is Tommy David on keys, an accomplished musician/composer in the early stages of his career. He has earned recognition in numerous jazz competitions and supported legendary rock acts such as Dire Straits Legacy Band, Nazareth, Hello Sailor, and plays with popular rockabilly band, Recliner Rockers. With composition at the center of his artistry, he can't wait to share the exciting and genuine compositions he has created.

The rhythm section features Behzad Karakia (drums) and Tyler Diprose (bass), both veterans of performances with many of New Zealand's jazz greats.

On lead alto sax is James Dawes, recently selected for an international touring band on a year-long cruise. His versatility extends well beyond jazz.

On keys is Sam Voyle, whose primary instrument is tenor saxophone. Performing with Tommy since their school days, he has built a strong musical bond that has led to major appearances, including the America's Cup main stage and high-profile corporate events.

On vocals is Melody Lui-Webster, an award-winning singer and accomplished musical theatre performer and actor, with numerous professional stage and television roles.

Thank you for watching!

description:
Air Force in Concert Featuring Hollie Smith, The Royal New Zealand Air Force (RNZAF) Band is set to blast some big sounds in November. The Wellington-based band joins forces with New Zealand soul singer Hollie Smith. Together, they will take over the Michael Fowler Centre with a diverse repertoire. The RNZAF Band will perform hits from symphonic masterworks and marches to jazz standards and pop classics. Hollie will shine with several of her own famous soul songs. 
Hollie Smith is a prodigious songwriter. She has three number-one solo albums and an abundance of awards under her belt. Fat Freddy’s Drop, Trinity Roots, Anika Moa, and Boh Runga are just a few of her many collaborators. 
The RNZAF Band is a reserve force military band. It regularly welcomes dignitaries at Government House and Parliament, and provides music for commemorations at Pukeahu National War Memorial. Many of its members perform in the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Orchestra Wellington, Shapeshifter, and the Rodger Fox Big Band.
Tickets available to the public from 8am on Monday, 8 September.

description:
Hihi and The Stitchbirds at Wellington Bluegrass Society, Hihi and The Stitchbirds are going from strength to strength. The songwriting is flowing and evolving, new instruments are being acquired, and the band are excited for what might happen next. After a packed out EP launch last year for their EP On A Good Day, they are thrilled to be returning to Wellington Bluegrass Society at Abandoned Petone on Saturday 1st November. Their next dream is to record a full album of their original songs - perhaps on another good day in Wellington!

Hihi and The Stitchbirds are: Elena Saunders - vocals and vibes, Chris Goldsbury - guitar, clarinet and vocals, Tessa Luff - guitar, banjo ukulele and vocals, Matt Hutton - bass ukulele and vocals, and Ellie Stewart - fiddle and vocals.

Two acts will also perform on the night. First is Tessa Luff, who is the main song-writing powerhouse behind Hihi and The Stitchbirds. With natural musicality pulsing through her veins, Tessa experiments with melody and rhythm and brings an ethereal mix of life’s raw highs and lows to her songwriting. For the very first time she will perform her works solo and the audience are in for a rare treat.

Second are The Elderflower Experiment, a charming trio of singer-songwriters priding themselves in story-telling through song. They combine tight vocal harmonies with folk inspired strings, to take you on journeys of love and loss and the spaces in between.

The Elderflower Experiment are:
Tessa Luff - vocals and guitar, Ellie Stewart - vocals and fiddle, and Elena Saunders - vocals and vibes.

description:
Next week! Dying Fetus + 200 Stab Wounds + Organectomy - Wellington - San Fran, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗴𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁𝘀 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦
𝗔𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻 & 𝗡𝗲𝘄 𝗭𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗧𝗼𝘂𝗿, 𝗗𝗲𝗰 𝟱 – 𝟭𝟰, 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱

Armed with undeniably some of the heaviest riffs known to mankind, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 has established a reputation for uncompromising integrity with a slew of classic albums and today rides a resurgence of respect and esteem with a new generation. The band continually refines its unique take on death, grind, and hardcore with a combination of virtuosity and ferocity, inescapably catchy hooks, punishing breakdowns and a complete lack of pretension.
After 12 horribly long years since their last tour in Australia and in only their second appearance in New Zealand since 2009, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 are well overdue to lash us unmercifully with their savage beatdowns and earth-moving grooves and grunt, equally designed to pulverize and mesmerize.
On their first slog into the antipodes, Cleveland death metal legends-in-waiting 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦 serve up a brutal slab of old school death metal with a contemporary edge. Not for the faint-hearted, 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦 craft classic gore-themed savagery for themselves and like-minded brethren: thrill-seekers, carnage cravers, horror fans, and aficionados of the most extreme of metal.
Warming up the circle pits and necks will be the slamming sonic signature of ORGANECTOMY in New Zealand and the old-school death metal grit and punishing ferocity of ASHEN in Australia.
www.facebook.com/DyingFetus

www.facebook.com/200StabWounds

www.facebook.com/organectomynz

www.facebook.com/ashendeath

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Callum Allardice, The eleventh concert in our series of Aotearoa jazz composers features award winning composer and performer Callum Allardice, with a new suite of music for rhythm section and strings; Ode to Sadness.

A collection of songs, old and new, presented alongside some of the works that inspired them. From intimate improvisations and poignant melodies to soaring strings, the music moves through moments of reverence, reflection, and quiet triumph. Sometimes solemn, sometimes radiant, but always beautiful, Ode To Sadness is a celebration of the beauty found in sorrow.

Callum is an award-winning composer and guitarist based in New Zealand. He is a three-time recipient of the APRA Best Jazz Composition award for his works ‘Sons of Thunder’ (2016), ‘Deep Thought’ (2017), and ‘Chungin’ (2019). In 2020 he and his group The Jac, received the Recorded Music NZ Best Jazz Artist award for their album ‘A Gathering’, and in 2022 he was the inaugural Te Kōkī - New Zealand School of Music jazz composer-in-residence.

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Funky Fridays Vol.8 - Not My Sister, K-otik, Kimba Jade, Stolen Tuesday, Funky Fridays Vol.8 - Not My Sister, K-otik, Kimba Jade, Stolen Tuesday
We're back for another night of house, techno, disco, bass & more at Moon with Funky Fridays Vol. 8!
Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene, Funky Friday is more than just a night out, it’s a space for music lovers, dancers, and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. Each edition features a rotating lineup of talented DJs, both local and international, ensuring a fresh and unique experience every time.
Come with an open mind and leave with tired feet.
This edition features legends Stolen Tuesday, Kimba Jade, K-otik and Not My Sister
$10 presales available now via UTR, or $15 on the door.

Times:
9-10 Not My Sister
10-11 Stolen Tuesday
11-12 Kimba Jade
12.1 K-otik
1-2 Not My Sister
-------------------------------------------------------

NOT MY SISTER
Hailing from Italy and rooted in Wellington’s vibrant scene, Not My Sister burst onto the scene in 2024 and has quickly become one of Aotearoa’s most exciting rising DJs. In such a short time, she’s already lit up dance floors across the country, playing at festivals like Twisted Frequency, CubaDupa, Taniwha’s Den, and supporting international acts such as KC Lights.

She also holds a radio residency at Wellington’s iconic Radio Active, where her show dives deep into the world of house and underground sounds.

Heavily influenced by funk and disco, and driven by a love for vocals and all things groovy, Not My Sister delivers high-energy, uplifting sets full of passion and playfulness. She weaves together melodic basslines with soulful, tech, garage, and deep house elements, always keeping the crowd moving.

SoundCloud: www.soundcloud.com/not-my-sister
Facebook: www.facebook.com/notmysista
Instagram: www.instagram.com/not.my.sister
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@not.my.sister

STOLEN TUESDAY
Stolen Tuesday started life as a house music club dancer in the UK 20 years
ago, and has spent the last 10 years DJing at Wanaka and Queenstown's best
establishments, bringing her unique energy to create magical dance floors.
Since residing in New Zealand, she has previously split her time living between Great Barrier island and Wanaka, spreading the love through her weekly radio shows on Wanaka Beats and Aotea FM. Not shy of the underground scene, you will also find Stolen Tuesday getting down off grid and playing at bush doofs.
Best known for dropping all things bassy which exude an element of fun matching her own high energy, guest appearances on Base FM (Auckland) alongside well known Auckland DJs have helped showcase her enthusiasm and talent.
With a style ranging from glitter box style disco and funk, to dirty after hours Tech House and all things in between, including the occasional breaks/ghetto funk set, it’s no surprise that She has been a regular on the South Island festival scene where she has been happy warming up or playing after notable international artists. She has also played at Otherlanz and remotely at Great Barrier Island’s new Wingman festival.

Stolen Tuesday now resides in Wellington and whilst fairly new to the city has already played several times for both the 'Open air' brand at Carlucci land and with Wellington renowned 'Little monsters' notably shaking things up at this year's Newtown festival.
Although not one to take herself too seriously, Stolen Tuesday knows it all comes down to the music and having a good time!

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/user-720686581

KIMBA JADE
Kimba Jade has been lighting up dancefloors for over 20 years with her signature blend of deep, funky, and globally inspired grooves. A master of musical journeying, she weaves bass-driven beats with tribal, melodic, and soulful sounds that move both body and spirit.

With a deep passion for Ecstatic Dance and the power of music to connect and uplift, Kimba brings that same vibrant energy into clubs and bars. Her sets fuse Tech House, Indie Dance, and Techno, blending driving rhythms with emotive melodies to create an atmosphere that’s both immersive and electric.

After years in Sydney and Auckland’s underground scenes, Kimba now calls Wellington home—bringing her unique mix of rhythm, soul, and bass to local dance floors.

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/kimba
Facebook: www.facebook.com/kimbadj/
Instangram: @djkimbajade

K-OTIK
Based in Wellington, New Zealand, K-otiK is a multi-genre DJ. His sound spans house, tech house, bass house, and techno — laced with heavy vocals and thumping basslines. With a cheeky stage presence and high energy behind the decks, K-otiK takes crowds on journeys that balance careful curation with unexpected twists. A regular on RadioActive FM and part of Wellington’s Open Air collective, he’s built a reputation for spreading joy through music. For K-otiK, music does not discriminate — it’s the universal language that brings people together.

Instangram: @dj_kotik_nz

description:
This week! Pig Destroyer + Glassblower + Post Natal Abortion- Wellington - San Fran, PIG DESTROYER Australian & New Zealand Tour
September 2nd – 14th, 2025
with guests WORMROT – Australia only
Sept 2nd – Perth, Amplifier Bar w/ Bile Cannon, Allocer*
Sept 4th – Adelaide, Lion Arts Factory w/ Meth Leppard
Sept 5th – Melbourne, Max Watts w/ Tongue Scum
Sept 6th – Sydney, The Factory Theatre w/ Crown Street Militia
Sept 7th – Canberra, The Baso w/ Blight Worms
Sept 9th – Brisbane, The Triffid w/ Awful Noise
Sept 10th – Townsville, The Warehouse w/ Varrim*
Sept 12th – Auckland, Galatos w/ Imperial Slave, Sawnoff*
Sept 13th – Christchurch, Loons w/ Vixen Execution, Unyielding Desolation*
Sept 14th – Wellington, San Fran w/ Glassblower, Post Natal Abortion*
*Wormrot not appearing in Perth, Townsville or NZ
TICKETS ON SALE at:
PERTH, MELBOURNE, CANBERRA, TOWNSVILLE – www.oztix.com.au
ADELAIDE, SYDNEY, BRISBANE - www.moshtix.com.au
AUCKLAND - https://galatos.co.nz
CHRISTCHURCH - www.undertheradar.co.nz
WELLINGTON - https://moshtix.co.nz
PIG DESTROYER boil metal down to its muscle, sinew, and bone - razor-sharp guitar, percussive pummelling, and a lone, stark howl - and use them to commit a vicious assault. The lyrics paint loathsome, frightening images of pitch-black self-hatred and the frailty of the human experience. These musical manifestations only serve to cement their already legendary status. Having not been in Australia and New Zealand since 2008, PIG DESTROYER’s long overwaited return has just one goal. To unnerve the unprepared with a deranged, grisly intensity which very few, if any, can match.
Recently reforming to the original line-up, Singapore’s WORMROT resume their genius in unleashing exquisite noise together, with the announcement of a new album 'TNT'. Grinding faces with the best of them, their performances are intense, spectacular, furious, with a barrage of unrelenting, head-caving abuse, honed by a singular determination to destroy the competition.
www.facebook.com/TheRealPigDestroyer

description:
Donál Gunning, Every Wednesday, come down to Moon for FREE live music from 6.30pm, all pizzas $15 from 5.30-9pm

Dónal Gunning is a singer songwriter from Dublin, Ireland. He draws on rock, folk, indie and punk influences.

Now based in Wellington, New Zealand his debut solo single Homesick released in October 2023. Homesick is a song dedicated to the masses who have emigrated their motherland for opportunity and adventure. It tells the story of the struggle in leaving friends and family.

His debut EP Born to Perform released in May 2024. The EP was inspired and written while travelling New Zealand, Portugal and Ireland.

Donal has released two singles in 2025 Your 1 & Losing Weight both of which have received tremendous praise globally. He is set to release a second EP later this year. He knows how to work the crowd and always brings fun, energy and Irish charm through his thought-provoking lyrics and formative sound

description:
NO CIGAR - Under The Surface Tour | Wellington, Eccles Entertainment Presents:
NO CIGAR - Under The Surface Tour
Fri 7 Nov | Meow Nui, Wellington
Sat 8 Nov | Ngaio Marsh Theatre, Christchurch
Fri 14 Nov | Powerstation, Auckland
Ticketing Presales: 12pm, Thu 19 June
General Public On Sale: 12pm, Mon 23 June
Tickets - www.nocigar.co.nz/pages/shows
-------------
Breakout Aotearoa five-piece NO CIGAR have announced a three-date tour across New Zealand this November, in celebration of their highly anticipated third studio album Under the Surface, due for release July 30th.
Since forming in 2019, NO CIGAR have built a fiercely loyal fanbase across Aotearoa and beyond, carving out a unique niche that blends elements of indie, surf, and alternative rock. Their upcoming album is crafted for the stage — shaped by the band’s dynamic chemistry and a deep connection with their audience.
NO CIGAR’s 2023 sophomore album The Great Escape spent more than 74 consecutive weeks on the NZ Top 20 Albums Chart and featured the breakout hit “Concubine,” voted the 10th best rock song of 2024 by listeners of The Rock FM.
Their past tours across NZ, Australia and the UK have consistently sold out, driven by a word-of-mouth buzz and a reputation for electric, unforgettable performances. This tour will host their biggest headline shows on home soil to date and are not to be missed!

description:
Elton John vs Billy Joel *NZ Tribute* Petone Club, NZ’s Award-winning hit tribute show “Elton John vs. Billy Joel” are coming to perform an intimate show at the Petone Club Udy Street as part of their NZ-WIDE TOUR!

Doors 7pm , show starts 7.30pm sharp

After wildly successful sell-out shows across New Zealand, join Cam and Sam for an intimate night out as they wow audiences both young and old performing the greatest hits of Elton John and Billy Joel LIVE! Piano Man, Rocket Man, Uptown Girl, Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, We didn’t start the fire, Bennie and the Jets, She’s always a woman, Crocodile Rock and many many more.

Your favourite Elton and Billy songs are in safe hands with Cam and Sam, these professional touring NZ musicians have performed on live national television, commercial radio and featured in the NZ Music Charts in careers spanning two decades. This amazing Piano Man extravaganza features astonishing costumes, two grand pianos in black and white, plus plenty of banter and all the songs you love.

Let's face it, Elton John and Billy Joel require little introduction, their music has provided a soundtrack for generations of loving fans. Englishman Sir Elton John has sold over 300 million records, making him one of the best-selling music artists of all time. He has more than fifty Top 40 hits on the UK Singles Chart and US Billboard Hot 100, including seven number-ones in the UK and nine in the US, as well as seven consecutive number-one albums in the US.

American Billy Joel has sold more than 150 million records and ranks as one of the most popular recording artists and respected entertainers in the world. Joel has had 33 Top 40 hits and 23 Grammy nominations. In 1999 he was inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame and has received the Recording Industry Association of America Diamond Award, presented for albums that have sold over 10 million copies.

description:
Capital Blues Presents: Jamie and the Numbers, Jamie and the Numbers are a Wellington soul‑funk outfit fronted by powerhouse vocalist Jamie Musuvā.
What began as a one‑off recording project quickly grew into a passion for Northern Soul, funk, and inventive covers, all delivered in their own unapologetically loud and soulful style. The band mixes original songs with cleverly re‑imagined classics, drawing praise for their debut album and earning airplay across New Zealand and even the BBC. With Jamie’s voice and a tight line‑up featuring Elliott Fuimaono and the Lerwill brothers, their live shows are renowned for energy, groove, and connection. Collaborations with producer Lee Prebble at The Surgery Studios and releases through Deltaphonic Records have cemented their reputation as one of Wellington’s most compelling soul‑funk acts.
It’s hard to describe how good this band is. You will just have to come and find out.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
David & Shimna @ Newlands, This dynamic guitar & violin duo are re-united for a series of sizzling shows across New Zealand in 2026. Shimna will be back from Belfast, Northern Ireland & this tour marks a special reunion, a chance to bring their close harmonies, infectious fun vibes, and exquisite guitar and fiddle playing back home to New Zealand where it all began!
Seated Show
Intimate Setting
Cheaper $15 tickets for under 18s
Saturday 28th March at Kingston House
Doors open from 6:30pm / show starts at 7pm (8:45pm finish).
Tickets are VERY limited - don't miss out!
What people are saying:
“Seriously sublime stringwork. World-class melodies.”
“Amazingly written and performed piece that kept me glued through to the end.”
“Great guitar riffs and performance – your two voices are so nice together.”
"OMG I love you guys"
David & Shimna are an acoustic guitar and violin duo whose music has been described as “absolutely beautiful… perfectly played… fragile yet powerful.” Their sound blends intricate guitar work, lyrical fiddle, and close vocal harmonies into a powerful yet vulnerable experience for all present.
David is based in Auckland, while Shimna has been living in Belfast, Northern Ireland since March 2025. This tour marks a special reunion, a chance to bring their music back home to New Zealand and share it in the way it’s meant to be heard: up close and personal in a town near you.
This summer, they’ll be touring small halls and community spaces across Aotearoa, bringing their songs to places most musicians don’t usually go. Each evening is an invitation: a night of stories, connection, and an experience intended to stay with you long after the music has ended.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Shaun Kirk | Live @ Le Cafe - Picton, NZ (Less than 30 tickets left!), Shaun Kirk | Live @ Le Cafe - Picton, NZ (Less than 30 tickets left!)
🚨LESS THAN 30 TICKETS REMAINING!🚨

More info & tickets >>> https://bit.ly/41W7UR4

With special guest: Nick Herbison

Hailing from the music-filled streets of Melbourne, Australia, Shaun Kirk is an award-winning blues and soul troubadour recognized for his exceptional talent as a born entertainer. His unique talent has not only earned him many accolades but also much praise from fellow artists, such as three-time Grammy Award Winner Fantastic Negrito, who has declared his show as "One of the best one-man shows he’s ever seen!"

Kirk's vocals exude a gritty, soulful depth that seems to transcend far beyond his years, with critics continually acclaiming him as "one of the finest blues voices Australia has ever heard" (Buzz Mag). Complementing his vocal artistry, Kirk's vintage guitar tones and raw grooves pay tribute to the timeless influences that have shaped his musical journey, resulting in a distinctive sound fast becoming his own.

Shaun’s musical journey has taken him to stages all over the world, where he's not only performed but consistently sold out shows, leaving audiences enthralled by his magnetic presence. From iconic festival stages like Bluesfest Byron Bay, where he's become a familiar name, to sharing the billing with legends like Robert Plant of Led Zeppelin, John Mayer, Paolo Nutini, John Butler Trio, and The Teskey Brothers; Kirk's artistic prowess is in esteemed company. Moreover, he's also had the honour of opening for household names such as blues maestro Joe Bonamassa, soul sensation Allen Stone, and the indomitable Beth Hart; further solidifying his place in the landscape of contemporary music. This remarkable journey is a testament to Kirk's unmatched talent and ability to connect with audiences across genres and generations.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Bunnings Halloween Family Night, This Halloween, Bunnings is inviting families across New Zealand to enjoy a safe, inclusive and delightfully spooky evening at their local Bunnings. On Thursday 30 October from 5:00pm to 7:00pm, stores nationwide will come alive with free Halloween festivities, including DIY workshops, face-painting and tasty treats.

Kids DIY areas across New Zealand will come alive with decorations from Bunnings’ Halloween range, creating a festive atmosphere for kids and parents to enjoy. Children can dive into Halloween-inspired crafts like making Jack ‘o’ lanterns or decorating masks and keyrings, face-painting and themed games. Bunnings team members will be dressed to impress in playful Halloween costumes, and plenty of food will keep everyone energised throughout the evening.

With the growing popularity of Halloween in Aotearoa, Bunnings is proud to offer a welcoming space for parents and kids to celebrate together.

“Bunnings has always been about community, and our Halloween Family Night is a great way to bring people together in a fun, safe environment,” says Melissa Haines, Bunnings NZ General Manager.

The Halloween Family Night has seen remarkable year-on-year growth, starting with 1,100 attendees across 8 stores in 2023, surpassing over 4,850 attendees across 41 stores in 2024.

This year, with all stores participating, Bunnings is set to make Halloween bigger and better than ever.


Visit Bunnings Halloween Family Night
Time and date: Thursday 30th October 2025 5:00pm-7:00pm

To book your spot at the Bunnings Family Night Halloween Event visit In-Store D.I.Y. Workshops - Bunnings New Zealand

For more information including store transformations, workshops and Halloween merchandise visit Bunnings Halloween
