description:
Family event: Explore Omnibirding with Giselle Clarkson, We are thrilled and delighted to announce we are going to be hosting a fabulous school holiday event with the multi-award winning Giselle Clarkson to celebrate the release of her latest book Omnibird: An Avian Investigator’s Handbook, a guide to the art and science of omnibirding.
Giselle Clarkson, the author of The Observologist, will be in Tawa for this very special event to explore the inner workings of the book and delights and wonders of the avian world.
Some birds are so commonplace it’s easy to forget how extraordinary they are. These creatures have a secret eyelid, hollow bones and a two-part brain. They dress in feathers. Omnibird, explores what’s remarkable about the birds all around us and the clues we can all use to become avian investigators.
Giselle is an author, illustrator and cartoonist based in Greytown, known for her work on conservation and environmental topics. She has illustrated award-winning picture books and nonfiction and is a 2023 Arts Foundation Laureate, receiving the prestigious Mallinson Rendel Illustrators Award.
This promises to be an unmissable event for bird and nature lovers of any age.
Books for sale thanks to the Children's Bookshop.
We wish to extend our thanks to Gecko Press for helping make this event happen.
This is a free event.
We expect this event to be very popular so to secure your seat early arrival is suggested.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Gotta be done! | Tawa Library, Gotta be done!
Join us for a Bluey™ bonanza!
Calling all parents with children who enjoy Bluey™, GOTTA BE DONE promises a day filled with laughter, games, and magical moments.
Drop into the library and take yourself on a self-guided tour through a series of Bluey™ activity bases:

description:
Childrens “Matisse” Collage Workshop with Linda Kirkland, Childrens “Matisse” Collage Workshop with Linda Kirkland
DATE: Saturday Sept 27
TIME: 2-3pm
LOCATION: Greytown Art Gallery
AGES: 8-12 years
COST: $35 (all materials provided)

Children’s “Matisse” Collage Workshop with Linda Kirkland – 60 minutes of fun and focused creativity for children aged 8 – 12 years. Immerse your child in a world of colour and creativity with the Under the Sea collage workshop, led by experienced educator Linda Kirkland. Drawing inspiration from the bold, large-scale collages of Henri Matisse—who famously described his technique as painting with scissors—Linda will guide the children through an exciting exploration of shape, colour, and composition. Her engaging teaching style will inspire the young artists to create vibrant and unique masterpieces that bring the underwater world to life.

This workshop has limited space.
Please register here: https://greytownarttown.com/childrens-matisse-collage-workshop-with-linda-kirkland/

description:
Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme, Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme
Get your kids ready for a fun, screen-free holiday programme full of mindful, holistic activities. Vegan kai will be provided daily too!

About this Event

At Mindful Kids we will explore nature, get creative cooking and crafting, play music and dance, do mindfulness exercises and more in a peaceful, safe environment. The programme has been crafted with care to give your kids the best experience and will be facilitated by a NZ qualified primary school teacher.
The programme will run for three Fridays over the course of three weeks as per details below.
Times: Drop off time: 8.30am - 9am; Pick up time: 3pm - 3.30pm
Dates: Friday 16th January, Friday 23rd January, Friday 30th January
Location: Bhakti Lounge - 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro Wellington
What to bring: A drink bottle, sun protection, weather-appropriate clothing, regular Medic*tion, and walking shoes.
Age range: 7 - 10 year olds
General daily schedule: Each day will run according to the following structure incorporating the daily theme as per below.
8.30 - 9am - Drop off time
9am - Mindful Moment: Roll, 5 mins of breathwork, 5 mins of yoga, story, circle time
9.30am - Activity
10.30am - Morning tea time
11am - Activity
12.30pm - Lunch time
1.30pm - Mindful Moment: Roll, 5 mins of breathwork, 5 mins of yoga, story
1.45pm - Activity
2.30pm - Afternoon tea and pack up time
3 - 3.30pm - Pick up time

Activities for each day: Check out the cool activities we will do each day!

Cooking and Crafts Day -16th January
Vegan cooking class - Learn to make sushi, sweets and more..
Masterchef Jr contest
Table decorating and restaurant designing
Arts and crafts afternoon
Nature Day - 23rd January
Nature treasure hunt at Central Park
Decorating pots and gardening
Nature hike
Fun at the playground and flying fox
Picnic at the park
Music and Dance Day - 30th January
Make your own instruments
Disco dancing with disco ball and lights
Dress up costume play
Music and dance games
Talent quest
Programme Facilitator: Our facilitator has a wealth of experience creating rich, engaging activities for tamariki in Aotearoa. As well as being a qualified primary school teacher for six years, she also has a degree majoring in Psycholgy and Spanish, experience running a yoga and wellbeing student club at Victoria University and experience being a school Sports Coordinator. Additionally, she has taught in schools in Spain, been the Positive Behaviour for Learning Team Leader and has initiated mindfulness sessions for teachers at various schools. She was the second in charge coordinator for a holiday programme in Nelson and is now excited to combine all of her skills and experience to give your kids the best experience possible at Mindful Kids.
We hope to see you and your kids soon! :)

description:
Meet the Characters: Kiwi's Big Hararei, These school holidays Zealandia Te Māra a Tāne will become the playground of a host of incredible critters from the upcoming Circa Theatre children's show Kiwi's Big Hararei!

Brought to you by award-winning company Horse With No Name, this free "Meet the Characters" event features an amazing array of manu including kiwi, tūī, kārearea and tītīpounamu.

The cast of Kiwi's Big Hararei will wow tamariki with a sneak peek of their show, featuring original waiata by New Zealand singer songwriter Benny Tipene. They will also kōrero about the unique adaptations of these manu, and how we can all be kaitiaki of them.

Bring your tamariki along to engage with these colourful creatures, with stunning costume design by GRIDLEY by Victoria. Musical performance, native biodiversity and interactive theatre combine on the Heritage Lawn for an afternoon of spring fun in the sun! The team of talented children’s entertainers from Horse With No Name are so excited to share a snippet of their show Kiwi's Big Hararei with you.

Kiwi's Big Hararei will be playing at Circa Theatre over the school holidays. For more information about the show, visit www.circa.co.nz

General admission fees to the sanctuary apply, free entry for members. Should the weather turn, this event will be held the foyer of the Visitor Centre on the ground floor. Overflow carparking is available at Birdwood Street during the busy school holiday period.

We'll finish up at the usual destination of St Peter's Village Hall where we'll cut the ribbon, walk across the crossing and declare it the World's Shortest Pride Parade, and celebrate eight years of Pride in the friendliest little village in the world.

description:
Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again, Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again
Our upcoming Echoes of Home invites audiences on a musical and storytelling journey that traces the emotional path of every migrant — from the laughter of childhood to the quiet ache of distance and the enduring warmth of return.

Through five evocative chapters of live music, dance, and performance, the show unfolds as a tapestry of memory and identity — celebrating resilience, cultural pride, and the beauty of belonging.

It begins with “Tuổi Thơ Bé Nhỏ” (Childhood Memories), a tender glimpse into early life in Vietnam, filled with playfulness and sunshine.
Then comes “Thời Học Sinh” (School Days), where friendship, curiosity, and the vibrant pulse of youth take centre stage.
“Trưởng Thành” (Adulthood) follows, echoing the courage to grow, dream, and chase life’s horizons.
The story deepens with “Xa Quê Lập Nghiệp” (Life Abroad) — a heartfelt portrait of those who leave home to build a new life, balancing hope and longing.
Finally, “Nhớ Nhung Tìm Về” (Longing and Return) closes the circle, where nostalgia meets gratitude and the heart finds its way home again.

Blending traditional Vietnamese melodies with modern artistry, Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again is more than a performance — it is a bridge between generations, a celebration of roots, and an embrace of the shared human journey toward belonging.

description:
Day of the Dead - Dia de los Muertos Celebration, Day of the Dead - Dia de los Muertos Celebration
¡Celebra con nosotros el Día de los Muertos con música, baile, comida tradicional y altares conmemorativos!

About this Event

Welcome to the Day of the Dead - Dia de los Muertos Celebration at AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing! Join us for a vibrant and colorful event filled with traditional live music, storytelling, rituals for remembering the dead and delicious prehispanic Mexican cacao drink. Honour your loved ones at our ofrenda, or altar, and learn more from our faciltator, Claudio Escutia, about this rich cultural tradition.
Let's come together to celebrate life and remember those who have passed in a joyful and meaningful way. Don't miss out on this special celebration!
What to Expect:
Cleansing copal and herbal welcoming.
An opening ceremony to acknowledge the Tlalmanalli (offering and altar) with the deep sound of the conch shell in the four directions and drums sounds.
History of the day of the dead celebration.
Explanation of the altar, and the main elements for an ofrenda.
Storytelling: learn of Mexican legends like Catrinas and Xoloitzcuintle (the Mexican dog that helps the dead to find their way to Mictlan, the Aztec underword).
Remembering and sharing histories about the loved ones that passed away (optional but encouraged) 
Traditional Mexican chants for remembering the loved ones 
Atole de Chocolate, a traditional prehispanic drink - amazing in flavour, consumed cold or hot
Music to invoke emotion and imagery of contemplative natural and mystical environments
Finish with a shamanic atmosphere of relaxation and traditional chants.

description:
Wellington Heritage Festival - Building by the Water, Take a closer look at the history of Porirua’s harbourside, from early Māori settlements to cutting edge contemporary engineering developments.

As part of the 2025 Wellington Heritage Festival, Kai Tahi presents a visual exhibition in celebration of Porirua’s unique harbourside heritage.

Building by the Water brings together archival images courtesy of the Alexander Turnbull Library Collection and recent photographic works by Jason Mann. Seen collectively, this visual record aims to place the Kai Tahi development into the wider history of construction along Te Awarua-o-Porirua Harbour.

The exhibition traces a history of harbourside settlement from Māori pa sites, to whaling stations, early settler communities, harbour reclamation, big box retail and now, in 2025, the next community-focused iteration of harbourside settlement, as exemplified by Kai Tahi and the reuse of existing industrial forms.

Kai Tahi has a simple but powerful mission: to transform the traditional idea of a food-court into a cultural and creative harbourside hub for the Porirua Community.

Historic images on display include aerial photographs from Whites Aviation, 19th century engravings and 20th century paintings.

Get ready, Kapiti – something bold, creative, and totally unforgettable is coming your way. On Saturday, 7th March 2026, the Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival makes its explosive return at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, bringing together the ultimate fusion of ink, art, and live entertainment for one epic day of creativity and connection. Whether you're a tattoo enthusiast, an art lover, or someone who thrives in high-energy, artistic environments, this festival is your ticket to something truly extraordinary.

This isn’t just another tattoo expo — it’s a full-blown creative takeover. Expect to see over 40 talented artists under one roof, from the regions leading tattooists to visionary painters, sculptors, illustrators, and local craftspeople. You’ll witness live tattooing, explore interactive art installations, shop handcrafted works, and dive into workshops designed to spark your imagination. Plus, with non-stop local entertainment on the main stage — from musicians to performers and DJs — the atmosphere will be electric from start to finish.

What makes this event truly special? It’s powered by the team at Kapiti Castles — the creative minds behind the popular Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo. Known for producing vibrant, community-driven experiences, Kapiti Castles has crafted this festival as a platform for creative expression, community connection, and artistic inspiration. Whether you're an artist looking to grow your brand or a visitor eager to explore the region’s creative heartbeat, this is your moment.

The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival is more than an event — it’s a movement. It’s a chance to meet incredible artists, get inspired, celebrate culture, and maybe even walk away with some fresh ink. With something for everyone — from art collectors to curious newcomers — this is a must-attend event for 2026.

So mark your calendars for 7th March, gather your crew, and get your tickets now. The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026 is where creativity comes alive, and you won’t want to miss being part of it. Tickets are on sale now — don’t miss your chance to be part of Kapiti’s boldest new festival.

description:
Carnival of Chaos, Myth, chaos, murder, alchemy, mystery, and devils are afoot in this four-night festival featuring six short retellings of classic works with strange new twists! We invite you to THEA 303’s ‘Carnival of Chaos’ in Studio 77, premiering hybrid works from the House of Echoes (1 & 3 October): The Odyssey, Medea and The Devil is a Lover, and the House of Secrets (2 & 4 October): Rope, The Taming of the Shrew  and  God’s Gift.

Each adaptation has been directed, designed, produced, choreographed and managed by the students.

House of Echoes (Season A): Performs on the 1st and the 3rd of October

The Odyssey – An adaptation of Homer’s The Odyssey
Odysseus just wants to get home to his true love, but the journey isn’t exactly smooth. The streets after 2 a.m. and too many beers are alive with obstacles; cops are grumpy, goth girls are tempting, and the help of the Gods is nowhere to be found. Meanwhile, back home, a dangerous polycule is getting cozy with his Penelope…

Medea – An adaptation of Euripides’ Medea
Medea lives her perfect 1950s white picket fence dream! When her husband starts taking new pills “Conservatol, the wonder drug for traditional love” she learns that traditional love means different to what she thought. Betrayal, hurt, and anger push her to the edge making her act in ways she never thought she would. “Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned, nor Hell a fury like a woman scorned.”

The Devil is a Lover – An adaptation of William Shakespeare’s Love Labours Lost and Ben Johnson’s The Devil is an Ass
Satan and two devils, Beelzebub and Pug, make a pact to travel to a 1920s speakeasy on Earth and abstain from corruption for 3 years. As the narrative combines absurdist actions with Shakespearean dialogue, the three devils quickly learn of the difficulties present in avoiding corruption and the effect their devilish meddling has on humanity.

House of Secrets (Season B): Performs on the 2nd and 4th of October

Rope – An adaptation of Patrick Hamilton’s Rope (1929)
Not a whodunnit, but a howdoyahideit? Marion and Melanie are sure they’ve committed the perfect murder by killing their friend Norman and hiding his body in a chest, a chest their select group of friends have been invited over to have a murder mystery games night around. It’s foolproof, until the over analytical Constance comes to play…

The Taming of the Shrew – An adaptation of William Shakespeare’s Taming of the Shrew
In 1970's Aotearoa, sisters Katherina and Bianca find their love lives complicated by their father's order that one may not pursue romance unless the other follows suit. The sudden appearance of a charming factory owner and friend of Bianca's beau could mark a new hope for the two, but will this lead to an ocean of love or does something far more sinister lurk beneath the surface?

God’s Gift – An adaptation of Ben Johnson’s The Alchemist
The Carnival has come to town in 1615 London. Lovewit has gone to see the show, leaving her manor in the hands of Jeremy the Butler, the “Alchemist,” and Dol, a hardworking prostitute. Lovewit’s house becomes a place for schemes, with ample opportunities to take money from foolish men. Will Dol be happy with her split of the money? Or will a surprise visitor shake things up?

Content Forecast: mentions of and implied sexual violence and domestic abuse, mentions of drug use, strobe lighting, violence, coarse language, loud noises, haze, and smoke.

description:
Hutt Valley Annual Diwali 2025, Hutt Valley Annual Diwali 2025
The Annual Hutt Valley Diwali, organised by the Wellington Punjabi Sports and Cultural Club Inc. (WPSCC Inc.), is a vibrant, family-friendly celebration of light, culture, and community. Held each year in the heart of the Hutt Valley, this non-profit event brings together people of all ages and backgrounds to enjoy the rich traditions of Diwali.

The festival features a colourful mix of cultural performances, traditional and modern music and dance, delicious food, local art and craft stalls, and engaging activities for children and families. It offers a unique opportunity to experience the diverse cultures that make up our region while celebrating the universal values of light over darkness, hope, and togetherness.

WPSCC Inc. proudly hosts this event to promote unity, cultural understanding, and community spirit in the Hutt Valley and beyond.

description:
XCOMMUNICATE, XCOMMUNICATE
The formidable powerhouse duo COMMUNICATE return to Wellington in November with their clubnight, XCOMMUNICATE, for one night only.

Known for their long sets that incorporate decades of sound, Cyril Orson and Heylady have been punishing dance floors across Aotearoa since they joined forces 3 years ago. Off the back of a monstrous summer, which saw them play 19 shows up and down the country, the pair have spent most of 2025 in the studio finessing their own brand of audio alchemy and preparing to release their label, also named XCOMMUNICATE.

Usually XCOMMUNICATE is a 6 hour journey though decades and sonic realms, however as Heylady is still recovering from a mighty dose of burnout they’ve roped in a couple of their good friends, who happen to be some of Wellington’s finest, to join them as they lay down four hours of four to the floor.

Halo is a mainstay on Wellington dancefloors and it was a no brainer asking her to be on this lineup. A DJ since 2000, she has played festivals across the country and never fails to rock her slot. Her set at Taniwha’s Den last summer was a big highlight and one of the best of the festival. Halo’s ability to drive forward thinking sound and her clever construction of sets are just two reasons you need to be on her floor.

DJ Coda is the godfather of techno in New Zealand. With a career that spans decades, he isn’t just a DJ but a dedicated promoter and one of the trustees of NZ’s longest running student radio station, Radio Active. Part of the COMMUNICATE family from the get go (and a longtime collaborator of Heylady’s), DJ Coda is a master of his craft and never fails to deliver. Armed with knowledge , taste and a hefty love of Detroit, DJ Coda is the man when it comes to rocking the dance floor.
First release tickets are on sale now, grab yours before they are gone and come and dance the evening away with four of the best. We recommend arrive early so you don’t miss out on any of the sets, they are all going to be killer.

IMPORTANT INFO:
Our event is a safe space for all. If you or someone you know is feeling unsafe or harassed, please approach one of the DJs or bar staff. If you are behaving badly and impacting others ability to have a good time safely, you will be removed. Please act with respect and care for your fellow attendees at all times, no means no and this goes for conversations as well as more intimate requests.

description:
NZ Drum & Dance Camp, NZ Drum & Dance Camp
Join us this 24th to 27th October for a West African musical immersion at our annual NZ Drum Dance Camp.

Set amidst 38 acres of native bushland just a short drive from Wellington, this weekend is a celebration of unity, rhythm, and the soul-stirring power of African drum and dance, curated for the NZ African drumming community.

We are excited to announce that Epizo Bangoura will be back to join us again in 2025!

Epizo Bangoura is a celebrated master musician from Guinea, West Africa, known for his extraordinary versatility on the Kora (African harp), Balafon (African tuned percussion), and Djembe/Duns.

Epizo will be joined by Ghanaian Master Drummer Yaw Asumadu and special guest Jimi Dale.

Camp Highlights:

♪ Djembe and Dunun Workshops: Suitable for all skill levels, from enthusiastic beginners to advanced drummers, guided by our awesome team of teachers.
♪ Traditional Dance: with the effervescent Epizo Bangoura.
♪ Group Jams and Musical Sessions: Strengthen communal bonds through captivating group jams and impromptu musical sessions.
♪ Tranquil Setting: Enjoy the native bushland environ - build mind, body and spirit whilst enhancing our weekend of music and togetherness.
♪ Catering – Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included on Saturday and Sunday, as well as breakfast Monday. Please bring a shared (pre-prepared) plate for Friday evening kai.

Featured Instructors:

Epizo Bangoura: A master of the djembe and traditional dance, Epizo brings profound knowledge and vibrant energy, embodying the essence of West African music and dance.

Yaw Asumadu: A Master Drummer from Ghana, Yaw has performed globally and taught African drumming for 25 years, collaborating with legendary artists.

Jimi Dale: A pioneer of African music in NZ, Jimi has been teaching African Drum and Dance classes since 1995 and formed the world music and dance group, Tamani. We are excited to have Jimi back again teaching us a dun dance piece.

Pricing Details:
♪ Early Bird: $450 (Reserve by Sunday 31st August 2025)
♪ Adult rate: $495
♪ Kids 9 – 14 years old: $250
♪ Kids 8 and under: $175
♪ Family Packages available on request
♪ Single Day & night $220 (includes 3 meals and full day tuition)
♪ Drum Hire: $15

Event Schedule Snapshot:
♪ Friday, 24th October: Arrive from 4pm - A warm welcome sets the stage for a weekend filled with rhythm and learning.
Bring a share plate for dinner.
♪ Saturday, 25th October: Engage in enriching drum and dance workshops. Participants will be grouped into their appropriate levels.
♪ Sunday, 26th October: Continue your musical journey with drum and dance sessions, leading to a group performance that encapsulates the weekend’s shared experiences.
♪ Monday, 27th October: Morning All in Drum & Dance ceremony, then it's time to hit the road.

FAQs
♪ Getting Ready: Bring your drum (if available), snacks for the weekend, dance-appropriate shoes, sleeping gear (pillowcase & sheet, sleeping bag/ doona), warm clothes, and an eager spirit.
♪ Beginners are warmly welcomed – our camp is a nurturing space for newcomers to discover the joy of African drumming and dance, bolstered by a supportive community.

For more information and tickets -
https://africandrumming.co.nz/tours-and-retreats/nz-drum-dance-camp/

More questions?
Contact - Tulletha at or call: 028 474 1123

description:
Happy & Willing Horse Clinic, Does something in your partnership with your horse feel a little “off” right now?
Maybe your horse is still doing the things you ask, but the softness, willingness, or spark you used to feel together is missing.
Maybe you notice tension, hesitation, or subtle “no’s” where there used to be “yes.”
If you want to pay attention now; understand it, work with it, and strengthen your connection before the new year. Then this clinic is for you!
When & Where:
🗓 Sunday 30th November
📍 Ohariu Valley, Wellington
Rider Spots: 4 only (to ensure plenty of hands-on time and space for learning)
This isn’t your run-of-the-mill clinic. We explore why things are showing up in your horse’s behaviour by diving into:
Horse psychology and learning principles
Recognising stress before it escalates
Setting your horse up to be relaxed, soft, and willing
Each rider works with me in two separate 1:1 sessions; on the ground or under saddle, depending on what your horse needs.
Sessions aren’t based on what the rider wants to do, they’ll be guided by what your horse communicates.
If your goal is to simply ride, compete, or “get things done” without considering your horse’s comfort, this isn’t for you ❌
But if you want a partnership that is:
✅ Pleasant and stress-free for both horse and rider
✅ Builds trust and connection
✅ Leaves your horse genuinely happy to work with you
…then you’ll love this experience ♥️

Rider Spots
Include:
Two 1:1 sessions
Two theory sessions
Fully catered luxury lunch + drinks & nibbles to close the day
WhatsApp support for a month to integrate learnings at home
Want to learn but can't bring your horse, use one of ours
Spectator Spots include observation of sessions, theory, Q&A, plus lunch and closing drinks/nibbles.

Please note: The clinic will only run if enough riders sign up. Tickets will be fully refunded if the event is cancelled.
Extra: Want to make a weekend of it? Stay over Saturday and we can arrange a VIP experience ☺️
Have any questions or want to organise a VIP experience: email susan@equineeq.co.nz

description:
Boos & Brews + Feeding Frenzy Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Boos & Brews + Feeding Frenzy Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
Friday raises a pint. Saturday unleashes the horde. Two nights, one wristband, all of Wellington's Halloween energy.

About this Event


👻🍺 Boos & Brews + Feeding Frenzy 🧛🧟‍♀️Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025

Two nights. One pass. Non-stop Halloween madness.
Friday kicks off with Boos & Brews — pints, cocktails, and costumed pub crawlers packing the city’s best bars. Saturday unleashes Feeding Frenzy — a zombie-fueled bar crawl where DJs, shots, and wild costumes keep the night alive until 2 AM.




WHAT’S INCLUDED
🎟️ One wristband for both crawls (Friday + Saturday)
🚫 No cover charges at any venue
🍹 Exclusive Halloween drink specials
🎶 DJs + entertainment at every stop
📱 Friday + Saturday digital crawl maps 🕺 Two huge closing parties




PARTICIPATING VENUES
Lineup announced soon. Each stop brings themed drinks, DJs, and a full Halloween vibe.


👻🍺🧟‍♂️🧛 Double your Halloween fun. One ticket gets you two back-to-back crawls, two closing parties, and hundreds of costumed partygoers.
🚨 Early bird weekend passes start at $25 — grab yours before they’re gone.




HALLOWEEN CRAWL TERMS & CONDITIONS
ENTRY REQUIREMENTS
This is a 18+ event only. Government-issued photo ID is mandatory at the door. No ID, no participation.
WRISTBAND POLICY
Your wristband = your access. It must be collected at the official check-in location during posted hours (before 10:30 PM).
If you miss check-in, your wristband will not be available and you will not be permitted into crawl venues. No refunds.
If you can’t make it, you may designate a friend to pick up your wristband on your behalf.
VENUE PARTICIPATION & RULES
Crawl schedules, bar times, and specials are listed on the Digital Bar List.
Your ticket is only valid during the scheduled crawl hours — not outside of them.
Digital Crawl Map: Always check it the morning of the event for final venue confirmations and any last-minute adjustments.
Venues may close early, reach capacity, or have staff unaware of the crawl — if so, simply continue to another participating location listed on the map.
All venues reserve the right to deny entry based on intoxication, dress code, behavior, or safety concerns. Standard security checks still apply.
TICKETS & SALES
All sales are final. Tickets are non-transferable and non-refundable.
If an event is fully canceled without a replacement date, a refund (minus processing fees) will be issued.
Events run rain or shine, and lineup, specials, or bar participation may change without notice.
COSTUMES & CONDUCT
Costumes are encouraged, but anything resembling a weapon or considered offensive may result in denied entry with no refund.
Disorderly conduct, harassment, or damage to property will result in removal without compensation.
LIABILITY RELEASE
By purchasing a ticket and joining the crawl, you confirm that you are participating at your own risk. You accept full responsibility for any injuries, illnesses, property loss, theft, accidents, alcohol-related incidents, or death that may occur before, during, or after the event.
You hereby waive, release, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, staff, contractors, sponsors, volunteers, affiliates, and all participating venues from any and all liability — whether due to negligence, gross negligence, breach of duty, or otherwise.
You further agree to indemnify and hold harmless all released parties from any claims, damages, or legal fees arising from your actions or participation.
By attending, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and accepted this waiver. It is intended to be as broad and enforceable as permitted by law.

description:
Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26, Join us for a Tour of the Sanctuary

Open days include a tour of the sanctuary to meet the animals, learn about them, their stories and how we look after them, followed by a vegan afternoon tea. Money raised from ticket sales help us with the ongoing care of our animals. We will also happily accept donations of fruit, veggies, or hay for the animals.

Please note open days are weather dependent and in the event of rain we will normally rearrange to the following saturday.

Please arrive between 12:30 and 1pm- bring strong closed-toe footwear, sunblock, and clothing for all weather. No animal food products are allowed on the sanctuary grounds as we are a human vegan space. Sadly, dogs are not welcome as we have a lot of vulnerable animals on site. Depending on the weather, your clothing and footwear might get muddy, so please wear clothing that isn’t too precious.

If you have questions about accessibility please these questions email us before you arrive. Unfortunately, the sanctuary is not wheelchair accessible.

Make a day of it!- we are 5 mins away from some lovely river spots on the Ōtaki river and 20 mins from Ōtaki town and beach.

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

Celia will bring her overnight backpack and show the gear she is taking on the tramp.

The talk will cover: food and drink, hut wear, toileting tips, keeping your sleeping bag dry, emergency communications, and looking after your feet.

Bring your questions!
Adam Philps from Masterton Foot Clinic, a festival sponsor will be joining us to talk feet and things to consider.

Murray Johnston, chair of Wairarapa Land Search and Rescue will also be speaking. Please bring a gold coin to donate to WaiLandSAR.

Please register for this session.

description:
Sunset Guided Tour, Experience Stonehenge Aotearoa at its most breathtaking — as the sun dips below the Wairarapa horizon.
Our Sunset Guided Tour blends astronomy, storytelling, and the natural beauty of twilight for an evening you will never forget.

Led by one of our knowledgeable guides, this 90-minute experience explores how ancient cultures used the Sun to track time and mark the turning of the seasons. You’ll discover the scientific and cultural thinking behind the Henge’s unique Southern Hemisphere design before watching the sunset alignment from inside the stone circle.

Weather permitting, you’ll witness how the setting Sun interacts with the structure — a striking moment that links ancient knowledge with the rhythms of the natural world.

Duration and Schedule
• Allow: Approximately 90 minutes
• Start Time: Begins one hour before sunset
• Availability: Offered any day with advance booking

description:
Gazley Volkswagen Wellington Marathon - 2026, Gazley Volkswagen Wellington Marathon - 2026
The Gazley Volkswagen Wellington Marathon has been the Capital City’s favourite footrace for almost 40 years.

Based at the famous Sky Stadium, the flat, scenic and fast route around Wellington's spectacular waterfront creates an occasion for all age and ability.

Whether in the Full Marathon, Half Marathon, 10k or Kids’ Magic Mile, more than 4000 runners and walkers from more than a dozen countries line up for this great annual occasion, which is also benefits the Heart Foundation.

But don't take our word for it. Find out for yourself... Enter Now for June 28th at www.wellingtonmarathon.co.nz !

description:
Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st, Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st
Get ready for the biggest Halloween Bar Crawl in Wellington on Saturday, Nov 1st. Hit the city's top bars & clubs!

About this Event


🎃🕸️ WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL 2025 🕸️🎃
Get ready for the wildest Halloween celebration in Wellington. Join the spookiest Halloween Bar Crawl on Saturday, November 1st, 2025, and get access to 4+ of Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs!
🎶 Music: Live DJs playing the hottest hits and Halloween classics.
📍 Crawl Stops: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, El Horno, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3—Wellington's hottest bars and nightclubs for an unforgettable Halloween celebration!
🕙 Kickoff: Doors open at 7:30 PM. Wristbands must be picked up by 10:30 PM!
🎟 Tickets: Starting at just $15. Prices go up soon, so don’t wait!
Throw on your wildest costume and get ready to crawl through the city with hundreds of partygoers. Whether you're spooky, cute, or covered in fake blood—this is the crawl to be at to celebrate Halloween.🧟‍♀️


⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 Halloween Bar Crawl Experience!
Gather your friends and take over the city with the Halloween Bar Crawl this Halloween, hitting Wellington’s top bars.
🚨 This event is limited to 500 attendees, so grab your tickets early before they sell out! Don’t miss your chance to celebrate this big holiday—secure your spot before it’s too late!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎃 Join Hundreds of Halloween Partygoers in Wellington
🚫 No Cover at All Participating Venues
🎟️ Exclusive Halloween Bar Crawl Wristband for Entry
📱 Bar Crawl Map to Navigate Each Spooky Stop 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Halloween Hits and Party Anthems
🕺 End the Night in Style at the Final Haunted Venue
👻 Costume up and crawl your way through Wellington’s hottest bars. Enjoy eerie drink specials, electric energy, and unforgettable Halloween experience!


🚨 Get Your 2025 Halloween Bar Crawl Tickets Before We Sell Out! 🚨
🦇Wellington’s biggest Halloween bash is just around the corner. Costumes, cocktails, and chaos await across the city's top nightlife spots.
It’s time to show off your best look and turn heads all night long. Whether you're spooky, sexy, or just straight-up wild, this year's Halloween Bar Crawl is your chance to shine. Hit the city’s most popular bars, enjoy themed drinks, and party with hundreds of fellow Halloween lovers. Your costume deserves a crowd, and this is where to find it.
🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a Halloween to remember!
💀 Let the WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money straight back to the bank!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
WRISTBAND VENUE:
Lulu Bar & Restaurant
🕒 7:30 PM – 10:30 PM
📍 31 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:30 -10:30 to arrive and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:30PM or explore the other venues.
MIDDLE STOPS:
El Horno
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 34 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
The Rogue & Vagabond
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
FINAL VENUE:
BL3
🕒 11:30 PM – 2:00 AM
📍8 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet at this final venue at 11:30PM for a massive final Halloween party!


Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Middle Stops” at your convenience between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM or stay at the wristband venue until 10:30pm. After 11:30 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate at the final party location!
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop (wristband venue), as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Please also note that wristbands are no longer available after 10:30PM at the first venue. No refunds will be given if you show up late and miss the wristband pick-up window!
This club crawl is a walking bar crawl—all venues are within walking distance of each other. Please plan accordingly for transportation and your walking schedule.
Wristbands for entry will be provided by event staff only. To pick up your wristband, please check in with the event staff at the front reception or host stand.


2025 CRAWL MAP:




🎟️ General Admission – $20
Includes access to all official crawl stops. No frills — just the fun.
───────────────────────────────────────

👑 VIP Ticket – $25
Includes everything in GA plus:
🔥 Access to the VIP-only crawl challenge for free tickets
🚀 First dibs on future crawl drops & pre-sales
───────────────────────────────────────

🤯 Ultra VIP – $35
For the dangerously curious. Includes everything in VIP plus:
🏆 Name on our “Crawl Wall of Fame”
📜 Official “Certified Crawl Legend” digital certificate
🚪 Access to a future exclusive pre-sale drop
❓ A mystery bonus item we legally can’t describe 👀



A SPOOKTACULAR HALLOWEEN PARTY YOU WON'T WANT TO MISS
Skip the overpriced cover charge and long lines at a single bar. With one ticket, you’ll unlock access to multiple Halloween hotspots across Wellington, each with its own theme, music, and party energy. Whether you're rocking a full costume or just out for the night, this is your chance to experience the city’s top nightlife all in one thrilling Halloween themed experience.
THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE HALLOWEEN NIGHT OUT
One bar? One vibe? That’s not how Wellington does Halloween. Grab your crew and bounce between the city’s best bars and clubs, each bringing something different to the table. From spooky cocktails to wild dance floors, the night builds up to one massive end-of-night party you won’t want to miss. 🧛‍♀️
THE BIGGEST HALLOWEEN PARTY NIGHT IN WELLINGTON
This crazy Halloween experience crawl will take you through the city’s top bars and clubs with a line-up built for non-stop fun. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks, and a crowd ready to party in full costume.
GET YOUR TICKETS BEFORE THEY VANISH!
Spots are filling fast, so now’s the time to lock in your plans. Round up your friends, pick your costume, and get ready to sip, dance, and crawl your way through one of the most exciting nights Wellington has to offer. Halloween only comes once a year... so grab your tickets today! 🎟️



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so they don’t miss out.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

description:
Heartland Flyer, Heartland Flyer
Travel with Steam Incorporated north from Kapiti via the spectacular Manawatu Gorge to Woodville for an easy day out. Picking up along the way from Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, and Levin, our destination today is Woodville. To get there, we travel through the famous Manawatu Gorge. Now only accessible via rail, you get a unique perspective of the monumental slips which closed the Gorge to road traffic from 2017.

At Woodville, sample the delights of the restored 1960s era station whilst our train is prepared for the run back down the coast. Meridian’s Te Apiti wind farm can also be seen from the station, occupying 1,150ha of land, with enough sustainable renewable energy to power 45,000 kiwi homes.

Fares
Adult (12+yrs) - $139
Child (3-12yrs) - $89
Infant (0-2yrs) - Free

Tickets available at steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/heartland-flyer/

description:
Watercolour and Wine Night in Wellington - Midnight Kitty, Turn wine into watercolour! Take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other, and let’s paint a watercolour masterpiece!
Join us for a beginner's watercolour painting event full of fluid colour mixing and delicate brushwork where you’ll craft your own bespoke watercolour artwork. One of our watercolour experts will guide step-by-step through the watercolour process and will encourage you to add your own unique touch.
Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.
Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.
What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!
We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!
For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to
[[https://paintvine.co.nz/]

description:
JETAA Wellington - Brewkaiwa August @ The Welsh Dragon, We will be having our August Brewkaiwa at The Welsh Dragon, a cosy and quirky pub nestled in the heart of the city. With its warm atmosphere, distinctive character, and range of drinks on offer, it’s the perfect spot to relax, chat, and connect.
Brewkaiwa is JETAA’s monthly casual meetup for anyone with any connection to Japan.
We’re a diverse group of people who have studied, worked, or lived in Japan or have been invited along by someone who has.
Come join us for a brew and stay for the kaiwa! Bring your friends!
***Japanese or alcohol consumption NOT REQUIRED!***
Brewkaiwaとは
一杯いかがですか？
JETAAがウェリントンで親睦会を開催するとどうなるのか？その結果、BREWKAIWA！
2020年に始まった、ブリューカイワは、ウェリントンの様々なバーで毎月開催されている飲み会です。大人気の国際交流グルップです！！！ 日本で働いたり、住んだり、旅行したことのある人達に人気のあるイベントです！！！お酒を飲んで、友達を出来、素敵なごちそうを食べ、おまけに異文化を知られます！
日本語が話せる外国人も良く参加しているので、日本語しか話せなくても全然大丈夫です！
是非来てください！

description:
Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Homewood Airstrip| Roast by the Coast, Enjoy a day out on the Wairarapa Coast with a family-friendly walk and a hearty roast lunch. Situated on working farmland, the Homewood Airstrip walk is a 5km return track that follows a gradual incline to the top, offering sweeping views of land and sea, before an easy downhill return. The gravel track is usually straightforward, but can be slippery or muddy in wet conditions—good footwear and wet-weather gear are recommended. Gates will be open and stock fenced off for the day. Thanks to Tranzit sponsorship the bus fare is significantly reduced for participants.

After your walk, return to the Homewood Storeroom to refuel with a traditional roast lunch of slow-cooked lamb, crispy roast potatoes, and seasonal salad, with an optional slice for dessert.

Walk Format
Travel: 1 hour each way from Masterton (2 hours total)
Arrive: Café at 10am (time for the loo and to collect maps—navigation support by Gavin, our seasoned guide!)
Walk: Depart up the airstrip by 10.30am; allow 2 hours including time to enjoy the views
Lunch: Return to the Storeroom by 12.30pm for a roast lunch
Return: Bus departs from the café at 2pm

This outing is ideal for fit trampers, casual walkers, families, pre-schoolers, and school groups (minimum age 4+). Expect moderate hills and potentially muddy conditions if it rains—but with the right gear, light rain and wind will only add to the adventure.

description:
Mystery Feast on Mischief Night! Halloween dinner with Chef Max Gordy 🎃 Supporting Kaibosh., Mystery Feast on Mischief Night! Halloween dinner with Chef Max Gordy 🎃 Supporting Kaibosh.
🎃 Step inside, if you dare... on the eve of Halloween. It's a Mischief Night!
👻A chilling murder mystery unfolds over a hauntingly good three-course Halloween dinner by Chef Max Gordy!

On 30 October, gather your cleverest friends and find your darkest ghoulish attire 🧛‍♀️ Who will crack the case first: the Detectives or the Villains? 🕵️‍♂️
Expect twists, laughter, and a touch of fright 💀 with spot prizes through the night — plus a reward for the best-dressed.

👩‍🍳 Award-winning chef Max Gordy ( @grazewinebar ) will conjure up a frightfully delicious Halloween-themed feast.
🥂 Your ticket includes one complimentary alcoholic beverage (with more available to purchase on the night).
🙌 Every ticket sold helps Kaibosh ensure that no good food is left to die.

TICKET TYPES
Bring a team of six to solve the mystery and devour a fiendishly good feast for $666.
Have a frightening four-some? Book a table for $444.
Spooky single seats available for $111... we will seat you at a mystery table...

VENUE
60 Dixon Street is up a flight of steep steps – with only one way in.

What is Mischief Night?
In parts of Pennsylvania and New Jersey in the eastern USA, 30 October is called “Mischief Night.” The tradition refers to the eve of Halloween in which children and teenagers celebrate the holiday one night early with pranks, tricks and more. While in New England, some call it Cabbage Night...
Join us to experience Chef Max Gordy's culinary take on Mischief Night in Pōneke!

#Halloween #HalloweenNZ #MischiefNight #MaxGordy #EveybodyEats #CharityDinner #FundraisingDinner #WellingtonDining #Pōneke #WellingtonNZ

description:
Le Petit Chef, InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.

Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients. Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.

As the journey unfolds, a five-course menu is served in perfect harmony with the story. Highlights include Wairarapa crayfish bouillabaisse, corn-fed chicken with Perigord truffle, and a decadent Valrhona chocolate dessert. Choose from the Grand Menu ($180), Classic Menu ($140), Vegetarian Menu ($140), or a dedicated Kids Menu $70). While each menu offers a distinct culinary experience, the stunning visual show remains the same for all guests and is centered around the Grand Menu storyline.

Please note, while primarily designed for individual bookings, some shared seating may apply due to the technical nature of the performance.

description:
Sconnoisseur, Get ready to master the art of making Wellington's iconic cheese scones at Pravda Café. Widely regarded as the home of the city's best cheese scones, Pravda's creations are so beloved, they often sell out before you can blink. Now, you can learn the secrets behind their mouthwatering scones firsthand.

In this hands-on workshop, you’ll be guided through mixing and preparing your own batch of Pravda’s famous cheese scones. Once your dough is ready, you'll hand them off to be baked to crispy flaky perfection. While they cook, relax with a cup of tea or coffee, and once your scones are ready, you’ll enjoy the fruits of your labour fresh from the oven.

The best part? You’ll get to take home the coveted recipe, allowing you to recreate these legendary scones in your own kitchen whenever you want. This is a perfect opportunity to learn a piece of Wellington’s culinary history and enjoy a deliciously rewarding experience.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Mischief Night Murder Mystery Feast with Chef Max Gordy, 30 October, 🎃 Step inside, if you dare... on the eve of Halloween. It's a Mischief Night* full of tricks and frights!
👻 A chilling murder mystery unfolds over a hauntingly good three-course Halloween dinner by Chef Max Gordy.
Gather your cleverest friends... who will crack the case first: the detectives or the villains?
Expect twists, laughter, and a touch of fright, with spot prizes through the night — plus a reward for the best-dressed.
🍽️ Award-winning chef Max Gordy (Graze Wine Bar) will conjure up a frightfully delicious Halloween-themed feast.
🥂 Your ticket includes one complimentary alcoholic beverage (with more available to purchase on the night).
TICKET TYPES
Round up your squad of six to solve the mystery and devour a fiendishly good feast for $666.
Have a frightening four-some? Book a table for $444.
Spooky single seats available for $111... we will seat you at a mystery table for some mischief!
VENUE
60 Dixon Street is up a flight of steep steps – with only one way in.
FUNDRAISING
Every ticket sold helps Kaibosh ensure that no good food is left to die.  
By joining us for this night of spooky fun, you’ll be directly helping us rescue quality surplus kai and get it to those who need it most.
*What is Mischief Night? In parts of Pennsylvania and New Jersey in the eastern USA, 30 October is called “Mischief Night.” The tradition refers to the eve of Halloween in which children and teenagers celebrate the holiday one night early with pranks, tricks and more. While in New England, some call it Cabbage Night...
Join us to experience Chef Max Gordy's culinary take on Mischief Night in Pōneke!
label: Food & Drink

description:

description:
THE SOUL TABLE 5 Course Dinner | 5 DECEMBER 2025, THE SOUL TABLE 5 Course Dinner | 5 DECEMBER 2025
This 5-Course dinner is a special pop-up menu designed by one of our bachelor students.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables arranged per order

About this Event

This 5-Course dinner is a special one-off pop-up event and is not one of our typical LCBNZ Brasserie dinners. It features a bespoke menu created by Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business student Sagar Rajan, inspired by his culinary journey and his current workplace, Koji Restaurant.
Due to popular demand we have opened an additional 20 seats for the 5th of December.

Ticket Information
IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables are arranged per order. If you purchase tickets separately you need to e-mail to advise which other ticket holders you wish to be seated with.
Date: Friday 5th December
Price: $99 per person
Booking Times: 6:30pm
Matched Wine Option: If you would like to add matched wines to your dining experience you can do so on the day by paying an additional charge. Alternatively, we have a selection of wines to purchase by the glass or bottle as well as beers and soft drinks. We are a fully licensed restaurant and do not offer BYO.
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.
The Menu: will not be released before the event. Please be aware that the menu will include fish, meat and shellfish components.
Tickets are allocated for specific seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time indicated on your ticket.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu 5 course dining experience is 2 hours. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' creations.




What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Cuisine programme. In the dining room we have our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students serving you and putting their theory skills into practice.

Brasserie & High Tea Refund Policy
• No refunds are provided unless the event is cancelled by Le Cordon Bleu NZ.
• Customers can arrange for someone else to take their place.

description:
Netherfield Ball, Step into the enchanting world of Jane Austen’s Pride and Prejudice at Homewood, where the timeless elegance of a Regency-era ball comes to life. This evening of romance, music, and culinary delight invites you to relive the iconic moments of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr Darcy’s fateful meeting.

Guests will be greeted with crafted cocktails inspired by love potions, showcasing ingredients from some of the finest distilleries in New Zealand and the United Kingdom. As the evening unfolds, indulge in a carefully curated selection of canapés, created with fresh ingredients sourced from Homewood’s own garden, evoking the flavours and charm of the Regency period.

The grand setting of Homewood, the esteemed residence of the British High Commissioner, will transport you to a bygone era. With the glow of garden lighting, live music filling the air, and an atmosphere brimming with romance, you’ll feel as if you’ve stepped into Austen’s world. Dancing will play a central role in the evening, allowing guests to immerse themselves in the grace and grandeur of the Regency social scene.

Whether you’re an Austen devotee, a fan of Bridgerton, or simply drawn to the allure of historical elegance, this event promises to captivate your imagination and senses. Don’t miss this rare opportunity to be part of a night filled with charm, sophistication, and timeless romance.

Perched above the harbour, QTea High Tea reimagines its plated treats into a sugar plum dreamland. Think raspberry-layered delights, golden pistachio choux, smoked salmon cups and piroshki that dance on the palate.

description:
Urban Wine Walk - Pōneke Wellington, The streets and laneways of Pōneke Wellington are set to come alive this Spring as a line-up of eight venues each play host to an incredible winemaker, who'll be there ready to pour and chat you through an unforgettable afternoon.


HOW IT WORKS
Kick things off at your chosen starting spot with something to eat, and then let the adventure unfold. Wander at your own pace, glass in hand, discovering incredible wines and venues along the way.

With a stellar line-up of winemakers, good vibes at every stop, and a guaranteed sell-out crowd, the Urban Wine Walk is the ultimate self-guided tasting experience you and your crew won’t want to miss!


PARTICIPATING VENUES & WINEMAKERS
1 - Choice Bros Ft. Coney Wines (NZ)
2 - Glou Glou Ft. Halite (NZ)
3 - Little Beer Quarter Ft. Hopes Grove & Aard (NZ)
4 - Lulu Bar Ft. Margrain Vineyard (NZ)
5 - Noble Rot Ft. VALLI (NZ)
6 - Panhead Tory St Ft. The Good Way (NZ)
7 - The Arborist Rooftop Bar Ft. Matawhero (NZ)
8 - The Tasting Room Ft. Tettonica Wines (NZ)

*Please note that traditional venue menus may vary due to the nature of the event.


TICKETS
Vino Lover Pass – $79 + Booking Fee (Limited Availability)

WHAT’S INCLUDED
Wine Tastings – Up to 3 wines per winemaker along the trail
$10 Food Voucher – Redeem at your nominated starting venue (before 1pm)
$25 Wine Voucher – Put towards event-day wine orders (six-pack minimum, participating producers only)
Event Essentials – Your official wristband & keepsake tasting glass


EVENT REGISTRATION & COLLECTION
Before heading to your nominated starting venue, swing by the official registration point to collect your wristband, tasting glass & vouchers.

Where: Panhead Tory St (1 Tory St)
When: Saturday 18th October | 11am – 1pm

Please note: The Urban Wine Walk officially runs from 12-4pm. Arrive early to grab your event pack and avoid the rush!


REFUND POLICY
Tickets are non-refundable (we’re all in for good times rain, hail or shine!). The only exception is if the event is cancelled or postponed by the organisers – then we’ve got you covered.


GETTING AROUND
One of the best parts about the Urban Wine Walk...? It’s totally self-guided! After checking in at your nominated starting venue, the day is yours! Wander at your own pace, discover new spots and sip your way through the trail however you like.


Sorry kids, Urban Wine Walk is strictly 18 Years and Over!


----------

Neighbourhood Events Co. recognises the unique role of Māori as Tangata Whenua and embraces Te Tiriti o Waitangi recognising Māori as Tino rangatiratanga of Aotearoa/New Zealand while embracing the three guiding principles of the Treaty – Partnership, Participation and Protection. We will endeavour to implement bicultural policies and practices that incorporate and value Māori cultural concepts, values and practices.

description:
WHAC Presents: Honest 10 on 19 October 2025, Join us at 8:30am on Sunday 19th October for the next edition of the Honest 10 taking in Wellington's beautiful waterfront. The Honest 10 is the perfect chance to test your 5km or 10km fitness and maybe have a go at walking or running PB.
EVERYONE IS WELCOME NO MATTER WHAT YOUR LEVEL OF FITNESS. The is an optional 8:15am early start for those who think they might need more time (eg over 70 mins for 10k)
[Note: If there are gales force winds, it is likely we will cancel due to safety reasons. Check back on this FB page at 7am on the morning of the race if the wind is howling as well will post any cancellation by that time. If nothing is here, then the event is going ahead
]
Organised by WHAC, the Honest 10 provides a fast, fun and friendly environment. The race course has been officially measured and there will be pacers running 40min, 45min, 50min, 55min and 60min to help you run your best.
Cost: Just $10 for 10km, $5 for 5km!!
How to enter:
1. Pre-register by email (recommended) BEFORE 5PM on Saturday 18th October. Payment methods for pre-registrations include online bank transfer (an email with your reference will be sent back to you) or pay cash on the day.
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
Use "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"
OR
2. Sign up on the day from 8am (cash only).
Photos are free of charge and posted online (on the WHAC website) alongside results after the race. https://whac.org.nz/wp/honest-10/
Where: At the Whale's Tail next to Freyberg Pool, Oriental Bay
When: Registration from 8am. Race starts at 8:30am Sunday morning. Let us know when you register, if you request an early 8.15am start, eg if you are walking the 10km or are likely to run slower than 70mins.
***Pre-registration details***
Email the following details to honest10@whac.org.nz BEFORE 5pm Saturday18th October.
You will receive a confirmation email back with your race number. If you select 'N' for prepaid, just bring cash to the race with you. If you select 'Y' for prepaid, pay via WHAC's bank account details below.
- Name
- Age
- 5km or 10km
- M, F or D (unfortunately we are currently unable to give age-calculated results for the gender-diverse (D) category, as our source currently only provides age-calculated result data for M and F)
- Phone number
- Prepay Y or N
BANK ACCOUNT DETAILS If you select "Y" for Prepay when you register via email, transfer your $10 entry fee (or $5 for 5k) to
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
using "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"
Looking forward to seeing you on Sunday 19th October

description:
Richter City Roller Derby | Team New Zealand vs Team Australia, Mark your calendars – Saturday, 8 November is bringing the heat to Kilbirnie Rec Centre with a night of top-tier roller derby!

7pm: Team New Zealand vs Team Australia

Come hungry and thirsty — we’ll have delicious homemade food, ice-cold Karma Drinks, and Garage Project brews to keep you going all night long.

Don’t forget to enter our epic raffle, with prizes from our awesome sponsors Iko Iko, Rich Coffee, and Thunderpants. Big thanks to Kapinua for their continued support.

Can’t get enough derby? Check our social media for details on Sur5al lite happening earlier in the day! Tickets are valid for both events.

See you trackside for a Saturday night full of hits, hype, and high-level derby!

description:
XTrail Spring - Rangituhi Rumble, XTrail Spring - Rangituhi Rumble
Rangituhi serves up a lush and leg-burning journey through one of Porirua’s most scenic spots. Starting from Spicers Botanical Park, all three courses wind their way up through the peaceful, green trails of Spicers Forest before breaking into the rugged beauty of the Colonial Knob Reserve. The short course offers a more forgiving climb with playful zig zags and a fun descent, while the long course takes you all the way to the summit of Rangituhi, a proper challenge rewarded with stunning views over Porirua Harbour and beyond. With a mix of forest trails, farm tracks, and fast-flowing descents, this one’s a true highlight of the region.

https://barefootxtrail.co.nz/

description:
NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series- 2025 Round 4 - Faultline Wellington, Get your gains in the capital for the NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series grand finale. NiBS at Faultline in 2024 was the biggest climbing event ever in NZ so don’t miss out.
The NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series is all about having fun and giving it a go! Whether it’s your first climbing competition or you're a seasoned pro, you'll find challenges suited to your skill and confidence level, all within a friendly and supportive atmosphere.
Once the self-scored main rounds are done, the top 6 ranked female and male competitors in the open category advance to the finals. This is where the energy and music volume ramp up and we get to witness some incredible climbing from the best in the game.
Summary of Changes in 2025
- New online registration and scoring platform
- Scoring change, points awarded to each boulder divided by the number of successful tops
- Age group changes to reflect IFSC categories
- Finals format updated to 2025 IFSC Boulder rules
- Youth round (U11, U13, and U15 and caregivers) on Sunday morning
Please read the rules and info page below for more details on the changes: https://www.nibs.nz/rules-and-info
Don't forget to unleash your creative genius and set your own route using our amazing new logo! Try it here:
https://www.nibs.nz/routesetter

description:

Nestled between Te Papa and Chaffers Dock, right in the centre of the city, our event HQ at Waitangi Park unlocks the gorgeous Wellington waterfront. The course takes in all the sights - Te Papa, Whairepo Lagoon and the Well_ngton sign - as it follows the wide public esplanade around the harbour. Views forever and usually (always) a decent wind to chase you to the finish line.
After you finish your 5k - running or walking a flat, two-lap course around the waterfront - grab a banana and water or sport drink before heading back to your tent to see how your mates did. The best performances of the day - plus our amazing team managers - are acknowledged at the Awards Cermony at 7:30pm. Spot prizes wrap up around 8pm and there's time to exchange war stories as you pack down.

All 3 courses begin in the lush surroundings of Otari-Wilton’s Bush, New Zealand’s only native botanic garden, and wind their way up to the summit of Johnston Hill. The short course offers a rewarding climb and scenic descent, while the long course adds a little extra vert and extends your adventure along the iconic Skyline Track, with sweeping views over the city, coast, and beyond. With flowing trails and plenty of natural beauty, it’s a proper taste of Wellington’s wild backyard.

description:
Manawatu Saloon Champs + Sidecar Best Pairs, Manawatu Saloon Champs + Sidecar Best Pairs
Speedway action this Saturday night at the Robertson Prestige International Speedway where the Manawatu Saloon Championship is decided along with the exhilarating side-by-side Sidecar racing action for the AFC Motorcycles Sidecar Best Pairs. Saturday night will also see the return of V8 Modifieds racing wheel to wheel around the Robertson Prestige International Speedway. Fantastic SuperStocks, metal crunching Stockcars and eye-catching Minisprints add to a massive night of entertainment.

A quality field of drivers is expected for the sought after Manawatu Saloon Championship adding to a packed show at the Robertson Prestige International Speedway in the form of Corvettes, Camaros and Mustangs racing wheel-to-wheel. The wide tyres and thundering V8 engines add another style of speedway racing which is proving popular not only with drivers but the spectators alike. The Saloon racing this season has been competitive at the Robertson Prestige International Speedway with local drivers including 7p Clayton More, 57p Calvin Honore, 81p Jonathan Mason, and 242p Ashleigh King all looking to be in contention for the title.

Adding to the exciting programme is the AFC Motorcycles Sidecar Best Pairs which will see some of the country’s best sidecar combinations pair up and battle it out. With 14 combinations confirmed including 5p Wingnut & Sam McNaught, 8p Rob Miller & Jaxon Hannan, 17p Tony Hislop & Aidan Foothead, recent Ray Tarrant Sidecar Memorial winners 27b Craig Boaler & Kayla Meehan all included in the sensational field. The Robertson Prestige International Speedway has seen some spectacular Sidecar racing and this best pair championship is set to deliver this high calibre of entertainment for the fans once again!

With the return of the V8 Modifieds to the Robertson Prestige International Speedway, expect a high calibre of side-by-side racing from these v8 powered race cars with replica fiberglass car bodies and big wings! Drivers including Newton Gordge from Taranaki, Cody Hata from Auckland, 28w Ricky Dykstra and 9e Sheldon Arapere have indicated that they will be in attendance for this momentous return of Modified racing to the Robertson Prestige International Speedway.

Adding to the packed programme this Saturday night, the Superstocks will hit the track with grit, steel, and determination to be at the front of the pack. Metal crunching Stockcars will be battling it out for the chequered flag as well. Both classes race Side-by-side and bumper-to-bumper, these drivers in both classes mean business, with their fearless attitude and willingness to put on a show its anyone’s guess who will carry the chequered flag at the end of the race! Rounding out what is set to be a massive night the Minisprints make their return ahead of their Oval Superstars Tour first round the following weekend.

Classes in action are SuperStocks, Stockcars, Saloons, Sidecars, Modifieds, Minisprints

Drivers, please follow the below link to register your intention to race on the 22nd November
https://www.pnspeedway.co.nz/forms/22-11-2025

Please Note: Entries in other classes will determine whether Youth Ministocks are added to the programme later in the week.

Admission prices are $30 for an Adult (16 years and over), $10 for Children aged 8-15, and $70 for a Family pass of 2 adults and up to four children. Kids aged 7 and under are FREE.

Tickets are available to pre-purchase online from www.eventfinda.co.nz , (tickets purchased incur an additional service fee) or on race day from Gate 1 (Waldegrave Street), Gate 2 (Cuba Street - Bridge) and Gate 3 (Cook Street) from 5.30pm.

Racing Starts 6.30pm.

Click here to view a full list of the Arena terms and conditions of entry https://venuespn.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Terms-and-Conditions-of-Entry-2023.pdf

description:
Wellington Speed Dating for ages 25- 39 by Cheeky Events Australia, Wellington Speed Dating for ages 25- 39 by Cheeky Events Australia
Get ready for a night of fun and connection at Wellington's hottest speed dating event!

About this Event

Let’s ditch the apps together and embrace real connections. Say goodbye to the dating apps and hello to your very own Cheeky Love Story! 💖
🍸 What’s included: Your first drink is on us—let’s toast to great company!
👇How It Works:
Before the event:Make sure to download the Cheeky Events App (free on Google Play & the App Store) to set up your profile and upload a photo.
P.S. Don’t worry—it’s not a dating app! We’ve skipped the chat feature because we’re all about real, in-person connections.
During the event:
Check in to grab your name tag and free drink token. 🍻
Arrive on time to enjoy 15 minutes of casual pre-mingling.
Ladies stay seated while men rotate every 5 minutes—don’t forget to rate your matches in the app! 👍👎
Take a quick 15-minute break before the next round.
After the rotations, feel free to stick around for some extra socializing!
After the event: Stay for extra mingling and check the app for your cheeky matches 12 hours later! 📱💖
For more details, check out our blog: What to expect
Who knows? You might just find your next spark! ✨ Our IRL singles events (single mixers and speed dating events) are happening across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! 🌏

About Cheeky Events
We host fun, inclusive singles events across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! Whether you’re in your 20s, over 40, looking for love, or just looking to meet new people, our events are designed to bring people together. Whether you’re seeking romance, new friendships, or even networking, we’ve got something for everyone!
👉 Follow us on Instagram:@cheekyeventsaustralia @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekyeventsnewzealand @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekeventsus
Visit our website: www.cheekyevents.net or download the Cheeky Events app to get started.
We can’t wait to see you at one of our events soon! 🕺💃
#speeddating

Women’s Day of Action: Rise Up for Pay Equity

RSVP here: https://www.together.org.nz/wellington_party_for_pay_equity

132 years and one day after women secured the right to vote in Aotearoa, we are gathering again in strength and solidarity.

The Government gutted Pay Equity legislation that would have eased the cost of living and lifted pay of 182,000+ people. Across Aotearoa there will be activations to send a clear message: Pay equity is not optional. Our livelihoods should never be on the political chopping block.

📍 10:00am – Gather at Midland Park
💜 10:30am – Protest march down Lambton Quay to Parliament
🎤 11:00am – Rally at Parliament
🎉 11:30am – (doors open at 11am) Party for Pay Equity – a free, family-friendly celebration with kai, kids’ activities, live music and more! At Wellington Cathedral of St Paul.

Wear: purple, green and white in honour of suffrage

Everyone is welcome – bring your whānau, friends and community 💜💚🤍

description:
Bride Of The Year 2025, For 55 years, Wairarapa Bride of the Year has been a mainstay in the events calendar in the region. The event returns to the Wairarapa Events Centre for 2025, where brides who were married between 1 July and 30 June and were married in the Wairarapa, and/or have lived or are living in the Wairarapa, and/or whose spouse has lived in the Wairarapa, will get the chance to relive the magic of their big day, donning their gowns again, all while raising much needed funds for Te Awhina Plunket Wairarapa.

This event is unique in its focus on Wairarapa’s flourishing wedding industry. It is a great opportunity for couples planning their own weddings to look for inspiration from other local couples, for friends and families of brides to reminisce on the weddings. It is also an excellent opportunity to support Wairarapa Plunket and the service they provide to our community.

In 2024, the funds raised through Bride of the Year went towards purchasing equipment for use for Plunket rooms across Wairarapa along with purchase .

A ticket to Bride of the Year provides you with a night of glamour and celebration of love, all while supporting Wairarapa Plunket and the service they provide to our community.
