description:
Friends of Karori Cemetery: National Monuments (Dec 2025), The two main stops on the tour are the Cemeteries’ two national Monuments – the Tangiwai disaster and Prime Minister Peter Fraser.  We will review what happened at Tangiwai and especially the bravery of the trains crew and in addition, what the court of inquiry found about the safety of the bridge. 
Peter Fraser is generally regarded as one of NZ’s best Prime Ministers of the 20th century, and we explore his initiatives in public health and education and also his leadership during WW2.
These are just two of the several stops we will make.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
This tour requires reasonable physical fitness and sadly is not suited for those with limited mobility. 
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you 1 hour before the tour start time by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

description:
Live & Work in Japan! Q&A Evening with JET Programme Alumni, Have you ever wanted to live and work in Japan?
Come talk
to some people who've done it!
Every year, a diverse range of New Zealanders representing a variety of backgrounds, ages, interests, and cultures start a life-changing adventure in Japan-and next year that could include you!
With applications for the New Zealand JET Programme around the corner, you may have questions about what it's actually like to be sent off to live and teach in Japan for a year or more!
The JET Alumni Association of Wellington, in coordination with The Embassy of Japan, have organised a casual evening event for prospective applicants to ask those questions, and hear some stories to help you make a better decision about if the JET Programme is right for you.
Q&A event details
Date: 6th October 2025
Time: 17:30 - 19:30
Location: Yoshi Sushi & Bento (Press Hall, Willis Street)
Doors open from 5:30, with Q&A starting from 6:00.
Enjoy free
courtesy of Yoshi Sushi & Bento.
(Drinks, including Japanese
will also be available for purchase).
Admission to the event is FREE!
So come along and bring your friends
to this great opportunity to meet a handful of the thousands of Kiwis who've taken part in this programme over the past 40 years
Anyone interested in applying is welcome to attend!

What is the Japan Exchange Teaching (JET) Programme, you ask?
The JET Programme is an overseas employment opportunity to live and work in Japan for a year or more! You could soon head abroad on the adventure of a lifetime, and get paid for it!
Programme criteria includes the following-are you:
A New Zealand citizen?
Already graduated?
Or will have your Bachelor's Degree/Teaching Diploma conferred by early July 2026?
Interested in international activities?
Interested in teaching English to young people and living in Japan?

Positions available:
Assistant Language Teacher (ALT)
ALTs help the Japanese foreign language teachers in class and help prepare teaching materials and class activities. They may assist in English language clubs and other extra-curricular activities. Knowledge of Japanese is not required to be an ALT.
Coordinator for International Relations (CIR)
CIRs work in local government offices and are involved in international activities, which might include editing publications, translation work, advising on the planning and implementation of exchange programmes, and interpreting at international events. A functional knowledge of written and spoken Japanese is required to be a CIR.
For more information about the New Zealand JET Programme, visit:
https://www.nz.emb-japan.go.jp/itpr_en/jet.html
https://www.facebook.com/JETProgrammeNZ/
We hope to see you there!

description:
Wellington: Te Matapihi Central Library Tour, Te Matapihi/Wellington Central Library Tour with WCC and Athfield Architects

RICS invites members to a site visit of Te Matapihi ki te ao nui, Wellington’s soon-to-be-completed Central Library. Delivered in partnership with Athfield Architects, LT McGuinness, and Wellington City Council, (with Aurecon, Tihei, Fire HQ, Rider Levett Bucknall & RCP), this event offers a look at the revitalised civic space following completion of the main contract works (public opening scheduled for early 2026, following soft fit out).

The project includes extensive seismic strengthening—base isolators, new foundations, and structural upgrades, making Te Matapihi one of the most resilient public buildings in the city. It also targets a 5-star Green Building rating and will house the Library, Capital E/Experience Wellington, Council Archives, and Council Service Centre, in a single integrated facility.

PPE Required: Hard hat, Hi-Vis and steel toe cap boots.

Contact:
For more information on this event please contact Caleb Steiner (RICS Member Engagement Lead) at csteiner1@rics.org

Privacy:
Please note, your details may be shared with the RICS NZ Member Engagement Group where strictly necessary for coordination of this event. Please contact csteiner1@rics.org if you have any concerns or would like any additional information. For more information on how RICS collects and uses information please view our Privacy Policy - https://www.rics.org/oceania/footer/rics-privacy-policy/

FAQs:
How can I contact the organiser with any questions?
Should you require further information, please don't hesitate to contact Caleb Steiner - csteiner1@rics.org
Can I pay by invoice?
No, only credit card payments will be accepted for this event.
Can I update my registration information?
Yes, you can update the information on your order by clicking your order on the Tickets page. First, access the account menu, then select "Tickets." Second, select your order. Third, select “Edit” to update your information. Once you’re done, select “Save” to save changes.
Reschedule or Cancellation of Events
Due to the nature of events, we may require to reschedule or cancel due to unforeseen circumstances. We will do our best to email all attendees as soon as possible, should this occur. Should a reschedule or cancellation occur, RICS will not be responsible for any costs, damages or expenses (i.e. travel) etc. that you may suffer or incur.

If you have never experienced Mirimiri or Romiromi before, this is your opportunity! Treatment is beneficial for conditions of pain, misalignment, sports or work injuries and relief from emotional distress, stress & tension; while also supporting the body to realign and rebalance energetically.

description:
Earth & Embers: Women's Beltane Gathering, Earth & Embers: Women's Beltane Gathering
Join Tamsin & Sofia for an afternoon of connection, ritual, and celebration beneath the spring blooms. Beltane marks the height of spring, the half way point between the Spring equinox & Summer solstice. It’s a time of celebrating the union between the flowers and the bees, the sun and the land, and rekindling the creative fire within. It’s the season of fertility, joy, and remembering the sweet pleasures of being alive.

Together we’ll gather in sisterhood to honour the earth’s abundance and our own inner blooming. Through shared ritual, creating a heart opening elixir on the fire, movement, and nature craft, we’ll awaken the life force that moves through all things.

🌿 Our Circle Includes:
~ Opening Circle & Intention Setting
~ Cycle Wisdom & Seasonal Teachings
~ Foraging & Earth Altar Creation
~ Heart Opening Elixir & Journaling by the Fire
~ Embodiment & Celebration

You’ll leave feeling grounded, open-hearted, and reconnected with the beauty and vitality that lives within you, and all around you.

When: Sunday 2 November, 3:00–6:00 PM
Where: The Yurt, Mangaroa Farms (Upper Hutt)

Come as you are.
Let the earth remind you how to rekindle the pleasure of being alive. 🌷

description:
Yana- An Inward Journey of Release and Renewal, Mystic Creative warmly invites you to join us for a very special evening to close out the last part of 2025. You'll experience the opportunity to restore, recalibrate and realign your soul to its highest timeline for 2026 and beyond. This intimate event will have very limited capacity, to ensure a deep inward experience for all.
We will share in a sacred water ceremony with coherent water that has been structured, charged and infused with frequency- ready to be programmed with your intentions to release and shift into the new.
Next, we will connect with a Triple Cone Orgonite meditation, further amplifying the Euphoria to all, energising your intentions and clearing the way for the shifts to come.
With awareness of breath and the rhythmic handpan drumming, you will gently be guided inward to begin your journey and actualize your intentions.
The heartbeat of the journey is a very special 30 year old handmade Buffalo drum from Utah, USA. Yana is the beat we move and breathe to, the guide and the gateway, the beat of Mother Earth. Allow her depth and resonance to take you to places you’ve forgotten and re-introduce to you the primal heartbeat of humanity, of your humanity. 
An intentional weaving of a multitude of instruments, beats and frequencies that will take you to places deep within yourself: an opportunity to explore, feel and release what no longer serves you. As we move into higher frequencies of consciousness as a collective, we are being called to clear the old- expectations, stories, beliefs, programs, conditioning and paradigms. You bring the intention and Yana will guide you into surrender, allowing all that does not serve your highest timeline to fall away.
And as you gently re-emerge into the waking state, you'll experience the quiet and space to recalibrate and sink into the tenderness of renewal.
This journey is a sacred experience, designed to guide you through your own process. As such, this will mainly be a silent event (not social). We ask that you respect others by refraining from socializing in the space.
Namaste
Mystic Creative

description:
Temple • Breath • Sound & Gong Bath, Temple • Breath • Sound & Gong Bath

A Breath, Sound & Silence Journey ✨🌌🌬

Held by the Heavens | Bathed in Stillness | Anchored in Cosmic Light

𝗝𝗢𝗨𝗥𝗡𝗘𝗬 𝗕𝗘𝗬𝗢𝗡𝗗 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗩𝗘𝗜𝗟 — 𝗪𝗛𝗘𝗥𝗘 𝗦𝗢𝗨𝗟 𝗠𝗘𝗘𝗧𝗦 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗥𝗗𝗨𝗦𝗧 🌌🪐✨️🏕🌠

Nestled within a sacred Sanctuary under the starlit skies of Paraparaumu, you are invited to enter the realm of Ether — the invisible thread that weaves all of life. Here, the boundaries between body, breath, and spirit begin to dissolve into the spaciousness of the cosmos.

Cradled by silence, expanded through breath, and elevated by sound, this ceremony is a subtle, sacred transmission — a remembrance of your soul’s celestial origin.

This soulscape will guide you through:

• Gentle Breathwork to still the body and awaken presence
• Blue Lotus Ritual to open the heart and third eye
• Crystal Singing Bowls & Celestial Light Language
• Shamanic Gong encoded with Star Frequencies
• Intuitive Energy Transmissions
• Integration through Sacred Stillness

𝗕𝗟𝗨𝗘 𝗟𝗢𝗧𝗨𝗦 𝗥𝗜𝗧𝗨𝗔𝗟

Blue Lotus, known as the Flower of the Heavens, has been revered in ancient Egyptian and Eastern traditions as a plant of intuition, divination, and deep heart awakening. As you connect with the energy of Blue Lotus you are invited to soften your edges and expand your awareness into dream-like states — where insight, creativity, and emotional release naturally unfold. She is the guardian of the liminal realms, ushering you gently into etheric remembrance.

𝗕𝗘𝗡𝗘𝗙𝗜𝗧𝗦 𝗢𝗙 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗝𝗢𝗨𝗥𝗡𝗘𝗬:
• Deep Nervous System Regulation
• Heightened Intuition & Expanded Consciousness
• Enhanced Sleep & Dream States
• Emotional Release without Over-Processing
• Alignment with Soul & Cosmic Frequencies
• Gentle Detoxification & Energetic Clearing
• Cellular Recalibration & Vibrational Healing
• Connection to Divine Feminine & Cosmic Womb
• Inner Peace, Stillness & Mental Clarity

𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗦𝗔𝗖𝗥𝗘𝗗 𝗦𝗔𝗡𝗖𝗧𝗨𝗔𝗥𝗬
Nestled in the hills beside the Lotus Yoga Centre rests a sacred Meditation Sanctuary
a place where many come to reconnect, find inner stillness, and bathe in peace.

Built in 1999, this Sanctuary serves as the spiritual heart of the Centre’s activities.
The location itself was chosen with great care, resting at the meeting point of powerful ley lines, its energy deeply aligned with Kapiti Island and the Maungakotukutuku ranges to the east.

The octagon-shaped structure is crafted from natural timbers, crowned with a glass pyramid roof that amplifies and channels healing energies. Around its frame, tinted windows radiate the seven colours of the rainbow—each one carrying a unique healing ray. On a bright day, the play of colours is nothing short of spectacular, filling the space with a living rainbow of light.

𝙒𝙃𝘼𝙏 𝙏𝙊 𝙀𝙓𝙋𝙀𝘾𝙏:
• Doors open at 3.00PM for grounding & Blue Lotus
• Ceremony opens with breath & intention-setting
• 60-minute sound and silence journey in the sacred SANCTUARY.
• Integration circle to gently return and reflect
• Closing around 5:30PM

Your only task is to arrive with presence and openness, ready to receive what is already waiting within you.

𝙒𝙃𝘼𝙏 𝙏𝙊 𝘽𝙍𝙄𝙉𝙂:

• Any sacred objects (crystals, journal, totems) that support your journey

description:
Third Eye Hi-Fi Presents - Druid's Temple, Third Eye Hifi Presents:
Druids Temple
Rooted in the ancient traditions of the druids, this night channels the deep connection between land, spirit, and sound. The druids saw the earth as sacred — every tree, stone, and breath carrying rhythm and resonance. Their gatherings in the forests were not just rituals, but sonic ceremonies — where vibration, intention, and nature intertwined.
Carrying that lineage into the present, we gather once more — not in oak circles, but beneath the pulse of sub-bass and smoke. The dancefloor becomes our modern temple, a sacred space where frequencies align and collective energy moves as one.
Channeling ancient energy through modern frequencies, our array of homegrown and international artists bring their influence in the 130 / 140 bass music scene for an immersive experience to remember.

This deeply calming experience weaves Reiki energy with the vibrational medicine of chakra-attuned crystal singing bowls, offering a journey inward through sound and sensation.
Held in a Reiki-activated field, it invites you to rest the body, quiet the mind, and shift brainwaves into a deeply relaxed state, supporting nervous system regulation and emotional balance.
Come as you are. Let the sound carry you into stillness, and the energy bring gentle release.
Mats, eye masks and pillows are provided but you are invited to bring anything extra to add comfort!
Meet Nizaad, your host
Nizaad holding a Reiki-infused Sound Journey designed to support deep rest and realignment. Blending the healing frequencies of crystal singing bowls alongside other sacred instruments, her sessions are rooted in the belief that sound and energy are medicine. Coming from a lineage of energy healers, she weaves gentle Reiki throughout the session to support subtle energetic balance and emotional release. Participants simply need to lie down and allow the sound and energy to wash over them, inviting a calm, restorative space to reconnect with the body and return to balance.

description:
Yin Yoga and Soundscape, with Kellie and Chelsea, Join Kellie and Chelsea for a blissful evening of gentle yin yoga and sound.
Together, they have a unique passion for creating a container that allows you to deeply rest and nourish your whole self. Kellie and Chelsea's offerings are a sensory sanctuary. They allow participants the space to deeply rest and balance and reconnect with their nervous systems, using the power of yoga and sound. If you're looking to deeply nurture your inner landscape, this is set to be very special evening.
This collaborative offering is a two and a half hour live soundscape, featuring a 90 minute yin yoga nidra and guided meditation.
Allow your body to unravel in gentle, guided somatic yin yoga movements, encouraging deep relaxation and release, all while you are enveloped in the bliss of soothing, gentle sound vibrations.
Together, Kellie and Chelsea have a beautiful collection of sound tools and instruments, including but not limited to:
Two full sets of crystal singing bowls
The handpan and its earthy, resonant tones
Angelic harp melodies
Soft and gentle wind chimes
The shruti box and acoustic guitar, coupled with voice activation and sacred mantra
Come as you are, all are welcome. We cannot wait to meet you.
With love,
Chelsea and Kellie
XX
Please note: You will need a yoga mat, drink bottle, warm blanket, comfortable clothes and a pillow.

description:
Astrology: More Than Just Sun Signs, Astrology: More Than Just Sun Signs
Astrology is a beautiful and powerful way to journey inward and discover more about yourself. It helps us find the light within and recognize that same light in others.
In this workshop, we will open the doorway into the world of astrology. We will explore what astrology truly is, and discover the differences between traditional and modern Western approaches. Together, we’ll enter the natal chart to understand its key elements and the wisdom they hold.
We will uncover how all twelve zodiac signs live within each of us, reminding us that no soul is ever defined by a single sign. Along the way, you will also gain insight into why two people with the same Sun sign can feel so different. By the end of our time together, you will understand the meaning of the seven traditional planets, the twelve zodiac signs, and the twelve astrological houses—and see how they interlace to reveal the hidden patterns and the unique story of your soul.
Whether you are just beginning your journey with astrology, or already walk with some knowledge, this workshop will offer you guidance, clarity, and a deeper sense of connection—to yourself, to others, and to the stars.
Plus - your ticket includes a plant-based dinner & dessert!
Whats on the menu?!
Jackfruit Rendang
Fragrant Rice
Satay Skewer
Gado Gado Salad w/ Peanut Sauce
Banana Cake w/ Caramel Sauce
Hot Carob Drink
Meet Jelena, your host
Jelena has been passionate about astrology and was fortunate to begin her studies under the guidance of one of New Zealand’s most respected astrologers, who helped her start on the right path. From the very beginning, she has pursued her learning independently, drawing extensively from recommended books. Last year, she completed a course in Horary Astrology through the School of Traditional Astrology (STA). She is currently continuing her studies through a one-on-one course with a traditional astrology teacher in the UK while also receiving mentorship from an astrologer based in Perth, Australia.

An Evening of Live Mediumship and Healing with Aussie Medium, Simon Hay

Simon is a psychic medium, medical intuitive and healer. He travels throughout Australia and New Zealand doing private sessions and events. His down-to-earth style of mediumship is accurate, surprising, and entertaining.
At these events, Simon shares messages and accurate information from spirit, but he's passionate about educating about energy healing and mediumship so he also answers audience questions about his career. If you’re curious about communicating to spirit and energy healing, you’ll love this event.

• Q and A — ask questions about spirit and energy healing

description:
Reiki Level One - Wellington, New Zealand. Dec 13th & 14th, 2025.., Reiki Level One - Wellington, New Zealand. Dec 13th & 14th, 2025..
Discover the Gift of Reiki with Usui Reiki Level One

Usui Reiki is a gentle yet powerful method of natural healing, rediscovered by Mikau Usui over 100 years ago. It uses the flow of Universal Life Force energy to heal and rebalance the mind, body, and spirit. The beauty of Reiki lies in its simplicity and accessibility—everyone has the ability to connect with these healing frequencies. Reiki is a lifelong tool, ready to support you whenever you need it most.

In this Reiki Level One course, you will:
🌟 Learn how to perform a self-Reiki session and offer one-on-one Reiki to family and friends.
🌟 Receive the sacred Usui Reiki Level One attunement in person.
🌟 Begin a 21-day spiritual cleanse to integrate the energy shifts.
🌟 Study the history of Reiki, basic anatomy, chakra systems, and the frequencies of language and emotional states.
🌟 Gain practical tools to incorporate Reiki into your daily life.

Join embodiment facilitators Jenna Joan & Sonic Sutra for an evening of connection, ceremonial cacao, freeform movement, and live soundscape.

🌑 𝐒𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐝𝐚𝐲 𝟏𝟑 𝐒𝐞𝐩𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐞𝐫

🎟️ $𝟒𝟎–$𝟓𝟎

As the season turns to spring, we gather in remembrance—an invitation to embody the strength within and 𝐟𝐞𝐞𝐥 𝐡𝐨𝐰 𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐥 𝐰𝐢𝐬𝐝𝐨𝐦 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐠𝐡 𝐮𝐬. When we connect to our inner foundations, we touch the support of those who came before and deepen our sense of belonging to life itself.

We’ll begin with ceremonial cacao, then drop into a guided movement journey with live soundscape. There are no steps to learn, no performance—just presence, curiosity, and letting your body move as it feels. 𝐁𝐚𝐫𝐞𝐟𝐨𝐨𝐭 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐩𝐡𝐨𝐧𝐞-𝐟𝐫𝐞𝐞, 𝐲𝐨𝐮’𝐫𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐝𝐫𝐨𝐩 𝐝𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐟𝐫𝐞𝐞-𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭, 𝐚𝐰𝐚𝐤𝐞𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐩𝐚𝐫𝐭𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐦𝐚𝐲 𝐡𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐠𝐨𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐧.

𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐟𝐞𝐞𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐞𝐦𝐩𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐝, 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐞𝐝, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐚𝐥𝐢𝐯𝐞.

𝐒𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐢𝐬 𝐚 𝐠𝐮𝐢𝐝𝐞𝐝 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐩𝐫𝐚𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐡𝐞𝐥𝐩𝐬 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐭𝐮𝐧𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐛𝐨𝐝𝐲’𝐬 𝐰𝐢𝐬𝐝𝐨𝐦 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞 𝐟𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐝𝐞 𝐨𝐮𝐭. Unlike ecstatic dance, which is typically an open, DJ-led space with no facilitation, somatic dance offers gentle guidance to support you in exploring sensation, emotion, and embodiment in a safe, intentional way. You’re not learning steps or performing—you’re being invited into presence, curiosity, and feeling. With a focus on nervous system regulation, personal expression, and inner listening, somatic dance creates a nurturing space to come home to yourself.


𝐘𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐇𝐨𝐬𝐭𝐬...

𝐉𝐞𝐧𝐧𝐚 𝐉𝐨𝐚𝐧 | 𝐄𝐦𝐛𝐨𝐝𝐢𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐅𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐨𝐫
Jenna Joan is a somatic family constellation therapist, yoga teacher, and group facilitator who has been leading movement spaces for over 15 years. With a background in yoga, somatic dance, and therapeutic embodiment, her work blends play, authenticity, ancestral healing, and deep nervous system awareness. Jenna is also a cacao alchemist and ceremonial facilitator, known for creating safe, soulful spaces that invite freedom, connection, and inner exploration. She has been hosting workshops, retreats, and community events for nearly a decade, and also works 1:1 in more therapeutic settings.

𝐒𝐨𝐧𝐢𝐜 𝐒𝐮𝐭𝐫𝐚 | 𝐒𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜 𝐃𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐃𝐉
Sonic Sutra is a sound artist and somatic dance DJ who creates immersive musical journeys designed to support authentic movement, emotional release, and deep embodiment. With a focus on somatic dance and therapeutic soundscapes, their sets are intentionally curated to guide movers through an inner experience—honouring the body’s natural rhythms and the intelligence within. Their offerings create safe, accessible spaces for people of all bodies, backgrounds, and experience levels to explore movement, presence, and connection. Rooted in play, precision, and deep listening, Sonic Sutra brings music that moves beyond entertainment—into healing and transformation.

description:
Mexican Prehispanic Experience at AWHI, Join Claudio in his Mexican project called Xochipilli´s Eye. Xochipilli (Pronounce: Zo-chee-pee-lee) is the Mexica god of music, flowers, arts, and sacred plants.
Claudio´s last trip home to Mexico was full of inspiration, reconnecting him to his ancestral roots in Mexico City. He was fortunate to meet a prehispanic musician and instrument maker who plays and crafts beautiful traditional instruments. Claudio returned to NZ with many special new instruments; and continues to be inspired and guided by the cultural wealth, wisdom, and knowledge of the ancient cultures of the Americas.
This event will be extraordinary and unique. You will learn about Mexican prehispanic cosmology and spirituality. Experience simple and powerful rituals together with unique musical instruments used by Olmecs, Toltecs, Aztecs, and Mayans. The instruments include clay flutes, clay drums, medicine drums, ocarinas, wooden flutes, shells, and shakers skilfully arranged to create magical shamanic atmospheres.
We will be sharing Cacao which is an energetic traditional Mexican prehispanic drinks that help open the heart, reconnect with the earth element, ignite your fire, and get you up and moving.
What to expect:
Cleansing copal and herbal welcoming.
Talk about the use of music in the ancient times.
An opening ceremony to acknowledge the Tlalmanalli (offering and altar) with the deep sound of the conch shell in the four directions.
Cacao ceremony: Claudio will offer the cacao drink as a connection with the earth, to yourself, and the moment.
Live music that invokes many emotions and imagery, from contemplative natural and mystical environments to uplifting and empowering rhythms. You are free to project and explore within and/ or express and liberate projecting outwards.
We will finish with a shamanic atmosphere relaxation and close the event with a traditional chant.
No previous experience is required.
What to bring:
Wear comfortable clothing! Bring an open heart and a mind ready to learn and receive. You are also welcome to bring a fruit and or a flower to contribute to the altar.
Date & Time: Saturday, April 13th, 6-7:30pm
Location: AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing, Level 2, 15 Johnston Street, Wellington Central
Investment: $55

Mystic Creative warmly invites you to join us for a very special evening to close out the last part of 2025. You'll experience the opportunity to restore, recalibrate and realign your soul to its highest timeline for 2026 and beyond. This intimate event will have very limited capacity, to ensure a deep inward experience for all.

We will share in a sacred water ceremony with coherent water that has been structured, charged and infused with frequency- ready to be programmed with your intentions to release and shift into the new.

Next, we will connect with a Triple Cone Orgonite meditation, further amplifying the Euphoria to all, energising your intentions and clearing the way for the shifts to come.

With awareness of breath and the rhythmic handpan drumming, you will gently be guided inward to begin your journey and actualize your intentions.

The heartbeat of the journey is a very special 30 year old handmade Buffalo drum from Utah, USA. Yana is the beat we move and breathe to, the guide and the gateway, the beat of Mother Earth. Allow her depth and resonance to take you to places you’ve forgotten and re-introduce to you the primal heartbeat of humanity, of your humanity.

An intentional weaving of a multitude of instruments, beats and frequencies that will take you to places deep within yourself: an opportunity to explore, feel and release what no longer serves you. As we move into higher frequencies of consciousness as a collective, we are being called to clear the old- expectations, stories, beliefs, programs, conditioning and paradigms. You bring the intention and Yana will guide you into surrender, allowing all that does not serve your highest timeline to fall away.

And as you gently re-emerge into the waking state, you'll experience the quiet and space to recalibrate and sink into the tenderness of renewal.

This journey is a sacred experience, designed to guide you through your own process. As such, this will mainly be a silent event (not social).

description:
EYA Presents: The Bible and the Sacraments Bible Study, What are the Sacraments? Where do they come from? What do they mean? And why are they so central to our Catholic Faith?
In The Bible and the Sacraments, you’ll discover the deeply biblical roots of the Seven Sacraments and how they are more than mere Church rituals, but streams of life flowing from the living Body of Christ.
Throughout this study, you’ll discover how God has always dealt with His people through “sacraments,” and how the sacraments of the Old Testament find their ultimate fulfillment in the Seven Sacraments instituted by Christ and celebrated in the Catholic Church to this day.
Eucharistia Young Adults (EYA) introduces our second Bible study for 2025! This eleven-lesson Bible study by St Paul Center will delve into the beauty of the sacraments of the Catholic Church.
Please bring your Bible, journal, pen - and of course, your lovely self! Bring your friends, co-workers, family members, the more the merrier!

description:
Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington, Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington
This September Wesley Huff is joining Thinking Matters for the Truth Matters Tour in Dunedin, Christchurch, Wellington and full-day Conference in Auckland.

While in Wellington, he will be doing his only Christian Leaders Lunch.

Proceedings
Doors will open 11:15 am
11:30 am - the event will begin with a short powhiri/mihi whakatau
11:50 am - Kai
12:20 pm - Wes will present his talk and do q and a
1:30 pm - Conclusion of event
About Wesley Huff
Wesley Huff was born in Multan, Pakistan, and spent a portion of his childhood in the Middle East. After being diagnosed with a rare neurological condition at the age of eleven that left him paralyzed from the waist down, Wes experienced a miraculous recovery for which the doctors themselves had no medical explanation. This experience, along with a great deal of study and soul searching in his later teen years, solidified his interest in faith and in engaging the beliefs and worldview perspectives of others. He spent his high school years in Northern Ontario and currently lives in Toronto, Canada, with his wife and three children.

Wesley is currently the Central Canada Director for Apologetics Canada and has been a guest on a variety of public platforms, from The Joe Rogan Experience and Piers Morgan Uncensored, to Apologia Radio and Daily Dose of Wisdom. He has participated in numerous public dialogues, debates, and interfaith events on issues of belief and religion globally.

He holds a BA in sociology from York University, a Masters of Theological Studies from Tyndale University, and is currently doing a PhD in New Testament at the University of Toronto’s Wycliffe College.

description:
Yin Yoga & Sound Healing, Take an evening to slow down and reconnect. This session weaves together the meditative stillness of yin yoga with the restorative vibrations of sound healing — an immersive experience that invites both body and mind to unwind.

Through long-held yin postures, you’ll be guided to soften rather than strive, creating gentle openings and space for deeper release. The live sound journey adds another layer — resonant frequencies that ripple through the body, calming the nervous system and encouraging inner stillness.

Emma offers a trauma-informed yin practice grounded in compassion and self-awareness, drawing on her own personal growth and understanding of what it means to truly rest. Paired with Alex’s soundscapes, the evening becomes a tender exploration of presence and renewal.

We’ll close with a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert — a simple way to share warmth, grounding, and connection after the practice.

All levels are welcome.

Meet Emma, your yoga teacher
Emma holds a 100-hour trauma-informed Yin Yoga teacher certification, blending her corporate experience with a deep understanding of self-care. Emma's classes are designed to help create a safe space where you can relax and connect with your body. Her approach to teaching yin is purposeful, driven by a strong desire to empower students through mindful and compassionate practices. Her journey is rooted in self-growth and connection, with a strong focus on nourishing the body as an essential part of this.

Meet Alex, your sound healer
Alex is a sound healing practitioner devoted to nurturing healing in both mind and body. She believes that sound vibration holds the power to expand consciousness and restore harmony and balance in our lives. Her journey into sound healing began with the realization of how deeply sound vibration was affecting her psyche—making her more mindful of the music she listens to and the intention it carries. Along the way, she has drawn inspiration from artists such as Deva Premal, The Flying Mystics, Stevin McNamara, and the Bhakti Lounge Kirtan. Their music has profoundly influenced her own sound healing practice, inspiring her to explore sound as a tool for transformation, connection, and inner peace.

description:
Singing Circle, Join the circle for gentle singing and connection. We will sing and chant to wrap ourselves and the world with songs of peace and compassion.
The songs are easy to pick up with very few words. You will be invited to sing some harmonies as you feel able and have the choice to pick the voice part that works best for you.
Enjoy vocal freedom in a relaxed and supportive environment. Sing for well-being and connection with the world. This session is FREE. KOHA welcome and optional to cover costs.
The Garden Room is situated at the back of St Peter's church. Please bring some flameless candles, a cushion or a blanket if you want to sit on the floor, and bottled water.

description:
2025 Pūkaha Wairarapa Garden Tour, 2025 will mark 15 years of Pūkaha’s much-loved annual fundraiser – the Wairarapa Garden Tour.

This two-day, self-drive garden tour will feature beautiful and unique gardens in North Wairarapa.

Highlights include…

Scenic Garden Trails
Wander through enchantingly designed gardens adorned with an abundance of native plants, exotic flowers, and captivating sculptures.

Meet the Gardeners
Gain insights from passionate gardeners who have nurtured these landscapes into works of art.

Exclusive Workshops
Learn gardening tips and tricks from experts, and uncover the secrets behind creating and maintaining a stunning garden.

The Market Fair
Indulge in delectable local cuisine and beverages and shop quality local handicrafts amidst picturesque surroundings.

Pick your gardens and choose your route according to whatever tickles your gardening fancy. The tour offers at least a dozen private gardens (not usually open to the public) to choose from. Gardens are revealed in the lead-up to tour weekend.

Locally-sourced and home-made refreshments will be available in selected gardens and BYO picnics are welcome in some gardens. Look for the icons to guide you.

Ticketed Event- early Bird tickets on sale 15 September 2025

description:
Wellington Botanist Expo, Wellington Botanist Expo
🌿🍻 Wellington, get ready for the ultimate green-meets-brews experience!

The Wellington Botanist Expo is hitting Brewtown, Upper Hutt on Sunday, 26 October 2025, and it's going to be a bloomin’ brilliant day out! 🌼✨

Whether you’ve got a jungle at home or you're just starting your plant parent journey, this is THE botanical event you don’t want to miss. Set in the heart of Brewtown, with its buzzing vibe and family-friendly fun, it’s your one-stop destination for plants, pints, and pure inspiration.

🌿 Here’s what’s waiting for you:
🪴 A paradise of indoor & outdoor plants, seedlings, seeds & greenery galore
🛍️ Gorgeous pots, planters & plant accessories to style your space
🌸 Stunning dried flower arrangements & botanical crafts
🎨 Eye-catching garden sculptures, outdoor art & furniture ideas
🎁 Unique creations from local artists & plant-loving crafters

🍻 And yes – it’s Brewtown, so there’s plenty of craft beer and good vibes to enjoy while you shop!

🚆 Getting here is easy – hop on the train from Wellington City and arrive right at the venue, hassle-free.
🚗 Ample FREE parking also available for drivers.
🍔 Food, drinks & licensed venues onsite
👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Family-friendly fun for all ages!

📅 Save the date: Sunday, 26 October 2025 | 9am – 2pm
📍 Location: Brewtown, Upper Hutt

✨ Come for the plants, stay for the brews, and leave totally inspired.
It’s the botanical event of the season – don’t miss out! 🌿🍺

#BrewsAndBotany #WellingtonBotanistExpo #BrewtownMarkets #FoxtailEvents #PlantLoversParadise #SupportLocalNZ #UpperHuttEvents

description:
Fabric-a-brac 2025, Fabric-a-brac returns to Wellington for our second event in 2025!

The first Fabric-a-brac was held in Wellington 15 years ago - we're sew excited to still be here, bring the sewing community together and raising money for Mary Potter Hospice.
Fabric-a-brac is a fun fabric and sewing supplies market where you can shop for vintage and modern sewing and upholstery fabric, patterns, haberdashery and more. It brings the sewing community together to share stashes, stories and delight in our mutual love of textiles.
Fabric-a-brac is volunteer-run, and is a fundraiser for hospice - in Wellington this is Mary Potter Hospice. All profits from this event are donated to their work. We've raised $80,000 since our first event in 2009.
Selling fabric
If you have a stash you'd like to sell, you can come and take a stall. You pay a stallholder fee (which goes to Hospice) but anything you make on the day is yours to keep. Stalls are allocated via a ballot, which will take place closer to the time. Go to our website to find the form. Closes mid August.

If you have fabric, haberdashery or patterns you'd like to move on, but don't want to have a table, you can donate items. This will all go onto the hospice table on the day, and all profits will go to their wonderful work.
Fabric donation points
- Made Marion
- Mary Potter Hospice - you can take donations to the Mary Potter Hospice in Mein St, Newtown

Pop-up cafe
The fabulous cafe is back with all of its gorgeous volunteers and fab food. There will be tea, coffee and sweet treats for sale, so you can sit down and chat over your new projects and fabric purchases. All proceeds from the cafe also go to Hospice.
Buying fabric
Bring cash - most stallholders and the cafe will be selling by cash only.
We look forward to seeing our fabulous fabric and sewing community soon!
*Saturday September 20 2025
*St Anne's Parish Hall, Emmett Street, Newtown, Wellington

Nos es grato invitar a toda la comunidad peruana e iberoamericana y al público en general a participar en la Sagrada Misa y en la Feria de Cultura Peruana en honor al Señor de los Milagros que tendrán lugar el sábado 1 de noviembre en la Parroquia St. Joseph, ubicada en Mount Victoria, Wellington, en la que podrán degustar deliciosos platillos peruanos y apreciar coloridas y hermosas danzas del Perú, música, y más.

description:
Martial Law Film Screening, In remembrance of the victims of human rights violations and extrajudicial killings during the Martial Law in the Philippines, please join us for a free/koha screening of the "Batas Militar" documentary in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.
NOTE: For a list of trigger warnings, please see this document. Since we will be viewing and discussing potentially sensitive topics, the event will have an Open Door Policy, which means that you may leave the venue any time, for any reason, and will not be judged for doing so.
WHAT IS MARTIAL LAW?
"Martial law refers to the replacement of civil rule by military rule. This may be characterized by curfews, the dispensation of military tribunal rulings on civilians, and the suspension of the privilege of the writ of habeas corpus. The writ of habeas corpus, which in Latin refers to “having the body”, is a citizen’s protection against unlawful imprisonment. This is suspended in times of crisis to expedite justice" (Martial Law Museum).
WHY IS IT IMPORTANT TO TALK ABOUT TODAY?
Human rights violations and extrajudicial killings are still on-going in the Philippines under President Bongbong Marcos, the son of the dictator Ferdinand Marcos Sr. who proclaimed Martial Law in 1972, and Vice President Sara Duterte, the daughter of former President Rodrigo Duterte who spearheaded the violent War on Drugs in 2016 (Karapatan).
WHY WOULD I WANT TO JOIN THE FILM SCREENING?
The film screening is for anyone who is keen to learn about the Martial Law Era, wants to share their experience during the Martial Law (or something similar) through group discussion, wants to meet new people, wants to watch a Philippine film/documentary, or just wants to have snacks.
I WANT TO JOIN BUT I'M FROM TĀMAKI MAKAURAU / CHRISTCHURCH / THE PHILIPPINES.
We will stream the film through Zoom for viewers outside Te Whanganui-a-Tara, however, there may be internet and other technical difficulties during the event itself. Also please make sure to select the "Online" ticket option when RSVPing.
HOW MUCH IS THE TICKET?
The film screening is free but we appreciate koha for the venue/snacks/donations to Philippine non-governmental organisations (NGOs).
NOTE: This is an LGBTQ+ friendly event.

Discover the magic of your regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Kaitoke Regional Park is more than just a beautiful place—it’s a hub for conservation. Greater Wellington’s work here protects freshwater, restores native bush, preserves historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers play a vital role in keeping this park special.

description:
Mystery 35mm Movie Marathon, Details
UPDATE - We have added some Half Marathon ticket options for those can't make the whole event. You can either select 'Daytime' or 'Evening' which will let you watch three features total. Daytime tickets are from 1:30pm until the dinner break (around 7:00pm). Evening are from the dinner break until the end of the last film.

Surprise we are running a 35mm Mystery Marathon very soon! We have had some exciting news that we cannot share for now but as a result we must move our beautiful 35mm from its usual location into storage for a bit. We are not sure when it will be set back up so to celebrate we are running a marathon of six 35mm features across one Saturday!

We will kick off the first film at 1:30pm sharp on Saturday and will have a short dinner break after the third film. All going to plan we should be done by around 12:30am.

In terms of the features, we have films from the 1960s through to the early 2000s with a mix of comedies, sci-fi, horror and cult classics! Granted not all of these films would be considered masterpieces but there is nothing more fun than sitting in a crowd not knowing what could be coming next!

We will have a snack menu you can pre-order before the first film so aim to arrive around 1:00pm to order. The breaks between films will be very short (probably just enough time for the projectionist to thread up the next film) so make sure you come prepared for back-to-back screenings.

This event has strictly no digital projection, it’s all film all the time. Now in theory it should all playback without a hitch as we are bringing in some of the best projectionist’s Wellington has. But 35mm is a strange beast that can sometimes throw up the odd issue.

Full marathon tickets (Admit) are $50
Half Marathon - Daytime are $30
Half Marathon - Evening are $30

Seating is general admission and cinema entrance will be determined by earliest ticket purchase times.

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - A Room with a View, A Room With a View captured the attention of the world upon its release, bringing the novel by E.M. Forster to dazzling life in the Florentine countryside and in the well-appointed homes of the English Edwardian upper classes. A comedy of manners with a quick wit and impeccable comic timing, A Room With A View is also a portrait of the quiet solitude that lies beneath Forster’s characters, and of the need for human connection in a world of rigid convention.

The young Englishwoman Lucy Honeychurch (played by Helena Bonham Carter), arrives in Florence on a Baedecker-style grand tour with her aunt Charlotte Bartlett (Maggie Smith). Through a series of events involving English expatriates Miss Eleanor Lavish, an unflappable novelist (Judi Dench), and the Emersons, a free-thinking father and son (played by Denholm Elliot and Julian Sands), Lucy’s life is changed forever under a loggia in Florence and in the Tuscan countryside.

Ivory’s delicate and playful direction spirits us from an adventure in the back alleys of Florence, lost with Dench and Smith, to the lace-parasolled rigidity of English lawn parties. Shot on location in and around Florence (including unforgettable scenes in the Piazza della Signoria and at Giotto’s frescoes in Santa Croce), A Room With A View made stars not only of Bonham Carter, Day Lewis and Sands, but of the Tuscan landscapes and Puccini arias (as sung by Kiri Te Kanawa) featured throughout.

Director
James Ivory

Producer
Ismail Merchant

Cast
Maggie Smith, Helena Bonham Carter, Denholm Elliot, Julian Sands

description:
NZIFF: Sex, Returning from last year’s Festival to screen alongside the rest of his Sex Dreams Love trilogy, Dag Johan Haugerud’s comic drama takes a candid and refreshing look at modern gender roles.

There has hardly been any investigation on contemporary male identity and sexuality as candid, insightful and hilarious as Norwegian auteur Dag Johan Haugerud’s Sex. After winning all major laurels in Nordic cinema with his impressive fresco Beware of Children (2019), the acclaimed director and author embarkson an Oslo-set trilogy simply called Sex Dreams Love.

The first instalment opens on one of the most tantalising and unexpected preludes in recent cinema. Two chimney sweeps frankly open up to each other on a coffee break in their office: the first reveals that he dreamt of being intensely looked at by none other than David Bowie, who was inspecting him as if he was a woman; the other confesses that he recently accepted the sexual advances of a male customer who asked him to have sex with him. But both men are “straight” and married to women. Here, the deft tone of the film and Haugerud’s rules of the game are immediately set.

A fervent admirer of Eric Rohmer’s thickly scripted skirmishes of love and ethics, the Norwegian writer-director infuses irony, depth and compassion in each of his elegantly composed tableaux depicting how the two men cope with the turmoil these experiences bring to their relationships with their partners and family, but most of all with themselves. Featuring some of the brightest and funniest dialogues of 2024, Sex is a real eye-opener. — Paolo Bertolin
label: Film & Media

Based on the stage musical by Richard O’Brien, The Rocky Horror Picture Show shattered conventions with its bold characters, flamboyant style, and infectious rock ’n’ roll soundtrack.
When a newly engaged couple’s (Barry Bostwick and Susan Sarandon) car breaks down on a rainy night, they wind up in the creepy castle of Dr. Frank-N-Furter (Tim Curry). There, they have an adventure that will thrill you, chill you and fulfil you like never before!

description:
Les Parapluies de Cherbourg (The Umbrellas of Cherbourg), Free Screening. Tuesday 11 November , doors open at 6 for the programme to start at 6:30 to conclude at 8:45. This will be in the Student Union, Memorial Theatre (SUMT 228; follow signage), Te Herenga Waka Vitoria University of Wellington (entrance via Kelburn Parade). See map of the campus here.
Les Parapluies de Cherbourg (The Umbrellas of Cherbourg), 
Jacques Demy, 1964 (91 minutes).
With Catherine Deneuve and music by Michel Legrand.
There will be an introduction and a Q&A discussion after the film.
 In Les Parapluies de Cherbourg, Jacques Demy transforms a simple love story into an enchanting and bittersweet musical. In the rain-soaked port of Cherbourg, Geneviève, played by Catherine Deneuve, propelled to stardom after her first major role, and Guy (Nino Castelnuovo) are separated when he is drafted for war in Algeria. Every line is sung (Michel Legrand is the film composer), every emotion is painted in luminous hues (poetic realism meets pop art), as Demy fuses everyday realism with operatic stylisation. Beneath its pastel beauty lies melancholy: love eroded by class, an unpopular colonial war and social conventions. Demy’s art finds poetry in artifice, a fragile harmony between dream, music, and loss. Winner of the Palme d’Or at the 1964 Cannes Film Festival.
 In his introduction to the film and in its subsequent Q&A session, Assoc. Prof.  Thierry Jutel (who, like Jacques Demy, hails from Nantes) along with Dr Missy Molloy from the Film Programme at Te Herenga Waka Victoria University of Wellington will discuss the iconic status of the film in French popular culture and its influence on generations of filmmakers. This will be Dr Jutel’s last public lecture at Victoria prior to his retirement.
 An event facilitated by the support of Te Herenga Waka Victoria University of Wellington and the Embassy of France in Wellington.
label: Film & Media

British and Irish Film Festival - Spinal Tap II: The End Continues, The long-awaited sequel to the comedy classic This is Spinal Tap is here to turn the Festival up to 11!

Forty-one years after the release of the original groundbreaking mockumentary, the now estranged bandmates David St. Hubbins, Nigel Tufnel, and Derek Smalls (Michael McKean, Christopher Guest, and Harry Shearer) are forced to reunite for one final concert.

Spinal Tap II: The End Continues also marks the resurrection of documentarian Marty Di Bergi (Rob Reiner), who once again tries to capture his favourite metal gods as they contemplate mortality—and the hope that their 12th drummer doesn’t join them in The Great Beyond.

Joined by music royalty Paul McCartney and Elton John, Spinal Tap wrestles with their checkered past to put on a concert that they hope will solidify their place in the pantheon of rock ’n’ roll.

Offensive language & sexual references
Director
Rob Reiner

description:
CIVIC: Short Film Screenings, Shifting Centre presents CIVIC: Short Film Screenings featuring works by local Te Whanganui-a-Tara based artists Veronica Lyu, Matariki Bennett & Eve Naicker.
Featured Short Films:
"Less Ness" by Veronica Lyu.
    Out of your body
                                                                Controlled

        Happening      over and over            
                                                                                         Again

                      Out of time                            
                                                  Nothing
                                                Everything
Never Enough
                     
                                   Waiting                                                                 Waiting            
         
It feels like you haven’t even started
         
                                                                              It’s you.
"Te Kohu" by Matariki Bennett
TE KOHU is the story of 14 year-old Hinehou and her sister, 17 year-old Whetū. In their isolated settlement of Te Ngahere, Hinehou knows Whetū is searching – searching for who she is, for the skin she should truly inhabit, and that she doesn’t belong in this small town. Hinehou comes to learn, it’s not about the place – Whetū doesn’t belong to this world. She belongs to the world of the ethereal Patupaiarehe - the mischievous fairy tribe of the forest mist. But as Hinehou grows to understand her sister's heart belongs with the Patupaiarehe, Hinehou must face the question - can she let her sister go?
"Tied Together" by Eve Naicker
Follows two strangers who paths keep crossing. A boy who never ties his shoes. A girl who starts to notice. As their friendship quietly deepens, something unseen begins to pull them closer, a gentle, inevitable, like a thread tugging through time.
"Notice" by Eve Naicker
Follows a character through a series of ordinary days, highlighting the contrast between their digital focus and the richness of the outside world they're tuned out from. But when an unexpected event disrupts their rhythm, they're forced to put the phone away and for the first time, begin to truly see what's been there all along. The Art of Noticing.
TIME: 5:00PM & 6:00PM
LOCATION: Cinema, Te Auaha (65 Dixon Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011)

General Admission $10.00
Unwaged $5.00
Aroha Ticket $30.00 (GA + $20 donation)

description:
War on Drugs Film Screening, In remembrance of the victims of human rights violations and extrajudicial killings during the War on Drugs in the Philippines, please join us for a free/koha screening of "On the President's Orders" documentary in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.

NOTE: For a list of trigger warnings, please see this document. Since we will be viewing and discussing potentially sensitive topics, the event will have an Open Door Policy, which means that you may leave the venue any time, for any reason, and will not be judged for doing so.
WHAT IS THE WAR ON DRUGS?
Spearheaded by the former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte, the War on Drugs is a violent anti-drug campaign which killed nearly 30,000 Filipinos, most of which were urban poor (Karapatan, Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch).
WHAT ARE EXTRAJUDICIAL KILLINGS?
"Extrajudicial killings, or extrajudicial executions, happen when someone in an official position deliberately kills a person without any legal process" (World Organisation Against Torture).
WHY IS IT IMPORTANT TO TALK ABOUT TODAY?
Human rights violations and extrajudicial killings are still on-going in the Philippines under President Bongbong Marcos, the son of the dictator Ferdinand Marcos Sr. who proclaimed Martial Law in 1972, and Vice President Sara Duterte, the daughter of former President Rodrigo Duterte (Karapatan).
WHY WOULD I WANT TO JOIN THE FILM SCREENING?
The film screening is for anyone who is keen to learn about the War on Drugs, wants to share their experience during the War on Drugs (or something similar) through group discussion, wants to meet new people, wants to watch a Philippine film/documentary, or just wants to have snacks.
I WANT TO JOIN BUT I'M FROM TĀMAKI MAKAURAU / CHRISTCHURCH / THE PHILIPPINES.
We will stream the film through Zoom for viewers outside Te Whanganui-a-Tara, however, there may be internet and other technical difficulties during the event itself. Also please make sure to select the "Online" ticket option when RSVPing.
HOW MUCH IS THE TICKET?

description:
NZIFF: War Stories Our Mothers Never Told Us, Seven women reflect on the emotional cataclysm of World War II in Dame Gaylene Preston’s landmark contribution to the collective memory of Aotearoa, which has lost none of its raw power on its 30th anniversary.

When young New Zealanders were mobilised as soldiers and sent across the globe to join the frontlines of Britain’s fight against Nazi Germany, the turbulence of the Second World War travelled back into South Pacific living rooms. Distance and death became everyday realities for Kiwis at home – and caused griefs that were at times taboo and suppressed.

Dame Gaylene Preston frames seven women, including her own mother, against a black background that creates a stage for their candid, unadorned and surprisingly intimate wartime recollections, as they look back from the 90s in interviews conducted by oral historian Judith Fyfe. The acclaimed documentary, which combines these shared testimonies with personal photographs and newsreel clips, conveys the immense pressure to conform to the value of stoic sacrifice for the cause under the scrutinising eye of neighbours, and reveals lesser-seen layers of resilience.

Marriages in the first flush of romance were cut short, pregnancies were navigated alone, conscientious objectors were met with ostracisation and American servicemen scorned, in a nation united around support of their boys in combat overseas – a state of affairs in which women were often granted little voice, as they took on more labour, and absorbed life-changing losses. — Carmen Gray
label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: Twinless, A grieving brother finds an unlikely connection at a support group for siblings who have lost a twin, but his burgeoning bromance threatens to turn into something darker in this uncomfortably sharp-witted comedy.

When his brother is suddenly killed in a car accident, estranged sibling Roman (Dylan O’Brien) suffers the unique pain of being permanently severed from his twin. Inseparable in childhood, the brothers drifted apart as adults, brother Rocky (also O’Brien) living out and proud in Portland while Roman lived a (decidedly hetero) tradie life in hometown Idaho. It seems he’ll never have the chance to work through his complicated feelings towards his twin until stumbling upon a bereavement group for just such a purpose.

There he meets Dennis (James Sweeney). Neurotic, sarcastic, gay, he’s the opposite that attracts as the pair bond over trauma and a deep need for attachment. They quickly become each other’s emotional support twin-surrogate, on call for late night grocery trips, afterwork bitch sessions, and road trip singalongs. But odd couple bliss can’t last, as Dennis has more than friendship in mind, Roman grapples with explosive anger issues, and dark secrets inevitably come to light.

Sweeny’s sophomore effort as writer, director, and co-star walks an entertaining balance between discomfort and hilarity. With finely calibrated performances from both leads, Twinless is witty, warped, and surprisingly warm hearted. — Adrian Hatwell
label: Film & Media

Early reviews back up claims that this intense and emotional exploration of boyhood is one of the most powerful Stephen King adaptations ever made – one that will stay with you long after you leave the cinema.
Based on King’s 1979 novel, the film is co-written by JT Mollner (‘Strange Darling’) and directed by Francis Lawrence (‘Constantine’, ‘The Hunger Games’ franchise) – features a sensational young cast alongside living legend Mark Hamill as our sinister antagonist.
Come to the cinema early to enjoy our themed lobby and custom pre-show… and don’t forget to drink plenty of water beforehand

description:
NZIFF: Mirrors No. 3, In the wake of a traumatic incident, a young woman forms a surrogate mother-daughter relationship with her rescuer. As emotional walls come down, doubts arise: is there more to the care offered than simple kindness?

Laura and Betty seem to be poles apart. Laura, a young, city dwelling music student, lives in an apartment with her boyfriend; Betty has an adult son and lives alone in rural Germany. Their lives are thrown together after a car accident leaves Laura in the care of the older woman. Despite ostensible differences, each recognises a familiar melancholy in the other. As a tentative trust grows, the women find something unlocking within themselves, even as complicating factors emerge, in the form of Betty’s opaque family situation.

Master dramatist Christian Petzold reunites with frequent acting collaborator Paula Beer (Transit, Undine, Afire) and regular DOP Hans Fromm, turning his pen and camera to a smaller scale domestic drama. Mirrors No. 3 (named for a Ravel piano piece played within) makes visual and thematic echoes back to Petzold’s previous work: from extended bike rides down rural lanes (Barbara), to the centrality of a piano (Phoenix), as well as the thread of mysterious tension that underlies them all. The film revels in the messy, stimulating complexities of human relationships, exploring the way that sometimes even questionable motivations can affect positive outcomes. — Jacob Powell

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - The History of Sound, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Festival de Cannes 2025 -

Based on the acclaimed book by Ben Shattuck, Paul Mescal (Aftersun, All of Us Strangers) and Josh O’Connor (The Crown, Challengers) play star-crossed lovers in this sweeping, moving and tender romance from Oliver Hermanus (Living).

In 1917, Lionel (Mescal) — a young, talented music student — meets David (O’Connor) at the Boston Conservatory, where they bond over a deep love of folk music.

Years later, Lionel receives a letter from David, leading to an impromptu journey through the backwoods of Maine to collect traditional songs. This unexpected reunion, ensuing love affair, and the music they collect and preserve, will shape the course of Lionel’s life far beyond his own awareness.

Paul Mescal and Josh O’Connor’s star turns received rave reviews when The History of Sound premiered at the Cannes Film Festival earlier this year, making this quiet but powerful drama a must-see at the British and Irish Film Festival 2025.
Rating
Sex scenes & suicide references
Director
Oliver Hermanus
Cast
Paul Mescal, Josh O’Connor, Chris Cooper

description:
NZIFF: Sentimental Value, This film may touch on the familiar theme of how artists draw from their own lives, but Renate Reinsve and Stellan Skarsgard bring incredible tenderness to a story that is ultimately about what children and parents never say to one another — and whether those lifelong silences can ever be broken.
Collaborating again with frequent co-writer Eskil Vogt (now also a successful director), Trier fashions a nuanced look at both a troubled family and a dysfunctional film industry. (Gustav’s comeback project will be distributed through Netflix, and the divisive streamer is the target of a couple of the screenplay’s better barbs.) Much of Sentimental Value takes place in the Borg family’s home, and an efficient flashback, framed as an essay Nora wrote as a girl, explains how they have lived in the house for generations… That slightly fading family home becomes an apt metaphor for the weathered bond Nora, Agnes and Gustav share, although Reinsve’s fragile performance articulates the festering resentment she feels toward her absent father.
Trier’s third picture to screen at Cannes, after 2021’s The Worst Person In The World’s breakout lead Reinsve won Best Actress, the reunion of director and star will entice arthouse crowds… and those seeking a smart, thoughtful tearjerker should be pleased with this sentimental but farfrom-mawkish film.” — Tom Grierson, Screen Daily

Saturday Laughs with Samantha Hannah and Wilson Dixon, Saturday Laughs at Abandoned Taproom Petone is a showcase of some of your favourite comedians in the heart of Petone

Hailing from Cripple Creek Colorado, country music legend, Wilson Dixon’s melodic philosophies on life have seen him become one of the most loved characters on the Aust, UK and NZ circuit.
He has had sold out season’s at The New International Comedy Festival and has won awards for Best Show and in 2010 he won the supreme Festival Award The Fred for outstanding artistic achievement.
Before sweeping the New Zealand International Comedy Festival his show ”Wilson Dixon’s American Dream” played to rave reviews at the Edinburgh Fringe and Melbourne International Comedy Festival. An unmissable act!

description:
Over and Out, Created and performed by Jackson Burling.

"NEVER become a truck driver!" - A young Jackson Burling took that advice, avoiding the fork in the road, but now, after a long and gruelling two year slog in the arts industry he must confront that age old question: "why not, Dad?" - and take us along for the ride. In Over and Out, premiering at the 2025 TAHI Festival, Burling brings a real interview, a big character, and even bigger questions to the stage.

One actor. 50 minutes. Countless emotional potholes. Along the way, we get a rare look into the gritty, heartfelt, and often-overlooked life of one of Aotearoa’s essential workers: the truck driver. Is the open road calling — or is the stage his true destination? Buckle up. This is verbatim theatre with serious mileage.

Audience Care: Contains coarse language and mature themes.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
mHz : Brutalist Noise Ensemble v2 / Te Tumu, Mo H. Zareei aka mHz is an Iranian sound artist and researcher based in New Zealand. His practice spans electronic compositions, kinetic sound-sculptures, and audiovisual installations. Using custom-built software and hardware, his work often aims to uncover the beauty in the fundamentals of sound and light production, and reductionist audiovisual elements that draw inspiration from physical and architectural principles.
Brutalist Noise Ensemble v2 involves a series of electromechanical instruments built to extend the territory of noise and glitch beyond the digital realm, while paying conscious homage to Brutalism: an unapologetic celebration of raw material through rigorous formalism, where noise replaces concrete. Despite its experimental raw materials, the formal structure of the work is established through purely grid-based and club-style rhythms and repetition is used to bring accessibility to noise.
https://millihertz.net/
https://vimeo.com/818597372
---
TE TUMU
Ka whakaputa mai au i Te Kore - From the Void I emerge. Ancient resonance future sound. Submerged dub rhythms and murky unprocessed bass with soaring taonga pūoro. Experimental, indigenous, slow dance.
$15 presales via UTR
$20 doors / $10 unwaged
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

description:
Tom Sainsbury: Lessons Not Learnt, Comedy chameleon Tom Sainsbury - social media sensation and star of Taskmaster NZ, Wellington Paranormal and Snackmasters - takes the stage with a brand-new hour of outrageous storytelling. From cringeworthy life lessons to small-town drama and the quirky characters that shaped him, Tom serves up big laughs with heart, charm and just the right amount of scandal.

It’s candid. It’s Kiwi. And it’s very, very funny.

Tom Sainsbury is a multi-talented comedian, actor and writer best known for his razor-sharp character comedy and prolific work across stage, screen and social media. A household name for his viral Instagram skits and political impressions, Tom has also starred in Taskmaster NZ, Wellington Paranormal, Snackmasters, Shortland Street, and countless theatre productions. In 2024, he won Best Podcast and Best Comedy Podcast at the NZ Radio & Podcast Awards for his hit true crime parody Small Town Scandal. Whether he’s playing a dodgy small-town mayor, a passive-aggressive flatmate, or a ghost-hunting cop, Tom’s comedy is distinctively Kiwi, weirdly specific, and totally unforgettable.

--

For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email kiaora@teraukura.nz or call 04)9740535 during office hours.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
John Bishop — 25 Years of Stand-up Tour, English comedian, presenter, and actor John Bishop is heading to Wellington with a milestone to shout about. The Liverpool-born comic is celebrating 25 years in the business. His material usually draws from life experiences, and previous stand-up has covered observations about fatherhood, cycling around the world, playing semi-professional football, and his time working as a nightclub doorman. His Michael Fowler Centre show will undoubtedly showcase his famous natural charm and humility while delivering hilarious observations. 
“I can’t believe it will be 25 years since I first performed at the Frog and Bucket in Manchester. It’s been a rollercoaster!” says John. On top of stand-up comedy, he has found fame as a presenter. Among his many television appearances is ‘John Bishop: In Conversation With…’ This series saw him chatting with some of the biggest names in entertainment, music and sport. He has also fronted multiple documentary-style shows.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Heartbreak Hotel, This one's for the young hearts, the old hearts, and the broken hearts.
Direct from a season at London’s Soho Theatre, Circa Theatre and EBKM are delighted to present a limited season of the Heartbreak Hotel. 11 Shows Only.
‘One of the best productions I’ve seen this year.’
★★★★★ Time Out Melbourne
‘It hijacks your nervous system and fast tracks its way into your soul.’
★★★★ Scotsman
“A brilliant production which I loved”
Suzie Miller, writer of Tony award-winning Prima Facie
Story, science and a synth combine in an exhilarating new play that examines what happens in our bodies when we’re bereft.
From acclaimed Wellington-based theatre company EBKM, who brought their ground-breaking Gravity & Grace to Circa Theatre last year (Production of the Year, Wellington Theatre Awards 2024), Heartbreak Hotel tracks a woman’s broken heart in a wrenching and relatable journey that’s studded with classic break-up songs and razor-sharp observations on the physiology of love.
Featuring award-winning performances from Karin McCracken (Gravity & Grace, Yes Yes Yes) and Circa Theatre mainstay Simon Leary (Blithe Spirit, Gravity & Grace, Transmission Beta), as well as exquisite direction from Eleanor Bishop (Gravity & Grace, Girls and Boys), Heartbreak Hotel is a hilarious, honest take on a universal human experience.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Legally Blonde The Musical, Coasters Musical Theatre Brings "Legally Blonde the Musical" to Southwards Theatre

Coasters Musical Theatre presents "Legally Blonde the Musical" from October 2-11, 2025 at Southwards Theatre, Paraparaumu. This uplifting musical comedy follows Elle Woods' incredible journey from fashionable sorority queen to Harvard Law student, filled with catchy songs, dazzling choreography, and plenty of pink power.

Based on the beloved hit movie starring Reese Witherspoon, the show delivers an empowering message about believing in yourself, breaking stereotypes, and discovering your own strength and intelligence. Lauren Loghry makes her exciting Kapiti debut as the determined and vivacious Elle Woods in this feel-good production that promises to entertain and inspire audiences of all ages.

description:
Chris Knox: Not Given Lightly | BOOK LAUNCH, WELLINGTON, Join us to celebrate the release of Chris Knox: Not Given Lightly, a biography by Craig Robertson.
Friday 28 November
6pm
Unity Books
57 Willis Street
Wellington
Come along to hear more from Craig in conversation with
Nick Bollinger and to get your copy signed. Books will be available to purchase thanks to our hosts, Unity Books, and light refreshments provided.
Read more about the book: https://aucklanduniversitypress.co.nz/chris-knox/
—
ABOUT THE AUTHORS
Craig Robertson grew up in Dunedin, New Zealand, where as a student he wrote a thesis on the ‘Dunedin Sound’, as well as articles for Rip It Up and a fanzine on local bands. He is now professor of media studies at Northeastern University in Boston, Massachusetts, and the author of The Passport in America: The History of a Document (‘provocative’ – New York Times) and The Filing Cabinet: A Vertical History of Information (‘captivating’ – The Atlantic). His book on Chris Knox is a labour of love by an enthusiast with a deep understanding of the man, the music and the culture he worked in. Knox himself blessed the project before his stroke.

description:
Wellington Law Revue 2025 - Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes), With the local elections looming, the Wellington City Council is divided. The National-led government wants to intervene, appointing none other than the Monopoly Man (yes the one from the board game!) to the job of fixing the Council. What they didn’t see coming is that this money-grabbing billionaire has his own personal agenda: money, money, money.

Meanwhile, four flatmates are stunned to find a new Mega Cycle Lane has been built through their front garden. Trying to get to the bottom of this, the flatmates unravel a sinister conspiracy that leads back to one man...

The Monopoly Man!

Can our heroes bankrupt our villain on the Monopoly board and beat him at his own game? Find out at the 2025 production of the Wellington Law Revue: Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes) presented by Peaches and Cream.

Please be advised that this production includes short sequences of flashing lights.

comedy.co.nz

It’s Alive!, Follow two young aspiring scientists as they sneak into their mum's secret lab to conduct their Best Experiment Ever — only for things to go horribly wrong, leading to the accidental creation of a puppet! Will the puppet be a friend? Or will they cause chaos that the kids will need to clean up before mum gets home?

Created by Francesca Browne, It's Alive! is brought to you by Improverished, the improvised theatre company behind family friendly shows like Can I Get an Underground Location and a Mythical Creature? and Random Fairytale Generator. Combining theatre, comedy, science, and improvisation, It's Alive! is full of silliness and joy.

All science experiments have been designed with careful consultation with chemists to ensure the safety of the audience.

Designed especially for tamariki ages 5 to 12 and their whānau. We do not recommend this show for children aged 3 and under.

description:
Pub Choir - Wellington, Aotearoa - Michael Fowler Centre (Average at Best Tour), Pub Choir - Wellington, Aotearoa - Michael Fowler Centre (Average at Best Tour)
Do you have the best singing voice in the world? Unlikely. But do you have the WORST singing voice in the world? EQUALLY UNLIKELY. Your voice is probably average (at best), and at Pub Choir: we think that’s great!

Now in it’s 8th year, Pub Choir is the easiest, funniest, largest music lesson in the world. Created and led by the human rubber band Astrid, be snapped into shape and flicked by her quick humour as she teaches everybody how to make a BRAND NEW PIECE OF ART TOGETHER.

What will happen at the show? An entirely improvised, comedy music lesson, where you are the main attraction. Astrid will teach you one song (yep, just the one) in 3-part harmony, and you will do your best to follow her instructions and not to cry.

Generally, you should prepare yourself to learn something new and to not be a dickhead in public. But what should you specifically prepare? Nothing. It’s not that kind of choir. There’ll be no auditions and no homework. Just bring your mouth and we’ll do the rest.

So come and bring your average-at-best self, and your average-at-best friends, and let’s try to worry less and feel better. Also worth mentioning, Astrid wrote a book, and it’s called Average At Best and signed copies will be available for pre-order purchase with Pub Choir tickets, to be collected at the show. Vocal health depending, Astrid plans to sit at the merch desk and sign these books after every show until her audience grows tired of her.

This show is 18+ Please be aware that this event will be filmed & photographed. By purchasing a ticket and attending this event, you are giving your consent to be filmed & photographed during this event.

Tickets on sale here 10am local time 3 July 2025:
https://www.ticketmaster.co.nz/event/240062D286A9097D

description:
Writers on Mondays: Brannavan Gnanalingam and Duncan Sarkies, The satire we deserve: Brannavan Gnanalingam and Duncan Sarkies
Two novelists take the pulse of life in Aotearoa and diagnose a hilarious and dangerous arrhythmia. Brannavan Gnanalingam’s The Life and Opinions of Kartik Popat takes the gloves off to better prod the weeping sores of our body politic and social media. Duncan Sarkies depicts the farcical and chilling demise of democracy within an alpaca breeders’ association in Stargazers. Join Pip Adam as she asks both writers about the serious intent behind the hijinks and why it’s a good time to wield the satirical scalpel.

ADMISSION IS FREE—ALL WELCOME
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.
