description:
Mana Up with Pio Terei in Wellington, Actor, singer, comedian, and storyteller Pio Terei joins The Village NZ for a transformative community kōrero: Mana Up - a deep dive into the real-life challenges that shape us and the real tools that can help us rise.
With his trademark warmth, humour, and humility, Pio guides us through the kaupapa that impact so many of our whānau:
Trauma
Relationships
Whānau dynamics
Grief
Anger
Alcohol & addiction
This is not a lecture. This is lived experience, shared with honesty and heart. Pio has a unique ability to speak with people, not at them. Creating a space where laughter and vulnerability sit side by side. His kōrero is grounded in te ao Māori, backed by simple, evidence-based tools, and designed for communities who are often the hardest to reach.
You’ll hear about concepts like Red Brain vs Green Brain, how trauma shapes behaviour, how to pause before reacting, and how to reconnect with the things that give us strength. These are tools people remember, take away, and use the very next day.
Why This Matters
Mana Up has been described as “an aha moment” for many who attend. One organiser reflected:
“An amazing workshop that was real, relevant, and so appropriate. Realising the whakapapa of trauma and being able to recognise behaviours as the result of such trauma really was an aha moment for a good percentage of the room.”
Another shared:
“The room spoke at length after you left, wanting more and asking for strategies to work on the trauma rather than just the behaviour. The feedback was exceptional -probably the best in my three years on the Executive Team.”
And perhaps the most powerful reflection of all:
“To have this delivered with such passion… I feel like there is hope for our ākonga, whānau, hapū, and iwi.”
These talks have sparked healing, shifted perspectives, and helped whānau feel seen, valued, and hopeful again. They are for everyone - parents, educators, community workers, youth, those impacted by trauma, those seeking reconnection, and anyone wanting to understand themselves and others better.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Griegol, From Trick of the Light Theatre (The Bookbinder) comes a charming, moving, and wildly inventive work.

After their grandmother passes away, a child suspects they are being pursued by the smoke demon shapeshifter of the old woman’s stories. The Griegol is a dark fantasy in the vein of Spirited Away, for older children and adults. Drawing from the techniques of silent film, it utilises silhouettes, smoke, puppetry, live music, and live animation. With the operation kept in sight, audiences see both the stage effects and how they are made. Combining hi-fi with lo-fi technology, and the mythic with the everyday, The Griegol is a show without words about death, love, and monsters. After winning Director, Composer, and Production of the Year at the 2022 Wellington Theatre Awards, and touring to the USA, The Griegol returns to the Hannah Playhouse this October.

Recommended for ages 7+
Contains references to death and grief
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
August's Nomadic Speaker: Rachel Young, Rachel Young is a freelance graphic designer, traveller, and occasional van-dweller who’s spent the last few years navigating the messy, beautiful reality of creative nomad life.
For Rachel, being a ‘nomad’ has never been just about travel, but a mindset. Since leaving her home in the UK in 2019, she’s moved across the world, worked remotely from a van, taught graphic design in China, and rebuilt her creative career more than once.
Today, she blends her love of design with a passion for helping other creatives navigate the highs, lows, and mindset shifts of freelance life, while inspiring those around her to pursue their own dreams.
In this Friday's talk, she shares the unfiltered truths of freelancing on the move - from creative burnout to financial uncertainty - along with the mindset tools that can make the journey not just survivable, but meaningful and joyful.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Glimmers of Gold | Embroidery by Jo Dixey, A gorgeous new exhibition pops up in Old St Paul's vestry this September featuring 79 hand embroidered golden humans.
Embroiderer Jo Dixey is constantly fascinated by the short interactions we have as humans that leave us with calm or happy feelings; feelings that can last for the rest of the day or sometimes much longer.
'This can be sharing a smile with a stranger on a beautiful day or even in the rain, chatting with people in a long queue, collectively watching a great movie. Being open to these moments enhances our lives and the lives of those around us,' Dixey says.
'In psychology, these tiny moments that stimulate positive feelings are called glimmers.'
Gold is a chemical element with the symbol Au and atomic number 79.
'Welcome to Glimmers of Gold.'
About Jo Dixey
Dixey is a Royal School of Needlework trained embroiderer. She teaches small groups a variety of embroidery techniques, works on commissions which have included large altar cloths, university banners and work for the fashion and movie industries, and repairs old embroideries. She holds exhibitions of her embroidered pieces every few years.
In 2017, Dixey published her first book Stitch People, which was later re-released as Creative Thread.
Her work is held in private and public collections in New Zealand and overseas.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Every Kind Of Weather, A theatrical double-shot from an iconic playwright and one of our greatest actors.

Bruce Mason is perhaps the most significant playwright in Aotearoa New Zealand’s theatrical history. Writing with courage and insight, he was a lover of language and a champion of the underdog.

Between 1959 and 1978, Bruce toured the country, telling uniquely Kiwi stories about emerging identity, cultural cringe and social difference. From church halls to country shearing sheds to the Edinburgh Festival, Bruce would play anywhere, in any circumstance, to any audience.

To celebrate his extraordinary legacy, Brilliant Adventures and Circa Theatre are collaborating to make two of his greatest solo works resound for a new age.

Two plays: timeless, universal, distinct. Following their critically acclaimed, sold out run of THINGS I KNOW TO BE TRUE, actor Stephen Lovatt and director Shane Bosher return to Circa for a not-to-be missed theatrical encounter with a master craftsman.

THE END OF THE GOLDEN WEATHER
“I invite you to join me, in a voyage into the past, to that territory of the heart we call childhood.”

Bruce Mason’s quintessential Kiwi classic chronicles the friendship between a 12-year-old boy and Firpo, a social outcast who dreams of winning an Olympic medal.

Through the boy’s eyes we see the wonder of life on a perfect beach, in a perfect 1930s New Zealand, during a perfect summer. It’s a world of magic and transformation, where anything can happen and miracles seem possible.

When the boy sets out to help Firpo make his athletic dream a reality, ignoring his father’s rebukes and community ridicule, a battle rages between the eternal optimism of childhood and the harsh pragmatism of adulthood.

Gliding effortlessly between flights of poetic fancy and blunt everyday speech, THE END OF THE GOLDEN WEATHER is New Zealand storytelling at its very best.

NOT CHRISTMAS, BUT GUY FAWKES
An adolescent boy tries to find his place in an adult-dominated world. A young man retraces an intensely felt boyhood experience of bullying. A playwright in his last days reconciles the value of an artistic life and challenges the idea of New Zealand identity.

Comic disasters and confronting your own hubris. NOT CHRISTMAS, BUT GUY FAWKES is a richly autobiographical search for self-expression. Profound and true, it is a set of variations about over-reaching, cheekily confronting our very own Tall Poppy Syndrome.

Celebrating Bruce Mason
Directed by Shane Bosher
Performed by Stephen Lovatt

Thursday 20 November to Saturday 13 December
Preview Night: Wed 19 Nov – The End of the Golden Weather
Preview Night: Fri 21 Nov – Not Christmas, But Guy Fawkes
Sunday Special: Sunday 23 November – The End of the Golden Weather
Q&A: Tuesday 25 November
Choose Your Price Night: Wed 26 November – Not Christmas, But Guy Fawkes
Circa Two
Tues – Fri 7.30pm, Sat 4.30pm & 7.30pm, Sun 4.30pm
$30 – $60 Early Bird Tickets Available

description:
Master Your Mornings: a Routine That Works, Master Your Mornings: a Routine That Works
Take charge of your mornings and set yourself up for a productive, goal-driven day. A well-designed morning routine can give you focus, fuel your ambition, and create momentum that carries through everything you do. In this workshop, you’ll learn how to build a routine that fits your life and drives your success.
Dive into the science behind effective morning habits, pick up practical strategies for building routines that stick, and explore proven techniques to stay motivated and on track. Whether your goal is to enhance productivity, improve wellbeing, or cultivate mindfulness, this workshop gives you the tools to turn your mornings into a launchpad for long-term achievements.
What You’ll Gain:
Understand the psychology behind morning habits and why they matter
Discover how to design a morning routine tailored to your personal and professional aspirations
Learn time-tested strategies for consistency and maintaining motivation
Build a morning routine that sets you up for success, every single day
Leave this workshop with a clear, actionable morning routine that empowers you to take control of your day, and more importantly, your future.
Start each day with intention, clarity, and the momentum to reach your goals
Meet Nava, your host
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After eight exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!

description:
Teaching Well - A supportive school for a well staff - Wellington (TWS2025/04), Growing attention to staff wellbeing has resulted in many workplace mental wellbeing initiatives. Nevertheless, the concept of staff wellbeing is rarely well-defined, with programs focusing on either work-related stressors or staff wellness approaches.

As part of a well school, it is just as essential to have a well staff as it is to a well student body. Don't miss out! Discover the key principles of wellbeing and build a sustainable, impactful plan for your staff.

Join this workshop tailored for schools & kura, exploring how to promote staff wellbeing in 2025. Learn the theory and practice of promoting wellbeing in staff!
From Remedial to Sustainable Action
Providing resources or assistance programmes to help staff manage job stress is a single element of an extensive staff wellbeing plan. Schools commonly start at the remedial end of the wellbeing continuum, creating welfare or wellness plans. Learning the differences between welfare, wellness, and wellbeing approaches, including their strengths and weaknesses, is important.

Meta-evaluations reveal that many workplace mental wellbeing programmes lack efficacy due to not addressing organisational and systemic factors that impact wellbeing. Effective staff wellbeing programmes must respond to staff needs and reflect the school's cultural values and character.
Utilizing collective impact, transformational change theory, and Te Whare Tapa Whā, we introduce a conceptual model outlining the eight pillars essential for a staff wellbeing plan. This model's strength lies in its specificity to different settings or occupations, necessitating an in-depth analysis of work nature, dynamics, and inter-relationships.
Based on insights from past workshops and participant feedback, this workshop now provides a comprehensive template for developing staff wellbeing plans.
This workshop does not offer a pre-packaged wellbeing programme. Research indicates that externally imposed wellbeing programmes have limited efficacy in schools. Effective staff wellbeing plans must be rooted in insights gained from reflective analysis and staff consultations. Notably, the consultation process itself is a key wellbeing activity.
Take the opportunity to hear from an award winning wellbeing specialist about:
the wellbeing continuum and the difference between mental illness prevention and wellbeing approaches
the key determinants that impact on staff wellbeing
effective strategies to respond to fatigue, burnout, depression and trauma
why one size doesn't fit all and how to scope and design a staff wellbeing programme responsive to the specific needs of your school
developing a staff wellbeing programme based on proven wellbeing outcomes
making informed decisions on your school’s staff wellbeing policy and activities
Workshop Format:
The content will be delivered over two workshops.
In-Person 1 day workshop in Wellington
Friday 31 October 9am to 4pm
On-Line Workshop
Wednesday 3 December 1 - 3.30pm

Topics covered in this practical workshop:
what is meant by wellbeing and its role in addressing stress and mental distress in staff;
the difference between a welfare and a wellbeing approach;
staff wellbeing as an industrial relations / conditions of employment issue
resilience, coping, thriving? - identifying desired wellbeing outcomes
the interface between personal and professional stressors and distressors
the impact on staff wellbeing from exposure to trauma and poor mental wellbeing within the student body
the key determinants that facilitate wellbeing in the teaching environment
what does and what doesn’t contribute to a supportive environment where staff thrive
the key components that should be in a staff wellbeing programme
designing, implementing and evaluating a staff wellbeing programme
School Group Participation
Schools are encouraged to have more than one staff member participate in the online workshops. Past workshops has shown that having more than one staff member has maximised the benefit of the workshop activities which can then been continued post-workshop. To promote school group participation, there is a 20% discount off the total registration fee when three or more participants per school are registered.
Who should attend: 
Senior leadership team members (especially those with responsibility of staff wellbeing)
OHS representatives or union delegates
Heads of Departments
Boards of Trustees representatives
School Counsellors / EAP providers
In-House Delivery:
This workshop can also be delivered in-house, school clusters, or organisations such as prinicpal assocations or unions. Post workshop consulting services such as mentoring the development of or reviewing a staff wellbeing plan can also be provided.
Post Workshop Consult:
Schools and Kuras have the option of a 90 minute consult with Barry in 2026 to review their staff wellbeing plan.
AN OPPORTUNITY FOR LEARNING WITH INTERNATIONALLY RESPECTED AND AWARD WINNING MENTAL WELLBEING PRACTITIONER AND SUICIDOLOGIST, BARRY TAYLOR
Barry has worked in mental wellbeing promotion and suicide prevention/postvention for 37 years at the local, national and international levels.  His extensive experience includes sitting on state and national government advisory committees; designing, implementing and evaluating suicide prevention programs; writing suicide prevention guidelines, training packages and community resources; providing technical advice to community based and national mental wellbeing and suicide prevention programs.  He has worked extensively with schools both here and overseas supporting management and staff in the event of a suicide. He wrote the first suicide postvention guidelines for schools in 1990, developed the first national suicide prevention guidelines for schools in Australia in 1999 and reviewed and updated the NZ guidelines in 2010.
He has led multiple ‘firsts’ in mental wellbeing both in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas.  In recognition of his outstanding contribution to mental wellbeing and suicide prevention, he was awarded in 2016 the NSW Mental Health Commissioner's Community Champion Award.
Barry has lectured on wellbeing both nationally and internationally and been appointed to numerous government advisory committees on mental wellbeing and suicide prevention.  He brings to this workshop extensive experience in advising communities and government on post-disaster recovery in terms of both mental wellbeing promotion / community resiliency and suicide prevention.
As a Health Sociologist and Public Health practitioner, Barry has a long-term interest in the social and cultural determinants of wellbeing, especially the role of gender and he brings a wealth of knowledge and passion for promoting wellbeing in men. He has examined the impact of discrimination, internalised stigma, social exclusion or inclusion on mental wellbeing along with the role of human rights as an enabler of wellbeing.
He embraces a holistic understanding of wellbeing and has an interest in the role spirituality and ecology contributes to a person's wellbeing. He uses a population health and systems change approach, drawing on transformational change theory and collective impact.
After a number of years overseas, Barry is living back in New Zealand and is passionate about building the knowledge base, competence and capability within our country to promote well whānau, workplaces and communities and for the incorporation of wellbeing principles in public policy and social outcomes such as education, training and employment.
WORKSHOP DETAILS
WORKSHOP PLACES ARE LIMITED. REGISTER EARLY TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT
Places in the workshop are limited. If the workshop is full please register your name on the waitlist
Group Booking Discount: Book 3 or more participants in one booking and receive 20% discount off each registration
School & Kura Discount: Enter SCHOOLKURA20 to the Discount Code box at the beginning of the registration process for a further 20% discount off the registration fee.
Payment: Payment is by either:
Credit Card (Visa or Mastercard) or 
Instalment payment (ZIP and Afterpay)
Invoice - Schools and kura have the option to pay by invoice. At payment method click on Invoice,
Terms for Payment By Invoice
By selecting to pay by invoice the organisation agrees to the following conditions:
1.  Your place in the workshop is not confirmed until payment has been received. Payment of the invoice must be made within seven days of registering to avoid having your registration cancelled. Late payment fees apply.
2.  A Tax Invoice from TaylorMade Training and Consulting will be sent to you separately which will contain bank details for payment.  
3.  By registering for the workshop, you agree to the cancellation and policy. (refer below).  Organisations who cancel within seven days of the workshop and have not paid the invoice for the outstanding registration fee are still obligated to pay the outstanding debt.

Cancellation and Refund Policy
Workshops can fill quickly. If you are no longer able to attend the workshop please cancel your registration as soon as possible. The following refund policy is strictly adhered to.
Cancellation up to seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop:  Full Refund less $35+GST admin fee
Cancellation within seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop: No refund but registration can be transferred to another person. To transfer your registration log on to your registration and update the name and contact details to the new person attending.
Non attendance:   No refund
Disclaimer: The information and professional advice delivered in the workshop and the associated printed material is provided solely on the basis that before relying on this material, participants should obtain appropriate advice relevant to their particular circumstance to evaluate its accuracy, currency, completeness and relevance for their purposes. TaylorMade Training and Consulting will not be liable for any damages of any kind to any person or entity arising from the use of this information. Your attendance at this workshop reflects your acceptance of this statement.

description:
Posture Perfection Is Possible, Are you a computer slouch, feeling stiff and tense at work? Do you find it difficult to maintain a good posture? Does your posture cause back, neck or shoulder tension? Would you like to enjoy more freedom in everyday activities?

Under the guidance of an experienced teacher, we'll explore movement in ways that help you reduce tense unhelpful habits. Movement lessons are done on the floor or sitting on a chair and are based on the pioneering work of Israeli physicist and engineer Dr. Moshe Feldenkrais. This workshop is suitable for all ages (over 16) and fitness levels.

Outcomes
By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to:
- Identify and reduce muscle tension
- Move with more lightness and freedom
- Improve your posture
- Describe some basic anatomy
- Have tools to use at home and at work

Bring two blankets (or a mat and a blanket) and wear loose, warm and comfortable clothing. Tea and coffee provided but bring your lunch.

Please note that instructions are given verbally rather than by demonstration, so good hearing and understanding of English is required.

1 Day
Presented by Sue Field.

A FasterEFT-based workshop to clear old emotional blocks + activate your next level

Manifestation isn’t about forcing, chasing, affirming harder, or trying to “think positive”.

It’s about clearing the emotional data from the past that gets projected forward.

In this 70-minute transformative workshop, you will:

* Identify the hidden belief structures blocking your manifestation

* Release old emotional references using FasterEFT tapping

* Step into the identity of the version of you who already HAS the outcome

* Activate new nervous-system-based possibilities

When the internal record shifts — reality reorganises instantly.

Join us for a powerful evening of nervous system re-coding, clarity, identity upgrade… and RESULTS

Krishnaloka is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. description:
Healthy Hospo Stress and Taking Back Control: A Breathwork Experience for Hospo - Christchurch, Stress and Taking Back Control: A Breathwork Experience for Hospo
Get peak season ready — with tools to take back control of stress.
We’re all told that stress is bad. Chronic stress can lead to burnout and even serious health issues. But what if stress itself isn’t the enemy? What if learning how to work with stress could actually make it a powerful tool for performance, resilience, and wellbeing?
With hospitality gearing up for peak season, there’s no better time to reset and equip yourself with tools that help you stay calm, focused, and in control. No matter how busy it gets.
At Healthy Hospo, we know the pressure this industry faces. That’s why we’re bringing you an interactive session designed to help you and your teams:
·       Understand the science of stress (and how it can work for you)
·       Experience guided breathwork to reset your body and mind
·       Walk away with practical tools you can use in everyday hospo life
Join us for a 2-hour interactive workshop with our resident Breathwork & Physiology expert, Josh Fankhauser, and discover how to transform stress from something that drains you into something that fuels you.
Yoga mats provided.
What you need to bring:
·       A notebook.
·       A pen.
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $35 per person is fully sponsored.
Spaces are limited, and as all spaces are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!

description:
Self-Hypnosis - Hypnotise Yourself, A practical workshop that will introduce you to a structured and easy-to-follow method to take yourself into hypnosis and use it to your benefit. Let go of old habits and form new ones, brighten your future, excel in your career and create excellence.

Description
Self-hypnosis is a fantastic self-development tool. It can also be used for controlling pain, accelerated healing, letting go of limiting behaviours and a number of other applications. This workshop will provide you with a good insight into the world of hypnosis, demystify it and dispel the myths that surround it.

You’ll learn a structured method of taking yourself into hypnosis (informed by scientific research), some of the classic applications of self-hypnosis and evidence-based skills that will convince you without doubt of your ability to hypnotise yourself.

By the end of the workshop, you’ll be able to:
- Define and discuss hypnosis
- Practice self-hypnosis
- Create and write hypnosis scripts for personal change
- Use the language of self-hypnosis
- Relax hypnotically to deep levels

Tea and coffee provided but bring your lunch, pen and paper.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. description:
Chit Chat with a Kit Kat, Chit Chat with a Kit Kat

Chit Chat with a Kit Kat and Coffee!

This is for 'all women' of all ages and from all walks of life who just need to be heard, and to share their worries, burdens, stresses, grief, sadness, loss etc.. and my friend and myself are realising there are alot of us out there experiencing these emotions for a myriad of reasons, be it loss, be it menopause, be it grief, stress, anxiety, depression, financial,family stuff, so my beautiful friend and I thought it would be a great idea to extend our little sessions that we have been having to more women who are in need of just being free to feel what we feel, to be honest, raw and open and not feel judged for our thoughts and emotions in a safe loving caring understanding space where we can support each other to be Brave Bold and Beautiful under pressure

We are human beings doing the best we can with what we have in a world that has sort of gone a bit pear shape hey, so this Beautiful Woman is about allowing you and me to speak our truth amongst like minded women in a safe space who are experiencing similar feelings and emotions with no judgement just love and understanding

The positive of this is when we vocalise and communicate our worries, concerns, hurts, disappointments, sadness, anger, frustrations, annoyances, we actually let go toxic energy from our mind, body, soul which actually improves our health and wellbeing mentally and physically, fact and truth!

Studies and Statistics have proven that 80% of illnesses are caused by STRESS, so let's just do something kind, caring, loving and healing for us and let's get together and get raw real and natural and chit chat about whatever it is you want to chit chat about, no judgement of course within reason lol :)

What do you think? Sounds fab? :)
If so then DM me or email to confirm, and i'll book you in on the 3rd of December or if you are just one of those bizzy Lizzy's like me and you forgot to book, then just feel free to rock up or text me which i will give you access to when you email

description:
HineHau Breathwork for Women: Workshop, Join Shannon Rose for this unique three-hour workshop—breathwork for wāhine.
Through story, breath, and reflection, you’ll learn and experience the power of your breath as a wāhine: to cleanse, to create, and to consciously live in alignment with who you are. Open to wāhine of all cultures who are ready to experience the healing power of Te Hā — the sacred breath.
In this workshop, you’ll be safely guided on a journey of remembrance, reconnection, and reclamation. Expect to come away feeling grounded, rejuvenated, and more at home in your body.
What’s Included:
*Karakia to open and close our space
*Purākau — Māori creation stories on the whakapapa of the breath
*Kōrero — how intentional breathing helps to align your mauri, wairua and mana
*Working with the nervous system to support manifestation and creativity
*BreathWav™ Journey — a 70-minute circular connected breath practice for release, alignment, and deep connection
*Journaling & Reflection to integrate what arises
Please bring:
Water, a journal and an eye mask
HineHau Breathwork for Women
With Shannon Rose
Saturday 25th October 2026, 11.45am-2.45pm | Awhi Yoga
Price: $65
Nau mai, haere mai!
About Shannon Rose:
Ngāti Porou ki Harataunga, Ngāti Whakaue, Ngāti Whakahemo, Tūhourangi, Scotland, Croatia, England. Shannon Rose has been immersed in the practice of breath since 2017 and is recognised as one of the pioneers of breathwork in Aotearoa. She is the founder of HineHau, a breathwork training kaupapa supporting wāhine to step into leadership and facilitation through the breath. HineHau teaches breathwork through a Te Ao Māori lens to wahine, offering 200-hour practitioner certifications.
Since beginning her practice in 2017, Shannon has been part of the early wave of facilitators bringing the transformative power of breathwork to Aotearoa. Her approach is both deeply spiritual and deeply human, making the breath accessible as a tool for healing, alignment, and reconnection.
Through HineHau (formerly Elevare), Shannon has trained over 50 practitioners in the BreathWav™ modality, a practice that works with the full spectrum of the breath to release, restore, and reawaken. At the heart of her work is a commitment to weaving whakapapa, story, and ceremony into modern practice, creating spaces where wāhine can return to themselves with clarity and confidence.

description:
Men's Group Tuesday 25 Nov, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

Join the event waitlist if meetings are full - a space often comes up!

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

description:
Wellington Walk the Waterfront, Wellington Walk the Waterfront
Top Up Together

As part of Mental Health Awareness Week’s Be Active day, the Aotearoa Mental Health Collective invites you to join us for an evening of movement, connection and community.
We’ll gather at The Lounge at St John's Bar, Wellington from 5.30 pm for a warm welcome and a chance to connect. Then at 6 pm we'll take a walk along the beautiful Wellington waterfront, returning to The Lounge at St John's around 6.45 pm.
After the walk, you’ll have the opportunity to share a meal or snacks of your choice, deepen connections, and continue the conversation in a relaxed setting. As this is a free event, you’ll order and pay for any food and drinks yourself and can choose from the wide range on offer at St John's Bar.
Walking alongside others and taking the time to connect can boost our wellbeing, reduce stress, lift our mood and strengthen our sense of belonging.
Spaces are limited, so secure your spot today.
We look forward to connecting, walking and topping up our wellbeing together this Mental Health Awareness week.

With thanks to St John's Bar, who have generously provided the venue for this free event.

description:
Inner Child Workshop - Shamanic Way, Inner Child Healing – Shamanic Way
Inner child healing has been explored in many therapeutic and healing modalities. Each approach offers its own wisdom and light, helping people in unique ways. What truly transformed my journey, however, is the foundational practice within my shamanic training — Inner Child Healing. It’s not an intellectual or analytical process, but a deeply intuitive and feeling-based journey that helps us dive into the psyche and reconnect with younger versions of ourselves that may have become lost or stuck in time.

In shamanic practice, we understand the inner child as a deeply activated part of the nervous system. In other words, healing your inner child means bringing safety to your nervous system, allowing the wounded part of you — the one constantly on alert — to finally rest. Your inner child is your nervous system. When that child feels safe, seen, and loved within your body, they can simply be the child they were never allowed to be. At that point, you no longer need to constantly “regulate” your nervous system through endless spiritual practices — because much of what gets triggered in daily life often comes from an unmet or unhappy inner child.

Once you learn to create a safe internal space for your inner child to simply be, and allow your embodied, grounded adult self to take responsibility in life, you’ll witness profound shifts in how you feel, respond, and relate to the world.

In this workshop, I will share the foundational understanding of how inner child healing unfolds in everyday life. Through a guided shamanic journey, you’ll be led to meet or reconnect with your inner child and begin integrating a healthy adult archetype within your system.

If you feel called to explore your inner child, work on a deeper, more embodied level — one that you can carry into your daily life —
join me this Labour Weekend at Capricorn Spirit Crystal Shop, from 3pm to 6pm.
Spaces are limited to 6 participants, and I look forward to journeying with you there.

description:
Men's Group Tuesday 11 Nov, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

Join the event waitlist if meetings are full - a space often comes up!

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

description:
Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Wellington, We're pleased to invite you to join us for this workshop on Building resilience and unlocking the power of the mind.
Why this matters:
In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill. It's not just about bouncing back from adversity but confidently navigating change. Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability. This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind. By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
What to expect:
During this interactive workshop, participants will explore the core concepts of resilience and the mind-body connection through engaging discussions, experiential exercises, and practical demonstrations. They will learn evidence-based techniques to enhance their resilience, manage stress effectively, and cultivate a positive mindset amidst adversity. By the end of the session, attendees will emerge with a comprehensive toolkit to fortify their mental resilience and embrace change with confidence.
Who this is for:
This workshop caters to individuals across all organisational levels who are eager to enhance their resilience and cultivate a resilient mindset. Whether you're an owner, manager, chef, senior staff member, or junior employee, this workshop offers invaluable insights and practical strategies to bolster resilience and thrive in today's fast-paced world.
About the presenter, Sarah Robb
Sarah is a certified coach, counselor, and Master Practitioner of NLP (neuro-linguistic programming) holding a Bachelor's degree in Psychology.
With a passion for transformation, she guides individuals through retraining their brains and breaking free from limiting beliefs and patterns. Drawing on her extensive lived experience, Sarah has collaborated with over 200 clients and organisations, empowering them to apply practical tools and strategies for significant improvements in their mental health.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

description:
5-Week Ultimate Calm Forest-Yoga Series, 5-Week Ultimate Calm Forest-Yoga Series
Last class series for 2025. Starts 12 October. Ancient, easy, calm, beautiful and gentle yoga practices to regulate your nervous system and change your internal state. Imagine if you could be calm, anywhere, anytime.

Break the cycle of moving through life stressed, anxious, unsure or unable to deeply recover from illness. We cannot heal when we are stressed - healing only happens when we are relaxed.

This is not strenuous leg-behind-your-head yoga. This beautiful series is guided meditation, gentle stretches, letting every muscle go as you lay over soft bolsters, deep breathing and calming down. These classes return yoga to it's roots - meditation, silent stillness, and experiencing the world without tension.

The impact of each 1.5 hour class will stay with you. And the by the end of the course, you will:

1. Understand more about your stress and relaxation responses
2. Learn easy ways to switch your nervous system over to rest
3. Learn breathing techniques to immediately calm you down
4. Remind your body what is feels like to be at ease
5. Support your mind to naturally and easily take a back seat
6. Learn to better transition to sleep
7. Slow down long enough to listen to what you truly need
8. Have access to audio and video recordings for life
9. Have unlimited support and curiosity throughout the course
10. Create your own home practice after the series.

The world is getting faster. We don't need to. Fast and productive is not not our natural state!

These classes are led by Janie Walker who has experienced chronic stress and long-covid. She teaches from her own experience. You will truly feel supported. You will also crave coming to BeCalmed Studio's little haven in the forest. You can rest here.

Here's what people have said about these BeCalm Yourself classes:

https://www.becalmedstudio.com/.../how-becalm-yourself

Your booking is for all FIVE WEEKLY CLASSES in the series.
Bookings essential.. https://www.becalmedstudio.com/studio-classes

Just 2-3 per class. If this time of week does not suit you, please contact Janie as there may be others wanting a different time slot.

And don't let money be a barrier - we can work something out.

Be calm.

The drawing process is fully guided and inspired by the philosophies and methods of British artist Cecil Collins, encouraging a non-academic, intuitive approach. Through playful interaction with asana, the connection between these two practices becomes beautifully apparent.

Drinks and nibbles follow, along with a chance for kōrero and connection.

Guided by JoElle Gragilla, owner of Island Bay’s South Coast Studio, and AWHI yoga teacher Lachlan Broughton.

Encouraging expression over perfection, this experience is open to all levels and accessible to both artists and non-artists alike.

Come curious. Leave inspired.

Investment
$75 (includes all drawing materials, yoga, mat hire, drinks & nibbles)

All supplies & props provided — wear comfortable clothing to move in!

description:
Healing Trauma and the Nervous System- Ancient wisdom for modern resilience, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Healing Trauma and the Nervous System- Ancient wisdom for modern resilience
Stress and struggle leave their mark on both body and mind, sometimes in ways we can’t easily undo. Just as knots form in the body, impressions and tensions accumulate in the mind. While we can’t change the past, the Bhagavad-gita teaches that we can shape our future—what we choose to cultivate now carries us forward.
In this one-hour workshop, we’ll explore how philosophical and spiritual wisdom can help us rise above the tangles of trauma and anxiety. Through practical insights, open discussion, and guidance from the Gita’s philosophy, we’ll look at how to build resilience—not only by steadying the nervous system, but by exploring the deeper self beyond the changing body and mind.
Meet your host, Sivananda
Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.
6.15pm Tuesday 28th of October
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

description:
MAP IT Marketing Strategy Intensive - write your own marketing strategy, Create a marketing plan in just two days
Designed to fit YOUR business.
Designed for you to take action

Time is precious, so let's make it count.

Join marketing trainer and coach Rachel Klaver for an immersive two-day face-to-face workshop tailored for service-based businesses.
This event will take place on the 19th and 20th of November, at The Bolton Hotel, Wellington.

This is designed to transform your marketing strategy from the ground up.
Over two days you'll explore and learn up-to-date marketing practices and strategy, and write a strategy customised for your business.

You’ll then create a clear action plan designed to attract, engage and convert your ideal customers
Numbers are limited to ensure you can get individualised help and support.

Here's what we'll cover over the two days:
How to best explain what you do
Simplifying your message to cut through a busy marketplace
How to define your target market (beyond demographics)
Defining your positioning
A check on pricing and profitability pillars
Identifying gaps and differentiation from competitors
Unique selling proposition
Improving word of mouth, influencer and referral marketing
Customer experience and the customer journey
Who owns the marketing role
Appropriate use of AI in marketing
Website Optimisation
Email Marketing that works
Creating a social media strategy framework
Printing and branding needs
Traditional marketing (Radio/Print/Other)
PR, Expos, Conferences
Business owner brand

(Everything will be taught for small business needs, rather than large organisations.
We'll be covering the following in everyday language, explaining all the marketing terms as we go)

Here's what's also included:
Guided pre-workshop tasks to make the most of your time.
Individualised analysis of key marketing areas.
A marketing strategy and action plan workbook.
Templates, spreadsheets to support your plan.
Opportunity to discuss specific areas where needed.
A month of free access to video training and lessons, templates, and worksheets to help take action. (with an option to continue monthly access for a nominal fee)
A content marketing planner to help plan out your activity and take action.

Who is your marketing strategist and trainer?
Introducing your Marketing Strategist Rachel Klaver

Welcome! I'm Rachel Klaver, content marketing coach, marketing strategist and small business owner.
I’ve worked with over a thousand small business owners on their marketing strategy either in small groups like this, or one-to-one.
I use real language, story, and simple explanations to break down marketing strategy.
I’m able to provide a range of options and ideas for you to use as you take action.
I want that for you.
(The other stuff: I work full time as a marketing strategist, coach and trainer. I co run our business Identify Marketing with my husband Rod. I've written 28 books, the last one on content marketing (it's called Be a Spider, Build a Web.). I write a fortnightly column for NZ's Stuff newspaper on marketing, and have two podcasts: MAP IT Marketing, and Confident Content. )

So... would you like to come join me?

Be prepared for VALUE - It's PACKED with goodness
This two-day programme is just $2,000+gst per person.
(limit of two per business)

This workshop is registered with the Regional Business Partner Network. To explore if your business may be eligible for support, contact me so we can put you in touch with your local Regional Business Growth Advisor if appropriate to discuss further

DON'T MISS OUT ON THIS VALUE PACKED, two day intensive - AND THE POSITIVE IMAPACT ON YOUR BUSINESS

REFINE YOUR STRATEGY. CREATE YOUR ACTION PLAN
This two-day intensive will get you ready to make the next 12 months a year of growth, and more profit. Get a handle on your marketing, develop an action plan and know exactly what you need to do to create consistent marketing output targeted at the right people.

description:
Painless Presenting - Tuesday 18th November, Full day presentation skills workshop in Wellington. Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
Who's it for?
You work in a technical field. You’re great at your job — but struggle to get your ideas across the business.
You often:
Dive into technical detail that loses or confuses your audience
Overload people with too much information, which makes it harder to get the results you need
Find it tough to explain complex areas of your role in a way others can easily understand
Spend hours planning presentations, yet still feel stiff and uncomfortable when delivering
Feel nervous when presenting, and wish you could speak with more ease and confidence
If this sounds like you, Painless Presenting will help you cut through complexity, present clearly, and build the confidence you know is vital for your career growth.
What you will learn:
A proven step by step process that will take the pain out of planning presentations and set the foundations for becoming a more engaging, natural and effective business presenter.

Participants are taught how to write a valuable business presentation, how to manage their nerves, design useful visuals and are given key delivery techniques to help deliver their presentations in a natural and engaging way.
You will come away with:
an understanding of how to use the SpeakerMap™ system, a step by step, proven approach to planning presentations quickly and effectively
a new appreciation of purpose when speaking
an understanding of how to quickly design useful presentation visuals
how to easily overcome the problems of speaking too fast, um-ing and ah-ing, and losing your place
a tailored strategy to dissolve the anxiety that so often accompanies presenting
three delivery tricks that will help you come across as credible and confident
Note: You will not need to present to the group on this course. If you are interested in a more intensive training option, including one on one coaching, check out our 2 day workshop The Effective Speaker.
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8

Monthly Topic: Powerful Email Marketing

description:
Impactful Leadership, Impactful Leadership:
What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.
Welcome to the final conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
What good leadership looks like has changed, but many of the methods we rely on to deliver it haven’t. This conversation will showcase what horses can teach us about impactful leadership in modern workplaces, and how anyone can turn those lessons into action that delivers.
Why be part of this conversation?
In this thought-provoking session, BBC journalist-turned-leadership coach Janine Sudbury will share how she discovered what really works in leadership development, and why traditional approaches often fall short.
You’ll take away insights including:
The three secrets of the horse whisperer that unlock authentic, presence-based leadership
How to overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing to lead with clarity and confidence
Why horses give the most honest feedback—and how that feedback creates lasting breakthroughs
Who’s the speaker?
Janine Sudbury is the founder of Impact Leadership and the creator of a truly unique experiential leadership programme that swaps the boardroom for the paddock. specialises in helping women overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing Syndrome to lead with more confidence, clarity, and authenticity.
With powerful insights and unforgettable stories, including her work with former All Blacks coach Steve Hansen, Janine invites you to lead with more purpose, presence, and impact.
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Janine Sudbury speaks
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
Business card prize draw:
Attend the event and go in the draw to win a “New BMW for a Weekend” and a “New MINI for a Weekend” from Continental Cars BMW and Wellington MINI Garage.
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
7 August: Strengths & Superpowers - Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest
20 August: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live! - Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.

Digital experiences that truly matter, Note: This is a Hybrid Event:
In-Person Location: Level 1 , 107 Customhouse Quay, Wellington

About this event:
About this event:

This highly interactive session will have engaging discussions that will uncover practical insights into creating user – focused, unified digital services that genuinely enhance customer experiences. We will discuss the complexities of web design and development, exploring them from a project delivery perspective, with a focus on building effective and impactful digital solutions.
About the Presenter:
About the Presenters:
 Pikselin: Pikselin is a New Zealand based consultancy and solution provider in the digital engagement and application development space. As a digital agency, they create user-focused digital experiences that are both functional and visually engaging. Pikselin delivers responsive websites, intuitive interfaces, and inclusive digital services for clients across government and private sector. Their expertise lies in simplifying complex information through thoughtful, user – centred design. As an approved supplier on New Zealand’s Government Marketplace, they have led key projects for a range of clients across the public and enterprise sectors. Pikselin is known for its collaborative approach and commitment to elevating digital experiences that truly serve New Zealanders. 

Steve Barnard Managing Director Steve leads client and partner collaborations at Pikselin, overseeing projects from marketing to post-development support with over 30 years of experience in New Zealand's IT industry.

James Guthrie Tech Lead James transforms complex design requirements into maintainable accessible code specializing in real-time data visualization interactive mapping, and fully accessible cross device websites.

Brian Smith Design Director Brian leads Pikselin's creative vision collaborating with clients and the creative team to deliver exceptional products and services.

description:
Launchpad IN PERSON Small Business Workshop November 2025, Join Bizezi’s FREE In-Person small business workshop and discover how to turn your passion into a sustainable venture — even with little or no capital. Whether you're just starting out or ready to explore self-employment more seriously, this interactive session is designed to help you think big, start small, and stay in business.
Workshop Highlights
Bust Common Business Myths - Learn why you don’t need loads of money, a company, or a perfect plan to get started.
Start with What You Have - Explore practical, low-cost (or no-cost) strategies to start and grow a business.
Understand Business Planning Tools - Get introduced to Lean Canvas, Business Model Canvas, and the Bizezi Business Planning App.
Learn from Real NZ Stories - Be inspired by success stories.
Validate Your Business Idea - Discover the no.1 secret to business success... before you build it.
Q&A and Live Demos - Ask questions, explore tools, and see how Bizezi AI can simplify your planning.
Benefits & Outcomes
Increased confidence and clarity around business idea
Practical skills to start with limited resources
Tools and templates to plan and validate your idea
Community connections and post-workshop support
Understanding of NZ’s business ecosystem and funding support

description:
Marlborough Tech Community Morning Tea: Shaping Our Future, Marlborough’s tech community has huge potential, and this kōrero is about shaping the next chapter together. We believe our region’s tech future will be stronger when everyone has a seat at the table, and we’re committed to making space for all perspectives to be heard.
Event details
📅 Date: Thursday 18 September 2025
🕘 Time: 10:00 am - 12:00 pm
📍 Location: Te Au Pūngao, cnr Arthur & Seymour Streets
Free to attend, registration is essential for catering purposes.
Join us for morning tea at Te Au Pūngao to connect with others working in technology, innovation, and startups, and to help set the direction for Marlborough’s tech future.
We’ll be talking about:
Making coworking more accessible for sole contractors, early-stage founders, and startups
Creating regular opportunities for local students to get hands-on support from industry experts
Forming a Marlborough Tech Steering Group to guide our community and develop a Tech Community Charter
This is an open kōrero guided by the principle of equity of voice. Whether this is your first tech event or your fiftieth, you belong here. We know it can feel daunting to walk into a new space, so our team will be at the door to welcome you and make introductions.
Everyone brings value to the conversation. Your background, culture, and lived experience help shape a stronger tech community.
Accessibility and inclusivity:
On-site parking, elevator, and accessible bathrooms
Welcoming to LGBTQIA+ community
Attendees are encouraged to bring a friend
Come along, share your ideas, and help build a connected and collaborative tech community in Marlborough.

description:
Best Practice Guidelines Workshop - Wellington, This interactive session will help you effectively manage volunteers at your organisation. The Volunteer Best Practice Guidelines provide a framework to consider and review your own practice, and learn from others.
The session includes insights into managing challenging behaviour and problem solving, and is aimed at novices right through to experts in volunteer management.
We will explore the practice areas:
Recruiting and engaging volunteers
Welcoming and onboarding volunteers
Volunteer support, leadership, and management
Train and grow volunteers
Feedback and recognition
Celebrate volunteer impact
Exiting Volunteers
We will be learning from everyone in the room, including you!
The workshop will be based on the Volunteering New Zealand's 'Best Practice Guidelines.' You can access these 
on our website here.
We will provide you with morning tea and a light lunch. You'll be asked your dietary requirements when you register.
Registration is from 9:15am. Entry to venue from Featherston Street.
What previous attendees have said:
"I just wanted to say thank you for the opportunity to attend that workshop. It was lovely talking to other people in the charity sector which I haven’t had the chance to do yet. Great discussions and ideas."
"I am very much enjoying your workshops, and have implemented some of the learnings already."
About your facilitator:
Alison Marshall is about helping others build capability through learning and development.
Ali has over 25 years’ experience in learning and development at a senior level. She has worked in a broad range of industries that includes oil and gas, professional services, retail, education and hospitality. She has worked for large global organisations, start-ups and government. Her talent is being able to build relationships across all levels of the organisation.
Alison Marshall

description:

Tipu Pakihi 2025 Dinner is here to highlight Māori business growth, foster innovation, and strengthen collaboration across Te Ūpoko o te Ika. Grounded in Māori values and whanaungatanga, this event brings together Māori entrepreneurs, rangatahi, iwi leaders, innovators, business networks, and support agencies to shape a thriving regional Māori economy.
Expect a delicious dinner, awards for successful Māori entrepreneurs, extended networking opportunities, and outstanding entertainment. From rangatahi start-ups to iwi investment strategies, Tipu Pakihi is a space where ideas are nurtured, partnerships are formed, and solutions are co-designed for Māori-led economic development.
This is more than just dinner. It’s a celebration of our people, our creativity, and our future. Come ready to eat, connect, and be moved. The vibes will be high, the kaupapa strong, and the memories lasting.
Whether you're starting out, scaling up, or supporting Māori enterprise, Tipu Pakihi 2025 offers connection, inspiration, and actionable insights.

Women in Business Lunch - Friday 28 November 2025, We would love you to join us for our exclusive Déjeuner de Noël event, Bubbles & Canapé's with Lisa O'Neill being held at Quarter Acre, for our end of year Women in Business Networking Event.
The event is being held on Friday 28th of November, from 12.30-2.30pm. 
For over two decades, Lisa O'Neill has been electrifying audiences with her unique ability to deliver profound messages through side-splitting humour. After watching countless people struggle with energy, leadership and personal growth, Lisa discovered that transformation happens when hard truths are delivered with lightness and laughter. She's authored seven books, spoken to audiences of 5000+, and works with major organisations like Ray White, Foodstuffs and L'Oreal.
With infectious energy and practical wisdom, Lisa helps people get out of their own way to create magnificent lives and exceptional results.
What sets Lisa apart is her ability to make transformation feel both possible and fun. She's been called a "human Berocca" for her energising presence, and "emotionally nutritious" for her ability to nourish both hearts and minds. Through her speaking, books, and programs, Lisa empowers people to stop making excuses and start living magnificent lives. Her message is simple but profound: with the right energy, belief and action, you can have, be and do everything you want.
Join us Quarter Acre Private Event Venue - Don't miss the opportunity to hear from Lisa in person.

description:
Electra Business After Five - 4 November 2025, October/November Electra BA5 
Electra BA5 Business Under Pressure
How to safeguard, secure and stay ahead 
Join us for an informative evening designed to help local businesses navigate the financial and legal landscape of 2025. Our expert panel featuring a leading insurance broker, bank representative, lawyer, and accountant who will unpack the key issues shaping business resilience today.

Our panel brings together experienced professionals who work daily with New Zealand businesses navigating financial, legal, and operational challenges to provide insights. 

Topics include overviews on the latest Trust legislation and whether your trust is truly protecting you, the IRD’s $100 million investment in increased audits, and why 88% of liquidations and receiverships involve IRD debt. You’ll also gain crucial insights into insurance risks, and what movements in the OCR and interest rates mean for your business planning.

Hear from speakers from CS Law on trust protection, Grant Thornton on accounting and compliance trends, Insure Group on mitigating business and risks, and BNZ Business on preparing for lending and cashflow pressures.

This is a must-attend session for business owners, directors and advisors who want to stay informed, protect  assets and make smarter financial decisions in the year ahead.
Electra Business After Five
Tuesday 4th November 2025  
5.30-7pm $10+bf
Te Takeretanga o Kura-hau-pō, Levin

You'll also learn how to name ranges, customise numbers and consolidate data from multiple work books and improve your knowledge of absolute and relative references. For those who have completed a Beginners' course or equivalent.

- Use of referencing

- Use of functions

description:
Optimising value through methodology - A PMO Case Study: Insights from NZ PMO of the Year 2025, Note: This is a Hybrid Event:
In-Person Location: Microsoft, Level 13, 10 Brandon Street, Wellington.
Online: The Zoom link will be sent out the day before the event.
Networking will start at 5.00pm for the in person attendees followed by the presentation starting at 5.30 pm for both in person and online attendees
About this event:
“The New Zealand Traveller Declaration, that international visitors use today, is the product of over 200 dedicated team members working with focus, collaboration, and resilience over two and a half years through much adversity. It is a privilege to present insights from my experience as PMO lead in this remarkable programme team.”

Join Chris Fisher from Nonsuch as he shares personal insights into the award-winning New Zealand Traveller Declaration (NZTD) Programme, recognised as New Zealand PMO of the Year 2025 (and New Zealand Technical Project of the Year 2025)

Chris will reflect on his experience in the NZTD Programme that overcame complex national challenges to deliver a secure, user-centric digital border solution. He’ll unpack how the PMO supported the evolving nature of the programme and tailored methodologies in a hybrid model, blending agile, traditional, and benefits-led approaches to enable rapid delivery, strong governance, and measurable impact.

Chris will also highlight the practical application of frameworks that help power success, including the PMO Value Ring, and share what made the programme stand out in its PMI award application. Expect practical takeaways, lessons learned, and winning strategies that could help your programme, project, or PMO to drive value.

Whether you're leading a transformation programme or evolving your PMO, this session offers valuable insights into how integrated methodology can unlock real-world results.
About the Presenter:
Presenter: Chris Fisher – Head of Consulting, Nonsuch
Join Chris Fisher from Nonsuch as he shares personal insights into the award-winning New Zealand Traveller Declaration (NZTD) Programme, recognised as New Zealand PMO of the Year 2025 (and New Zealand Technical Project of the Year 2025)

description:
Taiwan’s Economic Statecraft and the future of Liberal International Order, Taiwan’s Economic Statecraft and the future of Liberal International Order
Associate Professor Christina Lai will speak on Taiwan's trade practices against the backdrop of Cross-Strait tensions

About this Event

Abstract
Over the last decade, China has punished countries that undermine its territorial claims and foreign policy goals with measures such as restricting trade, encouraging popular boycotts, and cutting off tourism. These coercive measures have caused significant economic damage to U.S. partners such as Japan, the Philippines, Taiwan, and Australia. This talk focuses on Taiwan’s response to China’s economic sanctions, highlighting the agency of medium-sized countries in the shadow of a great power.
The second part of this presentation will propose a common understanding of the liberal international order in which state and non-state actors follow rules, norms, and legal procedures in conducting international affairs. This rule-based practice is an essential part of the Asian regional order. If Taiwan were integrated into the multilateral institutions in Asia, the chance of conflict would be greatly reduced. The future of Taiwan also depends on the resilience of the liberal international order and other middle-power states in the Asia Pacific.


Bio
Christina Lai is an Associate Research Fellow in the Institute of Political Science at Academia Sinica, Taiwan. Dr. Lai received her Ph.D. in Government from Georgetown University. In 2015-2016, she was a post-doctoral fellow in China and the World Program at Princeton University. She is interested in U.S.-China-Taiwan Relations, Chinese Foreign Policy, East Asian politics, and Qualitative Research Methods. Her works have appeared in the Politics, International Politics, Political Science, PS: Political Science & Politics, Journal of Contemporary China, Pacific Review, and Asian Security.



Agenda


🕑: 04:30 PM - 05:30 PM
Welcome reception with refreshments and light catering

🕑: 05:30 PM - 06:30 PM
Keynote address: Taiwan’s Economic Statecraft and the future of Liberal Intern
Host: Christina Lai

description:
Southeast Asian Perceptions of New Zealand – Report Launch, Join us for the presentation and discussion of the Asia New Zealand Foundation’s latest report, Southeast Asian Perceptions of New Zealand.
Co-hosted by the New Zealand Institute of International Affairs and the Asia New Zealand Foundation Te Whītau Tūhono, please join us for the presentation of the Foundation’s inaugural Southeast Asian Perceptions of New Zealand report.
After 28 years of surveying New Zealanders’ perceptions of Asia, the Asia New Zealand Foundation has turned the lens back on New Zealand, for the first time asking 200 subject matter experts across Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia and the Philippines how they view New Zealand and its foreign policy.
 Highlights:
Which country feels the warmest towards New Zealand?
How is New Zealand depicted in local media?
Is New Zealand seen as upholding its independent foreign policy?
Do our Southeast Asian neighbours think New Zealand lives up to its claims and promises?
What areas should New Zealand be investing more in and increasing cooperation?
Join us for this in-person presentation and panel discussion and the chance to ask questions and learn from informed experts on Asia on 13 November from 5:30pm - 7:00pm at Government Building Lecture Theatre 1 (GLBT1), Victoria University of Wellington Pipitea campus, 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington.

description:
Minilateralism: a new page in the Indo-Pacific IR lexicon, Minilateralism has emerged as a defining feature of contemporary international relations, particularly in the Indo-Pacific. Yet, despite its growing prominence, the conceptual boundaries of this form of cooperation remain underdeveloped. This seminar addresses this gap by proposing a comparative framework that distinguishes minilateralism from other established modes of cooperation—not only bilateralism and multilateralism, but also plurilateralism and regionalism. Through this analytical distinction, the study clarifies the conceptual contours of minilateralism and illuminates its purposive and exclusive character. By advancing a sharper theoretical understanding, this research contributes to the conceptual lexicon of international relations and enhances our grasp of cooperation dynamics in the Indo-Pacific.
 Mr Ryosuke Hanada is a PhD candidate and Sessional Teaching Staff at the School of International Studies, Macquarie University. He was a Research Fellow at the Japan Institute of International Affairs (JIIA), researching Japan’s foreign policy in the Indo-Pacific region from 2016 to 2020. He experienced several fellowship programs, including the Japan-US Partnership Program of the Research Institute of Peace and Security (RIPS), Young Strategist Forum of the German Marshall Fund (GMF), Strategic Japan Program of the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS), Indo-Pacific Fellow of the Perth USAsia Centre, and Raisina Young Fellow of Observer Research Foundation (ORF) in India. He holds Master of Research from Macquarie University, MA from the University of Warwick and BA in Law from Waseda University.

description:
Pacific Peoples and the Underclass of Aotearoa New Zealand: Repositioning the Narrative, In 2018, over 380,000 people in Aotearoa New Zealand identified with at least one Pacific ethnicity. Despite being a youthful and growing community, Pacific peoples are statistically entrenched in a cycle of disadvantage that cannot be ignored.
In almost every measure—health, education, income, home ownership, and justice—Pacific people are overrepresented in poor outcomes.
We are not just facing a Pacific problem; we are looking at the face of New Zealand’s underclass—systemic, intergenerational, and largely invisible in mainstream policy conversations. Despite progress for some groups, the Pacific population remains on the wrong side of the statistical ledger.
Pacific peoples experience:
• The highest rates of avoidable hospitalisations and chronic conditions.
• Worst material deprivation across nearly every indicator.
• Persistently low home ownership rates.
• A widening education achievement gap, often masked by ethnic averages.
• Underrepresentation in decision-making, leadership, and governance roles.
While initiatives for Māori advancement are critical and must continue, Pacific peoples require their own distinct policy lens. A “one-size-fits-all” approach under a pan-ethnic umbrella risks making the Pacific experience invisible.

description:
Café des Idées in Wellington - Sealife stories from the subantarctic, Café des Idées in Wellington - Sealife stories from the subantarctic
Join us for the next Café des Idées - Sealife stories from the subantarctic: links between France and New Zealand

About this Event

The next Café des Idées, organised by and , is honoured to host Wendy Nelson and Kevin Hackwell for a captivating discussion on the shared scientific and environmental connections between France and New Zealand in the subantarctic marine world.

Wendy will be talking about important marine collections made on French expeditions of discovery to the NZ subantarctic in the early 1800s that are housed in the Herbarium of the Muséum National d'Histoire Naturelle in Paris.
Wendy has been collaborating with Professor Line Le Gall (Departement Origines et Evolution) and for two weeks in October they worked to locate and document these important specimens - uncovering answers to some long held questions about the identity of species described over 180 years ago and not found subsequently.
In this talk she will take you into the Herbarium of the Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle, Paris - and highlight some of the remarkable treasures housed there.
(This work was supported by funding from the French Embassy in Wellington and the Royal Society of New Zealand Te Apārangi.)
Kevin will talk about the importance of the marine protected areas in the subantarctic and initiatives that have been taken to protect critical habitat for southern seabirds and connections between French and NZ in this critical work.

Wendy Nelson is a botanist and marine biologist, currently Senior Research Fellow Auckland Museum Tāmaki Paenga Hira
Kevin Hackwell is an ecologist, formerly Chief Conservation Advisor for Forest & Bird, a sister organisation to LPO (Ligue pour la Protection des Oiseaux)

📍 Alliance Française Wellington, 78 Victoria Street, Wellington

description:
Wellington Mayoral Debate 2025, There is no denying that public sentiment in Wellington has taken a beating. Dwindling economic stats, a struggling CBD and major infrastructure challenges have left the Wellington community feeling unhappy and unheard – and nobody has felt this more than the businesses in that community.
Every electoral cycle has debates, and all of them have politics. But this is the debate to attend if you are in business in Wellington, because unlike the others this debate is focused directly on what matters most to you.
What’s in-store
In partnership with The Post, BNZ & Victoria University of Wellington - Te Herenga Waka, the Wellington Chamber of Commerce is delivering the premier local government event for Wellington business: the 2025 Wellington Mayoral Debate.
Hear candidates Andrew Little, Ray Chung, Diane Calvert, Karl Tiefenbacher and Alex Baker talk about their vision for economic growth, their policy plans to stimulate business and their views on how council can work better with the private sector, all moderated by The Post’s own Andrea Vance.
Following the debate there will be the chance for open questions from the audience, providing you with the chance to hold candidates to account on the issues that matter most to you.
Light refreshments will be provided after the debate, where you’ll be able to network with candidates and business leaders.
Agenda:
5.30pm - Debate
6.30pm - Audience Q&A
7.00pm - Networking with drinks & nibbles
7.30pm - Event ends
Thank you to our media partner The Post , our venue partner, Victoria University of Wellington - Te Herenga Waka, and our supporting partner BNZ for their support.
